Very hard working man that is going after a dream after working in the restaurant industry for several years. Wish Frank great success and we will all be back very soon.Tip: Frank informed us the menu will continue to change. I hope that he will keep some sandwiches that continue to do well.

reviews.name: Brittany P.
reviews.review: This place is awesome! I am so impressed with the fresh, delicious simplicity of the food. It's really not something we get much out in Bellevue, or anywhere really without a side of pretentiousness. The first time I went in I was in a veggie phase and even though there was no veggie option on the menu the owner put together a great combo of sides and warm bread that was delicious. I will definitely go back many times!

reviews.name: Ju L.
reviews.review: This place is tucked away but a real gem. Fresh good and unique vibe. I had a specially made veggie sandwich in a delicious pretzel bread bun!!

reviews.name: Raymond D.
reviews.review: Very good food. Simple, but all the ingredients are real not processed meat and cheese.  Very friendly owner and amazingly low prices. We go in at least once a week.

reviews.name: Michele M.
reviews.review: You need to stop here! We were traveling from NC back to TX and needed to eat. We found this spot on yelp and it was right off I40. We wanted a sandwich but didn't want to stop at the chains. I had the number 1 and my husband had an 8. We also  split a side of Mac & Cheese. Sandwich was made to order and ready in about 8 minutes. I would definitely stop here again.  Also get the cookie, fresh BIG chocolate chip and oatmeal.  Our bill was $15 but we left $20, we felt his prices are way to cheap for what you get.

reviews.name: Private P.
reviews.review: 5 stars for the service alone. The gentleman who was the owner I believe is an extremely friendly guy who kept us up to date on our order and even threw in some free cookies. The food was pretty good and reasonably priced for what we received. The menu is on the smaller side but and the inside is a bit bare, but you cant always judge a book by its cover.  Definitely consider stopping by to give them a try and your business rather than the mass of chain restaurants in the area.

reviews.name: S B.
reviews.review: A nice local place run by an awesome guy. He was very helpful when my husband and I first ventured in there. The sandwiches were unique and super yummy! I would call ahead or make sure you have some time since he makes them all on the spot. Very good prices as well!

reviews.name: Jerry C.
reviews.review: Do not judge this little sub shop by it's very plain appearance!  Was looking for something quick and different and stopped by based in yelp reviews. The owner made me a delicious roast turkey sandwich with corn and scallions. Delilah. Clean and pleasant little neighborhood place.

reviews.name: Julie P.
reviews.review: Unique environment, not your typical restaurant. We stopped to spend the night in Nashville and we're looking for a dinner restaurant. We were very pleased with the quality of our cocktails and dinner. It was Saturday evening and the entertainment-pianist/singer was very high quality and enjoyable.

reviews.name: Maegan P.
reviews.review: My husband and I went here for our anniversary earlier in the week wanting to support a local business. Ellendale's is marketed as an up-scale place and, for the occasion, we figured we'd splurge. My formula on this star count has everything to do with price vs. the food. Had it been a little less expensive, I would have given 3 stars.First, the Pros:-Friendly Service-Easy Seating (we went on a Monday night so didn't expect a huge wait but still...)-Eclectic atmosphere. I like that this place is in a large, old house up on a hill. The inside looks very much like a historic home. The rooms are well-painted and they had someone playing piano; it made for a little bit of elegance.-All the food is organic and either grown at the restaurant or locally sourced (big points for that!)The Cons:-First and foremost, the food was just not cooked properly. Looking at the menu, I was a bit surprised things weren't a more expensive given everything was local and organic but, after it arrived, I felt like we paid too much. I had the "Romeo & Juliet;" steak medallions with mashed potatoes and greens. I ordered the steak medium rare and, when it came out, the overall appearance of the food was just blah and the steak was very overcooked. The taste of the food was good but I left feeling I could have cooked everything I had there myself and, possibly, better.-My husband's lasagna was about the same. Tasted good but not good enough for the price tag.-The menu was a bit mixed up. I got the vibe they are possibly trying to do too much and don't seem to have a true focus.I hear this place is going to be on Restaurant Impossible and I look forward to trying it again after the revamp. I think they are going in a good direction and, it seems to me, they do care very much about the quality of the food they are serving. I'd just like to see the cooking skills up to par with the ingredients.

reviews.name: Marie S.
reviews.review: Food was good, but was served lukewarm.  I was very sad about that as I was looking for a great homecooked meal.  It was just ok.The prices are great.It's in an old farmhouse so you can smell a bit of a musty smell, but not too bad.

reviews.name: Violet P.
reviews.review: Absolutely amazing place!!  We came on a Thursday at about 1:45 PM and had the lunch buffet.   This is all they serve until 2PM.  I believe dinner starts at 4PM.   There was a salad bar, soup, and about 8 warm choices of different items including pasta, veges, and steak.   Everything was so fresh and tasty as the owner/chef grows many of the veges and herbs on the property.  There is plenty of seating in this old building turned restaurant.   I believe there were about 4-5 different dining rooms.  The decor was so cute and looks like most of original woodwork remains.  Very inviting.  Outside, there is a patio with a couple tables and seats on the porch where you can relax before or after your dinner.  They have nightly live music.  The staff was extremely friendly.  I can't wait to come back for our "nice dinner night" next year!

reviews.name: Chad M.
reviews.review: Service was Decent. Live music was Enjoyable.That's about all. I ordered Steak Frites as the waiters suggested special. The fries were barely room temperature and the steak (ordered medium rare) was cooked close in some places, very inconsistent, but barely edible as the meat was tough and full of gristle. The bill was $20 for the meal only as I had water. I would have paid $9 for this steak at a pub and been ok but not at an establishment that was advertised as "southern cooking with a splash of modern sophistication". Never was asked how the food was or why I left 3 medallions of steak and didn't want them to go. No reason to return

reviews.name: Christina P.
reviews.review: What has happened to Ellendales! Just came in for a drink at 430 after work on a Friday and it's roasting hot inside. Plus French fries still in the floor from lunch! There are 5 patrons and more staff, took someone 5 minutes to realize I was at the bar. Then gave me a flat bottled beer then another. So ordered off tap. Good local brew but not very cold and unless Mayday Brewery planned it, seems flat to me too! Every time I came here for lunch over a year ago it was very good but now sad. FYI maintenance arrived to service the a/c and hope I can post the video or the nastiness he's cleaning out! Yuk!

reviews.name: Ron M.
reviews.review: I have been going to Ellendale's for many years. The Sunday brunch used to be a treat. I didn't mind spending the large expense because the food was great. Key word is "was". Over the past couple years the food quality has gone way down hill. We stopped going there altogether until we heard that Chef Robert Irvine and Restaurant Impossible went in to fix the place. After going there today, I am convinced that no changes were made except the price increase. Everything was exactly the same and the food was still terrible. Browned omelette? Terrible after 15 minutes in line.Waffles? Cold and crumbly.Coffee was barley warm.Buffet opened at 10am and food wasn't fully out for 20 minutes.The bill for 2 adults, 1 coffee and a fountain soda was $48. I wouldn't pay $10 for this. It's a shame because just a mere few years ago, the place was a treat!

reviews.name: Edward H.
reviews.review: Recommended by colleague. Excellent choice. Had beet and goat cheese salad and pork chop. Both great.service was friendly and efficient. Will go again on next visit to Nashville.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: My wife and I have had dinner at Ellendale's a couple of times now, and it's hard to absolutely recommend. I would sum up Ellendale's by calling it Faded Glory, like stepping into an establishment that you can see was once a bright and shining example of dining in Nashville but is now on a slow decline. The Mrs. Havisham of local dining, if you will. We've received friendly service both times. Sitting in the "music room" is like going back in time. The lounge singer/pianist made for some interesting conversation.We've now been through their menu and have found it's quality spotty. Flatbread appetizer that was mushy and lukewarm. My Cajun pasta was decent. My wife's shrimp and grits were better. The deserts offered were good...but I suspect not home made.I understand their brunch is a big claim to fame. We have not tried it and I admit I would be willing to go back. Donelson has so few other options for fine dining, but I would like to see Ellendales ploughback some of their profits to update their dining room, bathrooms, and menu. As it is, it's starting to seem pretty musty.

reviews.name: James H.
reviews.review: Atmosphere is unique, kind of quirky, eclectic.... Food was very good, service was good,  VERY FRIENDLY and accommodating of our party of 16 people! I would recommend to anyone looking for something a little different!

reviews.name: Amanda S.
reviews.review: No thank you. I was leery about dining here for brunch due the not so great reviews. But threw caution to the wind because I wasn't paying.My first impression was the smell of the restaurant. It was foul and unwelcoming. The restaurant itself just didn't seem clean.  There were items on the buffet which were unrecognizable. I believe a goopy light green tureen was spinach/artichoke dip. There was another offering of some type of salad, maybe shrimp salad, which would have been a choice for me if it was labeled.The buffet had the usual meats, veggies, waffles, biscuits and gravy, shrimp cocktail and an omlette station. Honestly, the best part for me was a nicely cooked piece of ham. Otherwise every thing else was either almost empty or just overstayed its welcome (dried out).The only shining spot was the server. He was great! But Ellendale's, in my opinion, isn't return worthy for the brunch.

reviews.name: Kathy D.
reviews.review: I visited this place because it was recommended to me by a friend.  The person spoke very highly of the food. Unfortunately, I was hugely disappointed.  I ordered the shrimp and grits, and it was horrible!  The shrimp was rubbery and was overcooked.  The deep fried grits became soggy from the Tabasco soup. It was drenched in the Tabasco soup! The waitress did tell me that it was flavored with Tabasco sauce - I didn't realize the Tabasco was the main focal point of the dish. I was expecting a hint of it, not a whole bottle of it!  The dish was super salty and super Tabasco-ie!  Oh, boy was it acidic!  The only thing I can taste was salt and Tabasco.  I barely ate the dish.  I was tempted to send back my plate, but it was late in the evening.  I was tired and didn't have the energy to make a complaint.  I just wanted to get out of there.  I left disappointed.  To their credit though, the wait staff was friendly.  I am just upset that she recommended the shrimp and grits dish to me too and told me it was the local favorite.  It was almost inedible.  Maybe, the chef was tired and didn't care for the plate when it went out to me.  This place wouldn't be the first on my list to eat when I am back in Nashville again.

reviews.name: Chris R.
reviews.review: Good buffet!!! Atmosphere is quiet and just by looking on the outside you wouldn't expect the inside to have what it does!!! Great salad bar and breakfast options are superb.

reviews.name: Sarah A.
reviews.review: My husband and I went to Ellendales for the first time for Sunday brunch. The atmosphere was nice, but I was overall quite disappointed. We sat for about 10 minutes before finally having to flag down a server. Brunch was served buffet style. The food was mediocre as it was lukewarm and didn't have much flavor. For the price, I would have expected much better food. I felt that overall it was overpriced, and was disappointed in the service and food.

reviews.name: Lee G.
reviews.review: Well, I finally went to Ellendales for the brunch/lunch buffet with my daughter and 3 year old grandson. In a word it was disappointing, very disappointing. You could get a better buffet at Golden Corral. The food was bland at best. It looked like it was thrown together at the last minute. The best thing about this visit was the omelet station, made fresh as you wait. Slow process with just one person making omelets. I should have paid attention to the negative reviews and saved my money. At $16 for adults this borders on theft then add to that $8 for a 3 year old, I feel like my pocket was picked. This was the first time and definitely my last time here. So disappointed.

reviews.name: Misty V.
reviews.review: Drinks were good, music was good, food was horrible! I sent my steak back twice! Chicken was way over cooked and dry. Even the baked potato and rice were overcooked. I was shocked that the manager did not check on us especially after two poorly cooked steaks! Keep the bartender, lose the grill cook!

reviews.name: Mickey D.
reviews.review: A hidden treasure. Fantastic place. Organic food. Live music. Perfect place for a romantic dinner or a group gathering. Have never had a bad experience.

reviews.name: Brandon M.
reviews.review: "And on the 7th day, Sunday, he rested, and went to Ellendales brunch, and saw that it was good, and he was pleased!"Hands down one of the best brunch experiences in Middle TN. Very similar to what one would expect to find on the Vegas strip, but pay North of $35 per person. The attractive $16.95 plus the 3 mimosas for $10 incentive makes this a regular stop for my local family and friends as well as those that visit to satisfy that weekend hunger one only feels between 10am- 2pm. It should be illegal to serve Premium cuts of beef and pork accompanied by fresh fish, chicken, shrimp, various pastas, pastries, and a table of homemade deserts all together...all at one time...impossible to sample it all. Then for all those craving breakfast fare a delectable selection of biscuits, gravy, waffles with fruit and whipped cream topping...and as every country boy knows, a Southern breakfast table is only complete when fresh hominy cheddar grits also adorn it. But wait fellow fat kids theres more...lets put all of these options out to satisfy that breakfast and lunch crave, but lets also throw in a salad bar in which only local, organic fruits, veggies, and meats are served....and for shits and giggles lets let our award winning restaurant  owner/chef man...or in this case...woman the omelette station where her first question is "oil...or butter." A question never asked to me by IHOP or Waffle House before making my omelette, but one I was asked twice on this fine Sunday for 2 magically prepared omelettes. 3 different types of cheese to choose from,  shrimp, ham, chicken...very basic, but throw in fresh minced garlic, locally grown artichokes, sundried tomatoes, broccoli, mushrooms, and im looking at her hand while she is flipping this buttery masterpiece to see if she married or not... Because if she is regularly serving omelettes with all these options...someone has hit the jackpot. Of course there is nothing like washing all of this down with 3 mimosas for $10. Not just any mimosas but a variety to choose from as well as the best damn fruit tea this side of the Cumberland river! I must mention the Beautiful garden at the restaurant, which the waitstaff said they use for some of the fresh vegetables in the food. The restaurant  seems to be a bit dated, it is a somewhat renovated old farmhouse, so expect that Victorian vibe...also expect tables that probably were used by the originals inhabitants of the home 100 years ago...but no need to be snobby, tablecloths masquerade the age well, and still allow the food to be served in the most proper manner. Go to this brunch, drink the mimosas, enjoy the piano playing ambiance, leave full, eat several omelettes and camp at the table of homemade deserts, where you can dip fresh strawberries into a chocolate fondue fountain, and leave feeling good about that $16.95 charge!

reviews.name: Robert D.
reviews.review: Agree with some of the other reviews I've read here. Major plus: the food is good and fresh. Also a plus: the outside and inside are quite attractive and inviting. Now the minuses: 1) they keep the interior too hot, 2) seating seemed a bit slow and disorganized and 3) they were out of too many items. My wife wanted a gluten free cake for dessert (out), a nearby table ordered mushrooms (also out) and I ordered an iced tea (out as well). I know this was after a mother's day brunch, but I don't think there's a good excuse for running out of tea! I'm giving 3 stars because our meal WAS GOOD, but there definitely could be improvements.

reviews.name: Deb G.
reviews.review: It's a challenge to rate Ellendale's with just 1 set of stars. If you are reviewing the food, it's 5 star. Delicious, fresh, creative, we had a wonderful meal there. The service was equally awesome. The challenge is the restaurant is in disrepair. The owners  need to invest in cleaning up the physical space, inside and out, in ways that do the food and the service justice.

reviews.name: Alex C.
reviews.review: Here on a business trip, my one free night from work and so I came to Ellensdale. I was told it's unique, interesting, not cookie-cutter corporate, and very Nashville ex-urban. And it is! The food was fine. Enjoyed the Wedge Salad with Blue Cheese Dressing; thought the Southern Fried Rabbit was great, flavorful but better be very hungry cause it's heavy; and the Honey Whiskey after-dinner drink a perfect ending. Is this a Michelin 3 Star restaurant? No. Is it worth a visit, yes! And the bartender, Jacob, just great. The piano player was fun too.Next biz trip, I'll be back!!!

reviews.name: Sandy S.
reviews.review: Just can't get enough of Ellendale's !!Last night was Shrimp & Grits..I felt like I died and went to heaven !!Tonight, Salmon and veggies..OMG !!Topped ONLY by my wife's (still a 15+ out of 10). Can't wait for tomorrow....

reviews.name: Elysse M.
reviews.review: I really wish I had great things to say about this place.  The food here is very good but the service is definitely lacking.  This was a second chance for this place on service and they failed miserably.  I am visiting from out of town;, the last time I was here (about 6 months ago) it took over an hour to get my food and tonight they didn't bring my salad until about 10 minutes after I received my entree. The server seemed surprised that I wanted my salad. The entertainment here is great, the atmosphere is wonderful but they seriously need to work on their service.

reviews.name: Liz V.
reviews.review: I dined in here for brunch today. This was my first time & the food was wonderful! We had the buffet which included a wide variety of items such as coconut  chicken, green beans, sweet potatoes, shrimp, etc. The owner was present & working the omelet station making fresh omelets upon request (that were also amazing). They had 3 for $10 mimomas which was awesome! They also have live music, which adds a nice ambiance. The decor is a bit dated, but the food is great. Our waitress seemed to get a bit impatient toward the end of our visit (we lingered & talked, seemed as if she were ready for us to leave). But otherwise, I loved  it & would definitely come back!

reviews.name: Cait C.
reviews.review: One star for live music one star for the bread at the beginning of the meal. Service was awful. Our waitress took ten minutes to speak to us twenty five to bring water. 45 to bring drinks to the table. Dropped one of our dishes into someone's lap. Messed up two of the checks. Train your staff better! The food was mediocre about the same quality and creativity of apple bees, very similar menu items as well.Don't have the dessert, we got the sampler and hated every single item which was all of their dessert options.

reviews.name: Dan G.
reviews.review: Ate here tonight with a couple co-workers, we're all from out of town. Thought we'd try this place as a local option. Atmosphere was very nice, older home turned into a restaurant. They use fresh ingredient from their garden, which was awesome. Organic options, and local beef. Service was quick and friendly, though it being a Tuesday they weren't terribly busy. There was also local entertainment, the band was pretty good. Though is louder in the main dining area, so if your looking to have conversation probably not the past place to be seated. There were rooms not near the band so if you are looking for something more quiet and romantic, still a good option. Food was great and flavorful, and cooked perfectly. Didn't have desserts as the entre was plenty. Also, drink selection was very good, no shortage of choices. Definitely would recommend to anyone.

reviews.name: T H.
reviews.review: First off the atmosphere of this place was pretty good. I like how it seemed more like a house than a restaurant. The area where they were having the live music was nice too though I wasn't sitting back in that area. Service wise, the wait staff were very nice & friendly & we didn't have long waits which was good given the size of the party. As far as the food I enjoyed the pasta dish I received & would order it again. Can't speak for the other dishes. The dessert wasn't quite what I was expecting & I probably wouldn't get it again. But overall I'd try this place again if I'm ever in the area.

reviews.name: Ruthann R.
reviews.review: I love the ambience of Ellendale's and their food is fresh and delicious. The menu offers an array of variety embracing people with varied tastes. They offer indoor and outdoor seating, small intimate settings, as well as a large open indoor room. I went with friends and family and each one of us loved our meals. I had the shrimp and grits, which I typically try anytime I see it on a menu. Ellendale's chefs definitely put their own tasty spin on this dish by adding a hint of hot sauce to the rich cream based sauce and pairing it with grit cakes instead of typical boiled grits. The shrimp were large and cooked to a perfect texture. The blend of shrimp, sauce, and grit cake created a symphony of flavor that lingered ever so perfectly on the palette.The staff is professional, courteous, and thoughtful. The musician performing on a 20 string acoustic guitar performed a great blend of original compositions and popular hits. Yes, I said 20 strings. His guitar was a lovely historical instrument with multiple necks and his musicianship and expertise were exceptional. Throughout the evening couples would dance as the guitarist played and sang. Our evening was capped off with warm varieties of cakes and coffee. All of which were rich and delicious. The chef truely weaves a variety of flavors together that cause the senses to explode. Ellendale's is a wonderful venue to relax and enjoy fine food,, great service, and a warm environment whether with family, friends, or coworkers. I have been there on multiple occassions abd always find it to be a rich experience.

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: First and only time I will eat here.  We had reservations for 8pm.  We were seated around 8:30pm.  We were taken upstairs to the attic and seated at a table comparable to a child's first Fischer-Price set next to a huge drafty window.  It was also extremely dark.  The menu had 4 entrees to choose from.  I choose the chicken, but I wish now I had went with sushi...at least sushi is supposed to be served raw!  I dont remember what side dish the menu stated the chicken would be served with, but I know it wasn't the over cooked penne pasta with butter that was thrown together in a panicked state after running out of the original side dish. Dont expect refills unless you ask.  Even after asking its 50/50.  Hopefully the only thing I took from this place was the receipt....although its likely I left with E-Coli.

reviews.name: Ms. D.
reviews.review: We were seated immediately. The waitress was extremely nice and attentive.  She took us over to the buffet to tell us what was being served. The buffet was well tended and had a good variety of food. Went for brunch on a Saturday but was told the Sunday brunch has more to offer (shrimp, omelette station, etc...) We felt happy with what was on the buffet when we were there. Everything was wonderful. We had the mimosas (huge and delicious!) and the price was 3 for $10 - a steal. We also had a Bloody Mary which was garnished with bacon and veggies. Equally as delicious as the mimosas. The building is an old dairy which has been remodeled and obviously repurposed.  Sits on a hill and looks very nice as one drives in.  The inside is quaint and interesting.  I am told that this summer they will be installing a garden around the perimeter of the building and they will use all the herbs and vegetables from the garden.  We will definitely return and we were happy to stumble upon this restaurant. The staff made it a very memorable and enjoyable experience.

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: Yeah yeah,  the inside might be a little dated, but that is the vibe. Been here a few times now, always had great service. Food has alway been good. You must get the chicken and waffles.  Total stoner food.  It has a funky vibe, not too hipster, which is good.  They have a band playing at a very low level.  Which is perfect.  So if you're looking for good food and good drink prices,  this will do you right.

reviews.name: Paige A.
reviews.review: Local organic food. Excellent choices for brunch. The owner really knows what she's doing. We actually met her. Julie was really nice and accommodating. You can tell she takes pride in her restaurant and cooking   Beautiful setting, not expensive and everything taste amazing!! We say outside and really enjoyed ourselves! This a must for brunch!

reviews.name: Nicole M.
reviews.review: I had the eye of the tiger pasta dish. Very large portion size. It was ok... I guess I didn't know what cheesy Philly sauce was until now. It tasted like cheese and the red pepper flavor overpowered it too much. And it was not thick enough at all. It was as if the pasta sat in a pool of red pepper/cheesy liquid that made a mess when you ate it. The beef tips were good, until I bite into a piece that had fat on it. Wouldn't order this again. For dessert I had the lavender cheesecake with raspberry sorbet. I am a lavender fan, I enjoy the smell a lot. Never have I eaten it before. Frankly I am a crossroads on the taste. Not sure if I enjoy the flavor as much as I enjoy the aroma. I felt like I was eating my car air freshner a little. The sorbet was delicious, pure raspberries and exactly what I would want from a sorbet. Watch out for the seeds tho. Not a good date food. I'd come back again and try something different. Great ambiance and fun place to be. Plus everything is organic and grown on the garden which sets it apart from other restaurants.

reviews.name: Elizabeth R.
reviews.review: Worst meal I have eaten in Nashville. Went with the restaurant wait staffs recommendation of Romeo and Juliet   Steak was like leather. Go eat at Darfons or any other location.

reviews.name: Mike L.
reviews.review: So, yeah, um... You ever eat somewhere and the first thing you start to think of is "I wonder if Gordon Ramsey takes referrals or if only the owners can call him?" Flies in dining room. Seated next to AC intake that was dusty and funky. AC vent overhead hanging cockeyed out of wall. Service was a bit slow, but friendly and accurate. Bread was a little stale. Stuffed mushroom app was fishy and bland and not cooked all the way, cheese on top still shredded and not melted let alone bubbly and browned. Mushroom hot not cooked though. Can't imagine that was how this was intended when it was dreamed up. Fish and chips? Yeah, so thin overcooked rubbery white fish in tempura batter laid over homemade fries like your mom would make from potatoes when she ran out of store bought. I mean, I applaud handmade effort but guys, this was kind of trailer-trash phoning it in fried potatoes, not even soaked or blanched to remove the extra starches, or crisp them up. I ate it, I was starving and made the best of it. These were at best, the stoner fries of my munchies laden youth.Girlfriend's steak was overcooked. She ate half, boxed it up to go. Carrot cake was ok but really cold, in ice box too long, frosting came off top in slab. House made cinnamon ice cream was ok, but overall, with two glasses of wine and a Pellegrino, this was not a meal I felt good about spending $72 plus tip to eat, and I can't imagine why I'd want to go back.

reviews.name: Melinda A.
reviews.review: My favorite place in the Airport hotel zone. Very non corporate vibe. The food choices are creative and there are veggie and vegan options. I tried the grit cake with kale, quinoa and a chimichurri sauce. It was very tasty, but I question whether it was chimichurri.  It tasted vaguely Asian.  No matter... Still good. My husband said his rib eye was fantastic. Their meats are locally sourced. ( Hereford Farms maybe?)We have had Sunday brunch there too. The salads are excellent which I really appreciate as it can be difficult to get veggies when traveling. The omelet was just ok. The hot line items are good enough. Nothing to really knock my socks off, but to be fair buffets rarely do. I would definitely go again. 2 for 1 happy hour 4-6 during the week. Live music starts at 6:30.

reviews.name: Kylie W.
reviews.review: Food was delicious! We wanted to try the rabbit but they were out :( will have to go back to try it !

reviews.name: Steven C.
reviews.review: Mother's Day 2015 was a hot mess!  Overbooked, air conditioning not working, 85F in dinning area.  Filthy bathrooms, food service areas, front of building.  Left putrid tea out front for people to drink!  Smell of rotting garbage from loading area!  Three words:  Clean It Up!

reviews.name: Lyna M.
reviews.review: Went for mothers day brunch and had the same concerns as previous reviews. They raised the price up for mothers day but had the same menu as any Saturday/ Sunday brunch. $32 for the same crap. How are they gonna raise the price and have nothing special on there!!! What a rip off. I will never go here again. It was hot in there and we made reservations and got seated way after our reservations. Been here plenty of times and was pleased. But this was the last straw. They will not get a dime from us again. They don't even deserve a star!

reviews.name: Jared K.
reviews.review: The wifey and I came into Nashville on business, but we also wanted to mix in a little fun by meeting some friends for dinner. We decided to try out Ellendale's on a whim, mostly because it was on the east side of town where both we and our friends were at.I was really excited to try Ellendale's after reading their menu online. To my disappointment, the menu on their website was definitely not the same as the one on site. The online menu had several entrees that I was considering (like Mahi Mahi Sliders), but sadly they were nowhere to be found once we arrived. I could understand if one of the review sites or Open Table had the menu wrong, but this was from Ellendale's own website.All of us seemed pretty famished, so we started with the Mediterranean Nachos for an appetizer. Basically, it's crisp pita triangles topped with garlic, hummus, red peppers, pico, goat cheese, pesto, and some sort of balsamic reduction. The pita was rock hard and there wasn't nearly enough of it to finish the toppings. The hummus was creamy and I really enjoyed the balsamic. Something had a spicy kick to it, but only intermittently. The flavors are there, but it's lacking in execution I think.For my entree, I picked what I thought was a safe choice: 14-ounce New York Strip with asparagus and a baked potato. I ordered my steak medium, but it was definitely well done. There wasn't even a hint of pink left. The steak was also a little gristly and tough to chew. I did like the Country Topping (bacon and bleu cheese), which had a nice bite to it.Disappointing food aside, the service was also a bit lacking. We didn't get silverware and napkins until after they brought our appetizer, and even that was only because I asked for it. Our entrees were also very slow to arrive. The restaurant didn't seem horribly busy, so I'm not sure what the hold up was. Our server was really nice at least, so that's something.I feel like Ellendale's has the potential to be a really great restaurant, but there are quite a few fundamentals that need fine-tuning first.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: Brunch 3 mimosas or sangrias for $10!It was very good, costs a little more, but there were so many food options, more Lunch food choices than Breakfast, but the food was SO GOOD. It was good southern food! I got there right at 10AM when they opened and had no problem getting a table, and appeared like there were only a few people waiting when we left!

reviews.name: Ken S.
reviews.review: Came here due to local hotel recommendation, would never have found it otherwise. Good food, organic, locally grown. The salad actually had a real, juicy tomato! Lots of vegetarian options, I had eggplant parmesan that was really delicious. The service was fairly good, and they had some nice live piano music to boot. Need to fix the AC though, it was sweltering.

reviews.name: Kelly T.
reviews.review: Disappointing.   We are from out of town and ended up staying overnight at a nearby hotel.  It was Mothers Day and on the spur of the moment, we thought we would go out for dinner and were looking for something a bit different.   Called in advance and we were happy to hear that they had a reservation!   Walking up, we were pretty excited  - the establishment looks like a house and definitely not "cookie cutter".   However, the experience went downhill from there.   We ended up in a line (3 or 4 groups) but that is not a surprise given the date.   I was surprised that there was one hostess who seemed to disappear for minutes at a time - to take care of one thing or another.  And she did not even seem to acknowledge any of us still waiting.   Finally after about 7-8 minutes (yes, I started timing it), another manager came up and let us know that they were a bit backed up and it would "be just another few minutes"    He suggested we wait at the bar.   We chose not to (thankfully) because the first hostess came back to explain that the actual problem was that the kitchen was backed up and they were pausing on seating anyone else (including those of us with reservations) - it would likely be another 20-25 minutes.   This was after waiting for 10 minutes already.   I understand that things get backed up but when I have a reservation I don't typically expect to stand around waiting for 30-35 minutes because they didn't plan well.wish I could review the food but we chose to leave - as did others that were in line.   Since I will not be back in the area, I may not have a chance to go here again.  Then again, I am not sure I would want to rely on them.

reviews.name: Wendy K.
reviews.review: Con:A hard to find restaurant tucked away up on a hill on a side street just off of Donnelson Pike. I realize it's an older home, but, the dark interior needs to be renovated and opened up with additional windows. The host did accommodate our request for a quiet table, although maybe a little too quiet with no overhead music to drown out the next table's conversation. The room had very little decor complete with a fiber board drop ceiling. It was a Sunday evening, the kitchen was on the slow side.Pro:The food was 4 stars. I had the recommended Vanilla Bean and Goat Cheese Salad with chicken. The salad was good but the chicken was dry and overcooked. My mom liked her Fish and chips over burger joint fries, the kind of fries that are yah-know-are- bad-for-yah-but-ya-luv-em-anyway. My husband had the Fried Chicken & Waffles which was also very good. The server was fast and friendly. To get your moneys worth I'd suggest sitting outside or near the music. Decor and ambiance gets 2 stars.

reviews.name: Laura D.
reviews.review: I have heard about this place for a long time always great reviews. Went there today for a staff luncheon for the first time and had the lunch buffet. The food was described by the waiter fabulously however actual taste was meh. Kitchen staff came out to replenish the buffet bar with no hair nets, no gloves, etc. The building has crossed over from that quaint lovely farmhouse atmosphere to run down and shabby. The silverware looked old worn and cheap and was rolled into the napkins wet. The napkins smelled so musty/soured that I had to ask for paper as the smell was making me nauseous. The salt would not even come out of the shaker because of some kind of moisture problem. We were seated by a window that had a "family" of flies buzzing around - a couple of which constantly buzzed our table. Annoying at best - not good to think of with an open buffet of food. We went upstairs to the banquet room to check it out as a possible venue for our Holiday event. Up here you can really see the slopping ceilings, where they have had water leaks, horrible shape! I left thinking I am really surprised codes or health department has not cited or closed them. Sorry for the bad review - apparently this was at one time a great place but my experience was far from that.

reviews.name: Danny L.
reviews.review: My entree, the Mimosa Scallops was awesome, but the other dishes weren't consistent.  Among my parties entrees, the worst was the shrimp and grits.  The fish and chips were disappointing as well.  The bread we were served was dry and stale, slow on a Monday night I guess, and the appetizer I ordered called the James Bond which consists of sirloin tips in green olives, garlic and shallots with splashes of gin and cream garnished with toasted focaccia were far too tough and chewy.  The sauce was bland, and while the olives were present, the shallots were either gone or cooked to mush, and their flavor and savor was equally absent. The toasted focaccia was hard as a rock and wouldn't even soak up the sauce.  This place would be  consistently great if they cared as much about the sides and service consistency as they did the more expensive entrees.  My party was disappointed.  The lunch buffet is renowned, but the phrase "all you can eat" covers a lot of woes.  We realized it was an early Monday timeslot, but stale bread, grits made like polenta and bitter, steak medallions too tough to eat, and less than attentive service with an almost empty restaurant really brought down this review.

reviews.name: Natasha M.
reviews.review: Ellendale's is a great dining establishment tucked away behind the busier streets by the airport. The location lends to its charming character and exquisite selections. I just had drinks and appetizers, but I feel confident based on the service that we would enjoy the full dinner service. Reservations are recommended, especially on holidays, so take heed. They offer about a dozen specialty drinks and I chose the Milwaukee Style Bloody Mary. It was beautifully garnished with peppers & olives. It was very spicy and you could smell the horseradish before taking a sip. The appetizer, the James Bond, was a great combination of steak, mushrooms, & green olives in a rue. Jordan is a great and attentive bartender. So, go out and see him and the rest of the crew!

reviews.name: Barbara W.
reviews.review: Fabulous food, fabulous music.  So pleased to find local, organic delicious food as we traveled cross-country.

reviews.name: Tammy M.
reviews.review: Excellent service here.  Every time.I came in not knowing that they had a Sunday Brunch.  It was very good and for a brunch it was extremely reasonable.

reviews.name: Brian N.
reviews.review: Avoid at all costs.Four coworkers and I went here to avoid the fast food chains we're normally relegated to - it turned out to be a worse decision.After waiting nearly 30 minutes for the waitress to take an order, it took another 15-20 minutes to get our drinks (which were spilled - literally - all over us), it took another 60 minutes for our food to arrive.The food was so-so - nothing great, but not extremely revolting.  Unfortunately, I ended up getting food poisoning and spending the entire next 36 hours within 3 feet of a toilet at all times.  All in all, a terrible experience - bad service, bad food, and no redeeming qualities.

reviews.name: Jay Y.
reviews.review: Went in for a mid-day lunch.  Service was extremely slow despite the fact that we were one of two parties dining at the time.  Plus, my drinking glass was dirty--it still had some lay's lipstick on it.  I wonder if they rinsed it in cold water after the prior use, or even at all.  That being said, the chicken and waffles meal was very good.  Chicken was seasoned perfectly and cooked to perfection.  But for the poor service and dirty glass, this would have been a 5 star review.

reviews.name: PJ L.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere, tom shinness playing guitar, awesome meals and service. One meal, chicken Alfredo was bland. Lasagna, shrimp & grits (just the right amount of spivey) and the fish and chips were great. Add Truants "four vines" Zinfandel and this is a place you want to come back to!! We were too full to have dessert!

reviews.name: Caroline S.
reviews.review: The food wasn't bad, but it wasn't exceptional. The service was amazing, and for that I feel kind of bad for only giving two stars because our waitress was seriously awesome - also the owner of the restaurant was working the omelette bar and I thought that was cool. However, it was suuuuuper pricey. I went for Sunday brunch, and brunch for two plus two mimosas was over $50. Maybe we weren't charged properly or something, but that seemed insane to me. If the food was exceptional, I would be more understanding but spending over $50 for two mediocre omelettes and two mimosas is not how I was hoping to start the day. I probably won't return.

reviews.name: Hannah D.
reviews.review: Nothing special - 9 for a glass of Cupcake wine.....we all know it's $9 a bottle. Wish the selection was fresher and that the restaurant smelled better....

reviews.name: Kenny Y.
reviews.review: I came here because it was close to my office and wanted to try something new.  I am on a business trip and want to try as many restaurants as I can while I am in Nashville.  I was hesitant at first to try the buffet and I should have followed my gut instinct.  It was very disappointing.  Most items were overcooked and dry from settling  on the buffet table for too long.  The vegetables were the only thing that was eatable from the buffet table.  The soup was actually good; well the salad bar was good also because it wasn't made by anyone.  So, I ended up having a desert and my waiter seemed to supply the desert menu to only couples.  So I asked him for a desert menu, and he quickly did some suggestions off the top of his head.  So, I ended up ordering the tiramisu for 6 dollars giving the whole lunch buffet was only 8.95 plus 2 dollar for Ice tea.  I don't mind paying 6 dollars if a restaurant actually knows how to make tiramisu.  There is a reason why this restaurant only had 3-4 tables for lunch.

reviews.name: Jeannie G.
reviews.review: It had been over a year since I visited Ellendale's for Sunday brunch. In the past, it has been very hit or miss. Today was definitely a miss and I can say with certainty that I will never return here for brunch again. The quality of the food just isn't there. More than half of the items on the buffet were picked over, nearly empty and looked very dry. When you're paying over $15.00 for brunch, you expect better quality. We informed the staff that several of the items on the buffet were empty and it took a while for them to refill it. The cheese fondue, which is usually one of my favorite things,  was completely empty and people were actually scraping the pot in an attempt to get some of the remaining cheese residue. Why were we the only people who saw this? Whose responsibility is it to keep the items fresh?I thought I'd get a salad while they refilled the buffet, but my Caesar salad was swimming in dressing to the point where the lettuce was soggy. Not appealing at all. The only thing I enjoyed was the fresh watermelon, an omelet and a few strips of bacon. The items on the hot and cold buffet fell extremely short.As if all of that wasn't bad enough, a woman took the stage and began singing and playing the piano. If she was talented, it might have been enjoyable. Her singing actually prompted me to get the check and leave. We couldn't take anymore.The only reason I'm giving two stars instead of one is because our server was very attentive and kept our drinks filled. I don't blame him for the poor good quality and empty containers.

reviews.name: Lackey S.
reviews.review: I'll preface my review by saying three things: 1. I had Ellendale's New Years Eve and it was incredible. 2. I did not retaliate against the server he did fine and I tipped 20%. 3. Everything I'm about to tell you is 100% true. So, it all began a couple weeks ago as me and my girlfriend were discussing Valentine's Day plans. She wanted something a little trendier, a little newer, something close to downtown. I told her repeatedly how amazing Ellendale's was on NYE. The place was packed, service excellent and quick, and the steak and baked potato was incredible. So she gives way to recommendation and we book a 7:30 Valentines dinner. It all went down hill from there. We walk through the front door and it reminded me of an overcrowded doctors office. The wait staff and hosts were frazzled noticeably. There must have been 20-25 people crowded in the hallway of this restaurant. All had reservations. I heard rumblings of complaints from other patrons. The vibe of upset customers and frazzled staff members was almost to much to bear so I headed for the bar. Went with a Dos Perros which turned out to be the best purchase of the night. As I'm headed back to the crowded hallway to wait, I don't believe my eyes. IS THIS REAL. A mouse scurries past the hoards of people waiting just feet away from people eating. Unreal. 30 minutes and 2 beers after our 7:30 reservation we are walked upstairs to our seat. I actually looked around for cameras. This had to be a joke. We were seated at a rickety old table covered in cheap table cloth right next to a utility closet. WITH THE DOOR OPEN AND LIGHT ON. Servers were coming in and out of the room to grab cleaning towels. There was also small heater of some sort plugged in and a bucket of ice. These were in my sight line and my girlfriend was directly aligned with the toilet. The bathroom door remained open when not in use (with the light on). So we're literally placed between a utility closet and a bathroom. Both less than 3-5 feet from us. If the mouse didn't kill the romantic vibes, this seating location certainly did. All this and I'm still not to the food. Honestly, I won't drag it on much longer....as bad as the experience was leading up to our food being served, it didn't really matter how good the food was...but, on par with the rest of the night, it was awful. They had a "special Valentine's menu" with only like 4 entrees to choose from and they had names such as "sloppy kiss", "hugs and kisses", and "she's a V". With 4 entree options how hard is it to mess up?? Oh and we started with an appetizer sampler plate which wasn't THAT BAD. It was a little cold and the kale chips tasted rubbery and cold but were seasoned nicely? As I feared, with people still waiting downstairs, the food was rushed out to us in no time. At least they're trying to get people seated?? My 6oz steak wasn't horrible but the "loaded baked potato" looked and tasted like a microwavable item from Wal mart. My one regret is not taking a picture. The potato I was served was nothing close to the one I was served on New Years Eve. My girlfriend tried her best, but couldn't force down anymore of the bland chicken she ordered. I was especially appalled at her side of asparagus. It was especially bad because I had cooked asparagus the night before that was 5x as good as what was served to us. In closing, I apologize for the length of the review and I do truly hate leaving negative feedback. I've never once left a bad review on any website for any restaurant. As I previously mentioned, the waiter did his job so I tipped appropriately. I wasn't looking to pull the scam of complaining to the manager and getting free food (although the table next to us was offered "desserts on the house" to which they declined). I can truly say, for $104 dollars, it was the worst dining experience I've ever had.

reviews.name: Stephanie F.
reviews.review: The food was just simply not executed well. The server, Nelson, was really nice but we left very mad at ourselves for spending $60 on the meal.

reviews.name: Emily B.
reviews.review: I'm sad that I'm not still there right now. Make a reservation through yelp for sunday brunch or you'll have to wait, but it can be done on opentable so hooray! We went for brunch and the spread is everything you'd expect, the mimosas are HUGE and cheap, and the staff was so warm and caring that they told us to stay and keep enjoying cocktails even after brunch. I will never eat brunch at another place in Nashville.

reviews.name: Kelly K.
reviews.review: I am happy to report that the owner made things right with me after listening to my concerns.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: Ate lunch here for the first time! Awesome decor inside and they only serve a buffet during lunch. Let me say it was wonderful. Delicious healthy choices! Salmon, grilled steak, sweet potatoes, zucchini, salad bar, green beans, and more. The owner says the buffet changes each day! O and all for $10. I WILL BE BACK!

reviews.name: Tim H.
reviews.review: Amazing food. The portions are huge. Very nice experience as always. Only negative was a male server running around with two large slots on the back of his pants - you could see more than you should. Maybe I am old fashioned.

reviews.name: Tony W.
reviews.review: Local sourced food, cooked by the owner of the restaurant. This guy takes pride in his food and it shows. We went for lunch, $9.99 for a buffet, well worth the price. 3 meat choices, several veggie sides along with Salads and a soup. The service was a little slow (getting drinks and our checks, but I believe it's because they had the waiter doing too much.) If I lived in the area, I would be back, no doubt.

reviews.name: Kate B.
reviews.review: I honestly don't even know where to begin. We too fell prey to the outrageous ($32 a person) Mother's Day Buffet. Never again. Please know that I rarely leave negative reviews and often support local restaurants, but felt very compelled to write this after yesterday's experience.Upon first entering the restaurant for our special family lunch, I immediately noticed how uncomfortably warm it was. The temperature was reaching 90 outside and it felt like a sauna inside the restaurant. Every server in the place was covered in sweat! One diner was even crouched in the hallway with a glass of ice water to her neck trying to cool off. Since the restaurant is in an old house I decided to overlook the lack of air.Onto the service...I was a waitress for 4 years and am very forgiving, but I saw our bus boy more than our waitress! I wish we could have given him the tip! Especially considering we waited for her to greet us and take our drink order for 15 mins and when she returned she had to ask each of us what drink we had ordered. Again, as a former waitress I realize that Mother's Day is one of the worst days to work, so I tried to be understanding.As for the food, I'm not even going to waste your time reviewing each thing we had. In summation, it was stale, bland, and had clearly been left out all day.I was disappointed, my family was disappointed and we were out $200. Please consider an alternative for next year's holiday. I had heard such wonderful things about this place!

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: This is without a doubt my favorite restaurant in Nashville.  The food is top notch, with a very good variety of menu choices and generous portions.  The atmospehere is classy and romantic yet casual.  The restaurant is in an old house and there are several dining rooms, each with different decor. The wine and cocktail list is extensive.   Parking is plentiful and easy and the service is superb.  There is live music nightly.

reviews.name: Jeff S.
reviews.review: Great local restaurant. Local sourced food. Live music but not so loud that you can't enjoy the conversation. Everything is good but you must have the dessert. I'm normally not big on sweets but these were great. Would definitely return when next in town.

reviews.name: Margaret P.
reviews.review: I ate at Eelendale ' twice this week, first because it was close to my hotel and the 2nd time because I enjoyed so much the 1st. I sat on the patio the first time and had the healthy hugger with a glass of the citrus sangria. The weather was perfect and I loved looking over the garden. The chicken was overcooked but the broccoli, steamed kale and baked sweet potato made up for it. The sangria was only ok.Tonight, I sat in the bar area next to a window looking out on the patio and enjoyed the music of Mandy Cook while I enjoyed the vanilla beet & goat cheese salad with shrimp. I was a little apprehensive about ordering seafood after reading previous reviews but the shrimp was grilled to perfection. The vanilla dressing was a little sweeter than I usually like but went well with the other flavors.I'd go to Ellendale's if I'm ever in town again.

reviews.name: Matt V.
reviews.review: I love reviews that say "just ignore every bad review."  Yeah, right.I am half-expecting to see Ellendale's on an upcoming episode of Kitchen Nightmares.  It has all the elements - a once bustling restaurant with some semblance of history has fallen into disrepair.  Guest counts are declining as word gets out about how it "isn't as good as it used to be."  Management starts trying to save money by carrying less staff, buying cheaper ingredients and putting off necessary repairs, wondering how they can reverse the decline and worrying about what the coming months have in store.The venue is nice enough and the staff is well-meaning, but the food is rough.  Came for Sunday brunch - they opened late, most stations were not ready, and some of the food was downright inedible.  The catfish, for example, should have been called 'semi-fried grease with fish texture.'  The meal was salvaged by a made-to-order omelet, but this place needs to find its way out of its death spiral.

reviews.name: Marlin B.
reviews.review: Food tasted great.  Old home redone into a restaurant.  The decor was nice. The presentation aspired but lacked. There was live music the night we were there (grand piano and singer) and it was very enjoyable.  Summary, food tasted great, but Ellendales seemed to just "miss the mark" in decor, mood, and food presentation that would have made it a great dining experience. I would eat there again.

reviews.name: Rachel C.
reviews.review: The food was amazing as well as the service. Definitely a place to visit when in nashville for some good cooking and a good atmosphere. The prices weren't bad either.

reviews.name: Will A.
reviews.review: This is the first time Yelp has let me down.My friend started with a signature cocktail that was nothing more than a glass of lime juice with seeds, while I had a beer tasted like it was poured from a dirty tap. The appetizer was toasted ravioli that was clearly reheated from a frozen bag.I had the chicken and waffles.The jalapeño bacon waffles were blander than free hotel breakfast fare and were way overcooked. Chicken was tempura fried, dry, flavorless and tan. Not George Hamilton tan either, we are talking Gap Khaki tan. There was no bacon and no jalapeño.This place was a major disappointment.Bland food cooked poorly.

reviews.name: Anne M.
reviews.review: Oh my god. Such delicious food and such a resemble price. Came for brunch, and there were so many options. 3/10 mimosas, Chuck and Larry was my favorite. Bloody Mary was delicious as well. Omelette station has so many options, beach vacation was to die for. Fondue both cheese and chocolate. I loved everything about this restaurant. Beautiful house with a cute porch to sit at outside. Service was wonderful and she was so helpful since it was are first time here. Would come back in a heart beat.

reviews.name: Sam B.
reviews.review: 8:30pm Came here for Valentine's Day on a reservation. 9:10pm It took them 40 minutes to get us to a table, and by the time we left the crowded hallway to our slightly broken wooden chairs, there were about 30 people waiting to be seated. That's a bad sign--overbooking. But I thought, maybe it could get better? I'm sure the food is good. 9:40 Thirty minutes after being seated, someone finally came to ask us for our drink orders. Thirty minutes! They didn't take our food order until 10:00....an hour and a half after we had reservations. But maybe the food is good....10:50 two hours and twenty minutes later, our food finally comes. The server was very nice and offered to split our bill in half. Most people left. I felt bad for her because I knew it wasn't her fault. 11:15 We leave. The food was okay, but I'm pretty sure that's just because I was starving. Long story short, if you want decent food and poor service, come here. If you want an actual good restaurant that runs its business correctly, do Not.

reviews.name: Jay F.
reviews.review: Today I went to the Sunday brunch buffet with friends.  And it lived up to what I expected.  The omelet station is terrific, plenty of yummy choices, salads and entrees were all tasty, great desserts.  And a good drink menu, so I will go back on Sundays again.  It was busy by the time we left, so may need reservations next time.

reviews.name: Rachel H.
reviews.review: My fiancé and I enjoyed this place. The food was made of local ingredients and in a little different way, so we were entertained. There was a nice low lit ambiance, a nice beer list to choose from, the service was pleasant and timely, and I rather enjoyed the view through the large windows. The deserts were also delish!

reviews.name: Channing C.
reviews.review: Went in for dinner not expecting a whole lot based on some of these reviews but was pleasantly surprised! We got the chicken and bacon cheeseburger sliders and those were both excellent. The meat on the cheeseburger sliders was cooked to perfection and was easily one of the best mini burgers I have ever had. Upon leaving we noticed they had a garden with all fresh veggies and a grapevine, this made me feel good about how fresh their food was. There were also fireflies everywhere in the front of the place which was nice and added to the experience :)

reviews.name: EdDee P.
reviews.review: I love how the restaurant is in an old house. The drinks were good. The music was good. The food not so good. Well, I had the rabbit and spend the majority of my night in the bathroom throwing up and going to the bathroom .... Now waiting for my flight with a stomach ache. Atleast I only had a few bites and did not eat my whole plate

reviews.name: Jeannie D.
reviews.review: Absolutely terrible experience!  Wanted a nice Friday date night dinner. Based on the prices on the menu, you would think that's what you would get. Wrong. We started with salads. The dressing was homemade and pretty good. They looked delicious when they arrived at our table, but hiding under my spinach was a pile of uncut iceberg lettuce, including the core. The croutons were so crunchy you could have broken a tooth on them. I ordered the ravioli. I only got two raviolois that actually had filling. The rest were falling apart and the entire dish was overcooked, like someone had forgotten about them and left them in the water too long. My boyfriend got the rabbit. He was was told it was boneless, but nearly choked on a bone in his first bite. The hunter's sauce the rabbit was atop of was so salty it was inedible. Our waiter was very friendly, but when it came time for the check, he was nowhere to be found. Needless to say, we will never be going back and I have warned everyone I know. This restaurant is a joke.

reviews.name: Dave W.
reviews.review: A rare experience that simply must be had by all. Dining in parlors and bedrooms fostering remnants of lives long past and the conception of the yet to come, Ellendale's was built in an nearly untouched historic farmhouse. The staff is extremely fun with pranks like bringing you a Bloody Mary when you order a Budweiser then trying to convince you that the Bud is a Bloody Mary! They have an untouched dirt patch on a hill you'll wonder about but eventually you'll learn it's the veggie & herb garden that supplies the whole restaurant year round. The staff made of robots, aliens, and animated corpses tells fantastic stories, it's how I know of the Japanese hornet that spits acid in your eyes. The drinks are never dull, the ingredients change with every order! If you're bored with the sounds of live bands they have an organ which is to die for. The brunch buffet leads straight to the restrooms so no awkward searching plus there's two for you ladies! The coy pond, fed by a fountain you can buy anywhere but won't look as good as here, is like none other! Ingeniously placed under a low bridge, it is hidden from the disturbance of the world as is the presence of this dwelling turned dining delight. For the full experience you'll surely find fascinating request Nelson!

reviews.name: Spencer B.
reviews.review: I was excited to come eat here. I came monday with a colleague but they are closed Monday. So I came back Wednesday. I was seated by the host and told to sit and wait to place my drink order. I saw a server 10 ft away. I sat and watched the server empty handed smile nod at me and continue on to the kitchen. She walked by 2 mins later ignoring me. Then on her return to the kitchen told me I could get up and go any time to the buffet. Not waiting for my response she continued on to the kitchen. I sat for another minute thinking maybe another server was going to show up. It didn't happen. I finally got up and went through the buffet. I had filled and finished two plates notocing that some of the patrons that had arrived before me had drinks. I was finishing my second plate when a server walked by carrying drinks from the table next to me she stopped picked up my first plate and was avout to walk away when I stopped her. she asked how she could help. She saw I had no drink and asked what I would like to drink. I smile and asked for water. I left no grtuity and when askimg for the manager on duty the host responded that he was the manager. I related my concern and was told she was told to offer a complimentary dessert. But after two plates I was full. The food was good. But the service had to be some of the worst in Nashville.

reviews.name: Daniel E.
reviews.review: I was in town for business and decided to eat here for dinner with my co worker. The atmosphere was nice but the service was horrible. We got a table with only about a 10 minute wait but the serve never brought our drinks and got our salad order but never took our food order. After 46 mins we decided to leave without eating. We asked for our check and the owner was very nice to comp our salads. She also offered to comp our meals if we stayed but we were thoroughly frustrated and didn't want to deal. Our server was Lance and he was obviously preoccupied. Sorry Ellendale's will never come back or recommend you to others.

reviews.name: Deborah D.
reviews.review: From out of town but had eaten there two years ago. Was just as good this time. We had an assortment of items. The eggplant parmasean was delicious

reviews.name: Robert P.
reviews.review: My review is mainly based on Sunday Brunch but I can't imagine any other time being much different. On the surface the buffet seems like an upscale buffet with some pretty cool choices but after the meal is over I always feel underwhelmed with the food! Bland all the way around. Really love the old home but an interior remodel starting with the carpet is past due. The piano player in the large room is a nice touch. Service is usually equal in quality to the food. Really wish I could be excited about Ellendals but I just can't.

reviews.name: Paden P.
reviews.review: Well, the used diaper on the floor was the start...  Yea!  Never thought I'd ever write that on Yelp!  If ever there was a location that needed Gordon Ramsey to kick them in the buns, this would be it.  I've had friends in the restaurant biz and they would close the doors and not let one person in until they had the place cleaned.The carpets, walls, glasses...  They have such great potential!  With only a week of downtime they'd go from nasty to classy.I'm writing this review as the heater in the background grinds away with every rotation.  Soooo noisy!!  It's hard writing this down without making each sentence a punch line.  I hate writing bad reviews!  This being my first, but I just felt it was needed to tell the owners and anyone thinking about trying this place.  I'm guessing it used to be pretty good, thus the past reviews, but now...  Used children's diaper...  It only took 10 minutes for them to come take care of it...Flee!!!!!  Hehe

reviews.name: Eddy W.
reviews.review: We just stopped in for a beer and to see what the place was like. I like that they serve local brews on tap. We got the stout which was great. We were surprised when we got a complimentary Mediterranean nachos. Wow was that good!!!!We will have to go back for lunch or dinner so I can have the rabbit  entree.

reviews.name: Dave W.
reviews.review: By FAR, the WORST place I have stepped foot in.  We can start with the organ music playing on a sunny afternoon  - more like a morgue.  There was an eerie feeling that this place is hiding something - every server told a different answer for each question - down to what whiskey the restaurant even served.   - The bartender did not speak - and would only respond to the owner.  I had to walk in to get my drink as it took over an hour and I saw my waitress dancing in a circle  - she waved and told me to take it and kept moving to the organ - I was in disbelief.   - They told us to turn and see the garden, we did, and there was a cut branch off a willow tree stuck in a dirt mound.  I thought it was a joke. - no, that was the garden. - The buffet leads directly to the restrooms and has a strand of lights over it - when my friend went inside the restroom he was greeted by a catatonic waiter standing, not moving - he was in a state of shock  - The waitress finally came back for a drink order and told me that she was so busy with a party - there was a party, but there were also 40 people on staff.  She started yelling and stating that she was indeed serving 28 people and that she was 65 years old and knows how to multi task - apparently I was not a "task". - The next waiter told us he was a bird in his past life and loves insects that can kill you with acidic sprays - we were appalled.  He was lying to us and trying to scare us.We literally ran out - and I mean RAN OUT

reviews.name: CC S.
reviews.review: Like other reviewers, I took my mom for Mother's Day.  We had an 11:00 am reservation and were not seated til around 11:45 am.  We stood in the foyer watching the hostess almost have a meltdown.  They were scrambling, and it almost seemed like they didn't understand why or how to fix it.  A manager or someone with experience really needed to step in and help, but that never happened.  I kept joking with my family that I was treating them to dinner and a show. Once we were finally seated, the room we were in was miserably hot.  Thank goodness I had a sundress on, so I was comfortable, but the rest of my party was not.  Even the servers were dripping sweat.  The food was ok.  Not exceptional but for $16.95 it was good.  Then, like the others, I got the bill and it was double what I was expecting.  False advertising for sure.  We were so miserable that we didn't have time to wait for the manager. I called back later but no one would answer after 5 attempts.I really wanted an omelet from the omelet station but after standing in line and watching the omelet chef's messy cooking style, I decided against it.  Toppings were going everywhere and pans weren't cleaned properly between omelets.  I didn't want some of the toppings that were left in the pan or fell in when they were making others.  What if I was allergic to one of the toppings?After deciding against an omelet, I went over to the cold salad table.  I was excited to see shrimp cocktail but then noticed the shrimp were not on ice anymore but were bobbing in water.  The ice hadn't been changed, and I didn't know how long they'd been in the water.  I warned my entire party not to eat the shrimp for fear of getting sick. Ellendale's has the potential to be something great, but it sadly is underwhelming. If the pricing was as advertised or if they did something to reimburse me for the false advertising, I would go back.  But since it is likely I will never hear from them, I will not return.

reviews.name: Tami M.
reviews.review: The old house is charming as well as the staff. We had house cocktails that were good...loved the ice chips in my martini. Hubby had rib eye prepared perfectly. I had the cioppino and it was very tasty. We also had a dessert sampler that was heavenly. Don't miss it!  Delores was a wonderful singer doing standards and classics beautifully on a piano.

reviews.name: Jennifer S.
reviews.review: The outdoor patio was lovely, the server was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive, and the food was delicious.  If I ever visit Nashville again, Ellendale's will definitely be on my list of stops.

reviews.name: Kat O.
reviews.review: We came here for lunch. They only serve a buffet, so we thought it would be a bust. The food was excellent with lots of flavor. The black bean soup was very good and piping hot. Brussel sprouts with bacon, apple pork and other wonderful choices. We came back for happy hour which was very quiet.  The bar has an excellent scotch collection. Most smaller bars do not have a great choice so I was pleasantly surprised.

reviews.name: Heather C.
reviews.review: Found this place on yelp and wow I am glad we did. Arrived at 11:30 to be pleasantly greater. After seated found out they only have a lunch buffet, which was fine. Found the buffet packed with 2 salad choices, soup, homemade bread and butters, 3 meat choices, 3 vegetables. All of this for only 8.95 what a Bargin

reviews.name: Meg P.
reviews.review: I went to ellendales for the first time last night and it was a great experience. They had a gentleman playing the piano which my toddler loved and keeping her entertained is always a challenge. I had the beet and goat cheese salad and the scallop entree and it was amazing. Their cocktails are fresh and masterfully crafted. I love how the food and drinks are top quality but it's not stuffy where you feel uncomfortable having your young children with you.

reviews.name: Corey W.
reviews.review: If I could give this place a 3.5 I would.Three words: Grilled Chilled Vegetables. Without these I probably would have gave them a 2 star. Not that they are bad just nothing but these make me really want to come back but they are a must, awesome grilled taste with a little olive oil, AMAZING. Not terribly complex but something that I love making at home and excited I could get it when I was out for lunch.Service is on par, if you have a decent lunch break you could stop here.Definitely a solid but maybe not a particularly memorable experience if you're close by for lunch.Price is right for the food. You could escape with spending around $10.

reviews.name: Dave C.
reviews.review: We were staying at the Radisson by the airport, and frankly pretty fearful we would find something "foodie" worthy close by, thank god for Ellendale's.We came at 6pm for a cocktail and the jazz/country band set up at 6:30pm, great music to eat to. i ordered the cajun chicken pasta, wow, super flavors.....really, really, great, absolutely recommend this dish.Great atmosphere, service, music and food.enjoy.

reviews.name: Vera B.
reviews.review: Food not terrible, but definitely not good either. Decor very old and creepy. Weird old musty smell in the place. Thumbs up on the beautiful veggie garden outside!! Service is pretty good.

reviews.name: David L.
reviews.review: I really, REALLY wanted to have a stellar experience here.  ...and for "stellar," I'm sure you'll agree that it has to be a perfect combination of food AND service, along with ambiance.Well, it just did not quite happen this particular night. (Please note:  this is not the first time I've dined here...far from it.).Ellendale's is an unpretentious little house nestled in Donelson, with a casual dining atmosphere, but a topnotch menu.To be clear, the food here is very good.  There is ample variety and a nice mixture of entrees, along with an attractive array of veggies and starches.  (They also change the menu periodically.  Sometimes, they add more attractive entrees, sometimes not.  By the way, I REALLY miss the smoked Ribeye.  Brink it back, won't ya?)Additionally, the wine selection is good and they pour a healthy bourbon.This evening, we had a family dinner for a special occasion.  We sampled:Me:- The Filet  - an 8 oz. slug of beef (plenty), cooked medium rare.  Very tender and full of flavor. Scalloped potatoes and roasted green beans.  The Wife: - The Amaretto Chicken:  grilled chicken breast with amaretto glazed mushrooms and almonds.  Paired with sweet potato spaetzle and wilted greens.  Very good.The Daughter: - The "Romeo and Juliet"  - a nice blend of sirloin (12oz.!) served with blue cheese cream and demi glace. Paired with truffled mashed potatoes, wilted greens and a grilled tomato.  She really enjoyed it.  (I tried it, too - and, the tastes were excellent with both the blue cheese cream and the demi glace.)The Son: - He wanted the Rabbit! And it was very tender.  It had a white wine sauce with rosemary, thyme, and portabellas.  The ginger mashed sweet potatoes were particularly tasty!As I've described, it was very good food.  Alas, it was the service where they fell short this evening...nothing outright bad, per se, but it just did not seem we received the attention a $150 tab should command.  The server gave us adequate time to select our entrees, but never returned to learn if we were satisfied, until we were done.Nonetheless, I've given a 4-star rating, as it was good food and "okay" service.  BUT, to really set themselves apart, it would be nice to see Ellendale's step up their service and attention.  The menu implies it is to be expected.  Customer loyalty should certainly command it.  And, I deserved it.

reviews.name: Sue M.
reviews.review: Food was not that great, especially for being a pricier restaurant. Steak, salmon, and vegetables, although cooked right, were very plain, hardly any seasoning.  Cheesy risotto was actually delicious.  Service was very slow.  No one took our drink order for 15 minutes after being seated.

reviews.name: Sam E.
reviews.review: Valentine's Day, not perfect. Overall, I had a very nice evening, and I enjoyed the food even though it wasn't perfect. With food, wine and a cocktail, I thought the total bill was reasonable.I snagged the last available reservation for this restaurant, not realizing it was Valentine's Day. My first clue was when the parking lot was full with all the nearby street parking taken as well.Being Valentine's Day, the place was incredibly busy. I was offered a seat immediately. I opted to sit at the bar and ordered promptly. My entree (NY strip with sweet potato) took just over an hour to arrive. The food was slightly warm. The steak was overcooked, lacking the topping I'd ordered, and the sweet potato was fully garnished, even though I'd ordered it plain. The bartender recognized the issue with the steak topping and sweet potato and immediately fixed it.Two or three people sitting at the bar mentioned that they had eaten here two days in a row. I had the impression they, like me, were travelers, and they obviously had good experiences in their prior visit here.Overall, I had a very nice evening, and I enjoyed the food even though it wasn't perfect. With food, wine and a cocktail, I thought the total bill was reasonable.I'd try this place again.

reviews.name: Stephanie H.
reviews.review: I have to say I was impressed when I walked through the door - wow, the interior of the restaurant was beautiful! That's the only positive thing about Ellendale's. If it is Mothers Day, please be prepared that not EVERYTHING is on the menu. When we were first seated (which had horrible ventilation, so I was already breaking a sweat) we put in our drink order & my husband ordered some tea. Waiter came back "we're out of tea". Good Lord this is the south. How can you run out of tea?! Put in our order, & I ordered the apple pork chops with caramelised onions. Well they were out of apples, too. But I'd let that pass. Well, we decided to stay and order dessert. I noticed there was gluten free chocolate cake. Well guess what, they were out of that, too! After waiting 5 minutes after he gave us the menu & said there is not a particular item on the dessert menu, I just asked for the check. I'll give this restaurant another shot but not on a holiday & when the air conditioning is fixed!

reviews.name: Josh C.
reviews.review: Good food. great chicken and waffles.....inside kinda old....but, wow...good food...!  Good service....

reviews.name: Shibby K.
reviews.review: Our reservation kept changing from 10ppl to 15, then finally 20ppl. And every time I called, the staff was courteous, respectful, and professional!  The food was great, ambiance was welcoming with a BnB feel to it, breakfast buffet had amazingly tasteful variety, and everybody was professional and presented great customer service!  The staff was informed it was for a bday so they came out with complimentary ice cream cake for bday girl and split her tab amongst our group. It was a well-organized event thanks to the staff at this restaurant

reviews.name: Junell H.
