reviews.review: Sorry but I would not recommend ellendales. The service was marginal, the piano music too loud, the place was drab and could use a makeover. The food was tasty, at least mine was. I had chicken, there was plenty, enough for leftovers. The vegetables were hot and tasty as well especially the sweet potato. Our waiter was the main issue; he got the drink order wrong, bought out salads before the appetizer, and was not attentive. We gave Ellendales a chance but would not recommend it and we will not be returning.

reviews.name: Ellen L.
reviews.review: In from out of town for business - sat right away with a group of 6 at 7:00 PM, AWESOME live, acoustic music, not a single complaint on our party's food order and the dessert is to die for. Everything is fresh, made in-house and the staff is lovely. They had no problem with splitting checks and were accommodating in every respect. MUST visit if in Nashville and looking for a  dinner spot. I head the lunch special is awesome too!

reviews.name: T W.
reviews.review: Loved the live music.  The musician was great, atmosphere was very nice, food great options.  Pricing was reasonable, music made it very worth it.

reviews.name: Jerry B.
reviews.review: Excellent food followed by an excellent service a must stop your next trip to Nashville.  Large parties no problem. Bar was nice with a decent band

reviews.name: Nicholas R.
reviews.review: Went for New Year's Eve dinner and while everyone found the food very tasty and appropriately priced, we had an issue with service.  You might attribute to the holiday, but come on, you gotta be ready for New Years.  Seemed only 1-2 girls were covering a large room and soiled plates were not removed between courses.  In addition, 1 person in our party of six did not receive his dinner until 10-15 minutes after the rest of the table...which is totally unacceptable!  I asked the waitress who was taking orders on the table next to us, but she barely acknowledged my question, so I sought out manager. Again, probably not waitresses fault, but you gotta be ready for New Years.

reviews.name: Brooke H.
reviews.review: We came for brunch, which was very good (I love the omelet station). Our server was nice, but distracted. I love the presentation of the "Bloody Mary", but the mix tasted like just tomato juice and horseradish (I should not expect much for $5). Overall it was good, but I don't think we'll be back anytime soon. Unless I get a crazy omelet craving...

reviews.name: Jamil M.
reviews.review: Went to Ellendale's at the recommendation of my fiancee. She is a big fan. I wasn't super impressed with the place. We went to the 'famous" sunday bunch. There was a wide variety, but the highlight of the brunch is the pasta/ omelette station. The problem was the person running the station didn't have everything he needed to run the station properly and he seemed new. I wasn't overly impressed, but that may be because the omelette I wanted didn't come out right due to the above mentioned situations. I would go back again, as I love a good breakfast buffet, but I hope that its a little better next time. And the mimosas are ok. not quite as good as everyone lets on. But I like having the option.

reviews.name: J B.
reviews.review: Visited based on reviews while traveling. Must have been an off night. There was a layer of "goop" on my Carbonara which appeared to be raw egg white and temp was cool. Second dish was better. It was still just eh in flavor, overcooked pasta. Server never asked why my drink remained untouched during the entire meal even after I paid my bill. As other reviewers stated decor in major need of cleaning and updating.

reviews.name: Scott B.
reviews.review: I have found my favorite place anytime I visit Nashville. I ordered the shrimp and grits "to go" and got great service on top of great food. When I stopped in to pick up my order, they brought me my food, and without saying a word they felt I did not get enough greens with my meal, so they brought out extra for me. I dug into my food as soon as I got back to my hotel and the food was AMAZING! I highly recommend Ellendale's! I will be going back to see what other tasty dishes await.

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: My husband brought me here for a surprise dinner date. I liked how the restaurant looked like a historic home. We were seated right away in the music room, where there was a great duet singing covers of recent hits. They were the best part of the night. My husband ordered the shrimp and grits, which he loved. I tried some of it and thought it was a little on the spicy side, and I wasn't a huge fan. I got the Romeo & Juliet sirloin, which was well-cooked and seasoned (minus the bleu cheese that was a little funky). The wilted greens and the mashed potatoes were excellent.  The dessert was my least favorite part. We got the tiramisu. I was really excited to see that it had coconut on it... but the taste of brandy was so potent that I could only eat two bites. I know you can usually taste a hint of liquor in tiramisu-- but it's usually more subtle than what I had at Ellendale's. The average price of an entree for dinner was around $20, which isn't terrible, but at the end of the night... I felt something was left to be desired. Overall, it was a quaint place with an old-fashioned vibe. No complaints on the food or service. I know other reviewers mentioned this, but it kind of felt like a scene my grandparents would have enjoyed and appreciated more.

reviews.name: Jeannine W.
reviews.review: Awesome place. Excellent food in a really cool setting. It's an old dairy farm converted into a restaurant. Eclectic place with eclectic excellent food. And live music too!  I had the caprese pasta which had fresh veggies over spaetzle. Spaetzle? Crazy good!!  Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Hector G.
reviews.review: Great ambiance with a beautiful house on a hilltop. Great wedge salad. The buffalo rabbit was very good.  Service was exceptional. The  cioppinio was amazing huge shrimp and scallops in a wonderful broth. The chef made a beautiful ragu for my wife which was not on the menu. We will be back.

reviews.name: JS B.
reviews.review: Very interesting menu and great location.  Will be back.

reviews.name: Michelle F.
reviews.review: This is a must-visit the next time I am in Nashville!  the service was awesome, the ambiance was classy (including a live pianist!) and the food was amazing.  There were things on the menu that you don't see everywhere!Ellendales is a little tucked away, so it's a little hard to find, but luckily, I had Yelp reviews and GPS to guide my way to this hidden gem!  After a horrible experience right across the street at Bar-B-Cutie (see scathing review), our tummies were still rumbling and we were on a mission to find something delicious.We found Ellendales!Our server was Paul, and he was one of the most attentive waiters I have ever seen in my life.  And one of the nicest!  When we ran low on pita chips for our mediterranean nachos, he brought some more out and we hadn't even asked for them!  When we needed refills, he was right there.  He made good suggestions and was quick to bring out the food with a smile!  he even brought out extra ranch dressing when he saw my friend fipping my discarded cucumbers in there just in case she didn't have enough!The food:Mediterranean nachos: Delicious--heavy on the hummusRabbit-Flavorful but differentSteak Sandwich-Fantastic, but I did take off the pickled onions--the taste was overpowering the taste of the steak.Paulimisu: My friend REALLY enjoyed it--and the menu is right, it was heavy on the brandy!I can't wait to come back again!!

reviews.name: Elizabeth B.
reviews.review: I went to Ellendale's while on business in town last Sunday.  I was overwhelmed by how many things I wanted to try from the menu.  We started with the toasted ravioli which was divine.  It was obvious from the first bite that this was not your standard Sysco toasted ravioli. I settled on the "Romeo and Juliet" for my main course--a  combination of steak with a blue cheese sauce and steak with a wine sauce separated by a large helping of mashed potatoes, tomatoes, and greens.  I must say that it is the very best dish I have ever had in a restaurant.  Everything tasted fresh, and the beef was obviously grass-fed.  To finish, we had the "paulamisu",  a layering of cake, pineapple, coconut, and brandy.  The service was excellent and as we finished our early dinner, the entertainer began playing wonderful ballads on the grand piano.  Great experience!  I will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Jack K.
reviews.review: Celebrated Mother's Day with Brunch at Ellendale's with our family of 4 adults and 3 small children.  While we really never heard of the restaurant before, we were pleasantly surprised.  Ellendales's is located in an old house and so the layout was a little difficult for a brunch setup.  The food was located in what was once a hall and getting the food was a little crowded.  But the good part is all the food was excellent.  A busy omelet table created some of the best I have had.  Main dishes included roast chicken and fried white fish which were really delicious.  Deserts included carrot cake and cheese cake which were also great.  They offer bottomless mimosas with several flavors.  Finally, they had a kids center with hotdogs and mac and cheese.  It was really an unexpected treat.

reviews.name: Rod B.
reviews.review: 2nd time here and the second was worst than the first if that's possible!  Bland BLand &BLAND!!!!!!!! Here for a family event and wishing I had ate before I got here. We were seated in a private room with 2 person wait staff. We had a pre set menu for our party of 25. The waiter was pretty good but the waitress was horrible. He may as well have waited on us by himself. It took 30 mins to fill our drink order for water. Refills were by inquiry only. Caesar salads were served without Caesar dressing. It took 20min before I realized my waitress wasn't going to bring it so I asked the waiter who took less than 1min to bring it. My gf's medium steak was as flavorless as it was devoid of heat. My exact sentiments for the uncajun pasta. Only if we had known that the prearranged menu meant we would be served previously cooked food. *** FINAL NAIL IN THE CULINARY COFFIN***HOWS ABOUT A LITTLE STOMACH BUG TO TOP OFF THE NIGHT! AROUND 1:30AM I WAS AWAKENED BY THIS MEAL VIOLENTLY MAKING IN EXIT FROM MY BODY. ONE OF MY WORST MEALS EVER!!!!

reviews.name: Dave L.
reviews.review: Thanksgiving buffet was not good.  First, our "reservation" didn't seem to mean anything as we had a wait in the cold parking lot for over an hour after our appointed time. We should have bailed at that point, but we didn't know where else to go. Once we finally got inside, the service was slow (drinks took about 15 or 20 minutes to arrive), and frankly the food was a real disappointment.  The turkey looked and tasted like chunks of turkey loaf, smothered in some sort of gravy, and several of the items had what could best be described as an "odd" taste -- not spoiled, but just not appetizing. They also tried to crowd too many tables into the restaurant. It was difficult to navigate through the restaurant without bumping into another diner. Lesson learned: Next Thanksgiving I'm going to cook at home and skip the Ellendale's mess. The food will be better, and we won't stand out in the cold waiting for it.

reviews.name: Megan F.
reviews.review: Staff was nice, food was okay and the setting was run down. So much potential to make this a gem of Donelson, but for now it is in need of a major facelift. Even just a thorough deep clean. It was in general, just dirty and that was what the public can see....I can only imagine the condition of the kitchen. Very sad that this was such a disappointment....a $70 one.

reviews.name: Adam M.
reviews.review: I went here about a year ago when visiting family in Nashville.  They told me that the lunch buffet is excellent so i went with them to give it a try. Everything was fresh from the salads, soups, and entrees that were available.  What i liked the most about the lunch buffet was that they also had a personal chef cook up whatever type of pasta/fettuccine dish (3 or 4 options) you wanted on a skillet. I'm going back to Nashville next week and i'll be definitely be going back to this place for their lunch buffet. Hopefully it's as good, if not better than it was last time i was there!

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: This is the best brunch in town! I've been coming here for a few years now and they do not disappoint.

reviews.name: Ethan P.
reviews.review: Very friendly staff, quality food, good selection,appropriate prices.My mom and I went to Nashville in January. We didn't have time to eat before the Grand Ole Opry and I was struggling to find a good restaurant that would still be open afterwards. I called Ellendales to see how late they would serve us as we would be pushing it. I had to miss the last few minutes of The Mavericks and got to Ellendales from Ryman Auditorium just 10 minutes before closing time. I wouldn't like having I serve someone so late in the evening but the staff at Ellendales welcoming as could be. I got rabbit for the first time at a restaurant and it was very good. I hope to go back someday soon.

reviews.name: Hank D.
reviews.review: In Nashville for work and had dinner with coworkers.  The items which got raves from my coworkers were the craft beers on tap as well as the rabbit entree.I had beet and goat cheese salad, which had a vanilla flavored dressing, which was great.  I also had their shrimp and grits, which had a sweet grit cake instead of the loose, runny grits.   The shrimp was in a spicy, hot sauce. This was served with kale and was very good. Eclectic furnishings in the restaurant and very warm on a cold night.

reviews.name: Lovemydog B.
reviews.review: Dining at our hotel was a little pricey so they sent us here.We stopped in on a Tuesday early afternoon.  It was not busy at all and they set us in the first room.  Which was nice.  Out waiter started out super attentive.  Drinks came quick and the food came out as planned.  The waiter suggested we take a peek at the salad bar, nothing to amazing so we passed.  I got the sliders and they we pretty good- I would suggest them.  I also got a Bloody Mary, it was a bit spicy but that didn't stop me from loving it.After our food was delivered our server left us alone.  He did stop back to make sure everything was ok- but seriously he left us alone.  We were fine with that, being on vacation and not in a hurry.  I imagine if you are on your lunch break, you might find it annoying.  Should I find myself back in Nashville- I would give it a dinner try!

reviews.name: Alex F.
reviews.review: I was in Nashville for a night and was staying near the airport. I turned to Yelp to find a nearby restaurant and Ellendale's turned up as a viable option.I enjoyed their Mediterranean Nachos. They had an odd but yummy taste to them. It was basically hummus with a Nacho kick.I ordered the rabbit. Never had rabbit before. It tasted like regular fried chicken to me, maybe a bit firmer than chicken, nonetheless it was good.I liked the fact that they had Simi Alexander Valley Cab - one of my favorite cabs.The place is located in an old house. It is quite charming. The live music was also enjoyable.  The service was good too. Overall it was a pleasant experience.

reviews.name: Nana B.
reviews.review: One of the best experiences we've had in a long time. Split the NY Strip steak with my hubby and it was delicious and cooked to perfection. The owner stopped by to make surE everything was okay and we had a great conversation with her. My hubby heard live music coming from the back so we enjoyed a glass of wine after dinner and listened to a wonderful young lady sing a variety of great songs. We wer treated to a sample of chocolate covered crunch and a dollop of homemade raspberry sorbet - wonderful taste and combination! We will definitely go back there next time we pass thru or spend the weekend in music city. Want to visit her deli too.

reviews.name: Mickey D.
reviews.review: Bring a flashlight if you want to read what's on the menu because they're a little stingy on the lights.  But, I don't expect that'll be a problem because everything we ordered was pretty darn tasty. I came with a big group and we worked our way through the menu from the appetizers  to the dessert sampler and I couldn't have been more pleased.  This place has all the great things that you'd expect from Nashville... great live music, fantastic food, and super service.

reviews.name: Benjamin F.
reviews.review: If this is what Nashville food tastes like, I'll fast while I'm here. Everything I tasted from their signature cocktails through their appetizers, entrees and deserts were bland uninspired recipes. Their menus are so much better written than their cooks can prepare. The food is beige, poorly seasoned, and overcooked till dried out. I sincerely hope I experienced a bad night but I won't ever risk coming back to find out. I'd rather eat at one of the many mediocre national chains nearby than ever eat from this kitchen again.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: As always we really enjoyed the Hospitality, Great Wine Selection, Live Piano Music  and Dinner.  Magical as always !

reviews.name: S H.
reviews.review: The Thanksgiving meal was definetly NOT worth the money. The food was mediocre, service was bad and the tables were way tooCrowded together. Sad we had to spend so much money on such a special dayOn a meal we didn't enjoy & in such a yuck environment,

reviews.name: LaDonna T.
reviews.review: Came during Sunday brunch 5/4/2014 after hearing wonderful things. Was not impressed at all. All the food seemed to be leftovers from the day before. They had a variety of chips and dip, however all the chips and pita bread were stale. The fish had no flavor. The breakfast bar had gravy that looked dry and over cooked. The waffles were claimed to be "fresh", but where sliced and thrown in a warmer. They didn't offer fresh fruit toppings for the waffles, just glaze looking stuff. There weren't any scrambled eggs. The sausage links were dried out. The omelette chef was not around for half our brunch. I got a Caesar salad from the cold bar which was mehh.. They had other pastas and shrimp that I didn't try. My date had the shrimp and describe it as having a "bleachy and fishy taste". I'm not sure how their service is arranged but I only seen my server when he introduced himself and when he brought us our drinks. The only reason I'm giving two starts is because of the atmosphere and decor.

reviews.name: Renee A.
reviews.review: I don't get to eat a proper brunch out often, so I was excited to try Ellendale's one morning a few months ago.  Unfortunately the food was just not good.  At all.  And it was grossly overpriced for what was available at that time. $40+ for 2 to dine on stale, dried-out, bland food.  I felt like I was being robbed as I paid; it definitely didn't seem like I got my money's worth of food, beverage, or service.  I haven't been back, and I don't plan on doing so.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: Excellent food.  Excellent service. Excellent music. I recommend the crispy southern fried rabbit.

reviews.name: Bridget O.
reviews.review: We went for Sunday brunch. The food was pretty standard. My husband and I weren't blown away. Everything seemed warm, but not hot and fresh. Adding on the bottomless mimosa's was definitely the best part.

reviews.name: Susan C.
reviews.review: This old home is located on a side street so it was hard to find in the dark despite GPS. It was virtually empty on a Monday night. We opted to sit in the room with the music ~ a wonderful woman singing & playing the piano. A few groups were yelping so loud, it drown out her lovely voice! Rude! I ordered the prime rib which came overdone....maybe my fault for ordering it medium. My husband had the shrimp carbonara which came with several HUGE shrimp, so overall, we were happy campers. The one thing that bothered me was the COLD room! I told the hostess but nothing was ever done about it.......Would return if in the area!

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: I took a vacation day from work to spend my birthday with my mom.  She had been here before and it looked like a great location for a mother daughter lunch.They have a big lunch buffet so I tried to sample some of everything.  The chicken and fish were good but the beef was a little tough.  There was a large assortment of steamed and grilled vegetables.  The salad bar and dessert bar had many choices.  The potato soup was disappointing.  It had a gritty taste instead of creamy.The restaurant is in a historic farmhouse and it was beautiful inside and out with a very relaxing atmosphere.

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: We hit this place about 1pm on Father's Day. Though there were tons of people on the porch waiting, our wait was only 15 minutes. This is an old house converted to a restaurant, and we were seated in a small front room that was full of couples (re: quiet!) We didn't realize that they only had buffet (and I don't know if that's an every Sunday thing or if it was just for Father's Day,) but decided to make the best of it. We are glad we did. I think I sampled one of everything they had. There were at least four meat entree selections, fresh vegetables dressed with herbs, fresh salads (mixed greens and a caesar) with homemade dressings, pasta salad, potato salad, breakfast options, an omelette and pasta station, plus home made breads and desserts. I don't know why I keep saying "homemade." Everything is, plus it is all organic and purchased locally (and some even grown in gardens on the property.)  I can't even describe how great this "buffet" food was. BTW it was $19.95 which I found quite reasonable.  I can't wait to try the menu! If I had to complain, I'd say the service was a bit slow, but jeez, all he was doing was bringing drinks and removing plates. But I saw him waiting at the bar for his drinks several times. Above all this, Ellendale's placed everyone who brought children in the main dining room where live piano music was playing, and didn't put parties with lively children into the smaller rooms with couples who wish to be able to hear their conversation. Smart!

reviews.name: Nick G.
reviews.review: Was intrigued by their other yelpers mentioning this place served rabbit, not to often a place has that on their menu, and so I decided to give this place a try.  I was impressed as I saw the place, it looked like a home that was redone into a restaurant, and very elegantly.  The ambiance and entire atmosphere was very relaxing and classy.  Their wine menu was extensive, exotic, and very informative.  I did order the rabbit, and accompanied it with a nice glass of white wine.  The rabbit was accompanied with a sweet potato mash and was almost excellent.  There were two cuts of meat that came with the plate.  One was tender, juicy and delicious.  The second however (conveniently hidden underneath the first) was dry and very rough at times.  It was as if it was over-fried... and kinda tasted like this as well.  If it wasn't for this second piece of over-cooked meat, I don't think I'd of had a second thought in giving a perfect review.Everyone was very friendly, and i very much enjoyed my visit here, though I can't go as far as to give it five stars.  If I was in town again, I would definitely make another stop here, and if the dish can do just a little bit more I wouldn't hesitate in giving it a five star rating.

reviews.name: Rachel K.
reviews.review: I give this place a two because our server was wonderful, thank you Alan S. Other than our server this place has the worst Sunday brunch I have never had. The food was cold, flavorless and overpriced. They need scrambled eggs so that I do not have to wait in a fifteen minute omelet line, also move the gravy and the biscuits to the same table. This place is ass backwards and very inefficient when you are trying to move through the line. I suggest buying fifty dollars in cheap champagne and a box of waffle mix and just staying home.

reviews.name: Brad H.
reviews.review: Glad I swayed coworkers from their suggestion for lunch (Ruby Tuesday?!) and found this unique place, thanks to Yelp! Love restaurants in old houses, great atmosphere. The Mediterranean nachos were an amazing appetizer--I would have been happy with this as my meal order! My buffalo chicken tenders were good, but nothing special. My wife's lettuce wraps were a big disappointment. They might have been good if it wasn't for the fact that the noodles and chicken were DROWNING in a not so tasty sauce. A coworker ordered the french dip, which was huge and looked very tasty. I would like to return and try that or something else. Still glad we tried Ellendale's and not something like Ruby Tuesday

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: i have had a better buffet at shoneys. went on a saturday and talk about bland and uninterting but it was ediable so hence the two stars. the waitress was good

reviews.name: Heather M.
reviews.review: Came here looking for dinner since I was staying at a hotel down the road. The house is a neat setting and they grow a lot of their produce on site. I sat at the bar and the bartender was super-friendly and attentive. Great service. They had some live music, an acoustic musician which was really nice. Regarding the food, I found it a little hit or miss. I had the Iceberg Wedge salad and it came with crispy onion straws, bacon, sun dried tomatoes and bleu cheese dressing. It was very tasty and I liked the combo of toppings. The proportion was slightly off so I needed to ask for more onion straws. Next I had the bruschetta. In my experience, bruschetta is always a gamble. They make their bread in house and then make the crostini from that and the texture of the bread was very good. My problem was the bread was soaked in the balsamic vinaigrette. You only need the slightest hint of balsamic, so a strong a flavor it is. There was basil ice cream to cleanse the palate, which was tasty, but it more like rescued my palate from the balsamic overkill. Again, proportions were off.Lastly, I had the Tiramisu. Be forewarned -- this is nothing like tiramisu. It was a real disappointment and I should have sent it back but I was so exhausted from my day I just tried to eat part of it. It was basically a slab of cream cheese and I do mean a slab, with some shredded coconut sprinkled on top, a few bits of pineapple thrown in, and some dry cake. Again the problem was with proportion. A ridiculous amount of cream cheese to all the other ingredients. Also, you need mascarpone to make tiramisu. When I heard it was all cream cheese, I was a bit confused, but decided to try it thinking maybe it was creamy like cheesecake, but no, it was literally like they unwrapped a package of cream cheese and threw it on a plate. I still get a bit queasy thinking of it. The ambiance is for the older crowd. Meaning on a Friday night there were a lot of elderly people. I was just looking for a quiet dinner, but overall not that impressed and if I'm in Nashville I wouldn't return. Service was great though, they just need to re-work the food. Is someone not tasting items in the kitchen or is the chef's palate just way off?

reviews.name: Catherine K.
reviews.review: I really don't understand the rave reviews on this place.  I've tried it twice for the Sunday brunch.  Both times I was equally disappointed.  The service was terrible.  The food was cold.  And most importantly - have you checked out their health food scores???  No, thank you.  Go to Darfon's just down the street!

reviews.name: AC R.
reviews.review: Its a very neat and casual dining spot. Staff is very friendly and helpful. I had the ahi tuna with a greek salad. The salad was delicious and very fresh. The tuna was just okay. It was a bit fishy and was not accompanied by any good sides. I will try it again, but hoping the entree is better than before.

reviews.name: Yotie E.
reviews.review: Wow! This place was really, really off. Visits in the past were always good. HOWEVER, taking  a  business party of 10 with folks from out of town was really a bad idea .So much for trying to  impress or please our party  by going to Ellendale's. The only thing redeemable about the place now was  the very hospitable hostess. The service at the bar and the  serivce of the wait staff is simply sad. Long waits with repeated requests for items and that's just a start. It was 7 PM and after we placed orders, the waitress came back and informed us that they were out of salmon and they were out of shrimp. What?? The other waiter said that they run out of food a lot and people complain. What??  The beet salad with vanilla dressing came with no dressing and hardly any beets. The empanadas were embarrassing. The steak was a lot of cartilage. The bread served looked like it had been run over by a truck. The dessert sampler was mediocre and the basil ice cream was really just green ice cream so they clearly forgot the main ingredient in that dish as well. Sorry to say, not a good reflection on Nashville cuisine  or for that matter, cuisine in general.  Never again. Goodbye Ellendale's and good luck to you.

reviews.name: Laura L.
reviews.review: Restaurant appears to be on its way to closing.  Holes in the ceiling, smelly carpet and mediocre sangria.  They charged to split plates $5. Worst wedge salad ever.Good service, good desserts, but with all the great places in Nashville, we won't return here.

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: This is a really nice restaurant. We stumbled upon it looking for something that was close to the hotel we were staying at and am glad we gave it a shot. Cool ambiance once inside. some guy was playing a set on guitar that added to feel. Since it was our first time there out waiter walked us through the menu. I had the rabbit. That's right. Rabbit! Was super good, would have been better if not fried. Every thing on the menu looked great and the portions are massive! They had about 5 craft beers on tap and a large selection of wine. Dress is casual nothing fancy. If staying at any hotel on elm hill this place is worth checking out.

reviews.name: Ashley A.
reviews.review: Thoroughly disappointed in Ellendales! Went for brunch today with a reservation. Stood in the entryway for 15 minutes (10min past our reservation time) without even being greeted by the hostess, who was apparently in the back clearing tables. When we were finally greeted, there was no apology. In fact she barely acknowledged that we had been waiting. Brunch buffet was sub-par at best and overpriced for food that obviously came from cans and boxes. My date had "orange juice." We had to wait for them to "make a fresh batch," so he was expecting fresh squeezed; instead, he ended up with Tang or some other orange koolaid equivalent. Biscuits were hard as a rock and the bacon in the buffet line was nearly raw - can you say food poisoning waiting to happen? Definitely wouldn't go back.

reviews.name: Sal P.
reviews.review: So I'm giving this place 5 stars because it's just downright incredible. The ambiance is great. It's like Walking into somebody's warm and welcoming home. The service was world class. Our server was Rod and he was great. Knowledgeable about wines, the menu, and anything you could ask him. So we started out with a glass of wine. It was reasonably priced for a house brand. We had an order of bread with garlic butter. Now the bread hits you with a punch to the face with garlic. This is a good thing. If you like garlic don't miss out on the bread. It was incredible. We moved on to the bacon wrapped shrimp stuffed with crab. This was sooooo good 4 large pieces of shrimp with crispy bacon wrapped around it. Prepared perfectly. My wife had the new York steak and it was tender and juicy and prepared just as ordered. She had the baked sweet potato along with it. I had one of the best ribeye steaks I've ever had. I had the baked potato which was prepared perfectly. Both dinners came with asparagus that was very good. Oh and I forgot. We both had a wedge salad. The wedge was pretty good. Not the best I've had but still very good. We were too full for dessert but damn they looked good. The entire time we were there we listened to some local entertainment. It was a couple playing soft country tunes. They were great. All in all it are for a great date night while visiting for business.

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: As a Donelson resident, I certainly wish I could give this place a higher score. You see, the dining pickings are slim in 37214 and after a 5+ year wait from the last time I tried Ellendale's, I was hoping to add this option back on my list of neighborhood places I could count on. First bad sign - party of 6 was able to get in on a Saturday night at 7:30 without a wait. Second ding - they were out of rabbit. Third ding - didn't get our salads (to be fair, only 2 people ordered them). Fourth ding - only one person truly enjoyed their dish. Two of us had the shrimp and grits and man, it was just plain bad. The shrimp were the toughest I may have ever had and lacked seasoning - they may have been boiled. The dish was also lacking the dijon slaw accompaniment (which I didn't realize until after we left...I kept thinking it was missing something). Another person ordered the scallops and said the flavor was okay but they weren't cooked properly - no sear at all. Yuck.At least the bread was good, along with the herb butter. Someone at our table mentioned that it seems like nothing is made in house, and I tend to agree. Sorry, Ellendale's, you won't be getting another chance from me.

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: This place is pretty decent, I think  you should really try the prime rib its really good for the price... If you're ever in Donelson you should make it your business to stop here and eat, the atmosphere, food and service is just phenomenal.

reviews.name: Melia R.
reviews.review: I can dig the scene. I might say 4, 4.5, but I'm going full 5 for ambience and service.The food is good, the wine selection is impressive for such a short list, and the soothing background music (provided by live musicians) is a nice touch.I was in town for business and Yelp led me to this establishment on my first night in town. I sat at the bar (like a REAL business traveler!) and met some friendly locals. The bartender, Jason, was great -- and an interesting cat, too.I imagine this place is great with a lover or friends, but I found it especially enjoyable as a lone traveler. Thanks for making my evening, guys!

reviews.name: Gai P.
reviews.review: Not for me, I didn't think the food was outstanding though they try.  The place smelled like old food that's been sitting out for a couple of days and it's mixed with chemical cleaner smells. They are going for the low lighting effect but it was just weird, I felt like I was in the Twilight Zone - something was off.  Not good for people watching. The only thing I like about this place was the house and the live music.

reviews.name: Peachraven O.
reviews.review: Had Thanksgiving Dinner here with my husband, two kids and another family of 4. Great experience! Although we had reservations, with it being busy for Thanksgiving, we had a 15-10 min wait. But that was OK. We sat on a porch that had heaters, hot cocoa for the kids and cheese dip and tortilla chips to satiate us while we waited. The adults had the bottomless mimosas for $10 and they were yummy. Everything was excellent! Our server was friendly and prompt. Food was great. Lots of variety and everything very tasty. The oyster shooters and shrimp were fresh, not soggy which can happen on a buffet line. Turkey, dressing, ham, sweet potatoes, steamship round w/ mushroom au jus, green beans almondine and the kale w/ sundried tomatoes, quinoa salad which were faves, were all excellent! Love the cozy feel of the eclectic house -- made it feel more like being home.

reviews.name: Edwina S.
reviews.review: I've dined here several times. I have never been disappointed with the food. My last visit was on Thanksgiving - which needed reservations. We were seated about 1 hr after our reservation but Thanksgiving was beautiful weatherwise so we sat on the front porch and talked. If the weather had been lousy, this would have been aggravating. They had been serving since the morning, yet the staff did not act exhausted. The food was plentiful... loved the roast beef carving station. I would just suggest calligraphed name tags on some of the less known dishes. I got a sample of what I thought was fondue but it was squash based. Still have no clue what it could be as it was surrounded by breads. I am usually there when a grand piano is being played in the main dining room. It's really lovely. Recommend it

reviews.name: Pritish Z.
reviews.review: God Bless my Stomach!! So my team decided to rope in at Ellendales for lunch and trust me, it was awesome from the ambience, to food, their service won my heart (& stomach). As always, I will brief you about my exp in all departments: 1. Ambience: From outside it looks like a traditional house located in a quite neighbourhood (really). The have pretty good seating arrangment, lots of tables, good lighting. Suggestion: Have some Italian music that will attract even more people - Mr. Owner 2.Food Service: Well during the lunch time they offer buffet which doesn't require lot of staff interaction / help. I found their staff to be polite and helpful. Overall 5 stars in this dept. You guys rock!! 3. Food: Here comes the real stuff. Well, as always as soon as i entered, I checked with their staff if they had veggies options and they did had a variety of options! I started with Salad which is right across the "Pasta Bar", it was sooo good. I really liked the pasta as it was made fresh. I will surely recommend to all my friends.

reviews.name: Ceile G.
reviews.review: Fantastic brunch. Lunch buffet is incredible. Live music at night. Ambiance is special because the building was once an old estate and it's filled with antiques and many separate dining rooms. Grow their own herbs in garden on premises. Outdoor seating. Linen napkins and tablecloths.

reviews.name: Marc M.
reviews.review: "Your review helps others find out about local businesses."  This is some of what makes Yelp great...I was staying at the Sheraton Music City and wanted to take some local clients out for a nice dinner close to my hotel, but nothing on the order of a typical high-end restaurant.  I Yelped Ellendales and we made a reservation.  If the weather had been better, I would have expected a wait, but we were seated right away, despite being 15 minutes late for our reservation.  The place is big - you've read that it is an old house on top of a hill.  I am not sure how long the place has been a restaurant, but they have added a big bar and lounge that is where we were sat.I was a bit leery at first of lounge singer, but by the end of the evening I came to believe we might have seen a future up-and-comer in the Nashville music scene.Our dinner consisted of crab cake appetizers (good) and entrees of lasagna, mahi-mahi and a char-grilled ribeye. Mine was the ribeye and I must say that I was disappointed in how fatty the steak was.  I like the flavor of ribeye, but this was a bad piece of meat.  Everyone else enjoyed their meals.Service was good.  Drinks were reasonably priced.  Overall, it was a good meal and I would go back.

reviews.name: Lindsay P.
reviews.review: After reading mixed reviews,  my family and I decided to try the Sunday brunch this afternoon.  I was anxious to try all the delicious things, but I didn't see any of it on the brunch buffet. The blue cheese sirloin was very chewy and hard to cut, and the only other entree choice was bbq porkloin that had been there for awhile. I decided not to eat, I couldn't see spending $15.95 on dessert.  The omelet station was the only redeeming quality about this visit. The air doesn't keep up, so the whole family was covered in sweat. Almost everyone kept asking to move, and they just kept seating people in that room. My biggest disappointment was that what is charged for your children is based on server discretion.  Meaning they can guess how much your child ate, and then charge you accordingly.  I've never heard of anything like that in all of my restaurant experience!  My 1 and 2 year old who split an omelet and drank nothing were charged $10. I think this place is a good concept, but execution is totally lacking. We will not be going back anytime in the near future.

reviews.name: AP J.
reviews.review: Great food!  Great service.  Thank you Ellendale's for having Maddi or Madison on your staff.  Her serving talent was the perfect match for perfect food.  Amazing dining experience.  See you when I return.

reviews.name: Cassi Y.
reviews.review: I hate to post a bad review because this used to be one of my favourite spots, a don't miss when I come to Nashville. Unfortunately their menu has changed recently and I was not impressed. I got the Rabbit which was good but the sides were just terrible. I was with a group and it was unanimous that our food was at best mediocre. The atmosphere outside was nice and they had a fantastic trio playing made for nice ambiance. All in all though I miss my Romeo and Juliet steak with mashed potatoes and spinach!

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: I wanted to love this place. It met all the requirements I wanted for my night: food, live music, and close to my hotel. They served tofu (in the deep south). They're in an old house. It all added up to a great time.I came here based on yelp reviews especially the one about the ginger ice cream. I laughed at the one where the youngest guy was 44 (in my case I was the youngest at 33). I took it at face value the poorer reviews and came because of the strength of a 4 star.The appetizer was awesome. I highly recommend the Mediterranean nachos. The Caesar salad was ok. I liked the baked cheese touch. The main course was a sweet n sour fried tofu. This was not what I expected. The tofu was good. However the be of greens and unidentifiable white stuff was weird. Next time I'd order the other tofu dish (something about tofu, zucchini etc). The ginger ice cream was ok but not as good as you can get in any Chinatown.I will say the service was amazing! The ambiance was fantastic. The live music very enjoyable. I liked all that. It's just pricey.

reviews.name: Robin W.
reviews.review: I REALLY enjoyed the Sunday brunch.  Omelet station, meats, veggies, fruits, desserts....my mouth is watering, and I want to go back!  This is a pretty big establishment...able to accommodate a lot of hungry people.

reviews.name: Jim C.
reviews.review: The night before Thanksgiving we went with friends who hadn't been there for a while... but said it was excellent...Upon entering we all thought we were in the wrong place.... great disarray.... dark...dreary.... ugly...ok...give a break... night before Thanksgiving.... We were seated.... ordered a drink and were given paper copied menus....hmmm not what's expected in a better restaurant..... the one star is for the drink..... less if possible for the rest. We did not stay to try the food. Nuff said.....

reviews.name: Dave P.
reviews.review: Warning!  Please READ!:  perhaps if I had read more of the reviews before coming here, I would have realized the buffet is ONLY available during lunch hours and on the weekends for brunch.  But they do not offer it during dinner hours.I arrived at 6:00 PM on a Thursday night.  There is a piano here, but nobody is playing it (many Yelpers mentioned the piano music).So, I came to this place because of the sparkling reviews - I had never heard of the place before even though I travel to Nashville a couple times per year.I was dining alone so I sat at the bar.  The bartender(ette) - Julia- was quite friendly.  I ordered the Amaretto Chicken, and she warned me it was quite sweet.  She was right, too sweet - but I ate it all!  Really good!The chicken breast was grilled just right, but the sweet potato spaetzle it was paired with was too soft.  The wilted greens were delicious, but the portion was small.No desert, but I had a glass of wine.  Total bill: $24.07 before tip.BTW:  I'm 44 years old, and I'm among the YOUNGEST customer here!It's 7:00 PM.  The bill is paid, and I'm heading out... But a piano player just showed up.  Maybe I'll have another wine and hang out a bit longer...

reviews.name: Tim G.
reviews.review: It has been over 10 years since my last trip to Ellendale's.   Not much has changed.  Poor service and food that makes you well...wish you didn't have it.  Maybe in another 10 years they will get it right.

reviews.name: Rick T.
reviews.review: The Thanksgiving buffet was very disappointing. Turkey was not fresh roast beef tough Mac and cheese horrible. Staff poorly trained. I will never go back.

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: I think Ellendales is one of the premier local restaurants in Nashville, and you're doing yourself a disservice if you don't check it out.The brunch buffet is excellent, and at only $16 (with $4 mimosas) it's rather cheap compared to the usual dinner prices.  The omelet bar is especially amazing, and the current guy working the omelet bar is very helpful and sociable.  The lunch selections are varied and very tasty, with the usual breakfast selections of grits, bacon, sausage, etc.  The one complaint I would make about the selection is that there are no eggs on the buffet besides the omelet bar.  I think breakfast buffets should at least have scrambled eggs.The dinner menu is excellent as well although somewhat on the expensive side.  I do wish they still had the Saturday night prime rib buffet:  I miss it.

reviews.name: Jason K.
reviews.review: I got the impression that this place caters to travelers due to its proximity to so many airport hotels...nevertheless, it was surprisingly good. There was a great flamenco/jazz guitarist/singer playing. The ambiance was quite nice as the restaurant was located in an old house. Though my ribeye was just OK (it was done a perfect medium-rare but the cut of meat itself was poorly marbled and gristly), the cioppino was superb. It wasn't an authentic San Franciscan cioppino (I've had my fair share of those), but was delicious nontheless. The tomato broth was spicy and full of body while the generous servings of seafood were perfectly cooked...not an easy task. Curiously, this was served over fettucine. We will definitely return the next time we are flying out of Nashville.

reviews.name: Kenisall R.
reviews.review: DO NOT BOTHER GOING HERE. Most especially do not go for "Sunday Brunch". We paid $77 (2 adults, 1 child) with tip for a buffet that was less than mediocre. The  wait staff was very good and helpful, but the food on the buffet was horrid. The few breakfast foods tasted like they were bulk pack warm up. The omelet station was understaffed, ran out of eggs and I'm fairly certain they were just wiping pans down with a questionably clean towel between omelets. I have eaten here several times in the past and it was very good. I can't say that about the current food offerings and price  structure. I will honestly never eat here again.

reviews.name: Jeff A.
reviews.review: I hate that my special occasion was ruined by this restaurant! Cold salty food. They change the sides from what was listed on the menu and decided I didn't need to know or have a choice. I was very embarrassed I choose this place!It even had a bad odor where they seated us.

reviews.name: Nick G.
reviews.review: Very unique and special dining experience at Ellendale's. I was taken here by local family while I was in town for a convention. This is not a place I would assume people come unless they are local because it is not near hotels or touristy spots. However, I felt very much at home here... because the restaurant is a converted home!Each dinning room is a different room of the house and has a different flare and sound level. They had live music, but my uncle has a hearing aid and we didn't want to not be able to talk during our short meal time while in town. Our room was supposed to be one of the quieter ones, so if that matters to you, make sure to let the host know.The menu was interesting, because it wasn't southern, it wasn't super high class, it was somewhere inbetween, but then again, so were the prices. Decent meal, and the food was good. Service was also very nice and we had a good time. The strength of this restaurant is that you feel far away from the hustle of the city, without having to go hours into the country. If you want a nice, comfortable, and different dining experience, give Ellendale's a try.

reviews.name: Emily L.
reviews.review: After a long day of traveling to Nashville, all I ever want is Ellendale's in Donaldson(which is next to the airport). I want a glass of blantons and some fried rabbit/bison/vension or their beef stew. Ellendale's is always accommodating and relaxing. The owner is a gorgeous women who showed us around her garden last time we were there, as the fireflies were coming it out. I love this place.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Everyone says that the Sunday Brunch is where its at, but I was there for dinner.  Overall Nice Atmosphere, The food was good, but I felt the portions were a bit on the small side for the price. The service was average, the server was "unsure" about a few things on the menu and didn't really seem that interested in resolving the que

reviews.name: James R.
reviews.review: Wife and I went for brunch today. Fan. Tas. Tic. The food never disappoints, and the staff is exceptional. And if you ever get a chance to try their bleu cheese buffalo chicken - DO IT!Worth the price of admission alone.

reviews.name: Nick P.
reviews.review: Had a great meal here last Tuesday night.  I had shrimp and grits, which were fantastic!  The waiter told me he wasn't sure which to recommend more, this, or the chef's black sirloin, so I figured I might be back the next night to try the steak.  Alas, I had to leave town the next afternoon.   The portion was a little small, but that's probably because I missed lunch.  The martini was great, and the basil sorbet was an excellent dessert.

reviews.name: Jenny M.
reviews.review: I came in with a large group of fifteen, and the restaurant was very attentive to the fact that we were large - they allotted two servers to our table. The food was excellent as well. I had the shrimp carbonara which was fantastic, as well as the lavender cheesecake. I was worried the essence of lavender would be overpowering, but it was the perfect blend, with a fantastic raspberry sorbet. Everyone in my group seemed satisfied around the table, and we certainly appreciated the attentive service. All in all, a great place, close to home, and not too busy. Since it's in Donelson, it might be overlooked, but it's certainly worthy of attention.

reviews.name: K D.
reviews.review: Interesting set-up in an older house. The mimosa selection is extensive and interesting (although they should have been served colder).  The bloody mary was impressive and spicy with a great piece of bacon and some interesting garnishments.Taylor, our waiter, was attentive but not efficient. Good personality, but seemed to run back to the kitchen 2-3 times per request and didn't fulfill all of them.Recommended:  the eggs/omelet and potatoes, shrimp and grits (beware, it's very spicy!)Not recommended:  falafel sliders - they were dry and a little too crumbly.  Basil ice cream tasted a little soap-y.  Mac 'n cheese. The ketchup is smoky and tastes a little more like BBQ. We didn't ask, but they should offer a normal ketchup as well.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: What a neat spot.  I've been here twice now while in Nashville for work and really enjoyed it.  The reviews on Yelp directed me here and the hotel I stay in is only about a mile away, so it's perfect.The first time I dined here I had the Salmon Pasta and it was outstanding.  The caper (one of my favorite nuances) and olive marinara was unique and mouthwatering.  The second time I went (last week) I had the "Raspberry Lava Chicken and it was just OK.  The chicken could have been a bit more tender, and maybe larger in portion.The environment is entirely unique, however.  It's in an old huge house and everything is nice and rustic.  Service is very friendly and I believe I heard the bartender say that they have live music every night?  I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town and I'll stick with the Salmon Pasta.

reviews.name: Kendyl M.
reviews.review: We went here two nights while we were in Nashville.  The reason we went back was for the BBQ pecan bacon wrapped shrimp.  Other than that everything else was hit or miss.  Service was mediocre even though our server was very nice.  Anything that had bread with it (hummus plate, chicken burger) the bread was hard and dry.  The appetizers are where it's at.  The James Bond, shrimp, and stuffed mushroom caps were all delicious!

reviews.name: Ashley N.
reviews.review: One word for this place, AMAZING.We went here after reading reviews on yelp and it did not disappoint! We had a great bottle of wine, Mediterranean nachos (OMG to die for!!!), raspberry lava chicken (yum), amaretto chicken (yum) and a creme brule. Everything was super delicious and the service was great. Sitting in the music room was a really nice experience as well.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Loved the spicy Shrimp and Grits.  Never had anything like it before.

reviews.name: Brian W.
reviews.review: Would be four stars but my steak wasn't very good, quite tough and too well done for medium rare.  It was well seasoned however.  All else was very good, other meals including red snapper, appetizers, dessert, setting, and music.  The rabbit appetizers were unique and quite good. I recommend this place but not the steak. TV was showing the Broncos vs Steelers playoff game, happen to be watching during the miracle OT 80-yd TD pass.

reviews.name: Mark L.
reviews.review: Good martini's. Nice wine selection. I had special for the night- a grouper with a crab sauce over rice with green beans. Very food. gOthers had the trout - would recommend again. Lasagna. Said it one of the better lasagna's that he has had.

reviews.name: Ian P.
reviews.review: My wife and I came here on New Years Eve and were subject to the special Holiday Menu. It all looked good and we went there based on a review in our hotel magazine. I also liked the fact that it was a local business wanting to use as many local products as possible. The setting being in an old house as well also helped make our deicison.We arrived and had to wait a few moments to be seated, this was expected being New Years Eve, so it was no big deal. There was a nice dark room to sit near the bar which was very relaxing. The staff asked us if we wanted to drinks and that we would be seated shortly. No problems here.When we were seated, we were enjoying a local musician at the piano singing everything from Billy Joel to Elton John to basically everything on the Classic Rock station. She was enjoyable for the evening and very welcoming to all the patrons and took requests.Our server surprised us from behind as our seats were put in a way to face the stage. He went over the menu with us and we ordered our appetizers and dinner. My wife started with a salad. It was decent but nothing over the top. I ordered the rabbit pate and found it pleasant. For dinner, my wife order the half chicken. It looked good, but it was rather tasteless. The barley on the side was tasteless as well. I ordered the advertised New York Strip medium rare, which turned out to be a rib eye instead according to our server. That sparked my interest even more since I like that cut better. The steak came out and was undercooked. The server even asked me to check while he brought it to the table. Hmmmm.... It was still rather rare and in about five minutes he brought it back and it was cooked to my liking. After a few bites, one would expect a little fat here and there, but when each piece turned out to be fatty and stringy, I was getting annoyed. On top of all this, the steak was way too thick to be the rib eye's that I am accustomed to. I am almost thinking it was a chuck steak bought in bulk for New Years made to look like something else. I sent back the steak and decided to order the pork chop instead. The pork chop probably faired much worse than it actually was as my appetite was waning. The side of mash potatoes was decent but by that time I was done.I felt that all the servers were running around frantically for no reason. My wife and I both have worked in the restaurant business so I want to make it clear that I am not just complaining. They were far from understaffed but could not seem to accomodate their tables in a timely manner. At many times, I found servers hiding in the bathroom hallway or servers not even present and rarely coming out of the kitchen area. I cannot speak for other tables, but for the few around us, there were not many smiles based on the service and the food. If something was happening in the kitchen, it was very obvious on the faces and personalities of the servers.At the end of the night, our server tried to make nice with us and tried to make conversation over my wife's South American name. It did not help his tip at all. I think he knew we were upset with his service as well as the food.All in all, the best part of the evening was actually the OK lounge act the restaurant offered. She made the rounds to each table and wished us all a Happy New Year. What bothered me even more was that the restaurant was not overcrowded. There were empty tables scattered throughout and still the servers were unable to perform their jobs properly. The kitchen had a smaller menu for the holiday and still they were not able to make quality food for the price we were paying. The restaurant must have known what the dinner service was going to be like with the reservation book as well as the usual walk-ins.This restaurant we will definetly overlook the next time we are in town to visit.

reviews.name: greg p.
reviews.review: While this normally is a great place to go, today wwas NOT! We went for Sunday brunch. It started with the Omlette station. No feta, no pesto, no calamata olives, and out of several other items that they did offer. As I'm about to order, Omlette chef has to go to kitchen because he ran out of eggs.( you would think they could anticipate they would need eggs at an omlette station) Gone for 10 minutes. Comes back to long line of people. Burns omlette. As for the buffet, they were out of everything. Went back a few times trying to get some items, but they were never replentished. Server was MIA most of the time. Had nothing to drink for good 15 minutes. Took 20 minutes just to pay the check. Something was terribly wrong today.  Only plus was the Bloody Mary and Mimosas were good. They had to be short staffed or something, because, in the past, food and service were always good.

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: My first inclination was to give Ellendale's 4 stars but taking everything into consideration it comes up a little bit short. First the bad: when we first arrived my wife and I were left waiting in the reception area with no staff in sight. That lasted for a few minutes. Not a good start. I really like the location of Ellendale's and the fact that its setup in an old farmhouse. The ambiance is very nice. Our server was friendly, the guy in the corner playing piano was good and not too loud. I ordered a Gentleman's Manhattan to start the meal and it was excellent. The restaurant was out of both appetizers we were thinking of ordering so we jumped into the entrees. This is where I really felt let down. I ordered the Creole Chicken. The rice and the tomato were very good. The sauce was very good. The chicken was leather. I mean really tough. I'm not one to leave food but I left a good portion of that shoe on my plate. My wife ordered the grouper and was a little surprised that it came breaded.  We reminded ourselves that Ellendale's is "traditional" American and not "new" American.  Never one to turn down anything breaded and served with a cream sauce (her words), she enjoyed it.Dessert was where Ellendale's really stood out.  My cheesecake with ginger ice cream was excellent, and my wife's sorbet had thick chunks of raspberry that made it more substantial than you would expect.  Glad we went.  Liked the atmosphere.  Would probably give it another shot if we were back in town and staying in this area again.

reviews.name: Robin B.
reviews.review: Ok ran a search for "family restaurant" close to our hotel and this came up.  My husband, myself and our 10 month old decided to go for it.  The stats say its casual, maybe casual is different in WY, we felt out under dressed in jeans.  I also missed the stat that says its not great for kids, by not great, I mean we may have had a little green alien and fit in better.  Aside from that it was ok, our waiter was great and the food was pretty tasty.  We both had the lamb.  The thing that really irked me was when my husband told me they charged $10 for each salad!  First of all, the waiter asked what dressing we wanted on our salads, not, "would you care for one of our salads?"  Second, it was some spring mix greens with 2 slices of tomato, that's highway robbery!!  Overall, it wasn't relaxing and the food is overpriced.

reviews.name: ty g.
reviews.review: this place is awesome..It is a older house that was a bed and breakfast and now a restaurant...the atmosphere is friendly and you get the impression it is a formal environment ,however it isn't ..its a great casual place to enjoy an incredible meal at great prices...the prime rib is one of my faves.  they have a great room they call the music room and there is live music after 7pm nightly...there are more intimate rooms for more private dining,and the can handle larger groups  upstairs....homemade cinnamon vanilla ice cream is sinfully delicious...the staff is extremely friendly and very accomadating...highly recommend this place....the menu is fresh, eclectic, they even grow veggies and fresh herbs outside restaurant ...for a extra special treat reserve outside gazebo for dinner...

reviews.name: Heidi p.
reviews.review: We really wanted to like Ellendales because it has all the trappings of a cool, local, vibey place. The waiter was fabulous. We were in a hurry and he was actively accommodating. Unfortunately though, the food was really bad. We had a cheese fondue that was basically just a glop of goo with some stale crackers, and a hamburger that was cooked until it morphed into rubber. The caesar salad was OK, but not amazing. Also, they need to clean up the place- it smells musty. I hope they do, because as I said, we really wanted to like the place.

reviews.name: Ellen G.
reviews.review: Super disappointed. Stopped here for lunch on my way to the airport and expectations were high after all the great reviews. However I would compare this place to one step above an Old Country Buffet. Just not very good food and in need of an update/remodel.  For example, what was described as cheese fondue looked and tasted like warm Velveta with sun dried tomatoes thrown in to liven it up.  Should have skipped it and eaten at the airport.

reviews.name: Green D.
reviews.review: This place has so much potential to make it to 5-stars! I dined here on a Sat night at the bar. Julie has a wonderful heart for service and was knowledgeable about all of the dishes--and she makes a mean dirty martini!! I had the NZ lamb and a salad. I've got no complaints. Service was excellent. Piano bar was excellent. Wine list needs some work--especially for a place of this caliber.  It's insulting to the diner to have Crane Lake on the bottle list at all--but then to put it at $24!!  I understand your need to markup and I don't mind paying on a decent bottle--but Crane Lake!!???  Ambiance was excellent!  Price-points offer a good value for the menu in this area. I will definitely return.

reviews.name: Miranda J.
reviews.review: I have gone to this place twice, both take out.  The first time I ordered an appetizer and salad, the Buffalo shrimp and half caprese salad.  I'm normally a pretty small eater, and appetizers are almost always sufficient to fill me up.  We paid $18.00 including tip.  I got 4, yes 4! medium shrimp.  My salad consisted of two (not buffalo's milk) small mozzarella slices, two tiny tomato slices, a basil leaf and 4 lettuce leaves.  I mean it just seemed crazy!  I don't think I've ever paid that much for that little of food in my life.  It was delicious though, I've got to say that.  But wow.The next time I ordered from the main courses, since I learned my lesson the last time.  I had the tortellini.  It was good, but sloppy and seemed carelessly made.The waitresses who answered the phone during my take out orders were perfectly polite and professional, probably more than any other place I've ordered at as well.Overall I think I won't go here again, but I'm sure it's very nice to have a sit down dinner at.

reviews.name: Kaz H.
reviews.review: What an awesome restaurant! It's on top of a hill in this old looking house. I loved the atmosphere. This place is enormous...I tried the chicken pasta for lunch. Delicious!! It's gotta be one of the best pasta's I've ever had. I also had the soup of the day (chick pea?). Just wonderful!

reviews.name: Michael V.
reviews.review: I hate to give this place two stars, because if the food was good, I'd give it more. If the ambiance wasn't my main reason for going back there, I'd give it less. I love the old house it's in, and in the past, I've tried to make it there for lunch whenever I'm in town. I have to say that my latest visit was probably my last. The food has continued to go down in quality, and as many other reviewers have noted, it's just plain bland. I would even have to ad mediocre.

reviews.name: Lou S.
reviews.review: I have never tasted anything like this.I had the Salmon Pasta, just wonderful Our waiter was delightful If we lived here we would be back tomorrow

reviews.name: Stephen H.
reviews.review: Awesome!! The duck was great...  Mediterranean Nachos were amazing and the service was excellent! Topped it off with cheesecake and raspberry sorbet... A perfect intimate dining experience with my wife with live piano music.

reviews.name: Priya K.
reviews.review: Delicious food; awesome customer service.

reviews.name: Steven L.
reviews.review: Best buffet that I have found anywhere!  Extremely creative dishes, "chef driven" in the current parlance, with excellent ambiance.  Plus, convenient to the airport for those of us not from Nashville.

reviews.name: Russ C.
reviews.review: Had a quick business lunch here while visiting the Nashville.  It's very close to the airport and hotels right around the airport.  Had the fish & chips which were excellent.   Well, the fish anyway.  Chips were hand cut thick potato chips that were a bit soggy.  Nice decor, buffet looked great, and service was efficient and attentive.  Really enjoyed it.

reviews.name: Courtney W.
reviews.review: The calamari was a bit of a let down, but bonus points for serving the tentacles, not just the rings. The show stopper was the homemade steak sauce. I ordered the hot affair and was a bit turned off by the thought of A1 type stuff on a steak sandwich with goat cheese. I asked for it on the side and figured that was where it would stay. I was dead wrong. It was absolutely amazing, if I could have drank it I would. It was tangy and sweet and....ok I can't think of more words...it was $%&*@!? amazing. Service was good and the live music was a treat I didn't expect. I wonder if they bottle that sauce....

reviews.name: Jennifer J.
reviews.review: This restaurant was HORRIBLE! The bartender was rude to my friend. The waitress was snooty and unhelpful. The food was AWFUL. No flavor and tacky presentation. Also, the portions were laughably tiny. I weigh 110 lbs. and I even left still hungry and ordered a salad and meal at their absurdly inflated prices for the piteous meal.

reviews.name: Eddie D.
reviews.review: My wife and I had Sunday brunch and it was decent. It is a typical brunch buffet divided among several stations including breakfast, salad bar, an omlet/pasta station, hot bar with lunch entrees, and desert. There is also a Bloody Mary station where you can customize your drink if you ordered one. Not the best brunch we've ever had but definitely good!

reviews.name: Amber B.
reviews.review: I'd say this place gets a 2.5-3 star rating. The food was ok overall if you average the good and the bad together. Caprese Salad was great. A little different than the traditional one, but still good in its own right. 4.5 starsMy husband's Curry Lambchops were pretty good...probably give it 3.5 stars.My entree, the Lava Chicken, was a good concept and the flavors worked well together, but the chicken was soooo overcooked I needed the steak knife they gave to my husband to cut it. Too bad we were starving and it was getting late or I would have sent it back. Dessert was their Chocolate Mousse Cake. Big fat 0 stars for that one. The bottom layer of chocolate mousse was not smooth like mousse should be, it was actually a little gritty. Then the top layer which I think was a kind of custard had taken on the odor of the refrigerator they kept it in. Yuk. Plus the whole thing tasted like they added 2X's the sugar the recipe called for. I actually couldn't taste much of a chocolate flavor in the mousse part because all I could taste was sugar. The atmosphere was nice and the entertainer very good, but they need to step it up with the quality of the food if they are going to charge the prices they do.

reviews.name: Jennifer H.
reviews.review: We wanted a quick lunch that wasn't fast food and was close to our hotel. We saw that Ellendale's had good reviews, so that was our choice. I am guessing we only got the lunch menu, as it was just sandwiches, pasta, and salads. We each got a salad and they were good but nothing special. I am guessing maybe their dinners are more exciting? The service was good and the ambiance was nice enough (though I can see how dinner might be more romantic).

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: Ellendale's is a place that would be super easy to drive by because you might question the quality or cleanliness of the place, although acknowledging that the house itself is darn cool looking.  The food is really great, and the house is one of my favorite residential conversion restaurants in town.  The lunch time buffet is usually pretty popular and it is not hard to see why.  I recommend giving it a try.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: Lunch on a Thursday - Buffet was average at best. The make your own pasta bar was great. Overall, not a great experience.

reviews.name: Dan M.
reviews.review: Wonderful night out with my wife. Sat in the piano bar area, heard some great music, and had some wonderful food. One of only two preparations of rabbit I have ever had - very well done. Delightful dessert sampler option at the end - allows you to try multiple desserts.  Big surprise: a basil ice cream. Delicious!

reviews.name: Aisha M.
reviews.review: Let me start by saying that I have only dined here for brunch. Nevertheless, I love this place. The selection is wonderful and the service is always impeccable. The omelette/pasta station is enough to make this a worthwhile trip, but there are so many other great features. They do a good job of changing up the offerings on the buffet menu, and they are always outside of the box.  Definitely worth a trip.

reviews.name: Andrea F.
reviews.review: Great, quiet place for a romantic evening dinner or family brunch. Always enjoyable!

reviews.name: Avonel R.
reviews.review: I am shocked that this place has four stars on yelp. Typically I agree with most other yelpers but not in this case. The food is okay, however when you add a $14 price tag for lunch onto the okay food, this place cannot possibly pull anything more than two stars. The hushpuppies were so overcooked that I couldn't even bite them and the potatoes tasted extremely overcooked. The pasta was good and so was the macaroni and cheese but I wouldn't pay $14 for this meal. The service was okay, but was not attentive enough to make me want to return.

reviews.name: Molly K.
reviews.review: Really, the only decent restaurant in Donelson, but has become very pricey.  Food is good, brunch is fantastic.  Atmosphere in remodeled large dining room is the best with live soft music in the evenings.   If price isn't an option, try it out.

reviews.name: Dave C.
reviews.review: I came here with my Boss once and I was pretty impressed.  The piano bar lounge is done really well so it is still really classy.  The food is great and some interesting american style flavor combinations (Buffalo shrimp etc..).  I would highly recommend it but make sure you have someone else drive, the drinks complete the circle on a good dinner.

reviews.name: Jim T.
reviews.review: So, we came into Nashville not knowing a thing about the city. Wondering where to have breakfast or an early lunch on Saturday, we came across Ellendale's and it WAS FABULOUS!Great buffet, way more tasty food than we were expecting, most of it 100% homemade. THE BEST biscuits and gravy I've ever had and the jalapeno hummus was out of this world. Best part, though? We didn't know how much the brunch was per person -- figuring at least $25-$30 (which would have been perfectly fine considering the quality and quantity of the selections), but it was like $34 for two, including drinks!Well worth it and we're going back Sunday night for dinner when they have live bluegrass/jazz music out on the deck.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: After hearing so many awesome things about Ellendale's, my boyfriend & I decided to enjoy our Valentine's Day dinner there.  However, enjoy we did not.  The host wasn't there for the first 5 or so minutes that we stood in the main lobby area, and when he did show up he didn't apologize for the wait or even wow us with his niceness.  In fact, he didn't even speak to us while he walked us to the table, which was right by the far too loud entertainment of the night (basically a moderately talented piano player belting out cheesy songs).  Then on top of this...they didn't have calamari, which surprised me considering it's one of the only real appetizers and it was Valentine's Day weekend!  Our dishes were very bland, and my boyfriend's "Romeo & Juliet", which was supposed to be 12 or so ounces of meat, looked like it was approximately 5 ounces.  He ordered it medium rare, and it was well done when they brought it out.  The entire experience was less than ideal.

reviews.name: Andrea v.
reviews.review: Went for Thanksgiving dinner.  The buffet was reported to be one of the best in the area.  Food was good, but a bit disappointing experience overall.Arrived a few minutes early for our 2:30pm reservation, had to wait outside.  Watched as several larger parties arrived (with 2:45pm reservations) and was surprised to see that they were immediately seated.  Once we got inside it was complete chaos.  Servers and guests bumping into each other.  We struggled to keep up with the speed demon hostess - my father-in-law moves in an obviously slowly manner  - the hostess didn't care and wanted us seated, her impatience was painfully obvious.The waiter we had was great.  Attentive, quick, friendly - he saved us from a horrid experience.  Buffet was full of Thanksgiving favorites.  Turkey, Ham, Roast Beef.  Tasty food and plenty of it.  The flow of the buffet was very odd, as if they just randomly placed tables of food out and hoped for the best.  The chaos of guests and servers all getting food and placing food out, made it difficult to navigate.The cleanliness left a whole lot to be desired.  The bathroom was a bit scary.  I saw servers touching food with bare hands, and guests touching serving spoons with their hands.  (edit - people touched the spoons on the serving ends, not the handles, with their bare hands)  Not what I was anticipating given that they are supposedly known for their buffets.  Staff might need some refresher training in proper food handling!Price for three of us, with drinks was $150.00Overall - Worth a try when it's not on a holiday, food was plentiful and tasty.  I might try it again, but might not.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: I'm giving this place 5 stars because every time I have been here the food has been amazing, service has been outstanding, and the place is very clean! Granted, I've only eaten off the buffet but everything is piping hot on the buffet and usually when you hear buffet you wouldn't think the food would be as hot and tasty as this is! The dishes have all been fantastic! My favorite on the buffet has been their meatballs! It taste just like mom makes! You can tell all ingredients they use are fresh and not frozen. Ellendales is filled with so much charm! I work in the area and try to frequent at least once a month! Their chocolate fondue is outstanding and their fresh fruit is so yummy! I had my bridesmaid luncheon here and everyone raved at how amazing this place is! The service was great with such a large party! I would highly recommend this place as well for large groups!

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: My wife and I got in from Florida on an early Friday evening flight so the hotel recommended us making a reservation here. Very pleasant and exceptional service.  The restaurant is a converted large home on a hilltop in the Donelson area and hold a very nice ambiance upon arrival. We were seated in a front parlor room with a small fireplace by the window which we enjoyed. Martini's and Bruschetta started things off. The wine list was adequate and we quickly found something to our liking. Entrees were done very well and our server suggested having dessert in the rear lounge area as they had a female vocalist on the piano. All in all a very nice evening.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I am usually not a fan of buffets, but I enjoyed Ellendale's. A recruiter took me out to lunch here one day. Even though the crowd was pretty sparse (which always makes me nervous), the food was good.There is a menu, but I did not even look at it. Everyone apparently eats at the buffet, and I can see why. It's mostly southern food on the buffet, but there were plenty of options. You can always fill up on the salads at any rate. There was some good roast when I was there and broccoli salad which is my favorite. I tried not to pig out in front of the recruiter. Ellendale's is not on my side of town, and I'm not sure I would make the drive all the way over there to eat lunch or dinner. If you work or live in the area, it is worth checking out. It's a lot nicer, shall we say, then a lot of other places on that strip. The buffet is only $10.95 which does seem like a good deal.

reviews.name: Chris F.
