reviews.review: Cool house, could use a bit of updating, but I liked it.Food was great, as well as the service. Had the prime rib, small sized (Queen I think) it was HUGE. I can't imagine what the King looked like.Live music almost every night. Mellow, jazzy stuff. I liked it.Save room for desert.

reviews.name: Kasey O.
reviews.review: Another off the beaten path restaurant, near the airport, but worth the drive. We were seated in the "music" room for dinner and glad we did. There are other rooms to dine in if you want peace and quiet or more romance. The food was absolutely great. We both ordered salads (so we could get desserts cuz that's what girls do). Best, most fresh tasting salad I've ever had. Grilled raspberry chicken salad was amazing. The dressing wasn't too over-bearing and the pineapple made all the difference. Ordered the Small Dessert Sampler and was a happy girl. The ginger ice cream was great and the best creme brulee I've had in the states. Will go back again!

reviews.name: Stacey W.
reviews.review: Very good food and one of the better restaurants in the airport area.  Not sure I loved the ambience but overall a good experience.

reviews.name: Wise W.
reviews.review: This place is awesome!  The food was as terrific as the atmosphere.  I had a bottle of wine (which is a bit on the pricey side), the Mediterranean nachos, amaretto chicken and crem brule.  Everything was absolutely delicious.  I almost wish I was moving to Nashville instead of Baltimore.

reviews.name: B C.
reviews.review: Woke up one Sunday with a suggestion of brunch for the day.  But, knowing the list of brunch options is painfully short, we toggled back and forth over where to go.  I happened to jump online and came across Ellendale's - mentioned as one of the 10 best brunch spots in Nashville.Well, why not?  It can't hurt and we should really try some new places.The old farmhouse is quaint, service is great. The Sunday buffet brunch is $15.95 per person, drinks not included.  Not quite sure what I was expecting, but was pleasantly surprised to find a nice selection of salads - pasta salad, caesar salad, mediterranean salad and a rice salad. Breakfast fare included well cooked bacon, canadian bacon, cheese grits, some carrots and a veggie lasagna type concoction.  Pasta and omelette bar had about 13 different filling options - both were made to perfection no matter what you ordered.  The salsa that comes with the omelette was also quite delicious which was surprising to me.  Interesting assortment of desserts - my favorite, the whipped cream made from scratch.  So delicious.  I think the highlight of the meal was the fresh strawberries, served next to melted dark chocolate which we paired with a healthy dollop of the fresh whipped cream.All in all, fine experience.  Would I go back again?  Probably not.  It's edible, but not memorable.

reviews.name: John F.
reviews.review: This is a solid four.  My cioppino was fine, with the various seafood contents done just right.  And the broth was seasoned very well.  Combine good food with caring and knowledgeable service and a broad wine list, reasonably priced, and you have a place to which we'll return.

reviews.name: Tonya O.
reviews.review: I've heard of Ellendale's for years but never given it a try until recently. I tried the hanger steak. While I have never even heard of hanger steak until my visit to Ellendale's, it was an okay cut of meat, but a little more fatty than I like, but the steak itself had a unique but good flavor. The prices are a bit steep for what you get. Ordering salad is extra. Most everyone talks about the brunch, so maybe I just went at the wrong time. The atmosphere is very nice, and they have a piano player for the dinner hours.

reviews.name: Michael W.
reviews.review: It was my last day of a week long business trip and I wanted to have a good dinner in a casual relaxing atmosphere before I flew home Saturday.I was promptly greeted at the door and I decided to take a seat in the bar area.  It was 9pm and about 6 of the 16 tables were taken.  The piano was being played and the singer did a great job.  The duo kept it lively, but not overbearing.  I'd return for drinks or dessert just to hear them again,Seth was an attentive waiter and he helped me navigate through the many choices.  He kept my lemonade refilled (4 times) throughout the evening.  I started with the house salad, which was the appropriate size.  Fresh mixed greens and cheese.  Solid choice.  For my entree, I settled on the Rib Eye (medium rare) covered with roasted garlic and fried onion strings.  It came with sweet potatoes and green beans.  Another outstanding choice.,  Too much fat on the rib eye for my preference, but it was tasty.  I finished with the bread pudding (with apples baked in) ala mode (ginger ice cream!).  Again, it was an interesting twist on a standard item which many places do half heartedly.  Its nice to see an establishment elevate the mundane into something intriguing.Good food, great service, great entertainment, and a relaxed atmosphere which easily straddles the line of casual as well as dressy.I'll be back the next time I'm in town!

reviews.name: Stephanie B.
reviews.review: Went specificallly because of great reviews but was sorely disappointed. Saturday brunch was bland and dry, the only highlight (which got made for the 1-star) was the cheese grits and bsicuits and gravy. Restaurant looks run down and overall jusy dingy. Wouldnt go back!

reviews.name: Junie D.
reviews.review: Buffet lunch was EXCELLENT...  Salad bar included fresh caesar and tossed salads, pasta salads, etc.  Make to order pasta bar with sauces, veggies, shrimp, sausage, bacon, chicken, you name it.  Entree station included salmon lasagna (to die for!), fried catfish (yum), pulled pork, braised beef, mashed potatoes, squash, broccoli, etc.  But I could have eaten a whole plate of the homemade onion rings -- oh man!!!  And finally a dessert bar with fresh fruit, cookies, brownies, and hot fudge sauce.  I'm not even big on chocolate but I could have licked the pot -- it was just wonderful.  Will definitely return!!!

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Julie and Michael graciously welcome you to their fine dining Donelson restaurant. Dress casually, feel fancy. Music often entertains as you enjoy your dinner. It ranges from piano to easy going vocals, depending on the day. Lunch is good, with a buffet available in addition to menu items. Sunday brunch is even better. Best fare for a picky eatie in Donelson. Red and white wine selections are more than adequate. For special occasions I recommend the Napa Valley cabenet Chateau Montelena. For fun sip the Woop Woop red from down under.

reviews.name: Barbara P.
reviews.review: What a great surprise. I had been traveling over holidays (C'mas 2010) and was on the way to NC. I stayed at the Nashville Springhill Suites Airport Center Dr. Dec. 30, 2010. Sorry I forgot one of the lady's name at hotel front desk but I had asked her to recommend an upscale restaurant close by. She quickly recommended Ellendale's. I called to make sure of attire. Upon entering the front door I felt welcomed and knew I was in for a treat. The owner, Julie met us and told us about the history of her restaurant. This place is a gorgeous restored dairy. Ambiance is warm and wonderful. Food was incredible. waitress was knowlegable and had no trouble recommending items when asked. After driving over 7 hours I was needing a treat and Ellendale's was no disappointment. If you are staying (or live) in the Nashville Airport area it is well worth a drive. Only one disappointment, they were out of rabbit but my fish was outstanding. Prob one of the best Tirimisu dessertsI I have ever had.

reviews.name: Darren H.
reviews.review: This is the 5th time I was back. I take business clients here as the food is traditionally good for the value. However, this time I was very disappointed. Order the calamari and it was over cooked. Could have used them as rubber bands. The sauces were mediocre, however where the greatest disappointment was in the Rib-Eye. I am a steak man, and I ordered med rare, it came well done. The next one came blue. As for the flavor heavily char smoked and the meat was on the tough side. Not much flavor, and traditionally the Rib-Eyes have great flavor and tenderness due to the marbling. What disappointed me was after seeing that I hadn't eaten much of the second steak, that the server would have asked if it was ok. I would have expected the manager to come around and offer their apologies. I know many business folks take their clients here and it would be appropriate to show good customer service. Here's the kicker, we couldn't keep the flies away from the table. For fine dining atmosphere, you would not expect to be fighting over who was going to eat your meal.

reviews.name: Felour S.
reviews.review: We went there on 4th of July and it was great . The hostess was nice and friendly . It was 9 of us and the service was great. The salad bar was nice and clean Everything was fresh. The mash potato , mushrooms and the rice were fresh and hot . I liked all the meats , and when we had the nub on , the meat server were coming from everywhere ! My favorite was the tenderloin stake and the fish . They had special ribs for Fourth of July which was great !Our drinks were always full and they were cleaning the dishes constantly, we had some amazing desserts . We tried fried cheese cake and Flan , and also the gluten free chocolate cake ! They were all so delicious. It was kind of expensive but we really enjoy our time . But be prepared for %20 gratiuity added to the bill after-tax. which I thought was a little too much .

reviews.name: Casey S.
reviews.review: This is such a fun experience! You must be adventurous to come here and enjoy it for your money's worth though. If you are just getting regular cuts of meat like beef and chicken, I don't think this place is worth the price for you.So the basic concept is a buffet where you serve yourself sides and put up a little marker to show you're ready for the meats. Everything is all you can eat.Our server was very nice and even though she's gone through the explanation spiel a million times I'm sure, she was very warm and took time to explain everything. They did a good job of incorporating Brazilian things into the menu--each table gets a starter of 3 appetizers that are all Brazilian themed: fried polenta, fried banana, and a cheese popover. I also ordered a Caipirinha, because it's the only Brazilian drink I know! I got mine with strawberry and coconut, and it has big chunks of fruit in it. It was very tasty!They have an amazing bar of sides. You serve yourself the sides, and then the meat is brought to you by servers. There were so many delightful salads to choose from. My favorite was the roasted coconut salad, it was like a coconut cole slaw! They had couscous salad, quinoa salad, kale salad, and tons of other sides to choose from. They had macaroni and cheese, mashed potatoes, baked ziti, and a few other non-salad sides. This sides bar is well stocked and has tons of choices--probably 20 different items I woulds say. I could have filled up on this alone.Service was rapid! When we turned our marker over for more meat, they would arrive one after the other! We had to quickly flip the marker to stop them, because they would just rapid-fire offer us a new meat before we could even take a knife to what was on our plate already. It was great! And all the gentlemen carrying the meat skewers were very nice and chit-chatted with us.Meats we tried: Japanese pork, lamb, some kind of white fish (forgot what is was!), sweet and sour chicken, some other kind of chicken, a few different cuts of beef, Rocky Mountain Oysters (Google it...), Yak meatballs, Rattlesnake sausage, Elk sausage... I think that's it?I love the yak, the "oysters," rattlesnake, elk, and the rare beef. The fish was good, but I prefer a whole fish to just a slice :P As for me, yes there were a few cuts and types of meat I didn't like, such as the lamb (it was awful, but I've never had lamb before either). But that didn't detract form the experience at all, since I came prepared for an adventure. Overall, I really enjoyed the food. I do feel it is a tad overpriced at $35 a plate, but I can see how having all those exotic meats can raise the price up. I was originally worried that there wouldn't be enough rare meat, since that's how I like my steak. They had a good mix of rare and more done though, so I was happy to see one steak cut into that was very bloody. And it was delicious!

reviews.name: Stephen L.
reviews.review: My girlfriend picked this for us to try for her birthday.  The idea of lots of meats sounded like a great new experience.We arrived and valet parking was super easy and right outside the door.When we walked in we were immediately greeted and seated.  The server thoroughly explained everything about how the steakhouse works, and was very warm and welcoming.After got our salads and sides, the meats starting coming, and kept coming!  It seemed like the servers had radar when the little pegs were flipped.  All the sides were hot and tasty, and the meats all tasted fresh and flavorful (except a center-cut beef steak, which smelled awful and tasted burnt).  We got to try rattlesnake sausage (my favorite) and Rocky Mountain Oysters (my second favorite), which were two strange things I didn't expect.I was pleasantly surprised by the selections, and everything (except the center cut steak) was great.  Service was excellent.  The only reason for four stars is that it seems just a tad overpriced for a sampling of meats, but then again it IS all you can eat, so others may cram in a lot more than we did!  I would highly recommend this for a group or tourist.

reviews.name: Tina S.
reviews.review: We wanted to try something different and we felt Brazilian fit the bill. We were told a 20 minute wait and went to the bar. The bartender was new, and we were trying hard to be patient. It took him and bit and even after he looked in the book to learn how to make our drink. Next they lost our reservation..... Finally we got a table. Guess what another first timer server.....YEAH. After he got finished pouring half of my water on the floor and did not bother wiping it up... He explained the process of the green/red timer. If it was flipped green we wanted the gricho(?) to bring us the meat. It was sliced off of big skewers and you used your tongs to place it on your plate. We were offered flank steak, ham, lamb, catfish, bbq ribs and grilled pineapple. You were free to go the salad bar to get your sides. 15 different options to compliment your meat. It was overwhelming....The manager did come to our table half way through our meal, and we were given $25 off of our dinner because they lost our reservation...I know right NICE. We ended the evening with coffee and flan..I cant say that I would recommend this restaurant, but you should check it out for yourself.

reviews.name: matt s.
reviews.review: Really really good. We liked the chicken, steak and I am a big fan of the lamb. Salad bar was very good.   You MUST have the grilled pineapple and try to get a piece near the core. What could make it over the top fantastic - the food here is a bit exotic for Nashville and our waitress (who was super nice) didn't really know the menu. Tell us about the yucca or what the glaze is on that ham (so good!!)I wish there was heart of palm at the salad bar. The fish was pretty good - that could have been better. I was hoping for lamb chops but again - these are wish items. Really enjoyed this and recommend for a special occasion.

reviews.name: Travis B.
reviews.review: The best Brazilian steakhouse in Nashville. Plates never empty, glasses never empty. Service was top notch!

reviews.name: Sunny L.
reviews.review: The best Brazilian steak house I've ever been to. Their buffet was great but more American food than Brazilian though. They had a nice thick cut bacon in different varieties. Also had different sauces for a steak, I enjoyed a lot along with the tomato salad. Meat quality was great, They had filet, sirloin, lamb, chicken, sausage, pineapple.... Can't even remember everything I had.Everybody there was friendly, inside decoration is nice too. In my opinion it was better than Fogo de chao. Only bad part was waiting, we waited like 30mins. It is very crowded at the entrance, wish they had a bigger area for waiting or have a better way to keep it not to chaotic. But once you sit down, the dining experience was great.

reviews.name: John T.
reviews.review: Let me just recommend the roasted pineapple!!!!!Nothing that I ate here was bad and the service was great. Came for lunch because the price is only $17.00 plus drink. Cheap at twice the price. If you leave here hungry it is your own fault. The salad bar is amazing. I would continue this but I'm still eating and don't want to miss any of the meat selection. I think this would make a good date night place.

reviews.name: Yvonne K.
reviews.review: Our first time at a Brazilian steak house...it was a fun experience.I have to say the salad bar was amazing,several different types and all fresh. Appetizers I didn't care for. Sides were good and nice variety but not very hot. Mac n cheese was not good at all.Meat of course is why you come here! I tried several and didn't find any worth seconds, most I thought were over cooked & dry and the gouchos were not very friendly! That all being said I'm glad I went for the experience and I don't need to go back!!

reviews.name: Jennifer E.
reviews.review: I really wanted to give at least 4 stars for this review. I had planned on it.My husband and I were here on a date. We were both excited about finally trying Rodizio. The food was amazing; we enjoyed every appetizer, every salad bar item, every side, every meat, and our dessert! We showed up with empty stomachs and left absolutely satisfied.Our server was awesome! His name was Will. He rocks! Our gauchos were great, too. Everyone who approached our table with food was very informative and hospitable.So why only 3 stars?We had a reservation. We showed up several minutes before our reserved time. The waiting area was packed. I checked in and was told our table would be ready in a couple minutes. Those without reservations were told it would be an hour. Believe me, I was so glad I made our reservation! While waiting, I overheard a couple parties talk about how they had been waiting for about 30 minutes...and they had reservations, too! We all continued to wait. One person (with a reservation...and at the same time as ours) asked the hostess how much longer till he would be seated. She said that he was next.But he wasn't.Two other parties were seated before he was.A couple next to me (with a reservation) asked the hostess when they would be seated. They had been waiting nearly an hour, and their reservation was before mine!They were seated immediately.After 40 minutes of waiting (and being courteous to the diners with reservations who had been waiting longer than us), my husband finally approached the hostess. She told him we were next.Ten minutes and 3 other parties later (diners without reservations), we were finally seated. Nearly one hour after we checked in. People who walked in without a reservation after us were seated before us!So, yes, make a reservation before you show up. But it's a toss-up if it will actually do you any good.

reviews.name: Tom W.
reviews.review: Firstly when we called they made us dress up per dress code. Yet the place was full of shorts and slippers/flip flops. It's July and hot. When I went to the bar to get a wine menu. I was greeted with need something.  Had to wait for ever to get water. Way to long. The food at its best was ok. Best part was salad bar. Which $35 per person for that is ahhhhhToo many bland tasting or ugh foods and poor follow up. Ate at many great restaurants this week in Nashville. Try any place else. Trust me. Don't go here!!!!

reviews.name: Eva C.
reviews.review: Love the atmosphere! Fantastic salad bars & desserts. The garlic sirloin & the bacon wrapped, Parmesan chicken were my personal favorites. My husband like the salt & pepper steak & a little bit of all else. Ceviche on the salad bar was fresh & so refreshing on a hot, humid day. Love the staff & the fact that my water glass was always full! Great service! We enjoyed it so much we had supper there 2 days in a row. Crime brûlée for dessert the first day, they infuse it with oranges so it tasted somewhat like an 'orange creamsicle'....I love cremecicle brûlée so I didn't appreciate the twist, but it was good nonetheless. Our second day we opted for cheesecake.

reviews.name: C M.
reviews.review: This is a must try for anyone who has never had the rodizio experience (beau was a newbie), and a definite stop for someone who doesn't know what they feel like eating, as you get everything!The location is right off Broadway so it's very convenient, and we made reservations, which I would definitely recommend you do as well--the place was packed.  Would have liked a little more space between tables, but otherwise, it's a very nice set up.With the fixed menu, we paid around $34 for the full meal, which includes appys, salad bar, the meats and dessert.  Not bad at all.  The drinks were a little on the pricey side, but not ridiculous.For appetizers, they bring you banana fritters (from platanos maduros), polenta and Brazilian cheese bread.  You can get seconds if you'd like, but I recommend saving space.The salad bar was very clean/neat, and had a plethora of choices ranging from salad items, cold cuts, veggies, rice and potatoes. Again, you can visit the salad bar as much as you'd like.For the grill, they brought around several varieties of steak, ranging from sirloin to flank, lamb, chicken, turkey wrapped in bacon, sausage, chicken hearts and fish.  Quality ranged from beyond excellent to just okay, but overall, it was all worth it.Price wise it's a bargain, just be sure to come hungry!

reviews.name: Scott P.
reviews.review: I won't get into a whole spiel about various Brazilian BBQ , I will just compare this Rodizio to other Rodizio locations (like Salt Lake City) and that comparison is not favorable. I think a lot of the pretty positive reviews may be from less experienced n00bs.Meats- were pretty meh, and that's generous. Cuts were always thin and overcooked, there was almost no outside pieces available when they brought it around, the Gauchos need a little training in how to properly slice the meat (as this as possible for most cuts etc). They came around sporadically and we often went 5 or more minutes with no meat being offered. They also loaded up on like wine marinated chicken and other nonsense meats no one wants but were super light on picanha.Sides- we only got brought sides once at the beginning. They were all cold. The mashed potatoes couldn't have been more than like 3 ounces for a table full of people. The cheesey poofs were very flat and de-poofed as well as cold. They were never refilled. Salad Bar- we went for lunch and got there at like noon which should be busy time but the place was pretty empty. The hot sides had all very clearly been sitting their untouched for quite some time and had a thick skin on them- super appealing. Service- as discussed under meats not great. Also there is valet parking for like 10 dollars since its impossible to park on the street anywhere nearby. The valet parked our car about 10 feet from the valet stand. It then took 13 minutes from when we left the restaurant to when a valet showed up and got our car which we were standing by the whole time.

reviews.name: Kayla W.
reviews.review: What a fun experience! The food is outstanding, and a great selection! Everything was perfext. The staff was on top of everything. I can't wait to go back!

reviews.name: Becky E.
reviews.review: Good food (some way far better than other meat choices & buffet choices) so take a small bit of what you want & return for more if you like it. The appetizers were great! Come hungry & have "Lupper" (Lunch/Supper)... if you leave hungry you have no one to blame but yourself. Staff was friendly & attentive. If you don't see a selection go past research what is available on their website or menu to try as some of them don't come past very often. Be prepared to drop $100 for 2 people. The food on a stick makes the cost worth it & don't miss the pineapple, it is amazing so save room. Dine later at night as the wait time will be far less.

reviews.name: Mallery S.
reviews.review: Great meat, great ambiance, great service! Come hungry and leave with a food coma.I have celebrated two Birthdays here since moving to Nashville and that streak will continue

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: I have no idea why some people give this a low review. If you look they have minimal reviews, so basically some just come out to complain. And if they complain, they must be either really really mad, or embarrassed bc they don't want anyone to know who they are. We were there for Brunch. I was concerned we would not get the whole experience, but was happily wronged. The Hostess was so nice when I called THAT day for reservations--right before Church--what was I thinking?  God was watching me...saying get in here and we will let you out after. Valet was 7 dollars. I was a little surprised no one warned me here. Shame on you Yelpers. Now you know! Please feel free to tip on my paypal account for these pearls. JOKE BIG JOKE.  So they take my car we are off. Hostess was again as sweet as she was 1 hour previously and I asked to sit near the grill. Another Yelper told me this. No Grill seating but next to salad bar. Yeah OK let's see what happens. Well we had 2 not 1 waiters in about 5 minutes giving us the 411. I was not in the mood for a beverage, but friends had the specialty Cipriahana--spelling but you know what I mean the rum and lime drink and the soda- Antartica which tasted like a sweet Sierra Mist with Orange. Hands down, I liked the water. Salad bar had tons of things, but no Ranch or Blue Cheese Dressing. Had Caesar and Italian and lots of different vinegretts so that was fine. It was Brunch so there were eggs and bacon and different casseroles and rice and whipped with cream mashed potatoes. How many WW points I did not bother to add up. Lots of different salads and black beans and there were rolls and banana bread. They had the largest hearts of Palm I have ever seen. We had a little very little of most things, but did not want to fill up. When we turned the green thing, my friends said it felt the swarmed. Swarm Swarm Swarm like on Seinfeld at the bookstore episode. The meats were steak, sirloin, skirt and 2 others, Not Filet- I did not care, but heard some random guy ask. Well really, we eat Filet a lot, the meats compared to Filet were top notch. Also a few types of Chicken and Sweet and Spicy. Also a white fish and Chicken hearts which reminded me of Large Almonds with a intense Chicken Flavor. There was some Pork around and some Lamb but truly we did NOT gorge. I know that people say to do that, but really the worst feeling in the world is that full feeling.  We also had a birthday but I requested to opt of out of the singing. They do a wonderful Birthday song, but really we did not need that. Some friends had another drink, and we asked for the dessert menu. No such thing, they bring the cart. Would have liked for someone to try the Passion Fruit Mousse, but only the Flan and the Chocolate wonder were chosen Chocolate thing was really really sweet and the Flan was thicker. The Creme Brullee has Orange liguor in it. Oh the apps like the rest of the Yelpers are stating are 3. Fried and bread. Fried banana app, very very very banana tasty, Polenta "fries" and then the Cheese puffs. Again we waited for the main course. Oh they give you a drink menu only. The rest is salad bar and the gauchos. Also there was this dreamy guy named Michelle. One of the Gauchos. Could listen to his voice at anytime. He was quite helpful. All our servers were helpful. Maybe the Yelper's who did not like it here should go for Brunch?

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Came here for a date night and out of all the meats, only 2 are worth it.  The top sirloin is great and so is the wine marinated chicken but the rest are just so-so.  The side dishes were not hot.The wait staff is a bit slow (and they don't even bring you your food).  I might be back, but it would have to be with a group of people or a work event.

reviews.name: Jill N.
reviews.review: This place is great!!! The food is all fresh and flavorful. And the staff is extremely friendly and helpful. Awesome variety. The only bad part is that I always eat too much!

reviews.name: Soyoung H.
reviews.review: This is me and my husband's favorite restaurant in Nashville.This place is like ultimate destination for carnivores~!! We've been there couple of times(we both were stuffed and loved it!!) and definitely wanna go back when we are visiting Nashville again.Salad bar is not necessary I think cause grilled items that come out to you will fill you up pretty good. Tri tip, ham with pineapple is must!! Lamb is also good but make sure you eat that piece before it gets cold, it was slightly gamey. If you are familiar with it, Chicken heart is pretty good too.  Deserts are very good too. I mean, how can you resist the sweet goodies??!!??!!My favorite is  Creamed brûlée and  triple chocolate cake was good and don't remember the name but minty colored pudding kind of thing was pretty good too.I would recommend this place to meat lovers all the way for sure~!!!!

reviews.name: Melissa S.
reviews.review: Fantastic! Bring your appetite and keep the block on green. The pineapple is to die for as well as the lamb.

reviews.name: Thommy S.
reviews.review: Food was great! Very yummy food.  The people that walked around serving the steaks were awesome and came around quite often. Only reason I didn't do five stars was because our service was horrible.  Our waiter never brought our drinks to us, and when we asked for it, she snapped with an attitude, got mad, and said its coming... And our drinks didn't show up til we were almost full.  We never saw our server. She attended to other tables around us and would just walk by, and skip our table.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: This is our second time being here this experience was much better than the first. The number one feature is the food quality and on a Saturday nightevery meat we sampled tasted exceptional and the salad bar dishes were very flavorful.  The price was lower than your typical Brazilian steakhouse which is a big plus and the service was good.The only noticeable flaw might be the servers seemed less trained then Fogo de Chao or Texas de Brazil.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: Service was amazing and the food was absolutely delicious. We did not wait lonbg at all for a table and shortly after we were seated the appetizers arrived at our table. The staff is attentive and had the table overflowing with huge variety of meats.

reviews.name: L G.
reviews.review: If you are planning on going here, don't eat anything all day! You'll be so stuffed by the time you leave. If you are a vegetarian, stay as far away as possible. Your feelings will be hurt. They served us every kind of meat imaginable. Lamp, chicken thighs, top sirloin, pork, brisket, fish, sausage, bacon wrapped chicken, chicken HEARTS... I mean that's just to name a few. It was delicious. The meat was so tender and flavorful. The grilled pineapple was so good! Everything came to our table piping hot. Be aware because when you flip that little red and green thing over, they just keep coming, and coming, and coming. My husband and I had to hurry up and flip it on the red side. I didn't give them 5 stars because I was not thoroughly impressed with the salad bar. Don't get me wrong, there were many options however, some stuff was between warm, almost cold and room temperature. We came 2 hours before closing so that could have a lot to do with it. Also, we came on our anniversary, so if you're seeking quiet and intimate you won't find it here. I will say, however, the experience was great and it made our anniversary one to remember, so don't discredit them ;) Try this place, you won't regret it!

reviews.name: Brittany E.
reviews.review: This place is awesome!I wish there would've been more steak.we have been to the one in Memphis in the cheese bar seem to be a lot better.

reviews.name: Dee W.
reviews.review: This restaurant is one of the best places to go in Nashville.  This is the second time we've been here and can't wait to come again. Reservations are a must.We had 4 different kinds of steak, 2 kinds of pork,  2 kinds of chicken or turkey,  grilled pineapple,  ham, this amazing white fish and so much more.One or two bites of something doesn't seem much but portion size is perfect and it just keeps coming until you can't eat another bite.The staff is absolutely amazing and definitely in tune with the needs of the customer. Only negative is that it is always so cold in there.

reviews.name: Josh L.
reviews.review: First off let me suggest you make a reservation for this establishment. I spoke in detail with the hostess over the phone discussing the menu as I have a gluten allergy. She was beyond helpful and after learning that it was my first time dining there, suggested that I come on a nearly empty stomach. I'm glad I listened to her. First you start with the run down of how they operate there. Very unique and great experience. Not sure why more restaurants don't incorporate the idea. This is one you'll have to experience for yourself. They have a generous salad bar with tons of fixings. Good crisp lettuce and don't pass up the bacon strips. They are smack your granny good. The other side of the salad bar is all the sides. Each one is labeled GF is they are gluten free which made my life much easier. Then when you are ready the fun begins. The meat begins to come in waves. As much as you want.....yes you read that right. As much as you want. The first meat that came to us was chicken hearts....I passed on this one. The peppered steak and honey glazed ham was some of the best I have had. They would occasionally bring by grilled pineapple which was amazing. The meat was good in its own unique way. Now I like more seasoning on my meats but then again I've never ate Brazilian so what do I know. The food was a great quality and the atmosphere was great. I will probably be back at some point. The price for our meal was $34 per meal. Keeping in mind you get unlimited salads, sides, and meat the price is fair.  This is a great date night restaurant if you don't mind dropping a bill on the meal.

reviews.name: Tasha T.
reviews.review: They do not have a menu. The pricing is way too much. My family doesn't eat pork and majority of the meat was pork. Not worth the $$$. Our waitress was busy training someone while we waited for our drinks. The salad bar was the only good thing they have going for them. Also the desserts aren't worth trying at all. And if you ask for a dessert don't be surprised if they ran out of it, but still give you the end result of the dessert. Be prepared to walk or pay $7.00 for valet. This restaurant isn't worth it.

reviews.name: Bruno S.
reviews.review: Nice location downtown Nashville and the valet parking was convenient. Hostesses were friendly and our waiter was excellent. If you have been to a Brazilian steakhouse it is the same concept of appetizers, salad bar, and meat Til you die. Their desserts were amazing. Very lively atmosphere and their version of the birthday so g was really cool, they came out with samba drums to folks who we're celebrating their birthday there. It wasn't as pricey as others and the gauchos came around often once our cards were flipped. They hadn't brought picanha out but once I asked for it it didn't stop coming. Overall we had a great time and the food was good. But comparing to others Fogo de Chao chain wins every time hands down! However, there isn't one here in Nashville and this place is worth it for a great value. ($30 vs $50 which is what it normally costs)Tip: don't sit by the bar.

reviews.name: Cristina D.
reviews.review: Let's just begin with AMAZING.This is a restaurant you might want to have an almost empty stomach for, it is unlimited meat and salads.First the service itself was excellent, everyone was kind and very friendly. They were all very attentive and would actually educate you on some of the plates.Now I definitely have to talk about the food, everything was fresh and warm. They would come up to you with the meats and put it on your plate. I could not get over the fact that they would come to the table as soon as the little block was on green, you Would 3 or 4 people asking you if you would like the meat they were offering. They were all very skilled with their knifes and such.The facility was clean and spotless, including the bathroom which is a huge plus.In general, this is a place you have to try. It is as of now one of my favorites.

reviews.name: Tisha V.
reviews.review: What is there Not to Love About a Brazilian Steakhouse? The Service was Excellent and it is apparent that the entire staff works together as a team to ensure everyone's dining experience is a positive one.  The meat Selection was seemingly Endless! So much to Choose from! The Salad Bar and Side Bar did not Disappoint either! So much variety even the pickiest eaters should find something they will Love! Great Restaurant for a Date or just a Night Out With Friends!

reviews.name: Tony T.
reviews.review: Great place but Forsure go there hungry. They will feed you until you explode.Great staff great service. My wife had a blast !!

reviews.name: Jack B.
reviews.review: Outrageously good. Fogo has nothing on this place. Very reasonably priced. Had to be rolled back to hotel!!

reviews.name: Alicia N F.
reviews.review: This place is amazing!! Totally recommend it to Everyone!! Especially the Bacon wrapped meat.. You will not be disappointed!! :)

reviews.name: Miles F.
reviews.review: I think in my version of heaven, dinner will be served at Rodizio Grill... Everything is delicious. Presentation is great. The meat is... Perfect. The salad bar is fresh and full of glorious sides. You will not leave hungry. This is a quality restaurant and I would highly recommend feasting here!

reviews.name: B D.
reviews.review: What a fun place. Come extra hungry. Very nice salad bar and hot bar. Go easy though to save room for the meats. Fixed price @$35. The gauchos constantly patrol, each with his own meat on a sword and a large knife to whack you a piece. Many different meats, all very flavorful. You want to try them all- several times! Very friendly staff. Wine-overpriced. If I go back to Nashville I will definitely be back.

reviews.name: John E.
reviews.review: After eating here I've officially declared this my favorite restaurant of all time.  I'm freaking serious.  The salad bar is insane.  Totally not what you're thinking by the way--amazing side dishes on this thing--but be warned, if you're not careful you can fill up on it and not have room for the carved stuff.  I'm telling ya, this place is worth every dollar you'll spend.  One of the meat carvers named Osiel was especially kind.  He knew which cut my wife liked and even went to the back to get a fresh one for her.  Very attentive guy and served with a genuine smile.  Hats off sir.  If we're back in town this is a definite stop we will take.

reviews.name: Wayne D.
reviews.review: Not my first time at this restaurant, but this will be my last. One of the servers was so intent on hitting on (flirting with) the 4 girls at the table next to mine that he ignored me on every pass. I certainly didn't show up at Rodizio's to watch an attempt by what appeared to be a server with a fake limp hit on a table full of young girls while I'm blatantly ignored.  My "Serve me indicator" (or whatever the Brazilian restaurant industry calls it) was green up each time he passed my table and I tried to make eye contact with him just for grins.  He totally snubbed me.  I'm telling you, this guy was something else.  If you watched him as he wandered around the restaurant you would see him walk normal if he thought no one could see him from the dining room.  As soon as he stepped into the dining room he would start limping like he just broke his leg.  Crazy stuff.  Maybe he was telling the young girls he was flirting with that it was a war injury.  Who knows? Just for the record, the girls were not flirting back with this loser.  I felt sorry for them for having to deal with this guy.I've traveled worldwide for 29 years for business and pleasure, so I'm qualified to judge the service of a restaurant from a diner's point of view. I continue to be amazed that a restaurant will put people like him in a position to interact with patrons.  What purpose does it serve?  I guess it will remain a mystery to me.   Also, after I told my waitress I was finished eating, it still took her 15 minutes to bring my check (see below - very slow night).  Maybe it's ok to sit there while waiting for your check if you are dining with someone else, but if you're traveling and eating alone, the wait is very noticeable. Now, had the restaurant been overflowing with customers one could almost make logic of the arrogance of the restaurant employees.  But, let me assure you, the number of patrons was so small that they had us all crammed into a small dining area.  I can't figure it out - maybe the owners have so much money that their customer satisfaction isn't important to them.   I wonder if the owner of this restaurant actually reads reviews of their restaurant on high profile websites like this.  I travel on an expense account, so the only skin I have in this interaction is my time and my digestive health.  For the good people that travel to Nashville TN and spend their hard earned money for a good dining experience, please be aware that Rodizio's is not all that it should be based on my personal experience.  Oh well, I guess I won't burden this restaurant with my money in the future.

reviews.name: Mike T.
reviews.review: I visited Rodizios while in Tennesse. I have to say that the food was good. The service on the other hand was absolutely horrid. Worst I have ever encountered. We had a party of 18 since I was visiting family and granted the bill was divided but this waitress took an hour and a half to figure things out and it still was never right. The food is one price but the drinks and desserts were extra. She insisted we ordered more drinks and desserts than we actually did. She apologized for being new which duh we figured. Management kept having her come back when they should have stepped in right away. We ended up overpaying when all drinks and desserts should have been free because of the trouble. Terrible service from server and management. Would recommend finding another steakhouse to visit while in Tennessee. There are plenty

reviews.name: John R.
reviews.review: Went here for my birthday celebration last year, not being able to find many other options with a table for 5 on a Saturday night without further notice. Had no clue what to expect, but my dad had spoken highly of another Brazilian Steakhouse he'd been to in Germany. Was immediately impressed by the appetizers as well as the size of the salad bar, and who can beat an endless array of meats walking around the building at all times. Chicken hearts definitely hit the spot and a lot of the other meat options were amazing as well. Dessert options looked absolutely amazing, ended up having the chocolate cake option, and would've loved to try everything else as well. Can be quite a bit pricey, but is definitely worth the experience at least once. Servers do an amazing job never seemed to have an empty glass or empty plate of food. Great for group outings and a great family adventure as well.

reviews.name: Brandon S.
reviews.review: Came here on a Tuesday evening for a date night with my girlfriend. We had a reservation and were promptly seated. They had an excellent wine selection, and included appetizers were delicious. The salad bar that they had was extravagant and also had a selection of side dishes. The real treat was the meats that the gauchos brought around. As soon as we set out toggle on green we were bombarded by top sirloin, grilled fish, roasted ham, lamb,grilled pineapple, and more that I can't even remember. It was awesome. We had the chocolate cake for desert, it has a Brazilian name but I don't remember it either. The combination with the sauce over it was stellar. To top it all off our server Alyssa was charming and knowledgeable and made sure the gaucho with the pineapple made it over to us whenever possible. We will definitely be back regularly and requesting her.

reviews.name: Larisa N.
reviews.review: Ok Brazilian steakhouse, however variety of meat isn't very wide and quality isn't the best. It's not that bad, but I've seen better. Fogo de Chao for instance. They do have good deserts.Really slow service if you sit by the bar!

reviews.name: Aly G.
reviews.review: Everything about my experience here was PHENOMENAL.My boyfriend was visiting from Hawaii for Christmas and we decided to try this place out for his birthday.Our head server Ryan was not only ADORABLE but also extremely informative about the different courses of the meal and seemed to really enjoy his job! The food was literally never-ending and I can't imagine wanting it any other way. I mean SERIOUSLY, even the salad bar was impressive!This was such a special night for us and I definitely won't hesitate to recommend this place!

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: We come to Rodizio Grill on occasion where we're in the mood for a LOT of meat (believe it or not, that does happen every now and then, even to this mostly chicken and fish kinda gal).  We love the atmosphere, the friendliness of the staff and gauchos, the variety of meats, salads and sides, and those incredible cheesy bread things that are part of the appetizers served on every table.  Really, those cheesy bread things are good enough to eat as a meal on their own - YUM.The meats offered have always been good quality and seasoned nicely.  On a few of our recent visits, the chef gets a little carried away with the salt shaker and the meat is very, very salty.  I enjoy salt, but this has sometimes been a little much even for me.  That being said, the meats are cooked well and the gauchos come around to every table consistently.  If you leave Rodizio Grill hungry, it's your own damn fault.  Also, the gauchos will ask you which meat you enjoy the most so they're sure to bring it to you until you've had enough, which I think adds a nice touch of hospitality to the restaurant.  My personal favorite meat is actually not meat at all, but the fish option - it's ALWAYS good and I gobble up as much as I can while I'm there.  The grilled pineapple is also a nice palate cleanser between the different varieties of meat.I will say that I've never been super impressed by the bar selections - the cocktails are often VERY sweet and light on the liquor for their high pricetags.  That being said, Rodizio Grill does offer nice wine and beer lists to enjoy with your meal.  I will stick to those whenever I come again.I've also had a few work functions in their party room, located in the back of the restaurant.  The waitstaff and management do a fantastic job to make sure all of the guests are well taken care of - it's a great place to throw a party or host a corporate event for those who love to chow down on meat.  The $10 valet parking is also a great bonus, especially if you'd like to enjoy downtown Nashville after your meal.

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: My coworkers and I have now been here I believe a total of 8 times.  Not sure why my coworker likes to count, but he does!  Anyways ~ out of the 8 trips, we've only had 1 issue.  That issue stemmed from being super far away from the Grill Room and only seeing a server about once every 5-10 minutes.  Able to look past that one issue, and now we always request to sit in or near the grill room.  Enough meat to fill a small pickup and its always delicious.We try to keep ourselves from only going there about once a month or so, but we always find ourselves there for lunch every couple of weeks.Come hungry and be prepared not to eat dinner that night if you go for lunch!  Friendly staff, servers, and cooks.  And excellent food!

reviews.name: Tommy L.
reviews.review: Overall pretty good experience, but I limit it to 4 stars because the best Brazilian I have is in SD and Vegas.

reviews.name: Nicole M.
reviews.review: The best thing I have ever put in my mouth. My mouth is literally watering as I write this. Only my holy skirt steaks and grilled pineapples this was beyond good!!! The fish and peppers ohhhhh ohhhh myyyyyy. This restaurant will be at least an every other month  occurrence for me. Thank you thank you thank you. From the tip of my tongue to the bottom of my belly!!!!

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: Man, I'm pretty torn about this review... I think I should preface by saying I'm not a huge meat eater/lover even though I do eat it and enjoy being a carnivore on occasion. So if you are a meat head and love it... maybe I'm not your best review to read. However, I will continue with that disclaimer! This was my first time ever being at a Brazilian steakhouse, but I knew the standard; price fix menu and unlimited supply of food. To be honest, I have never had a desire to eat at one of these restaurants, but as it was someone's birthday I came along for dinner. There are two options; full rodizio with unlimited meat and salad bar for $32.99 or salad bar only for $18.99. Multiple people have told me this is a great deal as most Brazilian Steakhouses are around $50 per person. After taking a look at the salad bar and seeing all of the food available, I went with the salad bar only and it was PLENTY of food. I enjoyed it; they offered hot dishes and cold ones as well with some hits and misses, but overall pretty decent. I snuck a bite or two of meat from my boyfriend's plate and it was tasty, but I didn't find myself upset that I missed out on it to be honest... some feedback from the table who did partake in the meat selections said that there were some cuts of meat that were amazing, others were a bit tough. They also are pretty good about cutting off big pieces if you want that. I did get a bit frustrated having to say "no thanks" over and over again to the gauchos who were bringing by meat. It was better once we told our server that I was only eating the salad bar, but I still had to say "no thanks" again and again. One of them it must have been his first day because he didn't have hardly ANY muscle in cutting the meat and had some difficulty getting pieces off. So you see my dilemma... $18.99 is a bit steep in my opinion for a salad/hot bar only, but it was good. It's nice to have the option to opt out of the full experience if you are trying to save some money or have dietary restrictions. I think vegans are a bit screwed....just don't come here if you are vegan period! I keep going back and forth between 3 and 4 stars but I think I have to go with my gut and give them a 3.. I can't see myself rushing back unless it is someone else's choice.NOTE: My BF said he would give them 4 stars if that helps; he had the full meat experience!

reviews.name: Alycia B.
reviews.review: Hands down the BEST rodizio I've been to thus far (been to Fogo de Chao, Texas de Brazil, and a handful of others in various cities)So I arrived at 9:15 thinking I wouldn't get the full experience getting there so close to closing which was 9:30. Boy was I wrong! Between me (I was dining alone) and one other party of six we had the place to ourselves and the service was great! Fast, attentive, asked me exactly what I wanted and brought it right out to me (they don't try to fill you up on the less expensive meats like other places)The salad bar was not as fancy or exotic as other brazilian steakhouses but they had a hot bar that had more choices than any place I've been before. ok best part of the whole thing -- THE TOP SIRLOIN. Simply magnificent! Perfect flavor, tendy, juicy, melts in your mouth! Totally makes up for the fact that filet mignon is not one of the cuts here, because man oh man that top sirloin is better than the best filet you could ever imagine.The second best part is the delectible pineappple they bring around --- it's glazed and grilled over the flame just like all the other meats making it sweet, juicy, and succulent. (see photos!)The only negative I have to say is that the cheesy bread was a little hard, like it wasn't fresh. Probably because it was the end of the night. The bread is my favorite part of the whole experience, so I was disappointed but if that's not the case for you then this is the place to go!

reviews.name: Josh C.
reviews.review: OK, so what could make a delicious traditional Brazilian rodizio of meats even better? If you guessed bacon, you would be right.Since living in salt lake city, the rodizio grill has been my favorite restaurant. I went to it for the first time in 1999, right before I went to live in Rio de Janeiro. The rodizio grill is a great representation of a traditional Brazilian Churrascaria and is my favorite place to go to make me feel like I'm in Brazil again . I would also say that the Nashville installment is even better than the one in Utah.Now, back to bacon. When I went in January it was Bacon month, and there were several more of the meats that hat been paired with bacon. Also, at the salad bar there were several different local bacons for you to try. The jalapeño bacon was especially good. If that weren't enough, the pao de queijo also had bits of bacon in it. When we were offered refills on the delicious little cheese breads, we were given both the original version and some more of the bacon ones. They came right out of the oven, and were perfect. The rodizio of meats brought many different varieties. They seemed to have the perfect combinations of degrees of wellness. My wife was able to get the well done pieces she wanted and I could get the more medium rare pieces. Most of our choices were also the "first cut" pieces, which are the best. They are the ones who've been exposed directly to the fire and salted directly. I'll still say that the picanha is my favorite. The staff was great and brought us the few meats we wanted to try again at the end of our meal. I want to say Anna was our server's name and she did a great job.For the first time, we also got desert. The brigadeiro cake was an enormous portion that we shared and still only got half way through. It was delicious and reminded me of the Brazilian bakeries in Rio.We were extremely happy with our meal here and will continue to frequent regularly.

reviews.name: Natalie D.
reviews.review: Food is delicious and plentiful. Must try at least once. Say yes to the rice and black beans, say hell yes to the collard greens. Chicken liver not so much. Overall great meat service ok overall service and delicious food.

reviews.name: Afkham N.
reviews.review: 4.5 Stars!Compared to my last visit on valentines weekend, today was MUCH better. The service at our table provided by Gabriela was exceptional; attentive, informative and pleasant. The salad bar was stocked well and incredibly fresh, and the "meat boys" in circulation made sure we were offered every cut of meat frequently. They just need a bit more variety in the salad bar and a few more cuts of meat but for $24.99 for full buffet lunch the selection, value, quality, service and atmosphere/ambiance is superb!

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: When you want meat on a stick you have to have it.  This was mediocre fairly bland meat, no surprises.  Salad bar OK, drinks good, service poor.  Price point for overall experience $35 acceptable.  There are better meat on a stick places in town but during snow and ice this was the closest to the crib.  Really catering for tourists whom may be a little less fussy about everything.

reviews.name: Tarantula B.
reviews.review: Nice clean casual environment with a friendly staff. Really enjoyed the grilled pineapple, lamb and beef. Not a fan of the white fish and pork items. A big fan of the salad bar it provided a great variety of salads hot and cold - the kale salad & quinoa salad were my favorite. My husband loved everything, his favorites were the mac & cheese(a part of the salad bar), the chicken, beef, barbecue ribs and sausage. We were celebrating our anniversary so of course we had to have dessert....creme brûlée was the way for us to end the evening and it was fantastic. With a few of the meat carvers they were a little robotic- others were very energetic and their smile made you want to try what ever meat they were carving .  A manager never came to our table, but upon arrival the greeter acknowledged our reservation which included the message that we were celebrating our anniversary. Thank you Rodizio Grill family for making this a special evening.

reviews.name: Jeremy T.
reviews.review: The food and service are great.The food bar/salad bar has some good food as well, but is pretty small compared to other Brazilian steakhouses.  The offerings are good, but I would expect more, especially for the size of this place.

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: Brazilian steak houses are always interesting to go to.  It's a contest between your eyes and your stomach and which one will ultimately win (spoiler, its your eyes).  You get not only an endless "salad" bar (every side possible under the sun on top of salad) but what seems to be an unending parade of meat.  I mean, all possible kinds of meat.  Not just your classic steak and chicken but ham and pineapple and chicken hearts and every possible piece of cow you could ever think to try.  And admittedly, all really good.  Like, really good.  Some are seasoned and some are just plain perfectly cooked meat.  It comes on a giant metal pike and its cut right onto your already "salad"-filled plate.  You have a little stop/go button to summon these purveyors of carnivorous indulgence, turning over green when you want more and red when you need a break.  They also come around with carts filled with different shots as well.  I can honestly say this makes a great place for large parties, but not so much for chatting one on one as you are pretty much stuffing your face all the time by default.  But, it was good, filling, and fun, if you're a meat lover of course.  Not so much fun for vegetarians.  Not a quiet place at all also, FYI (complete with birthday party singing by all the staff).  Also, being on second avenue means it's a little touristy.  However, again, if you are having a big party of visiting friends who love meat, or need a serious carb-up before hitting Broadway, this will definitely do the trick.

reviews.name: Sharon B.
reviews.review: What a fabulous place. This was our fifth or sixth time and have never been disappointed. This time I took my 4yr old granddaughter to celebrate her birthday. She had a blast, especially when they came out singing Happy Birthday in Portuguese. Can't wait to go back.

reviews.name: Janette C.
reviews.review: Wow.....I mean  really....to sum up this place in one word....."wow" is what I would use!We made reservations and the place was pretty packed for the dinner hour, so we were glad we had.  You can do so on Yelp or on Open Table.It is a flat fee for the meal per person.  That flat fee includes a salad bar with a very good variety on it!    It included salads, breads, side dishes, soup, snacks and a lot more!   It was a meal in itself!     The flat fee also includes the all you can eat meats traveling around the restaurant!  When you are seated you are given what looks like a plastic timer, one side green and the other side red.  When you want the guys to stop at the table, you turn it to the green side.  When you are full or just making your way through the deliciousness and need a break...turn it to the red side!   So very much food!  If you can go and relax and make a time of it...spend a couple hours there  as a couple or with a few friends...enjoy it and don't rush!  That way you can soak up the atmosphere and really enjoy all the flavours and varieties there !They also have a decent selection for beer, wine and cocktails.Desert...yes we did get one even after all that food....is not including in the meal price but it was delicious and we split it :)Go !  Try it !

reviews.name: Courtney G.
reviews.review: First time here was for work. I was so full I thought they'd have to carry me out. Excellent food, healthy options too on the salad bar (which is enough to fill you up btw), drinks and desserts-I had the blond beer and creme brule' yum! Next time I will dress up a little more. It's a good date place too :-)

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: Had date night this Saturday night and we were seated right away. Their was Alot of Christmas parties going on but they found a table literally right in front of the meat prep area. Normally I would find issue with the proximity to the hustle and bustle of the kitchen, but to the contrary we had immediate assistance every time I flipped on the "bring the meat" color of green. It got to the point that the gauchos would ask me what I wanted to try, and they would request it and we would get first cut! If you want fast service sit here! Red meats were all tasty, and I was actually surprised by the flavor of the chicken hearts and lime, but the chicken and turkey skewers got a bit dry. Fish was amazing, as was the grilled pineapple. Overall a fun time and a great meal.Just be ready for about $50 per person on average bill. Always annoys me when I read a review on somewhere that expresses up front the cost, and yet people post how surprised they were with the bill.

reviews.name: William G.
reviews.review: What a great restaurant, so many choices of different  meats, I love the roast chicken and roast beef and the appetizers too many to list, top notch salad bar with pretty much everything you could imagine and the pineapples are out of this world.  My second visit today.

reviews.name: Steven I.
reviews.review: This is without a doubt my wife's and my favorite restaurant. I have to go at least 2 times month. every time I go I think that the service and food can't get better but instead my expectations continue to be exceeded.If you price it compared to a TGI Fridays or similar restaurants then it is more expensive, if you compare it to value for dollar it is quite inexpensive.

reviews.name: Jerimy C.
reviews.review: Was my 1st time eating at this place, I have a number of complaints, (1) Valet Parking. The valet was ridiculous, the car was never parked in one spot it was parked on the street and moved at least 5 times, if a spot opened up further up the road they would move every car behind it forward so the valets wouldn't have to parallel park. I Might as well have just payed somebody to circle the block in it till we were done eating.(2) The Appetizer. when the appetizers came they only brought 3 pieces of 3 different items for a table of 16 people, the server was apologetic and said she would bring more out, by the time more came I was already done eating the dinner part. (3) Meats. we were told we would we have choice of 12 meats, only 7 meats came to our table with a glazed pineapple as one of the meat choices, the meat cuts were small 1 bite per cut, it was also way undercooked beyond Rare, I assume that this contributed to the reason why everybody at our table was throwing up or getting diarrhea for the rest the night, I started getting sick before I left I had to walkout and find a place on the street to throw up because the bathrooms were full and I couldn't wait in the long line.  (4) Price. The waitress said the price for all you can eat was $34.00, when I asked for the check the previously nice attitude of our waitress flipped, She first told me she would get it when she had time in a tone of voice as if It was a major inconvenience I then explained to her that the food was making me sick and if she didn't bring my check I was leaving without paying she then came back very quick with the check. When the bill came she added a $7 Service charge I assume this was because I asked for my check before she was ready to give it to me. When some other people at my table complained to the staff they were offered no discounts no apologies and were told that they needed to have more patience because they were really busy, (on a sidenote it's not the customers fault because you're too busy!) I rate this place with one star because for a high-class dining experience at $50 plus per person I found it appalling that they would expect the customer to pay it forward for their mistakes and overcrowding especially when it's reservation only, I'm usually pretty forgiving and won't write a review on a place till mistakes have been made on multiple visits but for a pricy and classy environment like this I have no patience for the price it should always be 100% good Needless to say I will not go back there ever! Nor will I recommend this place to anybody!

reviews.name: Jonathon S.
reviews.review: Staff are rude ..management wants to argue. Didn't eat (yea was seated n in 10 minutes we were over their arrogance and rude behavior. Would not recommend unless you like rude service.

reviews.name: Julie D.
reviews.review: This was my first time in Nashville Tennessee and I've been seeing billboards and recommendations on this steakhouse so I decided to try it. My conclusion is 2/5 stars and this is why: Pros: they have a magnificent salad bar with a variety of foods. Our actual server was very nice and attentive. Also, the choices of meat were decent. Cons: their staff is extremely inexperienced and rude, the dining was rushed, the meat was not cooked to temperature, and no variety of lamb. In dealing with staff, their servers didn't ask about how we would like the temperature of the meat. When I asked to have something medium rare, it was given well done or rare. In cutting the meat, the staff had virtually no idea how to properly hold a steak knife and slice the appropriate width of meat. The meat either came too thin that it wouldn't be a slice, or it would be so thick that it was tough to slice through it. Out of our table of 6, they asked 2 people whether they would like the meat. The other 4 were not at all acknowledged. On top of that, when my friend said he wanted a piece, one slice was cut for me, then the server left in a rush bc "others requested" that cut of meat. Their staff also pushed through plates, and knocked over forks to sit the meat on the table for cutting. Rather than staying around the empty spots in the table, they chose to squeeze through couples and "make room" on the table to cut. After our forks were knocked over, there was no apology and they were quick to leave. I requested back 2 cuts of meat, and only 1 was brought back. The one that was brought back was not cooked to the approximate temperature that I requested, and the staff seemed annoyed that I asked for a choice of meat to come back. Also, The cheese bread was fairly burned and stale. I can genuinely say, I'm extremely disappointed and will never come here again. Maybe because Houston has so much competition, they're precise and detailed in the dining experience. I felt like I was at a fast food Resturant dining here and I did not feel welcomed nor enjoy the dinner. I hope this Resturant takes more detail into presentation, training, and service of their staff. From the time I walked in to the time I left, I was disappointed. Although there might not be many other Brazilian steakhouses in Nashville, that is truly no excuse to serve with less than mediocre service and at a bare minimum standard of food.

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: Don't be afraid to tip it to red and take a break....the gauchos will fly right back in when you go back to green.   When you are here, that comment will make more sense.  Take your time is sound advice here.Of the meats that came out, I would have to say the Frango Agri-Doce (a sweet and spicy chicken) was the clear winner with the Maminha (tri-tip sirloin) and Abacaxí (glazed and grilled pineapple) getting honorable mentions.I made reservations for a group of 22 comprised of conference attendees from across the country and I did not hear the first bad comment - everyone loved the change of pace from what I would call "southern food" and left full and happy.  I will 100% be back - staff and food are top notch.

reviews.name: Leanne B.
reviews.review: My daughter and I went for brunch and I was pleased overall.  The salad bar (yes some of us eat that) was decent and most of the meat was good or better.  Service was ok, because of where our table was it took a while for the meat bearers to come to our table. I will also say it was at least 20 min after turning our marker to green that we finally got the first entree that was actually beef.  Even after all of the meat I ate one of my favorites was the grilled pineapple! While it is expensive it is a pretty good deal for the price with the exceptions of drinks, I found the brazilarita yummy but overpriced.  Overall I would return, even for dinner at full price. Enjoy!

reviews.name: Tommy P.
reviews.review: Meal was adequate, but not as good as I expected.  Service from our waiter was poor....all other staff excellent.

reviews.name: Kevin W.
reviews.review: the food was very good. it was nice to finally have probably prepared lamb. the waiting staff were very friendly and knowledgeable  the reason the rating is not higher is because of the problems at the front of the restaurant. there was chaos which caused confusion about seating arrangements. lastly I was told by my girlfriend that the women's bathroom needed to be cleaned.  overall I had a very enjoyable experience.  I hope they can fix the confusion.

reviews.name: Jessica R.
reviews.review: Delicious food and good service. It was a little pricey, but we went for a special occasion. We liked everything we tried except the wild boar, which was a bit tough and dry. Otherwise, this place was right on. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Emily Myles H.
reviews.review: Rodizio's was great and our server Anthony was wonderful!  Mojito had a really nice flavor.  The salad and apps bar had a lot of options which was nice and there were endless types of meats with different flavors.  Cool concept!

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: Just having a dinner here one night should be sufficient to earn you a Meathead badge.For $32.99, you get a Full Rodizio meal which includes appetizers (Banana Frita, Polenta & Pao de Queijo aka Brazilian Cheese Bread), grilled meats, and full salad bar. To order the meat, you flip the wooden peg to GREEN. To stop, flip to RED. To order desert, flip it horizontally so the YELLOW faces up. Delicious grilled meat runs from beef, lamb, chicken, pork, to fish. The sweet and sour chicken is a must! It was my favorite out of all the 10+ meats I tried. Grilled pineapple and grilled tomato with parmesan cheese are also available if you want to get away from the meat a little bit. The salad bar was pretty amazing. There were so many types of salad, but my favorite was the Quinoa salad. The good thing about this place is they offer variety of Gluten Free salads. For drinks, I had the Hot Sunset (?). My friends had the Caipirinha (Brazilian classic cocktail) and something else on the list Gabriella recommended. They all were very good but not to point that made me drunk. We had the Flan and Orange Creme Brûlée. They both were delicious and not too sweet. Customer service was EXCELLENT. As soon as we turned the wooden peg to green, every 10 seconds there was a Passadores (Good-looking ones *cough*) came to cut us meat. The waitress was also very attentive. We asked for hot sauce and they had Siracha sauce for us (Siracha at a Brazilian restaurant!!). They weren't being cheap on the sauce either and gave us a full cup of it. We didn't need to make reservations on a Monday night, however I recommend to make one if you plan to go on weekend. This place can get crowded pretty quickly. They also offered valet parking here ($7 on weekdays, $10 on weekend) but we decided to park a little farther. After eating all of those delicious food, a long walk was much needed...For the ladies, I recommend you wear a dress or something comfortable (you'll thank me later).Check out this place, y'all. The FEAST is waiting for ya at Rodizio Grill!2013/#53

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: Was just alright. I've been to several Brazilian steakhouses, and this was probably the lowest of all of them. The meat was alright, when we finally got it. I think we got kind of screwed by sitting in the corner. We only had steak come around once and there was only a tiny sliver left. We had three kids with us, so sitting around for hours isn't a very good option.The buffet bar had a couple of decent options, but all of the ones I had been to in the past had more of a fresh seafood selection, including mussels with tomatoes and garlic, etc.. I felt like for $32/adult, and a nearly $140 total bill with kids and a tip, we could've had a much better meal just about anywhere else in that price range.The Gaucho's, were all very friendly, and extremely helpful when they did make it to our table, so I left 3 stars for that, instead of 2.

reviews.name: Ann L.
reviews.review: We had a corporate event for 200 people at this restaurant.  All the guests really enjoyed the dinner, and gave us a lot of compliments.  The restaurant offers a wide variety of food (meats, veggies, fish) and drinks at reasonable prices.  The atmosphere is nice too.The manager (event planner) was very helpful and attentive to our needs, and the servers were also excellent.  We requested for a live music band, and they arranged an amazing Latin band for us.  Everyone had a really great time. I recommend this place for some events besides regular dining with your friends & family.

reviews.name: Ariel S.
reviews.review: no wait for dinner we ate Saturday night (930p). for the price (about 35$ per person) you get unlimited salad bar and appetizer, and 12 kinds of unlimited meats. the drinks and desserts are extra but not terribly priced. you get a cube to use to request your meats and they just keep coming. it was a very awesome experience! I recommend to anyone

reviews.name: mumin k.
reviews.review: I went here based on the positive reviews on Yelp. I love the concept of Brazilian steakhouse with unlimited meat and have been to Fogo de Chao and Texas de Brazil many times. However Rodizio is nowhere near those places. The prices at Rodizio are slightly lower but quality is nowhere near the other Brazilian steakhouses i have been to. There is absolutely nothing I like about this place. The meat quality, the service, and the distribution of meat were all poor. The restaurant's layout is just inefficient. I won't even talk about the salad bar because this is a stake restaurant but if I had to, it would be another negative for the restaurant.The Meat: Every cut, and I will admit there were not many, I tried was dry and absolutely tasteless. The guys delivering the meat have no idea what they are doing. I kept asking for medium pieces but they would serve me pieces that was really well done or rare. Distribution of Meat: This was a complete disaster as we were seated near the bar area which is far from the action. We told our server several times that we were not getting any meat and he assured us that we will send someone over. Nothing changed. To be fair, the brown sugar glazed pineapple came to our table several times but i did not even bother trying it. I went to Rodizio for meat not fruits. At some point we were tired, asked for our check and left the place with some of us being still hungry. Yes, we were still hungry because we could not eat anything. How is it even possible to leave a Brazilian steakhouse hungry after paying $100+ for two. This is a first for me. Those who have visited a good Brazilian steakhouse would understand me here. The Service: Our server was incompetent. Him being incompetent was partially due to the fact that he was assigned to wait more tables than he could handle. But the result for us was an extremely poor service. Our drinks came late (he himself told us he forgot about our drinks). I asked for salt at the beginning of our dinner and he brought the salt right before we were leaving. I had the first couple of slices of meat in my salad plate as he was not around to serve us some clean plates. When I told him that we were not getting any meat, he asked me whether I was serious. I just pointed to the five empty plates sitting in front of us and he felt my frustration but did not do anything about this.Overall, we had a very bad experience at Rodizio and I will not go back. Not even to give it a second chance or even if it was for free. Another reviewer here on Yelp said "Go to Rodizio, the feast is awaiting you" .. Yeah, I totally agree that you should go to Rodizio if you are looking for "a brown sugar glazed pineapple feast"

reviews.name: Karl M.
reviews.review: 18 types of meat to choose from!? SIGN Me up! Garlic Beef and Bacon wrapped chicken were personal favorites along with the grilled pineapple. Their sides were also well done especially the mashed potatoes. While made for a buffet style of eating, it felt like dining at a classy establishment.$100 for 2 people was well worth it! I would go again tomorrow if I could! A must try!

reviews.name: Alex M.
reviews.review: You can't stop the meat from coming.  I think its  a great value.  They had 15 different meats in rotation.  Sirloin to flank steak, sweet and spicy chicken was great.  They had wild boar and rattle snake sausage.  The salad and side bar was OK.  I would have liked a baked potato.  At other Brazilian steak houses I've been to they had filet.  No filet here, but still excellent.  They came around with shots to the table.  Very good.  Valet parking was only $10 on a Saturday night.  Only problem is you have to pickup car by 11

reviews.name: Steve W.
reviews.review: Had our company's Christmas party there with about 30 people. Service and food was excellent. Really enjoyed the variety on both the salad bar and the meat skewers brought around

reviews.name: Ivo Leonardo L.
reviews.review: My experience was great! My mom and I went there for dinner (around 7) after a whole day walking around town. We did not have lunch that Friday so we were starving. After reading couple negative reviews I was pretty skeptical and even reluctant that it would pay off. It did. $33 well paid.The server was GReAT! The gauchos were also very good for the most part. Very good starters and amazing salad bar. As soon as we flipped the thingy to green they started bringing all kinds of meat NON STOP. High end meats as well. Only good things to say. Didn't try any dessert tho for lack of room in our stomach. They also have valet.

reviews.name: Jamin F.
reviews.review: I've never have been to a Brazilian steakhouse before and my wife and I wanted to try it. Our meal was a little over 100 dollars and we felt like the food was mediocre.
