It wasn't as good as much cheaper meal we had in town the next night. The meats didn't have that great of flavor, only had filet come by the table once. Ham was incredible but other than that the best part of the meal was the salad bar. Don't have other Brazilian Steakhouses to compare it to but maybe it's not my thing.

reviews.name: Carmen P.
reviews.review: if you like going into meat comas, this is your place.if you like lots of salads, this is your place.if you like caribbean drumming to perform birthday songs, this is your place!you can: get really dressed up, and fit income in your secretly elastic waisted pants and fit in.the salad bar only option is $15the salad bar and all you can eat meat off of the poles option is $35---shh, the salad bar has meaty items on it too! and soup.  instead of bacon bits, it has whole slices of bacon!  there's also pasta salads, shrimp salad..you know, just look at the menu online.service is attentive, the mgr on duty makes it a point to stop by each table and inquire into the service, food, experience. also, save room/make room, shove it down, for dessert. i recommend the creme brûlée...i always recommend that though. go ahead and spring for the valet parking, it's actually cheaper than paying for the lots (valet is $10, lots are as much as $20).

reviews.name: Rob G.
reviews.review: Went here for our 4 year anniversary and I cannot stop raving about this place to our friends and family! Drinks were strong, apps were great, and dessert was miserable.......but only because we were SO FULL! it was a fantastic experience! My wife doesn't do well with rare meats but it wasn't really rare, more like medium. She loved it! We sat in the back and it was really romantic and quiet. The meats were exceptional! I really wish I could go back every night if I could afford it but with $33 a person and the amount of food you get, its really not that bad AT ALL! Dont eat after 12 pm then go around 5. You'll thank me later!

reviews.name: P J.
reviews.review: I'm an unabashed carnivore and as such, I loved going to Fogo de Chao in Atlanta.  Since moving here a few months ago I started having that familiar red meat craving and decided to try Rodizio.  I went for brunch on the weekend, and frankly I was disappointed. I  make it a habit to try new restaurants by myself so that I don't have to worry about anybody else's dining experience being ruined by my choice.  I'm glad I followed that habit this time, though it may well have worked agains me.  While I was seated quickly, I was served slowly and reluctantly.  Their food was adequate, but nothing to rave about. The salad bar made me think of a "higher end" Ruby Tuesday's if that  exists, or if it makes sense to you.On a positive note, in order to say something nice, their prices were lower than Fogo de Chao or Texas de Brazil.  So, in summary,  if you've been to Fogo, you'll most likely be disappointed,  if you haven't,  this is a decent intro to Brazilian steakhouses. I'll freely admit that I have been spoiled by my experiences elsewhere.I'll try them again in a while to see if they had an off day and will update this review.

reviews.name: Matthew H.
reviews.review: A little disappointed. I was really looking forward to this place but overall I would say you could skip it. Here is the deal. Salad bar was amazing really tasty stuff and great selection. Our waitress was awesome, friendly and helpful. But.... The whole point of the place is the meat and that was just ok. Out of the 5 or 6 I tried only one was really cooked correctly. Most of the steak was over cooked and the chicken was kind of over flavored tasted like they just dumped hot sauce all over it. Turkey was too salty and the lamb was over cooked as well. I would say pass on this place and try something else to satisfy your meat cravings. They did have some great local beers on tap :)

reviews.name: Mandy C.
reviews.review: Rodizio needs to figure out a better system for distributing their meat.  I have been here twice now and each time we have had to request specific things that have not come by our table (but we have seen at other tables).  The last time I was here, someone from my party actually turned their plate in because he thought all the meats had been around, come to find out there were several more that came wayy later (too late).  I would give their salad bar 4 stars.  You can purchase this a la carte for $18.99 where the whole deal is ~$33.  I realize this is a value compared to some other brazilian steakhouses but it's mediocre and left me wanting dessert.  They could at least offer a few basics at the salad bar.  Just a suggestion.  The service can be professional but also borderline awkward.

reviews.name: Sarah P.
reviews.review: Wonderful experience. Wish I had a bigger stomach after eating here.  The staff was amazing and the meat oh the meat. I didnt even make it to the sides I was so full from meat

reviews.name: David A.
reviews.review: Great choice for dinner. The service was friendly and attentive. You've never seen so much meat in your life; over 17 types. All meat was perfectly prepared and it just keeps coming. My personal favorite was the white wine chicken. Try the salad bar as well - it was wonderful and I really enjoyed the BLT salad. Hot appetizer bar and garlic mashed potatoes were fantastic. I skipped out on dessert but those in my party who did partake spoke very highly of the cakes.

reviews.name: Jay F.
reviews.review: Went there last Wednesday for my birthday with 3 other couples.  Had a really great meal.  This is the second Brazalian style place I've gone to, the other being Texas de Brazil in Memphis.  Rodizio was $11.00 less per meal.  The salad bar was ample, plenty of selections.  The meats were all tasty and flavorful, especially liked the garlic beef, the lamb, the sausage and the bacon wrapped turkey. And the roasted pineapple may have been the best of all.  Service was very good, all told an outstanding meal.

reviews.name: Birdy A.
reviews.review: Side dishes and everything at the buffet was great, but the meats were just too salty and that was the primary reason we came.

reviews.name: Theresa C.
reviews.review: This is NOT just a place to eat - it is an entire dining experience. From the UNBELIEVABLE salad bar, to the 12 varieties of meats available -all of it, all you can eat by the way.  It takes a few hours to savor all the different flavors of this outstanding meal.Even my mother, a notoriously picky eater who just ordered the salad bar cannot stop raving about it.Just the way they serve the meal is a completely different way of dining. I won't spoil it! But it is truly ingenious!DEFINITELY worth a first visit - because I guarantee it won't be your last!!

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: Wow, this was a fantastic experience and dinner !Our server started us with a the appetizers, Banana Frita,  Polenta & Pao de Queijo which is a Brazilian Cheese Bread. Then the Feast begins as you flip the wooden peg from RED to GREEN the Passadores (meat waiters) come to the table with knives and a skewer, on which are speared various kinds of meat, be it beef, pork, filet mignon, lamb, chicken, duck, ham, sausage, fish, and other sorts of local cut of meat. Make sure to try the Caipirinha, this is the national cocktail of Brazil.Leave room for dessert, their Creme Brulee, ohh la la or in Brazilian, Saudade !

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: First let me say that I must respectfully disagree with the naysayers on here. Perhaps you went on an odd night or perhaps this was simply not your cup of tea. On the occasions I have been there I have been impressed and very pleased with the food, the service, and the experience as a whole. To me it is an amazing value given the variety and quality. I enjoyed the rattlesnake sausage and the wild boar. There was a great pork tenderloin and an incredible ribeye. Now the sirloin was not the best but when is sirloin the best? The house special sweet and spicy chicken was awesome as was the fish that I had. I will grant that the salad bar is not outstanding but it is fine given the fact that this place is a carnivore's palace.I was just there this past Friday and I was more than pleased. The servers work as a team and the management is on point as well. I would recommend this place to anyone. Reviews are opinions and we know what they are compared to. Go out and try it for yourself and let us know what you think and feel!

reviews.name: Tiffany S.
reviews.review: Took my parents here for a nice surprise since my dad is a huge meat eater & my mom loves salads. Win/Win right? Wrong! I'm not sure where these reviews are coming from. Sure I give my bar drink & the experience 5 stars but certainly not the food. Please remember that is what we should be writing about. There were only two pieces of meat that were edible such as the ham & salt/pepper steak. The other pieces were either not cooked to the right temperature are very tough. The salad bar was worse than chain restaurants. I've seen better and tasted better at Ruby Tuesdays. We waited at least 5-8 minutes in between meat servings. It was extremely slow & when you tried to wave them down it was like they didn't see you. When you go somewhere like this  of course you expect greatness and this was far from great. Everything was a bit bland and very under seasoned. The selections for the meet and the salad / pasta bar were so very few. If you have ever been to a Brazilian steakhouse this would have been a sure disappointment. I had planned to bring my entire team of 80 people for a team building exercise. However I am so grateful that I came with my family first so that I wasn't the laughing stock of the building.

reviews.name: Kacie A.
reviews.review: My husband and I LOVE this place!  The servers are always so great and the food is phenomenal! All you can eat meat along with the hot and food bar and salad bar. And the grilled pineapple is to die for!

reviews.name: Gregg K.
reviews.review: Liked it a lot!  Food is very solid and of course plentiful!  Service was awesome, dessert off the hook.  Really look forward to going back!

reviews.name: Denise R.
reviews.review: I have mixed feelings about this place.  It's nice to experience something new so i was excited to try it.  It was going to be a 45 minute wait so we sat at the bar to have a glass of wine.  My daughter ordered a Moscato  and the server pulled an uncovered already poured glass out of the fridge and pretended to pour from a bottle of wine.?????  Right after we get our drinks, they tell us our table is ready and seat us in a hallway of sorts where the servers rush by every couple minutes to pick up orders from the kitchen.  The Chef is wonderful.  He came out and showed me around the salad bar and was very helpful.   The food is all made by him and he even has one of his mother's recipes on the salad bar.   The gauchos are all great.   Our server forgot some things but overall ...everyone was professional and friendly.FOOD:  The meats are inexpensive cuts that have been seasoned nicely.  There's no rib eye or filet ..   The fish was catfish.   I was a little surprised because for $34.00 you could eat at a nice steak house.  The sodium content was so high that my dry mouth woke me up in the middle of the night.   I always ask myself if I would eat here again. .  The answer is no.  A nice one-time try it kind of place but not where I'd spend lots of money.

reviews.name: Melanie W.
reviews.review: We ate here for dinner and it was the highlight of our day. The staff was very friendly and the food to die for. To start off the salad bar has a variety of salads, meats, cheeses, pasta, rice you name it, is there. The meats: we turned over to green and the meat started to flow, from delicious chicken, steak, pork loins, sausage, fish and even grilled pineapple (which is a must). As they brought the meats the server will tell you how the meat was prepared and they all seemed very happy to serve you. Hands down one of the best steak houses we have visited.

reviews.name: Ebony L.
reviews.review: Good food and great service.  Came here a week after Fathers Day and had a good time.

reviews.name: Natalie F.
reviews.review: Incredibly interesting and tasty meal. Talk about a party in your mouth. Don't miss the pineapple and the sweet and spicy chicken. Collard greens and pickled beets. So many tasty meats.yummm. and you get to taste them all!!

reviews.name: Brett S.
reviews.review: I'll try to keep this one short! Came here with my family on my visit to Nashville. Despite arriving early to our reservation and dodging the meth heads outside, they were able to seat us right away. Service was great. The waiter was very well schooled in his knowledge of the restaurant and knew his wines as well. Basically the dinner goes like this. You receive appetizers first (which were awful), grab your plate at the salad bar and get some sides (which were also awful), and then turn your wooden block on your table from red to green and they start bringing the meat around. The first two courses are probably just there to fill you up and keep you from eating all their expensive meat. Well I caught on to their plan and they didn't fool me, I went and got an empty plate from the salad bar and was on a meat only diet for the night. Well I did try some rice which was all right.The specials of the day were rattlesnake, wild boar, and frog legs. I tried the rattlesnake which just tasted like a piece of chewy fat. The wild boar was pretty good. The steak they brought around was the best of the skewers. All the food other than the chicken seemed extremely salty/overseasoned and I had trouble putting it down. Brazilian food is usually salty, but not this salty. The desserts are probably the best thing they have here. I gave this place 3 stars for their service and funny workers, otherwise it would have been a 2. If I am ever in Nashville again, I probably would not go back.

reviews.name: Eric M.
reviews.review: Great Brazilian restaurant in downtown Nashville.  I've ate at several places like this including Texas DeBrazil and this one ranks right up there with them.  There menu has several styles of meat and their salad bar is diverse with lots of fresh and exciting items.  Some folks have commented on here about having chicken hearts on the menu.  First let me say this is a common Brazilian food item.  Second if you haven't tried it you should because they are delicious.  Aside from there vast array of meats they have some spectacular drinks.  We opted for non-alcoholic items.  My wife tried the strawberry limeade and I had a ginger ale type drink that was absolutely wonderful and refreshing.The price was cheaper than other restaurants of this style that we've visited which made it even better.  Service was fantastic and the manager made sure to stop by our table to ensure our experience was what we expected.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: Seeing as how I'm a huge fan of Texas De Brazil, I was really hoping for an awesome experience at Rodizio Grill, also. I was NOT disappointed. Rodizio is every bit as good down to the service, meats, salad bar, and even atmosphere. My boyfriend and I had a reservation for 5:30 on a Sunday. We were seated immediately and greeted by Marie, our friendly waitress. She promptly brought over the appetizers (which are included with the price of your meal) of banana fritas (chunks of banana fried with cinnamon-YUM), polenta fries-YUM, and Brazillian cheese bread-YUM! All appetizers are all you can eat. After we sampled all of those we made our way over to the salad bar. They had a huge assortment of crisp veggies to top your lettuce and also had quite a few "ready made" salads like Caesar and a delicious BLT salad. Also included were things like potato salad, chicken salad, mozzarella salad, and fruit salad. I believe some of their salad options change based on seasonal items. The "hot dish" portion of the salad bar had things like creamy mashed potatoes, different kinds of rices, sauteed collard greens with bacon, grilled vegetables, pasta alfredo, and chicken and beef stroganoff. Everything we tried was delicious! It is an option to purchase just the salad bar and forgo the meat experience and I will definitely say you would be absolutely pleased and full just off the salad bar alone if meat is not your thing. On to the best part- the meats. The Gauchos have 17 different offerings. Out of 17 we sampled maybe 10. I almost feel like I needed a list on the table to mark off everything I tried. My favorites were the Picanha, the bacon wrapped turkey, the sweet and spicy chicken, the marinated chicken, the sausage, the bacon wrapped parmesan pork, marinated pork loin, and the ham. I feel full after just writing that! The oooonly thing I was slightly disappointed with was the Brazilian Brisket. We heard the word "brisket" and was like "Omg. Get that over here!" Then we discovered that apparently Brazilian Brisket is the same thing as roast. It was served from a bowl with potatoes and carrots and it actually tasted fine but I am not a fan of roast due to terrible childhood roast memories. Ha. (Don't ask) We were thinking it was going to be like BBQ brisket but we were wrong. Oh well.During the course of our meal we had 2 bottles of wine and we got the cheesecake to go. This was a really great dining experience and about half the price of Texas De Brazil. I know we will be back.

reviews.name: Cristina A.
reviews.review: My first time eating at a Brazilian steakhouse & I loved it! What a great experience! Try every meat at least once! My favorite was the flat iron steak with some homemade chimichurri sauce and the pineapple coconut salad that they had at the salad bar was phenomenal! I will be back on my next trip back to Nashville :)

reviews.name: Michael V.
reviews.review: Pros:1.  Great food.2.  Great staff.3.  Fun environment and experience.4.  Good drink menu.Cons:1.  Little pricey.2.  I filled up my plate with the salad bar.  (This is more on me than them - next time I would pace myself with the salad and eat more of the meat.)Overall - this is a great place to go for a date night out or a night with a group of friends.  The price makes this a once in a while occasion.

reviews.name: Richard A.
reviews.review: You won't find a better place....

reviews.name: Cecilia P.
reviews.review: The only buffet style steak house I ever been to before was Texas De Brazil, which I find amazing. My boyfriend took me here on a date as I was visiting Nashville. We had reservations at 8pm which is sorta pushing it since they closed at 9/9:30ish. Started out with the salad bar, which I was shocked by the selection, had many variety of salads. We sat for a couple min, and was wondering where the gauchos were, we were worried they were done for the night, but a couple min later they all come to us. I was amazed by the price, it was $30 something a person, Texas de brazil is like $40 something.

reviews.name: Nick O.
reviews.review: Stopped of here for dinner during a convention with a couple of workmates. Flat fee here per person and all you can eat. Fabulous salad bar, good looking gauchos serving their meat (pun intended) great managers who work the floor. Nice selection of meat and fish on the skewers, if you have not eaten Brazilian before (no not that kind of Brazilian) then here's how it works. You help yourself to salad, and the gauchos come around with selections of meat from the grill. They carve at your table and you have a little "device" to let them know if you want to eat or take a break. Service was awesome, they screwed up my scotch twice for a bourbon ( can't drink since one night in 1989 - lets not go there) so the manager comped  my desert. I left my Visa card by mistake and had to go back later - the manager had it in a little envelope waiting for my return -awesome.Check this place out, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Angelo L.
reviews.review: Rodizios is everything that's promised and more. From the minute we were seated, our Server, Dan, welcomed us and explained the menu as well as "how it works" (more on that later). He made some great suggestions, was never obtrusive, but was always there when you needed something. I've eaten at restaurants all over the world and I have to say that this was among the best experiences I've had. The "gauchos" were great, and the Manager stopped by to make sure everything was going well. Now the food - You start with a light appetizer served to you of fried banana, polenta (essentially corn meal but with a garlic/ cheese flavor) and little cheese breads that were just incredible. The salad bar was next, which had everything from Marinated Quail Eggs to Roasted Garlic to Hearts  of Palm to Pastrami! Make only one stop because once you flip the little sign to the green or "go" sign- it's a non stop Parade of Gauchos and some of the most deliciously prepared beef, pork, chicken and fish that you've ever had! When at last you've had your last bite of lamb, or tenderloin or pork or sausage or chicken - the dessert comes out! We opted for the local Cheesecake made here in Mt Juliet and a glass of Port with flan. An incredible experience worth every penny!

reviews.name: Deepak B.
reviews.review: It ok. it is the better ones in Nashville. If you are expecting Fogo de Chao, think again.

reviews.name: Matheus M.
reviews.review: This place looks nice, don't get me wrong, but aside from that, the rest is pretty shitty. The food is not authentic Brazilian food. I was left super disappointed and will not come back. The paes de queijo we're too small. No one spoke Portuguese, which is fine, but also they did not know the cuts of meat or how to properly serve them. Overall, not Brazilian, looks nice, tastes less than average.

reviews.name: Michael M.
reviews.review: This is not the best rodizio but it was good. The service was friendly and the meat was good but not prime like Foco though worth the trip nonetheless. Solid wine list and salad bar.

reviews.name: Samuel D.
reviews.review: Delicious but not quite as good as Texas de Brazil or Fogo de Chao. Not as many options with sauces etc and salad bar not as extensive.

reviews.name: Brian R.
reviews.review: Very friendly and talkative staff.  My fiancee and I celebrated our engagement here.  it was a lot of fun, and the atmosphere just really set off the mood.  On par with other top chain Brazilian restaurants. Go for the valet parking 7 bucks plus tip.  Easily walk around downtown Nashville before or after dinner!

reviews.name: Mica S.
reviews.review: I absolutely loved this place. My server, Jackie, was amazing. She was super friendly and not overbearing at all. I loved the salad bar because it was not the standard lettuce, cheese, and eggs you'd find elsewhere. There were so many things to choose from on it. The drinks were great as well. When I ordered one that I didn't care for, the bar manager came by to apologize, and made a special concoction just for me, which tasted awesome. I loved the variety of meats that were offered. As for the desserts... you definitely need to save room. I hope I get the chance to visit Nashville again in the future, because I will definitely be eating here again!!

reviews.name: Jamil M.
reviews.review: Easily the one of the best dining experiences in Nashville. We went there because we had tried another Brazilian style steakhouse and was told by a friend this one was leaps and bounds above that one. I would agree.My fiancee was a little upset that we got sat at a table in the back and couldn't see the entertainment, but that didn't bother me at a all. That did not bother me at all. Everyone, from the busboys to the gauchos to the managers came by to check on us. There were plenty of options, and unlike our other Brazilian steakhouse experience, the meat was not over salted and was quiet good. Most importantly, the service was fantastic. Our section cleared out rather quickly after dinner, but we had no problem getting served. And when we made a request, they came right over with what we were craving on the skewers. On of the Managers, Glen, even went and got a fresh pineapple skewer for my significant other. Our server Harrison had a great attitude, and truly seemed like he enjoyed what he was doing. If your children are older, this is good restaurant, but I don't know why anyone with any sense would take young kids here. It's a nice change of place for Nashville, and again, our service was EXCELLENT.  I highly recom

reviews.name: Tim C.
reviews.review: One of the best meals I've ever had. Loved the meats, the atmosphere and the outstanding service.

reviews.name: Cynthia L.
reviews.review: Everything very good and reasonably priced. Staff and manager were attentive. The salad bar was fresh looking, the ceviche was good, and there was a good variety.  The meats were well seasoned and perfectly grilled.  Just one skewered bacon wrapped turkey medallions were overly salty, at least for my taste. Desert looked good, but no appetite for it.

reviews.name: Jen R.
reviews.review: Just ok. The concept is neat but none of the food is fantastic.  It's just barely tolerable.  I would only come back to attend a birthday outing. .. I'd be happier just going to Longhorn

reviews.name: Brennan W.
reviews.review: Honestly, I couldn't have been happier with the place. We made a reservation for a Monday night (which you totally don't need, by the way... I'm sure you would on a weekend), and arrived to be promptly seated. The staff, the food, the service, the atmosphere... Everything was wonderful. If you take it slow and try everything they offer, you'll end up with a two and a half hour dinner, a loosened belt, and a happy (although probably working-too-hard) heart. I felt buzzed without taking a sip of alcohol. THAT'S HOW MUCH MEAT I ATE. But really, It's not just the quantity of the food that's impressive. All of the meats are cooked to perfection, and with the exception of a few choices, I got seconds of every option. The grilled pineapple was honestly one of the most delicious things there. And that's saying something.

reviews.name: Trilce M.
reviews.review: My husband and I ate here once. We heard great things about and also my husband is a big meat eater so I decided to surprise him. I had to say that I love meat but it was too much for me, however, the salads were amazing! If u are not a big meat eater try the salad bar only, it is cheaper and so worth it. We had a great experience, the only reason why I did not give them 5 stars was the wait for or server. We made reservations and we got seated immediately but we had to wait 10 mins to be acknowledge by our server and if you are going with an empty stomach ready to eat all that food then it is not really nice. We were starving and nobody would acknowledge us. It was a little frustrating but then it got better.

reviews.name: Michael P.
reviews.review: Nothing better than endless meat on a stick...!!!  You better skip lunch (and breakfast) so you have room for all these meats...!!!

reviews.name: Doug R.
reviews.review: We enjoyed some of the finest cuisine and service at Rodizio's in Nashville, TN. The staff was calm and patient with newbies like us; explaining everything we needed to know. The Gauchos were pleasant, and served fine meats and grilled pineapple. Very few restaurants can garner this level of support from me, but in this case: Rodizio's nailed it! We'll go back anytime!

reviews.name: jacki R.
reviews.review: I have been to many Brazilian steak houses ,and this one is also one of good ones also

reviews.name: Dalan C.
reviews.review: Another business trip to Nashville, and another restaurant to try.  I have to say I've been to several Brazillian BBQ and this one is just ok compared to the others.I will say the decor is nice and modern, trendy, and open.Salad bar, eh compared to other rodizio's this was pretty scarce.Meats where standard choices with a few interesting things like rattle snake sausage.The beef items are where you want to be, they are cooked the best.  While the chicken was pretty dry.Of course grilled pineapple is a must.I will say that the food servers did come often and were very nice.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: I'll have you all know that I gave up meat for Lent and writing this review for Rodizio is bringing a tear to my eye.If you've never been to Rodizio, picture this: A festival of meat, where jolly Gauchos carry around spears of deliciousness with a sharp knife. Don't let this scare you, friends. These knives are the bringers of said deliciousness and with this comes a guaranteed happy tummy.Prepare to be served an array of meats from tri-tip steak (my fave!) to sausage to grilled fish (if you're lucky). I know this sounds like a smorgasbord on overload, but really? The entire experience is like a tasting and with the red/green table peg, you control the quantity, speed and everything else. (How does all that power feel?)Speaking of quantity, let's discuss the salad bar. I would have no qualms dragging my vegetarian BFFs down to 2nd Ave for these eats. This salad bar is no janky bed of greens! Instead, you can get everything from stroganoff, soups, caprese, fruit, cheese, quinoa... and yes, typical salads - caesar and strawberry fields, with BLT and edamame salads thrown in for good measure.Lastly, I'll add that the service we've received during our two visits are bar none! We're so smitten that we've even booked Rodizio for our rehearsal dinner. (Sneak a peek at their private event space in the back overlooking Riverfront Park and you'll understand why.)All that to say, GO. But only when you're hungry. Rodizio comes with a little bit of a price tag ($32.99 for the full Rodizio - unlimited apps, salad bar and rotisserie meats; $18.99 for unlimited salad bar), but trust me when I say: WORTH. IT.P.S. If you're there celebrating a birthday, do yourself a favor and let that secret slip to your server.

reviews.name: JC C.
reviews.review: Not near as good as Texas De Brazil inMemphis, but I might eat there again. Iwas there for wild game month and thefood was pretty good, but not exciting.It gets 4 stars because of Pineapple!!!

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: This is first review on this website, and I'm losing my Yelp-ginity to write an honest recommendation for this incredible restaurant.  Rodizio Grill has quickly become one of my favorite restaurants in town.  Yes, I'm serious.  I have been there twice now, and I have even reserved their amazing back room for my Rehearsal Dinner this Fall.Truth is, I'm currently residing far too high on the food chain to be a vegetarian.  That's why I love Rodizio - they are so well focused on meat, and in keeps on coming after you've eaten from their incredible salad bar.  The BLT  and edamame salads are my favorites.Not only is the food completely delicious, the staff goes out of their way to offer you great service.  It's like Mark Rosenthal and his staff are genuinely nice to you and to make sure you have everything you need until you say, "nao mais" by turing that ingenious little peg over to the red side telling them to stop bringing you food.The only bad thing I have to say about Rodizio is that the drinks I've ordered from the bar were rather light pours. No big deal - I'll just make it up with some more of that fantastic Maminha.  Mais por favor! Give this place a try.  Just make sure you are extra hungry when you get there, and prepare to loosen that belt when you leave.EDIT: Our Rehearsal Dinner was a smash hit!  Our guests are still talking about the amazing food and service they got from Rodizio.  The Stadium Room is one of the best downtown venues for hosting parties.

reviews.name: Marco W.
reviews.review: Fun new dining experience, great valet service!

reviews.name: Nicole W.
reviews.review: Very cool atmosphere and everything we are was great! Only got to try 4 different meats and they didn't bring meat as quickly as I had expected. Still good food though.

reviews.name: Diana V.
reviews.review: We went with a big party.  Maybe that is why my experience was not as good as the other reviews.  Ok, I am not Brazilian but I am from South America, so I expect some fried Yuca on the side, and the sweet plantains to be just the plantains without being breaded. Also the cheese bread, was made with a bitter cheese, that I am not used to, but not too bad but sadly small. I had only one bite because they never asked if we wanted more.The rotations of the cuts, were OK.  The start was chicken with super small portions, I understand that its suppose to rotate, but the waiters were always rushing, and not very polite. I had to request a clean plate multiple times. The meats were OK, I would say out of the 4,  one  was delicious, in the other hand the lamb was HORRIBLE! tasted like it was spoiled that I spitted it out We also  never saw the sausage or the beef we liked again, it was one rotation and it was gone!  It   The only WOW thing was the Pineapple.  When I asked the waiter what the steak was he would rush with the description, and go to the next person. Not a smile, or a questions if you like it rare or medium or well. I would have to say there was ONE server that was polite and the owner was overseeing the table. The salad bar was OK, there was a good selection, and seemed fresh. We also had to share the green, red thing they put on the table.  It didn't make sense, since the 4 of us that shared it ate at different pace, and liked our meats completely different cooked, which seemed a big challenged for them to provide a well done steak. I preferred mine medium rare but the other people at my table did not, so they probably tried 2 steaks, since all of them were cooked the same way. I was so sad to be disappointed, the word of mouth of this place was amazing, a couple of friends raved about it! If you are in downtown and want a heavy meal before going bar hopping this might be your place, but if not  then is NOT worth it after parking and the small rotations, I would have been more satisfied with a good piece of meat, instead of OK, small pieces. If you are trying to eat on a Brazilian steakhouse I would recommend Bombachas since it has the same idea, and the service is a little better, not the best but they do have free parking! Otherwise, maybe try Rodizio at its lunch hour, they might be less busy and provide better selection and service.

reviews.name: Lisa O.
reviews.review: Oh my goodness this place is fantastic. Staff was very personable. We walked to the restaurant from the piano bar on broadway so convenient when in the area. Love Love Love.

reviews.name: Russell M.
reviews.review: Wow! Is all you can say. The food is outstanding. I brought a friend from Brazil and he agreed on the place. Of course the options are to many and the quality of the meats are great. Lucky for me he could tell me what ever thing was. Again this is something you have to try.

reviews.name: Allie U.
reviews.review: So good! Not a traditional menu place and I normally like to order my own meal but it is a sort if eat "all you can eat buffet" but it is so much better then any what you think of when you think of buffets... I already want to bring my brothers here

reviews.name: Marie E.
reviews.review: By far my new favorite restaurant in Nashville.  I wish I could score it 6 stars! The service was on point.  Very good, especially for a new restaurant open.  Typically new restaurants are working on kinks and sometimes the staff seems confused, but not here. We were seated immediately.  The server Jason, we very friendly and informative about the restaurant style. The gauchos were prompt and attentive. Great personalities, not to mention they were HOT! The owner and manager stopped by our table which is always a nice touch.  Parking was a convienent $10 valet right in front of the restaurant.  NO PARKING GARAGE FOR ME THANK GOD! Even the valet attendants were very hospitable. The salad bar was sooooo fresh. The couve was my favorite, and the strawberry fields salad was great.  I also loved the fresh mozzerella and proscruitto.  Yummy.The meat cuts were perfectly seasoned.  The variety just did not seem to stop.  The parmesean crusted sirloin was the best!  I could not get enough.  Certainly a great place for a date or group.  But surprisingly kid friendly enough (if you have well mannered children).  My 4 year old loved it!  He is very picky eater, but the meat was tender enough that my 4 year old's little teeth could really eat beef for the first time.  He loved all the beef. I could not believe that he really liked the food.  Normally I have to force him to eat!  It was his dad's birthday and he did a little birthday dance with the staff and the drum.  All the staff high fived him and complimented his dancing.  He was so proud of himself.  It was too cute!  He'll remember that.  We will too.Can't wait for more memory makers at Rodizio!

reviews.name: Shawn K.
reviews.review: This is one of the best places I have ever eaten.  The service was great the food was awesome!  They kept up on bringing the meats around.  I've never seen a salad bar with the options they had.  Very cool!  I can't wait to try this again.  My first time eating at this type of restaurant, and wish I would have know of it years ago!

reviews.name: Dennis M.
reviews.review: Last night in Nashville after a great week and wanted to enjoy a nice evening. CMA week is getting started so lots of people getting in. I had got online for reservations which is very convenient. We were seated and greeted shortly after by the manager. She was very sweet and you could tell she was on top of things. We started off with very nice appetizers of polenta fried and very crisp on the outside with soft middle as well as fried plantains. All were very good. The salad bar was very nice and we tried a tasting of each item. Then we got started with the third course which was the meat. I have been to various Churrascuria's in Queretaro Mexico that were top notch and this one had different varieties of chicken along with sausage, lamb, beef and pork. They do not serve tenderloin but for the price of $68.00 for two people that is not bad at all. In Mexico the pineapples were coated in cinnamon and roasted which were out of this world. Here they are just slightly roasted and carved. Still very good and sweet. The ambience is very nice and the staff are very prompt. The dessert tray is very nice and you must try one as well. When all said and done, we had a wonderful evening for a Ben Franklin. I had to knock off one star for not having tenderloin.....

reviews.name: M C.
reviews.review: I have never been to a Brazilian steakhouse and it was an awesome experience.  The staff was attentive and friendly.  The appetizers were yummy and the meat selection was all delicious.  I loved the ham and pineapple while my husband preferred the salt and pepper sirloin, but it was all really good.  I can't wait to come back!

reviews.name: Catherine D.
reviews.review: Salad bar is plentiful and diverse. Wide range of delicious, succulent meat. I love it, but couldn't go here too often as I would be as big as a house. Come hungry. Staff was polite and attentive, but at times a bit overzealous about removing plates.Wild boar was my favourite, closely followed by the bacon wrapped turkey.

reviews.name: Gina L.
reviews.review: 1st time at this Brazilian Restaurant.  Wow we had top notch service, and the food was out of this world.  Total thumbs up. If you are ever in Nashville this is a must stop, you won't be disapointed!!

reviews.name: Kate E.
reviews.review: I took my husband out to Rodizio Grill last night to celebrate his birthday. He is a big meat lover and Rodizio did not disappoint! I read a few reviews on Yelp where people complained that the meat did not come around fast enough. We had quite the opposite experience- We were presented with a different meat option at our table every 1-2 minutes. Things moved along so quickly that I could hardly finish a bite before saying "yes" to another selection (not complaining). We were extremely pleased with the variety as well- anything from fish to chicken hearts to sirloin. I think in all we counted 13 different options, and I'm not even positive we sampled all there was to sample.I was most impressed by the salad bar. It was a great mix of both hot and cold items and offered a good amount of things I had never tried before. Actually if I go back to this restaurant, I will likely only get the salad bar instead of the full Rodizio- not because I didn't enjoy the meats but because there was so much on the salad bar I didn't get to try because I got too full. My only complaint about the evening is that it was not made clear to us at all that dessert was an additional cost (and I'll take the blame for not doing my research online beforehand). However, were just casually told to let our server know when we were ready for dessert, leading us to think it was included with the full Rodizio. My husband and I both ordered desserts, which were also very good, but we were so full that we each only had 3 bites of it before pushing it to the side. Needless to say I was a little miffed when I had an additional $14 tacked on my bill for something we barely touched. Live and learn. On a positive note, aside from this miscommunication, our service was outstanding! I never had to ask for a clean plate or a drink refill. Overall I am giving the experience a 4. Was it the best food you can find in Nashville? No. But if you're looking for a place that's different with a good atmosphere, vast variety, and quality food, this will absolutely meet your standards. We will be going back.

reviews.name: Mark B.
reviews.review: Brazilian steakhouse, type A. Most of the meats were tasty and presented well. The salad bar is nothing to rave about. Basically an overgrown Ruby Tuesday bar. But, who really cares? Right?What killed it for me was the lack of training in the server corps. The guy serving the brisket got a little perturbed when I stopped him from pouring any more brisket juice on our party from his serving spoon. Our primary server, while a very polite young man, was never shown how to cut the foil on a bottle of wine or to twist the bottle at the end of the pour. Wine on table and mangled bottle = not cool. The above mistakes would usually just knock off one star from my rating. What destroyed the 2nd star was the "happy birthday drum line". That's right...drum line. One person with a small drum and another with a tambourine  cadence out from the kitchen followed by the other, embarrassed servers. You know the rest of the story. This happened at least 4 times during our meal.  Shouting across the table = not cool.

reviews.name: Mjg Y.
reviews.review: Rodizio is a good Brazillian Steakhouse. Like others have said, compared to Fogo de Chao its probably second in line.  Their salad bar was a bit smaller in size but bigger in flavor than most. We loved their selections. The appetizer selections were slightly different than every other B. Steakhouse though. The cheese puffs were smaller and drier, and their plantains were actually deep fried bananas, which I didn't find as appealing.  They have a very wide meat selection, as well as a pot roast, pineapple and even chicken hearts (no thanks).  I think their price for dinner is also competetive, even cheaper than other B steakhouses.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.review: Visited Rodizio for the first time last night with my lovely wife to celebrate my birthday and it was absolutely great. We'd heard lots of great things about it both online and from friends and co-workers. When I saw that they served all you can eat meat, I made our reservation! When we arrived, we took advantage of their valet parking service ($7) and went straight in and to our seats. Luckily, we were right by the window and got to people watch as we ate. We were also right by the spacious bar which happened to be empty so I got to sneak a few peeks at the football game on the two TVs they had going. The whole place was decorated nicely and had dark but not too dark lighting, which I personally really like. Our waitress was very informative, nice, and helpful, giving us plenty of information since we'd never been there before. The appetizers we were served consisted of a cinnamon banana treat which was different and also a cheese puff thingy and polenta with parmesan. We liked the cheese the best. The salad bar was fantastic! Could have easily made a meal off of just that. Very wide variety of not so ordinary salads (my favorite was the shrimp pasta and my wife liked the spicy chicken). They also had some cheeses, breads, and meat (bacon, pastrami) as well as some soups, vegetables, and rice dishes. I lost count of how many types of meat we were served but we enjoyed all of them except maybe the chicken hearts which we really only tried to say we'd done it. My favorite was the garlic steak and she loved the garlic chicken. After we stuffed ourselves to the max, we decided to have dessert ANYWAY. Several options were available but we chose a sweet pastry with some ice cream and caramel drizzled on it. Again, I missed the name but it was very rich and delicious. We were very impressed with the atmosphere, quality of food, and very good service. We ended up spending right around $100 for the two of us but we did have a couple of drinks. We'll definitely come back again and highly recommend it to anyone for a change of pace from the ordinary "steakhouse" dining out option.

reviews.name: Manuel C.
reviews.review: I have Been to other braZilians steak house in Houston and Chicago and I'm so glad we have this now in Nashville I don't have to wait to go out of town to enjoy Brazilian food, the ambience in the restaurant is great and the food is outstanding!! I recommend this restaurant for dates and friends try the guava or the papaya mouse dessert :)

reviews.name: Michael S.
reviews.review: Went to Rodizio for lunch and it didn't disappoint. Not your daily lunch place but for a good celebration with some co-workers definitely recommended. I wouldn't bring a date if your looking for a place to go out... Definitely a mans mealYou will leave full of delicious cuts of meat (Chicken, pork, steak, and roasts) and a delightful salad bar with plenty of options. All this for under $24Note: Don't eat the chicken heart without putting the lime juice on it first!

reviews.name: Linda C.
reviews.review: We were  here last week  in Nashville.Tips:Nashville is known for 4 kinds of food--hot chicken, hot fish, BBQ and meats and 3 vegetables.Being that it was 98 degrees with very high humidity, I was limited to places  that was near my hotel.If the weather was cool. I would have gone to Monell and Arnold--both Nashville institutions for meats and 3. Please read their reviews if you ever go to Nashville.We had the lunch Full Rodizio for $17.99 a person.The Full Rodizio is a variety of rotisserie grilled meats, glazed pineapple, a gourmet salad bar and  authentic Brazilian appetizers.We started with the 3 appetizers of banana frita, polenta and pao de queijo, a Brazilian cheese bread made of yucca and cheese. All were tasty and unlimited .We only had a half piece of each.We had fruit salad, potato salad ,chicken salad, strawberry salad, hearts of palm, turkey pastrami ,and shrimp salad. We went easy on the salad bar. We each had about a quarter of  a tablespoon of each item. Needless to say there were more items in the salad bar that we did not take. We also try the hot dishes from the salad bar--Brazilian black bean stew, collard greens with bacon, beef strogonoff and the heart of palm soup.Then the fun begins. Each table is given a wooden peg that is colored green, red and yellow. Green means YOU WANT MEATS. Red is STOP. Yellow is I WANT DESERT.We had the tri tip sirloin, top sirloin, beef center cut, brisket, pork sausage, pork loin, sweet & spicy chicken, chicken hearts, marinated chicken, glazed pineapple, and grilled tomato.We had multiple servings of the beef only.We each had a Coke and the Rodizio limeade.We went back to get more fruit  salad and did not have room for desert. They have some pretty items.I am taking away a star because the meats were all SALTY. We each had 4 glasses of water to wash down the meat.The gauchos were the friendliest and once they saw that we were only eating the beef, they went out of their way to keep bringing us BEEF.A great dining experience at only $17.99.

reviews.name: Zack S.
reviews.review: Compared to other Brazilian restaurants (Fogo de Chão, Texas de Brazil) the price was actually decent, but it was immediately evident why. The salad bar was decent but lacking, the meat selection was on par with the above mentioned restaurants but the preparation was poor, and the service was terrible. Don't get me wrong, the staff wasn't necessarily rude (although they did bypass our table multiple times, only to return with either no meat or a poor cut), the problem was in their not knowing how to properly cut and serve the meat. The picanha, which is supposed to be cut so as to have a layer of fat on top, was being cut from the side with the fat being left off, which left half of what makes picanha so tasty missing from your plate. And to make matters worse, we were never once asked how we liked our meat cooked. All in all, it could have been worse, but then again it could have been much, much better. We won't be going back. Do yourself a favor and try Fogo de Chão. The price is a bit higher, but once you're seated it is immediately evident why.

reviews.name: Babe M.
reviews.review: This was my first time eating at Rodizio's, but I am no stranger to Brazilian Steakhouse's. I frequented the now closed Bombasha that was located at 21st and Belcourt and mom and pop joint's in Philadelphia. Rodizio's first course consisted of fried bananas, cheese rolls and fried polenta sticks. All three of these dishes were quite delectable. There was a nice selection of salads, cheese's and anti pasta on the cold bar. This was the biggest selection of a second course offering I've encountered thus far. The main course, the meats, consisted of about 13 cuts ranging from Picanha to chicken hearts. There was also roasted tomatoes with a Parmesan crust as well as the always succulent grilled pineapple. As my lovely girlfriend pointed out some of the meats were a little over cooked and dry. Especially her favorite, lamb! We absolutely adored the lamb at Bombasha. Over all service was great and the Goucho's were friendly, polite and funny! Next time, were coming back for the weekend brunch!

reviews.name: Fatwomancatty '.
reviews.review: So my girlfriends and I went to Nashville for my friends bachelorette party and we went to Rodizio on the first day. Our first trip there? AMAZING. We had excellent service and all the gauchos were really friendly and nice. The next day came along and we were going to go to Hard Rock Cafe but we had such an amazing experience at Rodizio's we went back for lunch. Now what we didn't know was the price change on the weekends but it was whatever. Our second time there was not so great.. We were hoping for the amazing experience we had received the day before. But our visit was ruined by ONE gaucho. He was disrespectful and rude. He stared us down and made the atmosphere feel really awkward. I know what you're thinking, your visit was ruined by ONE person? But really, if you were there, you would get mad too. All the other gauchos recognized us from the day before and was really nice to us and amazing but this one person, I will not name who, needs to be trained on how to treat customers better. But besides that one rude gaucho, everyone was AMAZING and the FOOD was AMAZING and I will definitely be going back for another visit! Thank you for the amazing experience!! Rodizio's is a restaurant you will not regret going to!!

reviews.name: Jen B.
reviews.review: We came here for dinner last night. The service is always very good, however, the quality of the meat has declined significantly. It's too bad, because the gauchos and waitstaff are all very professional.  Unfortunately, not nearly as good in terms of the food. We left disappointed.

reviews.name: Franklin P.
reviews.review: I am going to be completely honest.  I was very skeptical at first because not too many Brazilian Steak Houses have stayed in Nashville for too long.  But this place was amazing!  First off, the interior is beautiful with a modern feel.  Second, the food was off the chart and the service was amazing.  My favorite thing to eat was either the sirloin or the hot chicken.  Both were great.  The Salad bar also did not disappoint .  Everything was fresh, so vegetarians would also like this place.  They even had fish that they were bringing around.  I would highly recommend this to couples and families.  My wife really liked the Sangria!  Good job to Rodizio.  We will be coming back again and again.Oh!  I almost forgot!  Valet parking is the icing on the cake :)

reviews.name: Matt W.
reviews.review: Great food comes to you hot off the grill. The servers are great very polite and kind if you don't want what they brought to the table just ask them for the item and someone will bring it over. They have 16 different selections of food to include fish, chicken, turkey, pork, ham, tried tip steak, and potroast. Did I mention half of those are wrapped in bacon....Then you have the salad bar all you can eat alone with the appitizers. The salad bar was always fresh with a huge selection.

reviews.name: Vanessa P.
reviews.review: I was really excited to take my carnivorous husband here for his birthday dinner. He mentioned recently that he would like to eat at a brazilian steakhouse soon so timing was perfect. He has eaten at a brazilian steakhouse in NYC for $90pp and I've eaten at one in Atlanta for $65pp. Rodizio offered a deal in comparison at about $35pp, or so I thought. Service was ok. Salad bar was ok. Drinks were good (first caipirinha I've had in Nashville). Apps were ok.MEAT. WAS. BAD. No flavor, bland, blah, bulk meat. Bleh. Considering this restaurant focuses on meat, it should be good. It was not. I guess I should have figured - the price was too low and it is in the touristy area. Save your $$ and go have a good steak at another spot in town - it will be much more worth it.

reviews.name: Angela Z.
reviews.review: My sweet carnivorous husband loves Brazilian Steakhouses.  We've been to the ones iin Memphis and Atlanta and were excited to see that Nashville now has one.  I'm not a huge meat eater, so I had only the salad bar, but it was really good.  My hubby had the full experience and gave it two thumbs up.  Service was superb.

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: I was with a group and used the yelp reservation app.  Everything about this experience was positive.  Most impressive was the Management who could be seen taking an active role in making sure all our needs were met.  The food, drinks and service were among the best I have encountered.

reviews.name: Wendy S.
reviews.review: If you are looking for great food, and lots of meat varieties this the place, we had a great experience sort of different meats styles like steak, pork, chicken, frog legs, rattle snake etc... I really enjoyed the beef and I do ask for well done and they nicely gave me that part... Staff is really friendly and as soon as we place our table little thing green... Meat didn't stop coming that to eat slowly we had to turn it red or stop for a little bit... The grill pineapple was amazing that was my favorite thing... Bar salad was good nothing crazy... Overall it's a place for meat lovers.. I totally recommend it

reviews.name: Tifanny E.
reviews.review: Sometimes there comes a place and a time that goes beyond anything you expect and wows you. This is that place. This place executes, service, food, excellence, quality, and class all at the same time. It's a set price but believe me you get what you pay for. Don't be mad about the price. You are getting quality food. If you've ever eaten a meal at Whole Foods and know the feeling  you get when you've just finished a fresh and organic meal...well this place does the same. It leaves you feeling refreshed and overwhelmed with satisfaction. Great for a date or a family gathering. I absolutely would recommend this to anyone in search of a fantastic meal experience. I stayed 3 hours enjoying every part of my meal in peace and in no rush. What a place!

reviews.name: Gene S.
reviews.review: Very good restaurant! I stuck with the steak and salad bar. I say no to the filet minion here because filet needs to be MR and the when bacon wrapped and small the filet was more like a boiled piece of meat wrapped in a slimy piece of bacon. Garlic beef was outstanding and the staff brought me new sauces to sample. Great service.

reviews.name: Ben F.
reviews.review: I've been here twice within the same month. My wife is gluten free and all of the meat items including the sausage are gluten free and most of the items on the salad bar as well. Most the meats were seasoned well, I had a few that I felt were overcooked, but I simply requested for a medium rare one and they presented it to me a few minutes later. Service was excellent and the ambiance is what you would expect in a steakhouse - oaky dark colors. The meat variety was adequate, it lacked prime rib or filet, but at $32 all you can eat, it's much cheaper than Fogo. I would certainly return again. You are better off going with valet parking than paying the overpriced parking in downtown Nashville..

reviews.name: Estefania A.
reviews.review: After going to the other Brazilian steakhouse in Nashville, I was hesitant about whether this place would be any good or not. I was pleasantly surprised by many aspects of Rodizio Grill- the attentive service, the large salad bar with something for everyone, and the properly cooked meat. The only reason they lose a star is because the meat was a little slow coming around, but the manager noticed this and started coming around with meat himself. When I went they had recently opened, so hopefully that was just a kink that they've worked out. Either way, this is a great restaurant for a special occasion, with or without a crowd. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.name: Kelley O.
reviews.review: Love love loved this place! Atmosphere was warm , cozy, yet modern. Traditional Brazilian steak house.  The management and staff bent over backwards to accommodate me being gluten and dairy free.  This is a gluten free HEAVEN... They use gluten free I foredunes for appetizers that usually have gluten and they do the same for desserts!!! I just had to go dairy free and all apps and desserts have dairy so I wasn't able to indulge but oh how I would have if I was only gluten free.  The manager went out off his way to check the dairy content if the meats etc.... I walked away stuffed and happy with so many delicious choices.I highly recommend for anyone, but especially food allergy/sensitivity individuals.  I would go back in a heartbeat!!!

reviews.name: Dougie W.
reviews.review: Amazing Service.  Had a great time there.  Would highly recommend it to anyone.  It was my first experience at a brazilian steakhouse and this one here will make me come back.  Left stuffed.

reviews.name: Chris K.
reviews.review: Definitely recommend this place to people that love to eat good cuts of quality meat. Have eaten at a few Brazilian Steakhouses and very happy to have one in Nashville now. Would love it even more if they added lambchops to there selection as that's always been a favorite at others but good either way. One concern was that the floors were slippery and my pregnant wife almost fell a couple of times but will be returning for sure...

reviews.name: Frank B.
reviews.review: Took the wife for our anniversary ! She enjoyed herself and I ate like a pig! i will be back to get my grub on and again and again and again!

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: Wow was that place good. All the meats and sides were incredible.  Plus you can eat all you want.  The service was top notch.  I will definitely go back again.

reviews.name: JD W.
reviews.review: Come hungry! For $30, you will get to try around 14 different grilled and seasoned meats. Modern, large, hip atmosphere. Servers are constantly moving around the dining room with their large skewer of a type of meat, our favorite was the Parmesan beef. You can pass on whichever meat you don't want, or they'll slice you off a portion right in front of you. There is a large appetizer area that is self serve and includes items like rice, soup, cucumber salad, ceviche, edamame salad, etc. Some unique, warm breads were brought to us upon first greeting and those were delicious as well. This is a great date spot or for large groups.

reviews.name: Fred R.
reviews.review: Service was great!  Food was fantastic!  The best was turkey wrapped in bacon!  If you have not dined in yet ... what are you waiting for?  You'll be glad you did!!!

reviews.name: Dan J.
reviews.review: Great place to have a special night out. Traditional chuscarria,the meats are served hot off the grill. Plenty of choices from their premium salad bar. Been to one in Brazil. Other than the mostly Caucasian gauchos, it brought me back to that place and time.

reviews.name: Kristina C.
reviews.review: What a great addition to Nashville's restaurant repertoire!! We love trying new restaurants and eating great food. We weren't disappointed. If you like meat, you will love this place. The service from our server and the gauchos serving the food was impeccable. The salad bar was great, though as some have mentioned smaller than some of the other Rodizio Grills. They made up for it with the excellent selection of items there from fresh mozzarella tomato salad to a fantastic strawberry spring mix salad, there is something for everyone!! All you can eat appetizers, salad bar and meats all for $32.99. It was a massive amount of food so make sure you are hungry;) We went with another couple and it was a fantastic time! We will definitely be back!!!

reviews.name: Carol W.
reviews.review: We LOVED Rodizio Grill! Great food and great service. The salad bar had many choices and we all found things we liked, even our picky 6 year old. He loved the mac and cheese as well as my 18 year old daughter and my husband loved the mashed potatoes. Great selection of salads. We were impressed with the quality of meat and the variety - it was all seasoned and cooked perfectly. We were even asked if we had any special requests. We will definitely go back.

reviews.name: Randy S.
reviews.review: My favorite Brazilian restaurant so far. Small franchise. April is wild game month. Had rattlesnake sausage and antelope. Missed the boar, but all meat was great. Cheveche on the salad bar was a pleasant surprise. Will definitely come back next time in Nashville. (Noticed a Rodizio in Pensacola but was not able to give it a try this time.)

reviews.name: Er'yn K.
reviews.review: Loved it the meat was good and i friggin love that pineapple our waitress Amanda was really nice!! And our meat serves were funny and helpful. Totally coming back.

reviews.name: Nina D.
reviews.review: Went to Rodizio for my boyfriend's birthday. We thought we would be treated as nothing special but the service really made the night and my boyfriends felt very taken care of for his birthday.

reviews.name: karla m.
reviews.review: Went for dinner and had a great time.  The food is great and there is an energy to the place that is just fun.  Like that you have one gaucho that serves you so he makes sure you get to try all the different items off the grill.  One tip- make a reservation to avoid a 45 to 1 hour wait on a weekend night.Two thumbs up for sure!

reviews.name: Ian M.
reviews.review: Wow! I love this place! My wife and I just had dinner here. We tend to hit up any brazilian steak house that we come across in our travels so we can say Rodizio has the best salad and appetizer bar of any place we have been so far. Their meats are excellent and their salt/seasoning has so much flavor. You should definitely give them a try!

reviews.name: Mark B.
reviews.review: Nine of us had dinner last night at the Rodizio Grill in Nashville. Overall the experience was nice, but the food was good, not great. They have an expansive salad bar which was pleasant to the eye and had a nice selection which included palm hearts, marinated mushrooms, and asparagus.I would give the salad bar a 4. The rotation of meats was good and included chicken, spicy chicken, white fish,steaks (3 kinds), pork loin, and lamb. You could select your specific wellness (rare to well) for each cut, but the rare cuts were sometimes hard to find. The serving staff did attempt to please, and continued to bring back additional cuts. While tasty, the meats lacked depth and full flavor. That being said, for the inclusive price of $32.95/pp for salad, appetizer and meat selection the offering was a great value. The waiters, serving staff and cooks were very nice and attentive. I would return, but ask that the kitchen add some depth to the seasonings and possibly marinate some of the cuts. Nice addition to the Nashville food scene, but they need to raise the bar.

reviews.name: Daniel J.
reviews.review: We had a fantastic experience on a busy Saturday night. The full Rodizio was fabulous - we especially loved the garlic tender and the lamb. I could skip the chicken hearts next time, but I'm glad I tried them!Rodizio is a great spot - I strongly recommend you use the valet on a busy weekend night. Beers and wine are very reasonably priced and I think the $33 price tag per person is VERY reasonable considering the endless portions of meat. The meat carvers were all very helpful. Our server seemed overwhelmed at times and she was slow to bring more wine... But all in all it was a great night.

reviews.name: Tony Z.
reviews.review: This is a fun place for family birthdays, provided everyone is hungry for lots of meat.  The salad bar is excellent as well.  The atmosphere is festive, but loud.

reviews.name: Mattie W.
reviews.review: By far the worse restaurant!!! Meat was dry, cold and no taste! The hot food at the salad bar was cold, I couldn't believe they use the small burners to keep the hot food at the salad bar warm not hot...Ruby Tuesday's has a better salad bar than this place. We were extremely disappointed waited almost two months for this place to open and it was awful from beginning to end; the server was rude and she didn't know anything about the cuts of meat served, when we asked she said "you will have to wait until the rotation of meats comes around to ask any questions"... I couldn't believe this place didn't even have a decent grill! Whoever has been to Fogo De Chao will know what I'm talking about, I would rather  drive to Atlanta to eat at Fogo De Chao than come back to this place...

reviews.name: Katrina D.
reviews.review: Bring a big appetite to Rodizio!  I am not a big meat eater but I had many options to choose from on the cold salad bar.  The Quinoa salad was fantastic!!   The location on 2nd ave in downtown Nashville is very convenient and the valet parking makes the experience effortless.  My family loved the grilled meat options and are already planning their return!

reviews.name: Keith B.
reviews.review: Last night was my first visit to Radizio and overall the food was GREAT.  I couldn't say the same about the service.  We had a table of six and we waited for drinks, had to ask about the very small appetizers and the rotation of meat servers were slow.  I think the meat servers were told to give small portion cuts because we got a bite or to and then waited several minutes for the next server of meat.  In other type of restaurants like this I've never had wait this long for the meat servers.  I would blame the service on this being a new restaurant but we met the owner which is also the owner of another successful Nashville restaurant, so I don't think they have the server/customer ratio at a good level yet.  It's a pricey meal, so you expect good service to go along with the great food.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: We went to Rodizio's because my husband is a big meat fan even though I am not.  Not only did the grill meet my husband's expectations, but the salad bar was awesome.  I can't wait to go back and take the rest of the family!  Service was excellent.  Be sure to get a dessert!

reviews.name: David R.
reviews.review: Come on Sunday for the blues jam! Food and drink are all excellent.The staff is friendly and knows their customers. And seriously, the guys that host the blues jam are some of the nicest and most welcoming folks around.Whether you're a musician looking to build some skills, or just a music lover who wants to hear some amazing talent, you should make Twin Kegs II a regular haunt.

reviews.name: Cory G.
reviews.review: This is what a dive bar should be. Tucked away 1/4 mile off of Fesslers lane this place is good stuff. Great beer on draft. Great deals. Awesome Burger. Twin Kegs knows how to do the dive bar right with great things planned like karaoke, poker night, live music, and more. The place is different than the other bar off of Thompson lane, but still lives up to the goodness that is Twin Kegs. Good food and beer always make me happy. Cheers.

reviews.name: Rob B.
reviews.review: A dive bar made for Movies. Great karaoke on Fridays. Such a fun time we closed the place down. No kitchen just grease trap snacks but that's awesome too. It is a rough area of town and it did get rough inside once with a slight issue between two guys. I say just keep singing and let the fools fight.

reviews.name: Heidel P.
reviews.review: Time stops when you're here. Great karaoke. If your visiting Nashville, stop by, sing a song.

reviews.name: M M.
reviews.review: We decided on this restaurant for the many vegetarian choices and were not disappointed. I had spicy jerk soy. It was delicious and just spicy enough to not overpower the flavors. The Jamaican rice was a nice compliment to the jerk soy. My husband got a spinach and cheese pie that had a light and flaky crust and a well-seasoned filling. We both had plantains-cooked to a perfect tenderness and sweetness. The Johnny cakes are a fried delight and the pineapple ginger juice is so dreamy. The staff was very friendly as well.

reviews.name: Tara K.
reviews.review: I came here and had the goat curry with rice and cabbage.The goat curry was so-so. To be honest, I felt like it lacked some spice or freshness. Something. The rice was also so-so. I love rice, so when rice doesn't taste fresh, I am not impressed with the rest.  I would probably give it a shot down the road, after I have tried all the other merchants at the Farmer's Market, but I voted this place a 3 due to inconsistency or my mediocre experience.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: I ventured out from my usual lunch go-tos at the Farmer's Market to give Jamaicaway a try today *pats self on back.* Guy Fieri creepily looked down at me from his signed DD&D poster and stamp on the wall approving of my choice. Most people in line seemed like repeat customers and knew exactly what was what and what they wanted - I was the loser who had to ask for a tutorial. Woops.  The line was a decent length, but moved quickly. I went with the mild jerk chicken (spice wimp here), yellow rice and fried plantains. Around $10 for that and a drink. The mild jerk is boneless, but the spicy appeared to have bones. Everything was good and very flavorful, but I'll branch out a little more with my sides next time. The greens also looked amazing and a jonny cake or patty would have been a good addition to my plate of mushy (in a good way) food.  Others looked like they had 2 sides and a jonny cake, so maybe I just got overlooked on that one?The atmosphere is nothing fancy, just a few tables and worn booths, but it does have it's own separate seating area away from the cafeteria-style open space used by the rest of the restaurants there.

reviews.name: Jason D.
reviews.review: This is a great little place. The ladies behind the counter are so cute and friendly. Very helpful and actually appear to enjoy their job. The line is fast but they don't rush you. The employees are worth the visit alone. I liked the smiles. I had the spicy jerked chicken. It taste better than the jerk chicken I had in Jamaica. The meat was very tender and the jerk sauce was delicious. The rice and beans were really good and was better with the jerk sauce on it. Cheese mashed potatoes were not that good. Overall a great lunch, quick and filling. Now go find a place to nap!

reviews.name: Tim S.
reviews.review: This place has promise, and I will be back to try more of the menu.  The sides were what really had me going this visit, the collard greens and brown rice (had some sort of spiced gravy going on in it) were awesome.  The spicy jerk chicken was decent, but not spicy and contained a lot of tiny sharp bones.  I love that they have multiple ginger drinks, including some very respectable ginger beer.  The interior is perhaps a bit too authentic Jamaican, all the way down to the torn up booth cushions :-)So the first visit was a bit hit and miss, but as I said I will be back.

reviews.name: Brett B.
reviews.review: Met family there for a Sunday lunch had the Curry Goat in a green curry sauce fall off the bone tender with steamed cabbage and yellow rice, all together we had 3 meals meat 2 veg and bottled water for under $20 can't beat that

reviews.name: Robert D.
reviews.review: I think this place is a terrific lunch option in the farmer's market. My curry chicken was cooked to perfection: fall off the bone, yet still moist. It paired beautifully with my cheesy mashed potatoes, greens and johnny cake, all (with drink) for just over $10. I will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Jonas S.
reviews.review: The food was fresh, hot and delicious. I loved it. A great taste of the Caribbean. If you're in Nashville passing through or visiting, I highly recommend this place.

reviews.name: Jennifer H.
reviews.review: The food reminded me the time when my friend and I went to Jamaica. Although I never had Jamaican ox tail, the adventure side of me tells me I should give it a try. Well I'm glad that I did. The ox tail was tender and nicely seasoned. My boyfriend had spicy jerk chicken, even though it's not spicy, he enjoys the dish. Their side dishes were excellent too. I had the steam cabbage w Jamaican rice. Not only they have delicious food, the have wide range of drinks from Jamaica. We had the carrot mango and tropical fruit punch. The juices are very good, not too sweet. The overall atmosphere, is very relaxing and the staffs are very friendly. They serve you w a smile and help you with whatever you need.

reviews.name: Alexandra F.
reviews.review: WOW. I don't even know where to begin. I went here for lunch and I was the only one in the building. The atmosphere here is cool. Awesome music and definitely somewhere cool to have a date or nice dinner.Peach tea to start me off was great. I also noticed they have natural fruit juice. Can't wait to try those another time. I order the spicy jerk chicken with yellow rice and plantains. She also brought me out some extra spicy sauce. I have no idea what exactly it was made from, but it was tasty. I have no idea how I ate all of this food. I went for lunch, but it was actually technically dinner so the portions were bigger. My eyes lit up when the food came out. I dove right into the chicken, dismantling it in search of juicy white meat. The server had asked me if I preferred light or dark meat. I said light and that's exactly what I got! I HATE pulling meat off bones, but this was SO WORTH IT.The meat was so tender it pulled right off. The yellow rice was SO GOOD. She had told me it was jasmine rice. I love it. I had never had that before. Mind you this is my first time eating Jamaican food. The plantains were the best I've ever had. I would grab chicken, sauce, a little rice. Have a bite. Eat a plantain. Repeat. Everything tasted so good. Another peach tea and I was finished. Jamaicaheaven seems like a more appropriate name. Maybe they'll consider changing it.

reviews.name: Tresa P.
reviews.review: Very subpar food. The rice and peas were bland. The cabbage was just okay. The sauce on the oxtails was terrible. I literally scowled when I took the first bite. I had to wipe it off with a napkin in order to eat them. Several of the bones were just fat and no meat. I was very disappointed since I was really craving good Jamaican food. Maybe that doesn't exist in Nashville. I wouldn't come back and wouldn't recommend it, I wasted $13 and a cheat meal. The music was good and the service wasn't much to write home about either. Try again Jamaicaway.

reviews.name: Celeste S.
reviews.review: Everything was fabulous! I had the mild jerk chicken, green beans, mashed potatoes,  beef patty, and herbal tea.... All of that for just $11! The customer device was great also. Really great place to grab some excellent food!

reviews.name: Christina D.
reviews.review: So amazingly good! They even allow you to try anything before you order it!  So many vegetarian options and delicious sides. I couldn't be more excited to eat here again. Don't let this farmers market restaurant fool you, it's authentic and fresh! You know it's good when the workers are Jamaican! Love the different sodas and desserts too!

reviews.name: Ashley T.
reviews.review: Where do I even start?! Stopped by around 4:40pm today to grab some food to go (they close at 5). I've had JW bookmarked for a while now based on good reviews and a sheer curiosity of never having had Jamaican food before. The guy working was so friendly and let me try every vegetarian entree they had out. OMG. I seriously had the toughest time choosing just one! I tried the spicy jerk soy, bbq soy, curry tofu, and another soy dish that tasted coconut-y. All SO good. I chose the spicy jerk soy, steamed cabbage, and he was nice enough to make me fried plantains. He told me the Jonny cakes were gone for the day but gave me cornbread and told me to ask for the Jonny cake next time. Literally everything was full of flavor and delicious. Spicy jerk soy was spicy but not too spicy. And for a decent sized portion of food, it only set me back $8.65 before tip. I will definitely be back (maybe tomorrow, sue me) to try other sides (which he said were all vegan -excluding the cheesy mashed potatoes I'm assuming), chow down on a full portion of another veggie entree, and try the Jonny cake. Friendly service, great food, reasonable prices!

reviews.name: Tanya H.
reviews.review: Jerk gluten was a little to spicy, even eating it with my Johnny cake it was still to spicy, plantains and sweet potato was good. Herbal peach tea was great!

reviews.name: Annie L.
reviews.review: I visited here upon seeing it on DDD (diners, drive-in, and dives) on Food Network. I don't always follow the Food Network trail, but I remembered this restaurant in particular was in Nashville, and we were headed to Nashville for the Fourth of July holiday weekend sooooo why not give it a try? After having Jamaican food in Athens, GA at Kelly's Jamaican Foods---I've been addicted to that jerk chicken.Jamaicaway food is good, but not amazing. It's a bit overpriced in my opinion.
