I got the jerk chicken which was NOT spicy but was moist for the white meat. Cabbage lacked flavor. And the corn bread was extremely dry. It was good to dip in the jerk chicken sauce though. I did try the Johnny roll and wish I had ordered that over the cornbread. Butttttt I gotta stay true to my stomach. If you are truly looking for good jerk chicken that's spicy and full of flavor, bomb dot comb cabbage, and amazing cornbread---next time you are in GEORGIA try visiting Kelly's Jamaican Foods. YOU WONT REGRET IT. Jamiacaway is no comparison.

reviews.name: Sid N.
reviews.review: If you're in the mood for a little sweet and spicy, head on over to Jamaicaway. The coconut delight, curry chicken and spicy jerk chicken are delicious. You must get the Jonny cakes! Most of the entrees are under $10 so it's very affordable.

reviews.name: Jeffrey B.
reviews.review: Visited Jamaicaway in the Farmer's Market near downtown Nashville earlier this week for lunch with my girlfriend while I was in town for work. It was our first experience there, and honestly my first taste of true Jamaican food. Man, was I impressed!I'm a pretty adventurous eater, so I opted for the Curried Goat (with greens and yellow rice) - so not only was it my first taste of Jamaican, it was also my first taste of goat. SO GOOD!! Tender and savory. My girlfriend got the Curried Chicken with yellow rice and pineappled sweet potatoes, and she loved her meal as well. The prices were decent - I think we paid around $20 for the both of us. Overall, it was a fantastic meal that I'll be looking forward to experiencing again when I'm back in town!

reviews.name: Meg D.
reviews.review: Located in the Nashville Farmer's Market, Jamaica Way is definitely a place not to be missed.Upon walking in, your first task is to read the large menu on the wall, try not to drool and pick up a tray. To be honest, don't bother with the menu on your first trip. Wait in line with your tray and choose a meat and two sides once you get to the counter. The employees are very friendly and helpful... They'll be more than happy to answer any questions you may have!Good go to's for first timers:Jerk chickenFried plantains or cheese potatoes Collards or turnip greensJohnny cakeThe curried goat and ox tails are also fantastic choices for a meat.Jamaica Way is such a a delicious and consistently yummy place for lunch. If you are looking for something different, but still has a hint of comfort food, Jamaica Way will not disappoint!

reviews.name: Nakia H.
reviews.review: Not as good as what was discribed on tripleD. The best thing was the peach tea and the meat patties.  I had the spicy meat patty and it was good.  The chicken was all stewed instead of just baked like I expected.  The coconut drop had a weird consistency.

reviews.name: Trevor C.
reviews.review: Great food with vegetarian and vegan options. Great customer service. The food is very very fresh and different. Great find in Nashville. Filling and a unique experience.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: I popped in last minute as the Greek place was closed earlier than expected.  The girl behind the count was very friendly.  I got the curry goat, greens, and red beans and rice.  They have me a ton of red beans and rice and a good portion of the others.  The greens and rice were tasty.  The curry goat was fantastic.  I'll be back to try some other options as well.

reviews.name: Sharon K.
reviews.review: I finally found this place on Yelp! I saved a business card I got from here. I was here 4 years ago. Back then I donated some money and got a meal that way. It was pretty good. :) Sweetest owner ever. Not too spicy.

reviews.name: Sandy W.
reviews.review: Prepare to loosen your belt a notch. And make a sequel to your first visit soon after. This buffet style layout has so many hearty, unique flavors and too many dishes to try in one meal. They have jerk chicken, of course, but the total variety of other flavors will expand your palate for sure. There are a ton of veg options too (the curry tofu, jerk seitan, and polite sticks are all vegan). But they have collard greens, cornbread, Johnny cakes, curried goat, mango chicken, etc. to fit any craving. I like the assortment of actual Jamaican beverages too. The owners and workers are helpful with any questions you have to help you decide. You can complete your meal with carrot or lemon cake, or a packaged offering from Kahn's Desserts -which I couldn't refuse. I love coming here, slightly over-eating, and then walking it off around the farmer's market :D

reviews.name: Tony D.
reviews.review: While this place has a bunch of nice tables for eating in, it also caters well to the to-go crowd. Got the mild jerk chicken with fried plantains and sweet potatoes, along with a herbal tea drink. I'm not experienced with Jamaican fare, but I personally thought the chicken was okay at best; it was a bit drowned in sauce and too bony for my tastes. The plantains were pretty good though, and both the peach and raspberry herbal tea had an interesting flavor (pretty different from just sweet tea).

reviews.name: Marine A.
reviews.review: The Good: covering all bases, from jerk chicken to pork BBQ. Same with the sides: red rice to collard greens. Obviously all very tasty. Good deals, about 8 - 12$ for a meat, two sides AND a Johnny roll ( Jamaican beignet if you will ). Fun foods: goat ragu, fried plantains, ox tail.  Better know what you want, quick service by some friendly employees. The Bad: Boring ambiance, booths could use a makeover. Gotta pay for tap water boooo. Bottom line: Guy fiery came and conquered, you should too.

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: I've wanted to try Jamaicaway since the day I started work in the Metro Center almost 2 years ago but for some reason, I've had an excuse for not going. Well, I finally went yesterday because one of my friends wanted to go to the FM for lunch. I had the brown gravy chicken and rice/beans and plantains. The chicken was waaaaayyyy overcooked - extra dry. The rice and plantains were okay at best. Nothing special.... The meal came out to about $8 with a free glass of water which is comparable to other meals at the FM.

reviews.name: Pratima N.
reviews.review: First time trying Jamaican food during our Nashville trip and was pleasantly surprised. The serving portions were great here and the goat was cooked to perfection, fall off the bone, melt in your mouth type. The spicy jerk chicken was no exception. And the johnny cakes were a bonus. The sides were pretty delicious. Service was fast and some were friendly and open to questions but others a little harried.

reviews.name: Jason N.
reviews.review: Went here a fews weeks ago! Really enjoyed the food . Great customer service and friendly environment. Every Time  I go I get great service I will always recommend this spot.

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: I've never tried Jamaican food before, but I've been wanting to try this place since seeing it on Triple D.  I'm so happy we finally got to try it.My wife and I both tried the Jerk Chicken.  She really enjoyed the mild and I loved the way the spicy woke up my taste buds.  Even though I got full, I left already planning my next meal when we come back.

reviews.name: Janette C.
reviews.review: So many choices and so many GOOD food options in here!    We were driving around looking for a place to eat lunch and I suggested here.  It had been a couple years since I had been and my fiance had never tried it.   He's always looking for new and spicy things to try!We ordered a variety of items to try and we were not disappointed!  It was ALL very good and we were able to get it fast and get seated immediately.    If you have a lunch break and are concerned about time, don't be!  They are quick!  You can get it to eat in or to go.  Very good food and reasonably priced!

reviews.name: Huyen T.
reviews.review: Not sure if it's because this is the only Jamaican restaurant in Nashville...but the food was way overpriced and it wasn't all that special to be honest. It was my first time trying Jamaican food, but I went with another friend (who had Jamaican food in FL) and she said that she had better and it was much cheaper. I've had food from Trinidad, islander food, and  I have to agree...it could've been better for what I paid for. So meh, I will not be coming back.

reviews.name: Mitchell S.
reviews.review: Decided the night before to take a group of friends here. We planned our day around a trip to Jamaicaway. I never once thought I would need to call and see if this place was open on a Saturday...A SATURDAY.  They're located at a Farmer's Market...why are they closed on a Saturday?I am sure they're food is good but I'll never know. I live 600 miles away.

reviews.name: Edson D.
reviews.review: This wonderful restaurant has a location in COOL SPRINGS too!  I am amazed that so many people are not aware of it.  It is next to the Bodeli Sushi place--for those familiar with the area.  I loved the food EVERY time I visited the place.  I am a veterinarian and normally eat very late due to my busy schedule, so I have limited choices in other restaurants.  But the food is always fresh at Jamaicaway, and people are very friendly.  The Johnnycakes are simply addictive.

reviews.name: Yanik C.
reviews.review: pretty good food. awesome people. cannot be beat for the price.

reviews.name: Ying M.
reviews.review: My first experience with Jamaciaway was pretty great and I'm looking forward to trying it out again. I enjoyed a plate of goat curry, collard greens, and mashed potatoes, along with some delicious cornbread (alas they were out of johnnycakes when I went through the line). The goat was a little heavy for me, but then again it's goat. Sides were good- a little on the salty side, but that's par for the course with any meat and three (or two) in town. It was nice to see so many vegetarian options available, although I don't expect I'll be taking advantage of them any time soon- next time I go I'll be wolfing down a plate of jerk chicken.

reviews.name: Emma W.
reviews.review: I have been wanting to try this place out forever. Finally got to try it today and let's just say i meant to take half of it home, but I just couldn't stop eating. I got the tofu curry, fried plantains, and a side salad, which was all vegan. I want to bathe in the tofu curry broth. It's the perfect combination of curry and coconut milk. My boyfriend got spicy fried chicken, greens, and rice. He loved his as well. Prices were definitely fair. They also sell khans vegan desserts here! The music is authentic and creates a fun atmosphere. I will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Dani W.
reviews.review: I ate here for the second time yesterday. I love it! My first visit I ordered the ox tails with yellow rice and cabbage. Yesterday I had mild jerk chicken, cabbage, plantains, with a Johnny cake. Even though the food was good, they we skimpy with the portions of my sides. For almost 10 bucks I expected a little more. I also had to ask for the Johnny cake which came with the meal. If I hadn't asked I wouldn't have gotten it like the first time I visited. I will probably eat here again. I like trying different food and they have a large selection on their menu.

reviews.name: Amber L.
reviews.review: This place is yuuuuummy. Authentic Jamaican food - something I have not found in the state of Arkansas (where I live). It's nestled inside the Food Court near the Nashville Farmer's Market. In fact, I was impressed overall with the selection of food options here (Mediterranean, French, Indian, American, they have it all!)Despite the kitchen being somewhat chaotic (they ran out of plantains and were scrambling for more), the staff was friendly and apologetic for the chaos. We ordered the jerk chicken with sides of cheesy mashed potatoes, fried plantains, rice and peas, and a johnny cake. The jerk chicken was DELICIOUS - truly awesome flavoring! Everything was just superb, really. Highly recommended!

reviews.name: Tamoghna B.
reviews.review: This one definitely makes it to my personal top 10. It's a little gem tucked away in the farmer's market, a place that quite frankly, doesn't have a lot to boast of except for the food court which surprisingly offers a lot to choose from. My girlfriend couldn't stop talking about this Jamaican place that Guy Fieri stopped by. So we went. Like always, I asked the most solemn looking person in the staff what the one thing on his menu was that would bring me back to his restaurant and he instantly replied 'goat curry roti'. If you're getting one of their entrees, you get to choose 2 from an insane variety of sides. My girlfriend got the jerk chicken and  yellow rice and corn bread for her sides but I am told the steamed cabbage is worth trying as well. Grab a chicken patty (with warm coco bread, of course) to get that appetite working and a drink of their homemade sorrel and I promise you will hear Bob Marley 'stir it up' right inside your soul!

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: I finally tried Jamaicaway at the Farmers Market a few weeks ago and can't figure out why it took me so long.When you come in you get in line and order from the people by the counter.  The food is out like a cafeteria line so you pick your meat and sides and they hand it to you.  Don't forget your tray and silverware or you'll have to push through the crowd and get it later.  Ooops.I tried the spicy jerk chicken with fried plantains and greens.  God I love greens and they were great.  the jerk chicken was spicy but not too spicy and was tasty.  Watch out though because there's some weird gristly/chewy parts in there.  Fried plantains were perfect - I don't get a lot of opportunities to eat plantains so I had to have them.  The Johnny cakes soaked up all the tasty sauce from the jerk chicken and made me full and stuffed.Good place to eat lunch when you are at the Farmers Market - just be prepared to be uber-stuffed and needing a nap afterwards!

reviews.name: Ben W.
reviews.review: I am a cook.  This is as good or better than I do at home. Amazing flavor for fast food steam line. Spicy jerk chicken very good. Sides all good.  Mild hot sauce and vinegar bottles on tables, but they need salt and pepper shakers. Very reasonable prices and friendly staff. Had all I could eat for around eleven dollars. Definitely one of the places to lunch in Nashville.

reviews.name: Elizabeth B.
reviews.review: This is my favorite spot to have lunch in Nashville. First of all, the owners are of the nicest people I've ever met in my life. The wife is a former school teacher and always  finds something interesting to talk about. Even when the owners are gone, the other employees are fun too. They are all about having a good time and crank up the music while they work. Now for the important stuff! FOOD. Every time I visit, I always pour myself a giant glass of raspberry iced tea. It's almost a little too sweet, so I typically cut it with a tad I water (the sweetness adds to the charm though). My favorite dish here is the mild jerk chicken. So fresh and tender...it just melts in your mouth. This meat option pairs very nicely with collards, fried plantain (a must!) and a "johnny cake" (basically an unsweetened donut). This meal is so rich that you might pause midway and wonder if you should save the rest for later. Do not. Enjoy it while it's fresh and delicious. They also offer exciting other proteins like oxtail, goat (also delicious and happens to be the owners personal favorite), soy, and gluten. I've never tried oxtail. But I love the fact that I have the option of eating it at some point. This place is a vacation in your mouth. If you are stuck in a food rut, COME HERE.

reviews.name: Sam P.
reviews.review: First time experience today and was very impressed!  I was here with my partner who is originally from the Caribbean and he gave the stamp of approval lol We will be back regularly!

reviews.name: Mel V.
reviews.review: Nom, nom, nom, nom! I don't often make down to this Farmers Market anymore as I get the items I need at the the one in 37206. But when I do make it, I'm always pleasantly surprised! The Family and I stopped in here for lunch after running around town and we left full and satisfied. I picked the mild jerk chicken, rice and peas, and the sweet potatoes. My husband got a half an half of brown chicken and spicy jerk, greens and rice and pea. Our 2 year old loved his yellow rice and chickpea fritters. and we all shared 2 varieties of patties. That's a lot of food, I know, but we ate it all. ALL... Sopped it all up with a Johnny cake. Do yourself a favor, come on in during your lunch break and grab a bite, you won't be disappointed. It's all fresh, and it's all delish.

reviews.name: Jeff K.
reviews.review: Love the jerk chicken! A great selection of jamaican sodas as well. I tried the herbal raspberry drink and it was delicious!They lose a star because I never recieved my johnny's(sp?) that were supposed to come with our meal!

reviews.name: Morgan L.
reviews.review: This place was suggested to me by a colleague who knew my Jamaican background. I came with really high hopes and I wasn't disappointed I settled on the Curry Goat since they were out of Ackee and Saltfish. It was really good! A little too salty but all the other flavors were on point. I agree with others that it is overpriced but I am willing to make the sacrifice. :)

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Spicy. Jerk. Chicken.I am tempted to leave the review at that, but there are a few other highlights I have to mention. So the Spicy Jerk Chicken is out of this world. Perfectly seasoned, perfect heat, perfect texture. Just amazing. I got it with their cabbage, and I have never enjoyed cabbage so much. Also a great texture change from the tender chicken and fluffy rice and peas. The fried biscuits are unique and freaking delicious. I love this place.

reviews.name: L Dante G.
reviews.review: I love Jamaican food. A little known fact about my hometown (Toronto) is that it has the 2nd biggest West Indian population outside of the West Indies next to Brooklyn, NY. I grew up around Jamaican food and culture.  Imagine my excitement when I found this joint at the farmers market!As far as Jamaican food goes this joint is spot on. It's a for real Jamaican joint after all. The jerk chicken, oxtail, curry goat, curry chicken (all with rice & peas and callaloo) are the dishes I generally go for with a jamaican beef patty on the side.  Go for the kola champagne or a bottle of ting an you'll be good to go.Another joy was the fact that they have roti, which is a West Indian flat bread like tortillas but in my opinion is way better. It's got crushed chick peas and is as good as it gets. As for the beef patties, they're good, but not as hot (spicy) as I like to have them, but being in Nashville with only one other West Indian joint, I won't complain.Tell the good dude Kamal that eyejammy says "what up." I highly recommend Jamaicaway. Likkle more. seen!

reviews.name: LaTamera W.
reviews.review: Food is great. Variety is essential in everyday life. Love their jerk chicken patties! Love their plantain and sweet potatoes with pineapple.  Pricey place but understandable based on their location and the variety of food they serve.  This is a great spot for oxtails, greens, vegetarian meals, and Jamaican grub.

reviews.name: Ed H.
reviews.review: Was skeptical at first being this restaurant is within the Farmers a Market but I was pleasantly surprised.  While I'm not an expert of Jamaican food, I can say without a doubt this was the best I have tasted.  Definitely a place to visit.

reviews.name: Kimble B.
reviews.review: Years ago, when we lived in rockville, MD, we swore there was no better carribean restaurant north of Jamaica than Carribean Feast. Today in Nashville, we are so lucky to have a new favorite - Jamaicaway. The johnny cakes bring me back to the islands. They are the perfect compliment to an unrivaled spicy jerk chicken (my favorite) or tender oxtail that falls from the bone. Surprising, the appetizers are half thr reason I keep coming back. The cabbage is perfect every time and the greens are just right, not too sweet. Come for the food, come back again and again for the service.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Tucked away in the Farmer's market, buffet style, jerk chicken, curry chicken, beef tips, goat everything, top it off with some yummy callaloo and cabbage or a bit of sweet potato casserole and a portion is more than enough for two. Add s portion of the best Roti in town, drown it down with ginger beer and you'll be asleep before you get back to work.Food is a little salty but that's how it should be I think!Oh and did I say super nice people.  Snaps for small businesses as Elle Woods would say.

reviews.name: Deadria C.
reviews.review: As someone who grew up on Jamaican food, and frequently visits different restaurants in different states, I must say I was quite disappointed. Not only is the food over priced but the patties are frozen and thawed out prior to serving. Each of the desserts are improperly labeled, there were various silverwares missing. Even in Jamaica you don't pay $10 for a small oxtail.

reviews.name: Good G.
reviews.review: Authentic and good! Had the spicy jerk chicken an it didn't disappoint. The heat was perfect, not weak or overwhelming. Johnny cake was an A+, sides were average or better. Missed the mark for another star because I would have liked just a bit more of the main entree on the plate. Having said that, it wasn't too small. But I was hungry and it was good. Left me wanting more!

reviews.name: Colleen M.
reviews.review: So freaking good. If I were to visit Nashville again I would go again, hands down. I actually visited because I saw it on the Food Network. I was NOT disappointed. I got a large plate of the mango chutney chicken, which was wonderful, with fried plantains, a johnny cake, and pineapple sweet potatoes. Yuum. All awesome. I also got the carrot-mango juice which was bomb ($3.50 but so worth it). Also the coconut-ginger brittle thing they sell on the side is AWESOME. The large plate is a huge amount of food, though, so it was difficult to finish. It became an awesome breakfast the next day! One negative is that it is on the expensive side, but is in my opinion well worth it (will spend anywhere from $9 to $20 per person). Also, the menu said $12.50 for the curry goat and they charged my friend $13.50, which she caught on the receipt and pointed it out. The manager said they were "in the middle of changing the menu" and gave her the difference.

reviews.name: Hayley T.
reviews.review: I've been to Jamaicaway 4 times and I must say that I really like it. The first 2 times I got their Jerk Chicken because I love Jerk, but I was a little disappointed with the taste of it because I've had better Jerk Chicken from different places, but I guess different Jamaican restaurants have their way of making it.  But I did enjoy the Fried Chicken Mango Chutney!!  They give you 4 to 5 chicken fingers with sweet mango salsa, and It's really good. For sides I always get the rice and peas (red beans and rice)  the cheesy mash potatoes, and a Johny Cake. The Johny Cakes are so delicious, and they go well with Chicken Mango Chutney. For drinks I love their raspberry tea, it's so refreshing, they also have peach tea, which I'm not a huge fan of, I think it taste too sweet.

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: Wow wow wow. This is my kind of food, this is honest food, this is no bullshit food. Jamaican food is the quintissential fusion food. An almost perfect fuion of indian, african influence and I don't know what. We had the jerk chicken and the chicken stew and both were very juicy.I've gotta try the oxtail and goat next time. I mean, if you like this kind of food, you've got to come here. I have nothing more to write about it. I think as a foodie, a person who tries all kinds of cuisines, ethnic food, jamaicaway has to be the best nashville restaurant and for me it wins quite easily.

reviews.name: Marilee S.
reviews.review: There is NO reason to go to Calypso Cafe. None if you're anywhere near this little gem tucked front and center at The Farmer's Market. Tender meats like jerk or curry chicken, goat or oxtail, or vegetarian options. Fresh vegetables like kale or orange sweet potatoes with chunks of pineapple cooked in rich seasonings and yummy sauces.  The staff is delightful, attentive and willing to wait as you decide and sample your options. Don't go if you're in a hurry and want a quick sandwich. There's other options. If you're not taking it to go, you are served on real, not paper, plates with real, not plastic, silverware.Oh yeah I'll be back. Every time I go to the Farmer's Market I'll be back.By the way, we met another customer who had them cater his birthday. The best, he said. People talked about the food for months.

reviews.name: Mike E.
reviews.review: Wow. The food blew me away. I found this on Yelp and am totally happy I went. It's inside of a farmer's market. The service was a little slow cause they were understaffed, but the food made up for everything. I had the Mango Chicken and Spicy Jerk Chicken, both were amazing. If you are only visiting in town like I was, choose your sides carefully, as only 2 come with each plate (I ordered 3; Sweet Potatoes/Pineapple, Spicy Beef Patty, and Yellow Rice. The price was reasonable and the portion size was pretty decent. I can't wait to visit Nashville again so I can try the fish!

reviews.name: cin f.
reviews.review: saw them on diners, drive-ins and dives and wanted to try the food. you can go down the cafeteria style line and get a plateful of delicious food. i had the mango chutney chicken. it did not disappoint. it was crunchy and flavorful.  my hubby had the the tilapia escovitch which was absolutely fabulous. next time we go back, we will try the goat and/or oxtails.  the johnny cakes are okay.  the fried plantains were a little soggy.  the raspberry and peach teas were refreshing.  they have several  items on the menu that cater to vegetarians. makes me wish we lived a little closer. also, the place is conveniently located near the farmer's market. so you can eat and then walk around.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: So glad I finally got to try Jamaicaway! After hearing my girlfriend rave about their food and the two of us being at the Farmers' Market anyway, we stopped in for lunch and it blew me away. I had the spicy jerk chicken, green beans, and fried plantains (with a jonnycake on the side, which was sweet enough to be dessert). The chicken was the right enough of kick without it being too much and everything else was great. I would love to come back and try all of the sides alone! Also, my meal was only around $7 and the portions are hefty. You certainly get your money's worth!

reviews.name: B L.
reviews.review: Located within the Farmer's Market, Jamaicaway is a great lunch spot.They offer lunch specials which come with a meat, 2 sides, and bread for around $10-$12.  Their offerings are true to what I know of and have tasted of Jamaican cuisine, and they are done well.  The staff is courteous and friendly.I had the curry goat which was tender and well seasoned.  (I just want to put in a plug here for goat - you don't see it very often on menus here, but it is delicious!  I will never really consider myself a 'foodie' bc I do shy away from offal, but I would encourage anyone who is curious to give goat a try!)   For sides, I had plantains which were well fried - crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside, and callalou - which is a delicious green, very similar to spinach, but very hard to find in the states.  (if you ever see callalou soup on a menu, it is a must-try) When I inquired, the staff told me they have to get their callalou from Atlanta.   To complete the meal, I had a johnnie cake, which is essentially a tasty piece of fried dough.  This place makes me wish I was in the area for lunch more often.

reviews.name: Wayne H.
reviews.review: Tucked away in the Farmer's Market, this place serves cheap, delicious Jamaican food.  By far their most popular item seems to be the chicken, which may come spicy, BBQ, or in jerk, curry brown sauce, or with mango chutney.  While the chicken dishes all seem to be chunks of chicken (with bone) immersed in their respective sauces, the meat is tender, and the sauces are deliciously thick, and strong, the brown sauce having a slight sweetness to it, while the spicy sauces have a fairly mild but respectable kick. Other dishes include a Tilapia escoveitch cooked while you wait that comes off quite tender and crumbly, if a little watery, and has a distinct sweet and sour-like sauce to it, as well as curried goat and ox-tails, which I have not gotten around to trying.  All dishes come two sides, which range from three varieties of rice (rice with beans, rice with peas, yellow rice) to fried plantains, various greens (from reallly bitter callaloo to thick turnip greens to green beans), and mashed or sweet potatoes.  A side dish of rice is nearly necessary to counteract the strong flavors of the chicken or fish.  All dishes also come with a choice of Johnny cake or corn bread, which also helps counteract the intense flavors. The Johnny cake comes nearly fresh out of the oven and is hot and crumbly like a very soft biscuit. With a drink, including various Caribbean sodas and  herbal fruit teas, it is just about $10-$15 for a good meal. The restaurant has somewhat odd hours, and is basically a glorified cafeteria. The staff however are friendly and helpful despite the bustle that surrounds them. Jamaicaway seems especially popular on Sundays after church and can get quite crowded at that point, though that is probably also the best time to visit.  Go early, like when it opens at around 11, to beat the crowds and get first dibs on the freshly made dishes. If you have not tried Jamaican food, I think this is a great place to start.

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: I am a huge fan of Caribbean-inspired cuisine thanks to another local restaurant called Calypso Cafe. However, Jamaicaway was recommended to me for truly authentic Jamaican cuisine. My friend and I popped over after visiting the farmer's market next door and they had quite a variety. I ended up getting the mild jerk chicken, with pineappled sweet potatoes and green beans. The portions were huge and it was only about $7. The chicken was super tender and practically fell apart when I stuck my fork in it... not to mention how savory and spicy the sauce was! The sweet potatoes were some of the best I ever had - nicely sweetened with some cinnamon and brown sugar, and just the right amount of pineapple to give a bit of a fruity kick. I can't wait to go back again and try some new dishes.

reviews.name: Catherine S.
reviews.review: This place was great! The goat curry and jerk chicken are awesome... although the jerk chicken is different from what I'm used to. The people serving the food in the line are so friendly... I'd go back just to hang out with them! They also play good music! The tea is really really really sweet! If you water it down... it's good. Definitely check it out though... the food is a bit heavy, but it's pretty delightful.

reviews.name: Yao Z.
reviews.review: Found this place on yelp while traveling for work. Couple co-workers and myself decided to give this place a try.The flavor of the food is unique and very very flavorful. We shared 4 different dishes and all of them turnout to be great. Because the herbs and spices are so unique so this place might not be for everyone. However if you are an adventurous foodie and always seeking exotic taste and great dining experience this is definitely the place to try. Later.

reviews.name: Jermaine W.
reviews.review: It's been a while since I have been here, I decided to take a break because my last experience was not so great. Jamaica NoWay! I'm done with this place, they have lost their touch, something is off, not sure what but something is off with the food. Either that or I have been exposed to real Jamaican food in other cities and this doesn't measure up..

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: So, I only went here for my first visit today, and I'm not an expert on Jamaican cuisine, but from my first experience I give them five gold stars, with smiley faces even! I had the talapia escoveith w/ greens, cheesy mashed potatoes, and johnny cake.  Everything was so flavorful and delicious, and the rest of the food looks so good I know I'll be going back soon to try more.  They have hot sauces on the counter if you're crazy like me and can only eat food that's spicy.  The jonny cake, which is one of the bread options, would make Dr. Atkins roll over in his grave.  It's such a doughy goodness, I felt like I was committing a huge sin with each bite, yet it was so good I didn't care all that much.Located in the Farmer's Market, they are a little apart from the rest of the eateries so it's not hard to miss.  Also note they're closed on Saturdays.  The decor is modest and cheerful and there was just enough seating when I was there.  On the wall is evidence of Guy Fieri from Food Network visiting here, which is what made me aware of this place to begin with.  For my lunch entree, all of which come with two sides, I paid a little over $9 (chicken and veggies are a little less than fish).  Considering that is for something I can't get everywhere in Nashville and the food was delicious, I'd say that's a pretty good deal!

reviews.name: Kristina S.
reviews.review: Husband & I stopped here on our way back from South Carolina. I had the jerk chicken, pineapple sweet potatoes & collard greens & a johnny cake~all were delicious. My husband had the mango chicken that was amazing also. Will be back again next time we are down that way!

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: Good fresh "fast" food.  Jamaicaway is laid out "foot court style", in that the hot dishes are presented behind glass and are scooped onto your plate right in front of you as you order it.  With the exception of what I ordered today, which was the Spicy Curry Gluten (as in wheat gluten, as in seitan).  It wasn't quite ready, so the man behind the counter told me he'd deliver my food to my table.  He did.  With the curry I had friend plantains and stewed almost Indian-like cabbage.  And a johnnycake, which I will explain later.Jamaicaway has an enticing selection of meat dishes (oxtail, goat, and chicken) with an additionally enticing variety of vegetarian dishes. (Tofu, gluten, etc.).  The price of an entree with two sides was a little under $9.  Pretty good.  Sides include but are not limited to plantains, cabbage, collard greens, sweet potato and pineapple, and different rice preparations.The johnnycake... I suppose I expected an American johnnycake, a pancake flap jack thing.  Was I wrong.. each meal was served with a johnnycake, a palm size piece of deep-fried, dense dough.  Woah.  I'm glad I tried it, but another may kill me.  Small, not a fantastic choice for a huge group of people.  Try Jamaicaway.  Especially if you are vegetarian, as you will appreciate the dishes that honestly do cater to you.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: After I was ditched for lunch by multiple friends, I decided to go solo to Jamaicaway. Solid decision on my part. I went with the Mild Jerk Chicken, pineapple Sweet potatoes, and Cabbage. When asked whether I would like Cornbread or Jonny Cake, I went with the Jonny Cake.Everything was great, but the Jonny Cake really resonated with me. It's basically a doughnut, without icing, and without a hole. Everyone was friendly, which makes every meal better. Try it!

reviews.name: Cara P.
reviews.review: I'm sorry...no.  I had the curried goat, collard greens, and sweet potatoes.  The greens and sweet potatoes were great, but the goat....  It was very tender, I'll give it that.  But the curry was waayyy too salty, and I'm sorry, if you're going to serve meat in a sauce like that (almost like a stew), TAKE IT OFF THE BONE.  And lots of gristle in the meat (for me, anyway; I have a thing about meat fat & gristle & tendon, euw).  My husband's jerk chicken was also much too salty (that was really the main flavor in both meats).  And the herbal peach "tea" tasted more like a soda: cloyingly sweet.  I'm really sorry, I wanted to love Jamaicaway.

reviews.name: Joshua L.
reviews.review: great food, great staff, and great atmosphere!

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: That is a 5 for best Jamaican food in Nashville. For lunch (the best time to go), I had the following: fried Chixen (fake chicken but tastes sooooo gooood) with a mango sauce, rice with black beans and sweet potatoes with pineapple. I washed it down with a can of coconut juice. Also, you get your choice between Jimmy Bread - fried heaven or corn bread.They have ammmazing style BBQ. The options here are endless. This is equally as good for vegetarians as meat eaters. They are fast to get you on your way and more than nice can get. I paid $10 for all that! Don't forget to get the pineapple hot sauce before you leave.

reviews.name: Erin J.
reviews.review: Really like this place & the fact that they have many vegetarian options that taste great!  Really like the vindaloo.  Nice addition to the Farmer's Market!I hold back  two stars due to the service - the last 2 times I've gone there I have waited for nearly 10 minutes without acknowledgement.  Very frustrating!

reviews.name: Tara J.
reviews.review: Three words: VEGAN FRIED CHICKEN!  Wow, their food is tasty.  I had the aforementioned fried "chicken", peas and rice (SO GOOD!) and fried plantains.  The service was so incredibly friendly - they apologized that we had to wait approximately 30 seconds to be served.  The prices are low and there's a fun flea market next door to browse after eating.  LOVE!

reviews.name: Felicia H.
reviews.review: Awesome food. Excellent customer service! Been waiting to try this restaurant for several monts. Glad i decided on Jamacia Way over Cheesecake Factory today. Excellent choice. Reminds me of Elaines Kitchen in Dallas, Texas. One more Nashville restaurant i can put on my list as a thumbs up! Hallelujah!

reviews.name: X O.
reviews.review: I've been here twice. The staff is friendly and helpful. They gave me samples with a toothpick. They had several main dishes for vegetarians, the BBQ tofu was tasty. The sides were simple but delicious, I tried the collard greens and cabbage. The fried bread is great to wipe up all the tasty sauce. They serve good sized portions at a reasonable price. The line gets long quickly at lunchtime.

reviews.name: Ashley L.
reviews.review: Jamaican Jerk chicken is one of my favorites and Jamaicaway didn't disappoint!  The spicy jerk chicken falls off the bone and the sauce has the perfect amount of heat.  The steamed cabbage had amazing flavor and jonny cake was perfect for getting ever bit of sauce off the plate.  If you haven't tried Jamaicaway get there asap!

reviews.name: Emily B.
reviews.review: I'm nowhere near a Jamaican food expert, but what a tasty lunch this was! I tried the jerk chicken (fall off the bone tender!), plantains (perfect crunch), collared greens (perfectly cooked and seasoned), and johnny cake (mmmmm). Wish I could go back and try more on the menu!

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: Agreed with Jamie...Be sure to try a spicy Jamaican beef patty, some of their peach tea, and the Johnny cakes with jerk chicken.This place is seriously slept on....definitely a gem in the Farmers Market.

reviews.name: Chris S.
reviews.review: stumbled in here because the Indian place was closed. Man, this place is good and completely authentic. I am hooked on the scotch bonnet sauce. I didn't think the jerk chicken was very jerky, but the goat was amazing. Greens were excellent, and the staff was friendly. I would make a return trip the next time we are out there. Saw Guy Fieri painted his mug on the wall, so I guess he thinks that it is money.

reviews.name: Billy P.
reviews.review: I've been to Jamaicaway 3 or 4 times now for lunch.  Everybody I have taken liked it.  The food here is really good.  I usually get some of the fake meat vegetarian options they have.  I had the Johnny Cake the first time and did not get it again - too dry and doughy for me, but some like it that way.  I always get corn bread instead.  Lots of options and right around $10 for a main dish, 2 sides and a drink.  I hear this place has been struggling since the flood and might go out of business.  That would be a shame.  Go to Jamaicaway!  You won't be sorry.  P.S. Get plantains!

reviews.name: D.T. B.
reviews.review: Five stars for being the best Jamaican food in Nashville.  LOVE the goat and oxtail.  Not the best service, but the fresh and authentic food makes up for that.

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: I really really want to like Jamaicaway, since my mother is from Trinidad so I grew up on many Caribbean staples that are pretty difficult to find anywhere else in Nashville. This is the only place where I can routinely get a goat curry wrapped in a roti or some oxtail, so for that reason alone, I'd probably give it a pass.But the problem with places that feature food that reminds me of my childhood is that I'm going to have a pretty high bar set and I can't honestly say that Jamaicaway is hitting that bar. While I appreciate how tender they get their goat, I sometimes feel like the spicing is off in the curry base, and if you're going to get the goat roti (which is essentially like a big burrito filled with goat curry), it would be nice to only have boneless meat in there, otherwise you are in for a nasty surprise. My other qualm is with the callalloo, which they make using turnip and other various greens, which is just not the way it's meant to be done. Callalloo is a plant that is very similar to spinach and while you can make it with other greens, it won't officially be callalloo in my book if you do so. Additionally, I hate that they use all the parts of the greens they do use, meaning that you get bunches of undigestible and unplatable fibrous bits that are a bit like chewing bamboo. Not pleasant at all.Also, I don't want to fault Jamaicaway on being successful, but I think it is fair to say that if you come during the lunch hour, this place will be busy and service will suffer for it. Even though it's cafeteria style, the line always seems to stall, especially as I always seem to wind up behind someone who is ordering 5 or 6 meals to go. I do find the hours pretty inconvenient as well, as this is yet another one of those Nashville restaurants that only seems to be open for lunch or an extremely early dinner. I also think that the food is a little bit pricey, personally. Maybe if their goat roti were the best I'd ever had I could see spending $11 on it, but I've had better for a fraction of that price. The portions are generous, but I generally find that I don't want to eat my entire meal because the flavor just doesn't have the proper refinement.I appreciate that Jamaicaway is filling a niche here in Nashville, and for that I give it some extra points, but whenever I go, I can't help but wish it were better. I guess that like authentic Chinese food, I'll just have to wait for the Caribbean flavors I know to make it to Nashville.

reviews.name: jonathan s.
reviews.review: you can imagine my surprise when i was passing through nashville and at a random bar when a guy told me the next day i needed to eat lunch at this jamaican place at the market. jamaican in nashville? its a small little place laid out cafeteria style. jerk chicken and sides were real good and from what i hear we made the correct choice for that one day we were there for lunch.

reviews.name: Paul H.
reviews.review: I am totally a fan of Jamaicaway Restaurant.  It's hidden in the Farmer's Market building behind the Capitol.  But, it's worth the trek.  At lunch time this place gets packed, so keep your eyes peeled for a table.  But, don't loose focus.  When it's your turn at the front of the line you must not hesitate.  Hesitation will kill your momentum - like it did mine on my first trip.  It's almost like a classic meat & three place where everything is pre-prepared and you peruse and select.  I started out with the traditional jerk chicken.  I chose the mild, but would have probably preferred the spicy better.  I've also had the curried goat - which was both frightening and exciting.  Both meals turned out really well and I would totally recommend this place for a lunch-time visit.  The sides are pretty varied too.  I've tried everything from fried plantains to sweet potatoes and steamed greens.  I will say that I was a little disappointed with their johnny cakes though, not much flavor.All in all, Jamaicaway is a really good lunch-time value.  It's busy, but not too crowded, and parking is super easy.  Go, try something new.

reviews.name: Nichole R.
reviews.review: I went for the first time today and I will be back and take friends with me!I had the brown stew chicken with the pineappled sweet potatoes and rice and peas.  It was all great. If you have a cinnamon allergy you shouldn't have these choices.  The cinnamon isn't overpowering at all but it is there.   The herbal fruit tea was very sweet but they were very nice and brewed us up some unsweet.  The atmosphere was great for lunch.

reviews.name: Jason N.
reviews.review: JamaicaWay has damned near everything you could ever want in a restaurant:-Well prepared, fresh food-Knowledgeable, friendly staff-DeliciousnessI have had the Curried Goat, Braised Ox Tail and Vegetarian Chicken.  It is all fantastic.  If I were told that I could only eat at one restaurant in this town again, this is the one that I would pick.

reviews.name: Kayla P.
reviews.review: I stumbled upon Jamicaway last week while I was looking for glass-bottled Ting for my boyfriend. We had just come back from a great vacation in Negril, Jamaica from Christmas/New Years. When I walked into Jamaicaway, I was incredibly excited to see not only the Ting that he had drank every night while we were there, but the Beef and Chicken patties we snacked on late at night.  I looked over the assortment of food being served, and one of the women behind the counter was very friendly about explaining how one went about ordering, but I knew all I wanted was a Beef pattie(spicy was the only was to go in Jamaica!). I walked to my car and took a bite and closed my eyes and I was back on the beach!!!! This place is awfully authentic, while there was quite a crowd, the staff knew just how to handle them and got them in and out quickly.

reviews.name: Valerie D.
reviews.review: Great food and great staff - very island style!  Definitely try the curried goat!! Johny cakes are amazing. The rice and peas are a little different than the recipe I know but still good. Fried sweet plantains are a must, of course!  Even the coco bread and fresh coconut water were fantastic! Congrats on the Diners Drive Ins and Dives fame - you deserve it!  Next time we are in Nashville, I will definitely try the vegetarian options. They looked delicious too!

reviews.name: Senaka G.
reviews.review: Got the goat curry yellow rice , beans beef patty. Goat curry was very flavourful not spicy more like a yellow based curry. its,more like boiled in its own juices so expect it to be very goatish. Beans had a funny limy taste but passable. Yellow rice was nothing bad. Beef patty was deffy worth it good chunk of meat in it. Tried some calypso sauce and it was good(good way to make things spicy) i did see the other dishes and eggplant curry looked awesome. Staff is very friendly mayb they should gv more rixe but im satisfied with it. Cost me 12.50 for all.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: Jamaicaway is the best choice for affordable Caribbean comfort food in Nashville.  The selection is not huge, but everything that the do, they do well.  It is very hard to beat the Jerk Chicken meal at lunch time.  It is delicious, affordable, and a ton of good food.  Did I mention the johnny cakes, the ginger beer, the homemade hot sauce... Do yourself a favor and check it out.

reviews.name: ALEXIS P.
reviews.review: One of my favorite, most decadent lunch spots.  I am impervious to the fried plantains, yams, cakes, and homemade juices.  The proteins are always delicious as well, you cannot go wrong with any of the choices, even the most unusual-sounding meats and preps.  It's a good place to get adventurous- maybe even try the peanut butter juice!  im serious...  I would love it if they had more daily specials (even though their offerings are always wide and diverse) and homemade ginger beer, please!

reviews.name: Argenis Z.
reviews.review: Wonderful place great service and the food so delicious this is very authentic  thai food

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: We woke up on a Sunday morning & decided to run a couple errands. We were craving Thai food so we thought about hitting up Thai Taste. We would be in the area & we always enjoyed it. I looked to see their hours, recently they'd have odd hours. I checked the website & found they'd actually closed about a year & a half ago! It looks like a new Thai place has opened up in it's place, Thai Ville. We decided to give it a try. We stopped in around noon on Sunday & there was one couple at a different table. Not very busy, but that didn't detour us, I mean it's only been open for about 4 months by my calculations. We were greeted warmly & sat at a table & our drink order was taken. If you'd been to Thai Taste, the interior will be very familiar. They haven't change much. It's a nicely appointed restaurant for the age of the building. As we skimmed the menu (all with pictures), the owner stopped by & introduced himself & told us what dishes were his favorite & how this food is different than the other Thai places in Nashville. We decided on the crab Rangoon as an appetizer, I ordered the Pad Kee Mao & Phillip ordered some kind of pork dish. They've got a lunch & dinner price. There's about two dollars in price difference on the items. I told the server I wanted the lunch portion, seeing as it was lunchtime & I wasn't wanting a huge plate of food. She told us that on the weekends is only dinner portions. I thought that was a little odd but I figured we be getting a huge plate of food. The crab Rangoon came soon after. You can really tell they care about presentation here. They use a lot of flowers carved out of carrots & other vegetables. The crab Rangoon was okay. The won tong paper was really thick so it was kind of hard to bite into. I like it when the paper is more delicate & inside crab stuff is fluffy. The food arrived after we were done with the crab Rangoon. The "dinner" portion we got looked more like a lunch portion. I think the lunch/dinner portion on the weekend is probably just to make a few extra bucks. The menu didn't have anything on it about no lunch options on the weekend, however on the website, the new menu says dinner is from 11am-9pm on Saturday & Sunday. I enjoyed the Pad Kee Mao. The noodles were cooked well & the chicken was seasoned. I asked for spicy but it wasn't very spicy so we got the 3 little containers of spices. The bell peppers were a little soft for me. Overall I enjoyed the meal. I would've liked the paper on the crab Rangoon to be a little lighter, & next time I'll come when it's actual lunchtime, during the week only.

reviews.name: La Familia D.
reviews.review: So when you drive up it's not inspiring. Across from a booze & tobacco place as well as in the "lots of trashed used cars" district. Follow the street address & trust that tan building is Thai Ville. And safe.Our group had the vegetable & Spring rolls (awesome) a green curry, a noodle dish I can't spell, & of course pad Thai. All was anywhere from good to excellent. Price was good too.Service was great. One nice, tiny lady kept things moving.I'll be back. Don't judge a book by it's cover.

reviews.name: Jesse G.
reviews.review: Excellent service from the owners. Very personable and they always make it enjoyable. The location is iffy for most, thus the 4-stars, but their food and service is some of the best in Nashville.I've been here several times since back when it was Thai Taste, and always my food is very good and comes out quickly. When I ask them for native hot, they don't hold back! Panang Curry, Pad Thai, spring rolls....all fantastic.If I'm ever nearby, its my go-to Thai place.

reviews.name: A G.
reviews.review: Just a heads up- they will not honor the free spring roll offer from this app. They said it's not for their restaurant and they can't get it removed. Pretty annoyed that they wouldn't honor the advertisement even when we ordered a good amount of food for take out.Pas Kee Mao was dry and barely flavored but veggies were fresh. The other food we ordered was good but not as crazy good as other reviews made it seem.

reviews.name: Janine A.
reviews.review: Truly excellent Thai. Had the Tom Yum, fried rolls, and shrimp pad Thai. All delicious. Great service where they make an effort to get to know you.

reviews.name: Jonathan W.
reviews.review: Truly great dining experience. The staff here are very friendly and welcoming. I had fried spring rolls, curry, Thai tea and mango rice and all of it was excellent. This will definitely become a common stop for me.

reviews.name: Sara R.
reviews.review: Best Thai I've had in a while. Wonderful service with great ambiance and even better food. Please do yourself a favor and dine here soon.

reviews.name: John K.
reviews.review: What a great restaurant! Generous portions and the staff is very friendly! I would highly recommend this place to anyone who likes great food!

reviews.name: Joshua C.
reviews.review: Great authentic Thai food. The pricing is excellent and the food is even better. If you're looking for real Thai food and not break the bank, check it out!

reviews.name: Gare W.
reviews.review: I ordered take out and while waiting the staff was very friendly. Made me feel very welcomed. The food is amazing. I can not wait to go back for a dine in experience.

reviews.name: Wyatt R.
reviews.review: I stopped by this place after I saw it had just opened and thought I'd give it a try. I am really glad I did. It's without a doubt the best Thai I've ever had. The massamom was delicious and just the right amount of spicy. The owner Savilia and I had a long conversation since the restaurant wasn't busy. Nice atmosphere, friendly people, amazing food. Definitely five stars.

reviews.name: Henry W.
reviews.review: Clean, Kind people, and Great food. The food was spicy yet flavorful regardless of how much spice you pile on your dish. Honestly the best Thai food I've ever tasted.

reviews.name: Robin H.
reviews.review: My husband and I love Thai food, but don't love driving all the way across town to get to Smiling Elephant or Phooket Thai.  We couldn't wait to try Thai Ville when it opened just a few miles from our house, and we definitely weren't disappointed.  The staff is so friendly and attentive, making sure that you have absolutely everything you need.   The food was really excellent, and super fresh- the vegetables and herbs taste like they were just picked fresh from the garden.  I don't like a lot of spice myself, but my husband says it's legit.  The portions are generous, but I hope one day we'll have enough room to try the delicious sounding desserts.  Can't say enough good things about this place- give it a try!

reviews.name: Tom J.
reviews.review: Dinner prices at 2pm? That's what they charged me for Drunken Noodles (Pad Kee Mao). I much prefer the Pad Kee Mao at Thai Phooket, more saucy and veggie. This seemed like just soy sauce and hot sauce, with mostly just green beans for veggies -- and it's a small portion. I had tofu as the meat, and they used those pre-fab tofu cubes that I don't like as much as actual slices of fried tofu. I asked for medium hot and it was just perfect for my taste, but probably too hot if you're not used to Thai food. I'll probably be back to try other dishes since it's nearby.

reviews.name: Nelson R.
reviews.review: I have never had an experience of a meal quite like this. From the family's unique charm, to their food's authentic taste, it was an amazing meal. First I will focus on the food's native flair. I had two companions with me. One of my companions had the garden salad, with a orange and pineapple dressing, and the other had the beef tiger-tear salad. They were very satisfied from all I could tell. For our main courses, I had the pad Thai, it was the best pad Thai I had ever had. My associates had both the panaing curry, a creamy and spicy dish served with chicken and rice, and the Pad Se Ew a dish served with vegetables and brown noodles. All of this seemed to please them. The family was very friendly, our server, who was one of the two sisters, was one of the most friendly people I have ever met. She helped us with all of our decisions. From the call we made, we knew that they would have southern hospitality with another country's love towards foreigners. All in all, whether this is an introduction to Thai food, or you are a seasoned veteran towards the scrumptious tastes of Thai food, this is an amazing meal! I'm coming back!

reviews.name: Sean S.
reviews.review: I have eaten here several times in the past few months. Great food, great value. This is the first place I consider when I want good Asian food

reviews.name: Greg W.
reviews.review: This is a hidden treasure. Food is amazing, generous portions. Best Calamari. I will definitely be back. I would highly recommend a visit to this resturant

reviews.name: Jim S.
reviews.review: For the last several years, my wife and I would visit this location when it was called Thai Taste. We liked the location as it was close to our home and the food was always good. The problem was Thai Taste would often be closed and never seemed to keep steady hours and then it closed. We were very happy to see that new owners took over the location. It is now called Thai Ville and we recently visited the new restaurant. We were greeted by a very polite server who told us about his family moving here from Bangkok and how long they had been open. From the first bite, we knew we had found a winner. We ordered a variety of dishes to try as many items as we could. We started with Thai tea and it was creamy and the tea flavor was perfect. Sometimes the Thai tea can be harsh or taste too strong. This was excellent. I ordered Tom Yum with shrimp and my wife ordered Miso Soup. The Tom Yum broth was so flavorful and rich. I can't remember a better experience with Tom Yum. It's usually either too spicy hot or too salty but this was just perfect. The Miso was also very rich and perfectly seasoned. I ordered Chicken Satay and they generous portion was cooked exactly how I like it and the peanut sauce was excellent. The peanut sauce had to be homemade. My wife ordered tiger tears salad and it was very flavorful the seasoning was a great combination of sweet and savory. I ordered Red Curry with shrimp. Red Curry is one of my go-to's at Thai restaurants so I've had many. The curry in this one was so amazing that I found myself desperately trying to get the last drop of the curry out of the serving bowl. Chalk it up to a very good chef, very fresh and top notch ingredients and wonderful service, but I think I've found my new Thai restaurant in Nashville. I can't give Thai Ville enough stars. Great job!

reviews.name: Julie G.
reviews.review: The food at Local Taco was a bright spot in my recent trip to Nashville.  The service had some issues, but they were pretty busy, and I've only been there once, so I can't really ding them for that. Issues included getting an extra ear of corn that hadn't been ordered (they took it back and I don't think we were charged), flour tortillas instead of the requested corn, and just plain slow service. The bright spots of the service were friendly demeanor, and that they were willing to split our check for us.They have a great variety of tacos on the menu - I was really craving chicken so I went with 3 chicken. My 3 companions tried almost every variety in total.  I had a bite of the Korean inspired, it was delicious. Because I prefer my tacos to free of dairy products I tend to rely on either salsa or well seasoned meat to get great flavor. These met that requirement well!We split a pitcher of margaritas, which allowed each of us one margarita plus a little bit of refill for the faster drinkers. They were tasty, but pretty darn sweet.  If I go again (I live across the country) I'd request less sweetener. It can be pretty crowded inside. We were able to get an easily wheelchair accessible table, but I could see it being difficult to ever access the outdoor seating unless it was super dead inside (no architectural barriers from what I saw, just furniture & bodies in the way). I didn't make it to the restroom to check out access there.  Along one wall there are booths for those who prefer booths over tables.

reviews.name: Correy S.
reviews.review: the entrance was a bit weird.. no one greeted me and then asked if i needed something.. .not if they could help me find a seat. i ordered the one of their top salads and was marked GF (Gluten Free) but when I told them that I needed it GF and to ensure their was no dairy, they all seemed confused. Thankfully another waitress stepped in and told them that I couldn't have the dressing. My first salad came out work (cheese all over the top even though that isn't on the menu), but they were quick to correct it. The issue with the corrected salad is that they gave me a half portion of lettuce. This place is fine if you don't have other options or if you want a Mexican dinner that is light tasting, but the hospitality and knowledge is lacking with the staff. (also I came around 8pm and there was barely anyone there)

reviews.name: Alyp P.
reviews.review: So I've been here twice now and the first time was awesome. Great service. Sat at the bar- was left alone to read which is nice because some bar tenders really don't pick up on that or want tips for being chatty.The food is good. The Korean bbq tacos are delish.The second time I went in at lunch. The hostess was on the phone and completely ignored me. There was no one else to ask so I quietly said "should I seat myself?". Nodded without looking at me. I sat down and waited for about 15 min until someone else came in and ordered at the front. Wtf?I feel like the hostess ideally should be present with the person in front of them? Maybe someone else could get the phone? I'm not terribly impatient but I feel like that sucked. Going to try them again and see if it was just an off moment.

reviews.name: Jessica B.
reviews.review: Local taco in Brentwood or Sylvan Park are delicious, so I was so excited to see one move in close to us on the east side. However, this location has not been consistent with my experiences at the others. Out of four visits since it's opened, I would say The last two visits were not good and it will probably be a while until we return unless it's just for a margarita on the patio.The drinks and chips and salsa are always  good, but the tacos always seem to disappoint and I would say I've tried at least five different ones. They lack freshness and seem like they were pre made or sitting for a bit before sent to the table. Hoping these experiences were just a fluke for a new restaurant getting on its feet because I've had some really great food at the others!

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: A few friends recommended this place but I'm totally not impressed with this place at all. There was a long wait for my food. The tortillas were flour instead of corn.. Yuck. The food was mediocre at best and were filled with more filler items than protein. The shrimp taco was ok. Overall, I was disappointed and I have learned to never stray away from Mas Tacos again!

reviews.name: Josh H.
reviews.review: Not sure why this place is so well reviewed.At first, I was pleased with the welcoming decor and open air on a nice spring night, though many of their vintage rolling desk chairs are uncomfortable and rickety.The skinny margarita was good and decently priced, but they forgot to salt the rim. The skinny margarita here is a classic margarita: tequila, fresh lime, and agave nectar. This was the only win. The chips and queso were fine, well portioned and met expectations but nothing special.The tacos, though, were so disappointing, uninspired and bland. The grilled steak with horseradish crema was a huge miss. The steak was cold and seemed like it had been sitting for hours. Overall, the flavors just didn't make sense. Their signature "bang bang" sauce was a vinegary excuse for a habanero add on to my spicy shrimp taco, which consisted of four tiny, fried popcorn shrimp.All of this mediocrity was rounded out by a MIA, space cadet server, who ultimately rounded down the score from an average 3 to a below average 2. Can't see why I'd rush back, other than for a margarita on the porch.

reviews.name: Cate H.
reviews.review: This a review for take out. We got the brisket enchiladas & three tacos; fish, brisket and Korean. The tacos were delicious! The enchiladas were below average...and well since its called Local Taco and not Local Enchilada it stands to reason. The service & the attitude of the servers was meh. I arrived five minutes after I was told my order would be ready & I was sent to the bar to wait. After awhile the bartender sullenly asked me what I wanted & then went to get my order & slapped the check down on the bar in front of me without another word. It was very slow in the restaurant so I don't know why he was so bitter but the service makes me not want to return for the sit down experience.

reviews.name: Kina L.
reviews.review: Shortly after the new Fatherland location opened up, a couple girlfriends and I stopped by after a nice East Nasty run. We figured, hey, a 5K totally would compensate for baskets of chips, guac and tacos right? And so it began.We got the trio of sauces that included this black bean corn mix, salsa, and salsa verde. Loved the black bean mix, although you don't get very much. The taco selection was quite extensive including Korean rib tacos, which I ordered. I was disappointed as I felt for almost $4, they should of had more filling. Alongside with my taco, I ordered the Southwest salad with chicken. It was fantastic! Beautifully put together and a sizable portion (~$9). Service wise, I thought they did a great job. I would give them 5 stars for that! Our waitress was very sweet.Overall, I felt the food was O-K, but the atmosphere was a winner. They had a patio that was in the works when we were there, but I can't wait for summer months + beer. Local Taco is located on Fatherland next to Mater of Taste and a juice shop. Very cute area. Oh yeah, they don't have bathrooms inside the place. You have to use the ones right outside that is shared with the local shopping area. Which is not a big deal at all, but just a FYI.

reviews.name: Ashley T.
reviews.review: I've been to this location 4 times, twice to dine in and twice to pick food up. I love the setup and when it's nice enough out (re: not a scorching summer day) I prefer sitting out on the open patio. Margaritas taste fresh and not made from a cheap mix, which is a nice change of pace from most Mexican restaurants. We love the food! I have had the fish, shrimp, and fried avocado tacos, the fried mac & cheese, the street corn, and different salsas with the chips. Everything has been consistently awesome for us. Mine and my husband's favorite is the fried avocado taco with added boom boom sauce. He doesn't even really like avocado and he thinks it it awesome. The fish taco was my least favorite (this is usually my favorite food, period) but it was still good. I prefer grilled or lightly panko breaded and this was battered fish. The fried mac & cheese is so good and comes with a little cup of queso and a little cup of green chili sauce. Friendly servers and reasonably priced for the quality of food.

reviews.name: Jon W.
reviews.review: Highlights:10+ min to get drinks (including bottled beers)When food came out not all of it arrived and some of it was cold. Lots of staff but not a lot of customersBeans not seasonedSeemed like a lack of management, will most likely not return. Tacos were decent which are the reason for the two stars

reviews.name: Alexandra F.
reviews.review: Go to the East Nashville Local Taco. Order any taco on the menu. Love it. Order any cocktail. Love it. Smile. Eat tacos. And fried mac and cheese. Drink. Smile. That's the local taco.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: A Mexican favorite with tons of local flare! I love the changes that they've made to this location offering more entree style dishes like fajitas and taco platters.  They also offer waiter service unlike the Murphy Road location.  Brunch is here on Saturday and Sunday with dishes like "chicken fried chicken" breakfast tacos and mimosas!  I personally like that they sell their tacos individually so you can try as many flavors as you fancy.  I've had them all and they are awesome with quality ingredients and freshness.  It's also fun to indulge in their margaritas and sangria!!

reviews.name: Kate C.
reviews.review: We didn't really enjoy our food. Everything had a lot of sugar in it, and the spicy sauce they charge you extra for wasn't spicy. I got the brisket taco & it tasted like a sloppy joe. The drinks were terrible, but the service was fine & the atmosphere was nice.

reviews.name: Cassie S.
reviews.review: Stopped in here for lunch on a Wednesday.  My experience was pretty good, hence the 4-star review, but I can see where they could use improvement, or what might be an issue at a busier time.The food: I had 3 tacos.  All were excellent (though a little light on the filling in some of them).  I appreciated that they could do any tacos on corn tortillas and also marked which menu items could be made gluten free.  I did not have any of the sides.The area where you order is pretty small and the only menus were on the hostess desk, so no one could even look at the menu until they got to the desk.  I can see that being a major pain in the butt if there are a lot of people.  Also, there's not really room for a lot of people...  Hopefully they'll figure it out.

reviews.name: Tara N.
reviews.review: A regrettable $19 spent. I agree with more recent reviewers on this place not deserving its 4 star mark. The service was pretty much non-existent. In fact, it would have been better as a 'serve-yourself' type of place. You order inside, then someone brings your order to your table. In my case, the food came before the water and my drink - whilst being stormed by flies sitting outside. I had to ask the waitress for hot sauce. Then when she came back napkins. I didn't realize there was no silverware so attempted to eat my corn with my hands (didn't want to get back up to go inside to get a fork, leaving the flies to my food). The waitress never came back to check on me. The food was barely mediocre-the tacos being completely dry and the lettuce of questionable freshness. Overall a regrettable sum of money for what I got. Won't be back.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Order the pitcher of margaritas with no ice.. they pack it with ice.On Monday, you can get $4 margaritas which are cheaper than the pitcher for $21.Just order all your margaritas with no ice.. Wayyyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy too much ice.

reviews.name: Dawn B.
reviews.review: I have nothing good to say, sadly. I wanted this place to be decent because we really need places to eat around here but this place was the rare kind of bad that makes me write a yelp review. There were four empty booths yet it took 37 minutes to get two kids quesadillas and two tacos to go, and the guy didn't even mutter anything when he handed me my food- how about a "thanks/ thanks for waiting/ have a good night/ here you are?" If I'm with my toddler at dinner time I'd appreciate some kind of warning if the kitchen is backed up. All three people I interacted with who worked there were in a bad mood and talked to me like they were annoyed we were there.  No pretense of customer service skills anywhere. I'd like my night back. The food itself was fine. Not excellent. I won't be back because I don't like  feeling like my presence is a nuisance.

reviews.name: Branden B.
reviews.review: Love this place! Fantastic tacos! The bartender was hilarious and really made it a good time. I've been here 3 times in the past month and if I lived closer it would definitely be a weekly trip. If you're nearby and love tacos you should give it a go :)

reviews.name: Katie B.
reviews.review: After spending many nights at the Sylvan Park Local Taco location, I finally made it to the East side location last night - it's even better!Bigger menu, more seating, better atmosphere than the Sylvan Park location (which, by the way, I do not have a problem with. It is just down the street from my office after all...).Can't beat their margaritas - especially at $4 during their weeknight happy hours. I love the enchiladas. In fact, their tacos don't really do it for me. But the enchilada or quesadilla is sure to fill you up and make you happy!Love their guacamole. Love their queso, Love their salsas. Just go ahead and get the trio sampler, it's delicious.

reviews.name: Emily T.
reviews.review: One of the better Locals that I've been to. Service was slow. Our waitress's kept forgetting things and left us stranded a few times. Our tacos were hot and good. The queso was delicious as always. The hostess did notice the neglect and came over to fill our drinks - bonus points to her!

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: Love the fusion options including Korean tacos. The mole was so good and as far as I know, it's the only place in Nashville that has it. Very tasty margaritas. Our service was great. The ambiance is a little fast casual, chain-y for me, but otherwise, a great way to while away an evening. I'm looking forward to some spring weather so I can hang on the patio.

reviews.name: Ji Eun K.
reviews.review: Service is not great; staff could be friendlier. Food was bad. The korean taco was overly salty and the beef in the steak taco was overcooked and tough to chew. House salad didn't have roasted beets as described in the menu and the manager said they've never put beets in their house salad.

reviews.name: Derek M.
reviews.review: Food was outstanding. Unfortunately, we sat at our table for a good 30 minutes before even drink orders were taken. I had to get up and ask the hostess to please send someone to our table.

reviews.name: Thomas B.
reviews.review: In fairness all the other locations are good. This one just has lackluster service and the food isnt prepared with care the same level of effort and care - just isnt seasoned right. The brunch is pretty much eggs on a taco shell with seemingly no booze in the mimosas. I wouldn't waste my time with this one, which is unfortunate since we can walk. Four tries was enough.

reviews.name: J L.
reviews.review: Great food, great service ! My fav place!

reviews.name: Janna R.
reviews.review: We eat here at least every other week. I will usually order a few tacos a la carte and feel full once I add chips and margarita to it. I love the local BBQ, fried chicken, and fish tacos. The corn is so Delish- perfect amount of spice and cheese. We get the trio of dips and have loved every single one. Margaritas are on point!

reviews.name: Laura C.
reviews.review: Eh. This place is O to the K.Pros: Fun funky interior. Super friendly staff. Reasonable prices.Cons: The food is mediocre, at best. Order a taco and you'll get a cold flour tortilla and no seasoning. You must pay extra to have any kind of flavor. People seem to like this place a lot.. Maybe it's because Nashville doesn't know how good Mexican food can be? I was hoping for more. As for now, still ain't no taco like a Mas Taco.

reviews.name: Mike K.
reviews.review: Christmas came early to East Nashville. Mas Tacos aside (because that ish is good too) , East Nashville was lacking in the Mexican Food category.  Rose Pepper has a good atmosphere, but the food is kinda bland. The food/menu at Five Points and Las Maracas is indistinguishable, and although Mas Tacos is great, they close too early.Mix the atmosphere from Rose Pepper, and the freshness of Mas Tacos and you get Local Taco East Nasty.  Full disclosure 'doe: I've only been to the east location once. Future visits will bump dem stars up or down accordingly.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Came here for dinner and the tacos are always consistent with great flavor and a great variety.  The frozen margaritas are where it's at (the pitcher is the best deal).  Definitely coming back!

reviews.name: Rachel D.
reviews.review: The food was great. Hot, fresh, came out in a timely manner. Would definitely return to this place and eat here again. I had the shrimp and chorizo quesadilla and a side of that fried mac and cheese croquette thing. The croquette was ignorant delicious. I would not, however, sit at the bar and be waited on by the disgruntled bartender in the tiny t-shirt. He walked away as he was asking us which type of salsa we wanted. He stood at the computer to take our order so we had to shout and we still had to repeat, as the noise level here is just a touch elevated. Writing it down when he was standing 3 feet closer would have been much more efficient and polite. He never smiled. Once. At first I thought it was perhaps because we were only drinking non-alcoholic beverages. (There was a wait for a table and the bar wasn't even half full, that's the story there). But it wasn't a grudge against us, as I watched him. His demeanor never changed with any of the guests he waited on. Hopefully he was just having an off-night. It certainly won't keep me from returning, but next time I'll just wait the 10 to 15 minutes for a table.

reviews.name: Erica A.
reviews.review: All around not great experience.  We went on a Saturday night, about 9pm.  The place was pretty crowded and loud, but ok.  We sat at the bar, ordered many drinks and food.  The bartender just didn't check up on us at all and it was very hard to get his attention.  BTW, the bar is not big.  I ordered the chicken quesadilla and it was horrible.  I am not even sure there was cheese in there.  It looked like 2 tortillas stuffed with bad canned tuna.  Gross. I am only giving it 2 stars because it is a good location.

reviews.name: Sydney G.
reviews.review: I have been addicted to Local Taco since Summer of 2012. I recently bought a house in East Nashville and had been driving all the way to Sylvan Park to get my fix. Then, one day, I passed Local Taco in East Nashville and could hardly contain my excitement. I was a little confused by the whole ordering process at first. In Sylvan Park they take your order right at the door. Once I was given a menu I realized why it was a little different. The menu is much larger, plus they have breakfast tacos! This just made me even more excited. I did my usual 2 fish tacos with bang bang sauce and then tried a salmon taco. My partner had a steak taco, fish taco and fried chicken taco. They were all great!
