Literally, I have never tasted a better taco in the 24 years of my taco eating experience. Both locations are amazing, but East Nashville wins out due to the updated decor and larger menu. So happy I have one much closer.

reviews.name: Brett M.
reviews.review: 2nd meal, this time with the whole family in tow.  We loved it. Local Taco has gone out its way offer a large menu built around tacos, enchiladas, and quesadilla's. Super service, great flavor, makes Local Taco a likely family habit.

reviews.name: Kendall P.
reviews.review: My husband and I were so excited to have a Local Taco in our neighborhood. The ambience is better than the Sylvan Park location. The decor is more updated and less divey (this also sort of lends it a fast-food vibe that's closer to Chipolte than Mas Tacos or Rosepeppers), but overall, the atmosphere is good, and the patio will be great in warmer months.We ordered the Korean BBQ (great!), the Local BBQ (okay, nothing special), the Spicy Avocado (our favorite).Margaritas are awesome.Overall, we really liked it. The food is good and the atmosphere is nice.

reviews.name: Seventy A.
reviews.review: I almost fell over with excitement when I found out Local Taco was coming to East Nashville. I love it here. I want all the tacos all the time. And don't even get me started on the margaritas!Get the Korean BBQ tacos. Goodness! What a delight! And they make their own margarita mix that is sweetened with agave!!!! I die. Gimme gimme all the time. Ok. I'm headed over now. See you soon delicious taco awesome.

reviews.name: Matthew P.
reviews.review: Loved seeing that they have a location in East Nasty. Great atmosphere and it was warm enough that they opened the garage doors to allow fresh air. The spicy avocado taco with bang bang sauce was excellent as was the Southern Fried and the Korean BBQ.Took my two young kids here around 5:15 on a Saturday and the staff couldn't have been more helpful and understanding. Our waitress, Cristen was great and attentive without being overbearing.Love it and will be coming back.

reviews.name: Amanda B.
reviews.review: My husband and I had one dinner in Nashville, and were very pleased that this was it. I got fried avocado tacos, and he got the local BBQ - both were wonderful. If you're getting sides, you MUST get the Mac and cheese, it's fried into a patty, like nothing you've ever seen, and was soooo good. The Mac and cheese comes with tiny cups of salsa verde and queso too, which made a great addition to our order of chips and salsa. That's right, chips and salsa don't come free, and honestly, their salsas leave much to be desired. The red salsa is a thick paste of chipotle, and the pico de gallo was bland... The lackluster salsas were the only drawback to the meal. This chips themselves were delish! Also, it was margarita Monday the day we went, and the house margaritas were $4. Not sure if it happens every Monday, but it should. The margaritas were great; they didn't skimp on the tequila despite the low price!

reviews.name: Emily C.
reviews.review: Great food and great service. I come from a small town that doesn't have any "clean" eating Mexican food. Everything is very delicious without having to be slathered in something I was impressed with the venue and our waitress was really cool and attentive. I got the cocinero salad and my boyfriend got the kale salad. Very good food!!

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: A good little quick fix, nothing special but a nice hangout with a small group.  Korean taco is yummy. Do not expect the smokin gun margarita to be  consistent, I have had to send it back on two separate trips.  Being told it depends on which bartender is making it  is not really what I want to hear.  This drink really is smokin when made the right way.

reviews.name: Jayme B.
reviews.review: I am a huge foodie! So when it comes to finding yummy local tastes, East Nashville needs to be in your stop. I have eaten here twice so far (both times in the same week)! They have a flavorful and fun combos.  Meals can include sides and I highly recommend the Cuban corn.  I'm sad knowing I can grab a piece right now! The atmosphere is great! Great lighting and modern fixtures add the right amount of hipster to the place with out it being over the top. My faves: Fish taco with jalapeño tarter sauce and the grilled steak taco. I wish there were more drink selections but its not something that should keep you from going...ever.

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: Nice place and nice people.Food was not goodCorn was dry, rice was crunchy and way over seasoned, beans were hard and not cooked.  One of our Steak Tacos (to go) barely had anything in itMaybe they were having an off day?

reviews.name: Toni R.
reviews.review: Had lunch and ordered two tacos.  Chicken taco was ok, steak taco was dismal. Meat was extremely dry and little seasoning. Sides were Ham Hock Pinto Beans and roasted corn. Corn was good, needed salt but good. Beans were grossly overlooked and completely bland.  Could not even eat them.  Service was ok. Not bad, not good.  Wont bother again.  Also, they charge for stale chips and salsa that looks like mud

reviews.name: Trish K.
reviews.review: I've been a loyal customer and lover of the original Local in Sylvan Park for years. I was excited to come to the new location and see familiar faces and try the new menu. The first few times there were great!! However the last couple times were not. The waitresses were inappropriate and didn't get the drink order right nor was our food brought out correctly. I left saying to myself it was just an odd day and decided to give it another try. It's a holiday weekend and they have one server, we stood in the doorway along with several other people lined out the door before someone finally had to ask if we were going to be seated eventually. The hostess was extremely rude to everyone and most people left. Needless to say we won't be back.

reviews.name: Katie O.
reviews.review: I love the flavors they put together on their tacos. I've been a couple times now and have had consistently good food. The queso is also delish. The service is friendly and the atmosphere is really nice, particularly on a nice day with the garage doors open. Love Local Taco!

reviews.name: Stephen G.
reviews.review: One of my FAVORITE taco places in Nashville!! The fish tacos are amazing and the app trio is perfect!

reviews.name: Lauren A.
reviews.review: I haven't been to local taco in several years due to my not so pleasant experience at the sylvan park location (the bartender blasting maroon five pushed me over the edge), but since the new location opened up in my neighborhood I decided it was time to give it another chance. I was very surprised at how nice this place was! The inside is done up nicely and is set up to be a perfect place to go when the weather is nice. They have big garage doors to open up during the warmer months and really make for a nice atmosphere. The menu has gotten an upgrade as well, I love all the new options. The margarita was also quite tasty!  As long as they keep this up and don't run me off with shitty loud music, I'll frequent this new location.

reviews.name: Jeni B.
reviews.review: OMG! ABSOLUTELY DELICIOUS!!!! I went in for the first time, around 20 minutes before they closed. I felt bad about that, but I was treated very nice anyways. I was expecting the regular type of tacos. I asked for the classic 'beef and cheese' and they didn't do that.  I was a little disappointed about that. BUT - little did I know, I was about to have one of THE BEST eating experiences. I am a very picky eater, so the bartender let me have them made however I wanted. I got 3 of the Fried chicken, added cheese and got the INCREDIBLE lime sauce on the side, since I wasn't sure if I'd like it or not. Then, I got 3 of the pulled pork, with BBQ sauce, added cheese. I also got a lemonade. My total was $26.76. I thought that was really expensive... But thought, it had to be good for that price. So, I open up the box and dug in. Took my first bite of the BBQ pulled pork and I was almost in shock how delicious this was. I couldn't tell you how many times I made the - "mmmmm" noise. I'm not even kidding. The meat was definitely high quality, no doubt! It was juicy, tender, everything about it was good. I then tried the fried chicken, I put a little bit of the lime sauce on, took a bite, WOW. "mmmmm" I ate two of the chicken tacos and one of the pork tacos. I REALLY wanted more of the pork, but half of the order was for my special friend. That REALLY felt like a sacrifice! Lol. Not even kidding. I picked him up from work and started handing him tacos as he was driving. His reaction was the EXACT same as mine! It was so funny. He did the whole "mmmmm" thing serveral times while stuffing his face, just how I did. He said a couple times how fantastic it was. AND the tacos weren't even that warm by the time I feed him and it was STILL delicious. I don't understand how some of these people on here have left bad reviews. I am born and raised from Nashville, TN - and The Local Taco is definitely in my top 5 of places to eat....and I've eaten pretty much EVERYWHERE here in Nashville. Who would have ever thought, A TACO PLACE?!?! My review may be over the top here, but I am by no means over-exaggerating! I mean what I say and I'm all about high quality food. This place is 5 stars. If you don't like dealing with problems from servers - then get your food Togo! I couldn't believe that one man's review on here, complaining about flies outside! Well take your butt inside and eat! YOUR OUTSIDE DUDE! It's nature, there's bugs. I will for sure be back to this place. Yay! Thanks Local Taco! Worth every penny!

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: Mis-matched chairs & zany squiggle art gives Local Taco a vibe true to the East Nashville 'hood. Ate on the deck the other day which was pleasant, but will prob just eat inside till more pleasant weather in the Spring. A couple Tequila Lime Chicken tacos satisfied me, specially with verde salsa. It wasn't to busy since word is still getting out about the newest location of Local Taco.

reviews.name: l k.
reviews.review: Why do we keep coming back after multiple mediocre visits here? I guess the answer is easy...the location and the vibe. It's close and convenient and the patio is great...I know we'll be back simply b/c of the patio so that's why I'll give it 3 stars. But something is obviously wrong when on multiple occasions it takes 20-25 mins to get drinks after ordering (no, the restaurant was not packed) and 25-30 mins to get food after placing (again, not packed at all!) our order! I could understand slow service if the place was slammed...but it's never been while we've been there so I'm not sure what the problem is. Do they not have enough kitchen staff...is the kitchen too small/not equipped to handle the restaurant size...do the servers consistently forget to put the orders in? Frustrating! The other negative here is their prices... You have to pay for your chips....and the tacos really aren't that special/they're pretty standard run-of-the-mill/average quality. This place could be way better...

reviews.name: Bryce T.
reviews.review: My favorite place in Nashville for Tacos! I have eaten at a lot of quasi-Mexican restaurants around town and this one is my favorite. They make great taco, have a good selection of local beers, and have good margaritas. The outdoor seating is awesome and the service is superb. Everyone working there always seems like they are in a great mood and have treated me with respect whether I come in dressed nice or just after a long bike ride. If you want tacos and beer/margaritas, this is the place!

reviews.name: Char D.
reviews.review: I love the location but I left feeling a little less than satisfied. Chips were so greasy they shined, couldn't even finish half the queso with them and they left a film on my fingers. margaritas are good but very small. Ordered fajitas, all veggies with maybe MAYBE 10 pieces of chicken, this is a $13 dollar entree. They give you about 5 tortillas but they were all stuck together so when I tried to pull them apart they tore apart. Service was so so. If your looking for a wow experience I'd skip this place, nothing special about it what so ever.

reviews.name: Chad G.
reviews.review: Excellent lunch.  Food was fast, fresh and delicious.  Korean BBQ taco was exceptional.  Glad this is new to the East Side rotation and open on Mondays!

reviews.name: SN D.
reviews.review: friendly staff, great tasting tacos in a cute neighborhood.

reviews.name: Ed C.
reviews.review: Awesome food! Good margaritas. I eat here at least once a week and it's very consistent. They have good salad options too if you're wanting to eat healthy.

reviews.name: MelissaRose B.
reviews.review: So tonight I wanted to celebrate my bday with friends at Local Taco. Tonight it was also the coldest night of the year. I'm sure all the staff wanted to go home early but they were amazing and basically gave the place to us. Service was amazing, the staff was amazing. I live 2 blocks away and will definitely make this a weekly stop.

reviews.name: Stephen L.
reviews.review: Get the creamy jalapeno dip.  Just get it.  It's the best.My girlfriend lives very close to Opry Mills, so Chuy's is a go-to for us.  We visit frequently, so I've experienced peak and off hours.  It's always been a pretty good experience.If you go during happy hour, the chip bar can serve as a meal on it's own!  The burritos are great, as are the chips and salsa.  Margaritas always taste great, too.Servers here vary, but all of them I've experienced do fine.  You do have a chance of getting someone who is over-the-top awesome at their job though.  I've had some real characters wait on me who are witty and cool AND refill the chips and drinks seemingly every time they pass by.  All-in-all a great after-work Mexican dinner, but not a special place for tourists, and I wouldn't wait 30+ minutes for a table, which can be the wait time on the weekends.

reviews.name: Tiffany S.
reviews.review: I am a regular at this particular Chuy's. We go at least once a week and always have great service. We are always greeted within minutes with chips and salsa. Our server is always pleasant and accommodating. Tonight, we had a group of 5. Four adults and one child. When we arrived, we were sat within 15 minutes of requesting a table. We were one short of our group, so waiting to be greeted was not an issue. About 7-8 minutes after being sat, our server Justin L greeted us. He seemed pleasant and upbeat, very nice, and very happy. After bringing us our drinks, he proceeded to take our orders. We went around ordering our meals with a few modifications. He then repeated the order back to us, and when he got to mine I noticed he misheard what I had said. No problem, I corrected him and he placed our order.Food came out quickly and he served us all our meals. My food was placed in front of me and it was not what I ordered... I was kind of shocked because I had already corrected him one time and couldn't believe he had somehow got mixed up again but no big deal. He noticed and took it back immediately. The others had started eating and another person in our group had ordered a modified quesadilla (no chicken)... it was loaded with chicken. She was irritated, but picked the chicken out of the quesadilla no problem.Because my food was taking so long to remake, Justin apologized and told me we would be getting a dessert on the house and the meal would be taken off the check. I thanked him, we then asked for sour cream while we waited for my meal. He forgot. We asked for chips while I waited, he forgot. Finally when my food had come out, it was on point. Perfectly prepared, delicious. BOH did a great job. We asked for our sour cream and chips (for a third time) he finally brought it out. By the end of our meal. We were pretty irritated with Justin. We asked for our checks and told him who was on what check. And some how he screwed that up too...Long story short, Justin screwed up every last thing about our meal and I never got this "complementary" dessert. The experience was terrible and if I am ever sat with Justin again, I will probably ask to move.

reviews.name: Jenn W.
reviews.review: Waited 30 minutes on the wrong food order. Asked to speak with the manager who scoffed as he spoke with us like we were being trivia. Finally offered to take care of our lunch. In the meantime, 45 minutes later, our food came out. We come here every time we are at the mall, which is often. Never again, unfortunately.

reviews.name: Vince H.
reviews.review: Had a quick meal before dropping the wife off at the airport. The chips are always awesome and salsa is great. We always ask for obscene amounts of jalapeño ranch dipping sauce for chips. We love it so much we'd be ok if they just handed us a tub!! My steak fajitas were awesome as always. The marinade is great and the give you a good portion. I hate going somewhere and they are stingy with the meat!! The handmade tortillas are great and make the fajitas that much better!Our server was Crystal and she took good care of us. We let her know we were in a rush and she got us in and out with no problem!

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: Chuy's is the only place that I have seen in Nashville that serves authentic sopapillas - fluffy with an air pocket. Everywhere else, the so-called sopapillas are really just fried tortillas with some honey, syrup, or cream on top.Otherwise, do not go here if you are expecting authentic Mexican food. Chuy's serves more a fusion Tex-Mex with a California/West Coast flare to their dishes. It's not bad, if you're in the mood for that kind of thing. Atmosphere is incredibly touristy. Wait time is usually 45 min+ in high traffic times. Best to go at lunch, if you can. Margaritas are good, but not great, especially for the price.All-in-all: go here for sopapillas. Also, look out for their Green Chile Festival mid- to late-August/early September.

reviews.name: Neisha C.
reviews.review: I came here after going to Opry Mills. It was my first time and I sat at the bar( which is very festive I might add). I got a steak enchilada with rice and beans and a sweet tea. The bartender, Chris, was very helpful and sweet. I'd definitely recommend trying it. The atmosphere is very relaxed and I feel like this might be the place I come to get a little twisted for my birthday

reviews.name: Robert W.
reviews.review: I have heard of this place by some others that have been there. Chuy's lived up to it's great reputation. Music was a little loud for me, but the food was excellent. Service was exeptional. Highly recommend

reviews.name: Katie Y.
reviews.review: Gross!We are from San Diego so maybe our opinion isn't fair since we are used to AMAZING mexican but this place was gross. The chips & salsa are disgusting- we could make better at home sorry to say. The food has way too much sauce & cheese on everything. The food seems like microwaved cafeteria food. We will not be going back- we had to try it at least once though. Still on the hunt for some good mexican

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: After being told that there was a 2 hour wait on a Sunday night at the Mexican restaurant in the Opryland resort, we decided to venture out. We wanted Mexican, so Chuy's was a close option. The wait was only 10 minutes and we were seated. We were brought chips and salsa, plus a creamy sauce that we were told was their house made creamy jalapeño sauce. The chips were excellent and that creamy sauce was amazing! We all preferred it to salsa. Our chips and sauce were refilled multiple times over the course of the meal and two of us even used that sauce as an extra flavor on our meals. The menu is large and it was easy for me to find something as a vegetarian. I ordered the tex-mex salad combo, which included a large dinner salad and a choice of several smaller menu items. I chose a mini- burrito, which was not mini at all, but was compared to their menu burrito (12" long!). I got the bean and cheese, and it came with my choice of sauce over it - I got queso. Our food came out quickly and we dug in. It was yummy! Homemade sauces, fresh ingredient, and flavorful. My burrito was maybe a bit too heavy on the salt but still good. The salad was fresh and the dressing was great. Adding some of that jalapeno sauce to both enhanced the flavors too. My dining companions ordered a steak burrito and fajitas, and both loved them. The portions were too big for any of us to finish... or maybe that was the 3 baskets of chips we consumed. But I digress..So we came back for a happy hour. Their happy hour rocks. House margaritas for $4.25, and a free nacho bar. The nacho bar has their yummy queso, salsa, jalapeno sauce and ground beef. All with unlimited chips. It was like a meal. Price for 4 alcoholic drinks and 1 virgin drink was $23. We were staying at the Opryland resort, where it cost $26 at a bar for one wine and one cocktail. After happy hour we shopped at the mall, had drinks at another bar nearby, and then went to another place for dinner... where we were ignored for 15 minutes. So we walked out and came back to Chuy's for dinner. It was delicious again. 3 days... 3 visits. No shame!

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: Almost all the food was really good way better than a lot of Mexican places.PROS:the chips were the best chips I have ever had. Light crispy salty goodness.the taco salad with sirloin ground beef and fresh fresh veggies was very good. The shell at the top was chewy but the bottom of the shell was really good. The chili relenos with ground beef and cheese where the best I have ate. The light crispy coating was way better than the usally heavy breading ate almost all places. The charro beans were awesome get them instead of the refried beans which are average at best.CONS:The chicken inside enchiladas etc was very bland and boring... stick with the beef or shrimp.The salsa was very very lime like. It was fresh but overly tangy.The refried beans are so average I am saying it twice get the charro beans.The resturant itself had a fun relaxed vibe even when busy. I dont even like chain resturants but this is one that makes things fresh and does it right. I am not a huge fan of the same ol same ol mexican food. This place I truely enjoyed. I would give it a 4.5 but it earned the 5.

reviews.name: Jasmine W.
reviews.review: Great service, short wait time, great food/value. They have a few varieties of salsas/dips on the menu that are no extra charge. We came in at noon on Labor Day to a packed restaurant and waited no longer than 3 minutes for a table. We have only been to the one in Opry Mills mall but will definitely be trying out the one downtown soon.

reviews.name: Candy A.
reviews.review: Food was great and loved it all...the server wss rude and the service all around was not the best...Won't be coming back or bringing friends here again...

reviews.name: Fun C.
reviews.review: Meh...Being from Southern California, I know good Mexican food.  Not only was the food so-so, the margarita I had was nearly all water... No flavor at all.  Luckily I had salt on the rim to help.  I would recommend beer... it can't be messed up.The chicken quesadilla was four individual flour tortillas (different is okay) with cheese and chicken.  Luckily, I added items from the salsa bar to help, but I still wouldn't finish this food; not good.Mexican food needs spices and cocktails need flavor... less ice perhaps.The bar area is "seat yourself," but so small, I'm sure no more than 30 people would be needed to breach the occupancy limit.Location is convenient to the Mall and Opry.I won't return to Chuy's while there are so many great places to eat in/around Nashville.

reviews.name: Courtney H.
reviews.review: I'm not a chain restaurant fan at all, but I have to say I am now a HUGE fan of Chuy's! I am definitely not a fan of any other restaurants in Opry Mills Mall. Their food holds true to Tex Mex and is reasonably priced... And delicious! Their queso is to die for! Our waitress was extremely good, as well. We only had about a 5 minute wait before sitting at a table, and the manager came to thank us veterans/ active duty/ retired military for our service. If you are active duty or retired, your meal (only your meal) is 50% off if you have an ID. Now that was a pleasant surprise and goes to show what kind of appreciation the business has for our military, which I will support any day! Last but not least, our food came out of the kitchen very quick! We will definitely be going to Chuy's again.

reviews.name: Maria S.
reviews.review: I was a little disappointed in the service at Chuys today.  I won't pass judgement on today's experience but it still calls for a mention.   Food a+ drinks a+ service by Pete F.  Sad that I brought out of town friends and raved about hospitality only to be served by someone who didn't see it to serve someone of a different color.  I've seen the racism in the south - but being from NY I refuse to think it's really that way.  Sad to say after a year I experienced it.  Great place to have great food - next time I will just stay away from Pete.

reviews.name: Kelli W.
reviews.review: Went here to celebrate my younger sisters 21st birthday and the staff was not only super friendly but they were accommodating as well. Our server was very knowledgable of the menu and suggested multiple entrees and drinks for us. Their jalapeño ranch dip with tortilla chips is AMAZING and I just about filled up on those alone! They have great margaritas and Chuys is on our list of favorites for the family whenever we all get together!

reviews.name: Leigh Z.
reviews.review: I love the food at Chuy's though since I live in Austin I am spoiled and usually eat at the original location. But during a vacation I found myself hungry and in need of some Mexican food after a visit to the Grand Ole Opry and found this location. I have eaten at several Chuy's through the years and while the food has always been consistently good, the service at this location pushed this to five stars with me. We went for a late lunch on a Thursday....were immediately seated outside per our request....and waited on immediately. Our server was super nice as were other staff we encountered. Food and drinks were both served promptly and were good. We enjoyed our meal very much!

reviews.name: Jeb H.
reviews.review: Best Chili Rellanos you will ever have. My choice is Chicken and Cheese with their hatch green chili. I would take a photo, but I just ate every bite!

reviews.name: Christa P.
reviews.review: Im honestly not a fan of Chuys and even with the convince factor of being at the mall, I avoid it at all costs. First it's a bad version of Americanized mexican food. Second their margaritas are always filled with too much ice and become water (even if you ask for little ice). Third it always seems dirty and sloppy. I have been to the bar side and table side and both times the table/counter was sticky and you needed new silverware because something was caked on. Do yourself a favor, get a better margarita at somewhere else in the mall or get good mexican in nashville at the numerous other places.

reviews.name: Jeff K.
reviews.review: I was traveling on business and some of us stopped here for lunch. I've never been to this chain before, but assumed Americanized Mexican fare and my expectations were met...The PROS-greeted promptly-server was friendly, helpful and accommodating-salsa tasted fresh-portions were goodThe CONS-mall parking lot is overly crowded-no seafood fajita on the menu-salsa was a little too mild-black beans needed seasoning or something...bit bland-tortilla chips broke easilyAll in all this place is  pretty average...I've experienced better food along these lines at Chevy's... I didn't expect authentic Mexican food so the rating is in accordance to other chain tex-mex restaurants.

reviews.name: Charlene C.
reviews.review: Cute restaurant, very colorful.  We both ordered a salad, my husband the grilled chicken and me the taco salad with beef fajitas.  We both thought enjoyed the salads the star being the beef and the chicken.  Service was good.  Loved the chips and the creamy jalapeno dip.  We would eat here again when in town.

reviews.name: Kate J.
reviews.review: There is just something about this place that rocks.While most dishes are really composed just like any other "American-Mexican" restaurant - you know,  the same ingredients folded differently in a tortilla so they can call them, burritos, tacos, enchiladas....anyway, what sets Chuy's apart is their unbelievably good sauces...(umm Boom Boom sauce anyone?? yes,  thank you, and more please!!) , in-house made fresh tortillas, fresh salsa, thin wafer-like chips, and friendly staff, who can say more than 'hot plate!".....not that 's anything wrong with that.The chicken tortilla soup will knock your socks off.....this is soul healing soup. A rich chicken stock filled with fresh roasted chicken, corn, tomatoes, cilantro, a little carrot, topped with cheese and a lime wedge.This particular time, we got  right in with no wait (5:30 on a Monday). Our server was extremely friendly, knowledgeable of the menu and very quick to serve. Good job!The restaurant was clean, and the food was outstanding.Just go...it's worth the wait and it's worth having to unbutton your pants at the end of the meal.

reviews.name: Taylor B.
reviews.review: Food was good and service was awesome.  Always a delight.  Elvis fried chicken with the boom boom sauce with a side of tortillas is the only choice for me.

reviews.name: Andrea W.
reviews.review: I have been eating at Chuy's since I can remember.It's always been a fun quirky place to eat at. I am currently living close to Nashville, TN and when I get homesick for Texas I eat at this location. The staff is always really cool and friendly and the food is every bit as good as the locations in Austin. They have fantastic(strong) Margaritas! Happy Hour is amazing and they offer corn tortillas which is great for people like me who can't eat gluten. Their special jalapeño cream sauce is pretty addicting.*My Chuy's favorites are:Texas Martini,Tortilla Soup. Chuychanga, steak fajitas, Chilli Rellenos and the Elvis plate is so good, but it can probably feed 2 people. When I was in volleyball as a teenager I could eat all of it, but not anymore.The one con I have about this location is how crowded it is. It's attached to Opry Mills Mall and if you hit this place at the wrong time it can be a super long wait. Suggestion is to call ahead and see how long the wait is to prepare yourself or eat at an off time when it is less crowded. Also there are 4 more locations in Tennessee to check out.chuys.com/locations/tenn…

reviews.name: Kelsey C.
reviews.review: We had a great time at Chuy's. Our waiter was so kind. They were really busy, as we came on a Friday night around 8 and the waiter even brought us push pops at the end! He was great! The food was incredible. Their salsa is delicious, as is there queso and jalapeño ranchero sauce that comes with it. Fish and shrimp tacos are awesome, as is the #2 Elvis combo. Most expensive thing on the menu is fajitas at $15 for one or $25 for two. Everything else is around $10 or less. I will definitely come back again!

reviews.name: Jared K.
reviews.review: It is absolutely impossible to find parking at this mall. We were meeting some friends for what was apparently an 18-person birthday gathering. I realize that's a large party, but a 1 hour 15 minute wait at 6:30 on a Tuesday seemed a bit much. Chuy's has a loud, crowded atmosphere. Not relaxing by any means. Don't worry, beer helps that considerably.For my entree, I went with the Seasoned Ground Sirloin Chile Relleno. The menu says it comes with Ranchero Sauce, but our waiter strangely asked what sauce I wanted, so I picked the Creamy Jalapeno for some added spice. Of my rice options, I opted for the Green Chile Rice, to which the waiter replied, "Spicy Rice?" Uh, if those are the same thing, then yes. I also got refried beans with this order. After all of that, I had no confidence whatsoever in what would actually come out of the kitchen. Surprisingly, everything was correct.The beans were nice and mushy, but didn't really have much flavor. The rice was decently spicy. Although it looked a bit dry, it was actually quite nice. My chile relleno had a really good batter. The thick pepper had a nice flavor to it, and the creamy jalapeno ranch was a nice addition. All the spice kind of masked the beef, but that's ok.I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the food, although I'm not sure it's worth the wait.

reviews.name: Nicholas D.
reviews.review: Normally love this place but I got food poisoning the last time I went here. It makes me sad that I probably will never go back to this location, but I I still enjoy their drinks and will definitely go to a different location for food.

reviews.name: Mandi T.
reviews.review: Food was good! Restaurant was clean! Service was great! Started off the night with chips, salsa, creamy jalapeño sauce and the chili con queso. I am a dip fanatic and all three tasted good! The jalapeño sauce is different but delicious. If you don't take it easy on the chili con queso you won't have any room for your entree! For my entree I had steak tacos! Tasted great though the steak was a little on the tough side ... I'm more of a fan of smaller pieces of steak, i.e. Cubed, on tacos vs strips of steak like Chuy's. The rice and beans that are served with the tacos were good, pretty much like you would have at most Mexican restaurants. I always get excited when I find a place that makes "real" mojitos. I'm talking where the bartender has to put a little elbow grease into making it. Well, Chuy's mojitos are just that. If you like your mojitos sweet then you'll enjoy theirs. I had the strawberry mojito and it was just too sweet for me! Overall myself and other guests in my party enjoyed Chuy's and what they had to offer. 4 stars because there's always room for improvement :)

reviews.name: Danielle L.
reviews.review: Family friendly. Decent prices. Fun atmosphere. Great service!!  The guacamole is awesome!  The steak burrito was filled with delicious steak but the tortilla was too thick. I would eat here again.

reviews.name: Michael K.
reviews.review: it got good reviews and went there based on those and being starving.  it was not mexican but tex-mex.  not my thing apparently.  and its a chain (which normally isnt my thing)thin tortilla chips broke with ok guacamole.   the salsas were yummysilverware came in wasteful packaging.  i appreciate sanitary silverware but really dont see the need for silverware sleeves.  how about just wash them really well?the waiter had a good explanation on the sauces available and made suggestions based on what we ate.  but there were too many choices.a lot of food.  lots of cheese.   all of it just ok.

reviews.name: Jarrame B.
reviews.review: Love it!! Good staff. Great fresh made tortillas. Fresh chunky salsa!! Nothing to suggest this go around. The food definitely makes typical Mexican joints seem bland. Fellows, beware!! There is a H&M next door. So, if you are with the wife and/or daughters you will spend some money. Go ahead lol!! Back to the restaurant. The food is well priced!! Check it out!!

reviews.name: Kelly T.
reviews.review: I don't understand why this place is so busy.  Came in with a friend for lunch, had the chicken tortilla soup which looks like  one of those top ramen you buy at the grocery poured with hot water.  Awful!  Never again.

reviews.name: Christina S.
reviews.review: Actually connected to the Opry Mills mall, Chuy's entrance is on the outside. Chuy's is a great chain and I love the chips and chili cheese sauce. The chuy-changa is yumm.  Sit in the middle seating area.  The side room is a little boring and hot.

reviews.name: Paul T.
reviews.review: We went for shopping at the Opry Mills malls a few weeks ago. Many stores had 40-50% discounts, which made our shopping experience a pleasant one.Our lunch at the Chuy's was as good. Chuy's sounded like Chinese to me, but my wife who spent a few years in Austin, TX had high expectations of this Tex-Mex chain. Chuy's apparently started their business in Austin. Their service, food, and price all met her high expectations. We had a deluxe quesadillas, a comida deluxe combo, and an Elvis Presley combo for four adults. And queso. My wife had been looking for good queso for a long time and she finally was satisfied this time.For me, the quesadillas were slightly bland. But that was compensated by the tacos, which I liked it very much. The portions were huge, fresh and tasty. The price was reasonable as well. The waitress was attentive and friendly.

reviews.name: Jen B.
reviews.review: I almost popped a tear of joy when we drove by this mall and I saw that a Chuy's location had been opened since we were in town last. I LOVE Chuy's. LOVE love. After living in Austin Texas for a few years, it is one of the few things that I truly miss about living in the Lone Star State.Because I don't get to visit very often, I always get the exact same thing; A swirl margarita (a swirl of lime and strawberry frozen margaritas twisted together, perfectly balanced flavors) and a Shrimp & Cheese Chili Rellano with Deluxe Tomatillo Sauce, please. The guacamole is great, too. I love going during happy hour when the nacho bar is open and margaritas are discounted.The atmosphere is nothing but fun. The decor is something like PeeWee's Playhouse. The food is seriously good and the margaritas are perfection.Since this location is sort of new, they have a deal where is you bring in a framed picture of your dog to help decorate the Chihuahua bar, you get a free appetizer. Do it!

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: What a good tex-mex place. First the portions are large so come hungry. We were able to sample all there sauces and they were all good. I gave them 4 stars because for a chain they are above average, the waiters were excellent and they make there own tortillas. So big plus there. I had the Elvis memorial combo on the first eating and it was huge and very flavorful. The chicken is real chicken, the ground sirloin is real sirloin and the corn tortillas, the blue corn tortillas and the flour tortillas where perfection, cooked to just enough charring to where they weren't doughy but weren't dried out either. The sauces were fresh tasting with a great balance of heat. Ask to try the creamy jalapeño ranch and dip your chips in it. Delicious!!! Price is $9 and up.

reviews.name: Tony W.
reviews.review: Came here on Cinco De Mayo with a large group, at lunch, and still have nothing but good things to say. They had a free nacho bar, they offer several salsa's to compliment the free chips they give you when you walk in. The food was not only hot and fresh, but also delicious. I had a combo meal and would have probably cleaned my entire plate if we didn't run out of time. I usually prefer not to eat at chain restaurants when I travel, but we don't have these back home. If we did, i'd be a regular.

reviews.name: Shannon M.
reviews.review: The place is very clean! It was my bf very first time here and he loved how the place looks already. He is a huge fan of mexican food so when I told him about this place he was very excited! The chips and and salsa were AMAZING!!! The beef for my fajitas were the best I've ever had! My BF loved his burrito he ordered. He was so shocked at how big they came. We couldn't even eat all our food. I highly recommend this place for mexican food lovers!!! They also have a daily deal special every day!

reviews.name: Elliott W.
reviews.review: Chuy's still is my favorite teximexichain. The Opry Mills location has delivered on the promise to keep me happy twice with perfectly tender and delicious steak fajitas. And the added bonus is showing up during happy hour for free queso and pulled pork on the thunderbird bar, which we made copious use of. By the time dinner came out, we'd already had a full meal of pork nachos!Chuy's at Opry Mills servers their salsa a little chunkier than other locations that I've visited. I don't know which way is the Chuy's standard, but I'm not complaining. Its great both ways.Always a value. Always satisfied.

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: This place is great, my girlfriend and I get there about twice a month and split the fajitas for 1!, yes I said 1! It's more than enough, and with the extra money we save by not ordering for two we get more margaritas which are delicious and priced well, waitstaff has been tremendous every time too!

reviews.name: Christopher V.
reviews.review: You can never go wrong with Chuy's. Best Tex-Mex around that's for sure. Service was great, making sure they always kept my glass and chips full. They sell funny T-Shirts as well.

reviews.name: Millah J.
reviews.review: The wait was very long...they could be better organized. We finally found a table in the bar area and the service (Shea) was excellent! Shea was attentive and friendly. We were celebrating my birthday and they surprised me with sopapillas - which were delicious!! PLUS I was serenaded with a birthday song by "T" who has a phenomenal voice. Needless to say, I had a wonderful time! I tried the Comida Deluxe Combo (#1) for the first time - my usual is chicken flautas or the chuychanga - and I'm glad I did! I just wish my stomach had more room to fit it all!! If you're on the fence about going, GO! Just don't go on a Saturday night. And be sure to ask for the creamy jalapeño dip - you're welcome (trust me, you'll thank me)!

reviews.name: Armand K.
reviews.review: Far exceeded expectations.Was staying at the Gaylord Opryland Hotel and after dining at Cascades, supposedly their best restaurant onsite, knew we had to venture out for dinner. Chuy's was not only recommended by some of the Opryland staffers, but also was the top rated place within walking distance on Yelp. 3.5 stars didn't sound terrible, but going to Tex_mex in Tennessee seemed a little odd. Nonetheless we checked out Opry Hills Mall and two-stepped our way into Chuy's.4PM-7PM every weekday is their Happy Hour. Beyond a few drink specials, including their signature Margarita's and the Texas Martini (a Margarita served in a shaker bottle with a Martini glass garnished with jalapeño stuffed olives and a wedge of lime), the happy hour also includes unlimited house made tortilla chips, queso (nacho cheese sauce), seasoned beef, and their new creamy jalapeño sauce. After ordering drinks and loading up our nachos, we we're already pretty satisfied, and opted to share the waiter-recommended chicken fajitas. Served on a hot skillet with all the toppings you'd imagine (including guac) they were incredible. Not only was the chicken perfectly cooked, but the home made tortillas make a huge difference in overall taste.The ambiance is a step up from other casual restaurants in the same price range. Unlike an Applebees, Chili's, etc, most of the art inside Chuy's is handmade like the food. We skipped on dessert, but overall had an incredible experience. I know a big part of our satisfaction, was due to the gentleman who was serving us. When we ran out of fajita tortillas he even brought us a few extra for the last few pieces of chicken we had. I'm looking forward to my trip to Austin so I can visit the original.Pro-tips:-Go during 4PM-7PM Weekday Happy Hour-Try the Texas Martini-Portions are large

reviews.name: Jason K.
reviews.review: Pretty much what you'd expect from a Mexican chain restaurant at a mall. The guac was pretty plain and uninspired...but they fry their tortilla chips fresh...they arrived impossibly thin, hot and crisp. Enchiladas were pretty mediocre as were the sides. However, service was very friendly...our waitress brough my wife an order of sopapillas on the house for her birthday (they were ok). You could do much worse at the mall.

reviews.name: Richard S.
reviews.review: This place is great. It's always busy always loud and aways taste great. I love the creamy jalapeno dip. Appetizer sampler is even better. Awesome!

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: After getting robbed by Opryland for low quality food at stratospheric prices, we just had to eat at Opry Mills. Yelp led me to Chuy's and once I saw green chile dishes on the menu, I was in.This is the first place I've seen outside New Mexico with green chile anything, and they had Hatch chile, too. Reasonable prices + big portions = strong value. My son had soft tacos, which were a bit spicy for him (fine to me), and I had the "Southwestern" which is "a New Mexican tradition. Homemade blue corn tortillas stacked with freshly-roasted, hand-pulled chicken, cheese & Green Chile sauce, topped with a fried egg"; I really enjoyed it.The ceiling of the room we were in was covered in wheel covers/hubcaps; the rest of the place was similarly adorned. Our server, Ashley, was very nice and efficient.I intended to return but could not talk my unadventurous peers into ditching Romano's (chain) for Chuy's. Their loss.Recommended.

reviews.name: A H.
reviews.review: We love Chuy's, but this location isn't the greatest. The Franklin, TN and Murfreesboro, TN locations are the top one's in the middle TN area. If you order the smaller portion of a meal here you will receive a tablespoon of rice and three bites of the main item you order. It was as if I had a half of a kids meal. Very disappointed. I'll stick to the other two locations as they don't try save money on portion control. Won't be back to the Opry Mills location.

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: Awesome Tex-Mex food! I love the Shiner Bock marinated fajita beef. The creamy jalapeño dip is awesome too! This place is crowded at lunch time, so there is usually a wait, but it's worth it.

reviews.name: Rob C.
reviews.review: The in house soft tortillas are terrible. The service is very poor. My wife got the enchiladas and liked them. But the tacos are terrible.

reviews.name: Sandra F.
reviews.review: Wow! I love the creamy jalapeño sauce!  The waitress called it liquid crack... She's right.  I need to detox now.  Love the quirky atmosphere and the food is great. Witless be a five star if margaritas were better. Our waitress, Kalisa, was awesome!

reviews.name: Libby B.
reviews.review: This is one of my favorite places to come on a nice day. I've happily spent many an afternoon here enjoying margaritas and conversation.Speaking of margaritas, they have a couple new ones which are fantastic. The newest flavors are blackberry and watermelon, and both are amazing. You really can't have just one either! Their sangria is also top notch, and just as addicting.I've always had good service here. The waiters are good about checking on you and making sure your chip basket is full, your drinks don't run out, and that you get that 3rd order (no shame) of jalapeño ranch straight away.The food is pretty tasty, I have had their enchiladas and their tortilla soup on several occasions. Honestly I feel like they have some of the better Mexican food in town - too many places in Nashville seem have too watered down salsa and lackluster tacos.

reviews.name: Rebekah T.
reviews.review: After heading back to the hotel, we stopped into Chuy's for one last cocktail on our last night. Still early enough to try one more spot in the neighborhood.We sat at the bar and ordered a couple Margaritas, mine with a Cornita stuffed in it. Ridiculous and somewhat delicious in a overindulging way. *wink*Service was okay, but my guy was a little put off by the way they started closing down the area while we were still there. It wasn't closing time, but obvious that employees were getting ready to go. That was our cue to leave too.

reviews.name: Katie M.
reviews.review: I go just for the Jalapeño dip! It is amazing! The food is average, definetly not authentic. The atmosphere is fun for a family. Very noisy! Perfect place to bring someone you don't really want verbally interact with! That annoying coworker for example. Y'all go out for a drink after work and really hoped they were not going to join the group. Well...problem solved!We prefer the one at Opry Mills Mall, consistent with great customer service.  Wait staff is always attentive even with a two hour wait!

reviews.name: Carol M.
reviews.review: Simply, one of the better choices of restaurants at the Opry Mills Mall.  I would much rather eat here than at the food court or Fridays.  In my opinion, it's a little over priced for tex-mex.  The cheese dip is really good and the tortilla soup was okay.  I believe the tortilla soup was considered a signature dish but I didn't really notice anything  signature about it.  The atmosphere is a little funky and upbeat.  I can see where this would be a great place to bring the kiddos!

reviews.name: Mehgan H.
reviews.review: Chuy's...not real Mexican food.Of course, you know that when heading into the restaurant but you still expect your traditional Mexican food.I have tried out this place a few times and the only thing that I have liked is the cheese dip and the Coronita (corona beer in a margarita) drinks.All of the entree meals fell very short of what I hoped for. There wasn't any intense flavor or any "mmm" factor - it was just food.If you are looking for a place to eat Mexican food...I would not recommend going here.

reviews.name: Sean S.
reviews.review: Took off a star for the chips and salsa.   Chips were a little on the soft and soggy side and the salsa was missing something.  We ordered the queso dip which seemed a bit lacking as well. Cheese dip tasted similar to some velveeta dip I make at home. On the plus side, their chili sauces are awesome and the service was phenomenal. Our waiter was there when we needed him and never let us run out of anything. I asked if there was anything spicy on the menu and he brought out a sampler of sauces and let me pick just the right thing for my palette!Loved the chicken chili avocado enchiladas that we're on special for Tuesdays.  Entree and sauce carried this to a 4 star review after a slow start.

reviews.name: Holly W.
reviews.review: Service was great by Ashlee K and food was excellent! Great chili and the chips and salsa were very fresh!

reviews.name: Bryan A.
reviews.review: If I could score this place negative stars I would...I'm sitting at the bar right,  this trick walks buy and ask what will you be having...she's about 15/20 feet from me trying to multi-task.  I scream my order to her with appetizer first, she repeats it and I NEVER see her again...Needless to say,  my entrée never showed up.  This fat ass dude is running the bar at this point brings my check and asked is there anything else...i said yes my food???  You kmow what...nevermind,  I'm leaving...he says im sorry...   and that was IT

reviews.name: Ashleigh V.
reviews.review: Got into Nashville for a conference and immediately needed margaritas after a long day of traveling. We sat at the bar and had Natty as our bartender. She was amazing and extremely attentive. Best service I've received in SO long. And the food was good too! Great atmosphere, great food, great service.

reviews.name: Matt B.
reviews.review: Second trip here, worth coming back for. I would give 5 stars if they served Sol Beer and had an ala carte menu.  Cheese sauce and jalapeño ranch dip rule.  Very friendly and accommodating.

reviews.name: Todd G.
reviews.review: As close as you can get to authentic New Mexico style Mexican food. Best green CHILE comes from Southern NM and that is where Chuy's buys their green CHILE (HATCH, NM). I really enjoy their Tuesday special of green CHILE chicken taquitos.

reviews.name: Brian A.
reviews.review: Cons- slightly noisy. Our host was wearing skinny jeans that intentionally showed his underwear. Just too casual for me. Pros- Salsa is similar to what I'd make at home; very fresh. Our waitress,  Crystal,  was very quick to tend to our needs.

reviews.name: Mario E.
reviews.review: Every time I visit Nashville, I can always count on great service and food at a great price!

reviews.name: Cheryl B.
reviews.review: It's Chuy's. It's delicious. It's a chain I (and many others I know) frequent in Texas. We were pleasantly surprised to find one here. Texas martinis are fantastic, the salsa is super fresh and the chips are perfectly crispy just like we get in Texas. If you're lucky enough to be here during hatch green chili fest, it gets even better.

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: It's not really a Mexican restaurant, it's Tex-Mex, and it's pretty good.  We arrived after 9 on a Friday night and had about a 10 minute wait.   The prices are reasonable, especially considering that it's in the mall and next to the Opry.Steve L was our server, and he did an outstanding job.  Even though he was keeping several tables happy, he still took the time to answer our questions about their sauces and menu items. My wife and I both had the chile relleno and enchilada combination.  She had a beef-stuffed chile relleno and while it was good, I definitely preferred my cheese and shrimp stuffed relleno with the tomatillo sauce.  She had the chicken enchilada and I had the Chicka Chicka Boom Boom enchilada.  It was delicious, and really woke up my taste buds.  I was glad to have the Grand Ma's Rockin Margarita to chase it with.We took home fish and shrimp tacos to our daughter, and she really enjoyed them.  The fish wasn't overcooked like so much seafood is here.

reviews.name: Corey W.
reviews.review: Good place. Not a great place. I give it 3 stars not 4 simply because it is nothing that stands it apart. Don't get me wrong, I don't think it will disappoint if you are looking for the good tex-mex staples at a good price. One thing you should definately try is their side sauces. I think most don't realize you can get them with your meal or chips for free and it adds alot of flavor to the meal. Definately better than only having salsa. They have them on a side fold out on the menu.Not sure about the other locations but if it is anywhere near mealtime plan on this place being packed. You are going to wait 30 minutes or more before being seated. Once you do sit down though it can go pretty quick.Food is good but nothing terrible unique.Only three stars but I will definitely be back when I'm in the mood for some cheap tex mex. It's just not a place I would brag about or is on the must go too when guests are in town.

reviews.name: Shawn S.
reviews.review: For our only dinner in Nashville, I really did not want to go to a chain but it was convenient and since we were short on time, we gave Chuy's a shot.  We were not disappointed.  Crystal, our server, was one of the best servers I've ever had and really paid attention to what we were looking for in our food.  We asked about the different salsas and instead of bringing us out one, she brought out a dish of every kind they had along with explanation of the ingredients.  She was attentive, friendly and fun.  We had the combo fajitas - the meet was flavored perfectly and the onions and peppers sautéed nice and crisp.  Now if only they had one in Denver :)

reviews.name: Jonathan W.
reviews.review: Delicious! We went to eat here with family when we were in town for a wedding. Absolutely delicious with friendly and attentive staff. All 7 of us ordered different things and not a single person left disappointed or hungry. There was so much flavor and the options were numerous leaving me to believe I could have eaten there for a month straight and would still not have tried everything.    I would recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting the Nashville, TN area. As an added bonus, before or after the meal feel free to spend hours walking around the Gaylord Opryland Resort which will amaze you! Then, if you still have energy, walk through the Opry Mills mall which Chuy's is attached to for another great experience.

reviews.name: Randal V.
reviews.review: This place never has let me down. If you're visiting Nashville this may be one of the safest bets to eat good food on a pretty low budget.  Very friendly on their portions and good with the presentations. Last time I asked for a side of guacamole and I got a bowl of it. Little things like that made my meal more enjoyable. If you get a chance try their stuffed peppers. If you're a vegetarian like me, they have some filling options as well.  I usually get the burrito with beans and rice and they always make it amazing with some type of chipotle sauce and great vegetables inside it. This is not a burrito you will see at most restaurants as its like a pound or more and very delicious.  I heard a great rumor that they're expanding into Hendersonville which is closer to me than this location. Makes me happy that Blue Coast won't be my only resort lol. I'd love to give five stars but the only reason I'm doing 4 stars is that they don't buy all vegetables from the local farmers which is a deep passion of mine. Chipotle's model is five star worthy to me but their atmosphere is 4 stars. It's vice versa here to me. Great atmosphere and really good food. If I could do 4 1/2 stars I would.

reviews.name: Greg M.
reviews.review: I'd call it fast food Mexican style, with a wait.  The macho burrito was dry, pre-plated and lacked any defining flavors. The chips were fresh, on the bright side. Note to self: when the waitress says the plate is really hot, just send it back.

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: I seem to keep taking people here when they come to town - meal and a mall all in one.  It works.I first ate a Chuy's in Round Rock/Austin, TX and loved the place so I was excited when they opened up by me at Cool Springs.  It really doesn't matter which location you go to, they are all good.It's not really Mexican and it's not really that 'Southwest' Green Chili type cooking either but it is good and I always assure people that say they can't eat Mexican because it's too hot or makes them sick, this isn't the greasy Mexican place in the old strip center.  It's more like ChiChi's or El Chico.Some of the best tortilla soup around.  I always have them bring me their jalapeno/cilantro ranch sauce to eat with my chips.  I love their chips - so thin and light like El Chico's.  All of their salsas and sauces are good so it's hard to chose but definitely try this one.  My daughter isn't even a huge fan of salsas or ranch dressing or such but she loves this stuff.Everything I have tried is good but I am sort of stuck on the Baja Tacos.  You can chose fried fish or fried shrimp - you get two so they will also let you get one of each which is what I do.  The fish and shrimp are nicely seasoned and have a crispy, not overly light or overly thick breading.  They are on nice soft warm flour tortillas with a slaw and the jalapeno/cilantro dressing.  You also get your choice of rice and beans - they have both a more traditional Spanish rice as well as a green chile rice which I prefer and they have refried beans or some ranch style beans.  Portions are good if not huge.The sopapillas are a perfect way to finish off your meal.It gets crowded but they are always friendly, fast, and service is good.

reviews.name: Tara S.
reviews.review: I love Chuy's so much! They have awesome fajitas and delicious margaritas. Their happy hour isn't as good as other places. They only take off $1.50 for a margarita compared to most places that are buy one get one free or half off. I had 2, saved $3.00 and was still tipsy when I left so I was satisfied. I would've given them 5 stars if it wasn't for the happy hour specials and their customer service is a bit hit or miss. More hit then miss but none the less. Every time I go in I see different servers so I don't know if it's a high turnover or I'm just going on the wrong days. I try to stay as far away as I can from the mall on the weekends because of the nutty people and backed up traffic.

reviews.name: Ceile G.
reviews.review: A little pricy for fork and knife in paper sack, but delicious ask the same. The chips are thin, fresh, and hot! Guacamole side is pumped up by a bed of lettuce. Very nice ambiance.

reviews.name: Gai P.
reviews.review: #chainrestaurant #notbad #cheapbeers #hotchipsI decent go-to joint with reasonably prices beers. I don't think there's a bottled beer that's priced over $4 at this Opry Mills location.  The chips are light and served pretty hot which is great. The menu items are not as extensive but simple enough. The entrees are good but nothing to write home about.  The prices for the entrees are very inexpensive.  Great if you want to eat & get out about your business.

reviews.name: Gary H.
reviews.review: By far one of the best Mexican restaurants I've been to in a while. From the nachos and salsa, to the burritos. Great flavor. Great portions. They even make the tortillas right in front of you. Oitstanding!!!

reviews.name: Denise B.
reviews.review: Two words Stay Away! I sure expected more from a chain restaurant.  Apathetic staff who really didn't want to be there..prices were high for typical TexMex fare. To top it off apparently food and dishes are pre-made..came out immediately and was cold.  I chose not to send food back for good reasons..so the whole journey was an endurance test that was over quickly

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: Dear fine purveyor of "authentic Mexican food" (who seems to think that the "Mexican-by-the-numbers" chain joints are authentic Mexican, and who hated Chuy's so much he apparently went to two different locations to decide he hated it, since he reviewed both of them),I can't believe someone went here thinking they were going to eat "authentic Mexican food." Read much dude? Check the front of the menu. They never claimed to be authentic Mexican. It's chain Tex Mex. It's a great replacement for the failing Don Pablos that you have to drive 3 hours for now, since they closed half of them.  Their food is pretty dern tasty, but no, it's not authentic Mexican food, "for the dumbasses that like that crap." I guess authentic Mexican restaurants would make their own tortillas in-house. (OOPS! Chuy's does that.)  I'll take fresh food that's made by health department standards any day over "authentic Mexican."  Try the Comida Deluxe, for a little bit of everything. Great margaritas too. Also, free make your own nachos in the bar at happy hour is a bonus.

reviews.name: Albert W.
reviews.review: This is the same Chuy's like in Austin.  I can't believe Chuy's Tex-Mex has gone this far east.    I was expecting a water down clone but this place does the same things as in Austin.    They make their tortilla and chips fresh and they're not stingy on the salsa.   All in all, I would have said this was my best meal in Nashville (sorry.. had to stay at the resort).

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: We went on New Year's Day, the service was great, staff had great suggestions on food and drinks. Staff was friendly and efficient, food was good.We will visit again!

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: So got take out as we were staying nearby. Place was busy but was able to place order immediately by VERY friendly staff. Waited about 20 minutes, which was what I was told for how long it would take. M'lady got taco salad and enjoyed it greatly. "Bowl" was cooked well, ground beef well seasoned. I had a chile relleno with Hatch green chile salsa and a chicken enchilada meal (#4) with ranchero sauce. Honestly, after having so much cruddy mexican food from slop houses that were allegedly "authentic" this food rocks. Considering how you have to season food to please the masses, this stuff is awesome. All the food had flavor, rice and beans were standard fare, creamy jalapeno dressing had a kick. Go and enjoy it!

reviews.name: Megha M.
reviews.review: I have only been to the Opry Mills location , so cant speak for the other about the ambience. But I have stepped into this place a couple of times and decided not to eat because of a funky smell to the place. And no, its not because of the mexican food.  I did however venture in recently with a friend and LOVED the creamy jalapeno dip. Me and my friends call it "crack ranch" because its so addicting. The main food was okay - just like any other mexican place . Let's just say I've had better. Will go back for the margaritas and the creamy jalapeno dip .

reviews.name: Jamin F.
reviews.review: My wife and I tried this based upon reviews we read here. Some of the best Mexican we have ever had. The creamy jalapeño salsa is amazing. Never received our food faster either. Great service. You will not be disappointed. Do yourself a service and go there now.

reviews.name: Linda M.
reviews.review: As I traveled south, I saw this new Tex-Mex restaurant.  I wish they had the menu WITH prices online.  So when I got to TN, I took the opportunity to try it.  I walked from the Opry Mills Mall Food Court to Chuy's (2 phases down) and was not turning back.  So I tried their Queso Compuesto -- chile con queso with seasoned ground sirloin, guacamole and minus the pico de gallo.  Sirloin looked like ground beef.  So pricey.  I did not care for their complimentary salsa.I ate at the bar as it was first come, first serve.  Watched a NFL hockey game.

reviews.name: Megan F.
reviews.review: The chips, jalapeño dip and Chuy's margaritas are enough to keep me coming back! Fortunately, I always have great service as well! DeMarko is an amazing server and always guarantees a good experience!

reviews.name: R R.
reviews.review: This place is AMAZING, especially for a chain and especially for being in a mall! There's usually a pretty lengthy wait on weekends or right at popular dinner times, but it's so worth it. The dips are amazing. The happy hours are a great deal!

reviews.name: Christy M.
reviews.review: Great Texas Margs and free nacho bar! Love them!!!! The service was great and it's just a fun place to be :)

reviews.name: Afkham N.
reviews.review: Chuys is a Tex-mex tradition and i have always been a fan of the salsa choices and the Chili Rellenos. the Elvis Chicken with the Lays potoato chips crust is different but can be a bit on the bland side due to the chips and can get soggy and the crust falls off if you get it with the sauce over it thats why i always go with the Chili Rellenos, usually takes care of lunch AND dinner . this location is ALWAYS packed to the brim, so expect a wait time anything between -20 minute to an hour.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: This place is a fun place with great Mexican! Love the veggie enchiladas & milk cake!

reviews.name: Casey C.
reviews.review: Absolute best experience I have ever had eating out in my life!  I DEFINITELY recommend this place out of anywhere!  Their food is phenomenal, service was awesome, prices are great, and they have the best management I have ever dealt with!

reviews.name: Bob S.
reviews.review: Fantastic food.I have never had a bad meal at a Chuys. The atmosphere is very pleasant and fun

reviews.name: Tony S.
reviews.review: Chuy's is a unique Mexican restaurant.  Although I enjoyed the food, the service is very hit or miss.  As we were told the wait would be 15-20 minutes, but turned into almost 30, we overheard several servers talking to what I assumed to be the manager about leaving early and complaining about their tables.  This seemed very unprofessional to be doing right at the front of the restaurant in the waiting area.  Once we were finally seated our server was pretty prompt and got our chips, salsa and drinks to us right away.  We had the queso cheese dip and it was very good, I didn't much care for the very chunky salsa and asked what else they had, she recommended the creamy jalapeno ranch.  It was delicious, I even ordered extra to put on my main dish.   I would recommend Chuy's for a good meal and atmosphere just don't expect too much in the way of service from the wait staff.

reviews.name: Mich B.
reviews.review: Great, fast, delicious.  Our server, casey, was great and was very patient and helpful with our first visit.  He went out of his way to make sure everything was perfect and we were happy. Thanks Casey, we will come back next time we visit Nashville.

reviews.name: Kayla D.
reviews.review: The wait at this place is almost ALWAYS ridiculous (minimum 1 hour).. But it's worth it. The food is great, service is usually great as well. We always get the creamy jalapeño ranch for our chips- you have to ask for it but it goes SO well with the salsa and chips.

reviews.name: Darlyn S.
reviews.review: For all of you who love Mexican food, this is the best place in Nashville TN.  OMG, such flavor and the ambiance is most unusual but totally unique.

reviews.name: Bret D.
reviews.review: Not sure how anyone can be passionate about this restaurant on the good side or the bad side.  It is your typical chain Tex-Mex experience on the above average side.  Not sure if they are trying to be Tex-Mex or authentic.  The website says recipes come from South Texas, New Mexico, and border towns.  Then it makes mention of "authentic Mexican food at a great price." Que eres,  chiche or limonada?I arrived at the Opry Mills location at 11:45 on a Friday.  There was already a wait for  a table.  Fortunately for me, (or unfortunately, depending on how you look at it) I was dining alone so I sat myself at the bar.  The bartender attended to me promptly.  I ordered the Friday special which is Hatch Green Chile Chicken Enchiladas.  He brought out a basket full of chips and salsa.  The chips are really good as they are fresh and paper thin.  Salsa is also good as it is heavy on the lime and chunky.  It needs a little more heat but once again I have to tell myself - this is a Tex-Mex chain not Nolensville Rd.The enchiladas came after about 10 - 15 minutes.  They were piping hot and it was a generous portion.  Flavor was good with a reasonable amount of white breast meat.  My only gripe was that the only presence of Hatch Green Chiles was two 4 inch long threads about as wide as a shoe lace.  The dish would have been much better with about 5 times the amount of chiles.I have tried to eat dinner at the Cool Springs location only to be turned off by the incredible long waits.  The food is good, not great.  I certainly would not wait 30+ minutes for a table unless someone else was picking up my margarita tab!

reviews.name: J. K.
reviews.review: Food = Excellent (reason this is 2 star instead of 1 star)Service/Experience = Terrible.This was my second trip to Chuy's Nashville.  I was there a few months ago (Christmas) and the service was slow but not ridiculous.  This week, was another story!  I took colleagues out for dinner.  Here is our 2 hour experience as succinctly as possible:-  Arrival good, only had to wait 10 minutes or so.-  Arrival bad, no silverware - hostess advised she would bring some out shortly (she never did)- Server ("JC"), really terrible.  He was slow, acted like he didn't want to be there, and when he was asked what choices of beans they had, his response was, "I don't know, look at the menu."  Seriously JC?  Aren't you supposed to KNOW what beans you have?-  Appetizer plate and queso order took more than 30 minutes- Dinner order took almost an hour!We were in the restaurant right at two hours, it was ridiculous.  Even more ridiculous, the lack of professionalism.  After waiting for entrees for ~35-40 minutes, we asked for a manager - he didn't arrive.After a few minutes more we asked to see the manager a second time, he didn't arrive (we were told he was in the kitchen helping with food).A few minutes more, we ask for manager a THIRD TIME.  JC responded, "do you want him to come out here or get your food?".The table next to us had a similar experience - waiting a LONG time for food, their kids were crying that they wanted to go home, it was a joke!Finally the food and the manager arrives.  Basically he said they were busy and, "having one of those days".  Then, for the really odd part, when the check comes, JC dropped it and walked off.  I take a peak and see that all of our meals were comped.  While this was a nice gesture, I found it SHOCKING that JC nor the manager said a word.  No, "sorry this happened, allow us to comp your meal" or "please give us another try later", he just dropped the check and walked off.Very strange and unprofessional.BTW, JC really is a terrible waiter - he had to be "flagged down" to come to our table, would disappear for 20 minutes at a time, had to be asked multiple times for everything from drink refills to salsa, napkins, etc.  He was curt, had attitude, and had to rely on other servers to help him out.At the end of the day, the food here is really good but I have to seriously question the management at this location.  I've had SIGNIFICANTLY better experiences at other Chuy's (i.e. - in Knoxville).  Like the front of the door says, "If you've seen one Chuy's - you've seen one Chuy's".  For the sake of this company, I would hope that's the case!

reviews.name: Jim G.
reviews.review: Everyone said I couldn't get good Mexican food in Nashville, they were wrong. There was nothing I didn't like from the chips and salsa to beans and rice. The guacamole was very flavorful and the tortillas are fresh, probably because they make everything on site. The best Mexican food I've ever had from a chain Mexican joint. If you like your sauce spicy you gotta try the boom boom sauce (excellent).

reviews.name: Leslie C.
reviews.review: Better than expected.  Pleasantly surprised at how good this was being so close to the Gaylord and in a mall.  Not terribly over-priced either for the area, good tasty Tex Mex walking distance from our room at the Opryland hotel.  I really enjoyed the warm chips/salsa & happy hour margaritas for $4!

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: If you like crappy tex mex then have at it.  Taco Bell is better most times.Could be some of the worst mexican food I've ever had.  The food is the the standard crappy tex mex.  It's not even upscale tex mex.  Deep fried for the dumbasses who may like this crap.   If looking for legit mexican food in Nashville trying taking a drive down Bradyville pike for the best in the Nashville area....look at my other reviews to find out which places...

reviews.name: Ben F.
reviews.review: We went on a Friday night, and it was CROWDED because the mall has just re-opened. It was a 2 hour wait, but we asked, and they serve full menu at the main and outdoor bars, so we just went and made some room for ourselves in the outside portion of the bar. If you aren't in a large party, and you don't have kids with you, then sitting at the bar is a great way to bypass a long, long wait.We had our food in less than 20 minutes after ordering. I've been to Chuy's before, and am pretty satisfied with the general spiciness (pretty spicy) and the flavors they bring to their food. From the chips and salsa to the enchiladas, they make it all in house, and it tastes really good. If you have dietary restrictions (vegan/no dairy/gluten free) they seem pretty willing to work for you. They will fry up your own serving of chips in a separate pan of oil just to make sure no wheat flour gets into them if you ask. They will make a separate batch of meat without the gluten/dairy containing seasoning they would otherwise use.Ask for a bowl of creamy jalapeno sauce when they bring out the chips and salsa. It is free and it is wonderful. Not at all low-fat, though. My only criticism about the food is that they don't really do enough to differentiate the menu items. You would be hard pressed to identify all of the sauces they put on a typical plate, and they can start to run together. We have talked with a manager a couple of times, and feel confident in their food prep ethics. They were out of shredded chicken, and it was going to be a couple of hours to get some more ready...because it takes a couple of hours to cut up a chicken, cook it, take it off the bone, shred it, and then cook it again. I would much rather eat that kind of food.The guy who said "Taco Bell is better most times" has apparently not been to Taco Bell recently (since the `80s?). Or maybe has a personal beef against Chuy's for some unstated reason. It's certainly not 1-star food. I got a large plate of food, and it had zero fried items (other than the fresh chips I was eating at the time). Yes, there are more authentic (and honestly, better) Mexican restaurants on Nolensville Rd. If we're going to compare everyone to La Hacienda, though, everyone is going to lose. Last time I was at THAT restaurant, a handful of cars were broken into in the seedy back alley you have to park in if you want the real deal. If you are at the mall and looking for dinner, you could do a LOT worse than Chuy's.

reviews.name: Hope D.
reviews.review: Yay for the new Chuy's location at Opry Mills! And yay for it being in my hood! Little advice for you...the fish tacos are, well, not the best. But everything else I've had so far is delicious! The chips, salsa, and creamy jalapeno ranch are amazing.  They have outdoor seating at the bar too! Bonus points!Keep in mind this location just opened and parking is nuts!!Oh and keep an eye out for the tiny hidden cowboy hats scattered throughout the restaurant. It's fun to search for them!

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: I had no expectations and none were even hinted at.  After a slog of shopping a friend and I sat down on the patio for a 'Rita.  I had some fancy $8.95 one with grand marnier.  Could not spot the GM and it was the weakest 'Rita of all time,  the serving lad was shocked to hear me say that and scurried off.  Friends $5.55 'Rita looked just like mine, no matter still a nice spot to sit with your shopping bags.  After eyeing up the food on other platters we gave it a miss.

reviews.name: Jeannie G.
reviews.review: I lived in Texas several years ago and that's where I first discovered Chuy's. I've been to the location in Cool Springs and thought it was just alright. Something seemed to be missing. Not the case with the Opry Mills location. Had dinner there tonight and it was great. We got there around 6:00 and Happy Hour was still going on. We asked the server about ordering queso and he clued us in on a little "secret". During happy hour, they set up a nice little Nacho Car station in the bar area and you're free to help yourself to as much chips, salsa, and queso as you want. They even had refried beans and ground sirloin up there as well so you could add it to the queso if you felt inclined. I thought this was pretty awesome. And FREE made it even better!For dinner, I ordered Combination #4 -- a chile relleno with shrimp & cheese and a veggie enchilada. Both were delicious. My fiance ordered Combination #2 -- the Elvis Presley Memorial Combo -- and it was huge! It came with a beef Tex-Mex enchilada, cheese Ranchero enchilada, chicken Tomatillo enchilada, a seasoned ground sirloin crispy taco & homemade tostada chips dipped in chile con queso. Plus rice & beans! Definitely enough food for two meals and you could easily split it with someone!If you're in the Opry Mills area and have a craving for Tex-Mex, definitely stop by Chuy's. And take advantage of their awesome happy hour if you can.

reviews.name: Billy W.
reviews.review: I ate here last night with my daughter. She had a child's plate and I had the taco salad. Neither of the were delicious but they both were good. Why did I give this 5 stars you ask?
