The waiter was awesome. I got another salad to go for my wife and he took the time to put it in a cake box to make sure her tortilla bowl did not get broken. As we were leaving we stopped to watch the tortilla lady make some tortillas. She befriended my daughter and gave her a piece of dough to play with. This is a good inexpensive family restaurant. We will be back.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: Is Chuy's authentic mexican food? No. But I've eaten at several of them and the quality is alway consistant. The portions sizes are a little out of control, but if you like left overs then you will be pleased. On my last trip to Chuy's, my friend and I split the ground sirloin burrito topped with queso. Even splitting one, we still had left overs, but it was tasty. I like their salsa, its fresh and not very spicy. We usually also get some of the creamy jalepeno sauce to go with our chips. It pretty much jalepeno ranch dressing, but I think its delicious. I think my favorite entre that I've had here is the baja tacos. I wish they were grilled instead of fried, but they are still pretty good. The margaritas are ok, really nothing special. All in all, Chuy's is very consistant.

reviews.name: Peter S.
reviews.review: "Does the trick" tex-mex food.  I didn't know this particular chain existed outside of Austin, but if you don't have many other local choices to go to, I would recommend eating here.  Granted, it has about a years worth of sodium and fat in any of their plates, but just go for the heart attack because it tastes good.  Try the chica-chica boom-boom plate.  It is quite good along with their house-made salsas.

reviews.name: Carmen P.
reviews.review: i love chuy's, a lot. the service, the atmoshphere, the food. we were there president's day weekend, and thought they were super packed, we still had very friendly service. the jalapeano cream/ranch type dip is amazing, ask for it! i always get the southwestern enchilada, and it's always amazing. the salsa is amazing, the chips thin, and wonderful (i hate when salsa is amazing, but the chips are thick, and the chip takes up more space in your mouth then the yummy salsa). we were able to step back into the mall to look at the nearby shops during our 45 minute wait which made it less painful.  overall, i'm a fan of chuys, every location i've been too has been great.

reviews.name: Roy M.
reviews.review: Advertise as having gluten free even have a gluten free menu. So, we waited 30 minutes to be seated and finally got to table. Asked for gluten free menu and waiter says if you have allergies all our food is cooked on the same equipment as regular meals and we do not  really accommodate your allergy but the food itself is gluten free. We'll duh, I guess I will eat your food raw and not have you contaminate it by cooking. Somebody needs to educate these people on what gluten free means,

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: Definitely more Tex-Mex than traditional Mexican.  My boyfriend loves their creamy jalapeno dip but I stick with their salsa.  Their chicken fajitas were dry and I think they could give you a little more for the price.  Their tortillas were great.  Service was very quick.  I will definitely go again.  It's my boyfriend's favorite place to go in Nashville.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: yuuuum.  Although, the prices are pretty high for Mexican food.  Free salsa bar/taco bar is fantastic!  Good atmosphere, sorty cheesy but it's cute.

reviews.name: Mick F.
reviews.review: We were in town for a convention, and decided to give Chuys a try.  The restaurant was crowded, but we only had to wait about 20 minutes.  Our waitress was prompt and friendly, and kept the iced tea refills coming (always a plus).  The restaurant has a "Hand Made Tortillas" display in the center of the building where you can watch tortillas being rolled and cooked.  Chips and salsa were good.  They have a green chile rice that is tasty (but a little spicy).  Overall, the food was quite good - here's some more detail on our dining experience - bit.ly/OTVAUb

reviews.name: Steve D.
reviews.review: OK to be straight I do not like Mexican or Tex Mex or whatever Mex you want to call it. I don't hate it but they all look and taste the same to me. Unfortunately, my wife loves Mexican food so I end up eating for more then I wish. Chuy's get a 4 star for it's salsa alone. The jalapeno ranch is pretty good too but it does not really go with most of the meals they serve. Slap that jalapeno ranch on some chicken wings and you've got yourself a party!

reviews.name: Pete N.
reviews.review: We hit Chuy's once a week or so for happy hour. $4.25 house margaritas and free nacho bar with queso, refried beans, ground beef, salsa, and chips--all six food groups!

reviews.name: Peter P.
reviews.review: The creamy jalapeno dip is a great way to start off. Chuy's is doing some different stuff with Tex-Mex and their steak burrito was really good and really filling.

reviews.name: Antonio M.
reviews.review: Excellent place to meet up with friends and enjoy an all you can eat salsa bar abd cheese with ground beef!! They make excellent skinny margaritas that are excellent and I really liked their fajitas.  Would recommebond to anyone!!!

reviews.name: Hank S.
reviews.review: The tortillas were great but don't get the fish tacos.  They are bland with no cabbage on them.  I would like to go back and try another dish.  My service was real slow and not that great.  I am hoping that this was a fluke.

reviews.name: Lindsay B.
reviews.review: Super impressed! Food was wonderful! We have a 3 yr old with food allergies and I was asking the manager about ingredients. She asked if she could take the allergy list to the kitchen to answer my questions. The kitchen manager came to our table and answered all my questions and offered suggestions about what our daughter could eat. This never happens. This level of customer service will keep us coming back. Super friendly ad knowledgable staff and great food. We will be back!

reviews.name: Meleah J.
reviews.review: My husband and I have been here about 7 times in the past 5 months. I have tried several different entrees, I have not been dissapointed not one time. The service is GREAT, friendly wait staff, fresh salsa and fresh chips made right there in the restaurant. Oh and don't forget to try the creamy jalepeno too (it's free as is the salsa and chips). This is our new favorite restaurant for date night, yes it's different from your traditional mexican but it's AMAZING, try this place and you won't be dissapointed. Chipotle chicken enchiladas, or chicka chicka boom boom are my favorite, and "Big as your face" burrito is my hubby's favorite! The price range is about $8-$10/entree depending on what you get, check for the daily specials too:)

reviews.name: James W.
reviews.review: A great value (compared to some other places in the area) for the money. Good food in large portions at fair prices. Service was very good (quite a plus these days). Would not hesitate to recommend and will definitely return.

reviews.name: Rn R.
reviews.review: It is a nice clean place. The food is alright-not great and not terrible. My order was not correct. I ordered no beans in my Burrito-sent it back-the next one came out cold-sent it back. The manager took it off the bill (I was not expecting that) and gave us a burrito to go. Also, had the Enchilada and Taco's--very bland. The best thing I had was the chips with salsa and creamy Jalapeno sauce.I might give it another try when I return.. Just not sure if i will.

reviews.name: Mary L.
reviews.review: Excellent!!   This was our first visit to Chuy's at Opry Mills mall and I was impressed.  The atmosphere was fun and everyone from the servers to the managers were great.  I will definitely be visiting them again on my next trip to Nashville.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: After hearing and reading such great things about this restaurant, I was very disappointed in our experience. It was later on a Sunday night, so we were seated right away, but no one came to our table for about 15 minutes. When someone finally did come, she didn't apologize for our wait or anything. She just asked "Has (insert name here) seen you yet?" When we said no, she says "ugh. Well I guess I'll take you." You could tell she didn't want to do it. We put our drink orders in...me a mojito, my husband a margarita. They were nothing special. I dare say my 6-year-old niece could have made me a better mojito. We ordered guac to go with our chips. Again, nothing fantastic, but not terrible either. Then came our food. My husband ordered the #2 and I ordered the #9. My advice....don't. It's not worth it. Our food was just plain nasty. Everything tasted as though it had been sitting out for a day or two. I'm going to copy part of someone else's review and say that Taco Bell would have been better. We won't be going back.

reviews.name: Denise W.
reviews.review: Chuy's has great margaritas and guacamole and super for a long day shopping at Opry Mills!

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: I ate here the first day the mall re-opened and it was awesome! Our server suggested some awesome drink choices and the food was delicious! The pricing isnt bad at all, in my opinion.Then came round two..........an hour and a half wait and a server who was definitely in the weeds. We ordered the same drinks as our first visit (some kind of margarita that comes with a shaker and a martini glass), however when it came out it wasnt what we ordered. We explained this to the waitress who told us we were wrong, even after we pointed to the picture in the menu that clearly showed the other drink. She continued to tell us we were wrong and then promptly excused herself to take another tables order. When was our order taken? 20 minutes later, and with not so much as a brief stop at our table, we were able to order. Two entrees and an appetizer...........in the end, no appetizer arrived but fortunately it wasnt on my bill either.

reviews.name: Michael H.
reviews.review: We had terrible service and mediocre food. The waiter brought beef tacos al carbon even after asking twice about the chicken that ordered. Even then,both the beef and chicken were not prepared well. The beef was under done compared to authentic. The chicken taco shell was soggy. Service was slow and margaritas were mostly ice.

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.review: New place is as good as the other two in Nashville. Amazing Chuychunga (with Deluxe Tomatilla sauce).

reviews.name: Ed R.
reviews.review: We stumbled into Chuy's last week to get out of the summer Tn. heat and we had a great 2 hrs. with bartender 'Spring' who was a pro and very personable too - oh, food was wonderful. Thanks again Spring!

reviews.name: Beth C.
reviews.review: Excellent atmosphere.  I loved the outdoor seating with the patio bar.  Food was decent and kind of reminded me of the long gone but not forgotten Chi Chi's restaurants.  Service on the other hand?  S..u..p..e..r.....slllllow.  Yikes.  Honestly, it wasn't all that busy on a Sunday night at around 7:30 but it seemed to take forever to get drinks, chips, food, refills, the check.  Waiting, waiting, waiting!  You get a ton of food so the price and value is right on target.  I appreciate that they have several vegetarian options on the menu as well.  I had the veggie enchiladas with Mexican rice and refried beans.  After we had two baskets of chips, I couldn't even begin to start eating the refried beans.  My boyfriend had an appetizer sampler with nachos, flautas, and chicken tacos.  He really enjoyed the entire plate.  I also had the sangria on the rocks.  It was tasty but not like a traditional sangria with fruit chunks floating about in the glass.  My boyfriend had the house margarita and it was strong and delicious!  I had seen another Chuy's while driving around downtown Nashville but didn't realize this chain extended to Indiana until I saw one in Clarksville on our way back to Indianapolis.  I don't know that I would eat here again after the extended periods of waiting we endured but as that was probably an isolated incident, I might reconsider when near another Chuy's.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: When my mom came to visit, she was staying at the Opryland Hotel, so we ended up eating dinner here twice during her stay. Both times it seemed that there would be a wait, but we were seated right away (maybe because it was just the 2 of us). And both times, we were able to get a table outside. On our first visit here, I ordered the Beef Tacos. They were good, and portions were HUGE, but they weren't great. The second time, I ordered the Taco Salad with Steak and it was delicious. The steak was wonderful and cut up nicely. Their regular salsa is really good. It's chunky enough and spicy enough that I didn't end up trying any of their other salsas, but my mom did get one of the spicier salsas and she really enjoyed it. The prices were very reasonable, and service was great as well. I live about an hour north of Nashville, but we always take visitors to the Opryland Hotel, so we will definitely visit this restaurant again in the future.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: This was my first time at the Opry Mills location. I had previously visited the Broadway location downtown. Visited the OM location on a Thursday night around 6pm and it seemed to be super busy. Hostess said it would be about 30 minutes for our party of 2 to get a table. We were seated after waiting for only 15 minutes! Had a crappy waitress. She took our drink order (two waters, simple enough!) and came back a little later to take our food order, still no drinks and didn't seem to notice. Salsa tasted freshly made and had slight heat that didn't linger - I really liked it. She gave a table next to us their drinks and took their food order, then I had to ask her for our waters (not sure how long we waited, but it was definitely too long). Food came out soon after. I ordered the Chuychanga with Mexican rice, tomatillo sauce, and refried beans. It was all super delicious, but I was starving. Waitress checked on us once after our food was served. Between that time and before she brought us the check, my friend had run out of water. She did go ahead and split the checks without asking, which was how we wanted it anyway.Overall, not a bad experience, but I had better service at the downtown location.

reviews.name: J G.
reviews.review: We decided to eat here on a Friday night and had to wait an hour to be seated.  Luckily, their pagers reach a little ways down the mall, so we did some shopping while we waited.  Once seated, the restaurant was pretty loud but the chips were good and the salsa was super fresh.  We ordered the fajitas for 2 (combo chicken and steak), and they were very good.  The tortillas are fresh made in the restaurant, and they are delicious.  Rice was standard and a little dry, the beans had good flavor and were a good consistency.  Pricing was a little bit high, but servings are huge.

reviews.name: A B.
reviews.review: I've had dine-in lunch & dinner here over the past year, which started out as a slow, mediocre experience and developed into a personable, positive experience- as I became a "regular", so to speak. The soups are consistently on point & rich. The curries are very good as well. Sometimes, with the less "saucy" dishes, I find that they go a bit overboard with the fish sauce and a great dish can end up smelling like dog food...if you give it a try, like I did, you may even be able to say you know what dog food tastes like. I think this discrepancy isn't enough to warrant not going and trying Siam Cuisine- I would just stick to the heartier dishes.

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: So sad.....the menu is the same, but the taste was awful. My shrimp was sour (not eaten). Hubby was ill after eating. They did take my meal off of the bill, but overall so disappointing. The appetizer special is no longer available. I do believe this is under different ownership.

reviews.name: Kaylyn M.
reviews.review: Been here three times now and order something different every time! They have very good curry's and noodle dishes. If you are looking for Thai, come here. Their food is fresh and does not appear to be frozen before cooking. Their lunch special is on point as well.

reviews.name: Alexandra F.
reviews.review: They are awesome. The one time my order was wrong they gave me the correct spring rolls next time. I always get pad Thai and it's always perfect. Extra spicy is the way to go! Spring rolls are good. I suppose I should try more items from the menu, but I like what I like.

reviews.name: Sunshine W.
reviews.review: Favorite Thai in Nashville!! The vegetables are fresh, not frozen. Shrimp is always fresh too. Lunch menu is great and very reasonably priced! Nice quiet atmosphere. I have been eating here for years and will continue!

reviews.name: Shelby S.
reviews.review: The shrimp and pineapple curry is amazing you've gotta try it. The fried bananas are great for dessert too. :)

reviews.name: Candra G.
reviews.review: Overall, a nice place in the burbs to grab some decent Thai food.  We would definitely return to check out the rest of the menu.Pros:- Basil fried rice: Yum - flavorful and nice balance of spices.  BF and I really enjoyed it.Cons:- Service was a little touch and go.  Very nice wait staff, but missed out in a couple of areas: refilling drinks, necessary silverware, follow-up, etc.  - Pad Thai.  Wasn't terrible, but it was exceptionally bland and required a little doctoring to get it to where you think it's worth the calories to consume.

reviews.name: Bachs M.
reviews.review: I have been going to Siam cuisine for 15 years. Best Thai food in Nashville... Menu is extensive and although the service isn't alwaysconsistently great or consistently not so great, the food is consistently awesome! My favorite is a bowl of chicken Tom Kha Kha &white rice. There is plenty to eat for your meal and then plenty to take home for another! Siam is A Nashville staple for Thai food!

reviews.name: Darlene O.
reviews.review: My absolute favorite Thai restaurant and I LOVE Thai, so I have tried more than a few Thai restaurants. My favorite dish here is the pad thai. I was so addicted that I would order 3x a week and they knew me by name. I wouldn't even have to give my full order once I told them my name. Their shrimp blanket appetizer is awesome! The basil herb really turns up the flavor. I have also tried their seafood pot and their basil fried rice dishes which are also good! Like everything I have tried here is beyond amazing. This restaurant is great for lunch hour (serve food quickly and price is less than $10) and dinner. It is very cozy and intimate setting which I love! I also love their Tom Yum Gai soup which is spicy and filling in itself. Everytime I visit Nashville, I always make a stop here. The service here is always good too!

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I'll be back to Siam for some more green curry... the pad thai.. not so much. My BF and I have our typical order: chicken green curry 5/5 spicy, chicken pad thai 2/5 spicy, and vegetable tom kha soup. We swung by this location to try some take out, and the interior is very cute! Nicely decorated space off White Bridge, and they had some tasty looking specials as well.My green curry was more like 4/5 spicy with some parts of it hot, others a 3/5 spice. But I LOVED the flavor, it tasted like they had a lot of chilis in it. The pad thai was just ok. It had no spice at all, along with not much flavor. Meh. The tom kha soup was excellent; the veggies were cooked perfectly and it was just right! I would give them a 3.5 stars but rounded down because they didn't have the spice right and the pad thai wasn't great. But I am looking forward to giving them another shot!

reviews.name: Cameron H.
reviews.review: Good place to get Thai food in Nashville.  The price is reasonable and the food is good.  If you need Thai and you're in that area, you can't go wrong with them!

reviews.name: Lindsay R.
reviews.review: Excellent food!! I got the garlic pepper chicken and it was absolutely wonderful!! My husband got the pad-Thai and it was good, but not mind blowing like my chick. Tom kha soup and dumplings delish too!!! Will def go back!!!

reviews.name: John C.
reviews.review: Waited for seven minutes to be seated, then sat at the table for twenty five minutes, no one came to take drink order, no one even looked at us. Tried to get hostess or manager but gave up after waiting another five minutes for him. Busy for a Monday night, but they could have at least taken the drink order in thirty minutes.

reviews.name: Dew T.
reviews.review: We found Siam by accident when we first moved to Nashville 3 years ago and we've never been disappointed! We love Thai Food and Siam is by far our favorite place in town.Try the Ginger vegetables, pad thai, or the red curry. AMAZING!

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: Easily the best Thai food I've eaten since moving to Nashville.  No question!I come here often for lunch, and enjoy their daily lunch specials that always include spring rolls and their house chicken soup.  The basil chicken is my favorite item on the menu--always spicy and full of flavor, and not overly oily or salty--and served with fresh brown rice.  Yum.  I also love the chicken and shrimp dumplings, which are topped with delicious bits of crunchy roasted garlic, as well as the tom kha soup.The last time I came for dinner, I was with a party of about 15 people.  Siam Cuisine was easily able to accommodate us, allowing us to enjoy each other's company without pushing us to hurry or leave before we were ready.  The server was sweet, organized, and thoughtful, dividing our check appropriately (even without us asking).I'll be back soon, especially for lunch!

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: I am not sure why, but there is a smorgasbord of great Thai restaurants in the city. I am not going to look the gift horse in its mouth! Siam Cuisine felt like...a gourmet Thai place, a place one wouldn't mind going on a date to show off their exotic cuisine eating blurb that they had put in their OKCupid profile! The interior was tastefully red - walls, carpet, napkins, everything. Then again, I am colorblind, so I probably saw it all as green! As usual, vegetarians have a metric ton of options, including the ability to substitute anything with blood with tofu. I got the one with spicy peanut curry paste and, man, was it amazing! I was Thai-red of eating Pad Thai at every joint and this was an interesting twist. My wife got the glass noodle bowl. It came in a bowl big enough for a bird bath, the sort an ostrich could use! It was bang for buck and served as her breakfast, lunch, and dinner the next day.I'd definitely swing by this place the next time I am craving Thai.

reviews.name: Katy T.
reviews.review: Very disappointing.  The drunken noodle dish comes with a fettucine noodle instead of a flat rice noodle. Chicken was very dry.  Pad thai certainly left something to be desired.  Soup was decent.  I would not go back.

reviews.name: Mandy C.
reviews.review: Tom Yum soup is amazing.  Red curry is awesome.  Prices are right.  Atmosphere is calm and cozy.  Service is very nice and attentive.They do a wonderful job here, I love coming to Siam!

reviews.name: Rachel R.
reviews.review: I stumbled into Siam Cuisine to meet my grandparentals around noon. I'd woken up late (20 minutes prior), was about to eat Thai food for breakfast, and was not feeling enthusiastic about it.Boy did they show me.I dove right in ordered the red curry seafood and glass noodles... little did I know, it was a four course meal. We started with a simple brothy soup, then moved on to a gingery iceberg salad. Eh. Typical.When my curry arrived, it was wrapped in tin foil, which they glamorously cut open at our table using a pair of kitchen scissors. Inside was bubbling sauce, shrimp, squid, mussels and glass noodles. They also brought a huge plate of steamed rice, which I wanted them to take back, but the g-parents said to leave it. Why, God. After I demolished the entire thing, there was curry sauce left (and it was the best curry I've ever had), so I ended up dumping all of the rice in it and finishing that, too. I f*ckin' hate it when they bring rice and noodles... I CAN'T BE TRUSTED WITH THAT SORT OF RESPONSIBILITY. Regardless of my lack of self control, everything was absolutely delicious. Then, when I was on the verge of not-so-spontaneously combusting, they brought out dessert. Five adorable little egg rolls filled with steaming plantain, drizzled with honey and sesame seeds. They were too cute to resist. I mean, who's not a sucker for fried banana baby egg rolls? My indulgence cost me $17 bucks and a small amount of rice-induced guilt, but I'll be back for sure. That red curry whispers to me in my dreams.

reviews.name: Ed K.
reviews.review: We were regulars up until 5 yrs ago when the quality disappeared.  Tried it again last night.  Same exact menu, which is good.  I can only testify to the Tiger Tear Salad & Tom Yum soup, which were outstanding.   My wife's papaya salad & sticky rice, outstanding.  The grilled chicken was dry, leftover & the soup chicken was WAY past its time...but the next we visited, all was perfect.  Service, excellent.

reviews.name: Stephen L.
reviews.review: This place is killer! Red and Green Curry are awesome. Also the panang chicken was pretty stellar.

reviews.name: Kat L.
reviews.review: We adore Siam cuisine! I highly recommend the Pad Ka Siam or the Pad Thai. Golden sticks and fried dumplings are also not to be missed. This place is a hidden gem!

reviews.name: Glen G.
reviews.review: My girlfriend and I have both agreed (an extremely rare occurrence in the world of dining) this is by far our favorite Thai restaurant in Nashville. Our first night, being huge fans of curry, we decided to share beef panang and chicken massaman. Both were fantastic. The same week (we never go back to the same place in one week), we were still feeling curry. So we went red and yellow, but spicier. INCREDIBLE. A week later? The shrimp pad Thai and shrimp panang, hot. ABSOLUTELY MIND BLOWING. Comparing it to smiling elephant (great) and Thai phooket (never again), this is my favorite. Elephant has an incredible pad ka prao, but I feel like most of that menu is just riding the hype train. It's gotten better every time, and the service here has always a+. I'm glad I have one of my favorite places to eat right across the street from me.

reviews.name: John R.
reviews.review: One of the best fines in Nashville.  Spice up your life with the curry.  Try them all they are great.  Make sure to ask for the spice pepper tray and really open the pallet and make your head sweat.  Enjoy as good sample of food and sauce with the appetizer combo.  Always a smile at the door.  When on Whitebridge road, make it a priority to stop!

reviews.name: Sharmeela S.
reviews.review: Best this food ive had in Nashville.  I love all the curries.  Quality food at a reasonable price.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: First time I went, it was pretty decent. However, last time I went the food was terrible and more than half the people in our group got sick later that night. For the food, the prices are definitely on the pricier side. There are several other Thai places in Nashville with both better food AND better prices, such as Peter's Sushi and Thai, and Thai Phooket. Not planning on going back.

reviews.name: Faith B.
reviews.review: Having heard about this place for years, I finally decided to try it on Friday evening. The service was very good; my waitress was attentive, helpful and friendly. The appetizer I tried, crab rolls served with a chili oil, was really awful. This appetizer is a paste made up of pureed crab and tofu, wrapped in a wonton skin and fried. The first one was okay, then the second included a crunchy bit of crab shell surprise. Yuck. The texture was pretty off-putting, the shell bit revolting and the taste was bland and slightly unpleasant.  My entree, a massaman curry, was much better. The waitress asked me if I wanted extra vegetables, which was thoughtful and really improved the dish. The curry was rich and creamy and the medium spice level was just right. The vegetables were fresh and tasty, although the potato in it was overly crisp. Ultimately, this place was fine. My bill seemed a little high for 1 person, but not crazy. They do offer a lot of clearly marked vegetarian options and have an adequate beer and wine selection.

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: I've always had really good experiences here. Most recently, I went wtih a dozen co-workers for lunch. I called ahead and they had the table all arranged for us when we arrived. They did not have any trouble with this size group, which I really appreciated. Lunch portions were perfect - not huge, but plenty. Prices were reasonable. I ordered the Panang Curry. This is one of the few places I've encountered in town that makes it most like what I had when I was in Thailand. Thick sauce, lots of chicken. I've also had Mussaman Curry here and really like it. Others at the table ordered Pad Thai, red curry, some kind of fried rice dish, etc. Plates were cleaned all around.

reviews.name: Jayson W.
reviews.review: The food is incredible! Had the app sampler, green curry chicken, and pad Thai. Go go go! Great vibe/ambiance and very friendly staff.

reviews.name: Sasha T.
reviews.review: With our usual Thai restaurant going down hill with each visit, it was time to seek out somewhere new to satisfy my Pad Thai craving.We've been several times for dinner and usually start out with the pan-fried dumplings. They are just crispy enough and the sauce that comes with it is really good. Their Pad Thai is definitely the best I've had in town so far. On my last visit I went outside my usual ordering box and had the Massaman Curry (mild, because I'm wimpy) and it was also delicious. The only problem here comes on the service side. Its not that the service isn't good, the servers have always been friendly and someone is running around filling drinks. On really busy nights they often have only 1 or 2 servers so you'll be sitting around for a while before or after your meal. After you finally get to order your meal though it doesn't take an obscene amount of time to get your food. If you don't mind being patient, I definitely recommend trying it out.

reviews.name: Kiran G.
reviews.review: Really good food. I love Thai sweet tea and chicken fried rice. The appetizers are good. Over all good experience.

reviews.name: Mark M.
reviews.review: The best thai food in town! Awesome food. Fast. Friendly. Good.Awesome vegetarian options. Good tofu!

reviews.name: Andi D.
reviews.review: I've since tried this place again, as it's just down the street from my office, and I'm a bit more pleased.I get takeout, and it's always ready just as I come in.  I prefer 2 spring rolls instead of 1 spring roll and soup(they always ask when I call my order).  The Panang curry with tofu is delicious, and as a lunch special is reasonably priced.  Also, it can usually last me two meals.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: I have the misfortune of having 2 of my favorite types of businesses right next to each other (a yarn store next to an ethnic restaurant). And after a forbidden romp through the yarn store next door, I came in for lunch recently.I've never been a fan of Thai-style curries and soups.  I wasn't in the mood for pad thai or satay. So, I had a Chinese-based dish, their sweet and sour pork. It was just okay. The flavor combinations just weren't working for me. And I don't know if there was supposed to be any spice -- I didn't detect any.Their starter soup was interesting. It almost reminded me of Filipino-style tamarind soup, but not as sour. It was pleasantly mild to my tastes.And the spring roll that comes with the lunch was not memorable. But then, I grew up with Filipino lumpia.The Thai iced coffee was excellent and buzzed me for a few hours afterwards, in addition to giving me brain freeze.I think this may be the first Thai restaurant I've been to in which some of the staff are Americanized. While my first visit may not have been more exciting, food-wise, I'd certainly make coming here a habit when I happen to be in the store next door.

reviews.name: Richard S.
reviews.review: Try the red curry!

reviews.name: Pickiest Eater A.
reviews.review: Absolute worst thai foodWe asked for native thai...grounded pepper was sprinkled on the dish...really?

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Consistently the best Thai I have in Nashville. Any color curry or Thai classic will not disappoint. Clean and friendly staff to boot!

reviews.name: Holly H.
reviews.review: Vegetarians/vegans, watch out.I'll start by saying I do not eat any animal products. I wanted to order a curry with tofu that was not in the vegetarian section of the menu, so I made sure to ask if it contained fish sauce. It turns out that it did and it could not be omitted, so I ordered a curry from the vegetarian section of the menu.  The waiter came back from the kitchen and told me that that curry also contained fish sauce.  An item LABELED VEGETARIAN contained fish sauce.  This is unacceptable.  As a vegetarian/vegan, it is our responsibility to question what goes into our food. However, an item specifically labeled vegetarian should be a no-brainer. I was very disappointed.With that said, the food that is ACTUALLY vegetarian was fine, and the servers were nice as well. This is the only reason I decided not to rate below a 3.

reviews.name: Brian M.
reviews.review: I've enjoyed their food for 8+ years. The food is excellent, the quality is consistent and the prices are good. Everyone I have brought here loves it!

reviews.name: Samantha joelle A.
reviews.review: I love Siam Cuisine! I tried it because it is right down the street from my house in West Nashville, but have since discovered that it is hands down the best Thai place in Nashville that I've had.The staff are all super friendly and the food is great and reasonably priced. I always start with a Thai Tea, which is an iced tea with coconut milk in it. So delicious. The Tom Kha Gai soup is also one of my favorites. It's a coconut milk based soup with chicken, mushrooms and green onions. I almost always have to get a bowl of it. My favorite thing to order is the sweet and sour chicken, mostly because I love dishes with pineapple in it. My boyfriend always orders the basil with scallops "extra hot," and he loves it. The best time to come is for lunch. It is cheaper for the lunch portion and you get a little less food. However, it comes with a bowl of soup and a spring roll, which makes it perfect amount of food for me. I always end up taking home leftovers from the dinner size. Although, having the left overs for lunch the next day always gives me something to look forward to!

reviews.name: Kate B.
reviews.review: Came here on a date with my boyfriend for lunch.  It was absolutely delicious!  The decor is more tasteful than some thai places i've been before.  There was no wait and the staff was very nice.  I've never ordered takeout so I cant speak to that but dine-in was great!  Lots of options for meat-eaters and vegetarians alike.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: My girlfriend and I came here without really knowing much about the place and we were pleasantly surprised with what we had! The restaurant is very intimate and cozy, and my Pad Thai was excellent. Definitely recommended!

reviews.name: Glenn F.
reviews.review: I have two, maybe 3, Thai Restaurants in Nashville that I frequent and Siam is one of them. My kids love good Thai food and we order carry-out from Siam on occasion.  My favorite dish is the Pasta Kee Mow.  It is like a version of Drunken Noodles with linguini-like noodles and a thin curry flavored sauce. I never seem to know the names of each dish, but when I call and try explaining, the staff is always so helpful in helping me with my carry-out order. Prices, food and location are all great so I look forward to many a meal at Siam Thai Cuisine.

reviews.name: hobo s.
reviews.review: I've been here many times over the years and haven't been disappointed.  It is, to date, the only place I've found that has good pad thai.  This last visit I had the pad thai with tofu - they cook the tofu well - but forgot to ask for it spicy.  It was still very tasty, as were the tom yum gai and the crispy spring rolls.The pad thai at Siam is how I always think of pad thai anywhere else and whenever I'm somewhere else it always comes out overcooked or far too sweet or just wrong.  Siam keeps the integrity of the noodles, the tofu is borderline crispy on the corners (a good thing), and when you get it with shrimp or chicken, it does not disappoint.  It is even better when spicy.The fried spring rolls are nothing fancy, just vegetarian spring rolls with a sweet sauce, but they are tasty.  The massaman curry is another staple.  The potatoes were a bit undercooked this time, but only a bit.  I'm a fan of other curries and dishes as well, but I cannot remember them well enough to list/review.I've been here probably 10 times and I will come back again.Regarding review(s) that call it bland, you have to remember to ask for an appropriate level of spice.  I don't think it is crazily priced either.

reviews.name: Michael T.
reviews.review: Wonderful food. However they seem incapable of getting a takeout order correct.

reviews.name: Will M.
reviews.review: It definitely ranks up there, but I think the decor is the best among my top few.  I just had the Pad Thai.  Service was so-so.  Will have to try more.  Closed on Sunday.. boo!

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: Siam is one of those places where you have to go in and know what to order, especially if you want a decent amount of food for your money. Be aware that the appetizer portions are really really small. The soup is a pretty decent size, if you order the small, but the spring rolls are tiny and the banana dessert is microscopic.The lunch deal is good though. For about $7, you get an entree, rice, and soup and spring rolls. To be honest, you really can't beat that. The people here are really nice too, but for some reason, I just find something lacking here, even though I can't really put my finger on it. Maybe it is the atmosphere, but that's not bad either. It's decent, passable Thai food. I think it's better than Royal Thai, but there are other places I would rather go.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: This place is located in a small shopping area with about 5 other stores. We went on a Thursday night and the dining area was not too busy but I did see a non-stop flow of people ordering/picking up to go orders. They seem to have some regulars ordering out. We had the Seafood Soup and Pad See Eu. Both were good but not the best we have ever had. My Pad See Eu was a bit salty but still good. The staff was friendly and quick to serve you. The place is simply decorated with low lighting.

reviews.name: Ryan O.
reviews.review: This is my favorite Thai restaurant in Nashville so far. It is a great place to go for lunch because that menu's prices are considerably lower and you still get quite a lot. I wouldn't go here if you are in a hurry... the service is okay but not always fast.  I'd suggest the Pad Thai as theirs best I've had in this area.  The peanut sauce is also quite excellent and the spring rolls are pretty good. I'm not a fan of the soup... I usually tell them to hold it and get an extra spring roll.

reviews.name: Sunny Y.
reviews.review: Siam Cuisine and Thai Phooket are my go-to places for Thai food.I think the food is about the same in quality (depending on the dish, one place may be slightly better than the other) but the ambiance is much more elegant at Siam Cuisine.I always get the pad thai. My favorite. It's very good. The green curry is good too. And the tom yum. Also, I've tried ordering pu pat pong curry off the menu once. They were kind enough to take the order! And it was delicious!

reviews.name: Hayley T.
reviews.review: I went here for the first time today during my lunch break since, I never had Thai food and it was the closest restaurant in walking distances from my school/job. I ordered by phone and told the lady exactly what I wanted, which was the Pineapple Fried rice that was suppose to cost $12.95 on the menu, but I got there it was $17 something dollars o_O when I got back to work and opened the bag and there were extra things in there that I didn't ask for like soup, salad, and this mini looking egg roll things that where covered in honey, that didn't taste good at all. But the Pineapple Fried rice was really delicious, it had chicken, shrimp, pineapples and raisin in it, which had me a a little confused, because when I went to the website with the menu, it said nothing about raisins being in it, but it did mention it had cashews, and there wasn't a cashew in sight =/ I probably won't be going here anytime soon.menuism.com/restaurants/…

reviews.name: Scott D.
reviews.review: Thai food in Nashville is a bit difficult to come by. There are choices. Some are better than the rest. This place is possibly one of the tastiest in town. The menu is just the right size and has all the Thai staples from curries to pad thai. Their list of Siam Specialties is must try if you are going to splurge a bit for the evening. The only point of contention that I can muster would be that the service is a little slow in ending the meal. I've waited a while before to be brought a requested check.

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: Lots of people complain about the lack of decent Chinese food in Nashville. I have frequently added my own voice to the mix, but I do think the same concern could also be voiced about Thai food in this town. Yes, there are quite a few places claiming to serve Thai food, but most of them have pretty much the exact same menus and the authenticity of the food is questionable. Even worse, most of the Thai places in town charge an arm and a leg so dinner for two is generally going to cost you.I am not sure that Siam Cuisine really does anything to address any of the above concerns, but I'd still call this one of my top Nashville Thai places because by and large, the food is really quite tasty. I wish that dining here didn't so often set my husband and I back about $50 when we eat in (due to the cost of drinks + tip on top of our food), but the end result is simply that we don't eat here nearly as often as we otherwise would. I think a large reason why the prices here are high is because we often like to order dishes off their "Specialty" section (in particular, we love the crispy duck, duck curry, and the kang curry gai, the latter being a mild curry that I've never found anywhere else and that has a broth that is pure ambrosia!) which tend to be pricier because all of the dishes in this section are served with soup, salad, and a dessert. A lot of time I wish they'd knock $3-4 off the pricetag and just serve me the main dish. I guess I should ask if it's possible for them to do so, but it seems a shame they don't have some easy pricing in their menu that does that already.As for the food itself, it's generally decent, while some of it is very good. The curries are creamy and rich, and the duck is some of the best preparation I've ever had! The real flops are the free soup that comes with your meal, that may not come from a can, but is so generic and blah it might as well. I also really love Tom Kha Gai, and I recently ordered a big bowl of it for my dinner alone. The serving was huge (I got enough for two meals!), but unfortunately the flavors weren't there. TKG is so amazingly flavorful, but what I was served had no zing or zip and was instead pretty bland, and I don't even want to talk about the mangy pieces of chicken in it. So if you're a soup lover, maybe go elsewhere.Overall, this isn't going to be the best Thai food you ever eat, but the food is generally very good and the waitstaff is courteous and effective. The atmosphere has always been pretty chill and quiet whenever I've been, but I'd imagine this place is pretty busy at lunch. Calls for pick-up are fast too, as I generally only have to wait 15 - 20 minutes after placing my order before my food is ready. If you're craving a decent Thai experience, check this place out.

reviews.name: David R.
reviews.review: Awesome food.Had authentic Thai spicy and it was delicious.

reviews.name: Michael W.
reviews.review: Meh.Passable Thai food at astronomical prices. If you're craving Pad Thai, it's basically the only ship in town. They do a decent job on all the basic dishes with few surprises.But they use linguini for their noodle dishes! Linguini!

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: massaman curry = YUM. They customer service is why I rate a 5. They were closed and without knowing I walked in with a friend. There was already someone else waiting who obviously didnt know they were closed either. Someone greeted us, told us they were closed, but would serve us anyway. They were so kind, and the food was delicious.I will definitely be going back there again.

reviews.name: Todd G.
reviews.review: Undiscovered, partly due to dreary location. Cosy interior, especially if you can score a booth. Solid menu, interesting specials. Pasta Kee Mow terrific, curries very good. Sometimes the spice level is adjusted with red pepper flakes, a crude, one-dimension flavor sledgehammer. But sometimes there's no flakes, just floral heat as it should be. Good for takeout, too. A little pricy, but only in comparison with the backpacker-inexpensive expectation of Thai cuisine.

reviews.name: Brittany F.
reviews.review: I've been here several times and generally I would say it is one of my favorite Thai restaurants. Siam Cuisine has always ranked high on my list due in part to the variety on the spice tray and the level of heat they give to their dishes. This visit, however was a little different. Usually their noodle dishes are  very tasty with a fair amount of sauce so they don't taste dried out. This time, the spring rolls were mediocre and the Pad See Ew tasted as if it had sat underneath the heat lamp for a bit.  That being said, Siam Cuisine is generally very consistent in quality and it could have been related to us coming late in the lunch crowd. I still find Siam Cuisine to be one of my favorite Thai places in Nashville. Their tofu is delicious and the prices are very reasonable--especially for lunch. I'll continue to go back when in the area.

reviews.name: Colin S.
reviews.review: Solid Thai.  We ordered a number of dishes and each was excellent.  I would eat at this restaurant again.

reviews.name: Matt I.
reviews.review: Fantastic place for lunch, when most entrees plus a side are only $8. I've had nearly all of the curries and most of the noodle dishes, and everything has been incredibly flavorful without feeling overly heavy and greasy. Don't be afraid of picking something you've never tried before; if it sounds good, it is. If it's your first time eating Thai food, I would suggest either the pad thai or panang curry.One thing worth noting: the lunch portion is served with both a spring roll and a vegetable soup. The vegetable soup is absolutely awful; it clearly comes from a can that they just opened up in the kitchen. However, if you ask, you can substitute your soup for an additional spring roll at no charge. I always do this; the rolls are delicious!Pros: - Fast, courteous service - Delicious dishes with amazing flavor - Lunch portions are generous and relatively cheapCons: - Vegetable soup is straight from the can (but can be substituted) - Dinner entrees are significantly more expensive for not that much more food

reviews.name: Stephanie G.
reviews.review: This place was awesome! It's one of my family's favorite spots! I had the massaman curry lunch special. It came with a bowl of soup, a spring roll and rice. Perfect amount and a really good price for lunch! Tasted the Kao Soi and I would probably get that next time, it had such a great flavor. We shared the tiger tear salad to start. It had the perfect amount of spice and also was topped with rice powder which I never had before on this type of salad, but loved it! I will be requesting to go here again next time I'm in town!

reviews.name: A C.
reviews.review: As a preface, multiple trips to Thailand have made me a Thai snob. So with that in mind, I rate Siam Cuisine as OK. The curries are pretty good, but the Thom Ka (coconut soup w/ chicken) is not remotely authentic and lacks the lemongrass flavor (which can be found at local grocers). We went for dinner and most dishes cost less than $12. Apparently they have a lunch deal which is considerably cheaper and might make it more worthwhile. But if going for dinner, I would go to Golden Thai which is right down the road and much better.

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: This is a case where I wish Yelp allowed half stars.  I would give Siam 3 and a half.  But, four will have to do!  As far as atmosphere goes, this is a lower-scale Thai place--but it's clean and that is a lot more than I can say about some other Thai places in town!  I will say, a friend and I went on a particularly warm weeknight--when we walked in, we noticed it was pretty warm in there.  To their credit, the hostess ran over and explained that the air wasn't working (they did have fans all over though) and said she understood if we wanted to come back and eat another day.  But, we REALLY wanted Thai, so we braved the heat.  Wasn't all that bad!  Service was decent--a little slow here and there, but despite no air conditioning, the place was packed so our server was pretty busy.  Now to the food.  I think it's great!  I had a chicken/garlic chili sauce/mushroom dish with white rice that was amazing.  Can't remember the name of it unfortunately.  I couldn't even pronounce it when I was there--I just had to point to the menu.  The dinner portions are big too--I was able to take half with me for lunch the next day.  My friend ordered a veggie dish, and was very pleased with hers as well.  I've eaten here for lunch before too--talk about a deal, you get an entree plus a spring roll and soup for about $8!  Dinner is just a tad more pricey but not much.  With two glasses of wine and dinner, I was out of there for just under $20.I don't get to Siam as often as I would like, but I'm going to make more of an effort to do so--for the price, the food is fabulous!

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: I love this restaurant! Their curry is so yummy. They have lots of vegetarian dishes and yummy tofu. This is a place husband and I keep going back to. Our friends enjoy it very much as well. Its great for take-out or eating in and you will always have left overs. Oh and I've never had trouble parking here. Its in a strip mall area by a rug shop and a consignment store so there is a big parking lot.

reviews.name: Rob M.
reviews.review: This is my wife and I's favorite lunch spot.  We've been having lunch here at least once, if not twice a week at times for years.  The Pad Thai is an easy choice on days that I just can't decide.  Order the Kao Soi.  I can't figure out how this dish is so great, and keep in mind that you can request rice or rice noodles as well vs. the standard noodles.  The curries are spot on as are the soups and salads.  I order hot and my wife = medium, though we always have them bring us a spice tray and add heat as we go.  Sharing is a must here as you'll want to sample as much of the menu as possible.  Siam is extremely consistent and always friendly.  Every taste is as good as the first.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: Good, spicy Thai in an unassuming Nashville strip mall.  A little pricey, but not ridiculous. Pleasant service.

reviews.name: Kate K.
reviews.review: I've loved Thai food almost everywhere I've had it. Maybe my expectations were just too high, but Siam Cuisine disappointed in just about every way. Parking was a bitch, the front lot is very tight and was packed at lunchtime. Getting in and out of the back lot is one-way and inconvenient. We nearly got into an accident getting out because someone wasn't looking when they tried to get in.We were seated promptly in a very dim atmosphere. I always get edgy if a place is too dark. Do they not want us to see our food? Our order was taken relatively quickly, and then it was a lot of waiting. The soup had a pleasant, if mild,  vegetable stock, but the veggies were overcooked and the chicken tasteless.More waiting later, and our "Native Thai hot" curries arrived. Tthe vegetables were so overcooked as to be nearly tasteless. I've had crisper out of a can. To their credit, the scallops were perfectly textured, but that's not enough to make me go back. There was no heat to the dish whatsoever. If I took a mouthful with basil on it, I got some flavor, but nothing near what I've had in a multitude of places. I shudder to think what I would have tasted if I'd ordered "mild."  The spring roll was nothing special, not detracting from the meal, but not adding to it either. Go to Golden Thai down the street for a much better experience.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: I love Thai food and though Nashville doesn't offer the best assortment of it I think Siam Cuisine is actually a pretty good deal. Let me start by saying that having spent 3 weeks in Thailand I'm a total Pad Thai snob so I won't say that Siam's is great but it's a good enough for Nashville. I do, however, love their spring rolls. Their décor is a little cheese ball, but I like cheese ball so dig it.. I think one thing that stands out about Siam is their service, every time I have been there that have been efficient and prompt, and I can't think of a time I have had to wait more than 2 minutes to get seated.

reviews.name: Patrick B.
reviews.review: The Thai here is better than average and they were very gracious in allowing us to order right before closing and let us enjoy our dinner for as long as we wanted. Food is always cooked fresh.

reviews.name: Alan W.
reviews.review: Great spot for lunch. Lunch specials are under $7, large portions, and everything is delicious. Definitely substitute your soup for an extra spring roll.

reviews.name: Scott H.
reviews.review: Love it.  Get the curry with cashews and cabbage.  Also steamed seafood curry is great.  Only 1 dud - a snapper dish.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: I had BBQ in Huntsviile yesterday.  This is much better. Relaxing sitting area. Tasty food. I had the pulled chicken, baked potato, and baked beans. All good. Friendly staff. I'll come here every time I travel back to BNA.I upped this to a 5 because the service has been awesome.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: The BBQ beans were the best part of the meal.  The brisket was VERY dry.  The pork was OK.Very friendly staff.

reviews.name: K M.
reviews.review: All the 5 different sauces were way too spicey.  The mild was either mislabeled or else they do not know what mild isThe pork was too bland to eat without sauceThis is my first and last timeBBQ is my favorite food when traveling, just not here

reviews.name: Katie K.
reviews.review: I was In Nashville on business. I absolutely had to get as much BBQ as possible while I was here. My hotel concierge said this was her favorite place in Nashville. Holy Moly! Now I see why! It's solid. It's flavorful. It's beyond reasonably priced. The service is great! I went twice in one day! It's not much to look at, but don't be deceived. Go here!Get the smoked pulled pork. Get the Mac and cheese. Try all the BBQ sauces. Yum!

reviews.name: John K.
reviews.review: If your in town come visit this place!! Awesome service and great food. I ordered 2 meat combo. Pork and smoked sausage with 2 sides Mac n cheese and mash potatoes and a large drink is $0.99 and a 10% discount if u check in at yelp!!! Not bad for the price and food is very good!!! Their Mac n cheese is pretty good !!! If you can eat all this you had to be starving. Plenty of food for 2. Hope you stop by this place is greeeaaaat

reviews.name: Julie K.
reviews.review: Today I went through the drive thru. I ordered a baked potato w chicken and a sweet tea, due to my doctor changing my diet to include NO caffeine, I asked the girl when I got to the window if I could change the tea to a sprite. She got real shitty (which is not normal) and said that my total would now be 9.05, so up a little over a dollar. It isn't the dollar it's her crappy attitude. I'm taking a break from there after this visit. Let's hope my food is right.

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: Great BBQ, fast and friendly service! I was very impressed with the staff, cashiers were well trained and knew the menu. Plenty of staff in the dining area, checking in and keeping everything nice and clean. Had the sampler platter, great ribs, chicken and BBQ bread. Really liked the mash potatoes and brown gravy

reviews.name: Peach B.
reviews.review: Cornbread dressing warm and soft just like thanksgiving dinner. Pulled chicken had a good taste on top of cornbread.  Mix the Carolina and sweet sauces for a great dip for your fries. Sweet tea is great. Brisket a little too tough however had a good smoked flavor. Good place to bring group of friends or family.

reviews.name: Anna S.
reviews.review: This is now the second time we have been here, having been here a couple days ago! It was so good, we decided to come back on our way back to South Carolina.My mom is GF due to health reasons, and the manager was really good about letting us know what was gluten-free, along with having a menu showing what was gluten-free.I had the pulled pork spud and greatly enjoyed it. I would highly recommend this place to anyone traveling through the greater Nashville area!

reviews.name: Michelle C.
reviews.review: The owner came out right away to greet us, chat a little, and even gave us a few tips on Nashville events. It was so friendly and nice!The food was incredible. They have a great selection of sauces and the meat was all cooked to perfection. We had the sampler, a loaded potato, turkey sandwich, and fried pickles.  everything was good!

reviews.name: Neema C.
reviews.review: My food was cold, dried and smelled funny (very old baby back ribs). My husband didn't like the bland pulled chicken. But the service was good though. We won't come back. Sorry guys!

reviews.name: Steve B.
reviews.review: Tremendous BBQ.  Down with Team Portions.  Own BBQ sauce.  Service was kinda unfriendly but the food was definitely worth it.  Banging brisket, mac and cheese, collards greens, texas toast absolutely wonderful

reviews.name: Giovanni F.
reviews.review: Beautiful place. Ita walking distance from the hotels near the airport. So everyone(like myself) that has a canceled flight until the next day I so reccomend coming. It screams Nashville and I'm screaming I LOVE IT. Their Tennessee Fire sause is no joke. Extremely good!! They even have license plates from other states(including New Jersey, where I'm from). Its worth the canceled flight.

reviews.name: Mike K.
reviews.review: The three of us shared chicken nachos, pork, brisket, fries, beans, cornbread and slaw with various sauces.  The pork lacked a smoky taste and seemed salty.  The brisket was a little dry but otherwise ok.  The chicken nachos, topped with queso cheese, were excellent.The baked beans were delicious.  Cornbread resembled pancakes and were fought over by our trio - outstanding!  Fries were non-descript frozen variety.Service was friendly and prompt.

reviews.name: Wendy B.
reviews.review: My family loves bar-b-cue and believes good bar-b-cue is a true artform. We are in town for a short business + pleasure trip. While we found this restaurant to be tasty, it left much to be desired. The food was not exceptionally memorable, and the service -- though acceptable -- was provided without much hospitality. The Carolina sauce was a little spicier than expected, but except for the sweet, it was the only sauce with much flavor. I was pleasantly surprised to find baked beans on the nachos, as I've never seen that done before. But again, we didn't really find a reason to visit again.

reviews.name: Joze C.
reviews.review: LOVE LOVE LOVE Bar-B-Cutie! Anytime I travel to Nashville for business I make sure to stop there at least twice before I have to head back to Chicago. They have a great BBQ menu. I personally enjoy the pulled pork sandwiches, loaded spuds (baked potato with cheese, bacon, pulled pork, butter) they have great bread and the ice for their fountain drinks is great (trust me, you'll see) The people there are always very helpful and pleasant, gives you a feel of that southern hospitality.

reviews.name: Scott T.
reviews.review: The bar for BBQ in Nashville, it's just disappointedly low. This is a very cute little restaurant and the food really isn't particularly bad. It just isn't that good. I'm almost hesitant to call it BBQ. The brisket plate I had the meat was dry, no hint of smoke and not particularly much flavor to speak of. The beans were pedestrian, again, no hint of smoke, no savory sweetness, bland sauce. Canned? That's my bet. What's going on with this? The strips were thin and a little tough to cut with a fork. The cornbread a little dry and the okra, which actually looked like maybe it wasn't out of a bag frozen, had more stringy bits than I'm used to experiencing. Will say the people working here though were really, really nice.There's nothing here resembling the grand Memphis BBQ on the west end of the state, and there sure as hell isn't anything even approaching Kansas City BBQ I'm used to. I could get used to the Carolina sauces and flavors and have enjoyed them in other parts of the South. Whoever is managing this beautiful venue, suggest they get out and eat at a few other places in town, and then have a meal in your own restaurant and tell me you aren't tasting the difference. Good BBQ can be found in Nashville. The enjoyment of what makes it great was simply not to be found here on this visit.

reviews.name: Tony A.
reviews.review: I don't get to Nashville very often but when I do I come to Bar B Cuties. This place seems like a local hangout, and the service is tremendous! Sure, you order at the counter and they bring your plates to the table, but they check back frequently to make sure that everything is right. The sauce selection is large, all the traditional sides are available, and the barbeque bread is great. Being from Seattle I can't tell the difference between good and truly great barbeque, but I like what they have.Always too full to try dessert, I can't comment on that. If you are near the Nashville airport, give this place a try.

reviews.name: Michael M.
reviews.review: I flew in on business and I am not much of a BBQ person, but I figured when in Nashville, do as the Tennesseans do!I am very glad I tried this place! The wings were delicious and tender. They slid right off the bone. The sauce was thick and very tasty! The staff was very nice, the price was right and I would definitely go back!

reviews.name: Phil S.
reviews.review: This is always my go to BBQ joint. Been coming here for years. Never been disappointed. I'd love to try more items in the menu but can't get away from the pulled pork. Momma usually gets the stuffed baked potatoes. Portions are always more than generous. If I were to complain about anything it would be their selection of sauces but the sauces they serve are excellent. There may be better BBQ elsewhere but Bar-B-Cutie is always excellent.

reviews.name: Jason L.
reviews.review: I m confused by yelpers high reviews.  Although I don't have anything negative to say about my experience it wasn't anything worth writing home about either.  They have 5 different bbq sauces all about average for a bbq place.  I had the chicken plater with Brunswick stew with beans and greans.  Beans were very good.  Brunswick stew I don't recommend. Chicken was decent not dry but no real smoke favor.   With so many other places in Nashville I recommend you look elsewhere.

reviews.name: Christina B.
reviews.review: DELICIOUS, quick service, very affordable, amazing assortment of bbq sauces, great iced tea, great sides.  Would highly recommend.

reviews.name: Cc M.
reviews.review: This review is only for their sweet and fruit tea! Oh My Word delicious. Wish I could get a couple of gallons to take home.

reviews.name: Stuart S.
reviews.review: Rather disappointing visit to this old standby. Used to enjoy Bar-B-Cutie on my visits to Nashville in the last century but the Q was a little underwhelming this trip. Ordered the Sampler Platter for dinner which includes BBQ pork, baby back ribs and chicken breast. The pork was good, the ribs are okay ( a little fatty) and the chicken breast was terrible ( appeared to be a thawed out piece of chicken breast from a frozen 10 lb. pack). Can't believe that a BBQ smokehouse wouldn't have 1/4 BBQ chicken (with bones)- maybe they did but apparently not part of this platter. Strongly suggest that they 86 this boneless breast.Getting 3 stars because the staff was very friendly. Had served me fries with the platter and apparently the server felt that they were a bit old and she brought me out a fresh batch.

reviews.name: Lorilyn L.
reviews.review: This was our first time trying Nashville, TN BBQ and it was not that great. First off I was short an order and when I asked for my order the manager came to verify that I didn't order it; so I went ahead and paid for it. A family that we went with got their order incorrect. One of the meals was cold when they brought it out so he asked for a refund and it took the manager a while to come and issue him a refund. On their other food they added sour cream and it was on the receipt that they wanted it on the side. All I can say is first impressions late a long time. I didn't get that from this BBQ place and this is our last stop here in TN so we won't be able to try BBQ again. Maybe next time. We will try a different place with higher ratings.

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: I have had a good experience here. Food tastes great. Caroline sauce I recommend. I would not call them the best barbecue but they are decent. The Tennessee fire is a bit too hot in my opinion and I like hot.

reviews.name: Wrench O.
reviews.review: I think this is a good BBQ pick .. We had pulled pork ,and the brisket nachos ..it was all good and I would eat it again ....nuff said

reviews.name: Dan G.
reviews.review: Tried this based on a recommendation and yelp reviews. First time here. Good selection of BBQ items, though I have had much better BBQ. I would rate it as ok and a decent price. I probably won't come back because it just wasn't what I expecting. The BBQ sauces at the table were also just ok, none of them hot the spot. I had the beef brisket and pulled pork. Coleslaw was ok, the okra was good and the flat cornbread was ok. Again nothing to shout home about. If you're looking for quick BBQ but not really high expectations you'll probably like it. The atmosphere was pretty good and friendly staff.

reviews.name: Larry G.
reviews.review: Very good low-key barbecue. The atmosphere was local joint chic.  You order at the counter and in short order, the meals are delivered to the table you selected, as indicated by the number you've placed on the table.I tried the sampler and the big surprise was the chicken.  I was not able to identify the spices, but taken together they provide me an unexpected package that was so good, if I return, I'll be getting all chicken.Good stuff.

reviews.name: Rebecca K.
reviews.review: Okay BBQ...it was convenient to the airport and cheap enough. The Carolina sauce was definitely the best, and the mac and cheese was pretty good.I thought the ribs were very meh, but the bbq chicken was decent.

reviews.name: Brian B.
reviews.review: Pretty good BBQ, fast and reasonable priced. This is the kind of place you order off the wall and find a seat and they bring it to you. I had the two meat plate with pulled pork and BBQ smoked sausage. All was real good including the thick toasted bread that came with it. Plus they put a nice selection of sauces in squirt bottles on the table so you can try them all.

reviews.name: Daniel M.
reviews.review: Came to Nashville in May for vacation, had good reviews so we checked it out, glad we did! The food was awesome, me and my fiancee both had the pulled pork and its some of the best I had in Tennessee. The cornbread was awesome and looked like pancakes. The service was also great as we had a very helpful waitress. They had some cool decorations involving licence plates. The restaurant was very clean as well. We went to this location and one other multiple times and we will be back!

reviews.name: Howard B.
reviews.review: We went last night and noticed a long line when we entered the building. After we ordered we kept noticing people standing around waiting on to go orders and we waited quite a while to get our food. We come here every so often and never had any issues as we did last night with the slow service and the food was not as good. After we got our food which took some time The server never came back but once after we were through eating just get our dishes. Usually the services and the food is really good last night that was not the case. I had the barbecue turkey sandwich which looked like it was sliced and stacked out of a can.

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: Great customer service and the people were nice. My food was hot and tea was sweet. My food was average though. It's nothing to brag about.

reviews.name: J H.
reviews.review: I live in GA so we take BBQ as serious as we do family. I always swing into this little joint because it is right by the airport.The food is above average with a below average price. You can sample all the different sauces at your table prior to committing one to your plate I enjoy the TN Fire mixed with the Caroline sauce it is a great Sweet and Hot mixture.Stop reading this and get your booty over to BBQ cutie

reviews.name: Heather B.
reviews.review: Best BBQ I have had in a long time here I am on business and I want BBQ the way my family would have. Coworkers told me this is the place and they sure are right. I will be back on my next trip

reviews.name: Dave B.
reviews.review: Super nice people and great atmosphere. But if you love barbecue, this ain't the place. In a word, "terrible." Fatty tasteless ribs. Dry brisket. You are much better off with barbecue from the truck next to Sherwin Williams on Lebanon Pike, Pegleg Porker, Jack's, BB Kings or even Dave's Famous. BC barbecue is great too.

reviews.name: Kenny Y.
reviews.review: Not the best BBQ.  It was quick and simple.

reviews.name: Stephen F.
reviews.review: Stopped in because it was close to the hotel...ordered the Pork Plate with Fries & Brunswick Stew.......The fries were the frozen crinkle type, pretty standard for a BBQ joint...the Brunswick Stew a big thumbs up the pork was moist with just the right hint of smoke. The variety of BBQ sauces added to the meal..... mustard based to vinegar based they had them all right on the table.The folks there were as nice as could be and the restaurant bright and clean.

reviews.name: Cheryl S.
reviews.review: Yummy food, generous portions and a great friendly  staff making sure each guest has all they need!  The creamed corn was delicious.  Restaurant was very clean and had comfy booth seating.

reviews.name: Diane L.
reviews.review: My husband really enjoyed the ribs.  They were well prepared and he liked all sauces available especially the hot ones. I had the brisket which was fine but I was not a fan of the sauces.  I prefer a sweeter sauce. Their sweet sauce wasnt very sweet. I guess I just like my Chicago BBQ.  Staff was very friendly.

reviews.name: Jennifer G.
reviews.review: Blech!! Dry, tasteless, and altogether disappointing. Nice staff tho- just not enough to make up for the meal!

reviews.name: Bernadette M.
reviews.review: Off the plane and the family and I were looking for BBQ. My sister found this place on Yelp of course and our full minivan with me at the wheel headed straight to Bar-B-Cutie. You walk in and the menus are on the wall leading you to the register like it was Sizzler. They have combo plates, many sides to choose from, a kids meal and desserts. I ordered our meals, grabbed a number and occupied a long table.Our food arrived and it was sooo good. The corn bread was unbelievably good. The chicken and pork were good and the fried pickles were delicious. But the best thing about this place behind the corn bread was their selection of sauces from mild to Tennessee Fire and whoooo boy, it'll make you sweat! Oh, they were soo good. So good I bought four bottles. Two for me, two for friends that personally requested bbq sauce as payment for watching baby (my Boston Terrier) at home. And they enjoyed them. When I'm almost out, I'll have to get my cousins to send me some. It's that good.Decor had a farm house feel but with a big flat screen on the wall. Check out the collection of license plates that were in place instead of crown molding and be sure to go blonde and take a photo as The Bar-B-Cutie.

reviews.name: Jun E.
reviews.review: Great food, friendly staff, clean space, very comfortable place even just taking meal alone.  I will visit again !

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: This is my first time visiting any Bar b cutie.  It was pretty good.  I had the brisket and it was tasty,  but seemed a little bit like it was a Cisco product. I do not know where they get their meat from.  So can't say for sure.   But i have my reservations about it.  But it was good ...there are better bbq around.  So if you're a hard core bbq person you'll want to seek out another place.  If you're looking for quick good food.  This is your place.

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: I love their pulled pork sandwiches drenched in BBQ sauce and extra pickle!I gave it 4 stars because well, I wouldn't quite say they are the BEST BBQ spot in Nashville. It's not mind blowing BBQ, but it's damn good and worth the money.

reviews.name: Kat W.
reviews.review: Being from GA, and my husband from TX we have high expectations for BBQ.  I figure Nashville should still be the south right?  It definitely did not meet our expectations.  My bbq was basically wet, which caused it to be mushy.  My husband's brisket was the same.  I don't know if that issue happen s in the cooking or in the storing afterwards.  I enjoyed having many bbq choices but that Carolina sauce wasn't up to par.  The place seems to be full of kids, which isn't a problem.  The problem is they didn't really seem interested in their jobs.  Just laughing and playing around.  Constantly in and out the doors, talking instead of talking orders.  I even saw one come from the kitchen just talking on their cell. Very unsanitary.  All in all it was just Meh.  I've had worse, but I've had way way better.

reviews.name: Chris L.
reviews.review: Always a tasty bargain for Bbq sandwiches and good sweet tea. This location has the best atmosphere of the 4 locations I've visited. Staff were helpful and professional, and everything was clean except the bathroom floor.

reviews.name: Jennifer F.
reviews.review: Wanted to Barbecue in Nashville, by the airport and decided to try BBQ Cutie. I ordered a rack of wet ribs with Mac n cheese and fried okra. The Mac n cheese and okra was cold. The ribs were extremely dry. I will not go back.

reviews.name: Travis F.
reviews.review: I ordered the managers special bbq pork with two sides. I went with Mac and cheese and fried orca. Everything was rather bland. I loaded up my pork with BBQ sauce to which you get a nice selection of at your table. It was well priced for 6.99 for the amount of food but I got what I paid for. The Mac and cheese was from a box and didn't seem fresh. The fried orca was equally tasteless and I didn't finish it. I wasn't given anything to dip it in and bbq sauce wasn't an orca dipping sauce in my opinion. I also got to try their cornbread which looks like a pancake. This was equally tasteless and neither I or the person who ordered it finished it. No butter provided and it tasted bad. I didn't try the ribs which the meat fell off the bone but i was told it was very salty. It's not a bad place but definitely not my favorite.Good place for cheap bbq.

reviews.name: Mark C.
reviews.review: Smells great!  First visit. Welcomed nicely and extremely prompt service. Can't wait to try it. I bet I'll be back. Walked in from my hotel and was very pleased with the restaurant. Wish I had found it earlier.

reviews.name: W. Dannie L.
reviews.review: Well lots of people were talking about this place so we went. Everything had a extremely good flavor,  but all of it was just barely warm. Now it was 8pm when we got there and they close at 9pm but still! I got a "hot" roast beef, backed beans, mashed potatoes and mac and cheese.  All but the backed beans were cold or on the cool side. But even with that it was good and filling. The BBQ was good. If we lived here we would come back.

reviews.name: Maritza M.
reviews.review: On a recent trip to Nashville we chose this restaurant for dinner, and were not disappointed. My group had a variety of meals: chicken, pork and beef; all were tasty. Sides were good as well. I especially liked the selection of 5 different bbq sauces on the table, so I could try various flavors. All were very good actually, except the yellow Carolina one. Too mustardy for this Texas gal!

reviews.name: Scott K.
reviews.review: I was in Nashville for family reasons and staying at the Marriott.  The person at the front desk recommended this place for some good BBQ.   It was a short drive from the hotel and easy to find.  I ordered the sampler platter with Brunswick Stew as a side.  The ribs unfortunately were a bit dry, the chicken was a bit rubbery and the BBQ sauce that I tried was not much tangier than catchup.  The pulled pork however was delicious!!!  Moist and tender with a nice smoky flavor...  I can't say that I'll make a special effort to return to this spot...but I will say that this place made me miss my Atlanta BBQ spot--Fat Matts...  Drive through service was quick and efficient and even friendly.  Overall not a bad experience.  Do yourself a favor...get the pulled pork...  Lol

reviews.name: Sai R.
reviews.review: We have lunch at this place quite regularly. The food is always excellent. Today, though, we had a server named Lexi. She was absolutely fabulous. Very energetic and took great interest in what we needed. She was also thoughtful to get the job done and leave us to our conversations. Very rarely do you find that quality in restaurants unless its a high end place. A great big thumbs up !!!

reviews.name: Benjamin O.
reviews.review: I have reviewed this place a few times, and eaten there a few more. I believe today was my 7th or 8th time there in the last 2-3 months. The girl behind the counter gasped when I pulled out a little zip lock bag to pull out my card to pay, "What?? You don't have a wallet?" I explained I had recently lost mine (truth is I was a crime victim, and my wallet was stolen).
