Anyway... then another employee passing by stopped to comment on my zip lock bag as well (and the loud shock just kept spewing from the girls mouth... she could just not shut up).... while these comments were seemingly harmless to the people who said the words...it was incredibly embarrassing to me personally.... to have this racket going on so that other patrons were able to know my situation of not having an actual wallet. It really embarrassed me and hurt my feelings more than anything, and flooded memories from the night of the incident when my wallet was stolen.  This is what happens when establishments employ young people..and sometimes people who should be old enough to know better than to comment on things like this to someone spending money at your restaurant.My order was then kind of messed up, and the issue rectified... but this was my first sketchy experience at this particular location. It will most probably be a while before I return, if at all, and I will be experimenting with other bar b que places on the mean time. I NOW have a greater appreciation of other more negative reviews because the staff in there this afternoon could DEFINITELY use a customer service class....with a good dose of "take the damn money and keep your mouth shut"One of the staff, I think overheard me telling my friend (who would not eat after the cashier shenanigans)  that it was embarrassing and kind of hurt my feelings...I was then asked 3 times in less than 10 minutes if everything was ok... on the meantime I was just cramming food in my mouth trying to eat fast to get the hell out.I have a policy about things like this... I will refrain from going here for 3 months and try again.... and if other negative experiences happen... it will just get crossed off my list.I will say the food is always ok for me... but today the customer service experience was well below average....or what should be experienced.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: Came for a week long vacation and wanted to something good and fast did a little search at our hotel and this place popped up!! Delicious food!! The cornbread was delicious and the brisket was juicy and tender (just the way I like it)!! Plus there's a drive thru!!

reviews.name: M D.
reviews.review: only had a bit of time before we had to catch a plane, saw this on Yelp, decided to give it a go. Bit different, no waitress service, you order, go sit, they bring it. Ok, I can handle that, especially what happens after you sit! they have someone the comes around to see how you are doing, get you stuff you may need, refills your drinks and does this all with a smile. Very different from other places where you order your food and then go sit. Food was great, got stuffed! Cornbread looked different than anything I've ever seen, it looked more like a pancake, but don't let that fool you! Yum! Mac and cheese and potatoes and gravy were 'ok', nothing to write home about, but the pulled pork sandwich and the ribs were out of this world. Will stop in next time we are back in Nashville. (Very close to the airport)

reviews.name: Keny H.
reviews.review: Not a very good place. So sorry. Barbecue was over cooked and slopped in cold sauce. Probably won't be back for another shot.

reviews.name: Kimberly M.
reviews.review: For me this place was just EH. This was my first time in Nashville and visited Bar-B-Cutie on a recommendation that was significantly blown our of proportions. I wasn't a fan of their cornbread at all. The pork was decent, the beef brisket was better, but the sausage was gross. The mashed potatoes were kickin' and my friends were GA GA over the macaroni. They could've been a little more generous with their portions especially for the price you pay, just saying. The staff though... unbelievable. Super friendly and was eager to offer advice as to what to do in Nashville and where to get cheap wine and beer. SCORE!! Although I wasn't a fan of their food, maybe I'm just partial to a local BBQ joint in Cincy, I would go there again. There are other things I'd like to try.

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: Visiting the area and this restaurant was near the hotel. After experiencing BBQ from Austin TX, this food was average. I had the brisket platter with a side of Mac and cheese, with mashed potatoes and gravy. The brisket was dry, but had a great taste. So to say the least I wasn't blown away. The potatoes and mac and cheese were the highlights of the meal. They had a hot pickle and peppers bar which was excellent. The sauces were really flavorful. The woman running meals to tables was great. Very friendly and asking for the desert sale. I wouldn't say it was the best, but definitely worth trying if in the area.

reviews.name: Rob H.
reviews.review: Great food!  BBQ and cornbread are very good.  Carolina Sauce is excellent

reviews.name: Michelle F.
reviews.review: Oh Yelp...you rarely do it, but you steered me wrong...My friend and I were looking for a good BBQ place, and Yelp reviews led us here.  I really wish it had led us elsewhere!!  anywhere else...So my friend ordered the sampler basket (BBQ Pork, Baby back ribs, grilled chicken, corn bread and her side was the cream corn).  I got the beef brisket and my sides were the baked beans and the macaroni and cheese.So your oder, get your number and sit down to wait.  The lady brought out our food after about 10 minutes.  We were really excited.  Tried the beans.  Good.  tried the cream corn.  Good.Tried everything else on the plate--ICE COLD to the touch.  Every meat was freezing.  Chicken, ribs, beef brisket, beef, all very very cold.  So we bring it back to the counter and point it out--because like a previous reviewer stated--BBQ aint cheap.  We paid over $30, and we wanted great BBQ.The lady takes in back and comes back in about 5 minutes with our food.  the same food.  They just tried to microwave everything to heat it up which made this NASTY, DRIED OUT, CONGEALED mess of meat.  It was SO disgusting.  Nice customer service, guys.We left our plates full and our tummies empty and went to Ellendale's instead.  I won't be returning.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: This is one of my favorite BBQ places in the country. The food is always great. They have sweat BBQ sauce (as well as several other types) and some of the best sides. Their pulled pork and brisket are both always great, coleslaw, mac and cheese are very straight forward and they don't try to do anything fancy...just good. Their "texas toast" which they call something else, is worth the trip. Oh, and who can get great sweat tea.

reviews.name: Phil N.
reviews.review: I will not be going here again. It's not terrible. Just not special. And who has time to go somewhere meh?

reviews.name: Chris P.
reviews.review: Great food. No, AMAZING food! Love this place. Landed in Nashville and asked where to get some good food and was told to go here! The pulled pork is very flavorful, the meat falls off the ribs, the chicken is moist and delicious. The sauces are great as well. Each table has all 5 sauces they make and you can add what you want and how much. I even bought some to bring home. Staff is super nice. If you land in Nashville, you MUST check out this place.

reviews.name: Jack M.
reviews.review: Meat is just so so.  I travel from Florida, Texas, Iowa, through Tennessee.  Eat a lot of BBQ.  Mushy pork and only boneless skinless chicken breast!  Where's the chicken???   Second time here and did not mean to stop, but only BBQ joint near the airport.  Shoneys across the street!   Next time

reviews.name: Tamara D.
reviews.review: We had the pulled pork and beef brisket, which were very, very good.  The sides were average.  If you're seeking inexpensive, no frills, delicious barbq look no further.  People aren't here for atmosphere or fancy fixins.

reviews.name: Brooke S.
reviews.review: Pretty good food if you're looking for a quick bbq fix on the way home from the airport. Sauces were good, brisket was delish, no complaints. I was visiting from out of town and found this place on Yelp and it didn't disappoint.

reviews.name: Robert G.
reviews.review: Was in Nashville for work and this place was close to my hotel. Kind of a funky joint but the staff were nice and friendly. I had some sort of combo of ribs, brisket and a link. All of it was good. Not great, but really good. The flapjack style cornbread was cool, freaked out my coworker a little bit though. I like that they have a variety of their sauces right on the table so you can fix up your stuff any way you want. The dining room was acceptably clean. It can be tough to keep a BBQ joint spotless but it seemed like they were trying.

reviews.name: Leah D.
reviews.review: Very charming. There was a family in front of us in line who were regulars and made some recommendations. The pulled pork plate was medium sized and I chose Mac n cheese and fried okra as the sides. All were pretty good, though I've had better in Nashville (I.e. Jack's). The sauce choices were fun. The brisket was pretty dry. Overall, satisfying but not my new favorite place.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: Granted, I haven't tried every BBQ place in and around Nashville, but of the ones I have tried, Bar-b-Cutie is one of my faves. Yes, I know it's a chain and it's not cool to like chains but whatever, it's good. I've had the pork BBQ sandwich, the nachos, and the loaded potato. All very tasty! They have a pretty big menu with lots of variety. I've always gotten my food to-go and the service has always been friendly. Nothing bad to say about this place.

reviews.name: Ashley S.
reviews.review: Yum, yum, yum!I was staying just outside Nashville this past weekend for a wedding, and my brother and I had a craving for BBQ and ribs. It was kind of a haul walking from the Embassy Suites, but it was worth it. I ordered ribs with sides of coleslaw, fried okra and BBQ toast. I know...oink. Whatever. My brother ordered the BBQ pork sandwich and a side of turnip greens. The food came out in just a few minutes, and the guy who served it was very friendly and nice. He also checked back once or twice to see if we needed anything. Being a huge fan of condiments, I loved how there were 5 or 6 kinds of sauce on the table, and they were all tasty (especially the Tennessee Fire).The one small drawback was that the okra was just kind of lukewarm, which wasn't a big deal, but I could see it annoying somebody who really likes their food to come out hot. All in all, I really liked this place and would definitely go back. Yum!

reviews.name: E Y.
reviews.review: Better than average fast food, and way better service. I had the brisket plate and that was plenty. I think I liked the TN hot sauce best.

reviews.name: L H.
reviews.review: Great place and great prices. My BBQ sandwich was awesome. Cole slaw was ok. Would definitely recommend!

reviews.name: Cynthia P.
reviews.review: Had a terrific pork BBQ sandwich yesterday!  Cheerful drive up dude is the best!  He is always such a delight! And gets the order right too!   Makes my day to see competent and friendly service!

reviews.name: Joe G.
reviews.review: Dry brisket but very flavorfull! Overall very tastey.

reviews.name: Christine R.
reviews.review: Great little neighborhood BBQ joint - those that live in Nashville are lucky! This Yankee loves BBQ and was thrilled a friend suggested this as a place to eat after being picked up at the airport. (Disclaimer, not sure this was the exact location but as a chain, I'm sure the standards are consistent.)We came in with three adults and three children during a busy lunch hour - one of the employees immediately approached us and helped us find a suitable table and highchair. Very nice and very appreciated. I saved the table and everyone else went to order - DH got me a large pulled pork sandwich with onion rings. YUMMY! I thought the pancake style cornbread was kinda weird and so did the kids but the baby loved them, lol. Really good Carolina and Sweet Sauces, among others, already on the table. Tables are cleared quickly and washed down. Looks like the staff does a good job at keeping the place tidy.

reviews.name: Brad H.
reviews.review: I was skeptical that this would be "just another BBQ joint" but was very pleased with my meal and the service (didn't expect to be checked on and offered refill service at a counter-order restaurant). I had the turkey platter, with brunswick stew and cornbread dressing.  The side items overshadowed the turkey by far (turkey was just OK, I'll try chicken or pork next time). But the brunswick stew was incredible, and the same goes for the cornbread dressing. Outstanding.  Liked the variety of 5 different sauces, tried them all and liked the Carolina (think Cattleman's Gold sauce) and the Hot the best.  Will definitely be back next time I'm in the area.

reviews.name: Jim R.
reviews.review: love me some bar-b-cutie ... just amazing great service.. and good bbq

reviews.name: Bruce P.
reviews.review: Great pork salad (not on menu)! They also give your 4 legged friends a treat when you hit the drive thru! So sweet

reviews.name: Joe L.
reviews.review: First time here very disappointed the food was cold so we sent it back and the second time it was almost warm. Flavor was ok Mac and cheese was watery

reviews.name: Bret D.
reviews.review: This came on the recommendation of the Hotel. Not impressed. Meat was good, had brisket and pork. Brisket was sliced super thick, which made it feel tougher than it was. Pork was excellent.  Wish I could say the same for the sides....mac & cheese was nasty and cornbread were like pancakes.....

reviews.name: Danny B.
reviews.review: I only eat at Bar-B-Cutie when I have an uncontrollable taste for barbecue and can not  find que no where else... Nuff Said!

reviews.name: Melia R.
reviews.review: I gotta admit the name hooked me in. I had no idea what to expect, being from out of town....and maybe I'm no authority (since I'm from out of town), but I was pleasantly surprised by the food. I had the pulled pork on cornbread pancakes. The cakes kinda reminded me of corndog breading, and their sweetness did something nice to the whole package when I covered the pork in Carolina sauce (my favorite of the four sauces on the tables).The potato salad is the kind I like....creamy with a mustard-y tang, but sweet, too.The tea was almost gritty it was so sweet.mmmm mmmmm

reviews.name: Dan B.
reviews.review: Just average.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I planned on trying each sauce but started with the Carolina and it was just too good to pass up. Fried pickles hit the spot. Fruit tea was unbearably sweet.

reviews.name: Katie H.
reviews.review: First time in Tennessee and first stop:BBQ. It was pretty tasty. I couldn't complain much except one of the friends I was with waited half an hour to get her sandwich. But the hostess gave her a free pudding for waiting so long.

reviews.name: Laurence T.
reviews.review: Best thing about this restaurant is the pulled pork sandwich and their variety of tasty sauces.  Ribs were below average. Just order the pull pork sandwich and you'll should be happy happy.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: The service was super friendly. Good ribs and decent pulled pork. Great cornbread griddle cakes. Skip the Texas toast. Lima beans were mushy but the white beans were good. Plenty of sauces to choose from.

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: Must love salt. Had the Rib plate. Food was too salty for my taste. I'll look for something else, next time I'm in town.

reviews.name: Jacob J.
reviews.review: Exactly as Josh B describes, "Quick, clean barbecue" It's fast food barbecue without the fast food so much. A better encounter awaits inside, so skip the drive-thru. For about ten dollars you can experience the sampler which includes a side, corn bread for two, half slab (sauce of your choice), portion of BBQ chicken breast and BBQ pulled meat. Squirt a bit of all three sauces and try them side by side for a tasty time. Their hot sauce has a definite kick which is enjoyed. BBQ is good and not heavy. Dining in, service checks in every so often offering additional bread or asking if anything else is needed. Kinda strange. You stand in line and order from wall sized menu's, sit and wait for an associate to bring your food. Beginning to end you are taken care of by someone that's genuine. If only more people out here would tip a bit nicer? Well, makes my tip amount look like gold. Good BBQ and light. I will never understand Southerners and their love of sweet tea, blah! It's not just Bar-B-cutie's sweet tea, most places in the south make it unbearably sweet.

reviews.name: Emily R.
reviews.review: The pulled pork here is really good: flavorful and tender. Of the 4 sauces available I preferred the Sweet Sauce. The Tennessee Fire was too hot for me and the Mild was too bland. Turnip greens were good, but I was very disappointed with the corn bread, which was dry and tasteless (and also shaped like a pancake - weird). The Mac and Cheese also had no flavor. Didn't try any of the desserts. Overall, decent and affordable and satisfied my craving for BBQ.

reviews.name: Marnie B.
reviews.review: Ranked #1 BBQ for 2013...NOT SO MUCH! Forgot items in our order, forgot to add BBQ sauce. Well actually gave only one of us BBQ sauce and it was not the one we had asked for.  Employees have attitude with their manager on the job, not very professional in my opinion.  As for the food, MEDIOCRE at best.  My chopped brisket was cold and not very enjoyable.  Step your game up!

reviews.name: Mell F.
reviews.review: They have what may well be the best pork BBQ sandwich in the Nashville area. I really like this little local chain. I have visited serveral of their locations and all a consistent and delicious. They have a good variety of menu items and sauces. BBQ stuffed baked potatoes are outstanding and huge.  Crinkle cut fries - WIN. (I just like cheap crinkle cut fries. Don't judge me!)Surly service from an unhappy young lady on a Sunday afternoon, but I didn't go there for ego boost anyway.Pork BBQ sandwich with coleslaw and a combination of Carolina and Hot sauces, and you have yourself a dandy dish.

reviews.name: Gaby G.
reviews.review: Somewhat good.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: This is a chain, the "fast food" of southern BBQ. That being said, the food is good, the sauces are good, and it's a great value for the price with consistent quality- I've never had a sub-par meal here.I'm from California but I've spent enough time in the South to have experienced southern-style corn bread and it's NOT the "Marie Calendar's" style (which my Nashville friends call sweet corn cake, not bread!). Bar-B-Cutie is faithful to tradition and serves southern corn bread.... shaped like a pancake, more dense, and really great with butter or dipped in BBQ juices. Yum. The atmosphere is casual, service was fast and  friendly.  Bathroom clean, parking easy and plentiful.

reviews.name: Jennifer D.
reviews.review: People must really hate airport food. That is the only possible reason I could see behind this place getting 4 & 5 star reviews!  I didn't realize it was a chain from the Yelp reviews that I read before choosing this restauraunt.  The location is great, right by the airport- and I was starving.I paid about $17 for a pulled pork platter and drink.  It was a heap of (almost cold by the time I got it) pulled pork, 2 cornbread pancakes (okay, that's weird.) and 2 sides.This place has the same set up as City BBQ (which I frequent in Cincinnati) but is nowhere near the level of quality, in my humble opinion.My first test for a barbecue joint- is "Would I eat the meat with no sauce?"  Failed.  It was dry and the flavor was just nothing special.Second, because I LOVE barbecue sauce, I've got a pretty high standard for sauces.  I love to mix them.  In this case, the label on the sauces told me all I need to know.  "Tomato ketchup with vinegar and spices."  The label was the same on pretty much every bottle- and it was absolutely on point.  Tasted like ketchup and vinegar.  There were 5 different kinds, and I mixed 3 of them to come up with a flavor that I liked.  Well, kind-of liked.Whoever made the comment about the sweet tea being way past sweet was right on point.  I mixed less than a third of a cup into my un-sweetened tea and it was nearly too sweet for me even then!The cornbread, okay.  I wanted a muffin, or a slice of bread... but I got... a pancake.  A really dry flavorless pancake at that.  I ate half of a piece and left the rest.The mashed potatoes and gravy were so salty, I couldn't tell which was burning my mouth... the salt or the alternated bites of BBQ with Tennessee Fire sauce.  And I *LOVE* salt.  You know it's bad if I think it's too salty.The Mac N Cheese tasted like a stouffer's Mac n Cheese with a few tablespoons of water mixed in.  I almost asked for something different.You know what, I started this review with 3 stars, but as I remembered things, I changed my mind!  It wasn't the MOST AWFUL food I've had while traveling, but I probably will not go back.

reviews.name: Peter P.
reviews.review: Great for a quick southern bbq bite. Service has always been pretty quick.

reviews.name: Jordan C.
reviews.review: Chicken was dry and all of my food was basically cold. My friend had the turkey and complained of the same thing. The bbq sauce was good which I'm sure is out of necessity due to the lack of flavor! Maybe we just ordered the wrong thing because there was a decent crowd for lunch. Either that or there are no other options in the area!

reviews.name: Bob K.
reviews.review: Great tasting food! Good atmosphere and very friendly staff. Wide choice of selections. Best fruit tea in town!! Never had a bad experience.

reviews.name: Licinius S.
reviews.review: this place is awesome..!!  excellent bbq and great weekly specials..!!  reg bbq pulled pork sandw combo M-W is 5$..!!  also daily specials, but too many to list and it changes too..  great sauces..!!  carolina and tennessee fire..!!  love this place..  also, fire, emt, police, and military discounts..!!  i go here at least once a week..!!  great homemade banana pudding..!!

reviews.name: Tasha D.
reviews.review: Pulled pork sandwich is delicious.  Mon-Wed regular pulled pork sandwich combo is $4.99. My drink was upgraded to large for free. Next time I'm in TN, definitely will eat here again.

reviews.name: Catherine K.
reviews.review: Maybe I'm biased, but the Donelson location is SO good!  I've tried Bar-B-Cutie in other locations and was never a fan.  I decided to give it one more shot at this store and absolutely LOVE it!

reviews.name: Jen A.
reviews.review: 'Fast food', sit-down BBQ. Food was okay, not bad not great. You order food at the register, then sit down at a table/booth & it will be brought to you when it's ready. Good amount of food for the price. I got the pulled pork, which was just so-so. I always order pulled pork at BBQ joints and I'd put this in the lower middle of favorites/quality.

reviews.name: Sherri T.
reviews.review: great BBQ - and the drive thru is a bonus. the chicken tenders, beef brisket & sampler platter are all really good...

reviews.name: Spike J.
reviews.review: Good food cheap.  Fast service. Tea is way past sweet.  Deceptive name.  No cuties in site.The Tennessee Hot Sauce is not hot at all, and has a powerful vinegar bite.   I destroyed what was really good bbq with it.My side was brunswick stew, very small portion.  Good flavor.Orders made at counter.  Go for the meal, not the experience.

reviews.name: Sophia B.
reviews.review: This place was just horrible! In TN for the weekend and decided to try this place out based on reviews. We both ordered the beef brisket plate. It comes with 2 sides...we had mashed potatoes,fried okra,green beans and mac n cheese. Yuck! I wouldn't even touch the mac n cheese..It looked dried and sticky and the color was very orange. Green beans and fried were "ok" and the potatoes were flat out nasty. No flavor..I took 2 bites and didn't finish. The meat was cold,dry and flavorless. Huge disappointment...I'm from Texas and even the "ok" places there were better than this place. If this is what's considered good bbq here I feel sorry for the locals. Tip of the day..DO NOT EAT HERE! WASTE OF MONEY. We were cheated! I wish I didn't have to give it a star...

reviews.name: Matt L.
reviews.review: First, I'd like to say that in living in Nashville for six years, I never met a pulled pork sandwich I liked.  They were always dried up, slathered in bad sauce, and limp.That being said, I ran into a nice lady who gave me a certificate for a free pulled pork sandwich at Bar-B-Cutie.  I didn't have much of a lunch yesterday at work, so I figured that it was better than nothing.But when I got it, the pork was much fresher, it was juicy, had a real meaty bite to it, and was not drenched in sauce.  In short, it was a very good sandwich, a shock.If all pulled pork sandwiches were this good, it would be a boon to Nashville cuisine, instead of a hindrance.

reviews.name: Elijah L.
reviews.review: After hearing positive reviews, I stopped by and had the Combo platter with grilled chicken, ribs (dry rub) the pulled pork and some mac and cheese. The chicken was a little dry but the ribs and pulled pork were ok. The mac and cheese wasn't fresh. Overall I thought it was just average barbecue and dont expect to go out of my way to return.

reviews.name: Laura E.
reviews.review: GREAT BBQ TO STOP BY IN YOUR WAY OUT OR TO THE AIRPORT.Clean, nice people, cheap and awesome sweet BBQ sauce to add to ur sandwich!!! Jack's is overrated ....places like bar-b-cutie are way better and  u dont have to wait an endless line to eat.

reviews.name: Brian G.
reviews.review: Waste of good meat.  Horrible sauce.  Disgusting beans.

reviews.name: Jaime S.
reviews.review: We came in from out of town, pulled pork sandwiches were bomb, and the ribs were good too. Chicken was a bit dry. Enjoyed all the sauce choices and side dishes.

reviews.name: Jonathan H.
reviews.review: Great value. Good BBQ. I got the sampler with BBQ, ribs, BBQ chicken and a side for $12. I travel to Nashville often and will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Rene G.
reviews.review: Good food. Many options for BBQ sauce... I ate Brunswick stew for the first time and was really tasty.

reviews.name: Brian M.
reviews.review: I come to Nashville every month for business. I eat here at least two times a week when I am here. They have great pulled pork and the service is always friendly. You can't go wrong eating here.

reviews.name: Mark C.
reviews.review: My wife and I just landed and were pretty hungry. The security guard at the rental car place told us about bar b cutie and that he's been eating there for 50 years. Must be good then.... well it was. The ribs fell off the bone and the beef was perfectly smoked. The mashed potatoes were also good. They have different sauces on the table and they all were awesome! Were hitting this place on the way back to the airport tomorrow!!

reviews.name: Chris R.
reviews.review: I stopped in here on a recommendation from a local while traveling.  I prefer to try out the local restaurants when traveling.  It seems to be a smaller chain at least and I had never eaten there.  Being a St. Louis guy, I'm familiar with good BBQ.  This place wasn't bad by any means, but it wasn't exactly great either.  You can see the chain part of the restaurant.I had the sampler platter which included pork, chicken and a couple ribs.  I would say the price was probably a dollar or two high for what I got, but not too far off.  The chicken was ok, nothing that you couldn't do at home.  The ribs had good flavor, but should have been one more for the price.  The pork was really good with good flavor.  They had daily specials, which would be nice for a regular. The sauces were nice and the sweet and hot mixture I usually use worked wonderfully.  The baked potato was good.There was one very friendly, helpful employee and a few that looked like they wanted to be anywhere but there.  I wasn't a big fan of the neighborhood it was in, but it had plenty of parking.Not bad for chain BBQ!

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: Tried it again due to convenience and once again just a so so experience. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either. Sauces are unremarkable and the meats were a little overdone. Haven't found a better BBQ place in this area so you may want to drive a little further if you're looking for something special. It'll fill you up but you ain't writing home about ir.

reviews.name: Kyle E.
reviews.review: We stayed near this place last weekend.  I looked on yelp for places near me and this came up so we figured it was worth a shot.  We werent disappointed.  Its basically fast food bar-b-cue.  We both ordered pork sandwiches and we were happy with them.  They have 4-5 sauces to try, I liked the carolina the best.  The "corn bread" isnt too great.  It looks and almost tastes like a pancake.All in all, the price is very good and the food met and exceeding my expectations for the price.  I would eat here again.

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: I love bbq food and bar be cutie on donelson is the nearest bbq to my home. So whenever I crave for a pulled pork or brisket sandwich, this is the place. I wont say it mind blowing bbq, but for a chain restarurant it is good value for money. It is not the bbq restaurant you plan for the weekend but it is more like the mcdonalds of bbq food.

reviews.name: Albert P.
reviews.review: This is better BBQ than any place back home in baton rouge. If I wanted to spend my life working from morning til night I'd get a franchise, but I'd rather if someone else did so I could just eat there. Pulled pork and brisket (i asked for it chopped which does make it taste better) were excellent even without sauce. It is fun to mix and match the 5 sauces though. I've been to so many BBQ places that can't make sides, but these guys can. Beans, okra, Texas toast, etc. All good.

reviews.name: Cowboy B.
reviews.review: I can't believe I haven't review this place yet. My family and I have been coming here for the past 7 years or so and have yet to be disappointed. We were drawn to it by it's proximity to the airport and our desire to eat at local places (not chains) when we traveled. I've had BBQ all over. In my opinion Bar-B-Cutie has some of the best. Their mild BBQ sauce is my current favorite. And although I know their banana pudding isn't homemade, I can't seem to get enough of it. Prices are always reasonable ($7 for dinner with two sides, depending on what you choose for your main meat selection) plus a few bucks for your selection of sodas or fruit teas. It feels BBQ-wy inside, too. And the employees have always been nice. This place is on our list for a return trip as soon as possible.

reviews.name: Alex S.
reviews.review: Pretty good pulled pork sandwich, four decent sauces to choose from, really cheap price, blazing fast service, and really friendly staff. Not my favorite BBQ ever, but great for the price.

reviews.name: Mike B.
reviews.review: Stopped in for lunch today and had the pulled pork on cornbread cakes with okra.  Yum!  I hit up my sandwich with the sweet bbq sauce.  Definite win.I don't know why I've never seen the fruit tea here before but I'm glad I discovered it.  It is absolutely delicious.Most worth mentioning was the quick friendly staff who zipped through a huge crowd that walked in the door right behind our party.  I overheard one of the staff mention she had worked there 5 years.  That says a lot for a restaurant.

reviews.name: Beau G.
reviews.review: The service was great and the food was too. The sweet sauce was my favorite, and the crinkle fries were a welcome surprise. The cornbread BBQ pork sandwiches were delicious.

reviews.name: Steve L.
reviews.review: Excellent bar-b-q, green beans (home made). Very clean.

reviews.name: Jamie M.
reviews.review: Favorite dining spot on my recent road trip.  There aren't many places that can make a tasty bbq sandwich that doesn't even need sauce!  I ordered a pork sandwich combo with fries as my side.  Like I said, the meat on the sandwich was fabulous, I didn't even want to add any sauce to it.  The fries were okay, they were the thick crinkle cut variety which are hard to cook so they don't taste mushy.  I'd probably get a different side next time.  Really didn't expect such great bbq from a drive thru but life is full of surprises.

reviews.name: Jon A.
reviews.review: Great BBQ, but stay away from the chicken!

reviews.name: Steven K.
reviews.review: I am not a huge fan of BBQ but I have to say, this place is great. I have had some bad BBQ in the past and thought I just did not like it that much but when done right, it is terrific. The Cornbread Sandwich is awesome.

reviews.name: Josh B.
reviews.review: Love this place for quick, clean barbecue.  You gotta try the Cutie, which is kind of like bbq sliders.  Pork served with coleslaw on these homemade cornbread "pancakes".  Awe-inspiring.

reviews.name: Eric R.
reviews.review: Best collard greens this aging hipster reared in New Orleans has ever had. The food here is flavorful and they have ice tea mixed with orange and pineapple juice. I had a quarter white meat rotisserie chicken with two sides and a tea for under $10. The environment is casual and laid back. Servers were friendly. Overall, healthy, flavorful food for reasonable prices.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: I only had food from here as part of a takeout run my coworkers did for our department.I had the quarter dark meat chicken with Jamaican curry and 2 sides. The chicken to me was the best part of the meal. I love a bit of spice and sweetness with my meat dishes, and this fit the bill. It was very tender. I could also taste a vague Indian-influenced seasoning. However, your taste may vary: A coworker had this dish before and didn't like it. She thought it tasted like spicy apple sauce on her chicken.I wasn't too thrilled with the Boija muffins. Apparently they were not only stale and bland in my order, but in my coworkers' orders, and those of a previous excursion to this place.I also had the native cole slaw. I had only 1 bite and didn't care for it. I think I should stick with American style cole slaw.I think I also had some bread. I think they put margarine instead of butter on them. But I'm not sure. It didn't taste like butter to me.We had an order for a about half a dozen of us, and the food was ready fairly quickly.

reviews.name: Kiley H.
reviews.review: Meh. Definitely not my favorite restaurant in Nashville. Service was fine, not rude, but not friendly.  The food was decent. They put everything on one small plate and all my food was touching. They have weird combinations of food-like mashed sweet potatoes with coconut. The restaurant also isn't incredibly clean. Not a bad place, but you definitely have better options in the area!

reviews.name: William L.
reviews.review: This has been my go to place for take out lunch and dinner when I'm in town for work! Their 'Jerk chicken' plate is by no means a traditional Jamaican jerk dish, but I still really like it! Fresh and lean, half chicken with the black bean salad(no sour cream) and the rice is my go to!

reviews.name: Scott H.
reviews.review: Love this place, eat here at least a couple times a month. Super healthy and tastes awesome. Fairly priced, try the 1/2 chicken and fruit tea.

reviews.name: Hattie J.
reviews.review: Friendly staff, but slow service. Took like 8 minutes for the waitress to bring us our waters. Just OK food, though they do give nice-sized portions. Was not impressed. Would not recommend

reviews.name: Chris L.
reviews.review: Do not use your credit card at this location! I just found a charge on my bank account for three times the price of my meal with tip. It's just sad that this restaurant has resorted to scamming their customers.

reviews.name: Shawn B.
reviews.review: The atmosphere of the restaurant is pretty welcoming however the staff is not. We walked in and got seated and were met with a man who just said "We don't have chicken or burgers today" and walked away. No chance for us to ask questions, no explanations as to why this was the case, or anything. Then another woman comes takes our order and we all order. The food came literally 4-5 minutes later which was good but whenever that happens I kind of question why it was so quick. The food tasted like it had been microwaved and was very tasteless. No refills were given in fact, we didn't even see our server until they came back to bring us our check which was about 5-10 minutes after I food came. It was a VERY bad experience. I would not recommend anyone stopping here. There are way too many good options here in this city to settle for such an establishment.

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: Don't go alone. Won't get service after having to seat myself, I could not get anyone to wait on me. After 25 minutes I left. Place wasn't even half full, but they had just one waiter working. So, I guess a table with one person was not a priority.

reviews.name: Melissa C.
reviews.review: I fall in love with the black bean salad every time I go to Calypso cafe I just wish they had a larger seating area and more space / tables / chairs arrive early such as 11 a.m. and you'll get in and out quickly.

reviews.name: Consumer V.
reviews.review: Great food. Vegetarian and gluten free friendly. Prices are very reasonable. Just wish the seating was better (plastic chairs). Top 5 favorites in Nashville.

reviews.name: Snarky S.
reviews.review: This is the restaurant I craved the most when I lived out of state.I'm sad to see the one by the parthenon has closed but I did get there one last time before that happened.The dipping sauce for the nachos is awesome!

reviews.name: Amanda G.
reviews.review: This one star is based solely on service as I didn't have a chance to try the food. My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday around 6pm. The restaurant was half full with a sign by the door saying 'please wait to be seated'.Well, we waited... But it didn't seem like anyone was coming to seat us, so my boyfriend approached the counter and asked if we should wait. (We hadn't been here before, we didn't know). We were told to seat ourselves at any small table on the left side of the restaurant. (The right side was empty).Apparently the table we sat at wasn't small enough because shortly after sitting down, an employee came over to inform us that their half-full restaurant would clearly be packed to the brim before they closed in two hours, and that we should pick a smaller table. Give me a break.  This is not a restaurant where your meal takes 1.5 hours to happen.  Don't pack me in like a sardine before you're even busy. So I'm sitting at a cozy booth eating dinner and giving someone else my money. If you can't pay someone to seat people, then let me sit where I want while I pay to eat your food.

reviews.name: Frankie B.
reviews.review: Meals are well portioned, healthy, and fresh. Not authentic Caribbean food. Atmosphere was friendly. Prices are reasonable.

reviews.name: Jacoby D.
reviews.review: A lot of food for the money! Very, very good rotisserie chicken and sides. Highly recommend if you're in the Berry Hill area.

reviews.name: Cameron J.
reviews.review: One of the best restaurants that serve vegetarian food and filling. Highly recommended. The beans and three never disappoint.

reviews.name: Andy H.
reviews.review: My wife and I love calypso cafe. We are there once or twice every couple of weeks. I usually get the black bean salad with chicken. It is a huge meal (a dinner plate full of lettuce, chicken, black beans, tostitos type chips, onions, and tomatoes) which comes with their kinda spicy, kinda liquidy, barbecue "sauce". That is my favorite part of the salad. I don't like salads and, at first glance, it looks unappealing to me because, well, it's salad. Upon digging in and tasting it, I am a believer. We also always get a side order of their boija muffins as well. They are a sweet cornbread type of muffin with coconut on top. The coconut isn't overwhelming, but there is enough to give it the flavor. My wife typically gets the beans and three and loves their sweet potatoes and black beans. And the fruit tea. I would come here just to get cup of this stuff to go. It seems to be iced tea with orange and pineapple juice mixed in. Very good. After tax and tip, for the muffins, salad, beans and three combo, and 2 drinks it was $25 for 2 people to eat and get VERY full.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: I saw some animal protein on the menu.Place is staffed well.I called in my order and arrived about 10 minutes later and my order was not ready.But everyone was pleasant to me.Prices were ok.I picked up food for a friend, 3 meals in styrofoam.Three sandwiches & three cole slaws.With sales tax and tip it was $25.All three of us had the BBQ pulled chicken sandwich and none of us ate the bun.  Not sure why..We picked the food out off the buns.All three of us ate the cole slaw.Two of us ate the potato chips, that came with the sandwich.It looked to be ample servings.But no one raved about their sandwich.I doubt I'll be back very soon. So many other places in the neighborhood, to try.

reviews.name: Brandon W.
reviews.review: The fruit tea is one of the best in town. Service is fast and no nonsense (perhaps a bit curt). The black bean salad is awesome and wholesome. I could eat that salad at least one a week.

reviews.name: Brittany F.
reviews.review: Fast healthy options that are well priced are definitely the major advantages here! I got the white meat rotisserie chicken with the St Lucia rice and tortilla chips. I definitely should have gotten a different side than the tortilla chips, they were just a little boring, but I guess I shouldn't expect much from tortilla chips. The meat was really good, tender and tasty! The rice was pretty bland but was okay. The service was great, he was attentive and quick. This definitely isn't a go to spot for me now but if I'm in the area and want something quick and better healthwise than fast food I would definitely come back!

reviews.name: Tara S.
reviews.review: We came here a few months back while house hunting in Nashville. I used my trusty yelp app to try and find a place that had good reviews and a unique menu. I've only been once but I don't get all the hype about this place. They are PACKED during lunch time which is about the time we went. Customer service was only so-so. They weren't rude, but they acted a little snobbish at the counter. Our server wasn't terrible, but he wasn't the greatest we've had either. We had to ask for several things and it seemed like he was giving a lot more attention to a couple bigger parties than our party of 2. I get it, there's more people to look after and possibly a bigger tip, but we felt a bit ignored and left to fend for ourselves. When the food came out it was just mediocre. I had a BBQ sandwich and it was a bit dryer than I'm used to. My husband wasn't really impressed with his food either.Log story short, mediocre food and staff. It wasn't bad, but I won't be seeking this place out anytime soon either.

reviews.name: Amy L.
reviews.review: My mom and I had the black beans with 3 sides. All choices were yummy. My 9 year old daughter had the kids nachos. She was not impressed. All they did was take shredded cheese put on top of tortilla chips and melt it! Not good!! It came with a side of some sauce and she didn't care for that, either. But we lived our choice!

reviews.name: Katie I.
reviews.review: I still desperately miss the Belle Meade location, but I make it a point to trek over to the 100 oaks location mostly for an early dinner with my family. This location seems to be very kid friendly- they even have a basket with kids toys!  My go-to staple is the black bean salad with white meat chicken and lite vinaigrette. Fruit tea is the bomb. It's not too too sweet, you can taste the tea, but you get a little spice and pineapple, too. It's delish! Calypso is awesome, fast, inexpensive healthy food and super tasty!

reviews.name: J. B.
reviews.review: Black bean salad with beef ROCKS!!! The fact it's served cold means the dish can't be ruined but good luck with anything being serving warm or hot! My food is always cold or luke warm..... no excuse for that. I've ordered the BBQ chicken plate a couple different times and both times the chicken was luke warm and the hot sides were cold. I gave them a couple of chances but still disappointed. The food tastes good but the delivery fails to keep it hot. Who wants what should be "hot food" served cold? I'll tell you one thing, I'll only order the black bean salad or something meant to be cold.

reviews.name: Dana T.
reviews.review: Went here for the first time today...The only time I have had their food is a coworkers leftovers, which I love...So I went in today, expecting to be very pleased, yet I walk in to find the staff very impolite, and the manager/cash register woman was VERY RUDE! I ordered the black bean salad, bean dip, and carrot cake.1-the carrot cake is the bomb, thats the only reason they got 2 stars from me...2-the barbecue sauce was ALRIGHT. Not great.3-the salad was okay, MINUS THE BUG I FOUND IN IT!!!Paid $18 for my meal, and all I ate was carrot cake...Called immediately about the bug in my salad, they said I could come get my money back.The manager being so rude made it to where they will not get any more of my business, which is disappointing since I work right down the road.

reviews.name: Eugene S.
reviews.review: Dirty restaurant and they make a big deal about where you seat...eventhough they tell you to sit youself. 5 min in the restaurant and we get approached by the server who we thought would take the order. INSTEAD,  the guy was rude, didn't introduce itself and told us that I had to switch seats because they were about to get busy in like 30 min and it was 6.30pm already (they close at 9pm). Never going back again and I will make sure everyone I know to suggest that they should nor try this place.

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: I drink water, all day long, and it's usually the only liquid I order when I eat meals out.  However, on this occasion I ordered Calypo's hot spiced tea and HOLY HELL was it awesome.  A little fruity, a little cinnamon-y.  Gosh, PERFECT for a colder day.The variety of comforting, nutritious "caribbean" food on the menu is so enticing.  I had the BBQ chicken with a bunch o' sides, including the sweet potatoes topped with coconut and the coleslaw.  Hate to say that the coleslaw was a big disappointment.  However, the only disappointment of any of my Calypso visits.I loved completing my meal with one of the Calypso Bars - shortbread bar cookie topped with coconut, almonds, more yummy stuff.And SO affordable.  Ja mon!

reviews.name: Heather H.
reviews.review: I had a good experience at Calypso Cafe. It was super busy at lunch but while the waitress/host seemed a bit harried (I came right in the middle of their busiest time), they were attentive and quick. I have the Beans and 3 sides combo and it was the most filling non-meat based meal I've ever had. I have their collard greens (fantastic-one of my favorites!), their black beans (really good), bean &corn salad (good but had chickpeas which I don't like), and coleslaw (solid but nothing special). I also has their bean dip appetizer, which was absolutely fantastic!The prices are good and the service is fast. Worth a try!

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: Let me tell you about The Game. The game is to get a plate of black bean rice nachos and manage to eat them completely without using a fork or utensil and not look like you escaped from a mental institution.This is a more difficult endeavor than you might image as the plate is literally filled to the edges with nachos, beans, sour cream, rice, jalapenos, tomatoes, spanning a 10-12 inch wide plate and stacked like a pyramid rising 3-4 inches. It's then "cemented" together with what looks like volcanic eruption of cheesy goodness and served at a temperature that's somewhere between nuclear and burn ward.It's a whole lot of food when they make it like they usually do, and it comes to you hot and fresh and extremely fast.There's no middle ground with the black bean nachos. You either take them down or you go down fighting, leaving miserable and way way too full. You might even leave that way if you win the game.Additional challenges present themselves in the form of their fruit tea. Sometimes the greatest drink on the planet, the fruit tea is an inconsistent part of the Calypso Cafe experiment. When it's good, it's great, when it's bad, it's still good but is disappointing.People you bring with you can also be considered your enemies as they will attempt to push large, freshly-baked Boija muffins on you as they come two to an order and few can eat more than one.I should mention, silverware is provided. There's no reason you have to attempt to locate the optimum nacho to continue along your eating path. There's also no reason you shouldn't attempt to exercise and improve your cognitive nacho-pulling spacial skills in an attempt to leave no nacho behind while keeping your fingers clean.Should you think you beat the game, well, just remember that you lost the game. And if you don't know what that means a quick google search for The Game, or a look at your waistline after eating the nachos should be enough to cement that.Unfortunately the variety of this place, at least for vegetarians, does not change ever. It may be considered vegetarian friendly, but it's that because you can get a lot of food for little price, not because there's a vast array of choices (there are two that I will eat there.) The beans, they are beans, there's nothing done to them, and the rice, it's not special. The chips come from a bag and the tomatoes, sour cream, cheese, etc are all probably restaurant supply. Vegans are going to have a couple of options here, and I think I may be overselling it by saying a couple.The jerk chicken, I think, is the only thing they seriously work on. Everything else can be considered a plate full of fixin's.But the food is good, the service similarly so, the price reasonable, and as long as you're not attempting to go there when 400 other people are there (lunch) you'll probably have a good all-around time. If you're a vegetarian, go for the black bean rice nachos or black bean salad, I'd avoid the pita / veggie burger options as, well, I hate them and think they are stupid.But that's my opinion, and I just lost the game

reviews.name: Bonnie J.
reviews.review: I love Calypso, one of the few healthy choice places to eat. In addition, it is fairly quick and convenient!   I got hooked in East Nashville and when I moved to this side of town I was excited that there was another one close.  Great rotisserie, and I love the sweet potato side and house dressings!Although the food is just as good at this location, the atmosphere is not up to par.  Each of the 3 times I have been to this location there was food/ trash all over the floor and tables .  I'm not high maintenance, but it is nice to eat in a place that is kept clean and tidy.  It was not excessively busy and a handful of tables remained un-bussed for the entire time I was there.  Each of my visits.I haven't wanted to cut this restaurant out as a standard and I will give it another try at some point, I just hope that standards are raised and things are kept looking more sanitary.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: I don't know what all the hype was.  Ordere the bbq chicken platter with some rice and salad.  The bbq sauce tasted of rancid tomatoes and the jerk sauce was mild and bitter.  Even asked for some of the curry sauce.  It was bland and way to sweet.  The rice looked like it was from a bag.  AWFUL! .  The only positive portion of this meal was the cucumber dill dressing.  That stuff was GREAT!  Of all the places in Berry Hill.  Go somewhere else!  ANYWHERE ELSE!

reviews.name: David A.
reviews.review: Calypso on Thompson Lane is convenient as I often work in the area. This is an order at the counter type place. The food is average - not bad but nothing to rave about. I ordered a chicken taco salad which arrived in a timely manner and was freshly prepared. Decor is dated and the dining room chairs were plastic lawn type chairs. I'll give it another chance but I was not overly impressed based on this visit.

reviews.name: Samantha B.
reviews.review: My friend loves this place for its vegetarian options. I was not as impressed and will likely not be going back. However, it's not a terrible place, it just wasn't amazing.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: When I came here, I wanted some SOLID cuban and/or caribbean food.  Upon arriving though, I realized this place (which I later realized is a chain) was much more healthy and vegetarian themed than I thought. Don't get me wrong, I have nothing against vegetarian people.... I just really don't like vegetable only dishes. I was kind of put off by this. Also, they have some mexican stuff (nachos and maybe something else I'm forgetting), which kinda throws me off the whole cuban caribbean vibe. I briefly considered leaving, but stayed just to see what it was like, seeing as there were a couple options that had chicken.Honestly, I was pleasantly surprised. I ended up getting Nachos and they had some pretty tasty salsaish thing on them, and the chicken was flavored well and it was a decent size portion and everything. So at this point I'm thinking this is an okay place, but there really aren't that many options for someone who wants meat. In particular, they lack pork on a lot of their dishes, and I say a lot of their dishes, because I know cubans, and cubans freakin love their pork, and it's like on half their dishes. This chain is essentially sort of a mesh of several hispanic foods..... further meshed with a desire to make them healthy and/or vegetarian. Too bad cuban food is one of those cuisines that is inherently unhealthy.

reviews.name: Diana S.
reviews.review: The rotisserie chicken is juicy and tender and the honey lime dressing is addictive. Seriously addictive and it makes the chicken sandwich. The Lucayan salad with chicken, mandarin oranges and sliced almonds served with 2 sweet corn/coconut muffins is another favorite.Calypso has many options for vegetarians and vegans, with their meat-free black beans  + three sides, as well as the extremely popular black bean salad (think meatless taco salad) and veggie salads and sandwiches. Gluten-intolerant diners and those watching calories also can find many choices to fit their diets, especially if they go to the calypsocafe.com site to see the recommendations.When you realize how reasonable the prices are, the food tastes just that much better.

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: Had a fast lunch today with my wife and as usual, excellent food. Still the go to place when you want fresh, tender chicken done Caribbean style and a good price

reviews.name: Matt N.
reviews.review: Looking for a place to grab a quick bite to grab lunch or dinner, somewhere that offers mostly healthy options and is inexpensive? My solution for you happens to be my favorite "fast" food in all of Nashville: Calypso Café. So what if I have eaten there three times in the last week? Those who have been will understand why, and those who haven't.. well, give it a try and you'll get it too.A super casual, local-to-Nashville hot spot, Calypso offers several locations throughout the area, so you're bound to be close enough to one for a quick meal. I must confess, when I first moved to town six and a half years ago, my mind/palette wasn't quite ready for Calypso. I thus ignored all of the local hype, which unfortunately caused me to miss many years of their delish cuisine (disclaimer/reminder: from small town, we only had those 'wonderful' super chains and maybe a gas station or two to choose from). Learn from my mistake, and do yourselves a favor and prepare to broaden your horizons just a bit.Calypso offers what I would call fresh Caribbean inspired cuisine. Roasted chicken, creative sauces, incredible sides. My most beloved adjective best sums it up: FABULOUS.Here are my fave items to order:Nachos. Tortilla chips smothered in their bean dip. The other standard nacho ingredients; chicken, beef, or rice, and BBQ sauce. Simply divine.Black Bean Salad. Lettuce, black beans, tortilla chips, cheddar, tomato, red onion; chicken beef, or rice, and a side of BBQ sauce. Try an extra side of their unbelievable house salad dressing too.Pulled BBQ White Chicken. Fresh, tender, rotisserie chicken with an absolutely amazing sauce. Get it as a sandwich or a plate.Bean and Corn Salad (side). A mixture of beans, corn, in a cilantro vinaigrette. Just yum.Sweet Potatoes (side). The perfect amount of sweet and spice.House Salad dressing. Simple: Pour it on everything.Fruit Tea. Some of the best in town. When in Rome.Calypso Bar. One of my favorite desserts, ever-- their take on a cookie bar. Simple, sweet, a bit sour, just delicious.Ok.. There's my take. What are your favorite dishes at Calypso?

reviews.name: Melissa B.
reviews.review: I decided to stop at Calypso Cafe and get some Takeout. I had never been here before so it was all new to me and Tony was not with me so I opted to get two separate plates and then we would  mix them up on to our plates at home and try a little bit of everything.I got him the Jamaican Curry Rotisserie Chicken Dark Meat quarter size with Native Cole slaw and Martinque Calloloo ( mustard greens with onions and stewed tomatoes) and the Jamaican Curry is like a strange applesauce with onions and spices...Not sure if I like that Curry or not, but it was definitely different. The Native coleslaw was like normal coleslaw with a mayo vinaigrette sauce..and the mustard Greens are vinaigrette flavored with onions and stewed tomatoes ( you can taste the vinaigrette in the tomatoes)..I like the collards very much and so did Tony..The other plate was Rotisserie White Quarter Chicken with a Jerk sauce (hot hot hot on the side) and Cuban Black Beans with raw red onions and sour cream ( very good..highly recommend) and St Lucian Rice..another very good taste..I would definitely eat here again, but next time stay at the restaurant and enjoy the atmosphere there with the island music playing and the beachy feel to the restaurant. Everyone was friendly.The food cost $14 with taxes..but next time we are going to try the family package with a whole chicken and 6 six sides for only $15.95 plus taxes...ummmm good !!!

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: I like this Calypso Cafe better than the one on Elliston.  It's easier to get in and out of and not nearly as cramped.  The downside seemed to be the one waiter in the place was far overworked, and our party was large enough to be kind of needy.  At the end of the meal, we were also redirected to the cash register to pay where a disinterested staff member happily continued with her phone call while we waited to pay.

reviews.name: Michael E.
reviews.review: The rotisserie chicken is properly cooked however I found the bar-b-que sauce to be rather disappointing.  It tasted like a minestrone-base with some spice and a little thickening added.  I'll try the sweet sauce next.The Cuban black beans is not really Cuban black beans.  No onions were cooked into them, no cilantro was added, just plain cooked black beans.   And the toppings they add wouldn't follow a true Cuban serving.  Cubans would serve the beans with cheese melting on top.  But add these to the salad and you have a very nice salad.While the food is good to eat the prices feel over the top for what is served.  If they reduced prices or improved the food I'd give them another start at least.

reviews.name: Libby B.
reviews.review: Calypso was one of the first places I ate when I first moved here,  and for a light lunch or dinner, really hits the spot.                 I usually get their curry chicken plate here,  along with seasonal fruit or spiced sweet potatoes (sprinkled with coconut), and the fantastic coconut cornbread muffins. Recently I tried the BBQ chicken,  and found that rather as well. Their fruit tea is absolutely delicious and I always get it when I'm here!                   I've tried at least one salad here,  but it wasn't to my liking. I'm a picky salad eater anyhow. The burger option they have here is also good,  with spices and possibly peppers added to the burger patty. They do make excellent brownies and cookie bars,  and the key lime pie I had last visit was heavenly. Even with that I wasn't overly full;  the meals here really aren't too heavy.  This place is also pretty affordable, which makes it a nice healthy option in a sea of fat food choices.

reviews.name: Bec W.
reviews.review: The food is always great!  I love getting it to go and taking the food home.  I also requently meet my husband and baby there for dinner. Healthy options and great choices. really like it and they serve is extremely fast which is wonderful!My issue is the staff.  They are a miserable bunch.  They are short when responding and seem so unhappy.  I feel like I inconvenience them when i ask for something and when they see a child it is not a good think (just means big mess).   Even if there is 1 person in the restaurant with no chance that 100 people are going to show up they tell you you can only sit at a 2 top table.  You have to wait until your entire party is there - which i understand - but then you are in the way and they are inconvenienced by your presence.  Just wish they were a little more jovial and enjoyed their jobs.  it is a fun restaurant, laid back atmosphere and good food.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: Calypso specializes in vegetarian/healthy food, but of course I usually opt for the least of these.  The black bean + chicken nachos are spectacular! I would trade some prized possessions to get the recipe to that barbecue-y salsa-ish sauce.   Parking around lunch is terrible, so get there early. Parking at the Elliston location is awful, too. Annoying.  The service is usually pretty fast during their busy times, but that's about all that can be said for it - not outstanding, but they can get you in & out on your lunch hour for sure. The atmosphere is... different... very casual, to put it nicely. All negative aspects considered, for the price and quality of the food, you can't beat it.

reviews.name: Kelly F.
reviews.review: Excellent healthy food choice. Black bean salad is fantastic. My friends always get curry chicken and love it. Good alternative to "fast food".

reviews.name: Jeff L.
reviews.review: Unique, healthy, flavorful, cheap. What more could you ask for? Here on business, found it on Yelp - what a great find!

reviews.name: Em S.
reviews.review: Caribbean-style food in Nashville? Yum! There are two ways to look at this place - comparing it to a fine dining establishment versus comparing it to a fast food joint. The food is amazing when you do the latter - they specialize in jerk chicken, but the vegetarian options include black beans, Caribbean-style rice, collard greens, cole slaw, salads, veggie-sandwich, corn and chickpea and kidney bean medley, and cornbread (aka "Boija muffins"). Now, is all the food fresh? Probably not, but neither is everything at Baja Fresh or Panera or most restaurants these days, and the options here are a refreshing change from a sandwich or burrito. Their veggie-melt sandwich is good but nothing special (just raw veggies & cheese on a bun), so I would go for the platter where you get 4 sides, one of which (per the restaurant) must be the black beans.  If you are comparing the food to a fancy tablecloth and candlelit restaurant, then you will be disappointed, but the bill here can be less than $7 a person! I've tried the food at the Vanderbilt/Elliston Place location as well; it's the same menu so just go to wherever is closer. The atmosphere at both places is similar (cheap plastic chairs and table), and definitely not nice enough for a formal meeting or special date, but I could see a successful first or casual date or friend gathering here. The to-go service is also very fast because a lot of the food is already prepared. Regardless of the atmosphere, their cornbread muffins can hold their own compared to at any restaurant! Overall, I will come back  here, for good food at a good price.

reviews.name: Mia H.
reviews.review: I found this place after discovering the Loving Pie company was closed on Mondays.   This is a nice little restaurant with a diverse clientele and very reasonably-priced meals.  It appears to be a local favorite, as it was buzzing at lunch time.  I had a half dark chicken Jamaican curry style with black beans and turnip greens and I cleaned my plate.  It was $8.15 inc tax.  The service is good...quick and utilitarian.  This is not the most authentic Jamaican food you'll find, but I found it satisfying on all levels and would definitely recommend.

reviews.name: Peter P.
reviews.review: This place seems to have a cool premise, but the one time I visited, my waitress seemed annoyed and very disinterested in serving us, which really soured an already underwhelming experience. I got the quarter jerk chicken with rice and beans. The chicken was good but the jerk sauce was served cold in a cup on the side which I thought was weird because wouldn't you want to cook the chicken in the jerk  marinade? Pouring the sauce over the chicken was a bad idea because it made my chicken go cold. My rice and beans were flavorless and not worth talking about. Overall disappointing but maybe different food on a different day with a different waitress would improve my take on this place.

reviews.name: Heather F.
reviews.review: Vegetarian local chain in Nashville serving up yummy Caribbean inspired dishes.I have mad respect for vegetarians because I think it is so much better for our bodies and our planet to eat this way.  I am proud of Nashville for having such a chain.  Though the dishes are geared vegetarian you can order meat.  The day I went their soup of the day was a hearty type of 3 bean that was outstanding.  This place is affordable, healthy, and has a nice menu.  It is worth checking out.

reviews.name: A A.
reviews.review: My wife LOVES this place and is a vegan, but I dread it.  I can't slam it, because it's not their fault I'm a meat and potatoes kind of guy.  I truly have never found anything on the menu I like, and this is not the first time I've had to endure a vegan's dream.  They are not that into folks like me, and that's OK!  And like some before me have said, the chicken seems strange.  Kind of like that chicken you get at Kroger in the box.  Sweaty, bland, just plain ole chicken.  Point being, if you are a vegan, you will probably love it!  Rock on vegans and different chicken eaters!!!

reviews.name: Sandy T.
reviews.review: Always very quick! Good simple food...great vegetarian options...love their BBQ sauce. Prices are cheap... Their corn muffins are topped with coconut :)

reviews.name: Stefanie P.
reviews.review: I don't know what 'Calypso' food is or Jamaican food is, but i like this place. They have salads and beans/rice/chicken dishes.  I see some reviews about vegetarian/vegan choices. Not me. I need the meat. I recommend the Black Bean Salad. The only dish I've ever eaten here.  You can add chicken or shrimp. Beware the chicken is usually 'chilled' and not warm. Some folks may think thats weird. I tried the cinnamon coffee today to go and so glad i did. They have these most delicious corn sweet muffins that are just so yummy. This location makes you feel like you're in a garage because there is some painted trees and vines on the walls, plastic chairs and small tables. No real like 'decorations' or feel. Or the decorator for this place was a 6th grade class project. Ek!Salads are about $9 each and the platters the same range. I chose to eat here when i want something 'healthy' to eat like a huge massive salad with sour cream and tons of cheese. Whenever I take out of town guests here, no one complains and can find something on the menu they like.  Perfect for lunch!I think Calypso Cafe is a different type of place, with a interesting menu and a-ha, a local business! A alright place for me.

reviews.name: Carmen P.
reviews.review: always great food, not always great service.  actually, rarely great service...but i go here for the awesome food.

reviews.name: Simon T.
reviews.review: After spending two weeks on tour with my band eating crappy food (a.k.a Subway), we were craving something that was fresh and had some sort of nutrition. Luckily, a need to hit the Nashville Guitar Center placed us in vicinity of Calypso Cafe. I ordered their signature salad, the lucayan, with dressing on the side. It was a heaping mound of goodness with great flavor and hit the spot. My malnourished body took to it right away! My poor band mates opted for chicken sandwiches and a rotisserie half-chicken which all ended up complaining that they were dry but my food didn't have any issues. Services was quick and friendly, the prices fair... it was a good lunch spot. If I lived in Nashville as opposed to Portland, OR, I'd probably eat there pretty often.

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: Eating Environment: meh. Service: meh. Food: outstanding. This place serves up tasty dishes, especially if you're looking to eat on the healthy side. Their food is made from very pure and simple ingredients.  The stars that I give are for the food. Their wait staff is just so-so, but you can always walk up to a take-out counter. The eating environment just seems old/sticky. I will be back, but only for the food. :-)

reviews.name: Heidi S.
reviews.review: You can never go wring with the Black bean salad with white meat chicken and a fruit tea

reviews.name: Becky M.
reviews.review: Busy at lunch. Turn and burn the tables. But service was spot on. Items arrived very quickly, correctly and tasted fairly good. My only disappointment was the lack of seasoning in the "Caribbean style" food. The pricing was great. Excellent kids menu.  And little did I know there were other locations! I'll be back.

reviews.name: Jann S.
reviews.review: I had been meaning to try this place for a while.The counter service was good, and my sandwich came out fast, but I just wasn't really impressed with the food. I got the pulled chicken sandwich, and the sauce had a bit too much vinegar, without so much as a piece of lettuce to balance the flavor. The bun was plenty big, but sort of dry. And the black bean and corn salad was not really memorable. I had gone in hungry, but I didn't really finish anything.Next time, I'll try something else, but I don't think I'll be rushing back to do so.

reviews.name: Charles C.
reviews.review: Great, simple food fast.  I love the rotisserie chicken with the jerk sauce.  Calypso is my go to place for fast, fresh, healthy food.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: It seems the reviews for this particular location are pretty mixed. Personally, I've never had an issue with this place. This one is right down the street from my apartment and a favorite of mine and my boyfriend. We just actually ate there yesterday.I love the muffins with the toasted coconut, the Calypso bars and the Black Bean Chicken Salad. Off the charts delicious. And that barbecue sauce... ugh don't get me started on how good that is. However, I can see their blemishes too. If it's busy the tables are usually on the very light side of dirty, the soups don't stick around long enough and the options for vegans are pretty limited.  All in all though, I think Calypso Cafe is a delicious and unique little find.

reviews.name: Molly F.
reviews.review: It was clean and the people were nice, but the food wasn't great, at all, at least not nearly as good as it was talked up to be. We got the half chicken with black beans and sweet potatoes. The chicken was luke-warm, the beans I thought came from a can ( which is ok I guess, I'm guilty of the purchase) and the sweet potatoes were a little too sweet. It reminded me of left overs. Just not worth what you pay, which isn't very much. It was edible and some of the spices were tasty but not a place that I would recommend to someone looking to try something new. I vote CalypsNO.

reviews.name: HaileyTIffany M.
reviews.review: I've only been there once, so I'll have to give it another try. However, the 100 Oaks location we visited, we had the black bean nachos, which were kind of crusty, and it just tasted as if everything was canned (which, of course, everything in most commercial chains and even nicer restaurants is). The server had a chin beard that was braided down to his waist, and long hair, with no hair-net. Both of these were really unsanitary and health-code violations (as a long-time family former restaurant/catering employee myself). Also, when he poured our drinks, I could smell his lingering B.O. for quite a while. Dude. Fix that shit now, restaurant owner. Haircuts. HAIRNETS! Shaves. SHOWERS! DEODORANT! Are they even washing their hands? Clean nails.  If your employees have a problem with that, than don't work in a restaurant, then.It also seemed like everyone here was a little depressed. No one smiled much. Moral seems really low. I felt bad for them. The poor hygiene really made me uncomfortable. I know what goes on "backstage" in a kitchen, and if an owner is willing to let hygiene slide to this degree, I don't feel comfortable patronizing it.  It's YOUR responsibility, restaurant manager, to stay on their shit about hygiene, and fire anyone who slacks. This is representing your brand, and it makes patrons uncomfortable. What are you running, a 7-11? Health food doesn't mean grimy smelly employees getting their hair and B.O. in my food, thanks. Unprofessional. Also, the bathrooms were extremely clean, but the smelled musky, pretty bad. How about some Renuzit. About one would solve your problem.Also, none of your employees smiled at me. Only one of them acknowledged me. None of them used the time honored "trick" of touching the table as they took my order to increase friendliness and get a bigger tip. This should happen EVERY time they approach the table- touch it, tap it, say 'Hi!" freakin smile. Would it kill them? Seemed like it. When we walked in, no hostess walked up to us. We were pointed at from behind the counter by a guy who shouted as us to "seat yourselves up against the wall!" When I paid the check, I was ignored once again, as the cashier talked the entire time to his buddy, and didn't thank me for dropping in. Rounding out the customer service experience! :(  Don't want to break up your coffe Klatch, dude.Okay, buddy. Just.... it doesn't even seem like there is a manager on duty here. It looks like a restaurant, but it needs to tighten the ship. What the eff? Nice space, fun art and vibe, but ... Someone needs a manager to run the ship like a real restaurant with polite employees who are clean & friendly and run things properly. And get some renuzitt in the bathrooms! Soo close but SO far. :/

reviews.name: Timothy G.
reviews.review: I love the rotisserie chicken (check out the Jamaican curry sauce with your chicken), but I'm not a big fan of most of what's on the menu. If you like beans, you'll easily find something to enjoy at Calypso Cafe; but if you don't like beans, be prepared for a limited number of choices.

reviews.name: Chim R.
reviews.review: I no longer live in Nashville, but this is one of the few places I still crave on a regular basis. I may have only gone 4 stars when i lived there, but the fact that I still think about it makes it 5 automatically. BBQ chicken, curry chicken, collard greens and pretty much anything on the menu is good. It's carribean-ness is debatable, but who cares?I reliable lunch option

reviews.name: Angelina T.
reviews.review: I really don't like this place. My colleagues do, but I just can't get into it. I gave it two tries, but I won't be back. The chicken always seems dry and the rice isn't that warm. I do like the boija muffins, though again, not warm enough. I went for the pita wedges, which was a mistake. If there's nothing to dip them in, they're just bland. The service just OK. The tables seem like they should be outside (though there's no outdoor seating). There's a line to pay the bill, which I hate.

reviews.name: Erica W.
reviews.review: I've been here twice and in short, it's ok. It's fairly close to where I live and it's pretty inexpensive. My mother (who is West Indian) was taken aback by the fact red beans & rice was not on the menu. The main meat served is chicken with the options of barbecue, jerk, or curry, but pork is also available. I was surprised there was no fish on the menu. Also, I'm not a bean person (except for barbecue baked beans), but I love their black beans with sour cream. My friend loved the callaloo, but I wasn't that impressed. I felt a lot of the food wasn't as flavorful as I was expecting and that may be because I've had my grandmother's cooking, but I'd go again if requested to.  However, probably not on my own.

reviews.name: Avonel R.
reviews.review: I've only been to Calypso Cafe one time, so I cannot judge their full menu. I was told by friends that I absolutely had to try the nachos appetizer so I took the advice and tried them. FABULOUS. Also, I got so much food that I had enough for dinner later that evening. I only paid 8 dollars for my meal so I was more than pleased with the portion size. The spice tea is also amazing. Overall I enjoyed my lunch here. I didn't have to wait for a seat, service was pleasant, and I got a yummy lunch for under $10.

reviews.name: Nathan L.
reviews.review: I've been coming here for years for the food, which has consistently been good. Their attitude has always left a lot to be desired.  From the moment they seat you till you check out, they ignore, then hurry you.  They never smile, say thank you, you're welcome, or anything that could be construed as welcoming.Today was my last at this location however as I stood, for 35 minutes, while tables were vacant and uncleaned. And soon after my food finally did arrive, I was rushed out. The food didn't sit with me well either, it wasn't very fresh, and the pulled chicken wasn't great. Not what I'm used to for my go-to dish here.I'll continue to patron the other locations, but it's not worth going back to this 100 Oaks location.  Too bad as it's the closest to me, and the one I go to most often.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: I hope that I just happened to come on an "Off" day when I tried Calypso Cafe for the first time. I had heard that there were many vegan and healthy offerings so it made sense for me to stop by, rightio?Well.Not so much.I do appreciate the menu items that they offered that were Veg friendly but they didn't have soy cheese, tofu, or other protein replacements available? Don't get me wrong, I know that not all dining establishments offer these options but it I was a little surprised that a place that specializes in healthy and veg options didn't?I chose the Spiced Sweet Potatoes, Cuban Black Beans, and the Martinique Callaloo for my lunch and I have to agree with fellow Yelper Lee K that everything tasted as if it came from a can. The prices are fantastic and the service is quick so maybe I am unfairly comparing Calypso Cafe to finer dining establishments instead of a fast-food joint?
