I will try another location to see if the quality is better before I totally blacklist this place. Update to come!The upside is that most menu items are $7 or less but you get what you paid for.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: I entered the place with it's lotus flower emblum thinking, "Everything is going to be made from tofu." I saw the sweet faces of the people working, and the pretty hippie dreds I sometimes envy, and thought, "Yup, tofurky it is." Then we got the menu. Wow. There's chicken! The place has quite a few healthy options, and some not so healthy, so I'd say it's great for your average omnivore.I really enjoy this place for it's ample parking, nice people, and roomy interior. Sometimes you're elbow to elbow with people at Baja and Sam and Zoe's down the street, so having room to stretch out like Al Bundy is kind of nice, if not rude on my part. The food is great, and at a fair price, so we were able to afford a dessert to go. I can't remember what it was called, it was some type of brownie thing, but it was good.

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: I'm not a fan. I ate at this place not realizing that it was a place I already tried near Vandy. I had a salad and I don't recall which one. I just remembered that it was a salad with chicken and almonds. Whatever carribean tea that was that they created was yucky!Again, not a fan!

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: I went to this Calypso Cafe location with my Dad for dinner tonight.  We both had a quarter chicken with two side items.  The food was fresh and very good but our server acted like he was just going through the motions of his job and just seemed kind of indifferent.  There we only a few other tables occupied so they were not swarmed with business.  The food was ready slower than usual and that is not too good considering that business was pretty light tonight.

reviews.name: Cynthia F.
reviews.review: Excellent quality and service for the price.  I ate in the Nashville and the Franklin TN locations. Both times, I ordered the yummy  tuna salad sandwich on whole wheat round. The bread seemed like a packaged product, but you can't expect freshly-baked bakery bread for the price they charge! And I was happy it seemed to be real whole wheat, not the spongy "wheat" bread served in other restaurants.  The cole slaw and yam side dishes were both excellent.  If you order at the Franklin location, ask them to put the cole slaw in a separate bowl so the sauce doesn't soak your sandwich bread.  The carrot cake was not to my liking; tasted the way I'd expect it to taste if it were made from a packaged mix.  There are better desserts elsewhere, but you'll have to pay more!  Loved the Carribean decor, too.

reviews.name: Betsy K.
reviews.review: We went here for a sit down dinner with some friends on a Friday night. It wasn't busy at all and the wait staff was attentive, but next time we would probably just get take out.  It was very reasonably priced, I think our two meals only came to just over $20 which is great for two people to eat out.  I had half a BBQ chicken, some of the delish coconut muffins they serves and black beans as a side.  I was super happy with my food.  Since it was so tasty, quick and easy I think we'll definitely go back and get take out.  The vibe of the restaurant itself wasn't anything to get too excited about, I probably wouldn't go there for a dine-in experience again, but otherwise the food was great!

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: Mmmmmm. Calypso. Definitely one of my favorite places to go eat. We probably go here at least once a week. Good, fresh, dank food.  Its cheap, too.

reviews.name: John D.
reviews.review: I frequent Calypso all around town and know the folks well - GREAT FOOD. Despite all that, today we wanted to sit outside and was required to make our order take-out at the counter, deal with attitude, paid a hansom tip on a $51+ ticket and when I asked if they could bring the food outside (may 30 feet) the answer was "Nope."That was a missed opportunity for them. Live & learn.

reviews.name: Suzanne M.
reviews.review: I've picked up dinners to-go at Calypso a couple times in the last week and my husband I both love their chicken and all their sides - favorites are bean and corn salad, black beans, house salad, rice, and muffins.  They are fast and always have my orders ready when I stop in to pick them up - friendly staff and delicious food.

reviews.name: Pamela L.
reviews.review: This is often my choice for Wednesday night dinner with friends - it's so reasonable, the service is good, and I haven't had anything bad here yet. My four year old LOVES the cheese pita with fruit salad and black beans - am awesomely healthy kids meal option for only about a buck more than a happy meal. He ate the whole damn pita the last time which blew my mind!My only complaint is that there is no changing table in the bathroom! Not even a serviceable countertop or other surface! I brought Harry here as an infant and had to balance him on the toilet to get him changed. When I was there last Wednesday, my friend had to take her six month old, Ouida, out to the car to change her. Not cool, Calypso!

reviews.name: Christopher L.
reviews.review: Very tasty and extremely well priced. Today was the first time that I tried Calypso Cafe and I will definitely be going back. I got the half chicken meal that comes with two sides and a choice of sauce. The jerk sauce was wonderful! Perfectly sweet and spicy at the same time. The black beans were good, but not extraordinarily so. I couldn't really tell a difference in the beans there or most other places even though they did taste quite nice. I did however very much enjoy the cole slaw. It was dressed very well without being one of those with a heavy mayo base. It complimented the jerk sauce for the chicken in a very good way. All in all I would say that its a great meal served by a very friendly staff in a quick manner. I can't wait to go back again.

reviews.name: Bill T.
reviews.review: The best rotisserie chicken!

reviews.name: FromScratch M.
reviews.review: Wow, tasty rotisserie chicken with healthy and interesting vegetable sides for a great price. I'm a fan.

reviews.name: Karen H.
reviews.review: I found the food boring, but perhaps I'm not the intended audience.  I liked the atmosphere though.  Great service, too.

reviews.name: erin s.
reviews.review: I'm addicted to their black bean salads with rice!  The prices are great, the food is excellent- only reason they don't get 5 stars from me is because I'm pretty sure it's not the most sanitary environment.  But ya know what?  i don't care, just give me my salad and I'm a happy camper!

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: I have been here several times and had a good experience each time. Service is VERY quick. Food is always fresh. Lots of great options for both vegetarians and non-vegetarians.It can be a little noisy at times, especially if there are screaming kids or large groups. It has never been so noisy that I haven't been able to have a conversation with the people at my table though.

reviews.name: Taylor H.
reviews.review: Affordable and good carribean chow.

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: This is my favorite location of Calypso Cafe because this one, as opposed to Elliston Place, actually has enough space.I pretty much love all the food here. I haven't tried anything bad, but my favorite thing is the tropical chicken salad. I first got addicted to this about ten years ago at the Ellliston location, and I still love it.I also love the callaloo. It's delicious and very hard to replicate at home. I've tried. The vegetable plate is really good - three vegetables plus the muffins. Delicious.Did I mention that Calypso Cafe is also really cheap?

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: Lucayan Salad.  There are times when I crave it and can eat it every day of the week.  It's such an addiction!  Now, don't let "salad" fool you into thinking it's really healthy.  Yes, it has fresh greens and chicken, but the chicken has to be marinated in something ultra bad for you because it's so freakin' good.  It's definitely a Caribbean flavor, whatever it is.  On top of the chicken and lettuce are almonds, Mandarin oranges (there's your sugar!) and the best dressing this side of the Mississippi.  Here's a tip--dressing comes on the side, so request an extra!  You'll want it.  Again, I'm pretty positive it is full of fat because I could drink it by itself it's so good.  Pretty much makes the salad!  I can't say I've had much else to eat here, except for the black bean nachos.  They are so tasty too!  Huge portion--make sure you have someone to share them with!  Everything on the menu looks amazing, but I'm such a slave to the Lucayan that I can't bring myself to order anything else.  Let me know if you do!

reviews.name: Lee K.
reviews.review: Meh. Everything at Calypso tastes like it comes straight from a can, with a couple things made from a couple different cans mixed together. I appreciate that it's cheap and that the service is always very fast, but the food is as unexciting as it gets. The floor at this location in particular is consistently covered with pieces of the extremely dry and crumbly muffins they serve. Unless you're exhausted and hungry, just eat at home.

reviews.name: John G.
reviews.review: When I worked in Cool Springs we used to go to the Calypso Cafe out there pretty often, although we called it the Hippie Chicken.  The 100 Oaks Calypso is pretty much the same deal, as is the one over by Centenial Park.  I still get a quarter white, sweet potatos and a side salad with tea, and it is alway good. 4th star withheld for no good reason, other than this location doesn't have great atmosphere like the other two I've been to.

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: I find it funny that  people think this place is so vegetarian friendly.  Not that it isn't. But they are really no more so than anywhere else. Other than salads (and almost every restaurant has salads that vegetarians can eat) there are about two choices. The veggie pita / melt (which is successfully passed off as two choices when it really should only merit one). I find this pita  melt combination quite bland to be honest with you. So I usually go for choice #2 the "beans & three" plate (meaning beans and a choice of three sides). The food is good and healthy but the service is slow. There is always a considerable wait even when the dining room is empty. But if you do want something healthy this is a good place to stop. Its also fairly affordable.

reviews.name: kimbe m.
reviews.review: Okay. Best rotisserie chicken in Nashville (and I'm a Whole Foods fan). Best black bean salad ever. Great service BUT - make sure not to go on the weekends, when the staff by and large appear hung over and not at all helpful. During the week, though, yum! I get the black bean salad with beef, and ask them to "nuke the beans and beef" so the cheese melts. The chips are homemade and about as good as it gets. The staff are friendly and helpful. All in all, a great lunch spot.

reviews.name: Melody H.
reviews.review: Well, it's always clean, and the staff is really friendly. The 4 times I've been there though, I've had bad experiences with the food. It seemed every time I ordered something, I got it home, and the order was messed up, or it came NOTHING like what it sounded like from the menu. I wasn't impressed with the few different veggie items I tried any of the times. For example, one time I thought I was getting some sort of wrap thing with hot grilled veggies. When I got it home, the veggies were raw and cold, and stuffed in a cold pita thing. The best thing I had was a sample of vegan chili when a sick friend was looking for something to soothe her stomach. I really want to like this place, so I'm just going to opt for a different location!

reviews.name: Gina L.
reviews.review: As a vegetarian, I love their menu!  It's the best restaurant for a Vegetarian in Nashville.  The service is also super quick and the food is always yummy.  Must try: fruit tea (sweet Nashville specialty)Vegetarian eats: black bean salad with rice (can be made without dairy for the vegans out there!)

reviews.name: Vanitha V.
reviews.review: We didn't know how much to expect from Nashville's restaurant scene, especially being vegetarians, but this place put all of those fears to rest and made me wish for a Brooklyn branch. The food was excellent - we got nachos, veggie melts, and sides, and everything was very tasty and very healthy. The service also was excellent, even though they were quite busy, and the price couldn't be beat. This will be my first stop if I'm ever back in Nasvhille.

reviews.name: Adam B.
reviews.review: I always have a great lunch when i go to calypso. They have great food for vegetarians or those looking for a healthy lunch. Mostly jamaican/ island flavors and its delish! I love the jerk chicken  and the side items are wonderful. They have several side items but i love the bean salad and the boija muffins. Its a great cheap eat as well. Sandwich and two side items will run you around $6.

reviews.name: Andrew B.
reviews.review: The food is wonderful. I love the Jerk sauce. Really is the best, healthy restaurant in town.

reviews.name: Ashley T.
reviews.review: Here's the thing. I didn't eat anything here, although I'd like to have a bite next time around. Reasons I will be back again to try the food:- super cheap beer- cards against humanity- friendly and cute bartenders- jukebox with shania twain - cardboard cutouts of steve austin and snoop doggIf that doesn't make you wanna go here then I don't know what will.

reviews.name: Brian W.
reviews.review: I was treated really disrespectfully at this place.  The skinny fry cook with short brown hair and brown eyes, who was working at around 9:30 pm on September 27, 2015, insulted me and my girlfriend to our faces.  If I were management, I would fire this guy.  We were paying customers like everyone else and were made fun of (not in a playful kind of way).  Unfortunately, I won't be going back to this place and will tell my friends to do the same.  Sincerely,      Disappointed Paying Customer

reviews.name: Rachael Anne E.
reviews.review: Meh. You can get a better, and cheaper, burger and fries elsewhere. It's still open late, has cheap beer and the AC doesn't work. They have overpriced toppings for your fries. I got "animal style" which was some cheese, grilled onions and a bunch of pepper. I like pepper, but it was mostly pepper and there was no tang. I've had In-n-Out many times, come up with a different name. The cook seemed concerned when another patron asked for their fried egg "a bit runny." It arrived hard, just like the egg on my husband's burger. The free Yelp beer is nice. It's cleaner and the armadillos are still around, which people seem to like.  Overall, it felt like the place was trying real hard to be cool and I was guilty by association. I'd go back for late night food and that's probably it.

reviews.name: Amogh P.
reviews.review: If you are visiting, This is a must go place to complete Nashville trip like a local. Very friendly staff and the chef is amazing.We had Joe's hot fries which are topped with onions and jalapeños and house made hot sauce and chef Joe made us hot fried chicken. Both to die for. Must go place..

reviews.name: Christina D.
reviews.review: First off yelpers- Make sure you check in to get your free draft pint!This whole in the wall, oddly right next to 308, is a gem to East Nashville.  Not only can you drink the night away here for cheap ( yes, yes, yes) but you can also enjoy delicious food ( for example: an egg sandwich add bacon -add avocado) and the kitchen is open till 2:30am !!! YES.  SIgn me up! For you beer snobs, the bar doesn't have a ton of beer options, but there will be something you like and there are GAMES!  I stayed here for four hours drinking and playing cards against humanity next to a badass taxidermed armidollo (from Hail). With a tab of $15.  Why are you going anywhere else East Nashville? But also, don't come here because I want it all to myself.   its small and intimate, with a jukebox, and a hot staff who at 3:09 said to try to finish our beers (thank you for your kindness), and last but not least there is a cut out of Stone Cold Steve Austin.

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: This review is going to just be honest, and not biased. I was a huge fan of the "old" Dino's. But I won't let this cloud my review. I went in for dinner. I love the way they still kept the same decor, and the same beer in cans. I got a burger, and asked for only pickle, and onion. on my cheese burger. I watched the guy make it and he was making a few others at the same time. I saw he added lettuce, tomato and everything to them all. He then asks me "you got what on yours?" I said "onion and pickle only". He looks at both of the burgers he made and they had the same thing on them (lettuce, tomato, onion and pickle) and he hands me one, as if one didn't have lettuce and tomato. LOLNo big deal, I'll pick it off. I start eating and the burger is really deep red, and cool in the center. :( I don't remember if he asked me how I wanted it done but if he did ask me, I always ask for "medium well, no pink". This was deep deep red and cool. I felt unsafe eating it. I liked the fries mixed with salt and pepper. Not a fan. The burger (the part I could safely eat) tasted NOTHING like the way Rick used to make them. Oddly enough, I saw Rick walking in from the back. I guess they've made him an honorary guest or something. Riverside Grill shack still has the best burgers in my opinion.If the staff cared as much of the food, and the quality of the food, and the accuracy of the food order, as they did about maintaining reputation as being "the same Dino's"  then maybe you'd have something. Here's an honest opinion: Its NOT the same Dino's. Side note to all you yuppie parents: its 21+ after 8 pm.

reviews.name: Hank D.
reviews.review: I wanted to go before the change of ownership but never made it so yesterday was my first time hitting this spot. The place is small and AC did not appear to be working but no big deal. The boys and I ordered the cheese burger with fries along with a cold pitcher of the banquet beer. The burger was perfect and very satisfying. Cheap food and cheap beer we will be back.

reviews.name: Josh H.
reviews.review: I had the honor of eating a Dino's bacon cheeseburger on the last day that Dino's served burgers (on their final day, apparently Rick wasn't going to cook burgers, but Thanksgiving food). That's right, folks. Dino's, as we know, is no more. Rick sold the business and is going fishing.This place was a total dump, with old everything and brown (once white) smoke-stained ceiling tiles. I can just imagine Robert Irvine walking in and throwing a tantrum.Rick - the owner, bartender, and grill master - was exactly as advertised. I asked him what he recommended, and he quipped something along the lines of "You want me to tell you some of my food is bad?" So I told him I was between the bacon cheese burger and the patty melt, to which he said I'd better get out from in between them because that'd be too much to eat.We all ordered burgers and fries, and Rick got to work behind the bar. 30 minutes later, Rick presented me with a plate full of tasty looking food. The thick burger was well done but juicy, well seasoned, and noticeably had not been smashed down. The bacon and veggies were crisp, and the fries were golden, crunchy, and well seasoned. It was a well executed American classic.Thanks, Rick, for the delicious food. I hope you catch lots of fish.

reviews.name: Jim H.
reviews.review: Loved everything. Burger was great, and the fries, oh man, they are wonderful! You can't go anywhere and eat and drink beer that's any better, it will just cost you more. I'll be back!

reviews.name: Eckhard K.
reviews.review: This place is alright even tho you server is probably more interested in smoking a cigarette than taking care of you. Almost beer only but that's alright, its cheap AF.  Bring cash. Be patient. Gtfo

reviews.name: Rob O.
reviews.review: Amazing burgers.  As good of a late night spot as you could ever ask for.  Dino's rules.

reviews.name: Jen B.
reviews.review: The most delicious bar burger you will ever eat!!! Cheap, good fries, simple... Just freggin good!

reviews.name: Carissa O.
reviews.review: Look it's not gourmet. But the food is good. And it's fun. And I always come here drunk so just kinda take that into consideration. Love the bartenders, bathroom is clean, and did I mention it's open when I'm drunk?

reviews.name: Kina L.
reviews.review: Man I love this place. Rick, who I would not describe as an "old cantankerous fart" but more a character with a busted give a dang. I had the pleasure of witnessing the band performing that night order burgers from Rick (no idea what their name was because A. this was East Nashville and anyone performing there is going to have a band name that is way to hip and "ironic" for me to possibly even understand/remember and B. My memory is horrible).  When I say Order... I mean.. you want a burger? How do you want it is not really as much of a question as Do you want a burger? We had plans to eat at Pharmacy that night so the group stuck to beers. As Rick puts it...his burgers don't have that "fancy weird as* sh*t they got over there." Indeed, Rick. Indeed. His burgers were beefy and thick. The man definitely doesn't skimp on portion size. Like everyone has said... Dino's isn't a place if you're digging grassfed/organic/"fancy weird as* sh*t. It's where you go for your $1.50 PBR and a solid burger with fries. AND Rick time. And live music. Its not a democracy folks. Its a Rickocracy/Ricktatorship.

reviews.name: Quinn D.
reviews.review: Great burger! Kind of a down homeness to the whole spot. Very divey but I think they care about what they're putting out. The fish sandwich is way too salty but you can't find a burger this simple and delicious in many places outside yo mamas house.

reviews.name: Ursula N.
reviews.review: i love everything about this place!  casual, friendly vibe.  one of the top 5 burgers i've ever eaten (simple but delicious!).  ICE cold draft beer.  i'll be back soon!

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: Third time was not a charm. They still cook their fries in the same oil as the catfish and the guy in the Gilligan's cap was a real jerk about it. He just kept yelling this is a dive bar. It WAS a dive bar and that's not an excuse. It's just rude. It's also real bad for vegetarians. He also came over and literally tried to wrestle a beer out of my honeypot's hands. He didn't ask, he just grabbed. We were the only table that this happened to. He let everyone else keep their beers. I guess we didn't look cool enough or something. Then he started yelling, again. Literally yelling across the tiny room. I'll give you a tip about customer service. Fifteen minutes prior to collection time, "hey guys, we need to grab the beers in 15 minutes. Finish up if you can and we'll be back soon to grab them." There are probably 10 tables in the restaurant; it can happen. After 15 minutes, "sorry, I need to take the beers now. Thanks for coming in and have a great evening!" I've waited tables, I've bartended, and I've done about a million hours of retail. You represent the establishment. Respect it and the hat. In summation, I'm going to have to pass on the new Dino's. After being charged incorrectly the second time and the customer service the third, I will be heading over to one of the 20 other burger places in East Nashville.

reviews.name: Jackson W.
reviews.review: New Dino's: new management means not the same thing. However, this update does a lot of things right. The beer selection is apt, the food selection is solid, and the griddle still fries up some delicious food. The atmosphere and clientele are a bit different, but the Dino's feel persists. The new Dino's is worth the trip, whether you are a Dino's fan or not. I still miss the bearded man and his dog though.

reviews.name: Justin B.
reviews.review: I never made it to the "Old Dino's," however I've been twice since being acquired by new owners.  What seems like an effort to preserve this place as a low-key dive, comes off very half-assed, contrived, and lacking the kind of charm that patrons come to love from their neighborhood dive.  During my last visit, it was a 95 degree day and there was no air conditioning in the establishment - not sure if they don't have it or if it was broken, but it was a miserable experience.  I ordered a burger and fries which was $6 for the burger + $2 for fries which was less than exciting after seeing burger AND fries being advertised for $6 on their website before deciding to go.  My burger came crunchy-to-the-bite-burnt and wasn't finishable.  My advice is to save up an extra dollar or two and go to The Pharmacy (Or Miranda Whitcomb Pontes' other burger spot, Burger Up) and get a more bonafide burger and air conditioning.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: I met Rick, tonight. An old cantankerous old fart that has a few opinions...Asked him to make my burger MR..He wouldn't hear of it.Make my french fries crunchy.. That, he could do.Got me a burger with cheese and bacon, on a white bun.. asked him to toast the bun, please....decent burger. would have like to see some pink in it.he sprinkled some soy sauce or Worcestershire sauce on it, some seasoned salt and put a lid on top of it to steam it.. other than that.. yes, this is a true dive. This is a really true dive..  Those of you that don't know the true definition of dive, this is it.......  see it, learn it, memorize it.  some of the reviews that call some of the little diners around here dives....  I want what they've been smokin'..... this is what you call an American dive.even the owner, Rick is a dive!  Rude, opinionated, old school. Came here from Michigan, never left!  Don't talk too much to him, and you won't get insulted.Enjoy his burgers..Not many places except for Rotier's makes a true diner burger!on the griddle, covered to steam, well done!

reviews.name: Ethan O.
reviews.review: Not a fan of the new Dino's. I didn't eat and I've heard the food is good. However, the service was easily the worst I've experienced at any east Nashville restaurant or bar. This particular night, at least two workers looked directly at me, see me standing and waiting and then go back to whatever they were doing. They didn't even say "I will be right with you" or something to indicate my existence. Just overall disappointing for me because I was excited to check out the place now that it has a new owner. Bottom line, if the place is even a little busy, be prepared for a long wait every time you need a drink.

reviews.name: Gretchenlreed ..
reviews.review: Best burger in Nashville! Everyone has one month left to get a real one. See ya there!

reviews.name: Charles F.
reviews.review: The oldest bar in East Nashville, or so I'm told.  Probably the only tolerable one too. The owner and some of the regulars seemed to be characters - I didn't engage enough to determine whether I mean this in a good way or not.  I like that someone called Foodie Queen thinks the primary function of Dino's is to serve gourmet hamburgers and french fries.  If I felt the need to eat at Dino's, I think I'd be setting the bar low - ie if my hamburger wasn't arbitrarily garnished with cigarette ash and e-coli, I'd be pretty happy.It should be clear, but just in case, the primary function of Dino's is to sell you $1.75 cans of PBR.  Tallboy cans of PBR.  All other bottles were in and around $2, $2.50 I think.  The bluegrass is free, so are The Decemberists covers, unfortunately.  Friendly bartender.  You should tip well anyone who has to sit in a fog of beef and Native Spirit smoke for this long.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Many would probably gasp in shock that I chose to have a pitcher of PBR at Dino's on the evening of my birthday.... What can I say? The previous evening's celebration was the polar opposite with an exquisite dinner at Silo followed up by bottles of champagne at Patterson and I just wanted (or needed) a change of pace. I had always been curious about Dino's and thought that on the first night of my much-anticipated stay-cation, a $7 pitcher of Pabst sounded incredibly welcoming. Boy, was I right!Although Dino's is barely the size of a master bedroom in a Brentwood McMansion, it keeps character with it's gritty yet cozy ambiance. Think 1970's VFW hall. The bartender/cook/manager/waitress titles all belong to one friendly and efficient lady. The other patrons ranged from truck drivers to hungover hipsters while the Republican National Convention was playing loudly on the TV. Hot damn, I'm in the South.(On another note, what was Dirty Harry thinking?!)I had a great time chit chatting away with my friend who helped me guzzle the vessel of brew while an amused older gentleman watched in awe. He finally asked me, " Are you going to be able to drink that entire pitcher?" I had to ask him to repeat himself a couple of times as his accent was heavy and albeit slurred. Once I finally translated what he said, I smiled and flexed my muscle and said. "Hell. Yea."Am I going to be a regular at Dino's? Not likely. But, I am certainly not going to hate on Dino either. I enjoyed my low-key evening of cheap beer, gossip, and politics very much. I'm sure that I will sneak back for a little escape when I have a hankering to do so.I'd like to come back and try some of the bar food for appetizers and then perhaps heads off to Catbird for dinner. Isn't that what life is all about?TIP: You can buy cans of beer here for cheeeeeap.

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: The oldest bar on Gallatin, Dino's is legit as they come in terms of dive bars.  Everything is cash only, and you'll likely see an older gentleman with a fisherman's cap that looks like Ernest Hemmingway behind the bar.  That's the owner (can't remember his name), but he rules and has a lot of good stories if you get to talking with him.  Nothin' fancy about this place, folks, but the beer is cheap and the bar food is amazing!  I've never had the burgers at Dino's, but I hear they're the best in Nashville.  What I love most about Dino's are the Poetry Sucks! nights they host every few months.  Come to hear poetry, spoken word, and music from locals for no cover charge.

reviews.name: Lance L.
reviews.review: Love this place. Excellent for a "quick and dirty" cheeseburger and inexpensive bottled beer

reviews.name: jerry a.
reviews.review: Get tired of the overprice drinks and annoying hipsters next door? Wander into a dive bar of working class people with cheap drinks and a juke box peppered with Merle, CDB, Cash, Seger,The Doors and Janis. Got some gnawing hunger pains?  Order up one of the half pound burgers that are close to the top of any burger in town.  The staff is courteous and provides excellent service.  Sure the place is small, but in that smallness is coziness.  Tues nights they have $1 PBR drafts, $1 Bud Light drafts, $2 Premium drafts(1554 at the moment) and $2 off all pitchers.... drafts served in a mason jar, my kinda joint.  Oh, bring cash, you won't need alot of it but you will need it and leave that plastic at home.

reviews.name: Mell F.
reviews.review: Hamburger for lunch. Solid. Juicy and flavorable.As prior reviews have noted, there is nothing fancy about the place. Completely on purpose, I'm sure, as it does not appear they would abide hipsters happily, or happily abide hipsters, if you prefer.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: Dino's is the bar in East Nashville you go to for CHEAP beer (PBR's under $2) and delicious cheeseburgers and after leaving your hipster-ridden bar. (Although you will see a few stragglers here.) Bring extra change for the jukebox!

reviews.name: Ericka P.
reviews.review: I could/do/will make myself sick with the cheeseburgers here. When you watch them make them.. you'll see that obviously there's nothing special about the way they make them.. except for sweat that might make it's way into your meal... It's always hot as Hades in there.   Even though it's kind of a pain to always have to have cash when you go in there... the cold beer tastes a million times better at Dinos.. and if you're lucky.. you can watch an episode or two of COPS before all the hipsters flow in for DJ time

reviews.name: Samantha S.
reviews.review: Hand made burger, cheap and ALWAYS an interesting experience.  It's always smokey and smells like an old trailer park in there but that's part of it's charm.  I usually go just for a beer or two only to experience whatever craziness is happening there that night.  It's a trip!

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: Ahh, Dino's.  God bless little Dino's.  Opened in 1910, this quaint little dive has got to be one of the oldest bars in the city.  And something tells me not a lot has changed about the place over the past century.Dino's is what most might refer to as a dive bar, while others might call it a hole in the wall.  Any way you slice it, the place is a genuine old watering hole.  I must preface the rest of my review with a bit of a confession: my own sentimental ties to Dino's nearly convinced me to give the place five stars, but its merits probably warrant quite a few less.  Thus, I compromised with three stars.Dino's only offers about two brands of beer, so if you can't drink Budweiser, don't bother.  Seating is very sparse, but the entire building is probably about the size of the average bar's kitchen.  They make a hearty and surprisingly tasty hamburger, and everything is dirt cheap.  Probably the most unique and fantastic attribute of Dino's is its ever-present crowd of eccentric (and maybe crazy?) locals.  If you want a sample of gritty local flavor, this is the place for you.Dino's used to have pretty regular rock shows, partially due to two especially hip young female bartenders.  After these two parted, the shows sort of became a thing of the past, and now it's unclear whether or not the place can even stage concerts anymore.  Regardless, the jukebox has a pretty mean selection of old country and rock 'n roll hits.  I'll put it to you this way: if five dollar pitchers and dingy, low-light, smoky dives are your scene, go to Dino's.  Pronto.

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: Now keep in mind I'm a fan of a dive bar. Dino's may not have the cleanest atmosphere or bathrooms, but if your looking for cold beer and a fantastic burger accompanied by friendly longtime regulars and great music, then this is your spot. Dino's is cash only so be sure to stop by an ATM on the way down to this cosy hole in the wall. You won't be disappointed. Prepare yourself for an abundance of smokers on a busy night and have your favorite country song in mind to play on the highly affordable juke box. The beer is some of the cheapest in town. PBR and Budlight are the cheap domestic draft beers which sell all day and night at $1.75 and you can plan on them having Yeungling and New Belgium draft beer specials for $3.00 every day. Probably the only place you'll find a Yankee burger in Nashville!

reviews.name: Patrick F.
reviews.review: Great burgers and cheap beer.

reviews.name: Cynthia S.
reviews.review: Still the greatest burger!  Absolutely the best!

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: I've wanted to explore Dino's since I moved to East Nashville. I love divey hole in the wall places, and one can tell from the outside that this place is definitely going to fit that mold. Our pitcher of Bud was served with mason jar glasses, reminiscent of the backwoods bars I used to frequent back home in Arkansas. The $2 grilled cheese I had was deliciously Velveeta-y.  The guys behind the bar also fit the dive image wonderfully.What was somewhat disappointing was that the ambiance inside didn't have all the charm I had hoped. Places like Brown's Diner and Hermitage Cafe pull it off much more effectively.  When we first arrived Bravo was on the tube, and the clientele was East Nash standard instead of the dirty old men you'd expect from the boarded up windows out front.All in all, I am glad I went, but I probably won't return.

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: Pocket dive. Historic or just crusty? Jalepeno poppers were gross. Confederate flag in the corner was distracting. Still, an odd charm about the place.

reviews.name: Luke E.
reviews.review: Is it right to give 5 stars to a dive? I guess dives are inherently supposed to get 3 star reviews. But Dino's is the real deal. Pitchers for around $6 and a grilled cheese (ask Rick to make it w/ pickles and tomatoes) for $2.75 (or is it 2.25?). You never know quite who will be there (old salt of the earth Nashvillians, hipsters, cowboy themed hillbillies).... The grittiest place in East Nashville.

reviews.name: David D.
reviews.review: Great place! Great service! From the chips, salsa and cheese dip to the fajitas and chimichanga my wife and I had, everything was delicious!

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: My friend set up a happy hour get together here but... there's no actual happy hour specials for this restaurant. Bummer. They have 3 main Margarita flavors ( Lime, Mango and Strawberry) but you could get a Mango/Strawberry if your heart desires. I ordered the mango one but thought it was a bit too sweet so my boyfriend and I mixed the lime and mango together. Much better. We ordered the Fajita Texana for two. This came with shrimp, beef and chicken. The meats were very well seasoned and we were very pleased with it.We sat on the patio and it was beautiful... very open and you have a view of town town especially of the Omni. Depending on where you're sitting, you can also see the Batman building. I love that they have a parking lot which means free parking and no hassle!

reviews.name: Melissa M.
reviews.review: Being that I'm on lunch break, I can't speak for the margaritas... But for basic Mexican food they definitely stand out. Rice and beans are flavorful. Chili rellano is cooked perfectly (not a sloppy mess like elsewhere). Great little spot with an elevated view of the city.

reviews.name: Alban J.
reviews.review: A great value for money. The tacos and quesadillas are very good and great quantity. Service is fast and nice. Decor is cute although a bid dilapidated. We ate for 35$ for 4 people, including drinks!

reviews.name: Ashley D.
reviews.review: This is our new favorite restaurant. The owner is always there and is super nice. Food comes out really fast. Great prices. I love the margaritas (not too sweet). Plus they're $15/pitcher or $11/half-pitcher and .99 Bud Lights all day! We've been 4 times in 2 weeks and are taking some friends tonight! Definitely check this place out if you're in the area. They also have parking in back - which is a plus for a downtown restaurant.

reviews.name: Emily F.
reviews.review: We LOVE Little Mexico. Great drink specials, delicious food, and the patio is great when the weather is nice.

reviews.name: Jessica D.
reviews.review: Ate here for lunch last week. We were sat immediately and had great service. I got the beef tacos and refried beans. Food came out hot. Tacos were alittle small but seasoned well. I will be returning!

reviews.name: Katie S.
reviews.review: I had a really solid experience here. Really delicious fish tacos paired with really good service. It does help being the only ones in the restaurant though! It was a quick lunch, but I'll be back to try some margaritas.

reviews.name: James M.
reviews.review: Went here with 3 others and our experience was great. We all sat on the outside patio - beers margaritas were all great. Steak fajitas were excellent, and they use the white crumbled cheese (Queso Blanco..?), so I was a huge fan of that. Friends' quesadillas looked amazing, and they said they were awesome. Good value Mexican food very close to Downtown. Walking distance from Broadway, etc. Will definitely return.

reviews.name: Mike E.
reviews.review: Best Mexican restaurant near downtown Nashville. Great service, great food, patio, views of downtown & FREE parking! I love this place & so should you!

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: The steak fajitas, not chicken are the jam there at Little Mexico texmex joint. This bar & grill gets more cred from me for their cool drinks like the yummo margaritas, and from hanging out on the deck which looms on a hill over the back of the Music City Center convention site. The combo plate of a varied sort from their kitchen was just only average so so texmex not much better than elsewhere. Their redeemed by their fajitas. I taste a generous amount of inebriating tequila in their margaritas so thats good too. Its handy for downtown but not as good a value as the cuisine at Nuvo Burrito across the street in the Peabody Corner food court. Like the Peabody Corner restaurants Little Mexico has its own free private parking lot. Of course thats a important factor for a downtown eatery! I like the Peabody texmex for the food, and Little Mexico Bar & Grill for the drinks and for the deck.

reviews.name: John M.
reviews.review: The food here is very authentic, similar to what I tasted during my trip to South America. They have hot salsa, creamy queso, crisp chips, fresh veggies, and the portions are perfect. The place is always clean and the staff is very welcoming. What I like best of all is the fact that I can come in on my lunch break at work, order, eat, post this review and I still have time to make it back to work on time. Excellent place!

reviews.name: Anna O.
reviews.review: Nashville is lucky to have this gem.  Affordable, friendly and oh so good.  Salsa is just right, and no one makes chile rellenos like they do!  Light without that soggy crust, surrounded by a delicious red sauce and topped with cheese toasted perfectly.  Their chicken fajita salad is a great option for those watching carbs!  Can't wait to get back to Nashville and visit our friends at Little Mexico (formerly Sal y Limon in Murfreesboro)!

reviews.name: Bert L.
reviews.review: The food and service was fine but nothing amazing. I would say fair prices but when my meal was done I went into the parking lot to find out my car had been towed. Then I talked to the manager and he said he called it in because they didn't know it was mine. Long story short neither the restaurant or the tow company could help me out. Making my meal $125 more than I expected.  The waiter was nice enough to give me a ride to the impound lot to save me from a $20 taxi ride. However that seemed like to little to late.

reviews.name: Mitul M.
reviews.review: I really liked this place, my wife thought it was just OK but I'm writing this review so I'm giving it 5 stars. I'm just visiting Nashville from California so I'm not sure if this type of place is common here but given the music scene I would assume it would be. Vibe: a hipster/alternative vibe, slightly grungy but clean. This is the type of place I would typically spend a lot of time in. Everyone who worked there was friendly and welcoming. They had a stage so I assume they have live music some times. I went for lunch on a weekday. The kitchen smoke haze kind of hangs over the place, which is not ideal but could be fixed with an open window and a fan. Food: we had a large take out order for 8 people. I had the black bean burger, which was great. My father-in-law had the chicken Caesar wrap which he really liked. Everyone else had veggie sandwiches without hummus but realized that was a mistake and so added our side of hummus to their sandwiches which made them better. We ordered a random sample of sides, all of which were good. My favorite was the tomato and mozzarella salad but the black bean and corn salad was great also. I'm probably going to eat here again tomorrow.

reviews.name: Kim F.
reviews.review: I was excited to try Phat Bites after reading the reviews.  Everyone was spot on from the decor to the food.  I chose the spicy Dijon turkey sandwich and my husband went with the Big Jerk.  The spicy Dijon is no joke.  I had to scrape some of the Dijon  off, but still thoroughly enjoyed it.  The Big Jerk was a crowd pleaser as well.  We split the mozzarella and tomato salad...it was ok.  We got two iced coffees to go and the flavor was phenomenal.  Chocolate rocket fuel is the only way I can describe this delicious cold brew beverage.  I got a dab of almond milk in mine and my husband chose to wait and add some bourbon cream from his stash.  Both were delicious.   Highly recommend grabbing some iced coffee on your way out to keep you going.Next time I will definitely try a wrap..somehow missed that menu board when ordering.  Very friendly staff as well.

reviews.name: Katie B.
reviews.review: To be honest, I probably would have rated it highly before even trying the food just because it's one of the few unique places in the Donelson area with a good atmosphere, live music, and nice bar with local brews on tap.The good news is - the food is great! And even better, it's really affordable! I've eaten here four times in the month I have lived in the neighborhood. I love coming here and everything I'd tried has been really fresh and tasty. I highly recommend the kale salad - with walnuts, raisins, craisins, sunflower seeds, black beans, and garbanzo beans - it's the best mix of flavors and textures. I get it as a side every time. You can also get samples of the dishes behind the glass display, if you're curious about something.I've also had excellent, friendly service at each visit. And it's fun to see who's playing on a Friday night on their small stage in the corner. Donelson really needs more places like this. For now, I'll keep going back to Phat Bites!

reviews.name: Violet P.
reviews.review: After stopping and absolutely loving it's sister restaurant Ellendale's, we decided to stop and check this place out.   Since we were completely stuffed we couldn't eat any of the freshly prepared, yummy looking foods but we did take a tour of the place.   The place is very eclectic!  Loved it.  The colors were so vibrant. Many places to sit and they have a stage for live music.   Workers were very friendly and didn't seem to mind at all that we were just checking the place out.  Will def return and try out the food on our next trip to Nashville.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I was a bit bummed when Phat Bites moved to a new location, but I am pretty sure it's the same distance away from me, so no big loss! However, I drove past it the first time I visited, so keep your eyes peeled. It shares the same space as some nondescript business. I'm glad that the space is a lot bigger and they now have plenty of parking, even at peak times. The food, menu, and staff are the same. I came in for lunch a few times recently, and if you go early, you are golden. Anywhere between 11-12:00 you are fine. However, I stopped in around 12:30 and the line was long and order taking a bit annoying. I also waited about 15 minutes for my order, so it's not the quickest lunch option out there. When ordering take out, I like for it to be pretty quick, but expect to be at Phat Bites for at least 30 minutes at peak times. I still love the black bean burger that they offer. It's the best one I've had. I also have ordered a few sides. The kale salad is always great, and the hummus is out of this world! Phat Bites is amazing, so check them out!

reviews.name: James M.
reviews.review: Holy hipster! I enjoyed this little place in a strip mall off of Lebanon Pike but I would have to warn others to expect a hipster/green atmosphere before heading here. It was cool and made me feel a little more edgy and healthy but I'm not sure it's for everyone.As far as the food, I came in and got a to-go wrap and Kale Salad today. The Ninja Bomb was a surprise. I did not expect the bag to weigh as much as it did when I picked it up and was amazed at the size, freshness, and flavor of the wrap. It's got chinese chicken salad, granola, carrots, lettuce, and raspberry vinaigrette for a crunchy, sweet wrap flavor. It's so good! The Kale Salad was also excellent as a side and had pecans, golden raisins, and couscous (I think) in it. It was just the right flavor and didn't include any unwanted flavors that Whole Foods often puts in theirs like red onions.Pros:Serving size and flavor. I was able to split the wrap and have two full meals off of the side salad and wrap. It was really impressive. The staff was kind, approachable, and happy to serve their guests. Cons:The atmosphere isn't very approachable for out of town guests so I'll just have to get them to trust me about the food.Overall:I really like that this place is truly different in a Nashville restaurant atmosphere which is often too safe, atmosphere-wise. The food was so good and was the perfect lunch hour break. It was also enough to feed me for two full meals!

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: Pretty cool little joint.We knew this highly acclaimed spot relocated to our neck of the woods not too long ago, and finally stopped by this weekend for lunch.Upon entering the warehouse/garage-reminiscent space, we waited in line for a bit. There was a "help wanted" sign on the door, so I wasn't too surprised that they appeared to be short-staffed. We finally had our order placed, and tried to figure out how to pay...We asked, and were sort of gruffly told to walk to the end of the line. We pay, sit at the cleanest table we could find, and waited... finally got our food, which was the highlight of the stop. My chicken salad was fresh and perfectly seasoned. Boyfriend had the Big Jerk -- a pork tenderloin situation on ciabatta -- which he raved about (albeit, it was a bit small). He also enjoyed the potato salad well enough.Glad we stopped by--I'm sure we'll be back. They offer Bongo Java and have a bar that stays open late, so I'm interested to explore that.

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: I have been coming here for years. I have always loved the food and the art. Went in today - this is the first time I went in at the new location as I don't come to Donelson often. Still the same great sandwiches! I got the mufaletta today. The olive tapenade was wonderful. I really savored each fattening bite. I never have enough room to eat anything else. They have great looking salads too!Lots of awesome art. Heard a rumor that they were scouting east Nashville locations!EDIT: Lots of bad reviews here. For me, my sandwich only took about 7 minutes to make. And there were two people in front of me. The menu behind confused me at first, but it didn't take long to figure it out. Street signs I understand, would have been useful, but I found out about the new location via word of mouth. And I am ok with that. Its a local business that I am happy to support and will continue to give them my money!

reviews.name: thelma r.
reviews.review: Just go, be open-minded with the cool atmosphere. Food is great, prices are great, they have a full bar, the music they play is my favorite. They support local artists and musicians.

reviews.name: Kim P.
reviews.review: I finally had the chance to go to Phat Bites today. Saw them on DDD and just had to go. This place is awesome. Not only was the decor very unique and interesting, but their food is the same. I had The Stoner and it was great. A very comfortable atmosphere and the employees are very nice. I recommend Phat Bites to anyone.

reviews.name: J G.
reviews.review: Generous portions and very flavorful options. Renovated garage that is bright and airy. Good vibe and great staff. Menu posted high right by door.  Lots of options - especially for veg and non veg people. The hummus plate was awesome and easily shareable.  Orbit bowl great but could only eat a third - so huge.Real value - definitely recommend.

reviews.name: Kristin M.
reviews.review: My wrap was amazing! I had the buffalo chicken wrap and it was hot, very hot!!! It did take a while to get it though and it wasn't even packed. I definitely would not go around lunch time as the wait will be too long. I try to go after one when the lunch rush is over. Will definitely be back...after the lunch rush though, lol.

reviews.name: Eric H.
reviews.review: Bites, Booze and live music.  All great

reviews.name: Dave S.
reviews.review: Great lunch recommended by someone at Nashville airport.  Funky eclectic atmosphere. Great and healthy food choices. Sweet potato casserole with coconut and dried cranberry was fantastic.

reviews.name: Samuel E.
reviews.review: I've been here 3 times in the past week and a half.Their food is exceptional, I've been eating the Turkey Wrap and Big Jerk Chicken sandwhich. They taste amazing while being very unique and different. Also, the amount of food you get is definitely worth the money. Literally twice as big as I expected for the price.This will be my goto lunch spot for the future and can't imagine going anywhere else when it is so close to me, so good and a great deal.

reviews.name: Sarah A.
reviews.review: The food is awesome,  huge side portions and wraps. My friend and I picked the first 2 wraps on the board to share. Forgot the names already, but one had pork, and the other had steak as the meat. Both had plenty of veggies, rice, and other goodies stuffed and rolled tight in their wraps. We picked 3 salads (the Greek, broccoli, and sweet potato) for sides to try. Each were good, but both of our favorites were the Greek. Layout and where you have to go to pay is a little confusing, but the staff is nice and helped us new-bees. Tall ceilings and open kitchen concept in a auto garage shell is fine with us. Walls were decorated in awesome graffiti art, and we enjoyed looking at the album covered tables, games, and local art. Staff had an eclectic look and were well trained- didn't act like corporate robots. Which is always a plus. I didn't see this place as "a wanna be hipster place", just a relaxed restaurant were anyone can come and enjoy good food. I've watched suit and tie guys, military in uniforms,  hippies,  college students, kids with parents and everyone in-between come in and eat. Bathroom was clean and had plenty of back up toilet paper and paper towels in a basket. Overall great food, great atmosphere, good music, awesome staff. So glad we stopped at Phat Bites to eat. This area needed a place like this.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: My wife and I thought that the food was great. My wrap was tasty and fresh, her sammich was a big hit. She never likes avacado but she liked theirs. The staff were friendly and nice. Never claim that those who are hip are not friendly. The place is mucho popular and for good reason, but here are a couple of gripes:I like they have style, but I feel they should do more to improve the over-all condition of their location. Looking like a garage is cool, actually being a garage...not so much. Nothing led me to be suspicious of my food over it, but still. Maybe I'm just too old.I like chalk board menus. It means fresh and non-perpetual. It does need to be legible. Their boards are too busy to read quickly. When you're the only person in line (almost never) its ok to stare at the thing gaping until you can decide. Navigating it when busy just made me nervous.

reviews.name: Linda A.
reviews.review: My sister was visiting and wanted to try this place after seeing it on DD&D.  I'm not phobic about cleanliness but this place needs a bath.  The young lady who was taking orders for those of us in line was not helpful at all for a first timer.  I mentioned that I couldn't find their selection of sides on the chalkboards and she told me that was because they don't list their sides on the menus.  OK, could you tell me about your sides?  She said she could and then asked me which side I was interested in.  I asked her again what sides they have and she asked me again which one I wanted.  Sigh.I ended up ordering whatever was closest basically.  The meat quiche of the day...a HUGE square of a more egg casserole than quiche with cheddar cheese melted on it.  When it was handed to me I was warned that it was hot.  Well, it wasn't.  In fact the middle was COLD.  The broccoli salad side was the best part of my meal, it was pretty good.  The potato salad was awful and tasteless and I only had one bite before deciding it was not worth the calories.  I ate about 1/4 of the quiche.  Disappointing lunch.  My sister had the Ninja Bomb wrap and it looked good.  However, it took a really long time to get served.  She inquired about it twice and the employees were not helpful at all.  Finally it arrived.  The Long Life or Live Long Salad (the reason she wanted to go here) was good.  I'd never choose to come back here.  Snarky help, questionable cleanliness and underwhelming food.

reviews.name: Kelly Ann W.
reviews.review: Love this awesome lunch spot. Super interesting sandwiches and salads. Crazy eclectic 'ambiance'- graffiti walls, a suit or armor, skeleton flying an airplane- what more could you want? I recommend the Asian noodles, broccoli salad, all the chicken salads and the spinach feta hummus.

reviews.name: Stan S.
reviews.review: I really enjoy the food each time I go.  it is mostly healthy, fresh, flavorful, and uniquely prepared.  Additionally, the atmosphere is laid-back and highly unpretentious.  However, this also lends itself to mediocre service, long-lines, order confusion, and excessive (food) wait times.  If you are not in a hurry and willing to overlook some attention-to-detail deficiencies, I'd suggest that you check it out.

reviews.name: Brant I.
reviews.review: I want to like this place, I really do. There are so few quality independent restaurants in Donelson that when one shows any potential you want it to succeed.  Inconsistent food quality, frequently leaving described dish components off, routinely poor service. Such is the story of Phat Bites. They made their reputation on a Diners, Drive In's, and Dives episode years ago and if they follow their current trend are well on their way to becoming irrelevant.

reviews.name: mookie b.
reviews.review: Phat bites is the shit.I fed my whole family of six for $42 .my family is a rock band .  I had Anthony's  orbit salad and it was deliciouser  than  a motherfucker.  Don't get me started on that lavender infused ice coffee with almond milk.. Shit got my heart rate up and my taste buds a tingling.will definitely come back to pHa T bites when I roll through the country music city capital of the world again. Five stars five stars.

reviews.name: Michelle S.
reviews.review: Found this place by pure luck and loved it! Can't really see it from the road (it's in the Ace Hardware plaza). Looks rundown from the outside but open the doors and you'll find a spunky, urban oasis complete with colorful wall murals and eclectic, collaged table tops. I had the Hummus Envy and was not disappointed. I chose two of their 6 hummus options and it was ready almost immediately. It tasted amazing and the portions were huge--I'll be eating this for dinner and possibly lunch again tomorrow. Will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Barbra M.
reviews.review: Holy disappointment, Batman. This place used to be amazing! When I was pregnant this was my go to lunch spot. Service was amazing, food was to die for. I practically LIVED on caprese sandwiches. Then I went on maternity leave. I come back and the entire staff has turned over. What used to be a business filled with happy hipsters making slammin sammiches turned into a place filled with unfriendly, unsmiling, slow moving workers. I ordered a sandwich to go yesterday and ended up back at the office late from my hour long like break. Never again. They lost a long time, faithful customer yesterday. I would be hard pressed to go back unless I hear that they made major improvements. Attitude from the grill workers and eye rolls mixed with zero eye contact from the cashier. I can get better service from McDonalds and not have to pay $8.00 for a sandwich.

reviews.name: Bob B.
reviews.review: It feels/looks dirty when you walk in. I want my food establishment to scream CLEAN. This use to be a automotive garage, still kinda has that smell.  The sandwich was okay but nothing to write home about. It is a wanna be hipster place that misses the mark by a mile. I had the hot affair sandwich  it was a little messy. A side of hummus.  Like i said nothing special.  I've had better sandwich from publix.Nothing to go out of your way for. Sub depot blows this place away.  In the kmart plaza on Donaldson pike.

reviews.name: Jay R.
reviews.review: They are friendly and offer food you probably won't find at other places in Nashville. I had the sesame noodles. Super delicious! They have couches to sit at, and you can also look at the incredible art on the wall.

reviews.name: Lydia G.
reviews.review: We went to this place with my mom. I had the black bean burger. It was great. Big portions. my mom had the Reuben. She liked it. My husband had a classic sandwich and ate every bite. Will be back!

reviews.name: Matthew F.
reviews.review: Great place, we've made our way through most of the sandwiches and they are all unique and delicious. It's a Saturday tradition now.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: Today was my first time trying Phat Bites. Unfortunately we went to the old location on Allen Rd that is now closed. I was under the impression that they just opened an ADDITIONAL location, not just moved locations. It wasn't a huge deal though since the new location was only a mile or so up the street. However, even with exact GPS guidance it's still hard to spot due to it's awkward location next to Ace Hardware and the fact that there's no sign other than some painting on the window. Upon entering I was a little afraid my 67 yr old Aunt was gonna look at me crazy for bringing her there. It's very eclectic, funky, rummage sale, dreadlock-ish inside. Luckily Aunt Suzie is the coolest person I know and she felt right at home. As other reviewers have stated, it is a little silly to have the menu board up high and behind where you order. And definitely some directional signs would be helpful. Aunt Suzie originally thought we were supposed to pay at the old-cash-register-turned-condiment -organizer. Bless her. As far as the food goes, what we had was good. I really liked my VIP sandwich and she said her Charlotte wrap was tasty as well. We didn't have to wait long at all for our food. Less than 5 minutes. The things that would make this a 5 star spot for me are the following:*get outdoor signage you can see from the street *get directional signage on the inside. "Order here" "pay here"* new (or at least in better condition) tables and chairsI get that mismatched stuff is cool and eclectic, but some of the tables and chairs just looked broke down. And no thanks to sitting on a public, Goodwill couch.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: Cool vibe! Food is good, the bar is great with good drink specials, live music, fun place.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: I give kudos and stars, a place needs to be really bad for me to post something bad. I'd rather send you to heaven than to hell. Phat Bites is Donelson's little piece of goodness I love that the owner is into healthy fresh eating! Lots of good sandwhich, salads, and wraps ( try the Ninja Bomb, the Morphine wrap and The Cowboy,oh my goodness!!!!)  her Long Life Salad and and homemade desserts are so yummy good and her recent addition to coffee is such a plus.... But let me let you health nuts know .... I tend to one be at the right time..... The kale chips and the Kombacha is some of the best around! She also carries a bottle green juice that is delicious and much better choice than soda!!!   The only thing I would add to this little slice of heaven is a juice bar..... It would fit right in that place where the art work is sold, I could help start that up... Hint hint. But regardless it is a fresh, funky, and wonderful place to eat!!!

reviews.name: Keith L.
reviews.review: Good food. Nothing else in town that's really like it. Good prices. Looooong waits. Don't go if you have a 30 minute or less lunch break.

reviews.name: J R.
reviews.review: Love, love, love everything that I ate! The food was fresh, clean, and filling. The only thing that I had issues with was my chewing. Some of the dishes had a lot of different nuts in them. At some point, I got tired of chewing but I continued on because the food was amazing!  This place is very vegetarian friendly. I'd highly recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.name: Laini B.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed the wrap that I got from Phat Bites.  I think their only issue may be consistency.  The first time I got it it was great, the 2nd time it was just ok.  There was a woman working there who seemed a little out of sorts and wasn't treating the staff very nice, but maybe that is their working style and they are used to it.  I dont know but it made me feel bad for the staff.

reviews.name: Liz W.
reviews.review: I was in Nashville for a business trip, a lady at our hotel recommended that we go here. I had the Ninja Bomb wrap. Aside from the cool name, it is quite possibly the best wrap I have ever eaten. My coworker had the caprese sandwich, and thoroughly enjoyed that as well. I think if we had known about this place earlier, we may have gone here every day.I admit, the place seemed a bit sketchy at first. It is in a garage. But the inside was pretty cool. If you do go, make sure you check out the bathroom.Last but not least, staff was very friendly. You order and sit yourself, but everyone was nice and smiled.

reviews.name: Jonathan B.
reviews.review: Food was pretty good, but the ordering setup is very awkward; I am not sure why the menu is located where it is, and why it seemed like a crazy question to ask where it was located. Once I ordered my food, I was handed a ticket and the staff walked away. It was not clear if I was supposed to wait there, take a seat, pay, or anything. I took a seat and my food came out (wrong name and setup to go, instead of eating in as I asked). It just felt like an awkward experience overall. I didn't mind the decor as some people comment on, but I felt very unwelcome.Overall, I enjoyed my food, but the customer service experience was extremely poor.

reviews.name: Justin L.
reviews.review: I really liked this place. The sandwiches are tasty and extremely affordable. I can eat like a king on the cheap, which I like. The flavor combinations are impressive as well.I really, really liked the location. It was awesome. It reminded me of Empire Records, but as a sandwich shop. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. The setup is a little wonky, but not too difficult to understand.

reviews.name: Jessica T.
reviews.review: I want to love you Phat Bites, I really do! Your atmosphere is urban, creative and eclectic. Your food is absolutely yummy. On the other hand, your customer service sucks! I went in on a day where "shit hit the fan" and when I stated I had an online order and was told "We don't have any online orders", I was told what a hectic day it was. I was offered to have it made right then, but I chose not because I was already late for work. Instead I was given a coupon "buy one item get another free". I didn't read it at first because I sympathized the crazy day but when I actually read it later, not only did I pay for something I didn't get, I now have to pay again. Hence I'm giving 4 stars.

reviews.name: Cali C.
reviews.review: Everything is so good! I love all the hummus. The potato salad and the southwest chicken salad is the bomb. You also get so much food, I can usually eat on it for a couple days.

reviews.name: Adam M.
reviews.review: Good selection of sandwiches, salads and wraps. Everything was tasty and fresh - and the pickle was so tangy. I liked the atmosphere of the shop - very artsy and fun.

reviews.name: Rob W.
reviews.review: Drove from Florida to see it because saw it on Food Network. The kale salad was the feature and we asked for it. For the first time ever, they said, they were out of there famous kale salad. Other food was decent but very disappointed.

reviews.name: tommie r.
reviews.review: This goddamn food is so tasty and these dudes are so nice it makes me sick. Sick in that I'm suddenly disgusted with most other places by comparison.  Once you've been here you'll realize that the rest of the world is, by comparison, a wretched awful place.  Good luck.

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: I went here for the first time a few weeks ago. It's right next door to my neighborhood Ace Hardware, so very convenient. I went at noon -- which wasn't the best idea -- we had to wait about 20 minutes to order (standing in line ordering, not sitting at a table) and then it took about 30 mins to get our food. The food was great. My friend and I both thoroughly enjoyed both our meals. I didn't enjoy the atmosphere. It felt ... dirty. The restaurant sits in what I believe was the repair garage for an old car dealership. And it still feels like that. The decor is wacky, hippie, but I would be more comfortable if it at least felt clean.I will be back, though, since it's pretty much the only place in Donelson to get a nice -- healthy -- meal.

reviews.name: Guglielmo F.
reviews.review: I gave Phat Bites a second chance today. Eh. The place isn't very clean (flues everywhere and puked up dishes behind the counter just sitting) and the food is mediocre at best. The staff is ok - a new guy today was nice, but other than that, not very attentive. And it's loud. I don't usually mind loud, except that it gets in the way of conversation. And because the inside is cinder block and highly reflective, there's no getting away from it.Basically, it's everything that's wrong with the hipster scene, without anything redeeming. Too expensive as well. Especially given that there's no way they should be able to pass inspection.

reviews.name: Mike L.
reviews.review: This place is awesome. Flew in and wanted to grab a bite to eat, get some work done, and wait for a coworkers to fly in. Great food, awesome music going, staff was great. Perfect atmosphere to chill and hang out. Hands down Great job!

reviews.name: Doug J.
reviews.review: I have never used Yelp before, but after my 1st ( and last ) experience at Phat Bites, I felt like I would be doing society a horrible injustice by not reviewing this place. First off, the place is located in an old Chinese buffet in Donaldson directly adjacent to a hardware store. The interior of the "restaurant" looks like a cross between a Spencer's gifts blowout sale and a scene from Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles 2. The menu is on a chalkboard behind you. There are bread and cheese options, but it doesn't specify what they are.My GF and I ordered food ( I ordered a veggie wrap minus tofu, no cooking required, should be quick and easy), we were then told to go into a separate bar area to pay via tablet. No cash accepted?We sat down and waited for what seemed like an eternity, especially considering it was 5 o'clock on a week day and we were basically the only ones in the place. After 30 minutes had elapsed, my GF went to check on the progress of our meal, only to be told that they had forgot to make it. Given the circumstance, This is completely unacceptable. I'm only leaving two stars because the beer I had during our wait was quite good and the bartender that refunded our money was (seemingly) genuine in her apology to us.The food may or may not be decent here, but due to the Decor, bad service, and terrible location, I will never know.

reviews.name: Tessa K.
reviews.review: I just want to thank everyone at Phat Bites for the catering order today for our meeting. I will be here all the time now to get our meetings off to a great start. Thanks to Julie and Emily thank you thank thank you. Best place in the world and great customer service.

reviews.name: Jasmine J.
reviews.review: Two Words: Ninja Bomb. It's my favorite sandwich on the menu. (chinese chicken salad, carrots, sunflower seeds, granola, raspberry vinaigrette) I decided to rate four stars instead of five because I was unimpressed by the kraft single slices on my Turkey Wrap last time. Overall, a great place to grab a gigantic, affordable wrap & cheap sides made in house.

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: This was our very first stop upon arriving in Nashville. It was recommended by the gentleman at the rental car booth. I ate the Cowboy. It was an excellent sandwich. Had great flavor and the bread was fresh. The atmosphere was not expected but okay. It's a "whole in the wall" type place. Certainly not clean feeling, but who remembers the clean places. Some of the staff were great others needed a little help...dirty clothes, glazed over eyes. Neat place to go on vacation. I wouldn't be a regular if I lived here though.

reviews.name: Britt R.
reviews.review: phat bites is okay. 2 phat, the smaller counterpart, is actually way better. the fruit tea was very watered down, the portions of the chicken salad in the ninja star weren't as generous at this location, and the staff was less enthused about my business. I'll keep going to 2 phat instead for the same food.

reviews.name: LaTamera W.
reviews.review: Loved the Turkey Wrap with goat cheese and cranberries. What excited me the most was that they used real sliced turkey and not deli thin processed turkey. I was so very happy about that. This has become my new favorite place for turkey wraps and all things salad. On my 2nd visit I tried the Tuna salad. Loved all the yummyness they added like cashews, grapes, and cranberries. Yes! this is a great spot. the atmosphere is lovely. The service was great. Lots of smiles. The beer lady was friendly and helpful. My first go with Fat Bottom Ginger Beer = new fan. Thanks Phat Bites.

reviews.name: Lindsay M.
reviews.review: I work super close to the new location of Phat Bites and finally had time today to stop by for some takeout. The new location is awkward to say the least. The inside order area/menu area is also super awkward and doesn't make sense, not to mention the food prep area looks like such a hot mess. They were cooking something on a single portable burner. What?!Anyway. I walked in while another customer was finishing her order. There were two girls helping her, one of which was wearing booty shorts and boots, which was strange to see in a restaurant. I felt like I was at Deja Vu. The lady ordered and I stepped up to order but both of the girls walked off. They walked back my way about 3 or 4 times and the male cook also looked at me and no one seemed to think that I was of any importance. I stood at the counter for about 4 more minutes before turning around and walking out. I almost told the businessman who was walking in to go elsewhere, but I decided not to take that route. I was super excited to eat at Phat Bites because it's maybe a block away from my job and I needed a new place to eat on a regular basis. Based on my visit today, I won't be returning. Learn some customer service skills, dress like you have some self respect, and get some management in this place. If you're too busy to help a customer immediately, ACKNOWLEDGE THEM. Tell them you'll be right with them. It is so easy and will save you from losing money in the future. There are plenty of other great places to eat in Donelson. Go to those.

reviews.name: Jason T.
reviews.review: I agree with B.G. and Michael G.'s reviews.I have tried Phat Bites three times now with the same experience each time. The staff was slow to take my order and the food took 20-25 minutes after ordering. The food was okay, but by far the best thing that I have eaten there was the Rueben.Phat Bites is close and convenient to my work, so I really want to like this place, but there needs to be some customer service issues addressed.

reviews.name: Heather V.
reviews.review: Try the spinach and feta hummus, it is amazing. I had the chicken caesar pita and if was wonderful. The caesar dressing was very flavorful and the greens (romaine, mixed greens, etc) were good quality and flavorful (not your typical bagged junk). Pulling up the the place I was skeptical (they're in an old garage) but give it a try, well worth it.

reviews.name: Greg M.
reviews.review: My wife and I took our granddaughter after looking online for restaurants that were featured on the FoodTV show "Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives."  You have to go to this place with a completely open mind, and for us the hippie mystique wore off fairly quickly.  It was really hot outside and it wasn't much more cool inside.  It was uncomfortably warm, which is probably due to the fact this is in an old service garage in a building shared with an Ace Hardware.  There were flies buzzing around and landing on the food, the cement floor was painted and there was an eclectic collection of old, discarded furniture.  All of the furnishings looked like recycled stuff.... you know, someone else's junk.  I really liked my sandwich, although I agree with my wife's assessment that the steak strips were tough.  The flavors worked for me and I don't mind grinding meat with my molars but my wife was spot on - the meat wasn't tender.  There is nothing for a typical "kid" so beware anyone under 16 might not want anything on the menu.  Our granddaughter ordered the grilled cheese, which was the only thing that didn't sound foreign to her.  They asked her what type of bread and cheese she wanted and of course she asked for "white and American."  They asked if sourdough would be okay and we assured her she should try it.  They failed to tell us they substituted cheddar for American - you know you can tell the difference and even a kid isn't fooled - and they used mayonnaise instead of butter to brown the bread.  Technically it was almost burnt, and to my granddaughter two bites was all she needed to call it quits.  On our way out we laughed because two women happened to be leaving behind us and one said, "my grilled cheese was burnt."  Also, be aware there is graffiti on the walls and some of it is profane.  Not acceptable.  If this was a bar I would be okay with it because I don't take the kids to bars.  This was a DELI and therefore this was unacceptable.  Guy Fieri should remove this place from his "Triple D" listing.  WHAT A DIVE.  FAILED ON MULTIPLE LEVELS.

reviews.name: Rachel H.
reviews.review: I loved Phat Bites before their move. They are even better now. Granted, it's a little tricky to find the first time being in the same building as Ace Hardware. I LOVE the chinese chicken salad and as long as I can get it that's what I will get. In salad with or without strawberries, but they are preferred, on a wrap, a sandwich, any way is always delicious.  From what I know, they use natural, local ingredients in their food. So those strawberries you can't always get, along with some other thing because they just aren't in season. I understand. The yum yum bars you can get year round really do make up for it and the wait for your food is usually not very long. Plus, there is a bar. ;)

reviews.name: Jean J.
reviews.review: Saw this on the food network on Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives and searched this place out to try the citrus kale salad that was featured on the show. I drove a friend up to Vandy for an appointment and decided to have an early lunch here.
