Finding the place was a little bit difficult because it is BEHIND the ace hardware store in the same parking lot. There wasn't a sign indicating it was there. Parked in front at about 11am. Location looked like it used to be a car garage. Windows were tagged with the name of the business. I thought it was kind of cool. Went in and the place definitely was much larger on the inside. The decor is eclectic and urban. Had a chill atmosphere kinda like just a place to hang out and eat good food. I had to ask where the menu was and it's high up on the ceiling on chalk boards above the door.  Also told him that it was hard to find and it would be useful to have a bigger sign. One of the guys said that they were having one done and should be up soon. I mentioned that they should have one of the area's graffiti artists to make a sign for them to fit in with the decor. He kinda chuckled but i think he was just humoring me. The kitchen was in the open and everyone seemed to be busy. There was a variety of cold salads that all looked good and healthy. All the ingredients are organic and fresh. They were cooking on an free standing electric grill but they recently moved and it just fits in somehow. It reminded me of a large island cabana roadside food cafe. And EVERYONE knows that those things have the BEST food!! Anyways....The menu items had some crazy names but i think it tied in to the atmosphere well. They had a lot of items to choose from and they all looked good. I chose a turkey, bacon wrap with hummus, avocado and of course a plate of the kale salad! My friend chose the ruban sandwich and we sat down at one of the tables. I looked around a bit while we waited due to the only ones in there at the time. They have lounge couches and an area for a open mike poetry or local band. The garage doors looked like they would open up during the summer months and be kinda like a great place to just chill and have a beer. There wasn't a theme, it was just random and trippy. I loved it. They just picked furniture that they liked. I am a bit of a eclectic myself and i was comfortable. The place was clean!! I don't know why ppl gave such bad reviews. The food was AMAZING. They are not skimpy on the portions either. Most organic places give you a tiny plate that looks too pretty to eat. This place is no joke. It's like an urban free birds ( texas ppl you know what I'm talking about!!) If you're OCD about themes and matching things. And focus on the decor more than the food then you should probably not go there. I could only eat half the wrap and it was fresh!! The humus in it was amazing and the turkey tasted like they had prepared the bird. The bacon was crisp and yummy. The avocado was fresh and the pickle on the side was just crazy good. I could eat a jar of those things. My friend could only eat half of his reuben too. But he said that it was really good as well. One of the best one's he's had. The kale salad was A.M.A.Z.I.N.G!!! I have a love/hate relationship with kale. It's really good for you but i hate the taste of it. The salad had fruit and nuts in it, beans and a citrus dressing!! OMG!! I could of ate a bucket of that stuff. Half way through eating, people started flooding through the door about 12pm. It was a very popular place for lunch and you had a huge variety of people there. Just random people with no theme looking for a great place to eat!! I will def be back to this place when I'm around that area. It's pretty close to the highway too. I left full but not stuffed, light and not heavy. Great place with amazing food! If you want to think outside of the box, take off your shoes and chill for a bit and experience amazing organic food, i encourage you to go here.  I will def. be back! :) Great place!!

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: Another Triple D!  The food was awesome! The decor and atmosphere are fun and funky!  Guy had the Big Jerk and Kale salad which we had and loved every bite!  It did seem a little chaotic for service and food time but we'll go back!

reviews.name: Andy D.
reviews.review: Great place for a sandwich and drink. Great music while you eat. Service is great too.

reviews.name: Jeffrey B.
reviews.review: If u like a Bohemian atmosphere you'll love this place.  I usually have the Ninja Bomb - a Turkey wrap w cranberry salsa and granola for texture.

reviews.name: Victor G.
reviews.review: I love Phat Bites. I love the relaxed atmosphere, the friendly staff, and the fantastic food. I recommend the spinach and feta hummus.

reviews.name: Keith H.
reviews.review: Dissapointing....This place has went downhill. I used to recommend it to everyone but now I'm not sure I'll go back. This makes 3rd time for a muffaletta and they were out of ingredients.  Wanted a brownie but desserts had mold on them and their new places just feels dirty evertime I go. Sad sad sad.

reviews.name: Alexa S.
reviews.review: So surprised that this place does not have better reviews. Everyone seems overly concerned with the decor, and not focused on the delicious, fresh made food that is served. My mother lives right in the area, and has been talking about Phat Bites like it is heaven on earth. I finally was able to come today for lunch. So happy they were open on Labor Day.On to the important stuff. It was busy when we went in, around 1230pm, but we were still greeted and as I was clearly overwhelmed with what to order, one of the workers suggested his favorites. I had a turkey wrap, my mother had a caprese sandwich, and we also ordered some spinach and feta hummus. Unlike the other reviewers, I found the decor to be refreshing. There are so many chain restaurants in Nashville, and especially in the Donelson area, that it's wonderful to see a place that thinks outside the box. We are New Yorkers, and Phat Bites feels like home for us. After about a 5 minute wait, we were served and I was ecstatic. Not only was the turkey fresh, it was not deli turkey. Someone clearly slaved over cooking a whole turkey, the mayo was freshly made, the veggies were ripe, and the quick pickle on the side was beyond delicious. My mothers fresh mozzarella was to die for, and the ciabatta bread was up to par with anything we'd get freshly baked in New York. But the hummus was OUT OF THIS WORLD. I would return just for that.If the "hipster" decor and staff are too "dirty" for you, then you are seriously missing out(by the way, everything I saw was clean and all people preparing food were wearing gloves). Nashville needs to be educated on locally run and sourced restaurants, cafés, and delis. Paying $7 for a fresh wrap/sandwich/salad is much better than the same price for a value meal at mcdonalds. I will definitely be a frequent customer.

reviews.name: Dew T.
reviews.review: Hummus! Amazing Hummus. I get the Chipotle every time, but their spinach is really good too. Most days I order the Hummus Envy or the 3 sides and get 2 sides of hummus and the kale salad. I wish it was closer because I'd eat there a lot more. Great vegetarian and vegan options. I love Phat Bites.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: So cool!! What an awesome little underground place. Great service, great prices...will definitely be returning!!

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Not horribly impressed.  Arrived at 5pm on a Saturday and they were out of beef and pork.  Got the buffalo chicken sandwich and it ended up being okay.  Also, I found it a bit awkward to order...the menu is too extensive to stand there and look up to try to figure it out.  Handheld menus would make more sense to me.  Staff seemed kinda  disengaged, but I'll give it another shot sometime with the hopes of a better experience.

reviews.name: Matt D.
reviews.review: New location feels unfinished. Sandwich was good but not great. Meat was dry. All ingredients were fresh. Overall cool eclectic atmosphere, but image not fully finished.

reviews.name: Bridget O.
reviews.review: A cool hipster vibe with awesome food. Hung out and had some great garlic hummus while watching some fun live music. Fun spot to hang.

reviews.name: B G.
reviews.review: The review from Michael G is spot on. This place is REALLY screwing up something that other restaurants would kill for: a lot of hype. Forget about the food; it simply doesn't matter when the service is so awful. The people are friendly and all, but they don't seem to have a process for taking orders, building, cooking, etc.I have been there twice now and both times the wait was over 20 minutes AFTER ordering. And, one of the guys at our table got his food immediately... The food is good, but not so good that it's worth the poor service frustration. I will try them again in a few weeks to see if they've ironed out the (major) wrinkles.

reviews.name: William C.
reviews.review: It would be great if a wrap didn't take 30 mins, they also need to learn certain eating preferences. They thought vegan was just the absence of cheese and recommended tuna salad.

reviews.name: Iknow B.
reviews.review: Food quality has fallen over the past three years.  Their reuben used to be good.  Now it's a joke.  Arby's at least uses SLICED corned beef brisket.  Chopped? Are you kidding? Just a way to disguise the low quality and toughness of their brisket and VERY SKIMPY portion as well.  They apparently have borrowed from their name and now only give a BITE of meat in their reuben. Complained to the manager about this change and it seems it's of course the owner's decision.  I guess without the deeper pockets of your old owner (ellendale's) you decided to sacrifice quality to control food costs.  You won't have my future business any longer.  And the music was too loud for the filling station acoustics!  Goodbye.

reviews.name: Steven C.
reviews.review: This place is fantastic. The poor reviews must have been a result of the growing pains of moving. Fantastic food, quick and friendly service. The only place I know of that gives Mitchell's a run for their money!!!

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: Got the Big Jerk and it was good. The VIP was good. Neither sandwich as good as Mitchell's but the cheddar broccoli salad was awesome. If i ate that alone it would be 5 stars. The pimento cheese was really good, The loaded potato salad was just missing something it wasnt bad but it needed something to make it special. Avoid the pasta salads at all costs lol they were bland and just plain not good.

reviews.name: Aaron H.
reviews.review: Is it possible to give zero stars?  What a sh*t hole.  I mean the whole grunge thing is OK, but not in the kitchen.  Maybe all kitchens are like that, but this one is out in the open where you can see it.  I'm pretty sure I saw the guy on the grille pick a hair off a piece of bacon.  Dreadlocks and goatees are fine - WITH A HAIRNET!  Not sure these people know about hairnets - or hygiene in general.

reviews.name: Danielle F.
reviews.review: 3 stars for Great food.... When and IF it comes out. We've been a handful of times and something always gets forgotten or takes 30+min. I ordered a salad and came out as a wrap, or any modifications get forgotten like no tomatoes etc. there's always a customer at the counter asking about an item they never received. It's such a good place they really just need to get it together! We've decided to stop going for a while in hopes it'll get better. There seems to be no structure. Sad because it could do well if they had some sort of way or getting the food made and out the the customers. The food just comes out when it's ready so one person is done eating by the time the other gets their food...

reviews.name: Brad E.
reviews.review: I went to Phat Bites for the first time the other day. I ordered the Black Bean Burger. It was absolutely delicious, and it was more than I could eat in one sitting! It took a bit longer than I expected, but I think part of it is that they just moved locations. You can definitely tell they are in middle ground mode right now. I can see the potential for a great atmosphere with yummy food!

reviews.name: Brandon R.
reviews.review: Unfortunately, I am not able to say anything good about my experience there. I am all for supporting local businesses, but only when their service is worth it. Today was my first experience with this restaurant and it was not so great. What I am gonna say might seem critical, but they are points that I feel would serve the establishment well if they took notice. First off, the whole chalk board menu thing is cool and all, but there should also be some printed menus up front for people to look at. It is hard to place your order when the menu is behind you. Also when it came to ordering, I just assumed that you went straight to the cash register to place your order. I was quickly advised that I had to place my order back around the corner where there was already a line stacked up. I feel some simple directional signage would have easily helped in this situation. After ordering, my wife and I found our seats and preceded to wait...and wait...and wait some more. Finally our name was called with only one of our orders ready. I assumed the best and figured mine would be out soon. I get it if you are low on staff that day, but maybe just being up front with the customers saying "it might be a little while longer than normal today" might help. 50 minutes after ordering, we were forced to go up to the counter and ask about the missing order. She quickly scurried around and found a ticket with my name on it and handed it to me. At this point I was just ready to leave so we took our sandwiches to go and were out. It wasn't until I got home that I realized I had the wrong order. I apologize to the unlucky soul whose food I was given.

reviews.name: Mary P.
reviews.review: This place feels like a food truck.  Great street art, delicious food, terribly eccentric service, as eclectic an environment as you can imagine. Our veggie wraps were outstanding!  The vibe is at once vintage thrifting and "get over yourself".  Only place I know that let's you rummage while having lunch. I'd kick up the cleanliness a notch.

reviews.name: Steve P.
reviews.review: This place is great for large groups.  We had a bachelor party of at least 20 and the service did not disappoint.  We only had one waitress taking orders, but 2 or 3 others bringing food and drinks to the table on a regular basis.The tap list was pretty good.  Coming from Colorado, I know very few places will be able to beat the local tap selections.  As I said before, the drinks were delivered amazingly fast for the size of our group.  I was one of the last to order my beer and only had to wait about 5 minutes.  A few people in the group ordered the whiskey flight.  I was a little jealous I did not order one to start, so I kept with my beer.The menu is heavily dominated with burgers, so this is naturally what I ordered.  It was delicious since I had been craving a burger for a few weeks now.  I ordered the Cuban Burger and it did not disappoint.  It is usually interesting to see a traditional ethnic sandwich turned into a burger, but Pour House did not let me down! I thoroughly enjoyed my meal and would visit another Pour House wherever my travels take me next!

reviews.name: Lauren L.
reviews.review: Absolute disaster. We sat at the bar and the bartender refused to take our drink orders until we ordered food. We were given to understand the kitchen was about to close (at 9:00 on the Sunday of a holiday weekend?) but not taking drink orders while we briefly reviewed the menu? That's just bad service. Bartender wanted to serve me a cider he'd "just poured five minutes ago" that he took out of the fridge below the tap system rather than pour me a fresh drink. He was furious when my husband requested said fresh cider, as if it were somehow my fault that the person who had ordered the stale drink left. We couldn't understand half of what he mumbled even as he flitted around behind the bar and through the restaurant with more nervous energy than I've ever seen outside of a person on drugs. When my husband and I wanted to cancel our food after realizing the bartender was quite likely on drugs, we got a lot of attitude. Rather than give us our bill, he called out the amount and was offended when we requested a print out. After running our card (which he snatched from my husband's hand quite violently) but before we could give him our signed copy, he screamed at my husband to "get the hell out" for daring to speak to another customer who had asked for the manager as her party of eight was being mistreated by their server. (The manager was no where to be found by the way, how convenient.) The bartender was so peeved, he finalized our bill and slammed it on the bar without ever viewing the signed copy and before inputting the tip amount. Apparently our (gratuity) money was no good to him. What an absolute joke of a restaurant. I understand they're a chain. Hopefully someone from corporate will see this review and take action before a customer gets drugged or hurt.

reviews.name: Erica F.
reviews.review: I always doubted the reviews that talk about Pour House as havi ng an awesome location. Corner of a 4 way red light surrounded by restaurants in a huddle then kind of...blah and interstates, was not convinced. I ascended the steps to the giant upstairs porch with fans blowing, a lovely breeze, mister going and covered indoor-covered outdoor options, a huge bar, and pull down awnings for cold or rain. The breeze blew in, the city skyline sprawled in front of me and I didn't even remember the interstate was hiding behind the building. Check, I do agree the location is spectacular...except stupid parking. It's not really a busy area, it's just that there are limited streets to actually choose from parking on. I snagged a bit of mint from one of the plants and pulled up a happy hour menu while waiting for my friends to arrive. We tossed a table around a bit to coordinate breeze to fan ratio perfection in the humid hot day, the bartender swept around and he was very kind - got us menus, waters, beer for me. Service was greatt, loved the. I'm pay and the easy feeling that we could hang out for hours. What got me down was the food. I wanted slider veg option but had to go for full burger portabello...which really didn't take up more than half the bun and I got a wimpy little slice of gouda on top. So it was a nice slider portion for full price. They aren't totally generous with sweet potato fries. I had just spent an hour and a half between cycling and running so I was ready to get big pile of fries on. Weak. That said, the food was pretty awesome. Bun was just a buttered bun, ingredients were simple but the fries were crispy and I loved the ketchup. Their truffle aioli though is ameteuer overly truffle oiled down and cloggy super greasy, did not like. Overall I do like the location, but that stupid small portion grumped me out lots and it felt a bit bitty for the price. Yummy, when you keep it simple. Glad I got the sauces on the side or I would have felt like I was licking a hair band midway through their set.

reviews.name: LaSonya M.
reviews.review: Went to Pour House for lunch for the first time and it was awesome. Landon was very helpful in helping me with my selection. The building was very clean and neat great atmosphere. Will most definitely visit again. Thanks Landon your the best.

reviews.name: Sharon S.
reviews.review: Was hoping for a great seasoned burger but it lacked in taste.  They do cook it to order which is great and the onion rings were outstanding along with the Service. Valet parking is really nice since parking is limited in the area.  Over all a decent meal but I'm still looking for that perfect burger.

reviews.name: Jena S.
reviews.review: Love the atmosphere and the HUGE outdoor seating area. The servers and staff have always been very friendly, and provided good service. As a self-proclaimed beer snob, I'm quite happy with the available beer selection. They also make sure to have local beers on tap, which is always great. I've had some good burgers there, the sweet potato fries are to die for, and the brunch menu is tasty as well. Definitely give the fried green tomatoes a go - you wont' regret it!

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: 3.5 starsPlenty of seating, neat inside/outside dining, airy, plenty of parking around the street and valet.Our waitress was pretty good. When she realized we weren't there to pass the evening away, she made herself visible and approachable.Menu.. lots of variety.  We decided to go with a burger.  Both of us chose a bacon cheeseburger with a side. Friend got fried mushrooms, I got green beans.Friend got a bun on her burger, I did not.Friend did not drink, I did.All in all, friend got away with a very cheap meal of a burger and side for under $11.00.I got away with a burger and two alcoholic drinks for less than $42.00.Both of us love burgers and we pride ourselves on having gone around Nashville eating burgers often.. This one would not be on the list.  Our six ounce burger was so lean, there was no juice on the plate.  A dry beef patty.As we have said so often...  a little fat makes for a great tasting burger.  This one had no flavor.Would not repeat.We were lucky, we had an attentive waitress.Our glasses of water were kept filled.The sides were ample - and plenty of variety.It's close to the gulch.. close to downtown..They will probably stay in business because of their location.The food isn't bad, but if you're a burger lover... you will probably judge this place on the burger, alone.1 star to the burger.

reviews.name: Mia F.
reviews.review: The bourbon selection was excellent for my husband, he found a few new ones he liked, and the server was well versed in the menu. I don't drink bourbon, so I stuck with beer. Decent selection - nothing too extensive. We stopped by here after a quick tour at Yazoo and Jackalope with a couple of friends.  Needless to say, we were a bit hungry and wanted something close by. Pour House is in a very convenient location, so  many stores in that little area now. . . The restaurant area wasn't that crowded, but by the time we left (around 8, it was packed.I've been here 3 times, but this was the first time I ordered food.The service was pretty good, but I have to say the food was meh. We all had burgers (different ones). I had the Gouda burger and it was pretty good, but nothing fabulous. I also had the sweet potato fries and those were ok, i feel like it's hard to screw those up. My friend had the farmhouse burger (or something like it) with the egg on top, and she really liked that. The appetizers we ordered were fried pickles and chips and queso. . . pretty good. . . but the fried pickles weren't the best I've had. The atmosphere is really cool and rustic, I really like that aspect. The drink menu is good, and happy hours are fun there . . . I just wasn't that impressed with the food. Also looks like they have live music there, I would go back for that if it's an artist I'm interested in.

reviews.name: Will A.
reviews.review: Cool place to get a beer or cocktail. The outdoor area is the best on a Spring or Fall night!

reviews.name: Amy W.
reviews.review: I was a little leery after ready the review from 'Lauren' because we just wanted to sit at the bar for a drink, but it was fantastic.  Service was great, the bartender was very attentive and personable, and the selection of drinks was amazing.

reviews.name: Jake A.
reviews.review: Came here for Sunday brunch and sat on the outside patio which was very nice. 5 dollars mimosas, sangria, and bloody Mary's ! I ordered the ham and cheese omelet with grits and mimosas. Seems more of a drinking place with decent food. Prices not bad either! Will come back for sure

reviews.name: Brandon P.
reviews.review: Terrible food, worse service, kitchen takes over an hour to cook a burger. Manager didn't want to hear about it and walks off while we're still talking to her, saying she'll just comp the meal. DO NOT EAT HERE!

reviews.name: Maya M.
reviews.review: Man, smh. This place is awesome! Beer on beer! Brunch was amazing, grits French toast, potato cakes, pulled pork n waffles, ham n cheese omelette- everything was delicious. And the service?! impeccable! thanks for a great Sunday Pour House!!PS holy shit!! Live music- and it's great too!! I'm in love!

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: I really wanted to love this place. I like the size of the place & set up. The building has glass garage doors so during the warmer part of the year they can open them up so it's like you're dinning outside even when you're inside. I'm a sucker for that. We had a reservation at 7pm on a Saturday for a party of 5. We arrived and waited a few minutes and realized the group in front of us were given out table. We were sat at a booth that could fit 4 comfortably, & 5 was okay if the fifth person didn't mind hanging off the edge. To the server's defense, she did ask if we were okay sitting there & we said yes. We really didn't want to wait any longer for a table. This place as a huge bar & tons of televisions. It also has a large selection of bourbons & whiskeys. They actually have a walk-in room that had all the bottles displayed, pretty neat. Food - I ordered the mushroom Gouda burger & fries. I liked the taste of the burger, but for 11.75, the burger patty was almost the size of a slider & the bun was bigger than the patty. I could've been a larger patty. The fries were good, seasoned with some spices that made them kind of hot, but I liked that. Would I go back? Yea, if someone wanted to go there I would, but I don't know if I'd be the first to suggest it.

reviews.name: Melissa C.
reviews.review: Southwestern Chicken Salad was delicious. My boyfriend had the portabello burger and he said it was great. Great beer selection. Also I don't know what they put in their sweet potatoe fries but they're amazing!!!! They're a little sweet and the dipping sauce they're served with is awesome. Only downside was the service was a little slow, but not a deal breaker at all.

reviews.name: Jessica C.
reviews.review: Never again. Just look at the pic. Over priced burnt  food . Seems like they are more of a party spot then restaurant

reviews.name: Kina L.
reviews.review: A mantra amongst my girlfriends and I is.. budget. Is it in the budget? Girl that is Not in the budget. More likely then not, one of those statements (if not all) will be dropped at least once on any given night. Last night was no exception. My friend wanted to grab dinner at a "Poor House" she had heard of. She felt, "hey, that sounds budget friendly." An O here, a U there. No difference right?Well we ended up at the Pour house. First tip- just valet park. If you are coming here on a Friday night, it can be painful to find a parking spot. Happy Hour: 2 cheeseburger sliders for $5, 2 for 1 Abita drafts on Friday, $5 apps such as queso and chili cheese friesDrinks: The pour house has over 130 different whiskeys. You can get just a smidge for ~$4 or you can get the full size for $10. Or you can custom make your own flight. They offer an okay selection of Scotch. Of note, my friends ordered cosmos (super pretty pink ones) from Kendra the bartender and said it was fantastic.Food: The group stuck to burgers. The portabello was very flavorful (definitely can taste the balsamic vinegar). The best part were the sweet potato fries- sub that for your regular fries please!Service: Now this is where they stood out. It was a Friday night... they were very busy but our server was the greatest. Our waters never were empty, she always checked in on us and our appetizers were out in.. maybe 2 minutes. The owner even stopped by to say hi. He made sure that we got up to the rooftop to check out the view...and it was great.

reviews.name: Ron O.
reviews.review: I looked at the yelp reviews before we had dinner here and set my expectation low. I was delightfully surprised. Service was great, the beer was great, the food was great. The atmosphere is right up my alley. I had the mushroom burger and caesar salad. The burger was really good and a perfect option for a vegetarian. The caesar salad was good but was less creamy/anchovy version of a caesar and I liked their twist on it. The first beer I ordered was served perfectly with the perfect amount of head and tasted great. The second one lacked head when it hit my table but I will write that off as the only negative for the evening....and could have very well been the fault of the brewery. Based on others reviews it seems you may be rolling the dice but I seriously had a great experience.

reviews.name: Russell M.
reviews.review: I have been wanting to come here and date night was approaching. So with all the craft beer options I was excited but unfortunately it did not live up to the hype. I looked at the menu and found a couple beers I wanted to try. So I ordered one and it was out, okay I'll get something different, OUT of that, so 3rd times a charm right? Nope fail! So I finally gave up looking at the menu and ordered something the server guaranteed they would have. Food is okay but I didn't go for that anyways so being subpar didnt hurt my feelings. The fact they are out of to many things on the menu did. You should always have a separate drink menu so that you can update it when needed.

reviews.name: Caitlin P.
reviews.review: It was a busy Friday night and we were a party of four, the hostess was excellent helping us get seated outdoors. She was amazing!!! Prior to seating we hand a beer at the bar, great selections. Although it was busy the bartender was responsive and stated apologies, our drinks didn't take long. We were seated and it took a couple minutes for our waitress to be identified, the hostess again was on top of this. The appetizers were great especially the pickles and peppers. I ordered the Big South burger, medium well (no pink). It was inedible dry, literally sucked any moisture out of your mouth. My dinner partners agreed. At the conclusion of the service the waitress asked how things were, I did mention that the burger was inedible. She immediately was able to address this concern with the manager Landon, who was apologetic and removed this item from the bill and even offered compensation. I'll be back to try a different burger another time because the service was so accommodating, sometimes hard to find on a busy Friday night

reviews.name: Rachel F.
reviews.review: Ordered the Mushroom Gouda Burger with sweet potato fries.  The fries were so so and the burger was alright.  The atmosphere was just OK.  It's right on the corner and the highway is right there too which makes for a noisy, not so great view when you are sitting outside (the upstairs was closed).  Smoking is permitted outside on the patio which makes for a not so great dinner.  The only parking options are to valet your car at the door or if you get lucky, you can park on the street.  I probably would not go back.

reviews.name: Vanessa G.
reviews.review: Great selection of whiskey's/bourbons, however, some were rather overpriced. Beer selection was good as well. We only ate the fried mushrooms which I wouldn't recommend. Just seemed like an average place.

reviews.name: Rebecca M.
reviews.review: Pour House is good clean fun and food. Try the turkey burger sliders, they are scrumptious. Also, the beer selection here is right up my boozy alley. Sometimes they have live music and the layout works perfectly for those of you that want to listen, sip, munch and enjoy.

reviews.name: Melissa E.
reviews.review: A clean, vibrant fully stocked bar with a laid back menu. The patio is beautiful as well as t he interior.  Had a group of 8 and were served quickly.

reviews.name: Ashley W.
reviews.review: Visiting from Philadelphia during CMA Fest, my friends and I came here before the concert one night. I ordered the fried bologna sandwiches, which I never had before. They were delicious! We also ordered the fried mozzarella and fried green tomatoes. Delicious! Our waitress was very sweet and friendly. They even let me charge my phone for me. Overall, great food and experience.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: I had a perfectly lovely date here recently. Our server was friendly and sweet and more importantly, knew her shtuff (good luck on the bakers). The ambience is very relaxed, the prices are totally reasonable, and it's convenient to a whole bunch of music venues. I wouldn't come every night, but it's not a bad choice if you're off to a show.

reviews.name: Julie D.
reviews.review: We bar was within walking distance from our hotel.  We didn't really have the food, we just shared some sweet potato fries.  They were good.  Lots of beer choices and lots of flat screens to watch sports while we planned the rest of our day.  Service here was friendly and this place has a lot of atmosphere.  We enjoyed our visit.

reviews.name: Jacqueline R.
reviews.review: The selection of beer was lacking for local brews. But, over all good beer, food & service.

reviews.name: Casey C.
reviews.review: Would give 0 stars if I could. Came here to see a friend perform. Only parking option was valet. Valet stole from my car. 100% do not come here.

reviews.name: Katherine A.
reviews.review: A friend and I went last night, Thursday. It was pretty packed but we didn't have to wait too long for a table. I was excited to see they have a variety of bourbon and whiskey flights. That's where the positive experience ends. Our server was basically terrible. We asked for a drink suggestion and she said, "Well, we're known for our bourbons." The end. No specific suggestion, no help with their more popular cocktails, nothing. She was completely bored with us. Our food took forever! For two burgers. Since I was waiting, I ordered a beer. It came after I was done eating. Once my food finally arrived. We had already been there for over an hour, nothing was worth it, and I just wanted to go home so I had to send the beer back. There are just too many choices to waste time on bad service and bad experiences.

reviews.name: Sid N.
reviews.review: I arrived with a friend on Saturday afternoon. We were promptly seated on the patio. I ordered the Turkey Avocado burger and my friend had the Mushroom Gouda. The burgers and fries were excellent. There is a huge selection of beers and bourbons. Next visit I'll probably try a bourbon flight. I'm not a big fan of the area. There is no parking so there is no option except to use the valet. The views are also rather unexceptional to say the least.

reviews.name: Brenna S.
reviews.review: A group of friends and I went to Pour House on what was surprisingly a not very crowded, early Saturday night. We made reservations a good deal ahead of time to ensure that we would have our place here that evening. When we arrived early, we were all pleasantly surprised to find that our table was ready and waiting for us, so we sat down and began looking at our menu. As avid fans of a good drink, we were initially mostly interested in the adult beverage offerings. Our waiter came around to offer us water, and as we started asking about the seasonal choices for drinks, we realized we might not be getting the drink we hoped for as his knowledge was not only limited as to what they had, but non-existent. :-/ I ordered and Ommegang and some Chips and Guac, to which the waiter repeated back "An Oh My God??" While that is a fine name for the new imaginary brewery I would like to establish, it wasn't one that I had ever heard of (or ordered before). So, the waiter forgot my one order of an appetizer, but did remember my OM-meh-gang, and after being reminded of his error, he did eventually bring it out. When the rest of our table finally received our entrees, one of the burgers that was ordered was *severely* undercooked (if we can call it cooked at all). They happily fixed it, but the ordeal was starting to weigh heavy on our laid-back and hungry hearts.The check took about 25 minutes to arrive. Just before handing over our cards, they opened up the garage door-type windows to let the live band play directly into the ears of the sleeping baby that was a part of our group. When the day finally came for us to sign and walk away, I can honestly say that we were all relieved to finally part ways with Pour House. While I didn't check out the legendary patio and can't speak for everyone, I know that I probably won't be returning in the foreseeable future if I can help it.But if you do decide to check this one out - bonne chance to ya's. ;)

reviews.name: Lynne B.
reviews.review: This place is one of our favorite burger joints. Love the Valet parking and the food is to die for.  They often have live music which is awesome. The two times we have been there the food was great both times.The major problem we had the last time we were there was that our waitress was more interested in a large party that was taking place on the other side of the restaurant from us. We didn't feel important enough to have her attention. The food will make up for some things. It was delicious.

reviews.name: Vonn H.
reviews.review: This place was horrible. First, valet could not drive a stick so he told us to park ourselves. Not enough staff and those that were there seemed unconcerned that we waited 20 minutes for a seat; another 20 to even get acknowledged and get a water. Ordered a beer that came about 10 minutes later and was WARM. Ordered burger and fries. Burger decent, fries freezing cold. Maybe they should store the beer where the fries came from. Won't go back and wouldn't recommend.

reviews.name: Emily A.
reviews.review: Service was awful and the food was just okay. Took 10 mins to get a beer. The food came out fast but the service was just bad.

reviews.name: Erin K.
reviews.review: Only went for drinks and music but service was great. Three groups of singers took turns on the stage and it's a great environment for meeting the artists and other people. Outdoor bar/seating area is also nice. Felt like a place locals hangout.

reviews.name: Laura G.
reviews.review: Had the WORST experience at this place... valley parking guy was very rude, waited 50 min for food, 20 minute for check, 15 minute for card back, and waitress was rude and all over the place. the chicken salad was gross. never going back

reviews.name: Brian K.
reviews.review: Great beer selection but the food is just ok.  I have eaten here a couple times and was not really impressed.  The food is good, but the menu selection is small.   Pretty much the menu consists of a few appetizers and salads and then burgers and sliders.  I had the bacon cheeseburger and it's good but not the best burger I've had.  Also the parking is terrible.  There is only street parking or paid valet.  Usually the street parking requires walking a ways.  I may go back for drinks but it would not be my first pick for food.

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: I'm digging the Pour House. Not only can you make reservations online (PLUS!) but they have a pretty decent patio (PLUS PLUS!!) with a view of a partial Nashville skyline. And who could be upset with the list of bourbon and beer? I enjoy that you can sample, in theory, an unlimited amount of beer for free. Service could be improved with a bit more attention to detail (i.e. napkins, silverware). The drinks were a little heavy on the mixer..if you know what I mean. The apps are inexpensive and shareable. I'd recommend the fried jalapeños, pickles and banana peppers--yummy!

reviews.name: J A.
reviews.review: First time at Pour House on a quite Wednesday night. The bar downstairs was very clean & staffed with a friendly bartender who answered all my questions regarding the bourbon selection. I haven't frequent many whiskey bars in Nashville, but Pour House has a GREAT bourbon selection. Including rare & limited bourbons priced at a reasonable entry. There is also a cellar filled with bourbon bottles & the cellar is glass, so it allows you to explore the many options. I did not eat a meal at Pour House so I can't add a comment. Thanks for the friendly service!

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: Meh.  Stopped here for brunch.  Had been waiting all winter to try out their gorgeous wrap-around, double-decker porch.  Had a tasty mimosa, but sadly, my cream cheese, fruit-filled crepe was tough, though was accompanied with tasty home fries.  There was also some live-music action going down.  In general, I'm a huge fan of live music.  And this woman had some talent!  But they had her turned up so loud that I had trouble hearing my brunching-companion, and I wasn't even sitting that close to the stage!I'd be willing to come back to try a burger and a beer.  Seems like that might be more their style.

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Review is for drinks only:Stopped in last weekend with a few friends while we were waiting for area breweries to open.  We grabbed a pint and enjoyed good music, conservation, and friendly staff.I will say that the food menu looked a bit overpriced for what they were offering, and parking was a hassle -- the complimentary valet was more hassle than it was worth.

reviews.name: B D.
reviews.review: Cool atmosphere, decent drink selection...the problem is that the food is way off, big time. Both my date and I felt terrible after eating here. If you're going for the drinks and don't mind mediocre service then its okay. They get two stars for having the cool atmosphere, otherwise, head on over to The Gulch for one of those spots, its worth the 3 minute commute.

reviews.name: Adrienne D.
reviews.review: Nothing amazing.

reviews.name: Mickey B.
reviews.review: This was the third time I visited The Pour House and all three times the service was horrible. On this particular visit the place was not busy, but it took a long time to get our beers, as my companion was about t take a sip of her water she found a hair in it. When we told the hostess she did not even apologize. After getting our checks my companion did not receive her change and we had to ask the server for her change. Do yourself a favor and don't go to Pour House.

reviews.name: Denise M.
reviews.review: I've gone to Pour House several times and had a different experience each time... each time a little better.My first experience a few months back was definitely a lot like several other reviews and they'd have earned a 3 star review instead. My husband and I seated ourselves, and we ended up waiting a long time to get service. Luckily, though, other waitresses stepped in to get us menus and water while we waited for our server. We were just out just for a relaxing evening, and we really didn't care if we had to wait even though we did notice it. (Probably lucky for our server! LOL) We just relaxed and enjoyed a beautiful evening on the porch.We've not had the server troubles since that night, luckily, and we've actually found everyone we've interacted with at Pour House to be awesome! We've tried something different each time we've gone. I highly recommend trying one of their bourbon flights. I'm not a huge bourbon drinker, but it was a lot of fun sampling different options and stepping outside of my Makers/Crown/Jack comfort zone. The beer list is great as well. In fact, when you get the menu, there is one page for food, and the rest of the menu is dedicated to their bourbons, whiskeys, wines and beers. This is definitely a place to go if you are interested in trying something different drink-wise!The menu, to me, is a little TOO limited. That, and the food prices, are literally my ONLY complaint about Pour House. (But not a big enough complaint to stop me from going back!) To me, the prices a little steep for what you are ordering. Luckily, everything I've ever had has been delicious. So that takes a bit of the sting out of the price. If I could give them any advice it would be to lower the food prices a little. I'd order more drinks and/or dessert if I didn't feel like I was spent already with my meal. But, again, I like the food I get and the prices won't stop me from going back and enjoying the cool vibe of the place and excellent drink menu.

reviews.name: Bryan L.
reviews.review: Nothing at all to complaint about here. Stopped in for a quick bite before a show at the Ryman. Fast and friendly service. Cold beer, hot food and a pretty good burger. If that's wrong, I don't wanna be right!

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Not too shabby but not too great either. The food presentation and flavor were nothing remarkable and the environment was pretty much the same. The bartender was friendly enough and the selection of beers was better than average.... however, I don't feel the any real draw to come on back to the Pour House. Perhaps to check out the patio?Perhaps.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: I wasn't impressed by the burger I got for the price.  They do have a very extensive bourbon list, but that's not my thing.  It wasn't bad but It seems like an expensive version of ML Rose.

reviews.name: Summer H.
reviews.review: Service was okay, drinks were okay(ordered a Moscow mule which did NOT come in a copper cup), food was okay even though I had to send it back because it looked like the put EXTRA tomato and carrot on my salad when I asked for NONE. Waitress was very sweet and quick about it. However, this place gets two stars because a few hours later my friends and I were all hunched over the toilet. We didn't eat the same thing at the restaurant but we all had some sort of fried food(I had buffalo chicken on my salad). So assuming the grease must have been bad. I know it was this place because it's the only food we had all night and it hit us all at the same time. It's the next day now and my stomach is still hurting. Won't be back!!

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: I always see this place from the interstate and finally decided to try it out. Went on a Sunday night of a holiday weekend and it was pretty quiet around 8:00. Nice outdoor seating area and friendly bartender. Too bad one of the servers had her BABY THERE with the baby daddy looking after it. He was carrying/walking it around the restaurant the entire time we were there - and letting it walk barefoot through the bar area. I don't have kids, but I'm guessing that isn't acceptable to most parents. and then the baby started crying. Hmph, not exactly the atmosphere I look for IN A BAR and I can't believe a manager would allow this.Burgers ok, although kinda small. Good fries. Cold beer.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Okay, so I don't want to judge the Pour house based on the meal exactly because I didn't like what I got. But that is kind of my taste vs. the idea of the thing and others might like it.We arrived at lunch, which was surprisingly less busy than expected.  It IS "Complementary" Valet parking, which is kind of a bummer but parking is incredibility limited here and you probably wouldn't want to trust to park your car just anywhere...I ordered the Big South Burger, which was a decent size, but comes with an egg, bacon, and Pimento Cheese. I personally felt the Pimento Cheese didn't go well with the burger, but I didn't want to order it WITHOUT in case they had discovered the next Peanut Butter and Banana Sandwich.  When I got rid of the Pimento Cheese and added some Ketchup, the taste was a bit better.  As a side I got the chips, which were great (and home style kettle) except they seem to only give you between 6 and 10.  This was not the case with a friend who got the fries and he had so many he didn't finish them.It was a work lunch so no Beers were had, but the menu did look pretty healthy overall.Service was a little slow, even though it didn't seem TOO busy, but that might have been that we were ready to get back to work and the waitress had not reappeared.Finally, they have RC Cola.  Some Cola Hipsters might dig this, but I always found DIET RC to be kind of "Meh.", of course it is an atmosphere for beer, not for cola.I certainly would come back, but no pimento cheese on the burger next time.

reviews.name: Jeff H.
reviews.review: Good stuff!  Burgers were very good...fries are as well.  The beer was cold and the selection is deep.  Service was 10x better than the 'FOWL' place across the street.  Don't be a chicken, cross the street and come to the Pour House - you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Brooke M.
reviews.review: Had a very nice time here at the poor house. Live music sounded good. Huge selection of booze. And our server Michael was the best!

reviews.name: Philgood D.
reviews.review: I got here and excited as a first time as a new nashvillian. My friends had been Sat for 20 minutes and ordered drinks. It was 19 minutes before the waitress came back. I asked for a beer and some water. I got my beer....20 minutes later. No water. I went and got my own water from the bar. I ordered wings. They came out 20 minutes later but at that point I had no beer or water and no waitress in sight. We asked someone passing by to get her. 15 minutes later she shows up. We order our food. The burgers are not that big for being 10-11 dollars and my side of fries consisted of 9 fries. Yes ..9 fries. Small Fries not big ones. I order a gin and tonic and a water refill. Got that 15 minutes later.Needless to say ...I won't be back. This place is shit.

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: This is my first one-star review on Yelp.  It's actually upsetting me a little bit...I am a very bright-side-of-life kind of gal and more than willing to give second chances...but that will not happen here.  Nope, not ever.  I can honestly say I've never been so disappointed, so upset, over an experience like I had here.  I hate that I am having to do this, and I debated whether or not to say anything, but as you can plainly see I have sung the praises of so many places in Nashville that are more than deserving, and so I must be fair to my city and myself and be honest...and this place was HORRIBLE.I understand Pour House is relatively new but they've been open long enough that they, as a place advertising as a whiskey and bourbon bar, should HAVE A LIST OF WHISKEYS AND BOURBONS.  The answer all of us got, I kid you not, when we asked to see a list of the bourbons and whiskeys proudly displayed in gorgeous splendor in a glass case on the wall was, Oh we don't have a list but just look at the wall and pick what you want.Excuse me?!You've been open a week at least, a list should be in place.  I can type one up for you real quick if you want, in the note function on my smart phone if necessary.  Why do you not have a list telling patrons what they can have?  How do I know if I'm ordering a $10 shot of whiskey or a $100 one?  Is that your ploy Pour House?  Trick us into spending lots of money?  How can I make an educated selection without a menu?And the service was abyssmal.  I'm actually using that word...apparently their servers don't communicate because we had about 7 different people help us within 5 minutes of our arrival and all of them had something different to say.  5 minute wait, 10 minute wait, you can have this table OH WAIT this table doesn't have a server because people are doing their side work at this table, in front of people, while the place is open for another 5 hours (and when this girl was made to move oh boy did we customers know it because she was not happy!).  I don't know about you, but when I waited tables I would have gotten my butt handed to me if I did my side work in front of guests.  Oh and they were sweeping the floors too, while people are eating.  At 10pm when they are open until 2am.  Pretty sure the floor will get dirty again, and that was just gross.And they had a live band going, way too loud, for a place that seems a little small inside.  I couldn't figure out if they were going for a Broadway-style honky tonk, a chill bourbon bar, a family dining establishment, or some awful amalgamation of all that, but the result was bad.  We had one drink and left.  And despite the beautiful outdoor space they have for the warmer months, I won't be back here.  I will literally turn ddown birthday party invitations if they would take me hear.  I'm better off hitting up Frugal McDougal's next door, at least I'll get the bourbon I want and know what I'm paying for it.

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: I like this place! Some logistical matters were a little, er..., rough... but the food is delicious. The first time we came, my boyf and I showed up on a weekend night and it was PACKED. The "seat yourself" method was very awkward, as the lobby soon filled up with people waiting and it seemed weirdly competitive to stalk tables down. Luckily we got one! Service was a little slow with drinks, but we liked it. We came again a few weeks later and it was pretty empty! (~8:30 pm on a weeknight) We grabbed a booth only to realize that some sort of liquid was dripping from the ceiling (and onto my head). My butt had sat down right in it too! But no matter, our waiter was really nice and attentive and the food was yummy. Menu highlights: +Sweet potato fries! You get so many!!+Cuban burger is deliciousPour house, I would love to love you, just maybe have a host seating people when it's busy and maybe fix your leaky ceiling and I'll be there ALL THE TIME K THX

reviews.name: Latina D.
reviews.review: Waited 15 minutes to get seated, about 20 minutes to have a waitress notice us. Her response was "we should just grab someone". Finally got a beer, it was very warm, so they did do the right thing and take it off our bill. The waitress was nice nd attentive after we finally got r her attention. Burger wa s good, fries were cold. The service was sub par and the wait was ridiculous for as slow as it was. Don't feel I could recommend.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: The service is terrible. I went with a small group of friends on a Saturday night. Thinking it would be busy we made reservations. Didn't seem they were necessary because the restaurant wasn't very busy. We were immediately shown to a table and given menus. The waitress was prompt, but just that first time. We ordered water so we could look over the menu and huge selection of bourbons. I ordered a drink and some chips and queso. My drink never arrived and our waitress seemed too busy to be bothered with us. She eventually came back to take entre orders, but still no drink. They brought the wrong appetizer then a few minutes later chips and queso came out. A pitifully small portion for $6.00. The waitress disappeared and eventually our burgers came out. Burgers and sides were delicious. That's why they get 2 stars instead of one. But waitress was missing. We probably would have ordered more drinks had the waitress 1) brought the first drink we ordered or 2) asked. This place is in a great location and has a wonderful patio and the burgers are great. If they have such terrible service when the place is half empty what is it like when its packed?

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: There were some major ups and downs during our visit.  To start, they'll valet your car but ask that you seat yourself.  I would much rather have a hostess than a valet attendant.  We found a table over in the male dominated corner. Turns out a bunch of fire fighters decided to roll in for beer and shots. There was also another huge group in the back booths. Because of this the kitchen and wait staff were experiencing some major delays.Even so, the wait staff tried to be as attentive as possible. Our waiter even tagged in another server when he became overwhelmed trying to close out the group of 20+.For the good, I ordered the buffalo chicken sliders and they were tasty.  The beer breaded mushrooms were good, but very breaded and a little oily. You get a slider or burger and one side.  My meal cost $7.00.  For that price, I was satisfied.  You should know that you only get two sliders, not three.  We also ordered the fried cheese. You get three large wedges, two of the three were packed with cheese.  My only qualm is that I wish they gave you more than a drizzle of marinara sauce. The beer list is quite extensive and somewhat impressive. The Atwater Vanilla Java Porter was delicious! I also had a Napa Smith Amber Ale.For the weird, customers stole every last one of their bourbon menus. When I asked about the bourbon our waiter said the list was just way too long to recreate from memory (understandable). Because of this I stuck with beer. This was 1. disappointing, they are a bourbon place and 2. totally weird. (Not the waiter's fault)  The management needs to print off another 100 menus, go to Kinko's and laminate it. I don't care if they need to do it every morning, it's an integral component of a diner's experience.  Overall I would go back.  I'm aware that a new restaurant needs to work out the kinks so they are getting a little extra leeway. If they still have these problems six months out I'm not going to be as understanding.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: Oh Pour House, you cause me to have conflicting feelings about you.  Hopefully you can make me fall in love with you next time...We came for a little ladies night action and, at first, snagged a high-top table that was built around a huge square supporting pole (? can it be called a pole if it is square?  Oh well, you know what I mean).  So if someone was sitting across from you, you couldn't even see them, just a huge piece of wood.  However, they let us move to a large booth in the back beside the stage. Well, the reason no one was sitting there was because there was a leak, so the entire time I was getting hit in the head, face, lap, etc with drips of water.  Whatever, the place was packed and we decided to just go with it anyway.  When we told our waiter, just so he knew, he said "it's leaking AGAIN?"  I thought they just built this mo fo?  Anyway, we ordered drinks from our first table that hadn't showed up yet, so we ordered more from our new waiter.  Drip.  Drip.  Drip.  Tick tock tick tock.  It took AT LEAST 30 minutes to get our drinks.  I know the place was packed out but dayum, it is VERY IMPORTANT TO GET THE DRINKS OUT FAST.  It helps people not be irritated with how long everything else is taking.The menu is great - all types of burgers are available including veggie, turkey, lamb, and I think i saw chicken.  Plus a few sides to choose from.  They also apparently have bourbon but they didn't have the menu on the table and the waiter didn't seem very much like he wanted to find one, so he just suggested some.  I ordered a lamb burger that comes with feta cheese, cucumbers, yogurt sauce, etc.  I was hoping that if it came even close to Hubert Keller's lamb burger at The Burger Bar it would be worth it.Drip drip drip tick tock tick tock....order 2 more drinks at one time....tick tock.So FINALLY after a really long wait the food starts coming out.  He declares he has a veggie burger and a bleu cheese burger.  No one at the table orders a bleu cheese burger.  So he disappears.  The burger sits there.  Other people's food randomly comes out by other waiters.  No sign of the guy finding out about the burger.  He just disappeared.  I took a good close look at it and realized it was MY LAMB burger, not a bleu cheese burger, WTF?!  So I started eating it, too bad it had already gotten cold.  When the waiter came back I just told him hey, that was the lamb burger and he stared and then said "oh good".  He wasn't checking on it, he totally forgot.So in his defense, it was packed out, it seemed that the bar and the kitchen were waaaay backed up and no one was able to keep up.  He was apologetic and seemed as though he was going to snap and run out the door at any minute.  Probably still new enough to have some kinks with all this stuff.  But you have GOT to know the food and you have GOT to get the drinks out FASTER than that!  Anyway, the lamb burger, despite being cold, was pretty good - a middle Eastern type flavor that is one of my faves.   I also liked the fries pretty well.  I definitely want to go back and try some of the other burgers.  But I am going to go on a Wednesday or something at some off time so that the service can be less frantic and forgetful and sllooooooooowwwwww.  3 stars because the food was A-OK and I hope that the other issues will get better.  Plus they have a kick ass patio for summer months, so I am SURE I'll be back for that.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: Lots of buger choices, I've been here a few times and was expecting more. They have live music sometimes which is fun, but loud while you're eating dinner. They have valet parking because otherwise that can be tricky in that area.

reviews.name: Charlene B.
reviews.review: We have been several times for either drinks or food and drinks since out first visit in September, and each time has been great.   The food has been consistent and always so tasty.  We have now tried 6 burgers total: Bleu Cheese, Big South, Cuban, Mushroom Gouda, Cap Portabella, and the Turkey...we can't pick a favorite!!  The service (whether at a table or at the bar) has been great.  The staff is very knowledgeable about both the menu and their vast Bourbon menu.  Our last visit we sat at the bar (for our first time at the bar) to watch basketball, and Sonny was a great bartender.  This is officially one of our favorite go-to spots, and is on the list to take our out of town friends on a visit.  We know no matter what they order, it is going to be good!!!

reviews.name: Vicky D.
reviews.review: The food was good when it actually came out. We were seated promptly and our drinks came out in a timely manner, but the food took FOREVER! I really have no idea how long we were waiting before our appetizers came out, and then waited even longer till the entrees. She also forgot to tell us that we got sides with our entrees and had to come back and ask us what we wanted. The waitress didn't seem to have any kind of system of how she took orders so when she brought out food she would just guess who ordered it.  In the end we had 1 person whose food didn't come out and a mystery burger that nobody ordered. The manager came out and apologized to my friend who didn't get her order and said it would be comped, which is good. But then she asked her what side she wanted and she said battered mushrooms, and when her food finally came out they brought her onion rings instead. She didn't bother to correct them because everyone else was already done eating. Decent food but poor service in a weird location.

reviews.name: Alana A.
reviews.review: The spelled the name wrong. It should read poor house. Service was fine but the menu was misleading. When the menu reads homemade chips, you expect homemade chips right?! They were stale, store bought tortilla chips. Do hashtags work on Yelp- #thanksbutnothanks

reviews.name: CC W.
reviews.review: The atmosphere is very nice. Seems like a cool place to go for live music and late night drinks. Our waitress was very friendly and down to earth. Drinks were well made.We all had sliders and enjoyed them except for mildly dry taste, fairly small portions. (two sliders with fries) and high price of $8.50. Full size burgers start at $9 I think.A cinnamon apple sauce was served with the Buffalo Chicken Sliders which happened to be a bit spicy so it was a good dip. My Chicken Tender sliders were good except for the dry part that I already mentioned. Maybe a little bit more of that yummy honey mustard sauce on it would be perfect!

reviews.name: Chris D.
reviews.review: Awful. We had reservations for 10 and only received 3 menus. The staff seemed very rushed and disorganized. 20 minutes after being seated (I'm not exaggerating, I checked the time) a server came by to take our drink order. I ordered the Cuban Sandwich which included a ground pork patty. When I got my food I took a bite and discovered it to be cold and raw inside. Had I ordered a steak I would have been happy but eating a raw pork patty is rather unnerving. I sent my sandwich back, not wanting anything else. The manager told me he had spoken with the chef and the chef assured him eating raw ground pork was perfectly safe. I was too disgusted with my experience to argue by that point. That was a Saturday night. By Monday morning I was doubled over with stomach cramps and vomiting. Vacation officially ruined.

reviews.name: Thomas C.
reviews.review: Great after work spot for Friday night. Great live music and people. The food was good too.

reviews.name: J'Nene M.
reviews.review: My husband and I read the reviews but decided to take a chance anyway. The atmosphere was great!  We sat outside downstairs. Our server Jamie was excellent!!!  I really can't say enough about the service he provided. He was professional, friendly and seemed genuinely interested in ensuring we were happy. The burger was the best we'd had since we've been in TN. It had the old fashioned, fresh taste. Jamie recommended a local beer after finding out what our preferences were, and even brought a sample of another beer for my husband to try out. From beginning to end, our experience at the Pour House couldn't have been better!

reviews.name: Sara M.
reviews.review: If youre looking for a great view of downtown I recommend sitting upstairs . With misting fans and cool breeze, this was probably my favorite summer meal so far. We did not have reservations but the waitress was quick to move tables together and make room. While the food didnt stand out to me (the drinks did) and that is what the PH is known for. Make sure you never park next to Frugal Mcdooguals because they will tow you. There was a girl watching people park there and informing those that got out of their car to move. They have free Valet parking so id suggest that. With free shows on Fridays and Saturdays , this is a great place to spend your weekend with friends.

reviews.name: Kristin L.
reviews.review: Pour house was awesome. A great place to listen to live music. You can stay inside or enjoy the weather outside on the patio. Happy hour was awesome 2 for 1 beers. I didn't get a chance to eat but the good going by us looked delicious! They were handing out free samples of moonshine! Valet is free and easy!

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: There is a bathroom upstairs. It's past the women's room. I just didn't see it. Now there is no reason not to go try this place!i

reviews.name: Sarah B.
reviews.review: Hubby and I had dinner here Saturday when he was craving a good burger.  We had been running errands all afternoon, and the line at The Pharmacy in East Nashville was its typical craziness, so we decided to head home.As we were stopped at the red light on 8th, I looked over at the very interesting looking two story vastness that is The Pour House, and I said a place that large that is obviously a beer garden has got to have a good burger.  I was right.It was early evening, so the garage doors were all up and diners were happily basking in the patio areas and the dining room enjoying a nice breeze.  The hostess promptly seated us at a booth indoors (our preference) where it almost felt like we were outdoors, too.  Cool.The bar opposite our booth is U-shaped, and with the doors up, you feel like you are in a beach town filming a commercial for Margaritaville or something.  The way they have arranged the bar and the display of liquors, the lighting, and the in/out of it all is just cool.We were greeted prompt enough by our server, and since we're not beer people, ordered a tea and a water while we looked over the menu.  I ordered the "Ol South" ($11) burger - OMG.  The thing was like 10 ft tall... it's a Colossal onion ring (and they do mean colossal), topped with a fried green tomato, then a burger topped with pimento cheese, a fried egg, then lettuce and tomato.  No human on earth could stretch their mouth that wide, so I disassembled an enjoyed basically two appetizers with a great onion ring coated in a super yummy beer batter, a good fried green tomato, then a good burger as well.I love the fact that you can opt for sweet potato fries and no additional charge, I've never understand why so many places charge a premium for that.  Their SP fries are good, on the thicker/chewier side as opposed to crunchy.  Our server happily accomodated my request for honey mustard with the SP fries, and it was good, too, - on the balsamic/poppyseed/vinegar feel side, not syrupy sweet.Hubby had a regular bacon cheeseburger with normal fries which he enjoyed as well.  He did not offer me a bite, so that tells you something.Was it the best burger we've ever eaten?  No, but my favorite list of burgers only includes about 3 places in Middle TN.  Was it good?  Yes.  Ditto on the fries.  We really liked the feel of the place... the decor is interesting, booths comfortable, open-air is great.  And it's big.... so the waits are not long and they can handle a lot.  Great stage for live music, so that's a plus, too.There was a huge birthday party near us with tables together for like 20, including three toddlers that entertained us all climbing on the stage... too cute.The offer free valet parking if you need it, we just parked on the street, but good to know.  In short, while I'm not a "beer person," I don't see why so many yelpers are fussing so much about The Pour House. So if you're in the neighborhood, particularly on a pretty afternoon/evening, give them a try.

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: My favorite salad of all time, the buffalo chicken salad!

reviews.name: P. Taylor A.
reviews.review: Bad service. Food was screwed up and nobody cared. Waitress got smart when we told her that she forgot an entire meal. She said that she had us confused, which is perplexing...

reviews.name: Heidi M.
reviews.review: Pretty good! Had a Portobello burger with smoked gouda. Had to dr it up a little bit myself, but turned out great. There deep fried mushrooms could use some work...didn't care for the batter, was a little soggy in parts of the batter. Servers were great!!

reviews.name: Nathan W.
reviews.review: I had high hopes, I really did.  After shopping at Myers we went here on a whim.  I admit that when it comes to burgers I am a snob.  It seems I can't really be pleased, so take my notes here with a grain of salt.  I had the chili cheese burger.  I love chili on a burger, but this seemed to lack flavor.  The cheese wedge appetizer seemed a bit grainy in texture and the marinara was not bright and acidic as it should have been to cut the heaviness of the cheese.  Service was pretty good though, and for a weekday lunch I will say we didn't wait long for our food.  One of my dining mates had the cuban burger and he enjoyed it a great deal.  I believe in second chances, so I will go back again another day (this time I will have beer) and I hope that i will enjoy it more then.

reviews.name: Catherine D.
reviews.review: I went last Monday for the first time. There was a private buffet event downstairs, but no sign to say that, so I just walked in and stood by the host's table waiting for service until one of the guests finally told me that he thought they were serving food upstairs. Even though it was a chilly night, the only place we could get seating was outside. It took them 20 minutes to seat us. And then another 20 minutes just to get our drink orders. By this time it had already crossed my mind several times to just leave.When they took our orders, it turned out that they were out of some of the most basic things like ceasar salad. It took them another 30 minutes to bring out half of our table's food and the other half did not get their food until our half had finished eating our food.I would never go back to this place, even though it's only 4 minutes from my apartment, to me, it might as well not exist.

reviews.name: Diana S.
reviews.review: Went around 10pm on Saturday so it was already very crowded. I was surprised to hear the people in front of mention that they had reservations. They had a crowd of about 10 people, but this place did not seem like one you would make reservations for, or one that would take them. Inside it was crowded and there was a loud, mediocre band so we went upstairs and sat at the patio bar. It was a nice night, so it was pleasant sitting under the fan. Was really feeling like a frozen drink to accompany the warm night, but was informed they don't make them. The margarita on the rocks was typical mix margarita, but it packed a punch. The turkey burger was decent; the side of fries was small. The whole thing looked like someone had pitched it into the basket from a distance. Still - hadn't eaten lunch, so it hit the spot and soaked up the tequila.To me, The Pour House is a place to go for Happy Hour with a large group, like your softball team. You can get a small group in other places that are nicer with better food. The music was a bit on the metal side, but wasn't too loud to talk over. Also, I feel like their booze menu is best suited to fall or winter, since it is all about bourbon and whiskey, which seem like cool weather liquors. Of course, I'm not a great judge since I don't drink bourbon. Can't stand it - was the first liquor I ever drank and, well, you know how that story ends.

reviews.name: Liss S.
reviews.review: Went with friends for dinner and were sat in the bar area. The bartenders were our servers and they were very attentive. The bean burger was the best I have ever had but it was spicy so make sure you like that kind of thing. The jalapeno macaroni and cheese was excellent. The fried green tomatoes were very good. Friends had other specialty burgers and they enjoyed them as well! There is a lot to choose from food and drink wise! Would definitely recommend!

reviews.name: Jenna H.
reviews.review: I would recommend greeting people when they walk in the door.... We ended up walking out!

reviews.name: patrick l.
reviews.review: Great selection of bourbon, which is the only thing that can make it pricey...attention to detail can be lacking, though several items are great knoshes...the Cuban...beer selection is in decline, and the overall sexiness has lost it's swagger...great potential, needs more attention...lots of great space and patios...

reviews.name: Wm Z.
reviews.review: Although there is always room for improvement, I did not experience the bad service that others have mentioned in their reviews.  There were 20 or so of us taking up an entire corner of the dining area, and we were provided with two dedicated servers who were all smiles and fast on their feet, almost too fast. If you're slow to respond, they're on to the next person while you make up your mind. I DO NOT see that as a bad thing.Everyone enjoyed the large selection of beers, and I found another stout that I enjoyed. That's always a good thing! Hmmm, am I beginning to sound like a drunk???The fried green tomatoes are good for commercially grown, but could have been more flavorful. The burgers we ate were very good, and all of the deserts were amazing!  The one downside to the menu was the sweet potatoe fries which were soggy and tasteless.  No place gets everything right, right??? When I had originally looked at the prices upon arrival, they seemed high to me, but when we got our cheque, I was shocked that we had drunk 4 beers, had two burgers, an appetizer and a desert, and the total was still under $50 including tip!  AND they hadn't left anything off! They added 20% gratuity to the tab, but earned every penny. We will be going back. .

reviews.name: Chris V.
reviews.review: Is it possible to give a place ZERO stars? Let me start by pointing out that my average rating is often very high and I tend to avoid writing nasty things about local establishments, even when they deserve it. However, my latest experience at Pour House was so abysmal, it is my Yelp Elite duty to share it with you. My first visit to Pour House with Marcia M. earned three stars. I was unimpressed, but willing to give it some time to grow since it was early in their opening. However, it seems things have only gone downhill since that first visit. Last Saturday night, a friend and I were on the hunt for a new atmosphere and casual place to grab a drink before heading out. My friend hadn't yet been to this new place on 8th Avenue and it seemed like a good idea. After having to move our car twice to find an area where it wouldn't be towed, we realized we should have cut our losses then and found a better solution. But, we like to take risks I guess, so we ventured on. Once inside the formaldehyde-smelling restaurant - seriously, this place has an odor that makes me wish I could cuddle up for hours in Red Door's smoke infestation - we found a spot at the bar. There's no drink menu, so the ordering process is kind of a crap shoot - and crap it was! They opened a tab for me and set my debit card in a small cup near the POS. After we choked down our drinks and tried to pretend the smell wasn't giving us a headache, we asked the unfriendly, unhelpful bartender to close our tabs. After a few minutes of her shuffling through the THREE (count 'em, three) cards in the cup, she turned to ask me if she had taken my card. Indeed she did only moments before (Hello, remember?!?! Idiot!).  As she continued to lazily look around the bar area, I did a little research to find that my debit card had been charged another amount. You're following correctly... they closed someone else's tab on my debit card and sent them on their way with it. A result I don't blame the customer, who may have not noticed, for but rather the Einstein's behind the bar. The bartender called her manager over, who was equally as unhelpful and unapologetic. He offered to void the transaction that they charged (UMMM, you think?!?! Duh!!!).  Meanwhile, the at-fault bartender handed me and my friend our ticket for the drinks. Seriously? The manager quickly disappeared into the back and it was up to me to find a solution. I grabbed a piece of paper and pen and wrote my number on it, "call me if the customer comes back in with my card please," I told the bartender. I then took a separate piece of paper, not trusting that she'd actually remember what had happened at all in 5 minutes, and asked to see the manager. He came out from the back and I told him the same thing. He said he'd call if it turned up - although he's done nothing to apologize or even check in. I never heard from them, so I had to close my debit card and sat at home for a week waiting for it to arrive. (Awesome.) And here's the best part: they never voided the transaction - at least not the one they charged to my card. I was expected to pay for another customer's tab? I don't think so. This is single handily the worst experience I've had in Nashville to date, and needless to say, I will not be back. Final note: I understand things happen and mistakes are made, but the way it was handled - not to mention the disgusting food and drink selection - has me hoping this place is gone as quickly as it went up.

reviews.name: Cole S.
