reviews.review: My wife and I joined two other couples here last week.  As others have written, the service was terrible.  I had to ask for a whiskey list three times.  The wrong drinks were brought; the burgers were indeed overcooked, even though I asked for mine to be "on the lower side of medium."  As someone else said, the basics are there for a great place.  The location is good; the layout with the open air feeling is excellent.  The service just mucks it up.  It is like they are making everything up as they go along.  I wanted to want to return, but I just don't.  If they ever get their act together, it will be a nice place for drinks and bar food.Positives: On a bright note, the deep fried pickles and peppers were good, as far as those things go.  Also, our waitress was friendly and wanted to be helpful.  She blamed the bad service on the bar, and to be honest, I think that was legitimate. They just seemed to not know what they were doing back there.

reviews.name: Wade lee j.
reviews.review: 2.5 hours for dinner for a party of 9 without cocktails.Waitress broke into tears twice during dinner (and not from our table we were actually very accommodating)Food was cold, fries soggy, burgers dry...skip it

reviews.name: Angie L.
reviews.review: Like others, I was wondering what they were building for all those months in front of Frugal MacDoogal's. I'm also wondering why more businesses don't put up some kind of "coming soon" sign while they are being built. Before I get too far along, I want to explain my rating. I was torn between 3 and 4 stars. Since they are new (and hopefully improving), I went with a 4, but my rating might have also been inspired a little by the round of Woodford Reserve Four Wood bourbon my friend bought us!A couple of guys in our group do enjoy their bourbons and they were the main reason we ended up here. When we are out, they will order typically want something fancy like Blanton's while I'm happy with Jim Beam or a beer. Everyone in our group likes burgers though, and we agree that the food was good, not the best ever but not bad. My cheeseburger was big and cooked right and the sweet potato fries were tasty. The environment is very nice and the beer and sprits selections are impressive. Didn't take long to get service once we seated ourselves, but we were so loud it was probably hard to ignore us. Prices are reasonable and we think the potential there, especially once the weather is good enough to take advantage of the outdoor seating.

reviews.name: Bret D.
reviews.review: This place has a lot of potential but right now it needs a lot of help.  I want to like it because the atmosphere is great with plenty of outdoor seating but I will not be back unless they fix a couple of issues.  They need to get their heating and cooling system working correctly.  It was 36 degrees outside and about 55 degrees sitting at the bar.  All of the walls have clear roll up garage doors; unfortunately, they leak so you could feel the cold air pouring in.  When they finally turned on the heat, I thought I was going to bake.  The air was blowing so hard that it blew the napkins off the bar.  The bartender told me that one lady that was wearing one coat went out to her car to get a second coat.  It was not a pleasurable experience.Secondly, it took more than 30 minutes to get a turkey burger at lunch when there were no more than 20 patrons in the restaurant.  The server did not bring extra napkins when serving the burger which should be automatic.Thirdly, when I entered, I was grouchily told to "sit wherever you want" by some man who appeared to be a manager.On the positive side:  atmosphere is great, location is great (but limited parking), house potato chips were very good, draft beer selection is fantastic with lots of local brews, turkey burger was good but not great.I will give it another chance in several weeks to see if it gets better.

reviews.name: Ginka P.
reviews.review: Got to try out the new place in the neighborhood for lunch.  Valet parking was great and we were seated by a hostess quickly. The beer selection is the best I've seen in Nashville. Ordered a turkey avocado burger and a portabello burger with fries and fried mushrooms.  Everything was good and a good price.I'm giving it three stars because 1) the service was very slow and it wasn't that busy.  They had a big group and apparently the kitchen can't handle them because it has been mentioned in several reviews.  2) STILL no bourbon menu.  Don't put "bourbon" in your name if you can't even put it on the menu. I really hope they work out the bugs quickly because it looks like a great place to hang out.  There are just too many great options for burgers and beer in Nashville and they won't make it if they stay "marginal".

reviews.name: KC S.
reviews.review: Came here on a Saturday afternoon after doing some shopping next door at Frugal's around 3pm. My husband wanted to check the place out and see what kind of beer selection they had. The tap selection was decent and the bottle selection was decent as well. They had some unique beers like Lucky Bastard by Stone. I had a glass of wine, which was again decent. Since it was the middle of the afternoon we just wanted something light to munch on. We ordered the sweet potato fires and fried mushrooms. Those two things took over 20 minutes to get out. Seriously 20 minutes for two fried sides?! They were alright but not outstanding. If it took over 20 minutes for our sides to come out on a Saturday afternoon. I wouldn't want to be ordering food on a Friday or Saturday night.

reviews.name: Stacy B.
reviews.review: Three bean veggie burger is homemade and delicious!  It is a nice change from the more typical veggie burgers.  Fries were really tasty..not greasy.  Great lunch!

reviews.name: Tyler T.
reviews.review: Both beers we tried were flat. The food is just bar food and nothing special. Service was ok...I guess I'm just disappointed because this place could be awesome with the huge patio on both levels.

reviews.name: Justin J.
reviews.review: Great place!

reviews.name: Heather J.
reviews.review: Terrible service. My husband and I have been here several times and had a satisfactory experience. Recently, we stopped by early on a Friday afternoon (around three). The sign said "Seat Yourself". Even though there were other patrons outside; it was a little too hot.  So, we opted for inside.  It seemed there was only one waitress and one bartender on duty.  We waited, and waited and waited.  We made eye contact with the bartender a few times, but he was busy talking to other patrons.  Finally, after twenty minutes; we had enough.  We walked out right past the bartender who looked at us and smiled and didn't say a word as we walked out the door.  There were plenty of opportunities for someone to say "we'll be with you in a minute", or "sorry for the wait".  We will not come back.  There are too many other good places to eat in Nashville.

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: I liked it! Went late on a Saturday afternoon to avoid the rush. Parked on the street. Found two seats at the bar and ordered a beer I'd never heard of. It was good, so I was off to a great start. We ordered two different burgers to share - the Cuban and the Lamburger. Preferred the Cuban - the other was just a little too subtle. The buns on the burgers were perfect. Sturdy enough to hold the burger, but soft enough that they did not overwhelm. We had onion rings and house-made chips for the sides. Both good. Nothing to write home about, though. They should include some kind of dipping sauce - that would kick it up a notch. I agree with others that there should be a bourbon menu. It's too hard to squint up at the bottles and try to figure out what is what. Plus, I'd like some indication of cost. Service was very friendly and prompt. There were a few people working behind the bar, but they did not have any trouble keep straight what we were drinking and they came around when we needed them. Overall, it was a good experience. I'll be back.

reviews.name: Chris R.
reviews.review: I wanted to really like this place. The outside looks incredible, and with all of the patio space and garage doors, the vibe could be great once things warm up a little more. I had my first dinner and drink there tonight with some friends - here's my take away:The place wasn't packed; there were open tables, but service was slow and disorganized. On average, we didn't see our server for 20 minutes at a time. In fact, someone else delivered our food each time - appetizer, entrees, and dessert. All but one of us received the wrong drink altogether at least once. Several of the items that we tried ordering were not available, but the server wasn't proactive about helping us choose an alternative - instead we volleyed until something was available.The food was just ok. The fries, both the regular and sweet potato, looked more like home-style hash browns, but obviously weren't and were instead just poor food preparation. The sliders - meh. Positives: The appetizer came out quickly and hot. Valet returned my car in one piece so that I could leave.I probably won't return unless I hear multiple reports that things have changed. I don't think I can chock up tonights experience to growing pains. I've rated 2-stars instead of 1 because so far I haven't gotten sick. Sorry guys...

reviews.name: erin s.
reviews.review: Got the buffalo chicken sliders with fries and a lagunitas.  Very good food, cold beer, great atmosphere!  Went on a Wednesday afternoon so it was empty.

reviews.name: Luke K.
reviews.review: I didn't come in with incredibly high expectations and ended up pleasantly surprised.  We had a nice waitress.  The beer list and whiskey lists are long for the connoisseurs.  I ended up with a chili burger with jalapenos.  Quite delicious.  They served the chili on the side which was a nice touch so I could control how much I put on the burger, without causing too much mess.It was a nice open space to eat and drink on a Saturday afternoon.   Probably not at the top of my list for a repeat but I could definitely see myself heading there with a group to hang out.

reviews.name: Melanie V.
reviews.review: I liked this place the first couple times I went, but after today I'll probably never go back! You go in and they have a huge sign that says "Seat Yourself," so we did. 15 mins later, NO SERVICE! Waitress after waitress walked right by and looked directly at us and nobody bothered to ask us if we had been helped, bring us menus or anything! That is the epitome of rude and poor service, or shall I say POUR service.

reviews.name: Bro M.
reviews.review: Chips and blue cheese were amazing! All 6 of us ordered the Big South burger - which is a burger on a fried green tomato and finished with a fried egg on top.  Don't forget to ask for their southern ketchup which comes with the sweet potato fries, has a sweet spice to it.  Only complaint was there was no live music yet and it was around 8:30 on a Friday night. Great Whisky selection too!

reviews.name: Dave H.
reviews.review: I've visited Pour House about 3-4 times now. The first visit was a day after they opened and funny enough, it was the best service. Since, the waiters have never been very friendly or good at their job. Definitely not knowledgable about their own menu. Also, the last time I went, the waitress must of thought my undeserved 20% tip was not enough because when I looked online, they had charged me $2.00 more than my clearly noted total. It's not a lot of money, but you just can't do that. I gave this place several chances. I won't be back.

reviews.name: Robby H.
reviews.review: Excellent music for the Sunday brunch. Great menu. I tried the steak & eggs, perfectly cooked. I had the chicken-fried sandwich. It had chorizo bacon, smoked Gouda, and a fried egg on top. Wonderful food and very good live music. Perfect brunch spot.

reviews.name: Denise R.
reviews.review: First of all,  let me say that i like the decor!     I've been here twice and both times the food has been cooked to perfection,  Both times i came for lunch during work hours so i never could order the drinks.  The first time i tried the turkey burger.  After 3 failed attempts to get my order right ( no butter or cheeese), it came out perfect. and the fries were delicious.  The second time i came, i tried the meatball sliders.  You get two and they have roasted red peppers on top and a marinara sauce.  I loved them.  ALso ordered the fried pickles on the first visit and they were good. So  i love the fact that the food is simple and good.   The servers were nice and attentive.The only negative to me was the fact that you could not park in the restaurant parking lot without using their valet service.   I prefer a choice..  This is mandatory valet parking which is weird.    They take your car and park it  ten feet away ,,  um  thanks.. couldn't park that on my own.. thank God there is a valet to swing that.   IS this not backwards?  Valet for inside the parking lot  and then you hike a mile on your own if you choose not to valet cause you sure aren't allowed to use the restaurant's parking lot. So i always ask myself , would i eat here again or have a drink?   yes!

reviews.name: Chuck V.
reviews.review: This place is great, especially for one only open for a few months.  I've experienced nothing but friendly and accommodating wait/bar staff, great valet guys, and a fun atmosphere. Also, if you haven't been to the upstairs bar, it's got a great little vibe to it separate from the main restaurant (although it only has a limited food and drink menu, its still more than many places) and looks out over downtown.1. As for parking complaints - I don't get it.  Parking is a premium around there, many of the other establishments DO tow around there (I've witnessed it twice now), and so you pay a buck or two to know your car won't be towed, and you're dropped off at the door - nice I say. You can still try and park w/o valet - good luck, seems silly and risky to me.2. They DO have drink menus, including all bourbons, etc.  If you don't see one - ASK, I'm sure they will oblige. Like any restaurant, even the products they purchase are discontinued or changing constantly, so there may be a few items listed no longer available, and some not listed - big deal.3. I've personally never had any issue with the food being cooked properly, but it is concerning that it has apparently happened, but I do believe this place would work endlessly to make sure all is sorted out. As for pre-cooking and pre-preparing food...I don't believe that at all, my food has never been there "too fast", but always seems just about the right time, and was always fresh and hot.You know, there are many places I love where I've had bad experiences on the off occasion: it's a fluid entity with lots of separate moving parts, and it is impossible to protect and cover them all.  From working at some of the nicest restaurants and bars in Nashville and Chicago, and having many friends who are servers, bartenders, owners, etc., I can tell you this place is doing great for being open for just over 4 months now, and it is getting better each time I go. Summertime there is going to be superb fun with all the outdoor bars and seating they have.  Go with some friends and relax and have a good time. Anything that can go wrong will in all likelihood be minor, and eagerly fixed by the owners, managers, and employees.For anyone complaining about wrong credit card authorizations, etc, it happens, all the time, and many times the people calling to complain are not forthcoming or have no memory of what they had because they forgot to keep a receipt or can't remember - talk to any bar owner - and FYI I just had a drunk guy grab my tab and tip for me and sign for me the other night when I went to the restroom, so crap happens - the management sorted it out ASAP, no questions asked. Good people over there.

reviews.name: Samma A.
reviews.review: Be aware in the restroom of the horned steer watching over the big ceramic sinks while freshening your hands. Like the rest of the place bathroom time is a designed experience. This, the 28 mostly craft brews on tap and the additional collection of bottled beers make this the neatest place for ale in the gulch. Bearwalker maple syrup beer and Thunder Ann pale ale from Jackalope are fresh brews at the Pour House. Other craft beers from Nashville and beyond are also poured there. Bourbon sippers will find all their basic  whiskeys although this is more of a brew bar than a cocktail lounge. Lambburgers from the grill are good and tasty with a variety of gourmet toppings and sides. Upstairs the deck bar gives a cool view of the gulch condos and the towers of the historic train station beyond.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere, although a little noisy on cold days when the several overhead doors are closed. Food was great with good selection. Unique bourbon ketchup was good

reviews.name: RJ B.
reviews.review: I've been here a couple of times and always had a good experience. Probably not the kind of place I'd take a date or go "out for dinner," but it's a dynamite stop for a couple pints and some solid pub food. It's a nice, open space with lots of natural light during the day and a warm, lively feel in the evenings. I can't speak to the whole menu because I've eaten a burger both times (reasonably priced, great size, and good flavor), though what I've had has been really tasty.  The fried pickles and peppers put a spicy twist on a Nashville staple!  The beer selection is nothing special, but it's fine -- the bourbon flights are the real deal. Parking can be kind of a pain on busy nights and there's valet available if you don't want to deal with it.

reviews.name: Zoraida K.
reviews.review: OK, I have been looking for a good burger place. I live near Burger Up, Athens, and M.L. Rose and while I have eaten at all of them more than once and some more than a hundred and once (Athens), So my first experience went like this...7 pm on a Friday, I chose to sit at the bar in order to get "quicker' service. I wanted to be impressed and delighted....10 minutes later I was finally asked if I wanted a drink.I made another mistake and ordered the Turkey/Avocodo Burger, came highly recommended, but it came very over cooked and the fries were cool. There were two ladies sitting next to us that introduced themselves and asked how we liked it and if we had been there before. Turns out that one of them was the wife of one of/ the owners. We found that out about 30 secs before I had to kill a bug crawling on my plate. OK it was a small bug, about the size of a gnat, but he didn't try to fly away either. These ladies saw the whole thing and asked if I needed a "new plate". I also did not have my drink refilled in a timely manner.Tonight I gave them a second chance. We went earlier 5.45pm on a Saturday. Started off rocky with a 10 minute wait at the hostess stand without so much as a recognition, with only 60% of the tables seated. We were finally acknowledged and seated but our 3rd person had to literally park a 1/2 mile away due to the poor parking availability. Thankfully, the food was MUCH better this time. I even stepped out and ordered something way out of the ordinary, the Big South, it had a fried egg, an onion ring, and even some pimento cheese. It was delicious, cooked perfectly, though the sweet potato fries were cool again. : (I know they are a whiskey kind of place, so I asked for a drink menu, the don't have one, I asked for their best selling drink which contains a good whiskey but not just straight up, the waitress didn't have any suggestions. I will go again, probably for lunch since the dinner environment is all that, and hopefully get better service (with warm fries), and skip the alcohol, since the whiskey sour was nothing to write home about and weak, and the Jack and Coke tasted like it contained Diet Coke, and that is a "bar foul".

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: This establishment is close to our home...so off we went for dinner. The parking was easy with valet. Yet as stated in prior reviews, the seating was a bit to be desired..no hostess and seat yourself. We arrived to a nearly empty establishment and still waited several minutes for anyone to notice that we had not been offered water. Our waitress was not familiar with the items on the menu and she was not attentive. We ordered burgers, cheeseburger, blue cheese burger and three bean burger. My burger was dry and overcooked. Yet, the three bean burger was outstanding and melted in my mouth. Our daughter loved the cheeseburger and sweet potato fries. The atmosphere was great. (The heating regulated ). We had the fried cheese as an app...yummie and tasty. Overall I do hope that the service improves. Maybe they will soon have a hostess and the wait staff develop over time. I will give  them another try in a month or so. I hope they improve.

reviews.name: James B.
reviews.review: Nice selection of beers, good atmosphere and good service. Try the Cuban sandwich if you're burned out on hamburgers.

reviews.name: Christopher W.
reviews.review: Perfect place to go for a casual, affordable meal. I sat at the bar with a buddy... friendly, attentive bartenders, simple menu filled with classic dishes and a great bourbon selection. Ordered the Cuban burger which was really good... I was impressed, I'll definitely be back.

reviews.name: Timothy L.
reviews.review: When I bite into a burger at Pour House, I get the sensation I'm at a pee-wee sporting event and just ordered a burger from the concessions.  You know, the thin, frozen patties that are only prepared well done.  I should've known better than to expect anything great when I'm not asked how I would like to have my burger prepared.  The only thing more disappointing than the burger, was the service.  The restaurant wasn't busy and it took far too long for our server to finally arrive.  We were told by 3 other servers while waiting that our server would be right with us....how about you get the drink order from us while our server is doing whatever they're doing.  Especially considering we were sitting in the sun outside on the patio, I mean at least bring some waters or something.  While the bourbon selection was impressive, I wish they would've put equal care in selecting their meat for the burgers.  Had the battered mushrooms for a side and wasn't thrilled with them either, especially with the creamy horseradish for the side dipping sauce with them, just a bad combination.  Unless someone else is paying for me next time, i'm not gonna make much of an effort to come back again.

reviews.name: Meitra A.
reviews.review: Major disappointment.  We went for dinner last night and thoroughly regretted the decision.  It is a loud restaurant.  The burgers were bland, and the sweet potato fries were cold.  Our daughter ordered the blondie dessert, and it came out practically uncooked.  The only redeeming quality is that the wait staff worked to resolve the dessert calamity and didn't charge us for it.  I suspect the kitchen is trying to pre-cook orders because our food arrived almost too quickly for it to have been lovingly prepared.  Lacked salt and flavor.  We have way too many great restaurants and bars in Nashville that offer a similar format, I can't imagine why anyone would waste an outing on this place.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: Rude hostesses (when they made an appearance) and apparently an hour and a half wait (with no one waiting)... for what? Overrated, imho.

reviews.name: Kathe G.
reviews.review: Burgers are awesome And so are the brews! But one thing that stands out to me is the fact that they have complimentary valet parking but NO hostess! We sat ourselves and no one noticed us for quite some time. Seems odd to be greeted so well and then to be let down once in the door.They didn't have their beer flights which was disappointing. Take it off the menu if you don't ever plan on getting them back. I have been there twice now and both times they weren't offered. Management seems a little off here....LOOKS like an awesome place with a really sweet city line view. But once inside it's pretty disappointing based on service alone. Get with it guys! I would MAYBE consider giving it another try...only if its busy downtown and it's my only overflow option....

reviews.name: Z K.
reviews.review: I don't eat beef or pork.  So, I'm always looking for places that offer options.  I tried the turkey burger.  It was fantastic.  My friend had some kind of salad with grilled chicken that looked good.  I did not ask to try it as I was afraid they might want to try my sandwich that I did not want to share.  I will definitely eat here again.

reviews.name: David L.
reviews.review: My wife made me go and I wasn't in the mood for Friday Night Band and all that, but I gotta say, it was pretty fun and the food was pretty good.  The wait staff came around often to see if we needed more drinks and I left happy that we checked it out.  I would recommend trying it.  Parking is a pain and yeah, it might be a little pricey, but hey, how much does drive thru at the Burger Chain cost now days?

reviews.name: Patrick S.
reviews.review: Seriously this place should have the kinks worked out by now. If you tell people you carry bourbon at least have a menu to choose from.If you tell people you are a burger place, you better have a good burger. The open air concept is awesome, but everything else about the place is not. Burger was bland, bun was soggy, fries were small and cooked into a shriveled hard mass. The beer was flat and the waitress had no idea what bourbon they had. It took us 45 minutes to get our food and the waitress checked on us a total of 2 times. If these folks could make a good burger, with grass fed, local beef, hire some better staff and get a list of what they carry, this would be a great place. Unfortunately I see all these other bad reviews and I realize that probably won't happen. Good luck guys!

reviews.name: Brad M.
reviews.review: So pleasantly surprised at our find!  While running errands in Nashville, bad traffic took us off the interstate and by the Pour House. As we passed we decided to give it a try. When trying a new place my wife and I like to try as much as possible so we get an appetizer, split an entree and then get a desert. We started with the fried green tomatoes and mozzarella. Absolutely wonderful!  For an entree we split the Buffalo sliders. Great buffalo sauce!!  Kind of sweet but finishes with a nice kick. Chicken was lightly breaded and tender and the fries were great. To finish off, we had the bourbon chocolate cake and ice cream. Wow!  Fabulous and you could really taste the bourbon. Our server, wish I could remember her name and the receipt only says "bar", was excellent and quick to answer our questions and make suggestions. They have a fabulous selection of draft beers and over 200 boubons. The ambiance is great and would be a cool place to just hang out with friends. It also appears that they have live music there as well. The entire experience was great and we will gladly drive the 30 minutes to return in the near future!!

reviews.name: Mal S.
reviews.review: Stopped by last Friday night (27 June) and did the usual Valet parking. I highly suggest this. Parking in this area is not so easy, just let their valet's do this for you. I was bringing some friends down this night. It's not my first time here so I was kind of the tourist guide on this night. I have to say, that as usual the food was awesome, and the staff did a heck of a great job. My only disappointment of the evening was the fact that they dropped the Lamb Burger from their menu. I decided to go with their Cuban Burger and I think I just found my new favorite. My friends had the Black and Blue Burger and the Portobello Cap Burger, they were both equally impressed. Beer and Bourbon selection as always is impressive. The drink specials and live music are a plus. If you do get the chance, the rooftop seating is a great way to go especially when the weather is nice. The only drawback is that some food and drink items are not available in this seating area, so ask what's available before ordering.

reviews.name: Kendra C.
reviews.review: I was very excited about trying this out but I was v. disappointed.    My salad was OK, but my friend's burger, which was supposed to have pepperjack and japalenos, was as bland as white bread.  The lamb burger another friend ordered was sent back because it was overcooked and didn't even taste like lamb, The second burger came out undercooked and raw.The kitchen delivered the food to the wrong table, actually putting the food on the table and then having to pick it up and brought it to our table.We had a young, inexperienced waiter, which happens and we didn't penalize him for being new, but it added to a frustrated evening as we waited too long for our checks.  And a server at a Bourbon house should know what a water back is. A list of bourbons with the prices is needed.I don't know how that kitchen and wait staff will be able to accomodate the whole place once the warm weather starts and the patios are open.  They could barely handle the crowd they had.

reviews.name: Jason H.
reviews.review: Don't believe the brunch sign, the brunch menu is LIMITED to put it mildly.  We went for brunch, but do to the limited menu we ended up having lunch.  The Cuban sandwich is awesome but my wife's burger and both our sides were average, especially for the price.  Good drinks though and they have a bourbon sampler if that is your thing.

reviews.name: Mark W.
reviews.review: I really wanted to like this place.  BUT, I cannot.It was a Saturday after noon, about 1:45.  There was a nice crowd...trendy, looked like  a young musician's crowd.  The wait staff all looked scared, or worn out,  or like they just didn't care, I couldn't tell which. ...very few smiles and welcoming glances.There were 3 of us, and we each ordered iced tea.  Again, there must have been some kind of ice shortage because we got glasses of yesterday's  tea poured right from the pitcher that had been standing on the wait station for the last 15 minutes, I'd bet.There was a Caesar salad with way too much dressing.The onion rings were battered in bland pancake batter and cold  and  over-priced for 5 rings.The Cuban burger was like eating a flattened tennis ball (previously frozen pork patty would be my guess,) and about as tasty.The sweet potato fries were unexciting and not as good as the ones at White Castle---yes  I have eaten at White Castle on a late night or two.The chili was acceptable, but not a reason to return.I can't imagine this place with live music....you'd never be able to talk across the table.  But then again, that crowd isn't there for the food either.

reviews.name: Billy F.
reviews.review: We had been meaning to get over here since they opened, we finally checked it out this past weekend. The overall look and feel of this place screams the Gulch neighborhood..Good selection of Beers and Bourbon..The Apps were solid..Had Fried Cheese-Fried Green Tomatoes and Fried Pickles and Peppers...Yes everything fried, but nothing over battered..everything felt light. The Burger I ordered was very fresh but when I ordered a Chili Burger, I was surprised to see the chili on the side..it may have been a server mishap, but thats another story.. Thats my only beef with this place..We sat on the Patio (With no Fans on... 90 degree day), but thats where most people were..there were zero people on the 2nd floor and maybe 3 tables inside...so overall it was not that busy, but a nice crowd on the patio...It was as if our waitress just was overwhelmed. She lacked urgency and we waited for just about everything...She messed up a couple of our side item choices, but we didn't even say anything because we didn't see her much and were hungry..all in all..Good Food from what i can see, but possibly working through service kinks in the Front of the House

reviews.name: Staci V.
reviews.review: It should not be difficult to cook burgers as ordered and serve as they are described on the menu....but this did not happen.  Appetizer was not cooked, burger was raw in the center, dressing (tomato, lettuce, pickle) not included with burger.....

reviews.name: Katie S.
reviews.review: Truly no complaints first time around. Great service. Good food. Awesome beer selection. And they have a whiskey room. Can't beat it. Excited for warmer weather & their outdoor seating.

reviews.name: Cy B.
reviews.review: Don't understand the previous comments about having no drink menu?? I was just there Friday and they DO have drink menus.  Every beer listed, every bourbon listed. And those are long lists.  On menus.  On the tables.  We had a group of around 20 and had very attentive service.  Our server was more than happy to split all those tabs and did so correctly with no issues.   The food was very good (awesome homemade potato chips!) and our entire party loved the atmosphere and agreed it's a great bar.   As far as the valet situation, I don't know why this is considered a negative... fork over two bucks for a tip and relax and be glad you don't have to worry about it.  We really enjoyed The Pour House and will be back.

reviews.name: Kenneth M.
reviews.review: good food - crap service!!!

reviews.name: Bike B.
reviews.review: HOLY HIPSTER BATMAN!!!  This place sucks. I have been to this establishment twice now and am confident it will not be open next Christmas. Considering it is a so called " Bourbon House" you'd think they'd have a whiskey menu. I've been twice and have yet to see one. The snail like hipsters laze about like sloths in trees distractedly taking orders as if your happiness as a customer is an insult to their pseudo artistic taste. The first time I ate there my burger was undercooked cold and pink had to send it back twice and they kept sending the same mashed up burger back. The second time I ate here I ordered my burger well done just in hopes they'd be able to cook the only item they basically serve. Nope it was pink and cold. This tells me the cook doesn't even bother to try and get the cook right on the burger. This restaurant is obviously owned and operated by someone with zero experience. They put more effort on the look and feel of the place than the food and service. Anyone with any restaurant experience knows better.

reviews.name: Bernard L.
reviews.review: Le Peep was le good. It wasn't tres fancy, but if you are looking for le French, then look l'elsewhere. This is le American as it gets. I went with a party of 7, and Le Peep le delivered on their promise of le food and le drinks. The one thing I found le funny was that when you first enter Le Peep, there was a note on the door saying that due to avian bird flu, egg prices have increased. I find that le weird. When I eat le eggs, I don't want to think about bird flu. But alas, I soon forgot as I entered and sat down. The service was incredibly friendly, and the food came out pretty fast. It was also served nicely and tasted good for a solid breakfast. If you're looking for a solid breakfast spot, Le Peep is where it's at. Don't go le elsewhere.

reviews.name: Kristina W.
reviews.review: Second time here. First time was years ago and we had such a bad experience we didn't come back. We decided on a weekday brunch, so why not give it another shot?On a Friday about 10:30 there wasn't a wait, so we sat right down. They serve water in carafes with lemons. Asked for one without lemon and hope that's what's received. I like the carafes on the table but wish the cups were bigger!!! The menu is too big. And it tries to be clever, which it really isn't. With so many choices I can't decide or second guess myself. I settled on the migas which were basically egg and cheese goodness cooked with crunchy tortilla chips and served with beans. The actual entree was great but the beans were cold and the server no where to be found. Also had a side of potatoes and dang that was a lot of salt. We both had a hard time eating the potatoes. I would give it another try and just know to expect so-so service and avoid the potatoes.

reviews.name: Gabriel B.
reviews.review: Went here a few times. Food was good but I was charged $10 for a strawberry fields shake. I don't know what made me pay that much but I did and later in the day I called back and asked for the price of the shake and it was around $3. The person over the phone said that it was a new employee mistake and that she would give me two free shakes next time I went in. I went back a few weeks later and got a free shake from them. They are still on top a few bucks but I just wanted to let you guys know to make sure you check your bill.

reviews.name: Rosanah F.
reviews.review: Great breakfast and service.  Best Eggs Benedict I have ever had. We were seated very quickly.

reviews.name: Linda L.
reviews.review: This is a great little restaurant service was great the food was good like the fact they have more then just pork to choose from as a breakfast meat

reviews.name: Robert N.
reviews.review: First of all the stuffed French toast is great , definitely get that if your a French toast person . Otherwise the food is pretty good , nothing out of this world , but everything was cooked well and tasted well . Fresh OJ and a good coffee taste great as well. Good place to grab brunch in the area .

reviews.name: Mark M.
reviews.review: Decent brunch place. Have been to le peep elsewhere. Decent skillet breakfast. Kid friendly and they gobbled the chocolate chip pancakes.

reviews.name: Linda A.
reviews.review: Just OK.  I had this place bookmarked for a long time, but I don't get out that way at that time very much.  Hubby and I had lunch here last week.  I had the California Turkey sandwich.  It was supposed to be on flatbread but it was more like a really doughy pita.  I unwrapped the sandwich and ate the filling only after one bite of the "flatbread".  The salad that accompanied was fine, it was a salad.  My husband had more of a breakfast choice but it couldn't have been too great because he made no comment about it.  He did ask the server about the peasant potatoes that are all over the menu.  She said, "They come frozen in a bag and we add some...."  I'm not sure what she said because when it starts with "frozen in a bag", we both tuned out.  I thought with a name like Le Peep, this would be a cute, French style bistro.  It kind of felt like The Egg and I on the inside...or First Watch.  This is nothing special and I would not choose to return if I was making the decision.

reviews.name: Tim G.
reviews.review: Absolutely love Le Peep. It's amazing! The potatoes are to die for. I always also get the eggs Benedict! Love it here. Always has quick service too!

reviews.name: Morgan S.
reviews.review: I really enjoy going to Le Peep on Sunday.  Get there early to beat the church crowd.  They have great omelets made "skinny" that are very good.  My fiance loves the skillets.

reviews.name: Bradley H.
reviews.review: I cannot give this breakfast spot enough stars it is the best place in Nashville and I came from Florida where breakfast is king.

reviews.name: Jer W.
reviews.review: Pleasantly surprised! Had one of the better late breakfast experiences to date in Nashville. The space was brightly lit and airy, service was excellent, and the food was great. Slight corporate vibe but that was to be expected, nothing wrong with that but I did wonder what a "Peasant potato" or "Mom's Sassy Apple" was. The food was the real star of the experience though. Definitely looking forward to going back and sampling more of the menu.

reviews.name: Lyrad V.
reviews.review: Le Peep is a solid choice for breakfast and brunch in the area. They have traditional breakfast plates as well as a nice variation of options, including skillets, crepes, casserole type bakes, etc. They freshly squeeze their OJ so that's always a plus.The place gets busy on the weekends, and there is usually a wait. This is one of the few breakfast places that is worth the wait, because their extensive menu has a lot of items that I normally wouldn't cook myself at home. The service is usually good and the food comes out hot. I also like the cool artwork on the walls!

reviews.name: Stefanie F.
reviews.review: Don't get the migas... It's mostly tomatoes and eggs.  Even if you add the 1.99 chorizo doesn't add anything to it.  Totally bland!!  I was honest when asked, "how are things?"  I left half the meal after testing to add salt, salsa etc - still got charged full price.  I never complain but I was so unhappy!!

reviews.name: Jason B.
reviews.review: One of the top 3 or 4 breakfast spots in Nashville.  My favorite is the Farmer's Benedict, which isn't really a benedict at all.  Two biscuits, with your choice of meat, covered in gravy and topped with eggs.  Delicious.  The OJ is freshly squeezed, and they'll bring you your own pot of coffee.  I've never had a bad meal at Le Peep.

reviews.name: Alvin P.
reviews.review: Excellent breakfast place.  It's located in a strip mall that has some tight parking spots, so when it gets busy on the weekends, parking can be a bit of a problem, although there is additional parking nearby.  The staff is pretty friendly.  The food here is simply amazing.  It's pretty much strictly a breakfast/brunch place (and they close early) but they are really good at it.  I didn't even know what basted eggs were before I found this place, but I love them now.  Even the potato bites that come with it are good.  The veggie omelet was also very good, and the eggs bendict is delicious.  I don't think I've eaten here once and not liked the food much.  I also tend to stick to the foods that I know I'll like, so I haven't sampled too many choices from the menu, even though I've been here numerous times.  The prices are very reasonable for the good food IMO.  An order of say Eggs Benedict is pretty filling in itself, so you don't really have to order an appetizer and an entree of sorts to actually feel full here.  The coffee however isn't that great, and seems pretty plain.  They do have some fresh juices but I haven't tried them out in the morning. I took of one star mainly because they seem to have a bit of a backward policy in not taking on the phone take out orders on the weekends.  The weekend is when this place is very busy with almost all the tables are taken and there is a good waiting period as well.   This would seem like the ideal time where they can take orders on the phone so people can get the food and go eat somewhere else.  I understand that this most likely has to do with the staff being over-worked at a busy time, but that just indicates that the place is understaffed then.  I've tried to go  here numerous times on the weekends only to be discouraged by the waiting period and go elsewhere, but would've ordered take out over the phone if I didn't have to wait.  I would recommend the food here to anyway, so so on the coffee, and wish they would chance their weekend policies on take out.

reviews.name: Tammy T.
reviews.review: Their mimosas are good, but they are a bit on the pricier end for a grad student's budget. (they do say that their orange juices are fresh squeezed, so that might be the reason for the price) I went in with a group of friends on tuesday around 11 and the place was not as packed as I thought it would be. This might be due to its hidden location. Its hidden inside a plaza, but there wasn't a sign noting that Le peep was there so it was hard to find. I ordered the wanderer and I was not disappointed at all. The hash was perfectly cooked and topped with cheese and two sunny side eggs. MMmmMMMmMMM Be sure to check out this hidden gem!

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: Le Peep was tasty! My friend and I drove to Belle Meade after browsing the menu online and seeing the delicious looking photos on Yelp. Le Peep is located in a strip mall, and there are some weird restrictions on parking; some spaces said 60 minute maximum parking, others said 30. Not sure the deal there but there was a garage close by though it would be a bit of a hassle to get there if you've already driven in the parking lot.We made it in about 30 minutes before they closed (at 2pm) and ordered the crab cake benedict and dawn breaker. The dawn breaker was a scramble with mushrooms, bacon, tomatoes, cheese, and onions. My benedict was very large and was too much to eat in one setting. I asked if I could add spinach on my dish, and the waiter told me it would be no problem. Hey, I like additions at no charge! After I'd had half of my meal and my side potatoes I was full and took the rest to go. The dawn breaker was the perfect portion; just enough food. Our potatoes were a bit dry and had been sitting out for a bit, but we did come in close to closing and they were definitely winding down the food service, so I don't want to give them too much heat and they still tasted good. Our coffee was awesome and they have a giant orange juicer that I'm sure makes amazing mimosas! They also offer something called a cinnamon bun latte that sounded pretty spectacular as well as your other espresso drinks and smoothies. I think I need to return to Le Peep so I can explore the crepes next!

reviews.name: Eric P.
reviews.review: Had breakfast here today for the first time in years. Both Waitresses that handled our order were polite and professional. Food was excellent and cooked to order. The Kitchen staff (I could see the prep area from my table) is hard working and seem to enjoy what they do. My only negative comment is that the restaurant is "tired" and needs holes in the walls fixed, new paint, tables refinished and the floor cleaned. Success and a stable of regulars is no excuse for not keeping up appearances.

reviews.name: Nick And Cat G.
reviews.review: After driving all night on our way to Vegas, we stopped at Le Peep for breakfast on a Sunday morning.  Of course The Girlfriend got on my case for not just hitting the McDonald's drive-thru to save time, but she sure changed her tune when they brought out the stuffed French toast!  I received my well deserved apology in between bites of what she still claims is the best French toast she has ever eaten.  I had the Monte Cristo crepes which were pretty freakin' good.  If you order these ask for hollandaise sauce on the side so you can have half of the crepes savory and the other half sweet with the provided strawberries and raspberry sauce.  Service was quite good as well.  I would come here for breakfast anytime!

reviews.name: Dana Z.
reviews.review: This place used to be good. Notice the used to. I had their food this morning, and they must be hurting because they're now rationing the breakfast potatoes. When we confronted the waitress about the lack of potatoes she told us "that's just how the manager does it". We then spoke with the manager and she was argumentative concerning the potatoes. It was like we had asked for gold coins as opposed to potatoes. In general (not just the potatoes) portion sizes have vastly decreased. There are so many great brunch places in Nashville now, you could easily find a better place than le peep. I hope you're not hungry if you do decide to eat here.

reviews.name: Allison N.
reviews.review: This place pretty much defines "a-ok". Nothing remarkable but nothing horrible. I got an omelet, and it was not memorable. The place was not busy at all when we went in, and service was alright. Still, wasn't overwhelmed by amazingness during my trip here. There are better places to eat breakfast/brunch in the area. I'd pass on Le Peep.

reviews.name: Ali M.
reviews.review: Amazing brunch place! The only thing I can knock it for is that the mimosas are $7 or $8 each. They're great and I'd love to have more than one but really can't because I'd spend more on booze than my food! The specialty coffees are great too. I generally get one of the potato skillets which all of the ones I've tried have been amazing (the sweet potato one is probably my favorite). The eggs Benedict is also great. Their potatoes are sometimes a little dry and chewy but they're still okay when they're dry. One thing I LOVE about this place is that they give you water for the table so I'm not constantly flagging someone down for water refills. I go here very frequently. Love it!!

reviews.name: Aaron A.
reviews.review: Service is garbage... The people across from us got their food before us however came after us.  The servers seem  pretty nonchalant..my highlight so far on a positive note is my smoothie... everything from its taste and appearance to the ms who brought it out with a smile...The food better be delicious

reviews.name: Trevor J.
reviews.review: Fresh squeezed OJ is a must!  The breakfast food was definitely solid and it was a great meal before we went to Belle Meade Plantation, which is only a block away.  What I look for in breakfast joints is good hash, eggs, and something special.  I received my 2 requirements and the OJ was something special.  Reminds me I should get a fresh juice squeezer.

reviews.name: Michelle F.
reviews.review: YUM!  My first "Le Peep" experience was w/o my husband in Peoria, so when I was describing my delicious food (especially my Gooey buns), I had my husband extremely jealous.So imagine how excited he was to find out there was a Le Peep right down the road from where we were staying near Nashville!!!We arrived at 8:30 am on a Sunday morning, and there was no wait when we got there (but there was one when we left, so be aware of that!).  My husband was just as excited to try the fresh-squeezed orange juice as he was to try my gooey buns (which were just as amazing as they were the first time, I will have you know!). I got a veggie omelet in addition to my "breakfast appetizer".  I LOVED the potatoes they come with.  They're like really delicious seasoned fries.  SO good, and a wonderful accompaniment to my omelet!  My husband got a mexican-type skillet and wasn't really all that excited about it :(  He was definitely coveting my meal!  My daughter loved her funny face pancake, and my son devoured his as well, so I think we were 3 for 4 in the "satisfied" department.  But trust me, he didn't leave hungry--I think my husband was just hoping for better!I would definitely come back to this location.  They were fast, friendly, and had delicious food! :D

reviews.name: Nancy T.
reviews.review: Eggs Benedict are consistently good.....potatoes taste like cardboard with oil&salt! They are so uniform in size...positive they are frozen bagged potatoes. This is an O.K. restaurant with high prices!

reviews.name: Michael F.
reviews.review: After flying in from New Jersey, we decided to stop in and have breakfast since it was near our rental location. We began with the Greek goddess egg white omelette which came with English muffins and roasted potatoes. We also ordered the full stack of the banana Walnut pancakes. On the side, we had a side order of fruit.  My wife was very pleased with her egg white omelette and thought it was very tasty. There were plenty of bananas and walnuts in my pancakes. Not all of the fruit was ripe so the fruit salad was just okay. The coffee was excellent.  The portions were good and the prices were very reasonable. Service was good and friendly.

reviews.name: M L.
reviews.review: My go-to breakfast spot!! Great food! Oh man, the banana walnut pancakes are heavenly! They also have delicious eggs Benedict and scrambles.

reviews.name: Sharyl A.
reviews.review: Great food!  Will be back often!

reviews.name: Holly B.
reviews.review: We love Le Peep for weekend brunch! You need to get there early on Sunday to avoid the church rush because the wait can get pretty long. Also, the service can be slow at times but that's hit or miss. The food however never disappoints. I'm a breakfast lover so I usually stick with the eighteen wheeler so I can get a variety. But the pampered eggs, omelets, and pancakes are all delish! The fresh squeezed mimosas are pretty tasty too!

reviews.name: Tran T.
reviews.review: Came here for brunch on a Wednesday after reading some positive reviews from Yelp. I ordered the Crappy Patty Benedict and a Mimosa. I thought I read the description wrong when I had my Crappy Patty because I couldn't find the crab they promised me anywhere...they were just deep fried flour. Although the poached eggs, hollandaise sauce, and potatoes were good, everything was just really salty (mind you, I'm not on a low sodium diet). I chucked down the mimosa like water. It was hard for me to enjoy my food. If I ever come back here (may be when I'm around the area), I'd order the classic breakfast (pancakes, bacon, and sausage) and try their orange juice. And I won't forget to tell them to go easy on the salt next time.2013/#32

reviews.name: Cynthia B.
reviews.review: My family and I have been to le Peep more times than we can count and I've never been disappointed. Friendly staff, great drinks, and yummy food.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: a 1 is the lowest i can give them. very disappointed at their frozen entrees. the crabby benedecit includes a breaded, deep fried, processed crab cake that is NOT enjoyable. the brocolli served with dishes is frozen stems. no manager came by after reporting to the waitress our disappointment. i poured our own water and coffee from the carafes left on the table.  as we were getting up from the table the waitress took our carafe of water and placed it at the table of another guest. when i asked her if that was customary, she replied "you didnt use it did you?". service is better at waffle house

reviews.name: Ashley P.
reviews.review: I was not familiar chain but once seeing it on Yelp, I was interested in trying this breakfast option not too far from my home in Bellevue. The fresh squeezed orange juice elevates this above the standard chain breakfast fare. I also enjoyed the fact that they bring a pitcher of water to the table immediately. That alone makes it a perfect hangover option. I was not in the mood for coffee this morning;however, some of the coffee options sounded interesting and I would like to try. The scramble I had with eggs,cheese,bacon,mushrooms,and onions was pretty yummy. The peasant potatoes were decent. A few of my potatoes were undercooked and I found them over seasoned for  my liking. Even for a chain, packaged jelly is an instant turnoff for me. Especially because I wasn't even offered flavor options. 1 strawberry jelly packet presented with my English muffin. Would have loved some fresh preserves or jelly options for my English muffin. Overall I will definitely be back for weekend breakfasts.

reviews.name: Michael S.
reviews.review: Visiting Nashville from New York. In NY, there are diners everywhere; most with good breakfast choices available all day long. In Nashville, finding a good breakfast spot seems to require a bit of planning. Le Peep is a solid choice with great food, reasonably large portions, and friendly service. It's just 4 miles from the Vanderbilt section. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: I wouldn't even give it 1 star. There are sooo many more places in Nashville to get good breakfast or lunch. The Harding House is right next door at the Belle Meade plantation and the food is soo much better. I worked at Le Peep and was threatened and harassed by a guy that worked with me there and was then fired. I was told it was because of the "state" I was in. I was pregnant at the time and was just fine. I also found out that the guy that threatened me lied and said he was a culinary student at the Art Institute but really was not. He is a convicted felon though. Horrible company to work for and the kitchen was disgusting.

reviews.name: Sam S.
reviews.review: Literally such bad food. Bad artwork, sad vibes. Breakfast burrito, coffee, and French toast were SO BAD. Please don't come here

reviews.name: Jacobia D.
reviews.review: Le Peeps never disappoints! It's your friendly neighborhood diner with a flair. It's a great place for breakfast/brunch with family or business. The blueberry granola pancakes are tasty! The omelets , potatoes and english muffin are always a great choice. The only thing they could improve is the house coffee selection. The house coffee is does not compliment the food. I wish they had a bolder coffee option. Great atmosphere and great food.

reviews.name: EdDee P.
reviews.review: Sunday. No reservation. Middle of church rush hour. 20 minute wait not bad! They have a little bar area to order fresh squeezed OJ, mimosas, bloody Mary's, coffee. Cons: not a big waiting area. Boyfriend had Colorado with added chicken very good,fresh, little salty. I had the salmon Benedict....ehh ok. I should have chosen something different there is a lot on the menu! Will be going back. Good service!!!!

reviews.name: Will M.
reviews.review: Colorado original brunch spot is legit!  Eggs benedict and stuffed French toast plus fresh orange juice, and mimosa's (after 10am) . Enjoyed the space.  Potatoes were extremely salty, so I drenched them in my hollandaise and poached eggs.

reviews.name: Debra O.
reviews.review: We stopped here for breakfast on our way to Cheekwood Botantical Gardens.  What a delight.  The gooey buns are to die for. I had a great breakfast skillet with sweet potatoes in the ingredient list.  If we lived in the state, I'd go back for sure.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.review: Great little breakfast spot... was super packed on a Sunday.   But noticed a couple seats at the bar that are first come.   Have the fresh squeezed oj and breakfast burrito! Service was great, and quick.

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: Le Peep is probably the only good brunch place this side of the Parthenon. Serving an impressive array of brunch options, this place will blow your mind away. Vegetarians have many options here and I really dig this joint for having veggie Eggs Benedict. That's a rarity around here. Their pancakes are like baby bottoms and the endless coffee will keep you wired for more.

reviews.name: Heather F.
reviews.review: Why should you eat breakfast at Le Peep you ask?  Answer:  Fresh squeezed orange juice.I know that a good breakfast is more than just the juice.  But you have to admit that if it is your penchant to order mimosa's on a Saturday morning which would you rather have:  fresh squeezed from the fruit or Tropicana that was technically shipped from Florida weeks ago?They charge $8 for their mimosa's.  Yes, that is a bit high for the amount you get but worth it based on quality.  The bloody Mary's a Le Peep are pretty tasty too.Of course you cannot forget the food.  I heart the Belgium waffles:  fluffy, sprinkled with powdered sugar and browned to perfection they are made the way they are supposed to be done.Ingredients are so fresh and well done.  Only down-side is that the service can be slow and the place is small.  Be aware that when you go to check-out you pay the cashier up front.

reviews.name: James F.
reviews.review: Woke up this morning and had a hankering for some waffles.  So, the fam and I decided that instead of making them at home, we had to go out for the craving.  It was decided that Le Peeps would be the destination for the breakfast and so we went out.WE got there early enough to avoid the church rush ( always a suggestion here in Nashville where there are more churches than anything else in the area ) and got seated right away.  I ordered the Belgian Waffle combo which came with 2 eggs, bacon or sausage and some peasant potatoes (hash to the layman).  Food came out quick and that is always a plus when you are hungry.  The staff was decent, getting us seated and taking our order in pretty quick turn.The eggs, bacon and potatoes were good.  I mean come on, it is damn near impossible to mess up an egg and potato order.  However, this is about the waffles.  This is why I came.  The waffles were alright.  Not super amazing nor super disappointing.  Good batter and a traditional feel and taste of a Belgian Waffle but where I was left in a disappointment was that the waffle was too soft.  A good Belgian Waffle needs to be crispy on the outside and fluffy on the inside.  It was neither.  The waffle was too soft and overall not satisfying.  Would I go back here?  Probably.  I can say it was not Waffle House and that is always a good thing.

reviews.name: Konefkta K.
reviews.review: We went to Le Peep for a bachlorette brunch, and it was wonderful.  The mimosa was fresh and delicious, and the granola blueberry pancakes were out of this world.  We didn't have a reservation, but did not have to wait more than 5 minutes for a table for 5 of us.  Service was fast and friendly.

reviews.name: Annie P.
reviews.review: I came to Nashville for a visit for less than a week and I went to this place for brunch twice. It's that good! I love everything they have! Their coffee is good, their food is amazing, the service is outstanding, and they're located in a strip mall so there's definitely parking. Also, prices...pretty cheap! I love it here and I'm definitely coming back!!

reviews.name: Peter P.
reviews.review: Never heard of Le Peep but me and my girlfriend at the time used it as a backup when we didn't want to wait in line for the Loveless Cafe. Apparently it's a chain restaurant and their menu reflects that immediately. They're doing dozens of things, which makes me question how many of them they do really well. I got the Farmer's Benedict, which swaps out the normal English muffin for a biscuit, Canadian bacon for sausage patties, and Hollandaise sauce for sausage gravy. It was good, no doubt. No complaints whatsoever on that. I can't remember what my girlfriend got but I'm pretty sure she was happy with it as well. And they had freshly squeezed orange juice that was good too. As I'm writing this review, I really want to give Le Peep 4 stars but there was something about it that just makes me say it was A-OK instead of being a vocal fan of the place. I think part of the issue is that it's in the this awkward spot in a little strip mall that's fairly out of the way. I remember the interior of the restaurant being pretty uninspiring as well. Just kinda whatever, really. Overall, not a bad choice if you're in that area and you want a good breakfast.

reviews.name: Emily E.
reviews.review: I recalled reviews for this place being on the higher side, but I wasn't impressed with my experience.  I don't remember what my dish was, but it had plain egg whites, oatmeal, and peasant potatoes.  I also had a mimosa, and my husband had the crab cakes benedict.  I don't think much/anything here is homemade, but rather comes to them already prepared/frozen.  I thought the potatoes were fine, but my husband really dislikes that kind of food, so he didn't enjoy his.  He also didn't like his crab cakes, although they were fine to me.  I'm a big oatmeal eater, but theirs was really not good.  I also didn't enjoy the mimosa.Upon entering the restaurant, I was excited because there aren't many diners in Nashville, and I miss that, coming from NYC.  I will probably stick with places like Athens, where everything is homemade, and the occasional Noshville (on Elliston!), if I want to pay NYC prices.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: First, I should say that I'm a sucker for any place that brings you a giant bucket of Diet Coke, so they were going to get 3 stars for having clean bathrooms and carafes of caffeine at the ready.  Second, I know if you haven't been here the idea of going to brunch in Belle Meade is only appealing to most people who have blue hair and drive Cadillacs.  BUT this place is really great.  Hands down top 5 breakfast places in Nashville with great standards the kiddos enjoyed as well as to die for eggs benedict.  The hubby is more about hash browns and omelets than I am, and gives them the official 'man grunt' of approval.  Prices are completely fair and the wait is way the heck better than heading to Pancake Pantry to stand outside for 45 minutes.  Short story, its a great place to go with the family for a weekday breakfast although I can't say what the weekend wait is like.  Service is fast and friendly.  On the minus side, it is loud and the tables are sort of squishy so I hope you like your dining neighbors because you will be seeing a lot of them.

reviews.name: Gary W.
reviews.review: This was my first visit to Le Peep as I met a colleague for a breakfast discussion.  I was initially taken back by the parking situation whereby parking in front of the establishment is limited to 30 minutes and longer duration guests are asked to park in the downstairs garage. This was standard practice for all businesses located on site.The interior is clean, bright and comfortable.  Seating was the standard table & chairs affair with no booths. The menu is quite extensive with healthy options and good 'ol Southern cuisine as well. Service was quick, attentive, friendly and accurate. The orange juice is freshly squeezed and served in a reasonable quantity.  I ordered the Homestead breakfast and it arrived promptly.  It was prepared as ordered and had tasty seasonings that added to the dining experience.  It was clear that the biscuits were not fresh out of the oven but they were not stale either. The sausage gravy was excellent and scrambled eggs were fine. Fundamentally, Le Peep offers a pleasant opportunity to enjoy creative options for breakfast, brunch or lunch.  Nothing will "wow" you but you won't be disappointed either.

reviews.name: Sal E.
reviews.review: Get the Biscuit and Gravy-style eggs benedict. I will be recreating in my own kitchen for the next few weekends.... And that's only because I live in St. Louis. Fresh squeezed orange juice (with free refills) is also hard to beat.

reviews.name: Ali R.
reviews.review: Great brunch place. The restaurant is usually crowded and there has been a line both times I went. It seems to be popular for Saturday and Sunday brunch crowds. The banana pancakes are very good. I also love their breakfast potatoes. My husband got eggs, bacon, and biscuits with gravy and basically licked his plate clean. They have fresh squeezed orange juice, and you can watch them make it (they have a fancy machine). Wait staff is pretty good but not always attentive because it is so busy. They forgot my coffee until they brought food, but brought it to me when I reminded them.  Their omelets are very good. Will definitely keep going here.

reviews.name: Nic A.
reviews.review: Would have been 4 stars if my wife had been happier with her selection. She mentioned the eggs having too much cream cheese and the potatoes were not very good. Stuffed French toast was delicious and bacon was great too.

reviews.name: Tyler N.
reviews.review: I found Le Peep to provide an adequate breakfast. The menu has a lot of variety and the execution is acceptable but the slightly higher prices make me question that. Their peasant potatoes look like they were frozen but tasted fine. The fresh squeezed orange juice is worth returning for. The service wasn't outstanding but ensured I had everything In needed. The space is roomy which is nice for families with children. Plenty of parking on a weekend morning.I can go to better places and pay less money but I'll probably be back.

reviews.name: Katie K.
reviews.review: Five stars because it was the complete package.  My partner got the pancakes with an arnold palmer, and I got the biscuits and gravy with an orange juice.  The pancakes were hands-down the fluffiest we've had in Nashville, and the potatoes that accompanied my biscuits and gravy were perfection.  The potatoes stayed the perfect crispiness on the outside and softness on the inside, down to the last bite.  The arnold palmer, made with their freshly squeezed lemonade was wonderful, and the freshly squeezed orange juice had the wonderful sweetness a perfect orange yields.  The prices were very reasonable for the quality of food and service we received.  We're glad we found this one!

reviews.name: Amanda F.
reviews.review: Having lived in Nashville for over two years now, I can hands down say Le Peep in Belle Meade is one of my top places to eat brunch. Since I work during the week, I usually don't eat here unless it is a weekend day. There is usually a wait, but not too long and totally worth it. The service can be a little slow sometimes because the servers are a little older (not hating), so it is good to usually order as soon as possible. Their skillets are so amazing...potatoes, poached eggs, chirozo, and anything else you could want, all mixed together. The 'desperado' is fantastic, topped with texas pete. Tasty eggs benedicts as well. Also, you can't leave until you try their mimosa, made from fresh squeezed o.j. Absolute heaven! Great food every time and great prices, you will want to check it out.

reviews.name: Aubrey D.
reviews.review: So, maybe this is one of those pretentiously named Belle Meade spots for "ladies who lunch" but it's still good!I recently met a friend here for Sunday brunch. I got there at 9:30, and there was already a crowd. Fortunately, my friend had arrived a few minutes earlier and had already gotten us a table. No wait= yay!It was difficult to decide among the myriad of yummy sounding options. I ordered the Eighteen Wheeler (French toast, poached eggs, peasant potatoes, & bacon) because I wanted a little of everything. It arrived about 20-25 minutes later and was overall thumbs up! The only thing that bugged me was that the poached eggs were runny.  From previous reviews, I was also highly anticipating the Peasant potatoes. They are just crispy little home fries. Good but I thought they'd be more creatively prepared with cheese, veggies, etc.The French toast was quite good, and the bacon was killer! Thick, crispy, and mmmmmmm! It was just a cheerful plate of goodness to complement a good conversation.Be prepared to pay about $13-15 for an entree and drink= a little steep for brunch but worth it. I would have ordered a Mimosa but the sign said they are $8!!!!

reviews.name: Mjg Y.
reviews.review: We have been to Le Peep twice and we love it.  It's a perfect, unqiue brunch spot.  Nothing is greasy, lardy, etc. All fresh ingredients, especially the delicious orange juice and coffee.  Great selections & upscale enough for a fancy brunch.

reviews.name: Lyndi S.
reviews.review: You mean, Le Yum! The food here was pretty tasty. Not that it was some spectacular miracle to make a good breakfast sandwich, but the bagel was perfect (even if they only offer them in plain), the eggs were delicious, and the avocado (which I requested in place of bacon) came in heaps and was super ripe and fresh tasting. My favorite part was the potatoes, which were perfectly salted and not overly greasy.My boyfriend got a skillet, which was a delicious combo of cheese, potatoes, peppers, onions and basted egg, which I'd never heard of, but would get that next time...because it was a party in my mouth. Now to the negatives...The service, while good, was not really something to write home (or yelp reviews) about. The waitress brought everything out without error, but when I ordered a diet coke, she brought me out a carafe of watered down soda and a glass with ice in it. Pour yourself some soda that's been sitting in ice since we opened, it screamed. Not what I was looking for, but okay. I wasn't going to complain about a little soda when it was 10:30am and I just wanted food. But then, the waitress leaves the bill on the table without telling us to pay up front, so we all sat there staring at each other for about 10 minutes before realizing what was happening. Again, not a huge deal, but like I said, neither was the service. I would go back to try some delicious pancakes/french toast/pastry style breakfast, since I saw the reviews for that were far better than my generic "A-OK" rating. All in all, not bad... But let's face it, I've had better!

reviews.name: Liz D.
reviews.review: Went looking for a good after-church brunch place, and even though Le Peep was packed, we managed to get a table for two. The orange juice machine instantly caught my eye and was a great start to the meal. Remember that the freshly squeezed juice will settle, so keep it stirred up before drinking. I ordered the chicken crepe, where the chicken, mushrooms, broccoli and tomatoes were actually diced and mixed with the hollandaise and piled atop the crepe itself. Not what I was expecting, but still delicious. I cleaned my plate, which doesn't happen often. Service was acceptable, nothing special, and they didn't mention we should pay at the desk up front. But it was still great and I'm looking forward to heading back to try more of the menu.

reviews.name: Melissa T.
reviews.review: We really enjoyed this quaint breakfast place. My salmon eggs benedict was a good sized serving and the peasant potatoes are a must! Yum!It also has a friendly, local small town vibe  on the weekends that I found enjoyable.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: By the time we got to Le Peep Saturday morning I was starving! So, I think anything could have tasted delicious to me! I ordered the Vegetable Skillet. It came with basted eggs, potatoes, cheese (yes delicious melted cheese), peppers, and onions. It really was good. I had never had a basted egg before, but it was basically and over easy fried egg. It also came with a grilled english muffin. My girlfriend ordered a bagel sandwich, with eggs and avocados. It was good. The bagel especially, it was very soft and flavorful for a plain bagel.Service was just meh! Nothing great. They gave us our checks and didn't bother mentioning that we had to go pay up front. Its possible that I would return, but I might try out some other breakfast places before going back. They do have some pancakes that I was eying from across the room that I might have to try sometime.

reviews.name: Lorraine N.
reviews.review: I wanted to give this place 5 stars due to the quality of the food, menu choices, quality beverage selections.  Those were all perfection.   My husband had eggs, coffee, potatoes, biscuits and hawg gravy....he even loved it all and I had the mini-greek goddess egg white omelet , potatoes, and an english muffin with hot tea.  I was very impressed with the way they delivered the TEA it was STASH brand excellent choice and they brought an entire thermos of hot water for me and  Idrank the entire thing.  Water was brought to the table also without asking---and my husband said the coffee was better than average.  Soooooo why the four stars....I don't like the open ceiling and the server could have been a little more personable in my opinion.  She did her job but didn't try to charm us.  A  little smile and chit chat goes a long way......also---I feel like the decor and layout could be set up a little more cozy...Iit has a very bare feel in there combined with my servers cool attitude....it didn't leave me warm and fuzzy like the food did....

reviews.name: Jacob P.
reviews.review: Incredible food menu, especially for breakfast. True the service isn't the fastest (keeping it from a 5-star rating), but the food and atmosphere makes this place a great place for breakfast.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: I've been here a couple of times and always had a good meal.  One thing that has consistently impressed me is that they seem to not struggle with service whether you come in in a small group or with the cacophony of a herd of 5 kids under 6 and four adults.They have a number of healthy options, but what I love about this place is the plethora of unhealthy options.  I have a secret love affair with brunch.  It is the meal that says, "I may not be necessary, but I'm gonna make up for it in decadence".  And boy, these guys deliver.  They don't bat an eyelash when you ask for more Hollandaise or a side of corned beef hash.  Speaking of corned beef hash, it is well worth it and I'm not sharing with you; you should have ordered your own.  They make some great omelets and every time I've had their poached eggs, they were done perfectly.  They also have a great selection for vegetarians, too.The only way this place could get 5 stars is if they had a bar (sorry, juice bar doesn't count).  Nothing goes better with brunch than a spicy Bloody Mary with a nice spicy pickled green bean.

reviews.name: Tanda M.
reviews.review: Hands down...some of the BEST Brunch/Breakfast food I have ever had! 2nd time going there last weekend July 24th, 2011 and again...a great experience. The WAIT sucks, especially during your typical Breakfast and Brunch hours! The fresh squeezed OJ makes up for it though! Yummm-o! The red haired hostess is adorable too! Nice place, good food and NIce area (Belle Meade).  As a NY'er good food and good prices go a long way. I always have a good meal and I am always full- rolling away from the table there! Omeletes are pretty good and of course...did I mention the OJ? Enjoy!

reviews.name: Josh S.
reviews.review: Delicious freshly squeezed oj with an interesting breakfast and brunch menu that includes meals I would never usually make at home. The farmers Benedict, which was biscuits and gravy with two poached eggs and sausage patties.was a highlight for all.

reviews.name: Hanna H.
reviews.review: I am a sucker for a great brunch spot. I had been meaning to try this place out for quite some time, but it just wasn't on my way anywhere and I had not made the point of going yet. Well, it was on my way a few weeks back and upon spotting the sign, I swerved into the parking lot (along with the two cars following me...trying to figure out where the heck I was going)!Now, I had just had a SUPER FABULOUS brunch in Phoenix, AZ in April at this amazing place which I cannot remember the name of right now...  Le Peep was going to be hard pressed to beat this place, let me tell you.I wouldn't say that it did, but it was pretty fantastic on it's own. The coffee wasn't the best...I kind of expected better quality of taste. I ordered the Spanish Omelette ("Filled with combo cheese, onions, green chilies, smothered with salsa and a dollop of sour cream and chives.") and ordered the hashbrown equivalent and my choice of an english muffin. I was attempting to recreate the same meal I had in Arizona. It half way succeeded, but to be fair, I cannot compare the two restaurants.Le Peep was very good and lots of food for the price. I think my meal was around $8.50. The atmosphere was lively and loud, but I don't mind that. I actually prefer that. That way you can have scandalous conversation without  the whole world hearing you. I mean, right?I will definitely be heading back to this place in the near future. Perhaps I'll order something else just to mix things up!

reviews.name: Justin Y.
reviews.review: Fantastic place for Sunday brunch! (Just get there early)The one dish I have gotten since the first time I ate here is the Shamrock Benedict.  It's an Irish spin on the traditional Benedict , which incorporates corned beef hash on top.  The "peasant potatoes" or homefries are definitely complete the meal.The service is quick, waiters and waitresses are nice, and everyone is always in a good mood.  The atmosphere is also relaxing despite the hustle and clatter taking place from the many patrons.  Maybe it has something to do with the art hung around the restaurant.

reviews.name: Robin S.
