He was so kind and I felt he was genuinely happy to help.The food was SO YUMMY. I mean...really, it was all very good. Those spicy fries are like "hot fries" come to life. Yum!Hands down the best customer service I have encountered here, and from a drive thru no less. Some of the more popular establishments should take notes from them. Great food to boot! We will be back!

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: Yes! Finally some authentic middle eastern food in Nashville. This is a great family owned quick-stop for dinner. The lamb gyros are outa this world & their baklava tastes like it fell off the wings of an angel. I'll be back!

reviews.name: Taylor N.
reviews.review: Moved from tarpon springs, fl, where every family restaurant is a Greek restaurant. I was SO spoiled! So happy to have found this gem close by! Love the gyro sandwich with cucumber sauce and feta! Fries are fab also!

reviews.name: Elizabeth P.
reviews.review: Great gyros and falafel!  Small roadside, urban eatery with very friendly, accommodating staff. Fast service and you can sit on picnic benches and eat al fresco. Just what we needed for lunch break on our trip west.

reviews.name: SueAnn S.
reviews.review: The few times I've been here the service has been exceptional and the food fresh! It's great cheap eats. Make sure to get your fries spicy, and the combo is a great deal.

reviews.name: Simon T.
reviews.review: First visit to king Solomon was a good one.  Got a gyro and a falafel plate. Falafel was very good. Gyro was also very good and cucumber sauce was the best. We did have to wait about 10 minuets(worth it) but if you call ahead they will have your food ready when you get there. We will defiantly be back.

reviews.name: Josh W.
reviews.review: Was in town for the US soccer game and hit this place up for a quick lunch. Though it was delicious and hit my gyro craving but it is still not the best one I've had. Wish I had tried the baklava as that looked really good. Will have to try the Gyro fries that everyone else is talking about.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: This place may seem completely strange and random, but it is spectacular.  I don't give 5 star reviews lightly, so take note.  This place is a good as it gets.I can't speak to the hot wings, catfish, chicken, or other random items that are also listed on the side of the building, but the gyros are fantastic.  We pulled in on a whim one night after spotting the seemingly odd place and joking about going... then we consulted the handy Yelp app out of curiosity and realized that it may actually be worth checking out! We pulled up to the window and asked for recommendations since the menu was long and random and it was our first visit.  The gentleman inside asked if we liked lamb and tzatziki, and if we preferred rice or fries, then disappeared to make us each a delicious surprise meal. We ended up with one gyro platter with all the typical fixings (rice, salad, pita, etc), and one gyro wrap with fries and everything was amazing - we ended up splitting both boxes.  He also gave us a free baklava sample while we waited and handed us a jarritos soda when he opened one for himself (we didn't ask for it and he didn't charge us for it.) Besides the food being fresh and delicious, the service was friendly and over the top accommodating. Winner.

reviews.name: Eli C.
reviews.review: Nice guys - these are my friends who just happen to make good Gyros. There is a gyro place on every block in east Nashville and all of them are pretty good. But these are the best. Hummus is awesome, tabouli is great. I like these guys, and I love the kind of willy nilly aspect. Pull around? Nah, not this time - you're cool, just hang out. Want extra pita? Ok you should have extra pita tonight. It's always an adventure

reviews.name: Brian K.
reviews.review: I love King Solomon's Gryo sandwiches!  I always get the gyro sandwich combo with spicy fries and I'm never disappointed.  It's a great sandwich with lots of meat and at a great price.  I believe the combo is only $5.99 so you can't beat it.  I can't speak for the other items on the menu but I love the gyro.  Don't judge it by the appearance on the outside.  Try it first!

reviews.name: Laura L.
reviews.review: This place exceeded my expectations. Just a little dive on the side of the road but I had heard about the spicy gyro fries. I stopped with a few friends and had a wonderful meal. There isn't much seating just two picnic tables but the food is spectacular! The gyro fries lived up to all the hype and my other friends had a gyro plate and a gyro salad. Huge portions, tiny prices. What more could you ask for? The staff was pleasant. I cannot wait to go back!

reviews.name: Patrick P.
reviews.review: They noticed I had been waiting so long for my order, so they threw in some extra fries and upgraded my drink. The beef was decently prepared, but I've still had better. The fries weren't great quality, but the price point was good for the quality.

reviews.name: Colleen A.
reviews.review: Looking for something other than the sea of Nashville bbq and greasy bar food, or "fast food," my family stopped here on our way out of town. Excellent choice. Friendly service; very good, fresh food, and sweet tea. If we lived here, this would be a regular lunch/dinner destination.

reviews.name: I M.
reviews.review: U would not expect to be getting the best catfish sandwitch I've had in town so far, but when w ordered it, the guy already told us how we were going to love it, he marinates it and breads it himself and its fresh, not frozen...and well, he was right! We loved it and the sandwich lives up to the expectations. We are definitely going back

reviews.name: Patrick D.
reviews.review: Awesome people, great gyros and chicken. And it's decently priced.

reviews.name: Robert S.
reviews.review: My girlfriend and I have been eating here almost once a week. It's our go to when we decide to eat out. Being Detroit natives, it's wonderful to have a taste of home down here. The falafel kills it. Wings are killer EVERY time. And the gyros are straight fire. Thank you for being awesome king Solomon's! Plus not to mention the friendliest staff!!

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: I stopped by for a to go dinner tonight.  The service was friendly and quick.  I have eaten a plethora of no frills Greek restaurants, and this one didn't separate itself from any other.  I ordered a Gyro sandwich and some falafel.  Both were adequate and I have no regrets for going, but I don't get all of the five star reviews.  I've had better at the same price point.  There is a decent chance I go back, but it's not five star special.

reviews.name: Corie K.
reviews.review: No frills - great Greek chicken salad- awesome service. Also I noticed they had a really great food inspector score- so glad to have yelp reviews to convince me to give this a try. Don't let the lack if curb appeal fool you- the good was fresh, tasted great and the people were super friendly.

reviews.name: Issac M.
reviews.review: Great food and prices. I recommend the gyro. Park across the street next to the check cashing place. Parking lot is dinky. Weird double drive thru set up. I guess my critique is  that sitting areas are limited and can be awkward.

reviews.name: Sarah M.
reviews.review: I love these guys! Best gyros in east Nashville, super fresh and great flavor. The portions are big and they always remember me and thank me for coming back. If you have a large order, it is smart to call ahead.

reviews.name: Wes D.
reviews.review: King Soloman is my jam. Simple as that. They always prepare your food upon arrival, so you'll wait a bit. I like to call ahead to place my order. By the time I get there, my meal is ready to go. Can't emphasize how cool and friendly these people are. They're genuinely excited to whip you up some fantastic gyros. My favorite is a gyro/chicken combo salad with grilled onions, mushrooms, and cucumber sauce. Pita bread included! Considering the freshness, cool staff, and solid prices, King Soloman is the best takeout option in East Nashville.

reviews.name: Mark W.
reviews.review: Dirt cheap and delicious with friendly customer device. You can get just the gyro for 3.99 which is enough food for lunch if your not too hungry, or for 6.99 you can get a whole plate of food including a salad, yellow rice and the fixings for a gyro. If you just want so.e good food this is a great place to stop

reviews.name: Mandi G.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I stopped by on our way out of town, and I'm so glad we stopped here! We both got a gyro, and they were really great, especially for being so cheap. The best part though was that the employees were super friendly and nice. Also, the tzatziki sauce was the bomb. Thanks!

reviews.name: Angela P.
reviews.review: Food is delish but the customer service is what keeps me coming back. Love these guys!

reviews.name: Davis M.
reviews.review: Affordable, great food, and super personable service. The owner is usually working himself, and frequently offers free samples of new foods he's working on... It's always good.

reviews.name: Kate W.
reviews.review: As everyone else said on yelp, the service is great! They are family owned. We were new to neighborhood and very welcoming to us! Gyros are great! I ordered seasoned fries which were really good. Oh! order the cucumber sauce with your gyro! But my favorite thing was the milkshake! I got their butter pecan! Oh my word so good! Great service, really good cheap food! Can't be best!

reviews.name: Ozro D.
reviews.review: I'll be honest, gyros start to blend together after a while for me. It's rare that any one place serves a gyro that blows me away, and only occasionally do I get one I don't enjoy. Most gyros tend to be - at the very least - enjoyable, and I haven't found much variety in the preparation.That said, the gyros at King Solomon's ARE really good. And the fries (both regular and seasoned) are fantastic. The menu has a lot of options, but I see no reason to stray from the basic gyro combo. I've heard good things about the gyro sub as well.As odd as it sounds, the main reason to come here is the SERVICE. That's right - a small drive through with $6 gyro combos has standout service! The guys inside are incredibly nice, and eager to help out with refills or anything else you might need while dining outside. And the food comes out quick.Fast, helpful service; cheap; good food... what more could you want from a restaurant???

reviews.name: Jackson S.
reviews.review: I kept seeing this place every time I went to Kroger and my girlfriend and a friend decided to try it on a whim one day. SO GOOD. Fast (for made to order food), delicious, great portions and AFFORDABLE.

reviews.name: Greg B.
reviews.review: Staff is courteous and genuine about how much they appreciate your business.You must order the 'Gyro Fries', unreal experience. Fries (seasoned or reg), gyro meat, white sauce and a little hot sauce... it'll knock your socks off.

reviews.name: Amy C.
reviews.review: Good, Yes.  Best Gyro in Nashville (as voted in the Nashville Scene), I would personally have to say no.  Now, I'm not saying I would never come back, just that I didn't leave having an, "OMG this is the best gyro I have ever eaten" experience (which is usually what it takes for me to give a 4-5 star rating). On the upside...the food was cooked to order and came out piping hot and extremely fresh. So for fast/cheap eats in East Nashville, I would say to give it a shot. Happy Eating!

reviews.name: Chuck B.
reviews.review: Solid gyros and related. Super awesome service. Drive thru is handy or hang on the deck. Can't go wrong at Solly's!

reviews.name: Esther L.
reviews.review: King Solomon is top notch. The value for the food is hard to match, as the prices are low, and the food is delicious. This is a smart alternative to the plethora of chain fast food restaurants on Gallatin.Favorite dishes include the chicken hummus sandwich, combo dinner plate, and Greek salad. The yellow rice is perfect comfort food, and no order is complete without tzatziki. Given the heat as of late, as well as the less than stellar view from the picnic tables, I've opted for carryout to enjoy at home. However, it's nice to have the option to sit in front and gobble falafel when the craving strikes. I don't have experience with the drive-thru, but that seems pretty streamlined.If you're looking for inexpensive and satisfying food while painting your house, hosting a yard sale, rushing home from work, or getting messy in the garden, consider King Solomon. Fast food prices, slow food flavors. Many happy returns.

reviews.name: Adam C.
reviews.review: Seem to find myself going through the drive-thru weekly. I usually get the combo plate. It's a heap of Greek chicken and gyro meat with rice, salad, sauce and toasted pita. It all rings in at around $6. It's hard to beat especially with as much food as you get. Friendly and fast service makes this place my go to, safe bet, dining option these days.

reviews.name: Gary E.
reviews.review: The place looks scary from the outward appearance. The food is OUTSTANDING and very reasonably priced. Excellent Greek food!!

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: First, let me say that I didn't realize there weren't any photos of this business or I would have taken some. I'll get on that next time because I will DEFINITELY be back soon.I have spent so long on the search for a great felafel in Nashville and have been disappointed at every turn. When I read the review of King Solomon in the Best of Nashville issue of the Scene I decided to give the place a shot, despite my hesitancy of its location (East Nash Gallatin-adjacent Greek is always friendly, but rarely tasty) and super orange exterior. I am so glad I did!The felafel sandwich was a great deal at just $3.99 and was enormous and overflowing with deliciousness. Their tzatziki had a tangy kick that perfectly complemented the crispy outside, soft and flavorful inside, felafels. It was big enough to split for 2 with a side, but I ate the whole damn thing. It was just too delicious to say no.They make everything fresh, so it's worth the wait (which is still not super long, btw). My wait was made even more pleasant by the extremely friendly man at the window Bijon (I spelled it phonetically, but I'm sure it's wrong, sorry). He passed the time with jokes and conversation. I've never felt the urge to describe a drive-thru as "welcoming" before, but that's just what it was.

reviews.name: Russell M.
reviews.review: Always great. Service, food, and quality. They are always about customer service. Glad they have Yelp sticker in there window so I can give them a review. Tonight spicy chicken sandwich and grape leaves. Try this place.

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: Pretty decent spot if you are looking for a quick gyro. I got their gyro salad and it was tasty, a little onion heavy, but tasty. I can't say this is my favorite spot for a gyro in Nashville, but it is a good one. All of their food is fresh and full of flavor. Their hummus is off the chain too.You really can't go wrong at King Solomon's!

reviews.name: Steve R.
reviews.review: WOW!  I have lived in East Nashville for two years and have driven past Solomon's hundreds of times.  I decided to look it up on Urbanspoon and it had great reviews so I gave it a shot.  I will definitely go back.  I was really impressed with my gyro plate and the hummus was made minutes before i got there...Yummy!!!Give this place a try!

reviews.name: Con S.
reviews.review: Gyros are gyros, but the service is top notch.  They are quick and attentive, and all sorts of friendly. The salads are great too.

reviews.name: Brad M.
reviews.review: I really enjoy this place. It is a drive through only, so no seating. The mix gyro (chicken and lamb) is excellent as is the spicy chicken sandwich, which is actually chicken, wing sauce, jalapenos and ranch dressing on a pita. It's spicy, hot and delicious.  Fries and shakes are also good. It can be a little slow, because they don't prepare your food until you order it. But, it's definitely worth the wait.

reviews.name: Luke K.
reviews.review: I'm a loyal King Solomon's customer but had not previously had their gyro fries.  Mindblowing.  That's all I can really say.  If they weren't already five stars, the gyro fries get them there.  Brilliant, filling, delicious.  Good with the spicy fries or the regular although I recommend the spicy fries.

reviews.name: E W.
reviews.review: Great little takeout place. Love the gyro fries!  People were very friendly. I admit, it's not a place I would've stopped at on my own. I read the reviews on Yelp and decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did!  Tasty food, large portions and a great value!  Try it, you'll be glad you did!

reviews.name: Sean A.
reviews.review: Really good Gyro.  I'm not sure what makes a Gyro good, but I would know a bad one if I had it and this wasn't bad at all.  It could have used more sauce, but that could probably be said about every Gyro ever. The fries were pretty good too.  I got their "hot wings" too.  The wings were super crispy... I would say cooked to perfection, but not hot (as in spicy) at all.  That said, I haven't found any other good wing places around so I've gotten in the habit of getting wings plain or without sauce, and adding my own sauce when I get home.  To that end, the well cooked wings here are great.The staff was super friendly.  One guy took my order and another brought the food out, and both of them said "I appreciate your business."  While I was waiting, an old guy with gray hair and a mustache (King Solomon?) went out the back and got something from his car, and he stopped and waved to me.I'm not sure why it took me so long to eat there, but I'd needed to get beyond my usual staple of take-out joints: 5 Points Pizza, Calypso, Far East, etc.  I'm pretty sure I'll be back here soon.And for what it's worth, their health/code score is 96.

reviews.name: Nichole J.
reviews.review: My favorite "fast food"in Nashville. For a little over $5 you can get a huge falafel sandwich, drink, and side of rice or seasoned fries. That's (well, usually) enough for 2 meals for me.Did I mention the service? After just 2 or 3 visits, the employees all recognize me, and sometimes they even throw in a few extra falafels. Delicious food for the same price you would pay at the Burger King next door, and you're also supporting a local business.

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: Great takeout. Your basic gyros with a very friendly and helpful guy at the window. He asked if I had been there before and if I'd been satisfied with my food. Made sure we had everything we needed. Spicy fries were good, too.

reviews.name: Sean H.
reviews.review: I'm a little mad at myself for not trying this place sooner. I've liven in East Nashville for a year and a half and have driven passed her countless times and never stopped, ever with a recommendation from a friend. Well it's AMAZING! The best Gyro I've had in Nashville, super friendly staff, great food, this place is a must!

reviews.name: Geoff T.
reviews.review: I heard about King Solomon when Nashville Scene awarded them the Best Gyro in Nashville. Naturally, I had to give them a shot.You would not randomly stumble across King Solomon. It's in a drive-thru/walk-up only building on Gallatin Road. Honestly, my personal restaurant bias would have normally kept me driving right on past a joint like this.However, the food was surprisingly good. It was also surprisingly inexpensive. For $5.99, I bought the combination platter that came with both gyro meat and chicken on a bed of yellow right with a tasty little salad mixed in. I chose the cucumber sauce, which they poured over the top of the meat in the perfect portion size. I even felt like what I ate was reasonably healthy as well, for fast food at least.I ate lunch at noon. It's not almost 6pm, and I am still full. Value, people.Normally when I buy this type of lunch, the lettuce is the stale out-of -a-bag variety, the meat is a little dry, and I feel like I have to douse everything in the tzaziki sauce to make it palatable. I was pleasantly surprised to find the meat fresh (and very tasty), while the salad was actual romaine lettuce glazed with a good vinaigrette-type dressing and fresh chopped parsley. There were slices of fresh onion, black olives and banana peppers thrown in as well. If they had only thrown in some feta, it would have been perfection.Don't be tempted to feel dubious about the neighborhood or the exterior of the building. The family staff was friendly, the food was good and the price was very aggressive. Not a bad lunch for a cheap guy like me...

reviews.name: Chris S.
reviews.review: Went there today and got a falafel sandwich combo, probably the best i've had in town.  Their falafel are lighter in color than any I've seen and seasoned well, very tasty.  I think mine had like 6 pieces in it, frickin huge, and they gave me tons of fries-the spicy kind similar to the ones at Fat Moe's.  The guy working was super nice too, so I'll definitely be back.  Recommended for sure.

reviews.name: Suq M.
reviews.review: I love this place!  I go here with my partner so often the family (King, Queen, Princes and Princesses) know us!  I even got to say hi to one of the King's grandchildren a few weeks ago--an adorable little Greek baby.  The family the runs this place is super sweet, and so gracious. But about the food...I've heard its the best Greek in Nashville.  I can't say I'd disagree. For a drive-thru restaurant it's ALWAYS fresh, flavorful, and delicious. I personally like their salads. $6 gets you a huge, fresh salad covered in meat and cucumber sauce, with a warm, delicious pita on the side. Their spicy fries are crispy crunchy, their gyros are also delish. However, hands down, their baklava is to die for.  Definitely the best I've ever had. The best part is, it's cheap!  Scary cheap. Like, you can eat here for less than the neighboring Burger King, and not feel terrible about yourself afterward.  I usually call ahead since it's about a five minute drive from my house, and the food is ready when I get there.  King Soloman's is an awesome place for fast, delicious, cheap food, and you're supporting a lovely family!

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: I almost do not want to review this place for fear of Nashville's best kept drive up secret being let out, however as a foodie it is my duty to tell you about the amazing gyros this nice Iranian family serves. First off you pull up to a window or wait for a server to come to your car to order. AWESOME. Secondly the food is amazingly cheap. $3.99 for a good sized gyro or falafel. Thirdly these people could not be nicer. I had an incredibly interesting conversation with the owner's wife, an Iranian family, who is as interesting as the food is amazing.I've been to Israel and Jordan, let me tell you this is straight out of the Middle East. The gyro is the closest I have come to a one I had in Israel. Full of flavor and they do not skim on the meat or fillings. Fries are crispy and delicious. Falafel is not dry and spiced to perfection. I love this place and you should love it too. Stop by for a fast meal, when you are starving, or have the late night munchies.

reviews.name: Snug M.
reviews.review: Great food and even better service! Workers always have a great attitude. Gyro fries and Gyro plate are amaze balls!

reviews.name: Mike K.
reviews.review: I "moved on up" to the east side months ago and was hesitant to check this place out based on the exterior. Bad choice! I don't know Solomon from Adam but he is definitely the local gyro king.

reviews.name: Jason K.
reviews.review: I was passing through Nashville and decided to grab some greek. I went to King Solomon's for a Gyro and it was absolutely delicious! Great food, great service and I would totally go back there again! The only problem is there is only a small bit of outside seating for eating so if it is cold it might be better to get it to go.

reviews.name: Angie L.
reviews.review: If you haven't tried this place, do it ... now.  It's amazing.  Family owned.  From scratch food and just the best ever.  And, the people are so, so nice.  Love.

reviews.name: Randa T.
reviews.review: I found this place through Yelp and read good reviews. i got a yummy gyro combo and will definitely go back again.  The guys working there are brothers and seem dedicated to offer wonderful food & customer service.  This cute little drive through is a awesome... Also great prices!  The menu offers homemade baklava for even more temptation to stop by ;)

reviews.name: Paul C.
reviews.review: Best Gyros in Nashville.  Perfectly seasoned chicken and tastiest ingredients.

reviews.name: Hillary Y.
reviews.review: After reading positive reviews on Yelp and Urbanspoon, we decided to give this little drive in delight a try. I ordered the chicken plate served with cucumber dressing and rice alongside a healthy portion of rice. The chicken was well seasoned and cooked, tender and flavorful. The salad was fresh and crisp, though I'd have preferred whole kalamata olives over the canned black olive slices. The pita bread was hot and fresh.  I'll request a bit more dressing on the salad next time, and I could barely manage to eat all of my rice, but overall a fair price for a hot Greek meal that satisfied my craving. Service was friendly and quick, too, another plus! I'll be back.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: For the love of god we stuffed our faces with food and drink today.  Yummy meat and super fresh salad and  a portion of fries, pablo can be downright hog like!.  Delish apart from the white saucy stuff on the meat, lets say hold the white and add the hot sauce.  Yum and by the way the server was hot hot and cool (marcia can I say that). Nice cheap eats in the hood, snaps again elle!  Greek ? methinks not.

reviews.name: Brandon M.
reviews.review: The gyro was excellent. Full of flavor and great texture. The rice even had a great taste. Most places I've been the rice is very bland and is more of just a textural compliment to the rest of the dish. Everything was super fresh. The meat came out hot and was on the flattop just long enough. If I weren't such a foodie and extremely critical of everywhere I eat this would be an easy 6. I will definitely be going back.

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: I really dig this little tiny drive thru/walk up across the street from Kroger.  At just a little over $5 for a combo -gyro (lamb, chicken, or falafel), fries (plain or spicy), and drink, it beats almost any fast food combo and is so much better.  Plus it's not full of lard and grease so you won't feel like dirt after.  I also like the plates.  Chicken plate comes over rice with salad, tabouli, and warm pita, with either ranch or cucumber sauce (I prefer the cucumber).  It takes about 5 minutes to cook because they cook it fresh, and the service is very friendly.

reviews.name: sherri M.
reviews.review: we're happy customers of king's for a couple of years now.  you can count on getting a freshly-prepared meal that is good and affordable.  just because it's little doesn't mean you shouldn't try it!  you can call in your order & then pick up within 10-15 minutes.  i am so glad that i gave them a chance!  we eat there at least 1/month and it is never more than $15 for the 2 of us.  go and enjoy!

reviews.name: Rachel A.
reviews.review: I was excited to check out king Solomon's after it was voted best gyro in Nashville by The Scene. I thought my boyfriend's gyro was good, though I wouldn't say the best, but was very disappointed with my falafel sandwich. The falafel was bland and too dry. I didn't think there was enough tzatziki sauce, and personally prefer a pita pocket to regular pita for a sandwich.  Wasn't impressed by the hummus. There are several other places I will go before king Solomon's in the future.

reviews.name: M M.
reviews.review: Ok, I never ever do this, and I could probably be one of the snootiest foodies in the world "my little world" anyway. Being an East Nashville resident, and having tried each and every of the "so called" Greek eatery on Gallatin Pk, I gotta tell ya this place reminded me the most of my travels to Cyprus and Athens having sampled my fair share of street food. I was skeptical right off the bat because of the location, but immediately after taking my first bite I was hooked, unlike most of our Greek style restaurants they cook everything fresh, the only disappointing thing about the whole experience is .....I can't get enough of it, I have eaten there four times in the last two weeks and it is exactly the same each time, fresh seasoned perfectly, hot and very generous portions

reviews.name: Nicole M.
reviews.review: Great, fast service. Cold beer. Excellent seafood! I've come so many times for sushi and seafood; it's always excellent and fresh. Highly recommend! I usually come with a hankerin' for fish and chips, the crispy kind, not the greasy kind, and they never disappoint. Fried shrimp that are juicy, not rubbery, and 4 kinds of fish with your fries. Plus, a dog friendly patio!

reviews.name: Elliot E.
reviews.review: As a native New Englander I really wanted to like this place. And I was encouraged when the Boston (???!!!) Clam Chowder not only passed the spoon test, but was served with real oyster crackers. There weren't many clams and the flavor was meh, and sadly that's where the food peaked. The clam strip basket I ordered was missing the french fries and instead of tartar sauce, it came with mayonnaise. That didn't really matter however, because the clam strips themselves had been deep fried to just short of burned. Worse, it was clear these strips were the Sea Pak brand you could buy in the frozen food section of any grocery store.But that was nothing compared to the whole clams my wife ordered, which were clearly past their expiration date. It was as if they had gone from shell to fryer without being cleaned, and tasted like they had started to spoil.Since neither of us was willing to try again on the clams, I got the meatball grinder and my wife had the coconut shrimp. All I will say is they should have used some of the garlic from my tomato sauce and added it to her shrimp. Both would have been vastly improved.This would have been a one-star review if not for the efforts by our server Kara and the manager to make things right. They really tried, but the only thing that's going to save this place is getting kitchen staff who care about what they're doing.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: We went for Oyster Tuesday..  Two, for the price of one.  We also decided to have a roll or two.  No alcohol, just rolls and oysters.Oysters were good, tasty, cold.We ordered a couple of Wave rolls and they were warm.. no rice, just seafood.  Delicious.Water glasses were constantly filled.Price was right.Food was fresh and made to order.It was exactly what we were looking for, at a price we couldn't say no to.  thumbs up.

reviews.name: Valia G.
reviews.review: Oh my damn!!! This place is on point!!! The name was throwing me off because I am not a fan of battered fish... But oh my damn. It is not like that thin chicken batter, it is nothing like that.. All I can really say is oh my damn. Please please please make it a point to go here. We had the fishermans platter, cod and haddock fish, jumbo shrimp, clams, oysters... Oh my damn.. The service was wonderful and the food was excellent! Going back tomorrow!!

reviews.name: Scott P.
reviews.review: An East Nashville oddity with a few bangers on the menu.  Combine a sushi bar with a Boston sports pub, throw in some classic New England seafood and contain it all within a "sporty" 1980's atmosphere.  While you're at it, take a gander at some of the cheesy photos of Wade Boggs and other athletes of yesteryear posted throughout the restaurant...ladies and gentlemen welcome to Batter'd & Fried. Oyster Tuesdays, yellowtail roll, scallops, and fried shrimp never disappoint.  8/10 a solid East Nash pitstop certainly with potential to be more, but I can't argue with what it already is.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I've gotta be honest... the name of this place kinda turned me off. I try to avoid fried and battered things, and I just didn't have much desire to visit this restaurant. BUT I am so glad that I came here with friends who have visited before and recommended it. They didn't lead me wrong. We started with the fried pickle chips...YUM! They didn't last long. Then we moved on to drinks and I had a very delicious vodka mule that was served in a copper cup. Perfection! My friends raved about the sushi, and we ordered a roll and the boys had a platter of sushi which was HUGE. The sushi was legit. And I probably never would have ordered it had my friends not said it was so good. Who knew they'd have sushi at a place called Batter'd and Fried?! Also, they offered great service that was also fast! I'm so glad I stopped in and will give it another try when I'm on the East Side!

reviews.name: Johnny T.
reviews.review: 3.5It's all about expectations. Who would have thought there'd be a divey New England-inspired restaurant/bar at the tip of East End? I couldn't wrap my head around the concept so I avoided it for a while. That's a mistake. For what it is, B&F is just what you'd expect and should satisfy your fried seafood needs quite nicely.Take advantage of the hot weather and sit outside on the patio. Disregard the sticky menu (remember, expectations) and start in with a beverage. Sure, you could opt for beer but the cocktails here are big and cheap (at least, they were on a Tuesday evening). The BTE cocktail was $6.50 of fruity light-headedness. I can dig it. As for the food, ya gotta keep it simple: seafood and something fried. I opted for the seafood burger and fries. The burger sounds like it should be a mess, but it works. It's a patty made up of lobster, scallops, crab, whitefish, and shrimp -- along with peppers and onions. I don't know how they did it and I didn't ask. But, that's the burger. It comes with lettuce, tomato and garlic butter. And, that's all you need. The burger is substantial, filling and scratches the seafood-loving/needing itch. The fries that come with... addicting. Who knew bay seasoning and vinegar could make potatoes so incredibly delicious? Well, you know now. Done.Paramount to enjoying your experience at B&F is setting your expectations and knowing what you're getting into. Look around: we're landlocked and in the south. That said, frying the ish outta things is almost always a hit. Get some seafood. Get something fried. Go for a big cocktail. Enjoy. I take no responsibility for any deviation from this plan.

reviews.name: Katie U.
reviews.review: I'd give this 3 1/2 stars. I've been here and enjoyed everything I've gotten. They have a nice variety on the menu. The fried fish may be the best I've had, and the daily special is always delicious. A friend loves the oysters. The Boston Cream Pie is amazing. Though the veggie of the day is generally just ok.This is not a swanky place, and I like the neighborhood bar-type atmosphere. The service is ok - not amazing. One wish that would bring me here more often: everything on the menu being a few dollars cheaper!

reviews.name: Simon C.
reviews.review: I really appreciate their diverse menu. New England style seafood or sushi etc. the drinks have always been on point as well. Definitely a good place for a family where everyone wants something different.

reviews.name: Brittany M.
reviews.review: Great spot for fried fish. Crisp on the outside and perfectly flakey on the inside. The sushi is great as well, but they are really known for their fried fish.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Went during a huge rainfall. Did not want to get out of car. Parking can be found at Family Dollar where there is NOT a sign. Otherwise on the street. Heard about this place when it opened and I don't even think it is the same owners. The food was really very good. Oysters not in the month with a R were wonderful as were the mussels. We love mussels and hard to find a decent place in Nashville. They have fish and chips and get this 4 kinds with different names. I must be a toddler when it comes to Fish and chips, but usually the establishment says fish and chips and chooses the fish. Here they have what fish is which. They had salmon, cod, halibut and one other. Oops sorry I forgot. The Sushi rolls looked really good and nicely priced, however can't be objective because we did not have them. We had the ceviche. very good too. I had the unfiltered Sake, miss that from bigger cities, but Nashville is coming on board with having almost anything. The wine also was fairly prices. Finally, but I did not partake, the fries. The FRIES!!! They came in a bag so you could put malt vinegar in them. ohhhh so wish I could have eaten more, but was totally full from the Oysters, mussels and ceviche and Sake. Wish I could go back soon. Worth a try. Service was very good, bathrooms were clean and bartender and staff were quite helpful. There is a deck too. Looked like fun and those out there looked happy. BTW when did EVERYONE get colored strands of hair. I must be out of it. Lots of interesting people and good food great price. Definitely going back.

reviews.name: Andra B.
reviews.review: Great food and awesome staff. Love the Fish and Chips, Sushi, and everything in between. Nice neighborhood vibe in East Nashville. It's a must for seafood or sushi in the neighborhood!

reviews.name: Andy B.
reviews.review: I'm conflicted on this one, because it looks like they could use some more 4 star reviews, but I'm going to go with three for now in hopes the owner sees this and makes some necessary changes to get 4, or even 4.5 stars, because this place can do it.I sat in the bar after a Titans game and waited for a friend that was caught in traffic, and the bartender/waiter was very patient with me and had no qualms with me taking a 4 top so I could comfortably unload my motorcycle helmet and jacket (It wasn't too busy or I would never have done that as I know how annoying it can be).  The service was great.  Your staff seem friendly and good at their jobs.  Hold onto them.It could possibly help you hold onto them if you provided a decent bathroom.  I don't know if you're going for a freezing cold, warped walled, Boston dive bar motif here, but that's what you have - and it's nasty, and it makes you question the cleanliness behind the scenes.The place needs a little more vibe.  All you would have had to do was put some volume on one of the 2 football games on.The food.  Your fried shrimp is perfect.  I'm not really a coconut guy, but when I saw my roommates order I had to try it because it's kinda rare that you see that perfect amount of breading with that slightly oily glow.  They were really good.  The fries were really good, too.  The sushi - the sushi waaaaas.... a good deal.  I got two $7 rolls and they were tasty enough.  The spicy tuna roll and the philly roll.  As I went to the gross, freezing cold bathroom I passed by the sushi case and I would have to say that the fish is probably just fine, but not top notch.  The tuna had that dyed look to it where it's slightly too pink.  It makes it so I probably wouldn't venture into the $13-$15 rolls.  Also, you did have one IPA on tap, and while I'd love a plethora to choose from, I've come to accept and be thankful for just one here in the south, so you get a pass on that.  OHHH, the clam chowder.  You actually can stick a spoon up in it, and I have to admit, it was one of the better ones I've had, and adding some pepper, or salt, or Tobasco, or oyster crackers didn't make it any better.  I tried each individually and straight up was the way to go for me.So in this day and age when people are tighter with their cash, and care more about where they are dining out, please just make a little more effort to stand out, and places like this will topple the giant corporations serving crap processed foods and overcharging for it.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: I've been a few times and it's always been great. The only reason for four stars is because each time I go the service is good but slow and a little inattentive. I've never been in there when it was really busy so I have a slight issue with slow service such as having to track down the server to order additional drinks. Otherwise, it's a great fun place.

reviews.name: Kristen B.
reviews.review: Made me sick. When we first went in, it was very busy. They were quick to take out orders but it took forever for the food to come out. Plus they never once re filled out drinks so by the time we got our meal we had nothing to wash it down with.The people behind us never even had their order taken and ended up leaving after half an hour of no one tending to them.Me and my husband both had calimari which had no meat what's so ever. All batter. When we got our main course it was the same. A lot of batter. By the time we left we both felt sick to our stomachs. The next day I ended up throwing up at work. Considering it's the only thing we both ate together it's reasonable to believe their sea food is what caused it.  I wanted to like this place as we've heard so many good things. But I'm never going back.

reviews.name: Adriana B.
reviews.review: Smoke free. Great sushi,  fun bartender and staff. Love the small bar, food is great also! We had the pub style dig & chips, coconut shrimp and the Boston cream pie for dessert. Highly recommend!

reviews.name: Jonathan C.
reviews.review: Food was good but the kitchen seemed slow and the orders were not correct for parts of the group. Fried pickles came out as fried jalapeños. My wife's burger came out medium and not dressed. It took 25 minutes for the burger to be recooked. She got her food after everyone was done.  At least the server took the sandwich off after being asked about it.

reviews.name: Grant C.
reviews.review: Batter and Fried is okay. I think it's a little pricey, but according to my friends, that is primarily just me.I've ordered sushi in the past and most recently, the fish and chips. First, the fish filet for the fish & chips is/are huge. Get the one piece fish & chips. The fries taste good. I typically try to stay away from a lot of fried stuff, but splurged the other day.The service was good. They have outdoor seating. I've never sat outside because I seem to only go to Batter and Fried when the weather is bad. But when I've driven by and the weather is nice, I've been envious of all the customers who seem to be having a great time on the patio.I would definitely recommend the restaurant, if the person isn't a tightwad.

reviews.name: Jim M.
reviews.review: Was craving mussels, and B&F is fairly close to my house. Half of the mussels in my bowl were either broken or unopened. They were incredibly accommodating about it, and though I declined a replacement (not smart to mess around with questionable shellfish), and offered to pay for them in full, they took this dish and my beer off the bill.I'll be back for their amazing fish and chips, but will probably steer clear of anything else.

reviews.name: Leila M.
reviews.review: We were seated, our drink order was taken, then completely forgotten about. Our server walked past us and refused to make eye contact. I tried to wave him down and he just straight up ignored us. He seated two other people, took their drink order and their food order and we still had not even been acknowledged. I used to love this place.

reviews.name: Naomi D.
reviews.review: Clam chowder was the best part of dinner!  Soft shelled crab had a little too much tooth for my liking in the dragon roll, but was tasty.I tried the coconut shrimp as recommended and it was missing the coconut.  Most of the flavor was in the sauce.  A tad disappointing.  Hubby had whole bellied clams & said they were decent.We will be back for Tuesday night half price oysters on a half shell.....don't know if we will be regularz. We'll see!

reviews.name: Job T.
reviews.review: I went into the restaurant with some doubt. Being from Rhode Island, how good could a fried seafood restaurant in Nashville be? Well actually pretty good. We started with a very non NewEngland dish, fried pickles. There were good and not greasy.  We then had salmon fish and chips and a fried oyster sandwich.  The surprise was how good the salmon was.  Nice and moist, not over cooked. The service was good, but it was early on a weeknight.

reviews.name: Laura L.
reviews.review: We have been to BnF many times since my last review. It is our absolute favorite go to place. We love everything on the menu especially the sushi. YOU HAVE to try the fried cod and the Seafood Burger. Our favorites. Go. Just go.

reviews.name: Adam V.
reviews.review: Living in Franklin, it takes a lot for me to make a trip to east Nashville.  However, Batter'd & Fried is one of those exceptions!I don't know of another place that has better seafood in Nashville.  I usually get some kind of Fisherman's Platter so that I can try a little of everything.  It's all very good and there is a lot of it!  Your heart may not appreciate constant trips to B&H, but your stomach certainly will.Interestingly, they also serve sushi.  I have not tried it in the handful of times that I have visited, but it looks pretty good.  I may have to sample something from this part of the menu next time around.Batter'd & Fried is so good!  They have a diverse menu of seafood and serve huge portions.  This is well worth the trip to east Nashville (although there are tons of great places to eat in that area).  You will not be disappointed!

reviews.name: Holly G.
reviews.review: Decided to check this place out on a whim early Saturday evening with my boyfriend and my brother. This place is literally right next to Five Points Pizza, so the parking situation is the same. There is a paid lot across the street and it's $3.00 for 2 hours (the machine accepts credit cards). Convenient, but annoying at the same time.This place has a Boston theme to it, but when I was looking around I noticed it pretty much only had stuff for the Red Sox. I think another reviewer noted this, and it didn't necessarily bother me but just an observation. They did have some pretty cool memorabilia though, so I can appreciate that. Our server (can't remember his name now) was nice enough, but definitely not one of those above and beyond experiences.We sat really close to the sushi preparation area, but none of us decided to go that route. Just seems a little bit odd considering the type of restaurant. We decided to order the pickle chips first. They were sliced sweet pickles, which really threw me off. Every other time I've had them at other places, they've been dill pickles. So the taste was a little strange at first, but it wasn't terrible. Just not what I'm used to. My boyfriend also got the clam chowder, which I was able to try, and it was actually really good. It came out super thick (I was expecting something a little more soup-like) but had a really good flavor to it.My boyfriend and I went with the fish and chips, and my brother got the Polish sausage. I don't really understand why they put the fries in a paper bag, because you're just going to dump them out anyway... But they did have the malt vinegar to put on the fries, which were excellent. The fish was cooked really well, and the breading was very light and not too greasy. I got 3 pieces but I wish I knew how big they were before I ordered. They were massive! (not a bad thing of course) But if I would have known that, I probably would have opted for 1 or 2 pieces. My brother commented that the Polish sausage tasted like a hot dog. Not sure if that's what they were going for or what exactly happened.Overall, this is a pretty decent place. The food was fairly good, service was fairly good. But there wasn't anything that was spectacular or over the top amazing, which is why I stuck with the 3 stars on this one. Definitely a place I would go again, but not necessarily at the top of my list.

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: I have waited a long time to write this review because there is many things this place has to offer that I wanted to try all of them before writing this. I am seafood snob and things have to be good for me to say anything  positive about it. This place my friends gives me all kinds of good things to say. The sushi is always good andc I have tried several things and even something as basic as a spicy cruncy shrimp roll is outstanding. I love the fried shrimp and the last time I went I had the seafood pasta which was amazing. Everytime you go to a place there is always something that stands out and I have to give serious props for the guy making the Clam Chowder.... It is out of this world. Like there are things that taste great and then every now and then you run across something that's better. This stuff is the best I have ever had and I have been to Boston, Baltimore and City Island in NYC and no place even come remotely close to how good this is. The place is usually almost always packed so get there early or get a reservation but trust me on this you leave full and happy. As always if I like a place then you should really trust me because when it comes to food, I am never wrong!

reviews.name: Sunshine W.
reviews.review: Sooooo good!!! Amazing service!!! Sat on the patio and had great food!! I had the pollock fish (pub) and the coconut shrimp!! Both awesome!! Can't wait to go back!

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: This place has revised its Fish & Chips SO many times.If you haven't been there in a while, you should try it again.I go back and forth between Fish and Chips and Sushi (the Sushi is excellent).My kids love the Fish and ChipsI miss the old Days when they had Baked Potatoes.TIP:  get some Buffalo Sauce to go with your Fish.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: As our former Community Manager, Marcia, pointed out in her review way back when in 2011, do not be fooled by the name of the restaurant if you are Vegan, Vegetarian, and/or Gluten Free. You can still eat here as there are numerous options available to you.Additionally, I would like to point out that the sushi selection here is outstanding and the sushi some of the better sushi in the city of Nashville -- not the best but some of the better. So, even with a name like batter'd and fried and even with the Boston theme, yes, they have sushi and yes, it is good.My personal favorite items are:(A.) Fish & Chips -- Get your battered and fried cod in 2, 4 or 6 slices and your fries covered in malt vinegar and salt in a brown paper bag. Reminisce about the last time you visited the northeastern United States and maybe even start it off with a bit of clam chow-dah.(B.) The white chili fries (appetizer) -- if you ask them not to apply the malt vinegar to the fries, then this dish is gluten free and can be shared with your Celiac wife / friends / colleagues / newly acquired friend / etc. that are gluten free.The place stays busy and I recommend you arrive early, enjoy the food, watch a game on a TV in the bar area or enjoy the patio area... sit back, relax, and take in a piece of Boston but in Nashville.

reviews.name: Elizabeth P.
reviews.review: Over the years of going to Batter'd & Fried, I have experienced a variety of different wait staff, management, chefs etc. Every meal there has a completely different story.....I'll attempt to make this short & sweet, and start from the beginning. My first time (09') I met some old friends there for a 1/2 price Oyster deal they had. Oysters seemed "fresh" and the drinks were really good. I had no issue recommending this place to friends or committing to returning in the near future. My next experience was for a birthday dinner (party of 8-10) and the overall opinion of dinner was mediocre at best. I had the Sushi and everyone else had Fish & Chips or something in the "fried" realm. I've returned numerous times between 2010-2013 with no real "stand out" moments. Food was ok, drinks not as great, beer options seemed to be lacking. I could start to see this was not the same Batter'd & Fried I loved in the beginning. My last two experiences (both in 2014) would prove to be my last. Once again, I ordered Sushi and my other half opted for Fish & Chips. Mine was edible, though it seemed like the quality had gone down. The Fish & Chips were horrible and sent back to be replaced by chicken in hopes that would be different. One word.....dry. To add insult to injury, our Yazoo Hefe's were old (bottles are dated). Also, we had the privilege of listening to the hostess and manager loudly discuss their weekend. We paid our bill, boxed up most of the food and walked down the street and had dinner elsewhere.

reviews.name: Kyle C.
reviews.review: Wonderful food! Filets the size of a small child! A bit pricey, but the fish is amazing!!

reviews.name: Taylor C.
reviews.review: Love this place and love the food. The staff is sometimes a bit slow, really depends on the time of day and the people that are working. It's a small restaurant so if it's busy you are going to wait a while to sit and eat. The outside eating is great in the summer, but it does allow smoking. Overall if you want authentic seafood in east Nashville this is the place.

reviews.name: John P.
reviews.review: The venue: one star  - not the cleanest of places, there was dust on the counter in front of the sushi prep bar. Plus the card reader had caked food on it as did the malt vinegar bottle at my table. I was there for lunch and it was slow so the serving staff needs to not chat so much and actually clean their stations. More time on station prep and presentation would get more stars and a relaxed brow seeing as mine is cocked in skepticism for the meal I'm about to be served.The Menu: overlong and misleading. Will refer to that later. Far too many things on the menu so instantly this suggests to me that there isn't a lot of focus on specializing.Food: two stars the fish was tender and the breading crispy and light. It wasn't at all oily. However, there needed to be more seasoning. Maybe I was expecting too much seeing as the menu said they used Lawry's seasoning. Me thinks the cook haveth a light hand. Without the sauce, the fish would've been tasteless. The "chips" we're bog standard frozen thick cut. Not at all fresh. The icing on the cake was the 99¢ cole slaw in what seemed to be a slightly large sauce cup. Seriously, a head of cabbage is 99¢. The cheeky buggers...Service: Four stars... Our server wasn't too chatty, was able to answer questions, kept my water filled and was attentive. Price: two stars... - it's a bit too pricey for under seasoned fish, frozen cafeteria fries and cabbage made of gold.Overall, I didn't have a foodgasm and I will not be keen on anything battered and fried from Battered and Fried.

reviews.name: Kristina L.
reviews.review: Every time I have been to Batter'd and Fried, the husband and I have split the Fisherman's Platter and eaten until one(or both) of us almost loses a button on our jeans.  We both thoroughly enjoy the delicate cod, grouper, shrimp, coconut shrimp and clam strips that are literally served on a platter the size of a cookie sheet (full disclosure, it may actually be a cookie sheet) and loaded down with hand-cut fries.  We go hungry and we leave needing a nap.  We have yet to find a place that compares for fish and chips here in the 'ville.Last time we went, we actually branched out tried something different.  He went for the fried oyster sammie and I had the seafood burger.  I wasn't sure what to think about the seafood burger based on the menu description of lobster, crab, shrimp, scallops, red and green peppers served patty style, but I am a trooper and I rolled with it based on our server's recommendation.  I am glad to report that dude did not steer me wrong!  It was like a giant crab cake only with other goodies in it to boot!  I did not dip in the drawn butter on the side as the burger itself was plenty moist, full of yummy seafood goodness (with not much binder, just how it should be) and was a tasty treat to boot.  It was served with a very generous side of the hand cut fries that just beg for me to put malt vinegar all over them and eat to my heart's content.Service was quiet and efficient.  Our glasses never went empty.  Our tummies were happily full and we waddled out of there and made our way home for a nap.

reviews.name: Anita P.
reviews.review: Went on a Friday night before 7 PM, it was crowded, we went to the bar and was seated immediately. I ordered the fried clams and Fried Oysters. The oysters were tender and full of flavor and were just awesome. The clams were good as well. Served on a bed of overly salted fries in a basket. Good seafood! Staff was friendly but busy. Can't wait to try other menu items!!

reviews.name: Adam B.
reviews.review: We went here for one reason, the 2 for 1 oyster deal on Tuesdays. I am always hesitant about buying oysters someplace that is no where near the ocean. But, I was pleased to see someone shucking oysters in the back so I figured I had a fair chance. Turns out, I was right. They were tasty and cheap! Two dozen on the half shell for $15 bucks is alright in my book. The wife got some sushi (yes, it is also a sushi bar). She said it was fine but nothing exceptional. Overall, I'd go back for the oysters on a Tuesday. I'm not sure I'd be there any other day.

reviews.name: Jennie Y.
reviews.review: Eeh. It's ok. Apparently, my brother likes fried seafood and brought us here for dinner. We all ordered fried seafood dinners, except for my mom who got the seafood pasta with alfredo sauce. The pasta was ok, as was the rest of the dinner. Not horrible by any means, but there's just only so much fried seafood one can take before feeling like you're going to get sick. So yes, the portions are fairly large, although half of the big plate is taken up by french fries. I'm the type of person that goes and order the least ordinary stuff, so I got the fried clam belly while hubby got the fried salmon plate. The fried clam belly tasted like oysters, but fishier. I'm usually ok with fishy-tasting stuff, but it just got to be too much after 3 bites. Salmon, on the other hand, just slightly better. At least I don't feel like I'm going to throw up, but salmon is just not meant to be fried. The fish was dry and just not that appetizing. Overall, it was kinda of a disappointment. I really wanted to like it because the owners are Bostonians, but it got 2 stars because the clam chowder was at least decent. I seriously had better in Seattle.

reviews.name: Drew S.
reviews.review: A random 2:30 pm lunch with a friend turned into walking to this seafood place. Not many people there, and really didn't know what to expect... We were seated and our waiter was super nice (kind of hover-y since there were few people there, but hey it's cool). We each ordered the classic, fish n' chips and GAH-LEE you guys, it was so freaking good. The 2-piece really hit the spot. Kudos to the kitchen at this place, I will visiting again very very soon! Also, the pricing is just right.. Not too cheap nor overly expensive.

reviews.name: Sarah H.
reviews.review: Clam chowder is decent. I had Batter'd & Fried platter with fried cod, shrimp and clams-it was not bad, just that it was all fried. Fries are nothing special! My husband had the Buffalo Grouper Sandwich and it was terrible! Very fishy. We told the waitress and she asked if we wanted anything different and we said no, but didn't give us any discount on the sandwich. He couldn't even eat it! The bathrooms are nasty! This is probably a good hangout place for Beer and Fish n' chips if that's what you're looking for.

reviews.name: Dessy P.
reviews.review: Oysters buy one get one free on Tuesdays! I go there for the oyster deal. Great! *thumbs up* I wouldn't go there for the sushi. But overall, it's an awesome spot! Feels like home. (If you're from Boston)

reviews.name: Brandon C.
reviews.review: My family and I have been going here for years. The quality of food and service has definitely gone down a lot. In my most recent trip I got the grilled chicken salad. It was basically a house salad with chicken on it. The lettuce was whole pieces of romaine lettuce. Fresh but not chopped or cut whatsoever. It had store bought cheese and rock hard unripe tomatoes and chicken. The chicken was grilled with no seasoning and was barely cooked. Rubbery at best. And the salad dressing was not the one I ordered. My wife got the salmon. The fish was tasty and cooked a little past well done. The rice and broccoli were flavorless. I make way better food at home. And for $40 I was kinda pissed. The previous trip that we were there everything was fine. But we got the Chef Andys fish and chips. They seem to know how to do that and French fries well but that's about it. I do have to say their French fries are phenomenal. But the time before that I got the pub style fish and it was inedible. It made me want to vomit on the spot. The "pub style " is some kinda wet panko batter. The outside was crispy ant he batter was wet on the inside. Like it was still wet milk or egg wash. Like wet soggy uncooked fish wet soggy. It makes me sick thinking about it. Full on nasty. So I've been here 100 times or more and the last 2 out of three have made me want to vomit. So never ever going back and would recommend all my friends never go there. That wet soggy fish makes me shudder. The owners also own multiple restaurants in the area that are struggling or have closed. So don't know if they care or not anymore but this place has gone in the dumpster.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: The most popular dish at Batter'd & Fried appears to be the Sushi.. Which is weird, because its not Batter'd OR Fried.Overall a good meal. I didn't care for the fried pickles, but that is just a taste thing. The friend I was with enjoyed them quite a lot, so its certainly a taste thing.  The things I liked best with my Batter'd and Fried basket was the Shrimp. The batter was perfect, and the shrimp was great  The Clam Strips were also good.  For some odd reason I didn't care so much for the Cod, but as with the pickles, that's probably just me.Finally, don't forget the dessert sampler.  There is some really good stuff there, and if you are not really wanting to make a decision about a specific dessert, its a great way to get a good variety.Next time I'll absolutely try the Sushi.One downside.. parking is almost certainly going to cost you two bucks. So plan accordingly.

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: Today was my wife's birthday and she's always wanted to try this place out. We both grew up on the East Coast so it's difficult to be landlocked sometimes. Anyhow, we get there and get seated by the hostess/waitress. She hands us dirty, sticky, bended up menus. Ok, no biggie. She chooses the fried oysters and I get the coconut shrimp. She was very happy with her food, but I am writing this review on my selection. The description of the shrimp said that it was coated in coconut flakes and whatnot and served with a creamy coconut type dip of some kind. Great! Sounds delicious! While I'm waiting, I notice how disgusting the place is. The light hanging above us hasn't been dusted in eons. The window sill beside us has so much....dirt? bug droppings? I have no idea, but eww. I'm definitely feeling uneasy at this point. So we get the food. My shrimp looks like run of the mill breaded shrimp, no coconut on it. Not seasoned. Just plain old panko. The creamy sauce was so off-putting in it's appearance, I had a hard time allowing myself to try it. It looked like watered down condensed milk and tasted like it with coconut flavoring added. Not what I expected at all. I ate because I was hungry but didn't even eat half of it.This place has potential, I can see it. But the only way it'll succeed is if management and owner hires staff that truly cares about it's success. You guys have got to clean that restaurant. It. is. nasty. Seriously, take a good look.EDIT: 8-16-14 my wife and I have had very, very upset stomachs since leaving this place two days ago. We are both exhausted from the many bathroom trips we've had to make. I may need to make a complaint to the health department. Will definitely never go back.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: Came here for lunch and ordered the fried oyster sandwich  (po boy).  It was very good, the oysters were fried nicely and the bread was fresh, I am very pleased.  The homemade cocktail sauce was a hit with me, gotta try that if you haven't before.  Overall good experience,  I'll be going back.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: I've been twice and I hope to up my review.  First their sushi is worse than Kroger sushi.  The oysters were decent, but you can't judge a chefs quality from raw oysters.  The rest of the menu looks good.  I'll try again and re-rate based on the whole menu.

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: I thought it was weird that it's a sushi place/fish and chippery. My friend and I came in Tuesday night which was apparently 2 for 1 oyster nights. I hadn't eaten oysters in a while so I took the chance on ordering oysters on a Tuesday in a landlocked state. Our waiter was friendly and when we ordered Diet Cokes it took him a while since he had to go to their storage area which was down the street and reconnect it. The oysters came and we got a dozen oysters which were shucked, came with cocktail sauce but no horseradish and just a few lemons. They tasted pretty good with a little salt and hot sauce, but not as tasty as I remembered. In its defense the last oysters I got were literally fresh from a block of ice.I also got the 2 piece fish and chips where the fries came in a paper bag at first. Again, not as good as I remembered from my last time but it could be nostalgia talking. I thought the fish was crispy but not overpowered by breading. The fries, were actually very surprising, also crispy and light. I hate Heinz malt vinegar-I think it's too sweet compared to the other malt vinegars. However, I did actually enjoy it with the pieces they had here.I thought it was enjoyable but the dishes I ordered weren't as tasty as the ones I've had before. I guess it's unfair to judge the food here compared to the other times I've had oysters and fish and chips, but I can't help it.

reviews.name: Cody H.
reviews.review: Everything here is sticky. Sticky floor, sticky table, sticky soy sauce bottles, sticky receipt book...  I got the sushi lunch special. The salad was pretty good, but the miso soup was super super salty. The sushi (crunchy shrimp roll) was good, but next time I'll go to Koi which is close, clean, and has much better food.

reviews.name: Brian F.
reviews.review: Great seafood in Nashville? It IS possible. Like many others, we discovered this place because of the favorable Yelp reviews.We stopped in for a late dinner on a Monday night, 9:15pm. This allowed us a parking space in front, quick seating, and quick service... so we recommend going when it's not so busy.The clam chowder is excellent, with a nice savory flavor and dense consistency. I would've liked more clams, but the flavor made up for it.Fish and chips and cod sandwich were fried nicely, with just the right amount of seasoning. Homemade tartar and cocktail sauces tasted fresh and unique. Definitely worth a try.I had two sushi rolls, and chose them because of their unique ingredients. The Pad Thai roll was overwhelming with flavor, in a good way, though I didn't care for the abundance of crushed peanuts on top. It made chewing the sushi less enjoyable, so I ended up brushing them off. The Cobra roll with kiwi, avocado, and kimchee? Not bad, but not a must-have. It tasted fresh and gave a nice kick with the kimchee!Our waiter claimed this restaurant catered to families, like ours, but when we got the bill, he said that items on the kids menu did not include a drink, which was not stated on the menu.The kids menu did read, "One free refill", so we assumed drink included. He comped our drink, so we were thankful, though he made it seem like we were being unreasonable.This Boston seafood house gets 4 stars for this trip, but we'll see about 5 if the next visit is as good!

reviews.name: Chad P.
reviews.review: Order a salad with grouper and buffalo sauce. The french fries come in a brown bag and are some of the best there is in Nashville. Navigating the menu can be tricky, but once you learn how to order the place is great! Sapporo is the best deal on the menu.

reviews.name: John D.
reviews.review: My wife and I ate here on a Sunday afternoon about 4 pm.  It was not busy so we did not have to wait to be seated.  There were lots to chose from on the menu.  The New England Claim chowder was really good.  I had the seafood platter which was great.  I did not care for the coleslaw, but I just did not like the particular flavor.  I'm sure lots of people like the coleslaw they serve.  For two entries, two cups of soup, and no alcohol drinks came to less than $40.  I felt the price was fair value for the food we ate. Although I have had better seafood in towns on the coast, I have never head better seafood inland.

reviews.name: Carey James B.
reviews.review: as far as the seafood goes, solid 4 stars, pretty good.now, the sushi, would get 3 because they don't have a few things that REAL sushi places always must have like salmon roe.

reviews.name: Corey W.
reviews.review: So if you are looking for the type of place you can get French fries with your sushi look no further!That's right not only do they serve all the fried bar staple goodies that their name suggests but they also serve sushi! I like going in and ordering a side of fries to go with a rainbow roll. The sushi is quality stuff too. Who would have thought at a place where bar food is a staple? Fried oysters, fried pickles and a red dragon roll? yes, that's my order. It is the perfect place in Nashville if you have two people of completely different dietary persuasions.Added bonus if you are a Boston fan you will find a little piece of home here. Boston sports is the theme throughout the bar. I mean come on, who wouldn't love onion rings and a Spicy tuna roll for dinner?

reviews.name: Terri H.
reviews.review: Great sushi at a fried food place?Oh yeah!  I regret that we only ordered the spicy tuna roll but I made a mental note for next time.  More sushi less fried foods.  I ordered the fried grouper basket with the sushi.  Everything was good.  The baskets come with fries and it was more than enough food.  It didn't take long for the food to come out.The service was great.  We come out to this area to the Nashville Running Company frequently so I'm sure we will be back here often.

reviews.name: Nadia G.
reviews.review: While visiting my best friend in Nashville last weekend, we were looking for a place to eat fried seafood and our Uber driver recommended this place.  It was pretty busy on a Sunday night and the menu was pretty big.  Looking at other people's tables, the sushi appeared to be very popular.  We grabbed a couple of beers and both ordered the seafood platter, which was a variety platter with a little bit of everything.  They don't have Louisiana hot sauce here, and only had Tabasco and another vinegar option on the table, which was disappointing.  The food came out very fast and the platter was huge.  My favorite thing on the platter was the fried fish, which had a nice crispy batter covering the flaky fish.  The onion rings were also really good.  The tartar sauce was pretty average and did not really add to the dish.  There were only a couple of pieces of shrimp on the platter, which was also disappointing. Neither me or my friend could finish our dinners because it was a lot of food.  We tried the brownie dessert and it was very unmemorable.  Overall, the food was decent and I'd probably go back, but this place would not be my first choice for seafood.

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: Later this evening, I'm going to regret eating all that fried food, but it will have been worth it!The beer selection was decent, but I was a little disappointed that they didn't have any IPAs.  However, the Sam Adams Summer Ale was good.  My wife is very particular when it comes to Cosmos, and she said that hers was very good.Tracy W was our waitress, and she did a great job of taking care of us.  She may have been a little bit of a smart-ass, but then, I've been accused of the same thing from time-to-time.   I'll admit that we were surprised when our dinners showed up about 30 seconds after the clam chowder did.My wife has often complained about not being able to find whole-belly clams since leaving Boston, so she was delighted to find them here.  And they met all of her expectations.  I tried them, and they were delicious.  I also had the oysters, and they were also delicious.  I was told that the french fries were very good, but I was only interested in the seafood.  When I'm a little less full, I'll start planning the menu for our next visit there.

reviews.name: S B.
reviews.review: Yesterday I was craving clam chowder so badly, so I did a quick search and these guys came up. Thanks fellow reviewers, because it did not disappoint. Their chowder reminded me of Ivar's in Seattle, which is exactly what I wanted! I officially ordered the soup and salad, and the salad was yummy too. More of a spring mix, which was a welcomed change from most place's iceberg lettuce. My husband got the 2 piece fish n' chips. Not a huge portion, but not overwhelming. The few fries I stole were amazing. Overall: yummy food with seafood that I could trust in a landlocked state, and friendly service.

reviews.name: Jay S.
reviews.review: Wow, this place is amazing. I can only speak to the fish-n-chips, but they were some of the best I've had since World's End in London. Sure, the place is a little funky and could use some TLC, but I thought the food was above average. I will definitely be going back.

reviews.name: Hugh L.
reviews.review: Reminded this transplanted Bostonian of home. The Guinness was excellently poured. The decor reminded me of numerous bars and clam stands I frequented in New England. But the crowing jewel was the bowl of chowda. Thick, creamy, generous portions of clams and potatoes, and topped with old fashioned packet of Nabisco Oyster Crackers. This has become a new favorite and "must" stop every time I make the drive up to Nashville. I also suggest (and bring a cooler during the warm months) that you buy the Boston Crème Pie to go and take home for a late night indulgence.

reviews.name: Amy C.
reviews.review: Wow, on a recent trip I was taken back by the new, MUCH higher prices! Certain menu items have gone up as much as $3-4 without any additional value to the customer.  I hate to say this, but I probably won't be back anytime soon and it's to bad b/c I really loved their seafood platter. :(

reviews.name: Mike A.
reviews.review: I rarely venture to East Nash. But with places like this I will probably make it more of a regular thing.  I wanted a good, fair priced dinner with some fun atmosphere. I found it here. Great Boston theme to the restaurant and even though I'm not a Red Sox fan, I appreciate the sweet baseball decor.  I'm not a big fan of fried seafood. But this was lightly breaded and fried. The fish (I had salmon) was of high quality and very tasty.  I also had Sushi which was of nice quality for the price. An overall great experience. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Diane R.
reviews.review: My hubby & I ate here for lunch on a Monday. The place was pretty crowded when we walked in so I thought, "the food must be really good"!  We were seated right away but we got put at a 2 person table. Normally this isn't a problem but the table was soooo small. There wasn't much room to put the food and it was making me feel uncomfortable so I asked if we could move to a bigger table once the crowd died down. Server was nice & accommodated us. The atmosphere of the place was full of Red Sox stuff on the walls. One side of the place was the bar area, which looked like the kind of place I wouldn't mind hanging out with a couple of friends. The place overall was clean, average size, very casual. Server came & took our drink order & food order in a timely fashion. The menu itself was a good amount of choices. And I love Sushi so that was a nice addition to have a good size sushi menu also. Although,  as someone mentioned in another review a "gaijin" is making the sushi. I didn't try any there but saw an order come by for another table. The sushi looked good & a generous size portion on the rolls. Wish I would have tried one. We ordered the Ceviche appetizer. It's made with crab meat, cilantro, tomatoes, onions & peppers, sliced avocado on top and tortilla chips on the side. I have had Ceviche all over, especially in the Carribbean. This tasted different, not like the ceviche I'm used to so maybe this is more of a East-Coast Boston? type Ceviche. Maybe this is how it's traditionally made there. But just so you know it is different, a different flavor profile. I didn't taste lime juice...if it had it, there wasn't nowhere near enough in it for a ceviche. The taste was good, ok, but not anything special and for the $9.99 price tag, I was a bit disgusted that it was just ok & that the portion was not very big. For that price I expected a huge plate full for us to share. I know crab is an expensive ingredient but still I think this was overpriced for what it was.  If we go back I would pass on that.   Oh and another thing I wanted to mention about the menu was that they had NO lunch specials! They had a couple of specials on the sushi rolls but no lunch portioned/cheaper specials on the dinners. Everything is pricey on their menu too, compared to other seafood restaurants who have similar items. And especially for such a casual restaurant. Our lunch was $50 for 2 people. We both had water, 1 appetizer, & 2 entrees. Most working people can't afford to spend that kind of money on lunch!  Or not very often anyway. This place could do more business I'm sure if they had lunch specials. Back to the food. My hubby ordered the seafood platter- $16.99.  It had  a piece of fish, clams, scallop, oysters, & shrimp, fries & slaw. The fried seafood has a nice crispy coating.  My husband said it was all ok. We've been to a lot of very good seafood restaurants so we don't go overboard if the food is just average. My dinner was the Atlantic Whole Belly Clams- $16.99. It was an 8 oz. portion of the whole belly clams, cole slaw & fries. I had never seen the whole belly clams on a menu anywhere near here. This is a specialty up North on the East coast too. I saw them talked about on a food tv show & they raved about how much better they were than just regular clams. They tasted like an oyster, more juicy like one. But I think my order was over cooked so the clams were a bit too chewy & not as tender as I expected them to be. Slaw was good, fries were good. The sauces that came with both platters were ok but they were both homemade. . "The tarter  was homemade but looked like a creamy mayo with not much else in it. The cocktail sauce almost reminded me of a marinara sauce, a bit chunky and the taste was so so,. They had way too much pepper in that sauce. Oh & all the seafood, sauces, and even the chips with the ceviche was FULL of salt!
