Now, I like salt a lot & use it on just about everything so for me to say it's heavily salted than wow, it was on the verge on not being edible.So with all that said, this place is an average seafood restaurant but with big prices. Should you go out of your way to visit it, no. If you have the money to splurge on an expensive seafood dinner, this isn't the place either. So disappointed...it really COULD be a great place. Improve the food by getting a better chef! Add lunch specials and/or dinner specials.

reviews.name: John C.
reviews.review: This is a 2-3 star restaurant. Just because it is local doesn't help the food. I haven't been back since my last of several visits. I gave up. The food is overpriced and marginal. The staff is nice. The restaurant smells unclean and is dirty.

reviews.name: John James S.
reviews.review: Good food and service. Would recommend the sushi! The scallops were the downside. The menu said market price which traditionally was almost a dollar per scallop. Imagine my disappointment when I got a bill for $26 for a dozen scallops as an appetizer.  Other than that, great place and love the food

reviews.name: Bob S.
reviews.review: I been going here for several years and this is my go to place for a good piece of fried cod and fries!!!! I never go wrong here with it  and add on 4 piece of fried shrimp. yummmmm!!!  I have never had a bad piece of fish in all of my visits. Not only this we go there for lunch and one piece and fries are a great price and value. Also, I agree this is the best NE Clam Chowder in town. But today i went out on the limb and tried the 9oz swiss mushroom burger!! Well it was actually good!!! I have seen it on other tables a few times. It had a great charcoal flavor to it.... All though i wish the served it Medium, it was a good well done burger.. That one good thing on this menu, They are not all about Fried Fish, they have pasta, they will grill your fish, they have non-fish items, they have Sushi. So if you have some one that does not want fish... do not worry. :)

reviews.name: Sue M.
reviews.review: Excellent clam chowder and fish and chips! We also tried the woodland street sushi roll, and it was just ok. The salmon on top was great quality, but the roll itself was a little plain tasting.  Friendly, helpful, and fast service.

reviews.name: Lyrad V.
reviews.review: Let's cut to the chase. If you just want some good fried seafood, then this is your place. There aren't many places in the Nashville area that specialize in seafood, so I'm glad that this joint does it right. I drive from Franklin just to eat here.I only get one thing... the friend shrimp and scallop basket. Actually, they only have a fried shrimp or the fried scallop basket, but I have them do it half and half for me. And they always do it. I'm always amazed at how awesomely juicy and tender the scallops are time after time. When I order a scallop entree at a nice restaurant around time, they are never as good as they are at Batter'd and Fried. And they always give you a ton of fries in a brown paper bag, and I can never eat half of them.They also serve sushi, and it's good, because I did try it once with a girl friend of mine. I love sushi, but it's hard to pass on the friend stuff because I can find good sushi all over town. I've been to this place during the week, weekend, day, and night, and I've never been disappointed. On the weekends you'll sometimes have a good wait to be seated, but it's worth it! My only complaint is that the parking situation in East Nashville sucks, but I will risk my life and park in an alley to get my scallops!

reviews.name: Brad P.
reviews.review: Go for the clam chowder. Seriously thick enough to stand your spoon up straight. Save room for the Boston Cream Pie. Made in house, and good enough to make you try out that next belt loop.I brought my soon-to-be in-laws here for dinner and everyone was impressed. The fried fish is my favorite, the bartender pours heavy and the sushi is worth trying. Surprising from a fried seafood place, but worth checking out.

reviews.name: Gale K.
reviews.review: Hoped to write a rave review, but the full belly clams, which I LOVED in New England, and that drew me here were led than anticipated. Good idea, but if not FRESH off the boat, they lose the creamy, melt in your mouth texture that makes them so addicting. I ordered a combo of fried oysters and fried whole belly clams. The oysters were delicious, but the clams, while whole belly, were tough, chewy, and grew in my mouth as I chewed them. Fries and cole slaw accompanied them. The fries were advertised as "pub fries" and were served in a brown paper bag - not sure why. Try we're not particularly hot nor were they as good as the ones served in New England or other places serving pub fries in other places. The slaw was average. I will NOT order the whole belly clams until I return to New England or know that they were air shipped from the boat THAT DAY!Nice ambience and the waitstaff was attentive.As I was leaving, Anne, the General Mgr came to talk to me about my experience with the whole belly clams and offered her apologies for my experience. While she admitted that bring frozen may have been the reason for my experience, she thought that they may not have been cooked properly and offered that she send me another batch. I was too full to accept the offer, but she extended the offer for my next visit.  GREAT CUSTOMER SERVICE which endeared me to the restaurant.I'll come back for the oysters and other seafood - and because of Anne, i may try the whole belly clams again!

reviews.name: Marcus P.
reviews.review: Great fried seafood.. Check.Great seasoned fries... Check. I really enjoyed my meal. My fiancé and I both liked the tartar sauce... She didn't care for the cocktail sauce, but I thought it was pretty good. Definitely a different take on it.The atmosphere was nothing spectacular.. A weird mix of sports bar and Long John Silvers. It doesn't really matter though.. The food carries this place.I've been here 3 times now, and every time has been consistently good. Their patio is also dog friendly, which is awesome. The waiter even brought us a dog bowl for water.I'm a fan of the fried salmon...the seasoning does the trick.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: Their coconut shrimp is pretty darn good along with their sushi.I was hesitant at first because of the name, but it's a great place for carb overload and yummy fried food.The hostesses I've had the last few times have been not so nice, but the food has kept me coming back. Like I said in the tips, their dessert sampler is so mouthwateringly delicious.My husband loves the mussels and he's from Vietnam. He said they're as good as they are at home. That to me was super impressive.

reviews.name: Brent E.
reviews.review: This place is so awesome. Quaint little Boston bar that has great fish & chips style baskets and some very inventive takes on sushi rolls.  I come here as often as I can.

reviews.name: Jenni L.
reviews.review: Pros: Our server was great, the cocktails were generous and affordable, the fries was tasty, and the non-smoking environment is a rarity in the area.Cons: Unfortunately, the food was disappointing. I had the shrimp cocktail and the fish and chips. The shrimp had an off taste, and the cod in the fish and chips entree tasted like Gordon's frozen dinner.

reviews.name: Ryan L.
reviews.review: This is one of those restaurants where the name says it all.  It's pretty much all seafood and almost all is battered and subsequently fried.  However, there is also sushi which is pretty much the opposite of battered and fried (unless you're getting some kind of tempura sushi).  I don't recommend it for the health conscious or vegetarians, unless you love sushi.I tried this place with my family the other night.  It's located in hip East Nashville which is much more bohemian than I would have expected out of Nashville.  The place is quite large with a dining area with a sushi bar, a full bar and an outdoor patio.The menu consists of all things seafood battered and fried.  There are shrimp, clams, oysters, scallops, several varieties of fish, etc.  If it comes from the ocean, they've probably fried it.  I did not see fried Sea Cucumber but there were fried sweet pickle chips.  These two are very different.  Your fried thing comes with a choice of sides which are mostly potatoes or slaw but there are some interesting options.  The sushi seemed to be pretty much white people sushi.  It was california rolls and salmon and all the standards that white people like.  It looked good and it was served well.  I am a little skeptical about sushi not prepared by a Japanese chef at a restaurant that specializes in sushi but my sister said it was good.They also serve many specialty drinks here.  There is a full bar and the drinks all sounded really good.  I tried a variation of a Long Island Iced Tea where it's topped with Sam Adams instead of coke.  It was interesting and somewhat refreshing, but not something I would want very often.I ordered the fried clams.  They were expertly prepared and very delicious.  It's hard to mess up fried clams and I'm glad they didn't.  I got a side of mashed potatoes which tasted good but were room temperature.  In addition, I ordered a side salad and I got it after my main meal because someone gave it to another table.  It was lettuce, tomato wedges and shredded yellow cheddar.  My sister got sushi and it looked good.  Our service was good.  We were seated in the bar area, directly next to the bar and our bartender was actually our server.  I think his attention was spread a little thin, but he was very nice and pretty attentive for being so busy.I don't know if I'm dying to go back, but I would if someone else wanted to.  Check it out if you love fried seafood or sushi.

reviews.name: Russell M.
reviews.review: Great place and service. If each category had a rating these two definitely earned 5 star. Food was good, I had the Mahi and it was prepared well. Sides where s little less exciting but not enough to take down a star. I have been here before and always got sushi so my first meal outside of that and it was good. Now they do have good sushi and that keeps me coming back.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: With a name like that, you'd never think that a vegetarian or vegan could find hearty options here but how wrong could we be?The menu offers 7 options in the Vegetarian Rolls section alone! My personal favorite is the Sunflower Roll ($8.49) which I opt out of the cream cheese but still thoroughly enjoy the unexpected kiwi and veg flavors. You also can't go wrong with the Bonzai ($7.49) which includes fried tofu or the Garden Snake Roll (6.49) which has a nice flash of spice from the Kimchi tucked into it. Overall, their sushi menu is quite delicious. B&F clearly also offers up a plethora of seafood options but also have pastas, steaks, burgers, and desserts too. I usually opt for carryout since the ambiance doesn't exactly showcase anything interesting or exciting but this is a solid spot for food in the Five Points area!

reviews.name: Jermaine H.
reviews.review: Lunch was great. Food fast hot and fresh. I had the cod sandwich. It hit the spot. No complaints. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Nerice G.
reviews.review: Needed a fun place to take the family to for a Lenten dinner and this was the place.  Great drinks, friendly staff, and out of this world oysters!  Mussels were the usual but the gravy they were in was good enough to drink.  You should go!

reviews.name: Gina M.
reviews.review: I have had the fried side and the sushi side.  I love the basic fish and chips or shrimp and chips.  (the fries are seasoned and delicious)Tuesday is 1/2 price oysters-what more could you ask for? And the best thing on their menu is Chirashi (raw tuna and salmon over sticky rice with seaweed salad, avocado, spicy tuna, crab meat, ginger and Wasabi.  You can take your dog and sit on the patio with a huge fan to help when the weather is warmer.  Nice bar and beers on tap.  I love this place and we go about every other week and live in Goodlettsville and work in Gallatin.  Worth the drive hands down.

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Just a good fried seafood joint.  Yes, it's fried seafood what can be hard about it?  But it's a fun joint, with pretty good sushi, and good beer prices.  Not too expensive ($40 for two, with alcohol).

reviews.name: Rob W.
reviews.review: Great and fun place to eat! Looking forward to eating here again!

reviews.name: Pon S.
reviews.review: I love this place! Weird combination with sushi but hey I like weird! Had oysters twice! The second time wasn't was good only because because the oysters were a bit saltier but they couldn't control that. I loved the clam chowder, super creamy and hardy. The servers are pretty friendly. I also had the fish and chips and I am a fan! loved the paper bag presentation! Also they use the best bloody mary ever, ZinZhang!! So good!!

reviews.name: Julie W.
reviews.review: We had a large party 20+ people.  This group dines out once a month at different places.  With a big group and multiple tickets there are usually mistakes. This place was AMAZING!!!!  All the food and drinks were delivered to the correct people and it was delicious.   Our servers were wonderful.  Sometimes servers get frustrated with such a large group.  Not these guys.  They were pleasant and fun.  I recommend this place to anyone.  Great food and superior service. It's a win win!

reviews.name: josh s.
reviews.review: We wanted to try something new in East Nashville and we thought fish and chips sounded good so we stopped in and sat on the patio. The service was good and the fish pretty decent but as we were ordering the waiter said we have a $7.99 special tonight for Red Snapper since the fish and chips were $7.49. Two of the three of us decided to get the Red Snapper. The fish was good but everything else with it was horrible especially the fries but hey its what you expect when you're paying less than $8 for a meal right? Well the bill came out and the special was $27.99 per person. We were shocked as the restaurant and the food were not $28 worth! We chatted with the waiter and were looked at like we were crazy that we thought the special was $7.99 when all 3 of us at the table heard that it was and he had clearly misspoke. There was no offer to make it right. So we left paying $85+ for a subpar fish meal for 3 when we expected it to be around $25. Definitely not going back or recommending!

reviews.name: Laine S.
reviews.review: Awful frozen prebreaded seafood thrown into a fryer. You would get about the same quality at Captain D's. How does this place have so many good reviews???

reviews.name: Austin T.
reviews.review: You gotta love the name of a seafood place with "Fried" in the name. I sure do. It reminds me of going to Panama City Beach as a child and eating myself into a fried food coma at a place there called Captain Anderson's and getting a combo platter with everything fried, including hush puppies and of course french fries.A group of us went over there and one thing that made this our choice is even though guys like me can get our fried on, a couple of us got sushi and veggie rolls and other things that I'm not able to rate. I can rate the fish and chips (fried of course) and the beer, and both were solid. Fish was very flaky and tasty and beer was cold. I can't ask for more than that. My group would say that the sushi was good, but not going to put dedicated sushi places out of business. We also liked the cool 5 points location.Finally, I topped my fried dinner off with a selection from their "Fried Dessert Pastries" section of the menu. Fried chocolate brownie bites were excellent, and I did share with the sushi folks, who liked them too. I will be back, probably very soon.

reviews.name: Hart P.
reviews.review: Went with a friend and had a good time.  Enjoyed the seafood plates.

reviews.name: Con S.
reviews.review: Always a go-to for sushi or chowder. Service is always outstanding, and the fish is consistent, which is a little hard to find in a landlocked state. Plus, I love the boston vibe. Good patio and comfortable space. Go see Casey (I think?) at the bar, and he's always got a joke or two. Very friendly.

reviews.name: Adele J.
reviews.review: Being from Massachusetts I was excited to go to Battered and Fried. The Red Sox memorabilia was awesome but I had to wonder why the Bruins weren't included in the theme. Or the Pats or the Celtics. Ordered the fish and chips because I love cod. The fish was really good but the tartar sauce was so not New England. The fried clams good too. I am very picky about tartar sauce. I couldn't really identify the offending ingredient but I think it had horseradish in it. It was weird and really ruined my dining experience. If I go back I am going to bring my own home made tartar sauce. The server was very nice and worked hard to make sure we had fun. It was not baseball season and I was shocked that he had no clue who Zdeno Chara is. Seriously???? Biggest guy in the history of the Bruins (6'9" not counting skates) and Captain. So note, if you are fromMassachusetts, Connecticut, Rhode Island, Vermont, New Hampshire or Maine do yourself a favor, take your own tartar sauce and go during baseball season. Other than that it was a fine place. Especially in Nashville. I don't understand Sushi in a Yankee restaurant but this is East Nashville so something for everyone.  Go Bruins, go Sox, go Pats, go Celtics and God Bless the Commonwealth of Massachusetts!

reviews.name: Dude S.
reviews.review: Went for Lunch today. We had a large group. the service was great and the food was very good and filling. But it was a little pricey. I had the buffalo grouper sandwich. It was a good sandwich the fries were good. I will definitely come back and bring my wife. I would recommend the fish and chips those portions were huge.

reviews.name: Mel V.
reviews.review: Yum, yum, yum. Who doesn't like seafood breaded in panko and fried? Oysters on a half shell are fresh, hell it's all fresh here! The clam chowder is creamy and luxurious on the palate, not that runny, thin stuff.  I've had the sushi here once and it's ok, not my spot for that fare, but that's ok!They have a pretty great outdoor patio, that's smoking (bleh, wish it wasn't so) and doggy friendly! The bar is stocked with good stuff too. They can get super busy during the weekend, so there may or may not be a wait.  Regardless, if you have yet to go. Go and give em' a try.

reviews.name: Travis A.
reviews.review: After bookmarking this place months ago, I finally sat down for a meal here last night.  I wasn't disappointed.I've been on a quest to find the best New England Clam Chowder in town and I finally found a worthy contender.  They claim that it's so thick, that you can stand your spoon upright in it.  Well, I can confirm that is indeed the case.  While not filled with huge chunks of potatoes or clams, it delivers with the overall taste.  I'd definitely order it again, and it was filling and worth every bit of $5 for a bowl.My girlfriend had the Fried Grouper Salad, Buffalo style and said it was very good.  I had the New England Dinner, which consisted of a HUGE 12oz piece of haddock, and some fried whole belly clams.  I really wanted the fish and chips, but I saw the clams too and figured the NE dinner was the best of both worlds.  I wasn't in the mood for sushi, but my girl raved about the Pad Thai roll.  We also ordered the sweet pickle chips.  I'm normally not a fan, and despise dill pickles, but these were actually pretty good for what they were.I'll be back to try more things.  The patio seating was spacious and comfortable.

reviews.name: Deepak B.
reviews.review: I am confused in what to write as my ears still hurt the next day from the high noise level in this restaurant. The fried fish was decent, the clam chowder was excellent. The service sucked, but it is a pub. The drinks are tiny (four sips max). The noise level was like listening/watching the space shuttle launch in person. Not really toddler friendly...Sushi was a total...eh.

reviews.name: Vanessa V.
reviews.review: Why did I do it? This one was totally my bad.I guess I was feeling a little homesick and the idea of some good fried fish and good sushi was too tempting to pass up. I should have thought twice when I saw a gaijin behind the sushi bar. I should have ordered fish and chips, something nearly impossible to mess up. But no, I ordered chirashi. The fish, although definitely safe to eat, was probably the worst-cut mess I have ever seen. Just bad. It was all differently-sized chunks and totally not the right consistency. But that was nothing compared to M's buffalo grouper sandwich. Again, insane thing to order. But strips of grouper, deep fried and soaked in buffalo sauce, sounded like the perfect meal at the time. The combination of flavors was... gym socks. I'll leave it there.That being said, the waiter was very nice and attentive. And they were open at 9:30 on a weeknight when we rolled into town. But please, if you can't make sushi, don't open a sushi bar inside your restaurant... and if buffalo grouper tastes like sweaty feet, don't put it on the menu.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: The name is misleading, to be sure. There's an awful lot on the menu that hasn't been battered or fried. The seafood is good - lump crab in the sushi is real, not imitation, which is a bit of a rarity in these parts. Very kid-friendly. Nice patio to sit outside on a less than blistering day and people watch skaters at Asphalt Beach and hipsters headed for 3 crow. Yazoo on tap and a decent bottled beer selection. I pretty much always get the sushi when I come here, but I do recall the crabmeat salad being tasty. Favorite rolls are rainbow and green goddess. My little one loves the salmon roll and the animal crackers.

reviews.name: James G.
reviews.review: Nice little Boston-themed seafood house. This is one of my go-to places when I'm too lazy to cook and want a place where I won't feel out-of-place eating alone. Almost all of the food is good, but they do the fried stuff especially well, from shrimp to oysters to the fish and chips. The "chips" (fries) are among the best I've ever had--great texture and seasoning.Guaranteed to have Sam's and Sam's seasonals on draft at all times, but otherwise an extremely no-frills beer selection. Great for watching any Boston-based teams play on TV. Addition of a sushi bar adds a very East-Nashville quirkiness.

reviews.name: Jon M.
reviews.review: Great food/selection. a little pricy.

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: After living down the street from Batter'd and Fried for 4 months, I have *finally* gotten around to eating here, and I will definitely be back!  They have an amazing selection of sushi, appetizers, salads and golden-friend goodness, as well as a "catch of the day." I would have loved to try the fish and chips, but I am trying to eat healthy, so I ordered grilled salmon with asparagus and wild rice.  I don't know what they did to the salmon, but the outside was nice and charred, and the inside was incredibly moist (juicy, even), buttery, flaky and tender.  Melted right in my mouth!  Any time I make salmon, it ends up too try, so this was a nice change.  The service was quick and genuinely friendly, as well!  Although the fresh fish was delicious, I am definitely going to splurge on something deep fried next time.  :)

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: I always see this place hoppin' whenever I'm driving or walking by, and I certainly know why now! Their menu is quite impressive and should please everyone in your group. If they're not a fan of seafood, there is also some chicken, salad, and steak plates as well as (fish or vegetable) sushi. I went with the sunflower roll after reading its creative ingredients (red cabbage, sunflower seeds, and kiwi on top?!) and was not let down. I can't wait to go back and try something battered and fried!

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: This is my "go to" place in the neighborhood when I'm not sure where to go or what I'm in the mood for. Friendly service, especially at the bar, makes me feel welcome and comfortable. I usually get sushi, but occasionally will indulge in fish and chips. Other stuff looks good - a friend's husband really likes their pasta and hamburgers - but I stick with my favorites. I'm not an adventurous sushi eater - I like things cooked - so really like the Wasabi Crunchy Shrimp or the Green Goddess. I've had the Pad Thai roll, too, though and thought that was pretty good and different. Oh yeah, the fries are the bomb. I have actually ordered sushi with a side of fries. My idea of a happy meal.

reviews.name: Kab E.
reviews.review: The only thing stopping me from eating here several times a week is my waistline and bank account.To be honest about it, Nashville, Tn really doesn't have a lot of good seafood restaurants.  But I'm glad we have this one. I don't know a lot about seafood, in fact when I first ate here I asked, "... where are the hushpuppies?!"  Well, turns out that's a southern thing.  I do know what taste good to me though... Chef Andy's Fish and Chips is my entree of choice here.  And I know what goes best with good food... that's good service. Batter'd & Fried has 'em both!

reviews.name: Samantha joelle A.
reviews.review: If Batter'd & Fried weren't all the way across town in East Nashville, I'd probably come more often. Why does the East Nash have some of the best restaurants!? I always find myself here when I am playing bass for a show at the 5 Spot, since B&F is located right next to 5 Points. It's as close to Boston as you can get, in Nashville. The clam chowder that I had in Boston was one of the best things that I've ever tasted. The Batter'd & Fried chowder wasn't as great, but came pretty close. It was very thick, and yes, you can stand your spoon up in it like the menu says. Try it for yourself if you don't believe me!When I first heard of this place, the name threw me off. I am not particularly a fan of fried food, but was pleasantly surprised at the selection of sushi and non-fried foods, including burgers, pasta and salads. The sushi was some of the most creative rolls that I've tried in town. I did try the fried jalapeno chips, which were pretty good. I also love that I can order a Sam Adams Cherry Wheat any time of year. They also have a patio, which is a thing that I always look for in a restaurant in the spring/summer months. All in all, a great place. I look forward to my next East Nash show so I can eat here again.

reviews.name: Megan M.
reviews.review: I really like this place.  I don't think it's perfect by any means, but really consistent and good.  First of all, it's a local original and unique to Nashville.  We are never going to have the most amazing fresh seafood in the world here, it's Nashville.  But everything I've had here I've really liked.  I love their sushi and they have a sushi lunch special that includes miso soup, salad, and a roll.  My friend once got some kind of nigri bowl that looked amazing.  I try not to overdose on fried stuff, but sometimes I do get it and it's really good here.  The baskets come with more than enough fish and plenty of fries (that are served in a paper lunch bag) and cole slaw.  The fried salmon, though it sounds odd, is really tasty.  And it's salmon so how bad can it be, right? :)  I also like the clam basket.Their salads are good (though maybe slightly overpriced), and the chicken chili is wonderful.  I love seaweed salad and although it's not on their menu, they serve it and it's very refreshing.  Sometimes I just get that and chili for lunch, because I'm weird like that.They also have a full bar and beer on tap, but I couldn't tell you which ones.At lunch, I have never run into crowds or had to wait.  Some nights it can get pretty busy.  Parking is very limited at the restaurant but there is a lot across the street.

reviews.name: Lacy B.
reviews.review: Visiting Nashville from California we stopped in, and had lunch on the recommendation of another shop owner..My mom and I had the Boston burger. Let me tell you, it was the best burger we ever tasted. The fries were hot, fresh and served in a brown paper bag. We also had the fried sweet pickles which were out of this world!The server was great too! We were very pleased~

reviews.name: Avonel R.
reviews.review: This place was great for a simple week night meal. We ordered the sweet pickle chips and I admit they are a bit different. I'm a pickle lover and these are not normal fried pickles. I can appreciate a restaurant trying something different though and I finished them off. I ordered sushi and my friends ordered the fish and chips. My husband is a picky fish and chips eater and he gave them his seal of approval. My sushi tasted fresh and was quite creative compared to some other sushi restaurants in Nashville. The service I had was outstanding. Our waiter gave us advice on what to order (without being pushy) and frequently checked back on us to fill our glasses. I'll be returning in no time.

reviews.name: Emily M.
reviews.review: One of the best restaurants in east Nash. My bf does not love sushi so it is the best of both worlds for us. I get sushi and he gets fish and chips most of the time. The green goodness roll is amazing. The staff is also very friendly and helpful! Great neighborhood bar and restaurant.

reviews.name: Nicole B.
reviews.review: Last minute New Year's Eve plans. They put us on the list for a table and we found a spot in the bar, where we ended up skipping the table when it came available. Terrance the bartender was very busy but did a great job with everyone. We had the deep  fried cod and chicken strips. The chicken strips were just ok, nothing amazing, normal chain chicken strips. The cod was delish and the fries and onion rings were very good, also. Lots of happy sushi eaters around us! Would definitely eat here again!!

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: I am a little biased about this place because it's a Boston bar and that is my hometown. But, I really dig the food here. Great fried shrimp and seafood platter. About as good as you can get in landlocked Tennessee. Surprisingly enough, they also do sushi pretty well. It makes for a great date place for me and the wife as I can hit heavy and she can eat light. Worth a shot if you want fried fish!

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: Food was good but service was inattentative.  Not rude but just not there, my friend ordered a beer but was never brought, and the promised cole slaw was not on the plate. The server didn't stop by to check how things were so we couldn't even ask about the missing items.What we did get though was delicious but how can anyone not like food fried in batter.

reviews.name: S C.
reviews.review: Visited for a late lunch-- small order of fish and chips (huge portion for one person).  The fish was a bit muddy, the fries were tasty and not too greasy.  Access to an outdoor patio was great but ultimately the menu did not look appealing and the fish was just ok.

reviews.name: Matt E.
reviews.review: I have to give Yelp and fellow reviewers a thanks for leading me to this joint.  It's on the same corner basically as Margot and Marche so it can be easily overlooked, but don't pass it by.  This Boston themed pub style restuarant is excellent.  The name can be misleading though, there's plenty of non-fried foods with its extensive menu.  In fact, my wife and I stuck mainly to the sushi list.  We did start with the crab cakes and cup a of the clam chowder though.  The chowder was as advertised, thick enough to stand the spoon up.  It was really good and creamy.  In fact, I wish I had ordered the bowel instead of the smaller cup.  The crabcakes were nice too.  I would probably try the fried jalapeno chips next time though.The sushi list was surprising. They have quite an array of unique rolls.  We had the shrimp pad thai roll and the green godess. The shrimp pad thai roll was fantastic.  So many different flavors and textures in one roll just typing this is giving me a hankering for one.  The service was excellent.  Our food came out very quickly.  This one is definitely a keeper.

reviews.name: E G.
reviews.review: Not so trendy fish house & joint on the East Side offering excellent fish and chips but barely passable sushi. Outside seating lends to plentiful people watching.Terrific Fish and Chips served in cute little newspaper wrapping and baskets. The calamari is also pretty good but too many tentacles. (Yuck)Happy Hour prices are excellent! . Selection is okay but its not your normal Sushi. Its trendy sushi with strange names (Like the Green Goddess Roll) and the fish is well.......fishy. Blah. But we are in Nashville, right? This ain't San Fran anymore.Service is excellent.  I had some bad fish and the manager took care of it right away, and apologized profuselyWhen I am needing a quick sushi fix, I'll return to B&F, because frankly there are not a lot of options here in this town. When I am craving the good stuff, I'll set aside time, and fly back to Denver for some Sushi Hai!Thee stars for good location, management and services. Love those newspaper wrapping!

reviews.name: Brooklyn M.
reviews.review: This is my new favorite place for sushi in Nashville. The spicy tuna roll is indeed spicy. The rolls are a nice size. My husband loved the miso soup. Service was superb!

reviews.name: Justin D.
reviews.review: I've been to Batter'd & Fried a few times now, and it gets an A+ for consistency. As a native Bostonian I have to say I love the decor, the place just makes me feel a bit at home. I've never actually sat on the dining room side, but it looks nice as well. As for the food, everything I've tried has been tasty. The burger, a little greasy but well seasoned and cooked perfectly is one of my favorites. The buffalo chicken salad is great as well. And a bonus - there's sushi! Actually good sushi -  fresh, well made, and tasty. Sure, it's not exactly like a Gloucester pub and lacks the dark and seedy feel of all my favorite Boston haunts, but for a Nashville joint I think it represents pretty well.

reviews.name: Brandy T.
reviews.review: Hold the flies please! This was the worst I've ever experienced and let me tell you I been here plenty of time. 1st my mother orders  long island tea it came with garished fly 2. I ordered crab cake and it came with bacon. That wouldn't have been a problem if it was on the menu description but it wasn't and I do not eat pork. I mentioned it to the managment in a nice way and he kinda brushed it off. I want be going back no time soon....SORRY 2 THUMBS DOWN!

reviews.name: Mell F.
reviews.review: A perfectly acceptable place for a meal. It's not mind-blowing by any means, but sometimes you just want a decent, sit-down dinner.I ordered the Soup and Salad and a Sushi Roll.The Clam Chowder was very good. VERY thick. Well seasoned. Not real heavy on clams. Filling.The salad was sub-par. Small and had a TON of that fake shredded cheese type product you find on Shoney's salad bars the world over. (Digressing, I took a tour of a plant in Humbolt, TN where this orange-ish concoction is made. Let's just say it's NOT cheese.)The Sushi was fine. It was a shrimp something-or-other with wasabi mayo.Sweet tea was good.Lisa provided us with great service and was the highlight of the evening.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: East Nashvillians I know seem to like Batter'd and Fried. It has a neighborhood feel and is very inviting. The secret to enjoying Batter'd and Fried, as you can probably tell from the reviews, is not...repeat not...to order the fish and chips here. Indeed, the fries are fantastic. The fish was not so good.I was surprised by the breadth of the menu. My friend got a pasta dish that he really enjoyed. We had great service, and it was a pleasant environment. We sat in the bar away from the families with their kids (which there seemed to be several of). I know the owner took some knocks from the Scene when he first opened, and he made some changes. He also has his cell phone number on the web site's home page. Progress is good. Batter'd and Fried also has a sushi menu for your enjoyment. I believe they are working on finding a space for a separate sushi restaurant to open up.The company was good; the food was ok. I'll go back and try something else and hopefully it will be better.

reviews.name: Crystal H.
reviews.review: I love this place! the food is sooo good! they have excellent sushi and the best dessert in the world! which is their boston cream pie!!! it is to die for!!!

reviews.name: Heather G.
reviews.review: food was okay. if you dont want fried, you must eat sushi

reviews.name: Steven M.
reviews.review: Boston-y pub-type restaurant - near Marche and Cafe Margot.  The menu looks like bar food at first glance but it's a little subtler than that.  Clam chowder soup was great.  They use a panko breading on a lot of the fish which is more delicate and tasty than the usual.  My fried oyster sandwich was pretty standard but very delicious.  Good beer, good food, good service.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: Overall: I give the classic fish 'n chips option a thumbs up but the sushi is nothing impressive. Low key/comfortable place but be prepared for it to get a little pricey.Food: My favorite on the menu is probably a salad that has seared tuna & goat cheese (random given the name of the restaurant) but the classic fish 'n chips are good as well (though i do sub out the chips for onion rings - big fan of the onion rings!) The pieces of fish are about the size of 1 1/2 or 2 decks of cards so keep that in mind when you're deciding 1 versus 2. I've heard good things about the sushi, but honestlly, i was not impressed. I had a few of the rolls and the flavors just didn't impress me. The wine/beer/drink list isn't bad but the wine does seem a little expensive for the bottles that they have on hand. (that being said it isn't expensive enough for me to say "no thanks")Location/Atmosphere: Parking is easy & across the street. I've had both good and bad service... the last time it was definitely slow but i couldn't tell you why. It wasn't overly busy, i think the waitress just forgot about our table.Random fact - don't get excited about the tshirts, I don't think they will ever get more sizes. Last we checked, there was an extra small and double extra larges and it has been that way for a few months.

reviews.name: Hillary Y.
reviews.review: I've been here twice and I have a bit of a mixed review.A few months back I came in and had sushi-- the sushi is good, tasty, fresh, and well-prepared. I enjoyed it and thought the next time I'd try some of the fried offerings.We went last night and started with calamari. They were a bit dense and the breading was relatively flavorless-- I didn't ask if they were frozen, but it tasted like they were. We had a pick two plattered and shared-- Haddock and Chicken. The portion size was great. The slaw and fries were delicious. The chicken fingers were from frozen and not that good. They were like dense little morsels of dried meat.  The Haddock was 10 ounces and was just like any other standard fried fish. One chicken finget and piece of fish in I was done, the fried quotient reached, the oil seeping through my pours. I don't plan to come back for the fried seafood. I know this is a beloved spot by many, but I was just not that impressed.

reviews.name: David P.
reviews.review: Freakin' fantastic. Like a Red Sox museum...just with more sushi and fried fish and beer.The drive from the LP Field area to Batter'd & Fried might be enough to scare some unknowing patrons away, but not us. From the outside it looks a little sketchy, but inside the food and atmosphere are great.Definitely not the sort of place you'd order sushi, but we had good recommendations from some friends and past patrons, and they were right on the money. The fish was fresh and tasty and the special rolls were "fancy" enough to be interesting, while letting you enjoy the quality of the fish inside. The fried dessert bites - brownies and cheese cakes - were awesome!To top it off they have a great drink menu, including Sam Adams Cherry Wheat, of which I enjoyed several.Love it. Would definitely make the trip again!

reviews.name: Haines J.
reviews.review: Finallly. After searching the town for some good eats we found a place. In the east side of Nashville a foodies hideaway you will find Batter'd. Took my wife for her birthday to have sushi. It was outstanding. The place is a small house with a lot of atmosphere. The staff was great and very attentive. This is definately on my places to go back to in Nashville.

reviews.name: Leslie P.
reviews.review: We eat sushi weekly here! The green goddess and the woodland roll are our fav! Edamame is always the starter. Kids love the miso soup and burger and fries, plenty of fries served in a paper bag!.  The best sushi in Nashville.

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: I suppose if you are from Boston, it's awesome. Iam not and personally found it to be a a litle off putting. Chips and chowder vs. sushi...ok. Sweet pickle chips tasted like burnt apple slices.(waitress was kind enough to remove them from the bill though.)Clam Chowder was very..."Campbell's thick n' hardy". Decent but not wowing by any means.The sushi was up to snuff, philly roll and spicy tuna roll... but if those sucked we were in trouble.Boston creame pie finnisher... I guess it wouldn't knock my socks off unless they were red socks. Overall... perfectly average.

reviews.name: Sid G.
reviews.review: My wife and I tried this place out a couple of weeks ago and loved it. It's great that your can get some good sushi at a place where fried fish is served. The food was great and so was the atmosphere, especially if you're a Red Sox fan.As with most of the restaurants in this area of town, the parking is limited.

reviews.name: D D.
reviews.review: Just average. My husband and I wanted to try a new place in the neighborhood. I ordered the salmon and a shrimp spring roll. Tasty. My husband ordered shrimp. I thought they were delicious. Our server was friendly and not overbearing. Overall a positive experience.

reviews.name: Eddie D.
reviews.review: The food was good, our server was rude. She acted like any question annoyed her and was not friendly in the least.

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: really a 3.5  above average. yes the fish etc was good and fresh but special. i dont know. i have had the hamburger here and it was amazing and the polish sausage sandwich was amazing. so if u want a great sandwich get one of these two for sure. the calamari would have been much better in a lighter batter like the fish, if i just got the two sandwiches i would give this place a 4,5. best sandwiches around so far. the clam chowder just didnt have much flavor. the fries were better than average.

reviews.name: Dan D.
reviews.review: Batter'd and Fried gets this west end man over to the east side on a regular basis. The clam chowder is excellent, the beer is cold, and the fried seafood is fantastic. My wife always gets (and enjoys) the sushi. The sushi isn't anything elaborate, but it's not trying to be, so we're cool with that. I always go with the Buffalo Grouper plate. But-and this is important-never get the fried fish sandwiches! The sandwiches are uninspired. The bread is bland and there's just too much filler that obscures the flavor. The service and atmosphere are great, and pretty much anyone--families, out-of-towners, soccer players fresh off the pitch--can walk in and feel like they're not out of place. There are those who will call me an unsophisticated heathen for saying this, but I was in Boston a few months ago and I ate at Legal Seafood on Park St. I took about two bites of their clam chowder and I immediately missed the chowder at B&F!Ample parking is available just across the street or around the corner behind the restaurant.

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: It goes without saying that their fish n chips are the best.... But the fried oyster basket.... Amazing.  Sushi is also good but usually slow.  This place is still a favorite.

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: As a Yankee fan I should hate anything Boston.  Unfortunately I found myself living near Boston Batter'd.  To make things even more complicated I found myself a Boston Sports loving mate.  Sue me, I like competition!  Once I got over my initial reaction I was down with the BFB. It's recently popped back into my East Nasty rotation. I don't order the sushi, I'd rather go to Watanabe for that, but I have had the crab cakes and fish and chips.  Both hit the spot and did what they needed to.  I believe the F&C is panko crusted, which made me happy.  Although I could be imagining this.  It's hard because I am IN LOVE with legit fish and chips that come wrapped in paper so everything else is kind of a blur but I remember being content, not blown away.  The fries on the other hand are better than most.  I like the outdoor seating and the service has always been great.  They also have champagne splits.    Solid three stars!

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: Given this quaint little restaurant's name, I'm sure you can venture a guess as to the style and quality of its cuisine.  Batter'd and Fried is kind of like Captain D's in a three-piece suit: it looks great and it's nicer than what you may be used to, but it's still the same greasy fish-lover underneath.Batter'd and Fried is owned by the same fellow who runs Beyond the Edge, and, much like the 'Edge', B & F is a little...theme-y, if you know what I mean.  There is an entire ton of Boston sports paraphernalia and the TVs by the bar seem to be tuned to baseball games year-round.  The bar area feels completely sequestered from the larger dining area, and there is also a pretty lovely patio area out front.  The beer selection is pretty extensive, and they offer several seasonal brews.As far as the food goes--well, how much do you trust a landlocked seafood joint?  It's pretty good, considering.  I like the coconut shrimp, and the fries are frankly some of the best on this side of town.  The servers are funny and pretty attentive, and the atmosphere in the evenings (before everyone ventures out to get hammered in Five Points) is casual and nice.  I've heard mixed reviews about the fish, but my mom seemed to like it.Batter'd and Fried isn't bad.  In fact, it's one of the better places to eat in the Bar Hole (short of Alleycat of course).  They have sushi, though I haven't the guts to try it, and the overall vibe isn't bad.  There's just something about the food that won't allow me to give the place more than three stars.  Sorry, B & F.  I still like you.

reviews.name: J G.
reviews.review: We've been here twice and thought it was pretty good each time.  Both occasions, we ordered the fisherman's platter (or something like that, not sure of the exact name) with fried grouper, cod, clams, then coconut shrimp and butterfly shrimp + fries and lots of tartar sauce, cocktail sauce, and a delicious coconut sauce for the coconut shrimp.  It would be nice if you have the option to have some of the items grilled instead.  Service is pretty good, and atmosphere is ok- patio is nice!

reviews.name: Karen P.
reviews.review: This is one of our favorite places to go.  I love the fact that I can get my sushi and the fiance can get all the fried seafood he wants.  We have always had great service and the prices are fair.  I will say the last time we were there it appears the amount of food on the seafood platter was less than normal.  This is a busy area, with lots of other businesses around so parking can be a problem.  However, if you go early enough on the weekdays or in the afternoon on weekends, you should have no problem in getting a place out front or at the free lot just across the street.

reviews.name: Brian C.
reviews.review: You have to have the chicken chili.  Amazing.  Food overall is very consistent and the service is excellent.  Parking is horrid, but hey..it's local..so it's worth it!

reviews.name: Dan K.
reviews.review: I would say 4-4.5 stars but I feel the other reviews are too low, and I need to balance them out!  All i've had is the fish and chips, but those are definitely 5 stars! Other than a tiny little shop in the UK, these are in contention for best fish and chips I've ever had.  They were quite perfect. Some of my friends got items that they liked less than I liked mine.  I'll be back here when I can.

reviews.name: Ryan B.
reviews.review: What a great find! I love New England and was so excited to find this place.The sushi bar may seem a little out-of-place, but this place was a real treat and my clam strip meal was very, very tasty. I'm looking forward to raiding the menu over time.The service was very friendly and offered help and suggestions when I had questions.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: It's all about the fish and chips, not F&C as we Brits know and love BUT a rather delicious panko stylo fish large pieces and the three piece dinner enough for me and Pablo to share and feel full.  Served in a little basket, pop on your malt vinegar and away you go YUM..Sushi is Ok here.  We have not enjoyed any of  the other dishes on the menu that we have tried.

reviews.name: Scott R.
reviews.review: The fish and chips are not good.  Not even a little bit good. They don't understand the basics of deep frying and it's just not good.  It doesn't matter if they feel like they have it figured out because of their name.  I'm sure some like it, I sure don't.

reviews.name: Erin J.
reviews.review: I like this local, East Nashville eatery.  We eat here quite a bit mainly because it's less than 5 minutes from our house.  The Boston Tea Party is the best drink on the menu - it's cheap at $5.25, and it packs a punch; it's their version of a Long Island Iced Tea.  The typical vodka, gin (they use Tanqueray, by the way), rum, tequila, sweet & sour, but their twist is the final splash of Sam Adams.  Must try.The food is not the greatest, but it's not too bad either.  I like the soup & salad deal - the clam chowder is really good.  The ceviche was not really ceviche - don't order it.  The fried pickled jalapenos were good, but their fried - how can they not be good?!  All their fried fish is pretty good, my favorite being the grouper.  I've had the fried shrimp too which is pretty good.  The sushi is ok, but as most people have mentioned, it's not worth the price.  If I want sushi, I'll go across the river to Samurai.I like the atmosphere here, and always like to support my local businesses.  We'll be coming back!

reviews.name: Brian S.
reviews.review: After another visit, I'm bumping Batter'd & Fried up to a 4.  The sushi is better than a lot of places, and while it's not the BEST sushi in Nashville, it's plenty good and reasonably priced.  And I really dig the atmosphere.  See my original review for a more complete description of likes and dislikes.

reviews.name: Sara L.
reviews.review: Batter'd & Fried has consistently good food and service.  Their fish & chips are delicious and generous in portion.  I have dreams about their salmon Caesar salad.  Tuesdays are 2 for 1 oysters, which is fun.  The sushi is always good.  I recommend the Very Spicy Tuna roll.

reviews.name: L G.
reviews.review: Now I grew up bouncing back between Boston and Delaware so seafood was like a prerequisite of dining for my family. Only in the New England area can you find whole fried clams (clams with bellies as we call them). So when I moved to Nashville 3 months ago I googled whole clams (was craving) and came across this restaurant. My fiancé and I went and I was shock how good everything was! The clam chowder was the best I've ever had actually. As an appetizer we shared the Golden something roll, forgot the name but it started with golden. It was amazing, stuffed with lump crab and avocado. Yum. As for the clams I was not expecting them to taste as good as the ones I've had from Boston and they didn't. Not as fresh as I prefer mine and really not cooked to my standards BUT they were good, don't get me wrong. I'm just used to fresh seafood so I'm biased. But I would get them again for sure. Over all the service was good and the the food was great! I would recommend you to go :)

reviews.name: Ashli J.
reviews.review: I wish I could tell you about the food, but we couldn't get past the poor service to even enjoy a meal. I can't recall a worse experience at a restaurant.Our visit started off with our friends taking us to this place while we were in town visiting.  There was a little bit of a wait and the hostess couldn't really give us an accurate wait time.  When we asked her opinion, she stated to us that she would not wait.  Wow-way to bring in the business.  When we decided to put our name down she became annoyed, as though her job just got a lot harder in order for her to print our name on the paper.   There were six of us and two of us were pregnant.  The guys opted to stand near the door and us three girls found a table to sit at near the bar.  We asked if it was okay since there was a wait and the hostess said it was since nobody else was waiting to sit in that area.   The bar was crowded and a line of people stood even behind the bar stools watching the game. A waiter who was having to slide through the crowd came by and looked at the girl that was standing on the end of our table and said "Can you move somewhere else?"   There was no please...no smile, no offer to take our non alcoholic drink order..no nothing. Just the request, and he walked off.    He didn't bother to ask any of the 20 men standing in the way to move over.  Okay, so they have some rude wait staff...Surely the food is worth the wait and the pathetic lack of customer service.Our guys finally went to the bar and got us a few drinks (non alcoholic of course), dropped off the drinks at our table and then went back to stand out of the way.  The rude server then comes back and asks us if we would like to order something...OBVIOUSLY seeing our drinks and the fact that we had already been sitting there 20 minutes.  When we told him we got drinks from the bar, he threw his hands up and said "PERFECT." And again..walked away without saying anything else.  About 15 minutes went by and we still didn't have a table, hadn't been spoken to by anyone else and continued to receive the evil eye from the rude waiter each time he walked by and had to turn sideways to get by.  We then decided to leave when an Asian looking manager came up to the table beside us to clean it off. I told him I"d like to discuss the lack of customer service we had received at the restaurant and he seemed annoyed right off and continued to wipe the table without so much as some eye contact.  After I told him that the hostess informed us that she would not in fact wait to eat here..he looked at me in disbelief as though I was lying and put his hands up and said "Really, no why would she do that?"  I started to go into detail about the rude waiter but he continued to have this look on his face like he didn't care so we just got our belongings and left.   Again...no customer service when he was about to lose 6 customers...no asking us to wait a moment to see if he could rectify the problem, no apologies..  Wow.  I was in disbelief..how do you run a business like that?Needless to say none of us or our friends have been back.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I have to be frank, I try to support local non chain businesses but this one is not my favorite.  I love the ambiance. It's warm dark wood feels like a New England establishment. Here is what's good, the fries and the hot grouper bites.  I haven't tried the chowder. My husband swears the fish taste little better than fish sticks from the grocery. The sushi is high and just average for the price.    Overall, I don't visit here a whole lot because I think it's just expensive for what they are but my advice is to try it and find that menu item that might work for you.  It's one of those restaurants that I really want to like.

reviews.name: Brittney G.
reviews.review: This New England-style seafood eatery gets bonus points for simply being something different (i.e. not generic American dishes). It gets sprinkles on top for being the only sushi joint in East Nashville. Who wants to go to the mainland just for a California roll?So, I have to admit, I've mostly only had the sushi. The fried calamari appetizer was just ok and the edamame was good (hard to fuck that up). But the sushi menu is where I've spent my time. The have a sizable selection of veggie-only rolls which is a nice feature. Lots of creative rolls for fish eaters with plenty of starter sushi like crunchy shrimp rolls (which I can't seem to find in the Bay Area). Yum.The service is more than decent and the decor is nice. They could stand to have a bigger sake selection, and it is a little weird to see a white boy behind the sushi bar, but I ain't complaining. Overall a nice place for a light bite, so long as you stay away from the namesake menu options.

reviews.name: Brady O.
reviews.review: Food it great - would have given a four if the service was better. It was my 2nd time here and the first experience was the same as the second.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: J.D. the server was amazing.The sushi was high priced, but very tasty.I left feeling better than when I came in. Now that's some good seafood.

reviews.name: Jay F.
reviews.review: Really cool atmosphere at one of East Nashville's coolest corners....good parking available across the street. In nice weather the outdoor patio is a nice touch! I've always liked their clam chowder, and entrees I've had. Waitstaff has always been prompt and friendly, and they appreciate your business. I've been several times and am a satisfied repeat customer, and will send others. A couple times they overdid the salt on the fries, so now I remind them to go moderate, and they've been good. The only thing I wish they would do is bring back the mango tea but other than that, they are quite good!

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: This so far is my favorite place to eat seafood and/or sushi in East Nashville.  It's cool to find a Boston themed place that serves amazing fish and chips as well as great sushi.  I don't think I've ever encountered anything quite like it.  I love their fried pickled jalapenos, but they're a lot on the taste buds so be wary if spicy isn't your thing.  Their coconut shrimp and fried oyster  sandwich are some of my favorites.  They have some unique sushi rolls that are surprisingly delicious, which is one thing you wouldn't automatically think would be found in a fried seafood joint.  They have an outdoor patio which is always a plus, but they're parking lot is teeny tiny and sometimes you have to walk a bit to get there.  The one thing I find lacking about this place is their draft beer selection.  I wish they had more to choose from the best thing really is Sam Adams, which although fitting is not always the beverage I'm craving.  Their cocktails also tend to be on the pricey side, so if you're a liquor drinker on a budget prepare to limit your intake.

reviews.name: Mary B.
reviews.review: I give one for the food, and another for the Red Soxs.

reviews.name: Wes K.
reviews.review: I am married to a beautiful girl who grew up in Wisconsin.  Where she's from, there is only one meal on Friday nights--Fish Fry.So, this isn't Wisconsin style fried fish with a beer batter.  It's still really good, and they always remember to withhold the Lawry seasonings on the fish.  The tartar sauce and malt vinegar add a nice touch.The fries and slaw are both excellent, and the portion size is more than adequate.  The price is good as well.  If it weren't so unhealthy, I'd eat there once a week.

reviews.name: Dessa T.
reviews.review: Ate here on a Sunday afternoon. I love sushi, but arrived with traditional fried seafood in mind, so stuck with that part of the menu. Batter'd & Fried did not disappoint! Had the fried cod, coconut shrimp (which was served with a divine sweet sauce), fries, and coleslaw. The coleslaw was a little too creamy for my taste, but overall, everything was spot on. Oh, and my dining partner ordered the clam chowder - we both thought it was the best we've ever had in Nashville!

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: I'm so enamored by the concept of a restaurant that serves both New England style fried seafood and sushi.  I imagine the founders thinking, "Hey, if there's fish involved we're down."  The fried fish is definitely on the greasy side, but in a very satisfying sort of way.  The fries come in a brown paper bag which adds to the charm and also makes it easy to shake on some seasoning.  The coconut shrimp is served with a dip that is more like icing.  I didn't have the sweet tooth for it, but my table mates thought it was great.This is a great choice if your group can't decide on a food type because the balance of fried and light is definitely present.

reviews.name: Lee M.
reviews.review: I've been back again and the fish was worth the trip. Lynn mentioned about the Onion Rings and I am sorry to hear they were processed.  A place like this should be slicing and dipping their own.Come on Guys, throw an onion on that sushi counter and get busy.

reviews.name: Christine P.
reviews.review: The sushi here is so much fun! I love seeing stuff like sunflower seeds and kiwi on top of the rolls. Very clever stuff. I had a great meal here. Twice! Lots of fun. I didn't try the fried stuff, so I can't speak to that.

reviews.name: Matt D.
reviews.review: The lunchtime martini seemed diluted, and that may be standard procedure everywhere, so I don't hold it against them. Service is usually alright, but the table/chairs/menus/shakers were sticky both times I visited -- like they hadn't been wiped down in a few+ weeks.Both times, I ordered the fried fish po' boy. It was pretty good each time -- as were the fries.

reviews.name: Rick G.
reviews.review: Good food and good service, everything was hot and tasty.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed the clam chowder. I did enjoy my lunch of fried clams, however, my stomach is killing me now! But that always happens to me with friend food anyway. It's the most fried food you've seen... well maybe not if you live here. But it comes with a paper bag full of big, greasy french fries and cole slaw as well. It's a pretty cute little restaurant that most everyone seemed to enjoy in our lunch group. If you have a sensitive tummy like me, maybe try something not so fried....

reviews.name: Theresa M.
reviews.review: it's good mainly because we live so close to it.  I'm not a big fan of eating sushi and smelling things frying, so we usually will go to their sister restaurant, Wantanabe, for sushi.

reviews.name: Molly F.
reviews.review: My sister and I visited this place of few weeks ago and we absolutely loved it! I loved it so much that I probably could have eaten there the next day. The menu had tons of delicious food options. The atmosphere was very neat and upbeat! I would definitely give this place five stars.

reviews.name: Denise R.
reviews.review: Sometimes you just crave a fried seafood meal instead of all of the healthier alternatives!  I arrived right at lunch time and was greeted with a smile . The server asked if i liked the table she suggested before  seating me and i thought that  was very nice.  I immediately was asked what i wanted to drink and was promptly brought an iced tea. The unsweetened ice tea  tasted sour.  (I have this theory that all unsweetened tea is older because most southerners drink sweet. ) I ordered scallops and they came with fries and slaw.  the fries arrived in a brown paper bag and were seasoned well.  I didn't get the slaw due to my dairy allergy so i received the side salad.  it was fresh with homemade balsamic vinaigrette  and was delicious.  The scallops were heavily battered and were the sea scallops but not sweet like you'd expect.  I was also expecting bay scallops..  they were okay.. the cocktail sauce is also homemade and delicious.   The server was attentive and nice.  I think the atmosphere  is nice and casual and customer service is great!I usually ask myself if i'd eat here again and i'd have to say , "yes but to try something else"  It's a second chance . ;)

reviews.name: steven c.
reviews.review: Good location, and overall a cool place.  But the food is ok.  Not much else to say.  So, it gets 3 stars.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: This restaurant has improved dramatically since it first opened.  They wisely expanded their menu from only fried seafood to include some other options.  They have even installed a sushi bar that offeres a fairly good selection of rolls and nigiri.  The fish and chips are pretty straight forward and will probably not dissapoint.  My wife and I usually split a bowl of clam chowder (excellent), a roll of sushi, and an order of fish and chips and we are very happy.  All that and a beer usually runs us about $30 total.  Not a bad deal in East Nashville these days.

reviews.name: brian f.
reviews.review: Been here before... always thought is was good for a fried seafood house. I don't want to bash the restaurant as much as the waitress tonight. I was kind of shocked that she would only serve one person at the table alcohol. She told us that the bartender said we couldn't have drinks served at our table, but had no real explanation why we couldn't be served. That's ok we took the non alcohol service in stride and didn't even complain, but i feel that after the denial we were just forgotten about. I'm from New Orleans and have grown up around great culinary institutes and have never felt compelled to leave no tip, but I did tonight. I even feel bad about leaving no tip but it was deserved. I live in east nashville and it makes me sad to say that I don't want to go back. Thanks for making me feel uncomfortable in my own neighborhood.

reviews.name: Heather R.
reviews.review: This place is awesome! I ate there for the first time today. I really wanted the fish and chips but decided I should stay away from greasy food. I went for the salad and clam chowder and it had to be the best clam chowder I've had since visiting the west coast last fall! I don't get clam chowder that often since it is horrible for you, but decided it was time to have it again! Our large group sat on the patio and really enjoyed our lunch! Our server was awesome! She was totally on top of everything not letting anyone glasses go empty! Some of us got sushi and some had the fried fish and chips and not a soul complained! I can't wait to go back again...guess just not to often since it isn't the healthiest place to go unless you eat salad each time and skimp on the dressings!

reviews.name: Jimmy R.
reviews.review: Really good food and nice environment but you better love fried stuff.

reviews.name: Josh B.
reviews.review: This is an East Nashville mainstay.  They have an authentic Boston-style fish & chips that is excellent.  Also poor a great Guinness!

reviews.name: Mr Mrs J.
reviews.review: I took the kids here for a late lunch over the weekend.  I had the oysters, great! fresh! and kids had the fried shrimp/onion ring and fish and chips.  It was decent for a late lunch around 3pm before the night crowd.  Jason our server was great and the Sushi chef gave Alex a roll of crunchy shrimp which she chowed down.  It seems like a great laid back type of bar/dive.  Decent food if you're looking for something to eat.  Priced well.  Definitely not a kids place after 5.

reviews.name: Paul H.
reviews.review: The service was excellent; our server was quick and responsive to our needs.  The prices were reasonable; a full meal, with a side and a drink was around $15.  Nevertheless, the food itself just wasn't that great.  I ordered fish & chips because with a name like Batter'd & Fried you would think that they would have it down.  What I got was something like fish McNuggets - with a heavy and greasy breading.  The side of coleslaw was dry, and the tartar sauce appeared to be plain mayo.  Throughout the meal, I kept looking over at the table next to us, who had ordered sushi.  It looked much better than what I had, and they appeared to be enjoying it.  So, next time I'll avoid anything battered & fried and hit up the sushi bar.

reviews.name: Albert K.
reviews.review: this is a straight up good place to grab some fish and chips and a beer. i have been twice and both times i have gotten the fish and chips. cod is fantastic, fries come in a paper bag and basket that both come in is decked out in classic newspaper (re)print. my friend had the cod sandwich and the oysters. i didnt try the oyster because i am allergic to shellfish...they looked fantastic.highly recommended.

reviews.name: jacki l.
reviews.review: it seems as if everything for breakfast, lunch or dinner in nashville is fried. what's a california girl to do when she wants GOOD food and has an undying hankering for awesome clam chowder when she's stuck in nashville?! COME HERE. no joke. it was insanely awesome. i stumbled upon battered and fried thru random bar crawls around 5-points. the name wasn't too appealing. [don't let it fool you.] i yelped "restaurants in nashville" and a few popped up. this one had good reviews for the most part, and when it said "clam chowder", i was damn-near sold. it was pretty quiet in there, which was unfortunate. we went in on a friday afternoon...around 3ish. i ordered myself a bloody mary from a really friendly server. overlooking the menu, i was thuroughly impressed. THEY ALSO SERVE SUSHI. they have an extensive list of handmade maki rolls. being korean and japanese and craving seafood, i was game to try how fresh their fish was and how they could pull sushi off in the south. unfortunately between the hours of 2 and 5 they do not serve sushi. we had the seared ahi tuna appetizer instead. it wasn't the best. they encusted the crap out of it, to where each bite tastes like a sesame cracker. i just like the raw fish. if you cut the outer crust off, it's pretty good. they use an unagi sauce on it. like a teriyaki glaze. it would've been better had it had some garlic and ginger. give it some freshness to the marinade. i wasn't sweating it too much because i got oysters on the halfshell that i was working on, and let me tell you, these were the BEST oysters i've had. the liquor was so sweet, they were freshly caught and shucked that very same day and they were effing MASSIVE. amazing.i ordered the surf and turf with mashed potatoes and a cup of clam chowder. BEST CHOWDER. super chunky, from scratch, nice and salty, but not salty from table salt. more like, salty from the sea. mmm. when the steak came out, it was a juicy slab of hanger steak with 4 pieces of shrimp. the mash was freshly mashed red potatoes. good good good.i'm probably going there tomorrow for lunch before i fly out of nashville for new york. yes, it was THAT GOOD!!great food. great service. great selection. i wish i would've come here instead of every other terrible meal i've had to suffer thru.

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: Really happy to see a restaurant move into this space.  It's a New England style fish and chips bar, and the decor is spot-on.  Interesting lay-out inside with the old mahogeny-looking bar in a small space to the left, and a small, warm dining area to the right.  Great outdoor dniing right up to the street.  Small problem, though: food sucks.  All right, its not inedible, but the seafood is clearly not even prepared there.  You can get the same stuff in the freezer section of Kroger.

reviews.name: Rose K.
reviews.review: This place gets 2 thumbs up in my book! I'm in Nashville for a Nutrition Conference and after a long day of learning, our group needed some delicious wine.  We stumbled in during happy hour which was legit--7 dollar glasses and 7 dollar apps.  Worked out great!  The wine was top notch and the apps were delish--especially the fried risotto balls (every dietitian deserves a treat!).We hung out at the bar because there were not enough tables for us but after enjoying happy hour for over an hour, a table opened up and we enjoyed some more wine and apps.  It is a little pricy but the quality of the wine and food, in addition to the cozy ambiance and wooden walls, would make me come back if I was local to Nashville.

reviews.name: Russell V.
reviews.review: I attended a concert at City Winery on July 9,2015. The layout, decor, and overall space is promising for a concert. They of course have an incredible wine selection, upscale bar food, and descent amenities to offer you during your visit. Although the positives for City Winery are plenteous, I would say there are a few areas they kept me from giving them 5 stars.The first opportunity I found was with the valet. Although I read previous post about the price, which is $5, my concern was simply with the staff. These people are your first experience with the venue and they were very unfriendly and uninviting to my wife and I. Yes, you took my car and brought it back to me at the nights end but try and be as upbeat and excited as the workers inside the facility. Secondly, would have to deal with the food. I will openly admit that these opportunities fall solely on personal preference and not solid data but I believe there were some concerns. First, if you are offering a special, only allowed for the restaurant and not the stage area, don't put it on the projectors and show it to me every four minutes. Secondly, 98% of the food offered was not sharable but was also too large. I understand I'm at a restaurant but at the same time I am not. I have experienced in other locations shareable, medium size dishes worked better. Lastly, I didn't enjoy my food. My wife and I purchased the truffle fries and risotto balls for an appetizer then a hamburger, which was a burnt on the outside and raw in the middle, and a chicken dish which my wife enjoyed. The dining is attempting to be upscale and new age but seemed to miss the mark with each selections. The fries come with a garlic mayo which does nothing except take away from the fry. The risotto ball, which should come with marinara sauce, is accompanied with BBQ sauce and spicy mustard. Both offering nothing to highlight the flavors of their counterparts.  You can see the definite potential with City Winery but these are just a few areas where attention could be shown. Lastly, on a side note. If you are going to a concert and truly care about your view and sound quality, I would definitely recommend forgetting the front sections of sits. Although this is usually my section of choice, the venue and atmosphere of food, wine, and conversation with your neighbors really demands you sit in the second section and back. Thank you City Winery, Victor Wooten and friends for an amazing night. Honestly, despite the few comments here in this review I look forward to returning and recommending your venue to others.

reviews.name: Kristie F.
reviews.review: I went to the City Winery during my one day Nashville whirlwind. I went into town for the glaad concert for Love and Acceptance to see Meghan Linsey. As others have said parking is pretty impossible unless you do valet - which is $5. Don't try to park in the adjacent lot unless you want to be stopped by security in a golf cart.Since I had a ViP ticket, I was escorted to my seat. I don't know if the tables are always that close together, but I am on the lower end of a "normal" weight range and I felt like it was a tight squeeze. Not just on each side but even scooting my chair out. The person at the table behind me could not have pulled his chair out simultaneously with me. We were that close.The bathrooms were okay. They ran out of paper towels and they stayed out through the evening.The wine list is not as impressive as the name would lead you to believe. No Moscato anywhere on the list if you can believe that... Not even available by the bottle. I am such a Moscato fanatic (my dog is named after it if that gives you any indication), I would have bought a whole bottle despite being a two drink max girl. But alas it was not meant to be.I wound up getting a burger with those truffle fingerlings with some Chardonnay (sweet, but moscato you were not). The food was... Ok.I hadn't eaten all day. All I had had was caffeine. Caffeine and adrenaline. And somehow I didn't even manage to eat half the burger. I don't know...And I love truffle oil. Truly do. On fries. Tater tots. Grilled cheese. You name it. But, I found these needed salt and some (gasp!) ketchup to go with as they lacked seasoning. Service during the show was good. And quiet. She literally managed to get me my bill without me noticing she had placed it down.I also love the water at the table - reminds me of Bailey's Chocolate Bar in St Louis. It also saves the waiters time.But after the concert, the service was not so nice. A hostess came up to me to ask me where I got where I was wearing. She said another hostess absolutely loved it. I told her it wasn't a dress but a top and skirt but that only the petticoat was still available. She huffed off. Told the other hostess and not so nice commentary ensued after as if they didn't believe me when I said it was no longer available - it sold out circa 2013... Not making it up.The same girl didn't recognize Jamie O Neal later and it wasn't until someone informed her of who it was that she let them up the stairs... Whoopsies! They were quick getting my car out from the valet too.

reviews.name: Kimberly E.
reviews.review: Loved City Winery! The wine was fantastic and the food was even better. I got the grouper and my boyfriend got the steak. Both were delicious, we didn't want them to end! You can tell everything here is made with quality ingredients. We will most certainly be back!

reviews.name: Ira W.
reviews.review: Great music venue. Had their personal pizza which was very good. Wines are over-priced. This is the first establishment I've been in that triples the retail price of the bottle and then adds the TN liquor tax on top of that making the bottle four times the retail price.

reviews.name: Hye Eun C.
reviews.review: I had bought concert tickets here and decided to eat dinner here last minute, as well. First impression walking in: gorgeous ambiance. The lounge area is very open with lots of wood finishings and a round staircase surrounded by wine bottles. Very pretty. Our dinner included: fried risotto balls, chicken fricasse, pork belly, lemon olive oil cake, and a few glasses of wine. Overall, I was pretty pleased with the meal, especially the pork belly which was crisp and succulent. The risotto balls were also good and reminded me of falafel. The sweet jam that comes with the lemon olive oil cake was the best part of the dish, but next time I'll probably order the chocolate stout cake which I couldn't stop drooling over from looking at it from the table next to me. Dinner here is definitely not cheap. Our meal (for 2) came out to be $140 without tip. Plus, they charge an exorbitant amount of tax since they charge you liquor tax as well. Why the establishment (a "winery") doesn't pay it itself is kind of strange.  Also, valet parking is $5. Good luck finding parking elsewhere.
