My wife and I both like hot spicy food and we were concerned at just how hot this would be. Oh explained there is a spice scale of 1-5 (1 being mild, 5 being insanely hot/toilet rolls in the freezer) I opted for a 3, my wife for 2 and we both enjoyed the heat. However, I may have been a tad too brave as by the end of the meal I had broken a sweat which is typically a good indicator that I'm enjoying it! We have been back many times now and always had good food. My personal favourite is the Hung Ray with chicken and the Massamun curry is great (this is my go to dish for providing a baseline of the quality of the restaurant). The pad thai is also very good (according to my wife). My only reservation was on the sesame sweet and sour chicken which, although very lightly fried had little flavour in the sweet and sour sauce. I have to also recommend the ginger ice cream - ginger and ice cream together, does it get any better?This place has been so good that we have yet to try Ginger Thai which we've been recommended to check out.

reviews.name: Samantha B.
reviews.review: I got both the Red Curry and the Hung Ra Curry here and they were both pretty good! I've never had Hung Ra before so I was excited to try something new. I got my food to-go, but I wish I had been able to stay and sit in some of their neat seats. They had like booths with cushions on them. It was a very unique set up and next time I'm in town I'd love to return and stay and eat.

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: I had kind of a disappointing experience here.  My first visit was enjoyable and I thought of Golden Thai in high records.  Now I'm not sure.. I'm of course only talking about the food.  The waitress was very nice.I ordered what is often labeled as Pad-Se-Ew on the menu - wide rice noodles in a brown sauce, with broccoli, a protein, and various other veggies.  No broccoli appeared in the dish... And the brown sauce was really, really boring.  I realize this is often the "staple" plain sauce, but this lacked more than anything labeled "plain" should.  The appetizer sampler was quite good.  There were 3 pieces of everything, so a party of two ends up splitting (or fighting over!) the third.

reviews.name: Katie I.
reviews.review: I'm a sucker for some strip mall ethnic food, and Golden Thai does not disappoint! Awesome appetizer sampler. Love the shrimp soup, think it's called Tom Yum. Great pad thai. Nice atmosphere. Perfect for date night!

reviews.name: Christopher M.
reviews.review: The Spinach & Peanut Chicken is very good (and very rich)! Nice place with great food. Staff is friendly.

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: Golden Thai is one of my favorite places to go. its close to my house, and school, and I love how friendly they are. I usually go during lunch, which you get soup and a spring roll with your meal for a good price. They offer brown rice at dinner, but not sure at lunch. Did I mention how friendly they are? Seriously, every person I've encountered working there, is pleasant. This place is located in a strip mall, but dont let that fool you. The food is great, the staff is friendly, and the decor features artwork by John Hung Ha.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: So sometimes I get a craving for some Thai food and Saturday was that day.  With the entire day to kill and no one but me to please, I decided to try Golden Thai.  Why?  Because it was close, easy to get to, and I figured that I could look around the strip mall afterwards if I was so inclined.Golden Thai is in the strip mall across from the Target on White Bridge Rd.  Right beside the 2 Danes furniture store, near the Radio Shack, and across the parking lot from J. Alexanders.  Although the sign said "OPEN" it looked pretty empty but I went on in.  It wasn't just empty, I was literally the ONLY PERSON THERE!  It was like eating at a restaurant after the end of the world...I'm the only survivor!  In their defense, I didn't show up for lunch until 1:45pm so I don't think it is all their fault - I just eat at off times on the weekends.So let's say that the service was attentive and excellent since I was the only patron.  I got to sit where I wanted, I got my water promptly, and the waitress helped me choose between two things.  I can't remember the official name of what I got but it had stir fried onions, green bell peppers, carrots, and baby corn in a brown sauce.  You have the option of mild, medium, hot, or Native Thai spice and I ordered it hot.  It comes with rice to soak up the sauce.  So I was extremely pleased with the food that came out.  The veggies were so fresh, crisp, and tasted so good with the perfectly hot sauce.  The heat was hot, burn your mouth, but not burn your mouth so hot you can't taste anything else.  I really enjoyed this dish and almost wished there were more to enjoy (oink oink!!).  I also liked the fact that since the place was empty I could eat in peace and read my kindle to my hearts content.  Not too shabby.  Prices for the entrees were a little bit on the high side considering it was lunch and I was alone but it was really tasty enough that I didn't care at all.I am pleased to find this easy to get to, easy to park at, delicious to eat at Thai restaurant so close to my house.  I will definitely be back when I get the craving for Thai food - and I suspect my cravings will occur more frequently now!!

reviews.name: Kalpesh P.
reviews.review: One of the best Thai food I had in Nashville. Perfect spice, great quality and right quantity of food. If you are looking for a high kick in Thai Hot please try Spicy Basil, its the best.

reviews.name: Ellen F.
reviews.review: Lunch here just cannot be beat! A friend and I ate here for lunch last week and the food was fantastic, it came out quickly and the service was top notch. I had a tom yum soup for an appetizer and green curry as my entree. The entree comes with a spring roll and the entire meal was right around $10, not including the tip. My friend had some delicious noodles, soup and it was all very tasty.I LOVE THAI FOOD and will be going back here regularly, especially for the great deals at lunch!

reviews.name: R M.
reviews.review: Spotless restaurant and bathrooms, fresh ingredients across the menu, excellent taste and seasonings and authentic dishes presented with excellent service. Not sure how I missed this place before now. It will be our "go-to" for Thai dishes.

reviews.name: Lalie K.
reviews.review: I would have to say, Golden Thai may indeed be my most favored of all of the Nashville area's thai eateries. They have the best  panang, that is for certain.I am a vegetarian and i LOVE the way they prepare their tofu dishes.The vegi's are always fresh, the service is good.There are truly no complaints that come to mind when i recollect my 50 or so dining experiences at this establishment.It is the most balanced and flavorful Thai food i have eaten in Nashville thus far....i challenge anyone to say otherwise.

reviews.name: Simon K.
reviews.review: Golden Thai, your food is delicious but I only have one thing against you... your prices.The restaurant interior looks great but when the tab comes around, I know that I'm paying for that silk pillow underneath my bum.  The curries are good but as for the Pad thai test, the results came out a little too sweet.  The food is still real good, but not so far superior to justify the prices.  Golden Thai is a one-night stand for me.

reviews.name: Mia R.
reviews.review: This Thai food was terrible!  The pad thai was tasteless and had the texture of glue.  The Massomon curry was floury and bland.  We hardly touched our food and left hungry because it was simply so disappointing.  Will not return.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: One of my favorite thai places in town.   A little on the higher end of pricing but its the only place I've been to that has given me my Pad Thai NATIVE spicy.   Spring rolls and steamed dumplings are always a good way to start off the meal.   I also highly recommend the Tom Yum soup.  One of my favorite places for the soup in Nashville.

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: I've already said that my favorite Thai is Jasmine in Cool Springs, but Golden Thai comes in a close second. It's probably a more authentic Thai experience. If you're a bit of a wuss about spice, make sure you order mild, because when they say hot, they mean hot. My friend who went with me found this out the hard way as she shed tears all over her meal. Good for her though - she stuck it out because hot as it was, it was still "very tasty."The soup is phenomenal, full of lemongrass and basil and shrimp. I would recommend that and the spring rolls. I haven't tried as many things on their menu as I would like, but I was generally impressed. The prices are also really reasonable.

reviews.name: Judith D.
reviews.review: I like the food and the staff has always been very friendly. I'm partial to the "floor" sitting so it's nice to have that as an option. The service is prompt, the portions are large and the prices are reasonable.My only complaint is that we went with my son (11 months old) and did floor seating instead of getting a high chair, this was not really a great idea. I assume they provide high chairs, but I haven't asked (and I will next time).

reviews.name: Christian S.
reviews.review: I moved to Nashville from DC, so I was naturally skeptical when a friend suggested Golden Thai for lunch. I was pleasantly surprised - the service was excellent and the food is authentic.The spring rolls were incredibly fresh, served with a delicious peanut dipping sauce. For my entree, I ordered the red penang curry with chicken - deep flavors and very fresh ingredients shine through. Great value, too - most of the lunch entrees don't exceed $10.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: This is the best Thai food I have had in Tennessee, no doubt. The best dish we tried was the Basil Shrimp with veggies. It was flavorful, the sauce was not overly powerful but still had a punch. We also had beef stirfry, which was good, but not quite as interesting to the palate. The ambiance is slightly romantic, as the lights are dim and there are candles. There is good artwork on the walls if I remember correctly, and the staff was friendly.

reviews.name: Lashona M.
reviews.review: It didn't leave a memorable taste in my mouth. I found a better Thai place that actually has great customer service, atmosphere and flavorful food. Sorry but this one wasn't bad but not good either!

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: The other reviews are so positive! I don't know if things have changed in the last year (since most of these were written) but my lunch was beyond disappointing.I got the spicy basil stir fry, a generic dish I know, but I wasn't feeling too adventurous today. The best word I can use to describe it is juvenile, as in any college student with 15 minutes, some frozen ingredients, and a large handful of salt could have made something similar. It wasn't spicy first of all despite its very name. The presentation was haphazard and resembling mall Asian fare or cafeteria food. It's nice that the entrees are served with a cup of soup, but despite the numerous visible ingredients all I tasted was the chicken stock (now to be fair on that one I don't eat chicken so I might have been a bit sensitive to it).The decor said nice business luncheon, but the food said Drive Thru. All in all it was a lackluster, sodium-filled experience and a waste of my hard-earned lunch money.

reviews.name: Elle A.
reviews.review: Golden Thai is hands-down my favorite Thai place around (and yes, I've tried them all).  Lunch can be a little chaotic service-wise and also, keep in mind they close at 3 usually after lunch and before dinner.  My favorite dish to get is the "tiger tear" salad which is beef that is got so much flavor I don't even know how to describe it.  Briefly, It has a very strong lime flavor and is eaten with big pieces of lettuce.  For my entree, I usually get phaneang (spelling?) with beef as well (you can also get shrimp, tofu, and chicken). It is particularly delicious with cashews added in and washed down with a refreshing Singha beer. Go today!

reviews.name: Kate K.
reviews.review: I've been to Golden Thai for both lunch and dinner and have had consistently excellent experiences every time.The decor is simple, muted lighting, white tablecloths with glass tops. The cushions at some of the tables add some bright colors, but the overall effect of the atmosphere is crisp and clean without feeling sterile. I wouldn't necessarily call it romantic even though there is candlelight, but I had no problem taking my sweetie there.I usually get one of the curries as my entree--there are five to select from, and I always have trouble choosing. My last time there, I chose beef with cashew nuts and ginger, and asked for it "native Thai" hot--you can choose on a five-point scale.Meals start with a clear soup, which as been slightly different each time I've been there. The flavor of lemongrass is a staple of said soup, sometimes with still-crispy bits of cabbage, other times with the subtle nutty flavor of tofu. The  fried spring rolls are light and flavorful with a delightful sweet sauce for dipping.Portions are comfortably sized with plenty of fresh ingredients. The veggies have obviously not been soaking in the sauces, so they keep their crunch and add layers of flavor to their individual dishes. The curry with cashew nuts was loaded with julienned ginger and nuts to the point where I got some of each in almost every bite, and my lips and tongue burned pleasantly throughout. If you like spicy and flavorful, this is the place.For dinner I recommend the duck in red curry sauce--the hottest of the bunch, or the seafood combo.My only quibble is their location, White Bridge is a little out of the way for me, which certainly isn't their fault. Prices are reasonable, and it's definitely worth the trip.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: Went here during a weeknight. They weren't too busy for the time of day. Service was great as my water was always being refilled. We had the chicken pad thai and a seafood soup. Both were very good. We will be going back and eating here again.

reviews.name: Sissy D.
reviews.review: Well I too wanted to like this place, but after today I won't be going back. Staff was very nice, place was 8/10 for cleanliness, but food; over priced and over cooked! The chicken and shrimp in my pad Thia was powder dry and truly just tasted like the pad Thia you get in those little microwave entrees, and his sizzle beef was over cooked also. We ordered crab cakes as an appetizer and it looked like wet cat food with a tiny amount of crab shards inside it. My hubby said this is like rubber, and it was. I was so embarrassed I refused to let my hubby pay and I ate the check this time.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: Out of all the Thai places around town, Golden Thai is my favorite. As I have previously stated, 3 weeks in Thailand has made me a serious Thai food snob, and though every place since my trip pales in comparison, Golden Thai is about as close as it gets in Nashville. Their Pad Thai is quite good, however, their Tom Yum coconut milk soup is absolutely delicious. I love spicy, like seriously spicy, and this is the only place that actually makes my food spicy when I ask. With its authentic upscale looking Thai décor I can guarantee that you will enjoy the experience; if you are feeling adventurous you could even try having your meal while sitting back on one of the futons.

reviews.name: Alex N.
reviews.review: Service can be a bit slow, but their duck has no match in Nashville that I know of. Other dishes are very good, with coconut milk being a bit thicker/richer than at Royal Thai (or should I say "cocnut" milk, as per their menu? :)). Their number system for how spicy food is is consistent and easy to remember.

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: I hate to be the first to give this place a not so great review. To be honest I really wanted to like this place and very much expected to  walking through the door. The place is clean, well lit, has great art work, and even "floor" seating. When we walked in the place was empty except for one other table. I had been craving curry and tofu and so I ordered the Massman. We also both ordered a cup of hot tea. They brought us a teapot of the jasmine and two cups. (One weird thing about the tea was that we were charged for two hot teas. Which wouldn't be weird except that individuals had the same size pot of tea just minus one cup.) The curry was good and had a lovely flavor but the tofu was terribly lacking. There was about half as much of it as expected (or as compared to other places with similar prices), It was cut into tiny cubes, and it wasn't quite as well cooked as I would have liked it. (keep in mind that i'm pregnant and tofu was what i was craving).  At some point during our dinner the flood gates opened and the service went completely down hill. Think no refills and the phone ringing off the hook with no one to answer it. We waited for a long time just to get our check (we even out right asked for it but were ignored by our waiter ) and finally had to get up and go to the hostess at the front to pay. The hostess then had to track down our waiter (okay the only waiter) and go through all of  the other checks to find ours. We finally escaped. I do want to go back and try again. However I much prefer Siam Cuisine just down the street. The place might not be as "hip" but the food and the service are always great.

reviews.name: Eve P.
reviews.review: Nice ambience, but the food was so-so.

reviews.name: Jeanette C.
reviews.review: Can we say Goozy is Yummy! My nieces and I stopped by here after having dinner for a quick dessert. I ordered the chocolate chip skillet cookie, my niece ordered the smore, and my oldest niece ordered the chocolate sundae. Each one of these were exactly what we expected from a good late night dessert.  The Gelato is a must have when you go as well. They also have entrees on their menu and the next time we come here we will try a few to see if they are as good as their desserts.The staff were excellent from the moment we walked in they made us feel welcomed. The server we had answered any question we had with a through response. The atmosphere was a laid back chill kind of place. A cute place to hang with friends or a date.  If you are around Hillsboro Pike and have a sweet tooth drop by and check Goozy out.

reviews.name: Hye Eun C.
reviews.review: A small but cute place to stop by and grab a sweet dessert. Goozy offers several dessert options, including a gelato selection. I tried the dark chocolate gelato and it was pretty good. They also offer a selection of dessert wines to accompany your sweet treat. I thought it was particularly cool that they had a vinyl record section (albeit small) and customers are allowed to select whatever record they wanted Goozy to play. Unfortunately when I visited, the record player was out of order. Bummer. Cool concept though. For those with a sweet tooth, Goozy may be worth a visit. I'd prefer to stick to the savory though.

reviews.name: Kimberly S.
reviews.review: I had a great quick lunch today at Goozy. The set up was a little confusing for a first time-- I wasn't sure if it was counter service or full service. The man behind the counter was very helpful and guided me quickly to a table. I was the only customer in there at 11:30 so the service was very quick and attentive, which is always appreciated when dining solo. I had their lunch special of the day, which was a half of a Classic or Nashville melt and a cup of soup. I opted for the Nashville melt, which had pimiento cheese, Benton's bacon, and jalapenos. It was a tasty combo, but the bacon could have been crunchier to make it easier to bite into and there could have been a touch more cheese. It just wasn't quite spread to the edges. The tomato basil soup was very good. The special was only $6.00, which is maybe the best deal in town.I look forward to returning when in the area and trying some dessert!

reviews.name: Joy G.
reviews.review: Solid late night eats, with a focus on coffee, drinks, and desserts. Full bar, homemade gelato, skillet cookies, gooey butter cake, and even homemade smores. Coffee ($2.50 per cup)is smooth and full flavored.  Cabernet was nice, but a little expensive ($10 per glass).  Most desserts around $6 price point.  Great place to go after a movie, when everything else seems to be closing.  Small space, and kind of noisy, but very tasty and most things reasonably priced.  Service was excellent, and menu surprisingly large for a dessert bar.  Will return. Nashville needs more places like this!

reviews.name: Rolanda R.
reviews.review: I love this place....sandwich  coffee  and dessert...totally enjoyed  this experience....thank u Nashville for a cute coffee bar with a twist

reviews.name: Emily D.
reviews.review: WOW holy yum!!! I was not expecting my taste buds to have a spiritual experience when I walked in. My friend and I decided to try out Goozys and literally everything we got was flipping delicious. I got a salted caramel latte to begin with-- muy bien then I ordered the chili and my friend got the artichoke melt and whoooooaaa we ate every bite both we could not stop talking about it. Then for desert I got the salted caramel gelato and my friend got the croissant pudding and whoa I wish I got what she did the bread was warm topped with gelato and caramel sauce it was heaven with every bite. Even was our server super nice and accommodating. Absolutely will be going back great for coffee and a dessert or a nice lil lung to catch up with friends. They have a huge selection of alcohol too which is fabulous~~~

reviews.name: Christine A.
reviews.review: The delicious and spicy turkey tortilla soup was a big hit! It came with jalapeños and arugala floating on top. YUM! This little place has lots of seating in and out with fairly fast service. Soups, salads, sandwiches and their homemade gelato and ice cream plus coffee drinks. Add the liqueur of your choice. Oh yes, my friends...lots of liqueur options! Salted Caramel Gelato was yummy.

reviews.name: Neisha C.
reviews.review: Holy cow. I came here before work and his food is so freaking good. It didn't take long for hem to make my food, but I definitely expected them to just whip out some pre made sand which. BUT NO! The guy made it fresh! Right there before my very eyes. It's a really cute joint with a a super laid back vibe. The sandwich was so good and the cheese had so much flavor!!! I was hesitant about the jalapeños but MAN! They really added the perfect kick to the sand which. It was on sourdough bread and grilled which gave it a nice crunch! And plus the sand which had bacon...everything is better with bacon.

reviews.name: Marie L.
reviews.review: Apparently if you order special drinks or any meals off the menu, you are taking a gamble on service and quality.However, we came here just for dessert following another wonderful night at TPAC.  We strictly had water to drink and we tried a chocolate pan cookie with gelato and a type of butter cake.  Both were exceptionally delicious.  The service was also top notch.  Our sever came to our table and went over the menu with us and asked if we had any questions.  We had a nice conversation about their various treats and the server's input helped us decide what to order.I'm really surprised at some of the negative reviews but again, we did not order any kind of food or special drinks.  The only negative thing I can think of is that the place is a little small, but otherwise it was a great experience.  It is also a little on the pricey side but the quality made it worth the money in my opinion.  I'm sure we'll be going back soon for some more yummy treats!

reviews.name: Tara K.
reviews.review: Noticed that the former Christie Cookie company location is now Goozy. My husband and I were curious so we checked it out.  Little did we know how unique and tasty this place had become!  They sell desserts and craft beer and liquor galore!  And they have creative concoctions blending the different flavors and delights!  They also sell sandwiches too. I wanted to try everything but had eaten dinner prior.  We had the chocolate chip cookie in a skillet, and it came with vanilla gelato.  It was nice and gooey by the time it came out - so good!The place also has an obscure collection of rock albums too so you almost feel like you're in a Hard Rock Cafe but much more quaint and smaller and secluded....We definitely give this place a thumbs up on creativity and for satisfying our taste buds!

reviews.name: Allie W.
reviews.review: Fun restaurant concept but the food was pretty average. I love wine cheese and desserts so this place sounded perfect. I ordered the grilled cheese with the Mac and cheese in it, it was good but pretty overcooked--parts of the bread were blackened. We did get the gooey butter cake which was yummy, though weirdly cold on the outer edges and delicious and warm in the middle. Still, a good restaurant I will likely try again!

reviews.name: Robert D.
reviews.review: The primary reason I'm giving it a 4 and not a 5 is because it is tiny and probably hard to find seating for lunch. However, it was not a problem at dinner.I wanted to try Goozy after hearing good things about it and I'm glad I did. My grilled cheese (with mac and cheese and bacon) was excellent and went perfectly with my tomato soup (my wife did not like her sandwich as much, which had ham and onions on it; she said she should have got what I ordered). We both loved our desserts: I ordered the maple bacon sundae, which she ordered the chocolate raspberry cake with coconut gelato (I think hers was a bit better this time). In all, it was a fun change of pace and we'll be back.

reviews.name: Christina C.
reviews.review: I seriously debated for quite some time whether to give 4 or 3 stars, but for my first experience here, I do have to say it was just "A-OK." I love the entire concept of a late night dessert cafe which I've longed for many times in Nashville. Goozy gets it right with solely focusing on sweets for that late night crave. I love that they also have a small food menu if you're more than just dessert-hungry. Also, I thought they wouldn't have any cocktails since they opened up only a few weeks ago, but I was proven wrong. Their sippable menu actually looks solid. I know that Goozy still has some kinks to work out. I definitely want to come back and try their other desserts and hopefully when I do, things will be smoother and I will post an updated review at that time.So for my experience here... I drove in to the parking lot and saw the huge billboard sign that was lit up with "Goozy." Super cool. BUT. Under its name, it said "coming soon" so that sort of confused me since I knew it had already opened for at least a few weeks. I loved the interior, atmosphere, and the menu design. However, one thing I noticed about the menu was that there was a heck lot of chocolate treats. I'm more of a berry/fruit/vanilla kind of gal and the night I went I wasn't quite feeling chocolate so my choices were left to four options under the specialty desserts. All the Goozy cakes were chocolate cakes, so I felt a bit left out in that area. I'm not quite sure if Goozy cakes are supposed to all be dark chocolate molten cakes (?). I ended up ordering the Pot de Creme with a side of Cinnamon gelato. This is when I started feeling a bit uneasy about things here. I ordered this mainly because the menu said it comes with "fresh berry compote." I wanted this for the berries (!!!!). I finally got my order and ... no berries :(. I thought it might have been tucked inside the custard, but no. All I got was chocolate custard and the cream on top in a small cup and my gelato. 1. the gelato was fantastic, 2. the custard itself was not too sweet (just how I like it), but a bit thicker than I expected, and 3. no berries :(((((((. I politely asked the server whether I was supposed to receive berries with my order and she went back and checked for me. She ended up bringing me a small side of the berry compote (I really liked it!!! Could only taste sugar from the fruit, so nicely done) and saying that the menu was printed wrong and the fresh berry compote was supposed to be for the item above. I looked back on the menu and the item above Pot de Creme is the Crostata. I'm pretty sure the Crostata isn't supposed to be eaten with fresh berry compote... So not really sure what happened here.Something else I'm confused about - I read an earlier review here in which a scoop of gelato was added to the S'mores order for only $1. When I ordered my gelato along with my specialty dessert, I paid $3 for that addition. What is correct since I didn't see anything written out on the menu about adding gelato for just $1? :(((((My partner ordered the Raspberry goozy cake which we both liked. Also ordered amaretto gelato which was SO YUMMY. Overall, good service, ambiance, and gelato flavors. For a dessert cafe, though, I did expect a lot more out of my specialty dessert since I felt like I paid $6 for a small custard cup of plain chocolate cream. Maybe I ordered the wrong thing or the most boring dessert item. Anyhow, I want to come back, try the skillet cookie and eat more gelato. I'm hoping they'll have these little issues I pointed out solved by then.

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: WARNING LONG POST AHEAD! :-) Our night was a disaster. Much to our dismay our group of 7 could've made out better eating at the Wendy's next door than dining at Goozy. Arrived at 6:30pm for a friend's bday celebration and a couple minutes in two ladies sitting next to us whispered in my friends ear that they hoped we would actually get our food tonight. Apparently they ordered a cheese plate, drinks (which one of the ladies asked for a refill on her wine that never came) and they also ordered dessert and THAT never came, so they left. Now stay with me it gets better!We started to worry, and was it warranted! Our sandwiches took 40 minutes for us to get. Sandwiches. A Tuesday night. One of my friends orders was wrong (it happens) and she had to wait another 20 minutes for a BLTC with no cheese! How hard is it to put together such a thing? And another warning: do not get a side salad instead of chips bc all it is-is a spring mix with dressing drizzled on it.... No tomatoes, no cheese, not a single crouton, just lettuce. For a 2 dollar up charge! I would've much rather stuck with the chips and just not have eaten them which is basically what I did with the salad. And my friend and I both ordered the BLTC and there was no "L" on either of ours.... No one had much to say about their dinners. Honestly nothing special. Oh and we ordered dessert in the middle of eating bc we knew we'd have to wait... We didn't get our desserts until after 8. Most of them were good. The lemon pudding one was our least favorite. I only ordered gelato... As I was getting near the bottom there was a HUGE long piece of straight hair in it that I coincidentally was pulling out of my mouth as the server came up to our table. Thankfully our server handled that well and didn't charge me for it.The bread pudding came out with no gelato or syrup on it so we had to track down someone to ask for that. It was just a mess. How do you forget two main ingredients on a dessert at a place known for desserts? It's a small place and the tables became full after we ordered yet we were the last ones to get anything. Just seemed very disorganized. Our waitress was nice and apologetic to us after one of my friends finally spoke up bc not only did we wait on our food, but we waited forever for our checks. It was just one disaster after another. To make things go a little quicker we decided to each go up one by one to the counter and pay for our meal individually. Another friend was up there and the waitress was ringing her up; meanwhile, the manager (we didn't know she was the manager) asked how everything was- my friend just said "ok" then proceeded to talk to the waitress who was again apologizing... My friend was saying to the waitress that it was just a shame bc we had high hopes for the place. Then the manager got snippy with my friend saying- "Wait a minute, you just told me everything was ok and now you're saying it wasn't?! I need to know these things...." Not sure what else was said exactly, but she was rude to my friend and did not show good customer service. Sorry for the long post! So much went on that I just had to get it all out :) it's safe to say that we will not be returning to Goozy.

reviews.name: Chris P.
reviews.review: Pros: desserts are excellent, open until later than most placesCons: overpriced for small portions, very cramped environment

reviews.name: Coco D.
reviews.review: I had the Artichoke Goat Cheese with sun dried tomatoes. I had rosemary and olive oil deep river chips. Hat sandwich is always soooooo delicious and they serve it hot.

reviews.name: Dez S.
reviews.review: Amazing grilled cheese (with mac & cheese in the sandwich!) on Tuscan bread. Desserts to die for including Pot de Crème (chocolate custard). Great staff.

reviews.name: Steph C.
reviews.review: The grilled cheese sandwiches were delicious and cooked perfectly! We enjoyed the chips that came with the sandwiches.  The dessert menu was large; we had a hard time making a choice. We ended up getting the oatmeal raisin cookie skillet, s'mores, and bread pudding. We would definitely get all of them again!

reviews.name: S G.
reviews.review: It should not take 20 minutes to make a grilled cheese when there is all of one other party in the place.  Even if the food is good, which I may never find out because I am still waiting, I do not plan to return.  Now that I finally have my food, I'm happy to report that the grilled cheese is delicious. The tomato basil soup is also tasty, but served warm rather than hot.  Work on the timing and I will come back. Not before.

reviews.name: Anna L.
reviews.review: Awesome dessert place, which is rare for this area. The atmosphere is very casual. The cookie skillet is on point. Good selection of gelato too.

reviews.name: Jamia R.
reviews.review: Best place for grilled cheese and dessert. Absolutely delicious. I'm definitely coming back!

reviews.name: Joshua S.
reviews.review: We went here because Goozy was featured in Nashville magazine as one of the 37 best places to eat, and because the reviews on Urbanspoon and Yelp appeared to solidify that ranking.  Either Nashville has really low standards or we're missing something entirely.It's not that Goozy is TERRIBLE.  I think the concept is ingenious, seeming to be geared towards parents with kids (saw lots of kids, had a couple of my own) and giving something to everyone.  I also happen to be a big dessert fan, so Goozy definitely sounded right up my alley.  It's the execution that needed help.Some of my hangups:- our server repeatedly forgot to bring out drink orders, we never received a refill on water- our server/bartender wanted to make a fruit cocktail out of my Old Fashioned, but thankfully I've come across more than one inexperienced bartender and saved it from a terribly syrupy demise.  though i can't help but speculate that she thought i was crazy for requesting a real Old Fashioned, and not her muddled version- i was told (without asking) Benton's bacon is sourced locally.  it's actually made outside Knoxville, and I'm really questioning just how local that is.  not that it matters, but don't tell me you serve food sourced from local farmers if I would have to spend a whole day just to get to the farm.- my creme brulee had virtually no taste.  i LOVE creme brulee, and if its on the menu, I'll order it.  But this one seemed to lack taste and consistency (a bit lumpy).- service took an extraordinarily long time bringing our desserts and getting us checked out.All of these things made for a very lackluster experience, and I suppose I had higher expectations for a place touted as one of Nashville's places to eat... it was all just very forgettable.

reviews.name: Tetsuo S.
reviews.review: Good beers and all kinds of desserts I could live here. Pretty sure I'd pick this place for a "last meal". Only thing that would make this place better would be larger portions, open 24/7 and maybe be married to whoever makes this stuff

reviews.name: Angie T.
reviews.review: So many times I've wished for a late night place to grab a dessert. This is the spot. Quaintly tucked between Talbots and Sugar Dive, Goozy is Now Open and fabulous. We tried the Salted Caramel Chocolate Goozy and the Bacon Sundae. Both, as well as our coffees, were excellent. The place can't seat 50 though, so try it soon before the wait lines form!!!

reviews.name: Elizabeth E.
reviews.review: There are no words to fully articulate this goodness, but if we had to choose one it would be DEVINE. This was our first time at Goozy and we loved the whole experience: people, service, vibes, and eats. We tried the pear + brie sandwich, lentil soup, lemon dessert and torched smore. Each dish had its own unique flavor with a modern twist that left us completely satisfied with our decision. We also chose a record to put on and had a blast perusing the impressive collection. We will definitely be visiting Goozy again soon! It's a new Nashville hidden gem!Try it out, people!!!

reviews.name: Elise L.
reviews.review: I love the concept of this spot! Somewhere to grab a cocktail or some very delicious dessert! They also have food too.We went to grab something sweet. My husband got the crostata, which was great. I had the S'mores  and added the Jack honey gelato for $1 more(they have many to choose from). It was delicious! We didn't 't try a cocktail although the recipes looked good. Another cool thing is that they have a collection of records that you can choose songs from and they will play them for you. They also close later, which is great if you wanna grab some dessert and a drink to hang out for a bit. All around good experience. I think it's a great edition to the Green Hills area. I posted all the menus in the pics section).

reviews.name: Leslie L.
reviews.review: After several unsuccessful attempts to get to this place with a friend (due to illness and ice), we finally made it to Goozy last night! The atmosphere was different than I expected...it looked more like the inside of an ice cream shop than an actual cafe. We each ordered a dessert- she got the double chocolate cookie skillet and I got the chocolate goozy cake...both were delicious! It was a little pricey in my opinion (especially knowing that I could get a massive slice of cheesecake at Cheesecake Factory for less, our other go-to dessert place), but I will definitely go back and try some other things on the menu.

reviews.name: Molly N.
reviews.review: We tried to get in at Cheesecake Factory for dessert.   Wow can I say I'm glad they were 110 min wait to let us head a bit down the road to Goozy!   5 of us dropped in for some treats.  We had Nutella Goozy cakes with amaretto gelato.   Perfectly melty lava cake with great chocolate Nutella sweetness.  My son had the chocolate Goozy cake and didn't say a word till he was done eating. Which is saying a lot for an 8 yr old that would rather fill his mouth!  We also has the choc chip cookie and vanilla gelato perfection  baked crispy on the edges warm with the creamy ice cream.    Service was friendly and quick.   Skip the big places and head here for the treat.  Super close to the bluebird and open late so would be great in combo with that!

reviews.name: Joe W.
reviews.review: Two things you should know. I didn't actually eat here and it was busy.  Went in for a post dinner and a movie snack.  Once we decided we wanted to eat there, we opted to sit outside. We were told that someone would meet us outside and it never happened. So we left. I doubt I'd be back because there are so many other places to eat, but i can also see why its not necessarily their fault.  Didn't feel welcomed.

reviews.name: Steven C.
reviews.review: Nice place and interesting concept but it wasn't what I was expecting when I walked in. Small dessert list and too formal. Prices are too high for what you get. I spent over $10 on 2 medium size Mochas. I will most likely not return. Nashville has a large selection of cafes that are more reasonably priced.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: I got woozy at Goozy. Just a bit. Goozy is great in Green Hills, by Whole Foods. The amaretto-infused toffee cake I let melt in my mouth gave me a woozy sugary high aided by the dash of alcohol I enjoyed. The plain ambience of white painted bricks, black vinyl floor and the simple silver stool I sat on belie the gourmet quality of the pastry. A chocolatey dessert here pairs well with a Lindeman's. I'll be back for a shake and smore.

reviews.name: Greg B.
reviews.review: Really really good sandwhiches and salads. Nice beers and cocktails.  Awesome dessert.  Kind of small so frequently crowded.  Come at an off time.

reviews.name: Bob F.
reviews.review: Took my daughter for her 5th birthday. It was a huge success. I think that most of the sweets, while thoroughly enjoyed by the kids, went over their heads. The adults however were blown away. It was a party of 8 so we got most of the menu. The salads and soups were good sizes and very tasty. The sandwiches were amazing. The grilled cheese would be hard to beat. Dessert was the kicker. The skillet cookie was one of the best I've ever had. We will be back for sure.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: If you like sweet and gooey food, this place will be right up your alley. Fun spot to come at night for dessert and a night-cap. Good menu for both late night snacks, decadent desserts, coffees and cordials. Be sure you order one of the cookies that come in a caste iron skillet. Be prepared to wait as the seating is limited.

reviews.name: Ashleigh B.
reviews.review: The food here is delicious (5 stars) but the service leaves something to be desired (2 stars), which is why I'm giving it three stars. The grilled cheese with macn cheese is delicious!! As is the individual cake. I got mine with Nutella and really didn't want to share. So don't come during the lunch rush but come hungry!

reviews.name: Truc L.
reviews.review: Finally! Nashville has a cafe that has a good variety of desserts and is open late! We've been to Goozy several times already and have loved everything about it. Their grilled cheese sandwiches have a good balance of cheese and toppings, though I'd definitely classify some of their sandwiches as a panini rather than a grilled cheese (which was a source of discussion over dinner). We got the roasted root vegetable salad as a side to our sandwich, and it was *fantastic*. The wife got the mac and cheese which had a good blend of cheese, giving it the right balance of sharpness and richness. The serving portions were just the right size to make sure we had room for dessert! The Goozy molten cake can best be described as a cake wafer that is covering a ramekin of molten chocolatey goodness (flavored with raspberry or Nutella if you wish). The chocolate comes from Olive & Sinclair and is dark, decadent, and delicious. We have also sampled their croissant bread pudding (topped with whiskey caramel sauce, pecan brittle, and Jack & honey gelato)  as well as their Nutella waffle cone sundae (topped with cardemom soil). Both were also very good, though we would have preferred a waffle bowl instead of a waffle cone to more evenly distribute the ice cream & toppings. As a rule, we try to avoid the craziness of Green Hills at all costs, but Goozy is definitely going to be a regular exception to that rule!

reviews.name: Basak K.
reviews.review: The BEST indian restaurant in Nashville. I actually feel like I get my money's worth here. My OrderUp portions were actually an acceptable amount of food. I didn't feel like I only got 3 pieces of chicken in my Chicken Tikka Masala - which is a staple and very flavorful. They seem to be one of the few places that serve Dhal Tadka - I may be wrong but it does seem like most places only do Makhani. I will keep coming back here every time. I've never gone wrong.

reviews.name: Erin W.
reviews.review: I've had worse, but its the most BOOOOORRRRRRING Indian food I've ever had.  Asked for spicy on the aloo gobi and masala. Got anything but. And the salt. A little too hot and heavy.At best, it was a watered down version of good. On a high note: I ordered delivery and it came piping hot and earlier than the ETA.

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: The lunch buffet special is a great deal at $9.99, and it will have your favorite Indian dishes like Tandoori chicken, tikka masala, and classic vegetarian dishes. The interior is kind of small, but feels intimate. They have maximized seating space by adopting a family-style long table situated centrally among the booths. Anyway, this is a great place for Indian comfort food. I will say, though, that if you want a larger buffet and menu selection, go to nearby Sitar Indian Restaurant further east on West End. Sitar has far more tables, easier parking, and utilizes less ghee (clarified butter) in their dishes than Bombay Palace.

reviews.name: Bruce K.
reviews.review: Good service in a nice restaurant, but I have to say that the "spicy" wasn't all that spicy. Maybe they thought I was kidding and so they didn't add spice to it. But I thought I knew what I was ordering when I asked for a Lamb Rogan Josh "spicy" with riata, garlic naan and mango chutney. Oh, well.I've lived in London for two years so I think I can tell what good Indian food is about. Or at least "Anglicized Indian" and this was more "Americanized" which is okay. There was plenty of lamb in my curry and the sauce had good flavor aside from being not spicy enough for my preferences.The lamb was nice and meaty, not greasy or with any detectible gristle. So there's that going for it.

reviews.name: Madi L.
reviews.review: My family and I frequent Nashville Indian restaurants often and find that each has strengths coupled with major weaknesses. We collectively decided Bombay Palace is our favorite dinner spot for several reasons. First and foremost, each beautifully presented dish encompasses the spices and seasoning combinations of authentic Indian food. The papdum is peppery, crisp, and served with 4 contrasting chutneys and sauces each exploding with flavor.  For the entrees, my personal favs are the chana saag, vegetable korma, and saag paneer. The portions are perfect for the prices and service is consistently prompt with servers who seem to genuinely appreciate your business. When compared to other local Indian spots, Bombay Palace excels in all aspects we find relevant. Above all else, the qualities we like about this place are unwavering, which is what keeps us coming back.

reviews.name: Victoria T.
reviews.review: I was really looking forward to the meat samosas (my favorite Indian dish) but was a bit disappointed in the pastry (a little doughy) and the filling (cold in the center).  The only thing that saved them was the best tamarind chutney that I've ever had.  It was fantastic.The mixed grill was pretty good with a hefty portion and flavorful seasoning.  The seekh kabob was a little on the dry side but was also flavorful.The garlic naan was pretty standard, nothing exciting about it and nothing awful about it.The waiter was a attentive without being annoying and the cost of our meal was on par with every other Indian joint in the area.  The dining room was a little dingy and worn out but comfortable enough.

reviews.name: Jamee C.
reviews.review: Addition to my previous review: the staff is so friendly. It's so worth being a regular here.

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: Great Service. Kept water and spice tray filled at all times. Place was quite busy, and never had to get the waiters attention. Good food and fresh. Had chicken mango curry and meat samosas. Ordered it medium spicy as it was my first time dining here. Will go with hot next time. Don't be afraid!!!

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: I've made the rounds for Indian cuisine over the years and Bombay Palace remains my favorite. Their lunch buffet is very good with little surprises here and there complimenting the usual Indian fare like curry chicken and vegetable pakora. Their dinner menu has all the highlights you'd expect. Mixed Grill, chicken, lamb, vegetables, etc. I would never claim to be an expert on Indian culture and food, but I know what I like. My family has eaten regularly at Bombay Palace for a couple of years now and have not been disappointed. Out of despiration we ate there on a Christmas day when nothing else was open and had such a wonderful experience we've made a tradition of it.Service is good to great, depending on the server and day, but over-all has always been satisfying. Many times our toddler son was the center of attention from the friendly staff.The parking sucks, but that's West End for you, not Bombay Palace. The environment could use some sprucing up lately, but has always been clean. If someone says "Indian food" I always default to this place.

reviews.name: Hall W.
reviews.review: Okay... So this place is super interesting for me. The Indian food here is rather authentic (just be warned that if you never been to Indian food before - the food here is insanely hot - even if you get medium spice)...The food is fresh though (get the garlic naan) and the service was wonderful...but I had to give this 4 stars because:1. The interior decoration is rather sad looking... and drab. It is a huge mismatch given how the servers here are wearing bowties and suits.

reviews.name: Steve C.
reviews.review: Unbeatable place to go for a Indian lunch buffet. The veggie curry is really good! the rice pudding dessert is the best after the full meal. Service is professional too!I'd prefer to go there for lunch buffet only, cause you can have more types of curry during the lunch time.

reviews.name: Alvin P.
reviews.review: It's a good place.  I've been here twice, but the first visit was years ago, so going off my latest visit.  The parking is a bit tricky, there aren't a whole lot of parking available, since there are stores nearby that need the parking as well.  It's in the middle of Vanderbilt, so parking can be a bit scarce, although there is plenty of police around the place if you feel like being given the right to park on the main road for a fee and a free pep talk.  I ordered out from the place, and I have to say, the food was good.  It's not my favorite in the city, but it's open a bit later than usual, and the portions are pretty big.  The restaurant is a bit on the small side, so inside is a bit congested, especially when there are a lot of people around.  The service was also good, the person that handled the order (I believe was the manager) was friendly as well.  I ordered a decent amount of food because I was coming back from a trip, so needed to restock the fridge, until I worked the magic in the kitchen (or ordered out again).  I'm vegetarian for the most part, so this review doesn't deal with the meat, poultry, or seafood section.  First up to the plate were the samosas.  They were fairly large, and tasted good.  It has nice flavor, and the dip was nice, which is the standard tamarind and the green chilly sauce.  It's samosas, so unless you slept or bribed your way through Indian Culinary school, it's not hard to screw up.  Batting second were Onion Bhajia.  These were good.  They are not the best I've seen, but I haven't seen this option anywhere else in Nashville.  And I love these, so just by having these gets a special place in my heart.  The Malai Kofta was decent, albeit it needed a bit more flavor.  There was plenty of it to last about 3 days, and it goes really well with the rice they serve you.  It's great with naan as well.  The Malai Kofta is probably my standard curry order at most restaurants that serve it, so it was nice to see that Bombay Cafe had a nice tasting option.   The Aloo Paratha wasn't that great however, I think it was definitely hard to bite into, felt as if I needed to sharpen my teeth halfway through the meal to chew it.  The taste wasn't amazing, but I think it was just heightened by the effort it took to chew through it.  Overall, I think this is a place that falls in the 3.5 star category, but since they had one of my favorite options in the Onion Bhajia, I had to bump it up to 4 stars, since I like that they differed a bit from the standard choices around there.   I think this is a good place to check out every now and then, when you need some Indian food in the city.  It's not the best, but from the ones I've tried, I think this is second on the list in Nashville.

reviews.name: Reed A.
reviews.review: Disappointing. The vegetable korma was all greasy sauce and barely any vegetables. There was also a cherry in it which totally grossed me out. Not a fresh cherry, one out of a jar. How could that end up in there?!? My husband got chicken tikki masala which was ok but mostly sauce as well. The garlic naan was the only thing that was edible.The vegetable samosa tasted like burnt oil. All this goodness for $40. The only thing that could have made it worse is if we ate in instead of getting it togo bc the restaurant is outdated.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: Very good food and service so nice. Their buffet is usually interesting as well as great food cooked to order. Loved this place from the start even though there are 3 other Indian establishments within 3 miles. House wine is cheap too so a nice spot for the weekend if u like wine. Butter chicken and lamb are the favorites.

reviews.name: Ron B.
reviews.review: I've been here twice -- both times I was in nashville I ended up ordering from here. Both times it was solid. I think I got lamb saag the first time and the 2nd time, Tandoori Chicken. It did what i needed to do, was priced where I expected for that kind of thing and so...I don't know what else to say about it other than that. Good place and chances are, when I'm back in Nashville I'll probably be back again.

reviews.name: Mark D.
reviews.review: Went here for the lunch buffet (of course) and was not disappointed, all my favorites (tandoori, saag, pilak) plus some new things to try. It was all very good and authentic. Cramped space though, tiny restaurant with limited seating.

reviews.name: Kelsey S.
reviews.review: Delicious food and great service!Had the lamb korma, my fiancé had the chicken tika masala and we both got garlic naan and a mango laasi!Atmosphere is dark, lit with candles, but with bright colored furniture. Not the most fashionable, but the food makes up for it.Portions were good and they gave unlimited rice.I was very very impressed by the service! Drinks always refilled! Even when not under a half a glass! Asked for a to go box and brought it out with rice and also gave me a bag, without me having to ask. I enjoyed my experience!

reviews.name: Kristen P.
reviews.review: Great food! We are vegan, so we ordered a bunch of vegetable dishes and samosas.. Everything tasted so fresh and delicious. Would definitely recommend. Delivery to our hotel was quick and easy too.

reviews.name: Oscar A.
reviews.review: Don't get deceive from the appearance of the restaurant.  This restaurant serves one of the best Indian food I've tasted.  Friendly service.  We ordered Mix tandoori, lamb karaihy, goat vindaloo, paneer chilly, meat samosa, mix meat briyani, .....

reviews.name: Vivian H.
reviews.review: Food: Papadum--as soon as we were seated, they gave us two baskets of papadum (a thin, crispy fried flatbread) and some sauces and chutneys to go with it. All of the sauces were delicious and I liked that papadum wasn't overly filling the way bread is (I tend to get almost full on bread at American restaurants and not have as much room for the main course).Garlic naan--I ordered a basket of garlic naan which came with 3 pieces. Great flavor of garlic and herbs and a good price at $2.50Shrimp bhagari--I was trying to decide between two shrimp dishes and the waiter recommended the shrimp bhagari. Definitely a good choice--it was a creamy, tomato sauce that was slightly sweet and tangy. I'm generally not a huge fan of Indian because I find a lot of the different curries to be overwhelming in the use of different spices and have a muddled flavor profile but this dish was more up my alley. The shrimp was perfectly cooked and despite being in this sauce full of Indian spices, the shrimp stilled retained its sweet, shrimpy quality. All of the entrees come with basmati rice which went perfectly with the entree.They have a heat scale of 1-10 and I ordered mine a 3 which ended up not being spicy at all. I tried my friend's dish which was a 9 and that it wasn't insanely hot as I thought it would be. If you want some actual heat, I would recommend ordering something higher than a 5. Mango lassi--what can I say, I've never had a bad mango lassi and this was no exception. I like that they put ice in theirs as I've had practically room temperature mango lassi at Sitar (the other Indian place near Vanderbilt) before.Price:This place is definitely on the pricey side--the dishes are in the $13 to $20 range and the portions are fairly small. My shrimp dish was $15.95 and came out in this small copper dish in this special holder with a candle under it. I wish there had more pieces of shrimp (I think had 6-8 pieces) as it was mostly sauce. However, despite the small portion, you do end up being pretty full because you eat it with the rice. So I didn't leave the meal hungry by any means but it did feel like I paid mostly for rice.Service:Very friendly wait staff. When we asked for more papadum the waiter said "no problem, I'll bring that right to you" but are food came just a couple minutes after and I guess he forgot about the papadum but no biggie. Otherwise, they were super friendly and informed us that the rice was complimentary and unlimited so when we were low on rice and asked for more, they brought out more right away.Environment/Ambience:The decor was that of your typical old-school Indian restaurant. The place was pretty clean and they wiped our plates with how towels right before placing them in front of us which I appreciate because I've been to plenty of Chinese/other Asian restaurants that using super dirty dishes and silverware.*Overall positive experience, despite being a bit price I would definitely come back because practically all the Indian restaurants in the area are around the same price range.

reviews.name: Loralyn D.
reviews.review: Great lunch buffet!  Lots of options, good food, quick and easy.

reviews.name: Steve W.
reviews.review: I love Indian cuisine & don't know why it took me so long to visit this place but I am so pleased I did. The ambiance of the place is relaxed with booth seating & the floors, toilets & table linen were pristine. You have complimentary pickles & popadoms which we enjoyed, the popadoms were the best I have ever tasted & the pickles were mild to medium heat. The menu is pretty extensive & I chose the Chicken Madras & my wife had the chicken & mango with a Naan side. You select your heat preference from a 1 - 10 scale to cater for all palate's. The service was just the right level & the smartly attired waiters all speak good English & are very pleasant & polite to deal with. They had a good selection of Indian beers & spirits. I will be back whenever we go downtown & it is my choice of restaurant.

reviews.name: Megan A.
reviews.review: This place serves great authentic Indian food. We have been here twice, once with our one year old and once on a date. Both times we have be very impressed. My husband is from England and is picky when it comes to Indian. We have been on a week day and on a Friday night. We had a short wait on Friday night maybe 10-15 minutes. The onion bhaji is a delicious appetizer. It can be compared to onion rings. The onions are rough cut, battered and fried with Indian spices. It's very good.  We have ordered 4 different curry dishes, two chicken and two lamb. Every dish has been very flavorful and spiced how we ordered it. My husband usually orders medium or spicy. I get mild. We love the Bombay place we definitely will continue to eat there. The service is occasionally on the slow side. But overall they are very attentive and great.

reviews.name: Aisha H.
reviews.review: Solid 3 stars. Pretty good variety on lunch buffet but typical style food with an overbearing tomato feel to some sauces. Palak was good. Got fresh naan and that was awesome. Service very good; tables always kept clean and water glasses full. Parking a little touch and go when busy because it's right off a busy road near Vanderbilt.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: I have to say that Bombay is one of the better Indian restaurants I have ever had. I ordered the chili naan and the aloo gobi. First of all, if you enjoy naan (and let's be honest...who doesn't?!!) and you appreciate a little spice then I would highly recommend the chili naan. It was a perfect match for my Aloo Gobi. The staff was extremely friendly, even when I showed up 15 mins late to pick up my take out. Do you have a taste for Indian food and live/staying within driving distance of Bombay?! What are you waiting for? Stop reading this and order!!

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: The $10 lunch buffet is pretty awesome.  It doesn't look like they offer that many choices but its more than enough.  I actually enjoyed everything that I tried and I'm a pretty picky eater.  This is a great option for those who are going vegetarian or people who are trying to eat less meat.  This is automatically one of my new favorite restaurants in Nashville.

reviews.name: Max K.
reviews.review: Great Lunch Buffet.my wife and I loved it.

reviews.name: Wayne M.
reviews.review: The food is delicious, I enjoy the buffet that they have.  The staff is also friendly. I dislike the uptight weird customers however. Every time I go I get funny looks as if I don't belong there.

reviews.name: Brandy D.
reviews.review: I LOVE this place and go at least once a week--hands down the best Indian in town, plus the guys there are super kind and friendly, and know my order (and me!) well by this point! Woodlands may have better food by a smidge, but I love chicken tikka masala, so... (also, I prefer the Northern/Pakistani style Indian over the Southern Indian style...). It's changed owners a few times, so even if you've been before and haven't been impressed, give it another go (now it is owned by the same folks who own Sitar)!

reviews.name: Jason C.
reviews.review: Phenomenal food and the best indian in Nashville. The food is always fresh, flavorful, and well priced. Hard to beat the 10 dollar lunch buffet special. The chicken tikka masala is delicious.

reviews.name: Teresa D.
reviews.review: delicious food. arrived via delivery hot, which is amazing. we will be repeat customers.

reviews.name: Will P.
reviews.review: Chicken Lajawab was fantastic

reviews.name: Chandler C.
reviews.review: Good, consistent service. Very friendly staff. Food is very good, not life changing but it is worth while. Honestly thought it is hard to complain about this place.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: i know i said this about the last place.... but this place has the best samosas ive ever had.

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: Amazing and authentic cuisine. If you need a sinus cleansing, go for the Vindaloo. Chicken or Lamb either one is phenomenal. One portion could easily feed two. I'll keep them on my speed dial!!!

reviews.name: Rebecca B.
reviews.review: This is a great lunch buffet. Good variety, wonderful service! Very affordable. There is no "American fluffer" buffet items like fries and chicken nuggets.

reviews.name: Ed W.
reviews.review: Bombay Palace is a solid spot for Indian food in my opinion. My staple at all Indian restaurants is the vegetarian thali, as I really prefer to sample all sorts of dishes rather than choose a larger serving of one.  Here, the vegetarian combination meal came with the normal staples and choices. But, what made it extra enjoyable for me was the spice level. I asked for a 7. It came out every bit of 7 that I could have imagined. If the 7 was a 7, I am impressed with whoever can eat a 10. I would absolutely come here again when in Nashville and seeking good, reasonably priced Indian cuisine.

reviews.name: Kimberly A.
reviews.review: Decided to stop in for my husband's Father's Day brunch ... Indian style. Not impressed with the selection for the buffet. One meat option? Just chicken? CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA was not the usual creamy orange hue I'm used to and was not as spicy as it usually is. This place caters to sensitive palates. Turn up the heat folks! But this would probably scare away all the kids from the place. I've never seen so many kids at an Indian buffet...All the veg dishes --- CHANA MASAL, DAL MAKHANI, VEG KORMA were way too watery for my liking. I felt like I was being cheated out of the $10 buffet fee. Highlights : 1) they had this awesome FRIED INDIAN BREAD that I've never had before2) their FRESH FRUIT was fresh and sweet

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: Here's the secret to loving the place. Go right before or right after lunch rush. The food is delicious, plentiful, and the wait is not there. If you go right at 12 you'll hit the doors with a hundred people trying to cram into the place and get stuck behind the "ooh, what is this? I wonder if it's spicy... Jim, do you think this is spicy?" person.Park in the rear of the building and go in the back entrance. It may look like you're walking through the kitchen but it is an entrance and will save you being crashed into by someone doing 80 on West End.I've never ordered anything but the buffet here, so please consider this a buffet review only. I've never left and not been very happy with everything except the amount that I chose to eat. The people are always friendly and prompt with the water an naan deliveries, except from 12-1 when too many people are there. Seriously, even going at 12:30 gives you a great experience.The only thing I'm not a huge fan of there is their salads. Just seems a bit too plain for the flavor explosion that everything else is.Other Indian buffets seem to range from too hot to too dry to flavorless mush, and that's never been my experience at Bombay.

reviews.name: Cody H.
reviews.review: I love this place!  The food is always very fresh and tastes really good.  Price is fair as well.  Just don't plan to go to the gym immediately after finish eating here.

reviews.name: Jane C.
reviews.review: Best indian food ive ever eaten all over the world and they offer you a dining experience with beautifully set tables waiters in semi tux attire who know the food and can answer any questions im so impressed with this restaurant which looks unassuming from the outside but does indeed offer this palacial dining experence from the moment you walk inside.  I cant say enough good things about this restaurant to do it justice!

reviews.name: Robbie Q.
reviews.review: Everyone here is friendly and the food is as authentic as it can get. I'm a regular. I come in and they know me by name and pretty much know exactly what I'm going to order. Great for take out too. Go here.

reviews.name: Danny K.
reviews.review: Great for a quick fix of Indian food and worth a visit if meat is a necessity with your Indian meal (chicken, goat, lamb, & seafood).  For strict vegetarians, I'd head to Woodlands.  Like most Indian restaurants, the dinner menu is much better than buffet. The servers are very polite and nice.  Take out is very easy and always includes a free desert dish.

reviews.name: Len C.
reviews.review: My wife and I are likely moving to the area soon and LOVE Indian food (my wife is from India) and based upon the reviews thought it was a great place to try... We where wrong.I love chicken tikka masala (aka Butter Chicken) for its creamy and complex depth of flavors and this place had 'none' of either.  It was, sad to say, the worst I've had ever to include frozen meals.  No Biryani (Wtf?)... No free refills on drinks...??? There was a lot of people there but all American and so far of all the places I've tried I've noticed a trend.  If Indians don't go there usually there is a good reason.The Tandoori Chicken was alright but that must be easy to make since it has been alright everywhere I've gone.Lastly, the buffet was not very big and personally I don't find that too much of an issue as long as what is on it is great but seriously... I don't get the raving reviews... clearly something has changed or I'm missing something major.Seriously... Horrible Butter Chicken...

reviews.name: Becky C.
reviews.review: Ever since my husband left the Air Force and we moved back home, we have searched for a good Indian restaurant. I am happy to say we finally found one in Bombay Palace! My husband got the goat curry and I got the chicken tikka masala. Both were absolutely fantastic! The garlic naan is also delicious! We will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Stacey M.
reviews.review: This review is for DINNER from the menu. We've had both the buffet and the menu. The lunch buffet is, unfortunately, a total let down but the dinner menu food is absolutely delicious. We've had the Chicken Makhani, the dahl, goat curry, different kinds of naan, the beef samosas and a bunch of other items. They are always delicious and expertly prepared. I would totally recommend this place for DINNER but would not recommend the Lunch buffet (only one meat option, just didn't live up to the food on the dinner menu at all).

reviews.name: Matt D.
reviews.review: I still love this place but there is a new owner and maybe a new chef in the kitchen. I still like the food but things are a little different. I have not made my decision yet.

reviews.name: Todd G.
reviews.review: Bombay used to be my second favorite Indian restaurant in town...second to Woodlands. My last couple visits, however, has them falling way down the scale. I have heard that they have new ownership and from what I can tell also have a new chef and menu. The Food this last time tasted totally different and NOT in a good way. Almost everything we ate was bland and fairly tasteless...a lot of the dishes overly oily , the Chana Masala watery and runny. I doubt that I will be back. This is a shame as I really enjoyed their menu.     If you are in Nashville looking for a quality Indian Restaurant then please try Woodlands, just up the street from Bombay Palace... it is a much better option.      I am sure we will see the rating for Bombay slowly decline as more and more people realize that the Bombay that they loved is no longer around.

reviews.name: Lars H.
reviews.review: I hadn't eaten all day, went with my fiance to have late lunch. They were a bit rude since we came 35 minutes before closing. I love Indian food and most of their stuff was pretty good. The reason they get a 1? I got the worst FOOD POISONING of my life from what I can only assume was undercooked chicken. It lasted several days before I finally decided to take some imodium.

reviews.name: Diana S.
reviews.review: Bombay Palace is the best Indian restaurant in the city, and I have been to almost all of them. The service is impeccable; gracious, swift, eager to please yet not hovering. They also remember repeat customers and treat them well. The food is always delicious, from the complimentary pappadam with chutneys and raita at the beginning to the mango lassi a creamy, fruity cold drink which in my opinion is best saved for dessert.My favorites on the menu are many: if you are looking to avoid the calories that come with the delectable sauces, definitely go for the chicken tikka, flavorful and bright red from the yogurt marinade, tender and juicy from the tandoori oven. Served sizzling with onion and peppers, it is a guilt-free choice that leaves you sated. If you aren't counting calories, amp up the volume and go for the chicken tikka masala, served in a spicy, creamy, fiery red (in color only, unless you specify otherwise) sauce. The korma is excellent. Your choice of protein served in a rich, nut-based sauce perfumed with spice. The vindaloo is also delicious, as are the saag paneer, madras, and most other items you might choose. The only time I ever had anything that was less than wonderful was when I ordered a broiled chicken dish that was flavored with mint and other spices. It was traffic light green, which was ok, as it was from the green herbs, but the meat was just a bit dry, unusual for Bombay Palace.I have never been there for lunch, but apparently it has an amazing buffet where you can experience many of the dishes listed above, for a budget-pleasing price. Which the dinners also are, by the way. At $13-$15 per entree which provides enough food for dinner and lunch the next day (especially since they give you extra rice when they pack your box), ordering off the menu is also extremely affordable.

reviews.name: Laura P.
reviews.review: Great food, drink and service! We had a party of two that spontaneously and unexpectedly turned into a party of five and they didn't hesitate to change our table arrangements (after we had already ordered). The food is delicious and that's coming from a person who didn't like Indian before she came here. Will come again and bring friends.

reviews.name: Jessica N.
reviews.review: We love this place! The food is really good, and the service is great. From the outside it does look like a hole in the wall, however that is what makes it such a find! The inside is warm and happy. We try to go a few times a month. Their lunch buffet is a great deal and is always fresh.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: Annnd we're back to 4 stars!Ordered take out last night and had the Mango Chicken, Chicken Jal Frazie and roti. It was excellent! Only complaint is that the spice level was swapped on the dishes, (mine was medium, my friends was hot) but that's OK. It was still delicious and not greasy like last time!Thinking my poor dish was just a fluke due to their high volume of customers. Keep it up!! :)

reviews.name: Richard B.
reviews.review: Visiting from NYC and walked over from the Marriott. The food was excellent and service was great. I ordered the combo dinner and asked to substitute one of the dishes offering to pay more. The honored my request and didn't charge extra. Great Indian food in Nashville!!!

reviews.name: Rex B.
reviews.review: Had dinner here for the first time last night, it was very good. Had a lamb rice dish, I can't remember the name. It was a bit spicier than I'm used to, even though I had asked for it mild. But it was still delicious, and the portion was generous.Really liked the naan bread, very fresh and soft. And the mango lassi was good as well.

reviews.name: Zeus T.
reviews.review: things have changed alot, and for the better with the new chef. Sitar used to be the best buffet close by. now, hands down without question the best Indian in town is Bombay.the lunch buffet is about $10. it has a good selection. the chicken tikka masala is excellent and the best in the local area. the vegetarian dishes (such as saag, etc) are excellent as well. obviously, Woodlands Indian is going to reign supreme as the vegetarian king, but Bombay is great as well. I am an avid fan of Indian food, and have had Indian in large east coast cities (where there are larger Indian communities). but Bombay stacks up quite well in comparison. even the little things are great: the unlimited, oven fresh naan; the fresh, cold, crunchy onion chutney; the tangy sweet tamarind chutney that is perfectly seasonedif you order off the menu, the food is even better. the portions are large.the service is excellent. obviously when it gets crowded, it's hard to take care of everybody perfectly. but at most times, my glass is constantly refilled and the naan keeps coming.I am genuinely impressed. I stopped going to Bombay 2 years ago because I was not impressed. I cannot compliment enough the food from the new chef.

reviews.name: Michael T.
reviews.review: Have to try the chicken shorba best I've had. Regular stop for me when I'm in Nashville

reviews.name: Corey W.
reviews.review: I've been here a few times mostly for dinner and if it was based on the quality of service alone I'd give them 5 stars. Love the lunch buffet but bad idea if you are planning on going back to work, for you and your coworkers.It is not a very expensive place (not cheap either) to eat dinner but the wait staff treats you like you are in the Ritz hotel. Courteous, professional, and prompt. They have their timing down so that you never feel over whelmed or forgotten. And I am a sucker for any waiter who gladly takes your leftovers and boxes them for you. Always a nice touch. The space they are in though is a little cramped. Cozy though. Good for a date, I feel like it would be bad if you had a party of more than 4.The food is good. Quality Indian staples (or at least what an American would expect to find) AND they serve goat! I love this fact because not to many places around Nashville do. Of course if goat is not your thing (your loss) the chicken and lamb is wonderful.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Awesome lunch buffet with fresh naan and good food. Not the biggest variety of food as far as buffets go, but the dishes they do serve are delicious. The chicken is very juicy and tender.As for service, it's hard to comment on it because I've only been for lunch buffet so there was not much service required. It does tend to get packed very quickly for lunch, so plan accordingly. Luckily my friends and I got in right before the noon rush and had a table, but a few minutes later there were lines starting to form.

reviews.name: Dhara P.
reviews.review: Food was prepared quickly and delicious. Service was wonderful. We were checked on enough and with politeness and smiles. Prices were also great! Would recommend to anyone in the area who loves Indian food or wants to give it a try.

reviews.name: Micheal P.
reviews.review: I wasn't really impressed with Bombay. All of the dishes I tried were fine, because Indian food is delicious, but they didn't live up to the standard set by other indian restaurants.If you go to Bombay, you're already so close to Woodlands... and if it's meat that you're looking for, go to Sitar. Their chicken korma is far better!

reviews.name: Stlouis C.
reviews.review: Stayed at nashville overnight. Visited this place because of good reviews. Had vegetable thali- which had one naan, soup, steamed rice, three entree samples and kheer As dessert. Overall very impressed with quality of food and with service. Prompt and polite staff. restroom was also clean. Good ambience. Will visit again if in Nashville

reviews.name: Catherine W.
reviews.review: I have been here too many times to count and never have I been disappointed. Their Saag Paneer is the best. They have so many selections on the menu, there's something for everyone. I've taken children there, and they've eaten all their food. You can choose how spicy you want your food- unless it's the lunch buffet, then I think it's an assortment. Try their different naan breads, they are delicious! I tried their rice pudding last night, delicious too!Update: I still give this place 5 stars!
