There have been 2 times that the food tasted a bit off, like someone forgot to follow the recipe, but it was still good. Plus, they remedied the problem when we told them, without a fuss. This place is delicious.

reviews.name: Jessica H.
reviews.review: Man, this place is awesome! It's in an unassuming location but I really liked the vibe inside. Cloth napkins and water goblets, oh yeah. I had the Malai Kofta and it was absolutely delicious and then I dipped my garlic naan in the sauce...YUM. I forget what my friend had but it was also a really great vegetarian dish. It took some time for our meals to arrive but the servers were friendly and our water was never empty. And it all came at a very reasonable price. I cannot wait to go back and try more dishes! I was so impressed with my first visit that I can't wait to give pretty much everything on the menu a try. Loved it.

reviews.name: Joey R.
reviews.review: I've always gone there for the all you can eat buffet. It's generally been pretty good. I'm not savvy enough with Indian food to really rate the food as outstanding, but I always enjoy it. It's got a pretty casual atmosphere. It's a pretty good deal for the money. I think it's like $10 which is just a little more than if pay for to pick up food elsewhere. I just have to limit that good bread so I don't fill up on it.

reviews.name: Cher Y.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed my meal here as the food is very tasty, fresh and well balanced in spices and aroma which is the hallmark of great indian cuisine.  Minus one star in terms of the service - spotty refills of anything including water, waiter always acted rushed - not sure if they were understaffed that night. The food is deserving of 5 stars for the Nashville area.Pros:-The food is fabulous and authentic- nice mix of meat and vegetarian dishes- Great variety in menu- Great variety in drink options- Ample parking in the back of the restaurantCons:- Not a lot of seating, feels compact- Mixed waiter service- waiter messed up my spice level preference, didnot check on us in a timely manner for water refills, rice, naan and all other basic stuffOverall, I look forward to my next meal here and exploring the rest of the menu!

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: Best Indian food I've found in Nashville. First, the food is fantastic. I usually stick with chicken dishes but got the lamb and goat at the servers recommendation on a couple of occasions. All dishes have been great. Second, the service is great. They're always quick with appetizers and drinks. Keep up the good work!

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: I've spent nearly a year in India in my life and can tell you hand's done this is the most authentic Indian food in the city of Nashville.  The lunch buffet is $11 and incredible.  The naan is fresh and unlimited.  I can't comment on service as I've only been during lunch when it's very much what you'd expect of a buffet style.  Park in back to avoid the fiasco of West End.

reviews.name: Terry S.
reviews.review: Giving this a middle rating in the hope that my experience tomorrow evening is better than my last visit. After a very long time enjoying this as the best of the bunch in town, with the best chicken 65 anywhere, I was disappointed to find the ownership had changed, the chef gone and the food dosed with so much salt that it was almost inedible.  Found the owner in Cool Springs, still without his chef, but that's for a different review. Will post again in two days.

reviews.name: Eileen C.
reviews.review: I went for the $10 lunch buffet. It was AWFUL. The staff were very kind and helpful in pointing out which dishes were vegan (on my visit, two entree dishes and one appetizer, plus rice and naan). Mainly, the food was lukewarm and stale. The cauliflower fritters were probably pretty good right after coming out of the fryer but the batter was kind of soft and tough by the time I got to them, which was only mid-way through the lunch service.The cucumber salad was a large bin of shredded iceberg lettuce with about 4 thin cucumber slices left. There was apparently no intention to replenish that, as I made three passes and it looked just as sparse and sad as the first time around. (Come on, all you had to do was slice up like TWO cucumbers.)That was one of the most depressing restaurant meals I've ever had, second only to takeout from Satay Thai Grill the night before. In both cases, it wasn't due to lack of vegan selections, but rather, the mediocre quality of preparation. If it hadn't been for the unlimited naan, I probably would have left the restaurant feeling genuinely angry. Granted, this was an AYCE buffet, but it's also the only thing anyone in the restaurant was eating, so it seems like a little more effort would have been in order.There seemed to be a fair number of regular diners at Bombay Palace when I was there so maybe I caught them on an off-day. I'll never know though because I'll never go back there again.

reviews.name: Marian C.
reviews.review: I had no idea what to expect! People either really love this place or really dislike it. My 4-star review is based on my overall experience. Food was not the most amazing...I've had better tikka masala and no samosas on the buffet makes me sad, but other dishes were surprisingly good like the mango chicken, some yellow yogurt curry dish, and saag. The people that worked there kept the buffet STACKED with food. Big bowls kept appearing to replenish the buffet. The naan was super fresh and plentiful. Basket after basket after basket kept showing up. That mint chutney was delicious too! Just not too many different meat options. Mostly chicken and a fish dish among the veggie dishes. The place was super crowded with a wait and no open tables. The kicker, it was all for $10. And for me, that is what bumps my overall experience from a 3 to 4 star rating. Had the price been more lofty, I would not give as high a rating. It was still tasty, great price, plentiful food, great service, efficient, and fresh. I'll be back!

reviews.name: Jigna S.
reviews.review: We went for the lunch buffet so didn't expect much anyway. Indian restaurant buffets options are never going to be as good as sit-down menus. The nonveg options were only chicken and all bland. The chicken biryani tasted more like pulao and wasn't at all spicy.  Same goes for the veggie entrees...not at all spicy. And the dessert..i think they attempted to make a mousse but ended up with pink colored whipped cream. Service was good though, and the naan was hot and seemed to be made to order. Again...it's a buffet so can't expect much.

reviews.name: Mary V.
reviews.review: My favorite Indian! The outside is unremarkable, but the service is excellent, the food presentation is good, and the dishes are delicious.

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: There is an ancient Indian saying - "if you see fewer Indians than others in an Indian restaurant, the food must be really good. Or expensive." Or something of that sort. The food is not terribly expensive, but it is impeccably good. BP, as opposed to its rival, Woodlands, right across the street, specializes in North Indian cuisine. Their naans are fluffy, their curries flavorful and perfectly spiced and their appetizers mouth-watering. The place is a bit cramped and can get crowded around dinner time, but the wait is worth it. I don't have to add that vegetarians get ample choices, but I must say that meat eaters can peck at some delicious Indian dishes. I have been tempted more than once to dig into the tandoori chicken that seems to be happily swimming it its own sauce.

reviews.name: Blair S.
reviews.review: We decided to help a friend "practice" for a trip to India and heard this was one of the most authentic Indian restaurants in the area.  Everything we ordered from the dinner menu was good. The spice was mild, so next time I'll order hot instead of medium. At my table we had the combination platter for two, tandoori chicken and chicken tikka masala. We also tried chai tea (a recommended treat for a cold day) and a poori. For dessert we had kulfi and kheer. I preferred the kheer.Service slow at the start and one item was late to the table, but overall it was good and everyone was friendly. Prices are slightly high but reasonable for the area and quality.

reviews.name: Huyen T.
reviews.review: I went with a friend right after going to the mall, the place was packed but it wasn't loud at all. Once we got in, we can smell the delicious spices. The atmosphere was comforting for the lighting was dim. There was a few table that was reserved, but was given to us as soon as the other guests that asked for reservation arrived. Our waiter was very nice, our glass of water was refilled quite often. This was my first indian food experience...so I didn't know what we should do. When we sat down, they served us these flat crispy chips...i'm not exactly sure what it is. but it remain me of the vietnamese rice sheet. and along with it is 4 type of sauces. Looking around, i figure how we would eat it. You mix the 4 sauces together on a plate and dip the chip and eat it. I ordered the Bombay special dinner. It took a while for the food to come out because they had to grill the chicken and naan bread.I loved the naan bread with the Vegetable korma (which was yellow and sweet. yummy). The rice was a little dry, but it balance well with the dishes that was very flavorful. Overall, the experience was really good. I would recommend this place! We didn't finish our dinner, so we asked for a to go box...and our waiter gave us some dessert to take back. It was very sweet of him!

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: Matt was singing Bombay's praises and despite my confidence in his opinions, I was sure this place couldn't live up to the hype. I shouldn't have doubted, he's a trained chef and Dudney knows his food...Bombay Palace was amazing...and Matt picked up the check! Even better. I will get the negative out of the way first: We owned the buffet forgetting to eat in moderation. Dreadful.The highlights of the buffet all deserving 4-5 stars each:Chicken Tikka Masala - big pieces of tender white chicken with mild tomato based curry sauceVegetable Pakora - fried up veggie goodness with a hint of Indian spicy flavorPaneer Karahi - fried cheese with veggies and nice broth...who knew? Tandoori Chicken - Grilled chicken and it wasn't dried out! The rest of the items on the buffet were very good. The ambience is nice. Despite being crowded at lunch it was comfortable and the buffet line moved smoothly. Also. this place stands out in terms of service. I can't wait to go back!

reviews.name: Trilce M.
reviews.review: The food was good but it was not the best. I have had better Indian food in Nashville. Portions were small compare to other restaurants and the service was ok.

reviews.name: Jenny C.
reviews.review: Excellent service, extremely flavorful and well-cooked meal. Will definitely return!

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: I don't want to knock one of the few Indian places in Nashville  but it's really not worth coming to. I was really craving Indian food and my Nashvillain friend here brought us here. The buffet was the big draw and we walked in the door and just stood there for a while, just as I wanted to turn around and go somewhere else one of the waiters seemed to open his eyes to notice us there. The standard Indian buffet items were there, tandoori chicken0which was okay. They had a goat biryani as the special which was the highlight. We waited for nan but it wasn't until our 2nd trip that we managed to get a waiter's attention to get any nan.I wanted to get a mango lassi but again, getting a waiter's attention was pretty much an impossible task. I don't think too much of it. I'll go somewhere else to try Indian before I come here again.

reviews.name: Holly J.
reviews.review: I'd read a few of the reviews about the change in ownership at Bombay Palace, so I wasn't really sure what to expect last night.  Indian cuisine is my favorite, but I don't have it very often because the best restaurants in town are a bit of a drive from my house.  (And I've tried to cook it myself, but I just can't pull it off.)  So last night I visited Bombay Palace for a belated birthday dinner.The good news -- and the bad news -- was that I found everything to be pretty much the same as it ever was.Let's start with the good news.  The food was still incredible. I have always loved Bombay's use of the dish-warmers at the table, and I've found that I can actually get my dishes prepared to the 10+ spice level I enjoy. The curry entree portions are reasonable -- though the price can be a bit high for some of the vegetarian dishes -- but it's a price I'm willing to pay for the food I enjoy so much.Now, the bad news. The service is still just inattentive enough to prevent one from fully enjoying the food. Here's what I mean. First, when we arrived, our water glasses were filled when we were handed menus, but we didn't see our server again for at least 10 minutes -- when he came to ask if we were ready to order our entrees.  So we didn't have an opportunity to order drinks or appetizers -- and Indian restaurants are one of the few places that I really enjoy ordering both. This isn't a big problem, but for me it is one contributing difference between 4 stars and 5 stars in the service department.We had the same problem when we received our entrees. I had dinner with two other adults, and when our food first came out, we received only one small plate of rice. No problem, it was just enough for each of us to get a couple of spoonfuls to start our dinner.But it was quite some time before we saw our server again so that we could ask for more rice, which left us awkwardly picking at our plates for a bit. We were then brought another small plate of rice (essentially the same amount of rice that is provided to a single person dining alone), which we again quickly demolished among the three of us.  We wouldn't see our server again until it was time to leave, so we never really had enough rice to enjoy our meal.Similarly, when we asked for to-go boxes, we received no additional rice. Almost every other Indian restaurant I've frequented either brings rice in the to-go boxes or asks if we would like more. So among three adults who ordered three different curry entrees (one for the table to share) and one tandoori entree, we only received a two small dishes of rice.In general, the portion sizes are good, though I was a little disappointed with the size of my Tandoori Special Dinner. I typically find the combination dinners to be extremely generous and far more food than one person can eat, which justifies the high price. However, for $17.95 I received a small-ish tandoori chicken leg and thigh, four small (inch and a half long or so) pieces of lamb and chicken kebab, one large shrimp/prawn in the center of the plate (about the size of a small onion ring), and about 6 chunks of chicken tikka. This was served on a small bed of lettuce and was accompanied by a bowl of raita, naan, and the aforementioned rice.It was delicious food, but I won't order that particular entree again. I think the size would be perfect (for the cost) if it came with a curry or vegetable accompaniment. Similarly, the masala tea always ends up being extremely overpriced because the cup is a very small serving and I've never been offered a refill or another cup. I'm not sure if this is a factor of the inattentive service or if the tea is meant to be a no-refills item, but it's a lot to spend for the small cup of tea.One positive note about the service, though. I do prefer the relaxed, leisurely atmosphere of Bombay Palace to that of Sitar. Once you are seated at Bombay Palace, you do feel as though you're allowed to enjoy your dinner and have a good conversation with your dinner companions. At Sitar, though I find the food to be equally good, I always feel that they are trying to turn tables much more quickly, so I have often received the check and to-go boxes within 10 minutes of receiving my entree. This is honestly a bit funny, to me, since Sitar has far more room for diners than Bombay Palace, but I've always felt rushed there.So I do enjoy the relaxed pace of Bombay -- I just wish that the service were more attentive when it comes to ensuring that diners have the rice and drinks they need.We will keep going back, but still with the expectation that the service will be a bit lacking and the food a bit overpriced.

reviews.name: Darlene O.
reviews.review: THIS restaurant is the reason why I love Indian food! Every dish I have tried I loved! My absolute favorite is the Chicken Tikka Masala, which is a creamy tomato sauce with big chicken chunks served with basmati rice and fresh Naan. I also love the beef samosas served with brown sauce and green chutney. The chutney is so fresh! I also go to the buffet from time to time. They ALWAYS serve Chicken Tikka Masala and fresh naan in the buffet. I have also tried Butter Chicken which is another great dish and Chicken 65. Try the Chicken 65 if you love really spicy food. Freshly chopped bell peppers and onions with tender, juicy dark meat chicken in a spicy sauce served with basmati rice. I have yet to find an Indian restaurant in Dallas that comes close to being as good as this restaurant. The waiters are very friendly always quick to refill your drinks. The owner is also a very nice guy who remembers me everytime I go.

reviews.name: Rebecca M.
reviews.review: All I can say is delightful. This is my favorite Indian Restaurant in Nashville.

reviews.name: Sean C.
reviews.review: Negative first... The men's restroom is not clean. Kinda gross for a restaurant. This is the reason for only 4 stars. I ordered the garlic chili naan and chicken tikka masala. The naan is excellent and I did order the tikka masala spicy, with which they did a very nice job! Very excellent food. I am glad I came, but they seriously need to take care of their restrooms.

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: Had a wonderful dinner here last Friday night. I forgot that someone said there is parking behind the restaurant, but we were lucky and snagged a spot up front! An auspicious beginning. When we walked in, there were no booths left, only tables. The manager asked if we'd like a booth and invited us to sit at a table to wait. Shortly after we sat down, a booth became available and we moved. I appreciated being able to do that easily. The food was wonderful and there were enough leftovers for dinner the following night. I had Chicken Makhani (butter chicken) and loved it. Others at the table had Lamb Madras and some kind of chicken kabab that came out bright green on the outside. It was really quite a bright color and spicy. Delicious, too! The naan was very fresh - the garlic version was definitely garlicky.I'll be back - soon, I hope!

reviews.name: Kletia G.
reviews.review: Delicious. Tantalizing. Crazy Awesome. Wow. Amazing. Spicy... these were just a few of the mouthwatering adjectives that we used when we ate here. We loved our dinner so much, we came back a few days later for the lunch buffet, which Sealed the deal!Our first visit, we ordered the lamb curry, the chicken makhani (also known as butter chicken) and the saag paneer. Oh my goodness were they all delicious. The sauces were all incredibly smooth and flavorful. They we're each bold and unique, the meats were tender and they were just absolutely delicious dishes. We also ordered them on the spicy side, and they came out to our desired spice level!We loved the meal so much, we drove back into town for the lunch buffet. It is $9.99 per person, and runs until 2:30 (I think) Monday-Friday. It was again, a wonderful meal. There were a wide variety (5 or 6) of meat and veggie dishes to choose from, fragrant jasmine rice and a veggie biryani, some pakoras, a few salads and rice pudding for dessert, plus they brought us a little naan for noshing. We got a few mango Lassi's to drink... we were a couple of happy ladies!If you want to eat delicious Indian food, this is the place to go!Oh, it's a small dining room. When we went for dinner we had no problems getting seated quickly (it was Sunday night), but when we went back for lunch, it was packed! We didn't have to wait too long, maybe 5 or 10 min. max, but just letting you know.

reviews.name: Samantha K.
reviews.review: Very good authentic good at a decent price. Favorite Indian place in Nashville this far.

reviews.name: Jamie A.
reviews.review: Yes!  Finally!  An excellent date place for Indian!  Since Cuisine of India closed, we have not found a good dine in spot for Indian.  Enter Bombay Palace.  The room was lovely, service friendly and the food was excellent!  Complimentary Papadum and chutneys were a welcome start.  We also ordered Garlic Naan, super fresh garlicky!  I had my standard order of Mattar Paneer and my boyfriend ordered the Lobster Malai Khasa.  We both ordered our curries spicy and I wisely added on some Raita.  The Mattar Paneer was the best I have had in years.  Large fresh cubes of cheese and tender peas.  I very much enjoyed the lobster dish as well.  The lobster was perfectly cooked and was delicious in the nutty spicy sauce.I'm not a big fan of buffets, but I will have to give it a try to sample more of their offerings.

reviews.name: Sonja D.
reviews.review: Lunch buffet = delicious!! Ate EVERYTHING. Spoon all the curries and sauces and chutneys over your rice! Particularly the tamarind sauce.My only complaint would be the naan. Tastes like it came from the freezer. Make this fresh, hot, and soft and the restaurant would be complete!

reviews.name: Jin Z.
reviews.review: Really high quality Indian Buffet. They have the chicken Tikka masala and the cheese balls for desert. My friends who are Indian like Bombay over sitar

reviews.name: Xian H.
reviews.review: Bombay Palace gets 3 stars because it is good enough that it is my first choice...when Woodlands fails to satisfy the carnivore in me and I'm in a more northern India kind of mood. It's your average meat-n-potatoes kind of Indian fare for a regular work night (or work lunch if you have the luxury of pigging out on the buffet and being totally useless the rest of the day).PROS: Extensive menu that includes an assortment of lamb and goat dishes (if you're into that kind of thing). 'Medium spicy' is actually medium spicy (which may be very spicy by American standards). If you're a fan of rasmalai, I find the one here to be nice, sweet, and fluffy. Overall, good value. CONS: Nothing remarkable to say here.

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: Oh. My.  God.  Best Indian food I've ever eaten!  I cannot say enough good things about this place, as everything was perfect - the space, the service, the food.  As we walked in, we were greeted and welcomed very warmly by who I assume was the manager, which set the tone for the entire experience.  Actually, the whole staff was incredibly kind and genuine.  When our drink order arrived, I was given a mango lassi (a fruity yogurt drink) which I didn't order.  Apparently, one of the bus boys thought I was cute and it was on the house!  Ha!  Every time he came over to fill our water, he would make eyes at me, it was adorable.  Too bad I am in a relationship with another woman, right?  ;)  Our appetizer arrived first, which were vegetables deep fried in a spiced chickpea batter and we almost filled up on that alone!  Then our main courses came, along with plain naan and garlic naan, which are stone fired breads - yum!  My chicken tandoori was the most perfect morsel my taste buds have ever had the pleasure of experiencing.  The outside was cripsy and tender and the inside was incredibly tender and juicy.  I took bites of my friends' mango chicken and chicken tikka masala, which were equally tantalizing.  Throughout the entire meal, we all kept exclaiming how delicious everything was.  At the very end, we were given some cooling, refreshing rice pudding that was also on the house!  Before we left, the manager came over again and we chatted and laughed with him.  What a wonderful experience, I can't wait to go back and try something new.

reviews.name: Kim Y.
reviews.review: Mmmmm, bombay palace. I have only ever eaten the lunch time buffet (buffet open on weekends too!) but I cant imagine the quality suffers from their dinnertime offerings 'cuz its so tasty, always hot! I tend to judge an indian place by the spinach offering and gulab jaman - my favorite dishes. At bombay palace the spinach is usually a different variation every time, but always good! They dont always have the gulab, but thats just reason to keep coming back & the other dessert offerings are solid.I know this food is fresh because they are usually pretty busy, but never busy enough to not get a table. A gross 'buffet film' never forms over any of the food and the produce is crispy!For 8.95 you will leave in a food coma because you don't want to stop eating.Yup, the decor is ugly - UT orange EVERYTHING, but the service and staff are so wonderful and kind you can overlook this and just enjoy the yummiest indian food in Nashville.

reviews.name: Julie Y.
reviews.review: So happy to finally find a yummy Indian restaurant in Nashville. Arrived with the hubby and three year old, and we all ate, had a cup of milk (yay, they have milk!!!), and a beer, with leftovers for $56. We ordered the Combination plate for two. It was delicious. The soup was amazing and flavorful. The meats were all tender (we opted for chicken, but you can choose lamb). The rice was fresh, and the Vegetable Korma was three-year-old approved. The Naan was also tasty.The staff was welcoming and attentive. A very good experience for our first Nashville-Indian food restaurant. We will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: I went here again this weekend and just wanted to say, first of all I love this place, obviously from my initial review, but as an update, these guys were slammed on Saturday night (line out the door to get in slammed) and once seated I still got the same personable and attentive service and delicious food I always get.  They didn't change their game despite being very busy.  I was still treated like royalty.  You have a customer for life if you can do that!

reviews.name: David K.
reviews.review: MY FAVORITE INDIAN RESTAURANT in the country!  Seriously! I've eaten a lot of Indian food. This place is amazing! I always get the Indian Thali dish. Comes with so much food! Rice, Naan, Chapati bread, and I think it had 3 types of veggie curries on it.  Anyway, The Naan is so fresh, hot and buttery! The chutney they give you is so tasty. So much food! and i think it was $13 for the plate.  I moved away from Nashville a couple years ago , and STILL talk about this place! On top of that, the staff is super friendly. I can't wait to go back.

reviews.name: A B.
reviews.review: Best Indian food I've had in a lonnnngg time. Since moving from Seattle we have checked out numerous Indian restaurants, but were disappointed with all of them. I am positively euphoric that we found Bombay Palace. I am one of those that always orders Chicken Tikka Masala (unless buffet where I try other things too). It was so delicious and flavorful. It was not the pale-greasy stuff you normally get out here. This dish was a deep color, but creamy with perfect tandoori chicken. I always order garlic naan as well, and it was authentic and delicious (if a tiny weeny bit heavy on the butter; not always a bad thing.)Service was also great. They were very attentive and pretty fast. Very happy and will be returning soon!

reviews.name: Shane A.
reviews.review: A few of us were in town for a conference and looked on Yelp for something affordable but with good reviews.  We were NOT disappointed.I wouldn't have walked into this place from the street - it blends in with the storefronts around it and the interior is small and not particularly well decorated, but the menu looked good and we love Indian food, so we went.  The food was outstanding and the service was great, too (it was not a buffet night).  We even sat talking for quite some time after we were finished and we weren't rushed out.  We had a great experience here and would definitely come back. We ordered the lamb saag, lamb vindaloo, chana masala, regular and garlic naan, and mango lassi.

reviews.name: Jason W.
reviews.review: We had lunch(buffett) here on a Sunday.  We arrived soon after it opened & there were already about 20 customers inside, most of them crammed into the small confines of the buffett area.  10 minutes later, it was full.First impressions were that the place could use some money thrown at it, regarding decor etc.  The staff were good.  Friendly, professional & on top of things in general.  They delivered fresh baskets of naan bread to our table & topped off our water glasses on a regular basis throughout the meal.  Their naan was very good.  1: because they were bringing it fresh out of the kitchen, instead of  it sitting in a heap drying out under heat lamps, & 2: they make it thicker than a lot of other Indian restaurants where it just cracks like dry lavash.The buffet itself is very limited.  There are only 9-10 hot items, including rice.  The flavouring of the dishes was pretty mild also.  Their tandoori chicken(on the bone) was cool inside, most likely because their heat lamps weren't working over them.  The other dishes tend toward the "chunks of something in a lot of goopy sauce" variety, which I can tolerate if the flavour is bursting out of the dish, but that is not the case here.  Flavouring is more in line with vacuum packed Indian dishes that you buy from ethnic supermakets, & heat in a pot.Their side dishes/condiments were fine & the raita was good in particular.Parking is very limited & somewhat hazardous, as you are backing out of your parking spot directly into an active lane of traffic.

reviews.name: laura i.
reviews.review: Yum... Best paneer I've ever eaten!

reviews.name: Heather H.
reviews.review: I'm still recovering from a total food coma.I went to Bombay for a Valentine's dinner, Indian food being a mutual, and therefore romantic, obsession for my husband and I. We ended up being the last customers to arrive that didn't have to wait for a table-however it was all of two feet from the front door, so all the people who came after us were all but hovering over our plates. It didn't bother me, but my hubby was a little weirded out. I believe they take reservations. I would make one. The service was excellent, reserved yet attentive. The entrées came out quickly and cooked exactly to spicy perfection despite how busy it was. We stuffed ourselves silly on garlic naan, samosas, and curries and still had dessert. So good. So gluttonous. So needed to be rolled out the door. This is as good as it gets in Nashville.

reviews.name: Ryan D.
reviews.review: Had their special combination with a friend - You'll need 1, maybe 2 friends to finish this puppy off. Really good food (and surprisingly was NOT sick the next day!).My only complaint, was the small amount of Naan (Non? Naaannn? NoOuN?) bread - which was delicious - that we were given, and that we were charged for extra when we asked for more.

reviews.name: Bret D.
reviews.review: I have been to this small Indian restaurant on several occasions for the lunch buffet for $9.95.  I recall my past experiences to be better than my latest.  The place has a better than average atmosphere for an ethnic restaurant but it is quite small (I would guess they could only seat about 40).  The staff is very friendly and quick to bring water and warm, fresh out of the oven Naan.The food is good although it can be a little bland.  The chicken tikka masala lacked punch.  There was a "House Special Chicken" that had excellent flavor, too bad it was cold (Buffet Lesson #1 - serve yourself from the bottom of the dish, not the top).  There was another chicken dish that did not seem very different than the special.  The chicken is mostly white breast meat and plentiful.  That was the problem; there was no lamb or goat on the buffet, only chicken.  Oh yeah, I forgot about the Tandoori chicken as well.  I think I was growing feathers by the time I walked out.The buffet definitely needs more variety.  How about a biryani and a vindaloo?

reviews.name: Rakhee V.
reviews.review: Although we love the lunch buffet at this place and mango custard, yesterday's visit was pathetic... quality seems to be degraded a lot... we had literally big lumps in rice and it looked lowsy.... we had requested for medium hot food but received a very spicy food which had lot of artificial colours added to it too....  Naans were all burnt out but atleast hot n fresh... overall experience very poor.... will never visit again for dinner

reviews.name: Peter P.
reviews.review: I think most of the food here is good but I feel disappointed quite often with their tandoori chicken and a few other items that fall a little flat and are underwhelming.

reviews.name: Jagannathan S.
reviews.review: Food was not all that great.Poori was hard like a rock. Gravy was too rich and creamy. Parking is difficult since the restaurant shares its parking with other businesses and the parking lot is small on the main road. Place is too cramped.

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: I am recently relocated from the cornfields where there is no ethnic or diverse food options. I saw Bombay Palace and wanted to try it right away. When we first arrived the place was almost empty and it was a Friday night but soon it picked up and was very full. The service was impeccable and the food delish.The garlic naan was out of this world so make sure to get that, I really appreciated the various vegetarian options. I don't handle spicy food well and I think the different cuisine and spice didn't sit well with my stomach after we ate, but during the meal it was heaven. The meal took awhile to get to our table because it was individually made and you can tell that personal attention had gone into making it delicious. It is definitely on my short list of places to visit again.

reviews.name: Lecelle C.
reviews.review: As a 10-year, Caribbean-born vegetarian, I can truly say the paneer mahkni is worth every cent. My favorite dish on the menu. Highly recommended.

reviews.name: Tatiana C.
reviews.review: Perhaps it's a matter of taste.  Or a bad night.The food was actually good.  But it was hard to appreciate it underneath the deluge of salt.  I got two dishes as takeout.  The bhinda (okra) masala and the baigan bharta (eggplant).  Not just one, but both were too salty.  And I know salty.  I am the proud owner of a salt lick (aka, a Himalayan salt plate).  And I have three kinds of salt in my pantry.  And I can taste the difference between them.  I sometimes eat my favorite salt all by itself.  Licking it out of my hand.  Because its delicious.  Friends.  I may indeed have a stroke in a few decades, but I am not afraid of salt. But the food from Bombay Palace was *really* salty.  Like, way overly, salty.  Like, so salty, it tasted like a mistake.  Now, this is the South.  My parents are southerners, so I remember the over-salted food of my youth.  So perhaps, its a matter of regional taste.  And the restaurant knows for whom it cooks.  But I expected Nashville--the land of glowing NYT food reviews--to have a somewhat...less-salt-laden palate.  Perhaps it was a bad night.  Or a matter of taste.  But if this is the best Indian food in the city (as other yelpers have said), I perhaps might have to learn to cook my favorite North Indian dishes at home.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: User Paul K informed me:"Bombay Palace has about 40 parking spaces behind it out back and you can enter through the rear door."I did not know this so I am updating my review accordingly.

reviews.name: Leslie W.
reviews.review: This such a nice little place.  The food is fresh, and the service is very attentive.  They want you to sit and enjoy.  The lunch buffet is a terrific bargain, and I usually taste a little bit of everything.Ordering off the menu at dinner is not exactly cheap eats, but a good value.  The servers are always willing to walk you through it if you are unfamiliar with a dish, or want to try something new.  The only negative is that I often have trouble flagging down someone for drink refills, and parking can be tricky.Kudos.

reviews.name: Emily W.
reviews.review: Really fantastic food! Probably the best that I've had in Nashville. The ambiance is also very pleasant- pretty crimson walls and crystal chandeliers.It is, however, a little pricey. A vegetarian entree with an appetizer and naan comes out to about $17. I haven't tried the buffet yet, but I'm guessing that's the way to go.It's right off of West End, which is probably a big draw for Vandy students and staff but creates a tricky parking situation.

reviews.name: Allison N.
reviews.review: The kinks have been worked out. Yay!!!! Went back tonight and as usual had wonderful service, but the kicker was the FABULOUS food. My meal ( paneer makhani) was great, the spice level that I asked for and piping hot. My husband's (goat saag) was the same. Overall GREAT meal! I am so glad that Bombay Palace is back to its old level of phenomenal food. Thank you to the owner who emailed me and asked me to try it again, it was wonderful. I'm glad our favorite local restaurant is back to its high level of quality, we are back to being regulars!

reviews.name: Brandon G.
reviews.review: I can see why this place is getting good reviews.  Everything had really good flavor and seemed fresh.  If you like Indian food this is the place to hit.

reviews.name: Leia A.
reviews.review: They have a great lunch buffet! For 10 bucks, it's so worth it. They have tikka masala, chicken curry, fresh naan, tandoori chicken, an assortment of chutneys, and some other tasty stuff! Relaxing and comfortable ambiance. Friendly waiters. We'll definitely be back again!

reviews.name: Lauren J.
reviews.review: Incredibly delicious.  We had a very enjoyable, late dinner on Saturday night.  The service was great.  The vegetarian mango dish, with just a bit of paneer but full of potatoes, peas, carrots, and broccoli in a slightly sweet sauce, was everything I want in an entree.  I had eaten myself into a food coma during lunch and wasn't even that hungry that evening, but it tasted so good I kept eating.  My boyfriend loved his chicken korma.  My only criticism is that the naan was a little crispy and didn't seem the freshest.  It is possible I caught it on an off night.I would definitely go back.

reviews.name: K S.
reviews.review: This place was amazing. the food was great as was the service. it's the only place I have been since leaving the west coast that can do a decent Lamb Korma. They gave us the wrong naan but I can over look that because everything else was so good. If I lived in Nashville I'd be here all the time.

reviews.name: Nicole F.
reviews.review: Hands down the best Indian restaurant in Nashville and I've tried all of them. I've been eating Indian (more specifically Punjabi) food my entire life, so I would know :) you really can't go wrong with ANY dish here!

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: So I haven't had Indian food in over a year and that was in Dallas....and I miss it.  No one I know likes Indian food so I have to just dream of delicious buffets. I guess I could go by myself because I'm good with that, but something about buffet and eating by myself seems like I'd turn into a sad chick eating her feelings or something!  However, I may not mind after trying Bombay Palace.I suggested to my lunch "date" that we go have Indian food and she suggested Bombay Palace.  It is right on West End so the parking in front seems a bit treacherous since you have to back out in West End traffic when you leave but they also have parking in the back!Inside the place is small and gaudily painted but it smelled like spice.  Mmmm!  We were seated and hit up the buffet as soon as we got our drinks.  Small buffet compared to some places I've been but large on flavor and quality.  They had a chef's special (chicken and peppers), a salad bar, some desserts, and an array of hot foods. My favorite was the chicken tikka masala mainly because the sauce was rich and spicy.  I also enjoyed the chicken tandoori and the chicken madras.  The chicken madras had some good heat without being too hot.  They also had saag and some other vegetable dishes that were all great!  They brought bread to the table for you to sop up all that spicy, delicious sauce.  No shame in my game, I got it all off the plate, trust me.  Too bad I didn't read the reviews for the garlic naan before I came...I'll have to go back and get me some of that because it sounds heavenly.  Lunch buffet is until 2:30 but they were seating people after that and they were eating so I guess it is kind of a loose end time?  They also serve dinner off menu and I hear it is really great.  Must. Find. Dinner. Friend.Give this place a try for lunch (or perhaps for dinner) - it will satisfy all your spicy Indian food cravings.

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: I have to admit that I begrudgingly came here at the recommendation of a friend (I had my favorite Indian restaurant in town, so I needn't try another).  Suffice to say, I was blown away and Bombay Palace quickly has become my other favorite.  I remain loyal to both of my favorites now.....This place is amazing, starting from their food quality, taste and presentation to their  friendliness. attentiveness and ambiance.   It is wonderfully located off of West End, parking is abundant in the back if the front is full.  My husband and I have come several times for the lunch buffet, which always has something new.  The food is very fresh and the buffet is well attended by the staff.  I'm not a fan of buffets but they take great care in making sure that the food hasn't sat for too long and are always refilling.  The variety is incredible too.  Always a great combination of vegetarian dishes along with meat offerings.  If you go for dinner, I recommend any of the lamb dishes.  I think that I have tried them all.  My favorite is the lamb pasanda but in all of the dishes the lamb is tender and succulent,  They take great care in it's preparation.  Their biryanis are also wonderful.  I don't say that lightly....they came very close to my father in law's lamb biryani in taste, texture and complexity of flavors so for that alone I had to give them 5 stars, but they deserve them outright without that!

reviews.name: Marinda H.
reviews.review: I've tried every Indian buffet (including the overrated Woodlands) in Nashville, and this is the only one worth going to! I've been eating Indian for 20+ years all over the US and was vegetarian for 6 years so feel like I have a good understanding of what the typical US Indian restaurants serve. The buffet has a great selection - typically 5-6 vegetarian options, 3-4 meat options, several sauces (ginger, raita, plum, etc.), jasmine rice, salad, rice pudding, and naan brought to your table. I've been 6 times and each time they have several regular dishes (dahl, some sort of pakora, etc.) and other new dishes. The food is seasoned well and not overly spicy. Love the dahl and chicken makhani! The only dish I keep hoping will be on the buffet is palak paneer (hint, hint...).The staff is friendly and efficient. My only complaint is that it's usually quite warm in the restaurant, but it doesn't stop me from driving 20 minutes to go there every other month!

reviews.name: Bryan B.
reviews.review: Best Indian food in Nashville

reviews.name: Penelope T.
reviews.review: The 5 star rating is at the insistence of my daughter. She loved, loved, loved  everything she had. The dal makkhani  was amazing and so was the tomato rice.  The chicken curry and  tikka masal were also favorites and the chef's special aloo didn't hurt anyone's feelings either.   There were a couple desserts on the lunch buffet we didn't get to because we ate too much and did not save room.  Just a few blocks from Vandy I can see many receipts from here in my daughters credit card future.

reviews.name: Crawmama C.
reviews.review: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in the world. I only go for the lunch buffet, because I'm a hawg. And indecisive. And it's a great deal. I usually like every single thing on the buffet, which has a ton of dishes. My favorite items are the chicken tikka masala (sometimes things are popular because they are good), the perfect rice, the salads, and the kheer (rice pudding)!! It is so delicious with a mild but interesting flavor including almonds, rosewater, cardamom, and I'm sure some other stuff. Go eat this food!

reviews.name: Elizabeth M.
reviews.review: Absolutely awesome.  My fiance and I were just driving around tonight looking for a place to go for dinner and I saw Bombay Palace across the street and on a whim suggested it.  Upon entering we knew it had to be legit because it was full and there were a lot of people in there who were Indian.  It's always a good sign when an ethnic restaurant has patrons of the same cultural background!  We ordered garlic naan as an appetizer (YUM) and we spit the Lamb Chops and the Chicken Vindaloo (hot although you can order it medium).  My fiance loves spicy food and this was an absolute treat.  I haven't had lamb in so long and it was so tender I literally cut it with my butter knife.  Service was a bit slow but perfectly polite, refined, and helpful.  They gave me suggestions when asked and my water glass rarely went empty, even when sucking it down from the spicy Vindaloo.  One of the best meals I have had in a while!  Go here!

reviews.name: María D.
reviews.review: If Bombay Palace proposed to me, I would say yes, that's how much I like this place. I can't say enough good things about this place. I tend to order vegetarian and I've never been disappointed. Every dish I have had has been delicious. The service is out of control - a few sips of water and they're there refilling your glass. The servers are unfailingly attentive, polite, and helpful. The dishes are served over little gas-lit burners, so they stay warm. They also have a nice wine and beer selection, which I avail myself of often. The ambiance and seating is cozy - there are booths along the sides of the restaurant and a few tables in the middle. The music is usually innocuous muzak and the noise levels are just about right. Ok, I've run out of things to say about this place. Just go eat there. These people are the best.

reviews.name: Alexander A.
reviews.review: I had the pleasure of eating at Bombay Palace last night for the first time. We were greeted and seated as soon as we entered the building. The service was polite and professional. I felt as if I was in an upscale dining establishment. We were given a flatbread with four sauces. Bpmbay offeres a few but good Indian beers. We had the Kingfisher and Haywards 5000 that were served and poured in the appropriate glass. We ordered the vegetable pakora which is inexpensive and delicious. Each different vegetable seemed to be battered with the same mix but cooked longer than the other giving it a slightly different texture. The garnish of iceberg lettuce and green pepper did not add to the dish. We ordered the lamb boti kabob masala, lamb pasanda, and the onion and cheese paneer. The entrees were served in neat chaffing dishes which kept them warm throughout dinner. The long grain rice was cooked perfectly. The menu states the lamb is tender and it was very tender. Our requested spiciness level was spot on. The pasanda was sweet and savory and the masala was tangy and creamy. The manage ice-cream tasted fresh and was a bright dessert. The fruit custard was garnished with candied fruit and minced pistachio. The portions were perfect. In summary the prices were surprisingly low for the quality of the food and the service. The manager even came by to check on us and say hello. My only criticism is that the decor could use an little work and the booths rock back and forth if you sit back in them. But that should not deter you from eating in this polite and delicious indian restaurant. We have found our Indian restaurant in Nashville now. Can't wait to come back.

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: I've visited Bombay Palace twice now, once for dinner and once for lunch.  My first visit was excellent--the service was wonderful and the dishes I shared with a friend (Saag Paneer and Chicken Tikka Masala) were perfectly delicious.  We asked for a medium spice level on the saag, and it was a solid medium spiciness--not too hot, not too mild.  When I visited for lunch a few weeks later, I was disappointed by the lack of variety on the buffet.  While I was thrilled to see all-white-meat chicken tikka masala on the buffet, there were very few vegetarian choices, which I always look forward to on buffet lines.  I was hoping for a vegetable korma or a paneer, neither of which was to be found.  I did appreciate the fresh naan that was brought to the table during lunch (most buffets in town keep in on the buffet line, which becomes old and stale after a few minutes), and the friendly service.  If you love chicken or lamb dishes on the buffet, this is a great place for lunch.  I will probably only come for dinner from now on, and have lunch down the street at Sitar.

reviews.name: Minsoo P.
reviews.review: Fantastic Lamb Vindaloo! Best I've had this side of the UK. In Nashville of all places! Who knew? If you love Indian food, come here. Seriously.

reviews.name: Will M.
reviews.review: Their buffet results in me eating a lot of spicy food.  A lot.  This is my one exception for buffet food.  It is great!Meat dishes  And plenty of vegetarian dishes, don't worry.  A perfect late lunch destination.  Mango lassi is a treat, I love mangoes.  unlimited nan.

reviews.name: Jasmine K.
reviews.review: Best Indian food in this city. My husband and I go here often. Our favorites are the Vegetable  samosas, chicken tikka, garlic naan, and the Curry Chicken (med. heat) SO SO SO good. You must come here if you love or want to try Indian food. Also let me just say, I love the staff. They are so friendly and serve so well. I am so pleased with our customer service at this place. So worth it.

reviews.name: Ruiqiu K.
reviews.review: Bombay Palace is only the second Indian restaurant I've tried while in Nashville. And I have to say that for the second time in a row, Nashville hits it out of the park for the quality of Indian food I've had thus far.  I've been to Woodlands and was quite enthralled by the amount of spices used. But Woodlands is vegetarian and I like my meat, so going to Bombay Palace up the street was a must.For starters, we had the papadams and an array of 4 dips: Green, red, orange, and brown. Sorry, that's the best I can do identify them. They were alternatively spicy and sweet and hot. There is probably a dip that you will like. The papadams were spicy, a version of which I admittedly have never had at restaurants back home. They were always bland.Before we moved here, I had discovered lamb at Afghan restaurants and fell in love. I now make it a point to have lamb anywhere and everywhere it's offered. I had the lamb pasanda here, and it was heavenly. And spicy. Oh so spicy. That's something else I've learned while in Nashville: "Mild" is probably considered "medium hot" where I'm from. But I'm also a wimp when it comes to spicy food.The last few Indian places I tried back home were very disappointing -- when I asked for mild, the dishes were completely devoid of spices. At Bombay Palace, I saw the cinnamon, the cumin, the cardamom, etc., in my dishes.The pasanda came with a rice pilaf / biryani, which was my only slight disappointment. I like rice by itself, but I didn't think to ask how this dish was going to be served. And in Indian restaurants, I like rice flavored with the usual spices. But give me the fancy rice which can become a meal on its own, then I think it's an overload of flavors, especially with spicy meat. I loved this dish, but when (and there will be a when) I come back, I will see if I can have this with plain Indian rice.The only suggestion I can make about this place: Lose the suit and (bow?) tie for your servers. Considering my introduction to this fine city was the intense humidity, I felt uncomfortable seeing them in this getup, even though the place is well air-conditioned. Not necessary to wear traditional kurtas or achkans or anything; just something more comfortable.

reviews.name: Scott G.
reviews.review: Christmas day was such a hit that we went back on New Years day.  The line out the door says it all.  In addition to the native Indians that seem to flock here, I was sincerely impressed.  The "special meal" came blazing hot - both in spice and temperature.  Nothing super fancy but stick to your bones Indian cuisine.  The wine list was limited but hit the spot with both dry, mid-range and sweet selections.  If you must choose one Indian restaurant in Nashville, pick this one.  it's a steady eddie and a a real gem.

reviews.name: Nathan K.
reviews.review: Went to Bombay for the Sunday lunch buffet and it was quite good ($9 bucks).  I'm not sure how it compares size-wise to others in town.The relative cleanliness of the plates is the only reason this isn't a 5 star review.

reviews.name: Julia S.
reviews.review: I can't believe it's taken me so long to rave about this place. Bombay Palace is my boyfriend's and my favorite dinner place in Nashville (and we eat out a ton!). The staff is always so helpful and friendly, the food is exceptional and approachable, and the atmosphere is clean, quiet, and intimate. I LOVE the Chicken Tikka Masala (Indian Hot!) and my boyfriend has tried a bunch of different things and loved them all. I feel like it's a hidden gem, and more people ought to check it out and give them some love!

reviews.name: Kelly B.
reviews.review: Great food, exceptional service, fair pricing...this place has it all. Got one of the combo dinners and left with enough food for lunch the next day. Give it a try, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Nathan A.
reviews.review: I'm a touring musician. I was in Nashville, playing a show when I decided to check out Bombay Palace.I've been really getting into fine Indian cuisine over the past 3 years. Bombay Palace is one of the finest Indian restaurants that I've ever been to!!! It is truly authentic. Loved the chicken tikka masala, saag paneer & some of the tastiest vegetable korma that I've ever had!!!The serving staff at Bombay Palace understand the perfect balance of helpfulness along with enough 'hands-off', letting you enjoy your food & experience. They brought us complimentary rice pudding after the meal as well as extra helpings of rice.I've been twice now - when I'm back in Nashville, I WILL CERTAINLY GO BACK, AGAIN & AGAIN!!!!!

reviews.name: Cameron S.
reviews.review: Food consistently good. Lunch buffet fresh and frequently replinished. Dinner meals very good and reasonably priced for the quality. Classy table settings and professional wait staff. Minus one star for occasional slow refills, esp during lunch, but otherwise a hit.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn K.
reviews.review: When my husband found out that I gave Bombay Palace 4 Stars, he almost joined Yelp for the sole purpose of writing a 5 Star Review.  Ha!  And he is right.  It totally deserves 5 Stars.  We recently dined at Taste of India in Cool Springs, and I was excited to compare the two.  Holy. Cow.  I had no idea what kind of flavor I was missing.  T of I - below average.  BP - Perfection.  Even though Taste is closer to our home, I will drive the extra 15 minutes for this food.  From the moment my hubs and I took our first bite, we instantly looked up at each other and laughed like..."What were we thinking going anywhere else?"  Not to mention, the service is about 10 x's better.  This is THEE Nashvile place for Indian food.  Trust me.  FAVS:1.  Garlic Naan2.  Saag Paneer3.  Chicken Tikka Masala4.  Boti Kebab Masala...and so many more...The manager also came by at the end of our meal, thanked us for coming in - and delivered a free rice pudding with pistachio dessert.  :)

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: Okay.  I admit it.  I was a very, very bad Jew.  Towards the end of Passover, the wife and I had the opportunity to be adults without children for the longest time in two-and-a-half years.  It was GLORIOUS.  We went to TWO movies in one weekend.  And frankly, because my wife was 8 months pregnant and really wasn't feeling like more matzoh, we were bad for a night.We went there for dinner and got great parking right in front.  And the place was packed, plus there were a lot of Indians or Pakistanis dining which is always sign that you've made the right decision.  We were immediately seated and the house staff was all well-dressed with bow ties, cute touch.  Service was very quick, the wife started with a mango lassi and it really hit the spot with the papadum and chutnies they served with it.  For our entrée, the wife got the Vegetarian Thali sampler plate.  It was a mixture of several veggie curries and an array of side dishes.  It was served on an old-school stainless-steel compartmentalized cafeteria tray, which was novel and cute.  It was all fantastic, as I had to test it all make sure that it wasn't poisonous for her, but one of the veggie curries especially was amazing, wish I could remember which.  I went for Garlic Naan and Chicken Vindaloo.  First of all the garlic naan was some of the best I've ever had.  Super fresh and covered in FRESH GARLIC, so amazing.  I ate the whole damn order in a blink.  Could be because I was sick of matzoh.  The chicken vindaloo was great, and even though I begged them to make it as hot as possible, I still think they went easy on me, but I am kind of a freak of nature when it comes to spicy foods.  Again, I won a clean plate award.The service was excellent and the servers were always coming back to check on us and the manager touched base with us as well.  Very cool to see that.  They also seemed to have their acts together on getting orders out fast as well, as they were turning tables left and right.  Oh yes, and they serve wine and beer!  Woohoo!

reviews.name: Simon K.
reviews.review: Battle of the Buffets... and the winner is Bombay PalaceIf you're "messin' in the West End" and you're looking for Indian food like Columbus, then you're either gonna hit up Sitar, Woodlands, or Bombay.  If it's for lunch, then you're gonna get the most out of Bombay.  Sitar is oily and offers less of a selection.  It's a hard choice between Woodlands and Bombay.  HOWEVER, if you're not a vegetarian then you're gonna enjoy Bombay a lot more.Bombay does great to offer fresh Naan (delicious bread) during the buffet, but Woodlands offers great dosas (mashed potato filled crepes) with their buffet.These buffets are "hands down" a great deal, but if it's dinner time then expect to dish out a little more cash.  TIP:  If you're gonna do dinner, then it's best to go with a group.  If each person gets a different dish then you all can share a meal family style and end up getting a good amount of food with great variety.

reviews.name: Kate L.
reviews.review: This place is one of our favorites. The food is DELICIOUS, but what really sets it apart is the impeccable service. Once we ordered take out and it was taking a while, so they asked us to sit down at a table and brought us both mango lassis on the house...so nice! The owner always remembers our faces and thanks us warmly for coming back. Menu highlights are definitely the vegetable koorma, chili paneer, and the garlic naan. The lunch buffet is a great way to try a little of everything and is a steal at $9!

reviews.name: Essence L.
reviews.review: I love this place. I work in the area and live far away so I have not had the pleasure of eating dinner here, but the lunches I have eaten have all been wonderful. The naan is wonderful and so are the various dishes. Each time I have visited the buffet has offered different selections of varying heat, texture and flavor. I have not come across anything that I didn't like. The interior design is elegant especially when considering the appearance from the outside. The staff is always very courteous and helpful, though sometimes it is crowded and they may not operate as quickly as you need.However, I don't consider that fact a bad thing and don't hold it against them. They have great food, people love it, and so do I.

reviews.name: Oliver K.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed this place when I visited in March, and I'm definitely going back when I return to Nashville in August! The staff were kind and caring, the meals were fresh and hot and the ambience was great. We had a pretty standard meal without much flair because I'm pretty wimpy with my spices and I found that the kitchen definitely catered towards that. I'm going to give it a 4* for now, but if I could give it 4.5* then I certainly would do! I'm hoping that after my return trip, I'll be able to update it to a 5*!

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: Although my last review of Bombay Palace was almost a year ago, you shouldn't think that I've been away from my beloved Indian restaurant's embrace for so long. Oh no, I probably go 2 - 3 times a month, generally for the lunch buffet, which despite being 7 days per week NEVER lets me down. The quality is always consistently good (which can't always be said for buffets) and the food is super fresh. This is no longer my secret little place, and while it's not unusual to wait for a table at lunchtime, it's always worth it. I leave stuffed and happy each and every time, and the owner always presses extra naan on me as I head out the door.I'm also happy to report that the owner and his staff are still delightful and eager to please - even when the joint is jumping, they always make us feel right at home and give us such personal service. There are definitely more waitstaff on hand during the busy lunch hour, so old concerns about sluggish service are no longer valid at all. At dinner the food can sometimes be a longer wait, but I think this is because they take the time to make the food fresh. The buffet is great for trying various dishes, but if you really want to treat yourself, the dinner is somehow even better because everything is tailored just for you. I would pretty much inject their veggie korma directly into my veins if possible, it's that good. I also love that they have an extensive goat section on their menu!This is exceptionally good Indian food regardless of city, but for Nashville it's absolutely the best Indian food there is. Long live Bombay Palace!

reviews.name: Rebecca L.
reviews.review: I'm struggling to find the words to describe the meal I had at Bombay Palace. "Divine" will have to suffice. I went with two friends, and we split a combo meal for two. We ate ourselves silly; I was full as a tick, but it was so delicious, I had to have another bite or two of everything. Go.

reviews.name: Dusty K.
reviews.review: So I lied in my original review. This place isn't good... it's amazing. It's mouth watering, lip smacking, finger licking good. And the garlic chile naan? Try to stop eating that. I double dog dare you. It's unreal.Don't like Indian? Don't worry, just go here.

reviews.name: Tristan T.
reviews.review: Fantastic.  Friendly staff, good food, Worth every penny and these guy visit the spice rack at Patel Brothers!!

reviews.name: Stephanie L.
reviews.review: I absolutely love this place. I eat here once a week and honestly I think they might even know my name at this point. I always get the Chicken Lajwab, which is amazing. I know I should try something else at some point, but I love what I got the first time so much that I have never switched. Also the naan is great!Sometimes the service is really slow, but if it is they will sometimes give you a free rice pudding for your wait! If you want the amazing food and don't want to wait, I would suggest Take Out. They make it faster and you usually get a free dessert. Also it seems like you get more food! Yum! I might have to get some tonight after writing this post.

reviews.name: Pritish Z.
reviews.review: It's not a place I would visit often since they add lot of spices which makes my hand yellowish .. and mouth salty.

reviews.name: Alex W.
reviews.review: Excellent Indian food.  The goat vindaloo was very tasty along with the garlic naan.  The mango lassi was also good and helped with the heat from the vindaloo.

reviews.name: Charles L.
reviews.review: I'm brand new to Nashville and I love Indian food.  I must say that Bombay Garden surpassed my expectations.  It was absolutely delicious.  It's tough getting used to things in a new city, but the chicken tikka masala made me feel at home.  Thanks!  :-)

reviews.name: Michael P.
reviews.review: Walk in breathe deep. aaaa spice. First order a Flying Horse, a light beer with a honey finish that will calm the fires to come ( note: not everything is spicy but I love a flaming tongue so it works for me). Oh and the bottle is giant soooo that works for me as well.Goat Vindaloos and garlic naan. Wonderful. My only complaint is more goat less bone. I maybe out of touch with tradition but come on.. It's not like they are on the endangered species list. Other than that minor bit of whining a great meal. The party next to me blather on about firing nannies and choosing cabinets... I empty my Flying Horse and press on.

reviews.name: Mike J.
reviews.review: Great service, buffet quality was outstanding. On the downside, no dish was particularly spectacular.

reviews.name: Brandon H.
reviews.review: Best Indian food in Nashville hands down!  The service here is always top notch, and great care is taken with each entree.  A glass never goes empty and the flavor of all entrees is perfect!

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: Had the great good fortune of attending a function last evening with catering from Bombay Palace.  omgdeliciousness.  There were so many options: garam marsala, chicken tikki marsala, malai kofta, and saag paneer all perfect for serving with rice and soaking up with the delicious naan.  I also loved the vegetable samosas.  Everything was perfectly spiced, fragrant, and beautifully vibrant.  Next time I need an Indian food fix, I know where to run!

reviews.name: Brett M.
reviews.review: I have been here probably 10-15 times now, which is why I'm writing this review.  Let me make this clear, I've eaten at MANY buffets in my life and I can not think of one single buffet I have ever liked in my life.  I like them when I'm eating then feel completely horrible after the fact. Generally you get substandard quality for large quantities......The Bombay Palace buffet changed all of that.  The food they make comes out fresh and if the regular dinner menu version of the items on the buffet is any better I would be extremely surprised.....thats how quality it is.  Wonderfully deep flavors in the curries.  Rice is cooked consistently well and the Naan..........Jesus Christ the naan....  Don't even start eating till you get it.  Also, the last time I went I tried the Mango Lasee(sp?).  Its like a delicious mango sherbet drink where the fats(from yogurt I believe) are meant to cut down on the heat.  However, if you are looking for real heat, the buffet will disappoint you there.

reviews.name: Ray H.
reviews.review: I had seen good reviews for this restaurant however I went to the lunch buffet and the food was lukewarm, there was a VERY limited selection, and the staff was unfriendly. Overall it was a very poor experience.

reviews.name: Harish K.
reviews.review: Lunch buffet too expensive ..9.95

reviews.name: Jude C.
reviews.review: The service and food are both outstanding and ten bucks for an all you can eat buffet is well worth it.  There aren't many choices on the buffet line but they are all excellent nonetheless.  I recommend trying the Masala chicken on the buffet line.  The orange fruit custard and the cheese balls in sweet syrup were two of the best dishes I've tasted I've tasted ever so I definitely recommend trying those dishes as well.  I will be back here the next time I'm in Nashville.

reviews.name: Rob P.
reviews.review: Worst Indian food I've ever had. I tried the buffet and you believe how old all the food Tasted !!! When asked the waiter he just walked away and turned on the heat !!! That's messed up!!!!

reviews.name: Brien W.
reviews.review: Really good buffet, must try for dinner, only regret is I wish the would get naan out sooner. I know this is hard because they don't make it in advance, trouble is I am 1/2 way down with my meal when it appears. Hmmn, what could I do, maybe stall somewhat... have to work on it!

reviews.name: Wayne H.
reviews.review: Bombay Palace serves tried and true Northern Indian cuisine: samosas, pakoras, saag, tikka masala, tandoori chicken, aloo gobi, and chana marsala. And truth be told, the food is pretty good, especially the marsala. Unfortunately for Bombay Palace, there are two other very good Indian restaurants in the immediate area, Woodlands and Sitar, both within a mile and both of which have better and more unique, if a fair bit more expensive cuisine.  Bombay Palace has the benefit of being the closest to VUMC and the cheapest of the three restaurants. Staff is friendly and responsive.  If you are in the mood for cheap Indian food close to Vandy this is definitely a good location to visit.

reviews.name: Anne D.
reviews.review: Caveat--I have been here exactly once.  But it was awesome, and I will definitely be going back!The place looks like kind of a dive.  We parked in the rear parking lot and came in through the back of the restaurant.  While walking past their storage supplies, I feared I was trespassing in a restricted area...no fear, this is how it is supposed to work.The inside is very cute, and the staff was unbelievably friendly.  I swear, by the way they treated us, I felt like we were guests in someone's home.  The food was unbelievable.  I used to order Indian takeout all the time during residency (there's a great Indian place just down the street from Johns Hopkins in Baltimore) but this place is infinitely better!They took the time to ask us how spicy we like our food.  My husband ordered the goat cooked in spinach, and I had the lamb mango.  Both were delicious.  They also brought out some nan bread, except it couldn't have been the traditional variety--it had some sort of fruit filling (fig?) and was sprinkled with cheese.  This could give the Finezza warm bread loaf a run for its money.I can't wait to come back here!  The menu had at least 50 other options that all looked equally promising.

reviews.name: Jessica P.
reviews.review: I can't believe that I still haven't written a review on Bombay Palace!  I eat here about once every other week and I have never been disappointed! This is easily the best Indian food in the Nashville area and on par with what I've tasted on Curry Hill in NYC.  For the gluten free list:  I've been eating here for two years and have not had a problem.  Just make sure you tell your waiter to keep the naan far away from your food :)

reviews.name: B L.
reviews.review: Went for the lunch buffet, (~$9) so I will only comment on that.  It seems many people also enjoy the menu offerings, but I will save that review for another time.The restaurant itself is brightly decorated with orange booth seating.  The buffet itself had a well done and tasty, if slightly small selection of your typical indian fair.  Nothing too spicy - if you're coming for spice, you will probably need to order from the menu, or load up on the various condiments/sauces etc, on the buffet .  Fresh, delicious naan is brought to your table.  The service was attentive.  Overall an enjoyable lunch experience.

reviews.name: Marilee S.
reviews.review: If you're looking for an ethnic restaurant - no, I'm not talking PF Chang's or Maggiano's, you MUST try Bombay Palace. It will impress the biggest food snobs in your group. Everything you order is fresh, made to order. We were hungry so we shared the combination dinner for two at $34.95 and enjoyed the most delicate Mulligatawny (lentil and lemon) soup, Chicken Tikka, Tandoori Chicken, Malai Kabab, Seekh Kabab, Lamb Rogan Josh (my fave), with fresh grilled veggies, rice and the lightest flavorful Naan I've had in a long time.What made the experience even better, was the decor and service. Generous leather tufted booths line each wall (tables in the center) and each was dressed with a clean tablecloth, fresh baby roses and a votive candle. The service was superb. The food arrived at the table on a cart and carefully set in front of us. We never felt rushed, hassled or ignored. We'll definitely be back again and again and again!!!By the way, there was enough food left over for us for both of us to have lunch the next day.

reviews.name: Amy B.
reviews.review: Went to celebrate the end of the semester with a buffet lunch.  This place hit the spot.  Good selection of my Indian favorites with a Chef Special to boot.  A bounty of gulab jamun finished the meal of right.  The only compliant was that our waiter made us feel rushed to make our final trip to the buffet as he said the buffet was closing.  As some folks were just seated for the buffet, this resulted in a bit of an abrupt and awkward end to the meal, one which really wasn't called for.  Still the buffet was great and the atmosphere was mostly relaxing and welcoming.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: For some reason the small strip mall next to the Apple Market has proven to be a graveyard to failed restaurants. Yet out of the ashes has arisen Bombay Palace. Hoping that they have better luck than their predecessors, I decided to it make it my next dinner stop. When I first walked in I was befuddled by the mood lighting and elegantly dressed waiters, nevertheless, I pressed on. We started with their vegetarian assortment of vegetable Samosas and vegetable Pakora. Seriously, it was delicious. Trying all the sauces that were on our table, I decided that the mildly spicy green sauce was my favorite, but the sweet brown sauce is definitely worth a try. Our entrees included the Tandoori Chicken and Chicken Tikka Massala and both where fantastic. Accompanied with rice and Naan Bread, the Tandoori Chicken fell of the bone, and the Chicken Tikka Massala, though different than what I'm used to, was equally as tasty. The candlelight cart service and fancy dish set up eventually grew on me, though you can definitely tell that they are a new restaurant. However endearing it was to watch the confusion over what table was getting what, their plates always came out quickly and their wait staff was exceedingly friendly. The owner came to our table many times to make sure that everything was up to par, and brought us a free rice pudding as an after dinner treat. New to the town, I hope Bombay Palace will be around for a while because it really was treat to eat there.

reviews.name: Joey H.
reviews.review: Tried the chicken tandoori. Still, not so great. And unfortunately, the naan wasnt good this time--quite chewy.

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: I decided to give this place a try for lunch today, and I'm glad I did. They have a buffet with several vegetarian options as well as some meat options. The vegetable korma is what stuck out the most. I loved it! Very creamy and the flavor was on point. They also bring fresh naan to the table, which I used to soak up the last bit of that delicious korma. I will definitely go back, maybe for dinner next time.

reviews.name: Minx R.
reviews.review: Far and away my favorite Indian restaurant in Nashville. Always attentive service, even when busy. Every dish I've had has been delicious and well balanced and they are happy to adjust spice levels in either direction to suit your taste. Plenty of parking in back of the restaurant if the spots in front are full.

reviews.name: Tonya O.
reviews.review: Bombay Palace is one of few experiences I've had with Indian food, the last time being a few years ago. I had no idea what to order, and luckily I spotted the Combination Dinner for Two and shared it with my boyfriend. The dinner included Muligatawany Soup, Chicken Tikka, Tandoori Chicken, Malai Kabab, Seekh Kabab, Lamb Rogan Josh, Rice & Naan Bread and was plenty to share among the two of us. For someone with little experience with Indian food, this was the perfect choice to try a little bit of several menu items and have an idea of what I might like next time. The Naan bread was somewhat burned, and the service was rather slow, most likely from being understaffed. The parking isn't ideal, but that's par for the West End area. However, the staff that was present was very accommodating and courteous. The food was pretty good, too. Be on the look out for coupons in the mail. Our server even gave ours back to us, and I look forward to going again in the future.

reviews.name: Doc H.
reviews.review: Let me start by stating that my wife is Indian.We went to Bombay Palace to celebrate the oldest's birthday (his selection of restaurant). The atmosphere, for a week night, was atypical of any sit down restaurant. The booths backing were not solid, so any movement from the other side is felt. The table setting is appropriate. The booths are a bit small for any size party over two.The food was decent. The Goat Vindaloo was superb. The Tandoori Chicken was not. The chicken was dry and had a harsh 'barbecued' taste. The chicken Madras was our favorite. It had a nice deep flavor and just the right amount of 'spiciness.' The Dum Aloo seemed more like Butter Chicken, without the Chicken.For the price, it was a slight value. My wife was impressed with the same as above, and had the same issues as above.

reviews.name: Brian S.
reviews.review: I've tried probably 2/3 of the Indian joints in Nashville, and I'd describe Bombay Palace as far and away the best. I travel a ton, and I've had Indian everywhere from California to Washington DC to London. I'm pretty familiar with the full spectrum of Indian food, so I can tell you what makes this place stand out to me.1) Service: this usually doesn't top my list when it comes to restaurants, but the manager in particular makes such a wonderful effort. Even though I don't go too often, and there are often multi-month lags between my visits, he still seems to recognize me when I come in. That's pretty incredible.2) Flavors: one problem some Indian places have is that so many of the dishes taste the same. The spectrum from butter chicken to tikka masala to curry to vindaloo should have distinct flavors. At Bombay Palace, it does.3) Meat quality: one shortcut that drives me nuts at some places is serving inferior meat quality. You notice this most with lamb, where you'll get chunks with fat or gristle. Sometimes, you'll get pieces of dark meat chicken in your curry too. I know some people like the latter, but not me. The meat quality has always been very good.I've had excellent luck at the buffet as well as at dinner. The naan is cooked well and is flavorful. The butter chicken at buffet time doesn't taste like it's been sitting out forever, a nice change of pace from other buffets.My favorite dish here, hands-down, is the chicken mango.
