Ask for it spicy, and you'll get a wonderful sweet-and-spicy flavor that's unique. A couple other "standard" Indian dishes that this place does well are the chicken korma and the lamb vindaloo. I ask for the vindaloo extra extra spicy, and while it probably is just that for ordinary people, it's never quite spicy enough for me. The makhani chicken and chicken tikka masala are just OK; for some reason, they lack the richness of flavor that I find at some other Indian restaurants.If you're in the downtown area and craving Indian, I can't think of a better place to tell you to go. And if you're not in the downtown area but still feel that hankering, it's worth the drive.

reviews.name: Phyllis N.
reviews.review: I have eaten at Bombay many times just first review. I really like the freshness of the food. I generally get the Buffet , seeing is believing the food looks so appetizing and is very tasty. I really like how the tables are set up to with nice table cloths and cloth napkins, and the servers are very  friendly and service is great.

reviews.name: Piyush S.
reviews.review: This is an average restaurant period. The curry entrees are not bad at all and the portions are relatively generous. The tandoori kababs are dry, tasteless and pathetic. Frozen kababs taste better. Nans and tandoori rotis are ok but sitar makes way better nans and rotis. I also prefer the entrees at sitar. Sitar is more authentic mughlai-indian-punjabi food.bombay palace is well located,more parking front and back and has way better service.                                                                                                             But it is just an average restaurant.

reviews.name: Fish H.
reviews.review: The food was very, very good.  It isn't a prepossessing place, but you can't argue with the food.

reviews.name: Todd H.
reviews.review: First time here, excellent!

reviews.name: Christian S.
reviews.review: My favorite Nashville Indian joint. The lunch buffet is less extensive than Sitar's, but the quality of each dish is consistently high. Just under $10, with tax. Dinner runs around $12-20 per person. The chicken makhani is delicious. Excellent & welcoming service.

reviews.name: Courtney C.
reviews.review: I love this place. I've been going since they opened in 2008. The quality and cleanliness have never declined.

reviews.name: Bill V.
reviews.review: Our fist trip to Bombay Palace was heavenly. That was in the evening and we ordered off the menu... no buffet at night. The food was better than good, the wine selection good, the beers unusual and delightful. The desserts were subtle and memorable. My wife and I had a fabulous time. Then we returned today for a late Sunday lunch and the buffet was the only option. But something was wrong. Very wrong. And it made for a most unpleasant experience. I believe that it's an attitude and organization problem. I'll explain:In the evening, you have a host to greet and seat you. You have a waiter assigned to your table. There's a food runner. The service is attentive, anticipatory, and gracious. And the food is divine. Go in the evening, and you'll love it. But the daytime buffet... yeah, not so much.For whatever reason, there is no waiter assigned to any group of tables, so they all- every one- wander around and ignore the guests. The same folks who were charming in the evening are dismissive, harried and curt. Perhaps they feel that they won't receive the same tips during the buffet that they would receive at the dinner service. The way the staffing of the buffet is arranged, I'm certain that's true.There's a sign on the buffet sneeze guard in 72 pt. type telling diners that naan would be served at table. I couldn't help but be reminded of the shop owner with the "restrooms for paying customers only!" signs that one occasionally sees in a struggling convenience store. It wouldn't have been bad if the bread had arrived at any time before we were finished with our meal. Our drink order never arrived. In short, the buffet is quite limited and OK for flavor, with unbelievably bad service. Don't go while the sun shines. But if you can wait until the sun goes down, the place transforms into near perfection. They should really be closed during the day. A lunch place is a different animal from a dinner place... and you'll seldom see a better example than Bombay Palace. (I gave it three stars because I couldn't give it zero for the day and five+ for the evening.)Go at night and enjoy. Go to Woodlands or Sitar in the daytime.

reviews.name: Stephen L.
reviews.review: As a celebration dinner for quitting my job, my fiancé took me to Bombay Palace. If I can't afford food anymore, I'm more than OK with the Chicken tikka masala having been my last meal. My fiancé had Josh Groban (Rogan Josh) which he said "hit the spot." Uh, Josh, we're going to have a talk...You're probably reading this because you're scared of Indian food. Don't be. Go give Bombay a shot.

reviews.name: Shane S.
reviews.review: This is the best Indian place in Nashville, hands down. I have probably eaten there 20+ times. The lunch buffet is sinfully good, and dinner is also wonderful. The best part is the service - Ranjeet and the rest of the friendly staff at Bombay make you feel like family every time.

reviews.name: Patrick F.
reviews.review: To start the have only 3 parking spots out front... The grocery store parking is not for the Bombay Palace. Food is bland and not spicy at all. My waiter was great but food was meh...

reviews.name: Rachel C.
reviews.review: This is the BEST Indian restaurant in Nashville!  I love the lunch buffet!  The restaurant is small so you may have to wait during peak hours.  The Naan is delicious and is included with your buffet price!  It is very well done and the staff is incredible!

reviews.name: Peter C.
reviews.review: The ecstatic proclamations of "oh my gawd" during my meal was enough to rival an all-night love-making session.  The goat saag and lamb chop were buttery, spicy, complex yet alluring, so delicious that it was mind-boggling.  If sexiness is flavor, I found it in these two dishes.  Great service and ambience, too, which rounds off the illuminating experience.  I must say, Bombay Palace transcends Nashville's stereotype and really adds a splash of quirk to the city.  By far the best Indian food I have tasted (which include heavy hitters in San Francisco, Miami, Baltimore, and San Jose).

reviews.name: India S.
reviews.review: In a great location, great ambiance, and friendly staff, but food was disappointing. Not much flavor, chicken makhani was watery and bland.  Dinner was quite expensive and I probably will not go back.

reviews.name: Winnie L.
reviews.review: LOVE!! Best Indian in metro area. The bonus is you can't beat the prices!

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: We just went there for lunch for the second time.  The buffet is small and neither time have they had everything out when they opened.  The first time I would just give it an okay rating.  This second time, I think I would almost give it a 4 star rating.  While all the food wasn't out again, it was excellent.  Every dish tastes different - it doesn't all run together no matter how similar they look.But the killer this time, she told us there were still more dishes coming out but the owner sent each of us a fresh off the grill leg quarter of tandoori chicken that was incredible - it might be the best tandoori chicken I've ever had, even better than that of a chef that is supposed to be the best authentic Indian chef in the Southeast.  Then when we got up for dessert, they had added two more dishes, one being peas (not chickpeas) and potatoes which was also very good.They try very hard and who cares who owns it or works there - the food is good.  And it's the only Indian restaurant in this part of town.  The waitress used to work at a Mexican restaurant down the street until they changed managers.  She recognized my coworker who had also stopped going there after the management change.

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: Two words....lunch buffet. This is all you need to know. If you are looking to sample as many types of Indian cuisine as possible, then this is your best option. Then you can find out what you really like, come back for dinner sometime and order just that!. I liked pretty much everything I tried,even though nothing was quite spicy(hot) enough for me. The real ticket is to get some mint chutney(sounds gross right?) It is amazing and has quite a kick! I put this stuff on everything. I thought it would taste really minty, but there is only a hint of it. It is mostly cilantro and peppers and vinegar...I am guessing anyways. Love it and will go back often!

reviews.name: Crabby O.
reviews.review: Close to five stars this place has really great food. The dining room is typical of the family restaurants common in big cities - kind of cluttered with stuff and small, kind of wondering if you were the only customer for that meal... This place has perhaps the tastiest vegetable dishes I have ever had.  The chef is very generous with ghee and the items are spiced perfectly. YOU MUST TRY THE MUTTON SAAG. Man is this good I can't get it off my mind. Skip the shanks - no meat on the bone.The naan sucks (tasted like it came from a bag) as does the iced tea (tasted instant, believe it or not). Of course this place is in Antioch, an area that has been disgusting for many years. Not sure that is worth mentioning...The people are very nice too.

reviews.name: Amy S.
reviews.review: Good Indian buffet for lunch and a good price (ca. $8 for lunch, daily). They always have at least one fantastic non-vegetarian, non-spicy entree. I recommend a mango lassi.

reviews.name: Claire B.
reviews.review: I am so glad Bombay Palace is here. I am a huge fan of Indian food and at last, Nashville has a great, not good, but great Indian restaurant. Everything here is just a little more carefully done - the flavors are better, the spices more aromatic, the sauces creamier, and the service is the friendliest anywhere.I love the lunch buffet, but I really like going for dinner because of the special combination dinner for two. It's a great deal that comes with soup , an assortment of tandoori, naan bread, and two curries. It's a good way to feel spoiled on a tight budget.My gauges for Indian restaurants are typically: naan bread, onion chutney, and chicken tikka masala. Bombay Palace's versions of all three knock the socks off anywhere else in Nashville. The owner is lovely too, and he has a great memory, and will remember you and treat you well so you'll become a regular.

reviews.name: Elisa P.
reviews.review: My first Indian food experience and it was awesome!  Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Rafael C.
reviews.review: Best Indian food in Nashville.  Hands down.  I'm a former Sitar devotee and have been converted to the greatness that is Bombay Palace.  The lunch buffet is the way to go.

reviews.name: Meitra A.
reviews.review: My family and I lived in the UK for two years, and we really became hooked on Indian food.  We have been consistently disappointed in the US, but Bombay Palace compares to many great Indian restaurants in the UK.  The service was excellent.  We tried the Chicken Khorma, Chicken Tikka Masala and the Goat Vindalu.  All three excellent.

reviews.name: Michaela M.
reviews.review: Fabulous food and super friendly staff. The quality of the food is a tie with Woodlands Indian Restaurant. But from a different region, so there are some differences in taste/flavor. Plus, this restaurant also offers meat dishes, while Woodlands is strictly vegetarian.Bombay is always packed for lunch, so you know it's a favorite around town. If you haven't tried it yet, do it. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Habiba W.
reviews.review: I tend to judge Indian/Pakistani restaurants by the quality of their biryani and based on their biryani I'd probably give Bombay Palace one or two stars- it's terrible!  It's incredibly greasy and the rice to meat ratio is way too high for my liking- in fact, there is hardly any meat in their biryani!  However, the service is good and their other dishes are decent.  Also, you can't go wrong with the lunch buffet.

reviews.name: Kiran G.
reviews.review: One day it was raining and I was hungry. I wanted to eat something but was not sure what to. I went to chipotle at west end. There was a huge line before me. I looked around and I just saw something like a mirage in a desert. I went into bombay palace. Ordered SPICY chicken tikka masala and 2 Naans. They were quick, just before that they served me papadams. They were delicious. Loved the food with a bottle of budwiser.The waiters were very attentive and took care of every customer with respect. I liked the place. Sometimes it gives a gloomy feeling and crowded appearance but once the food is on the table, you dont look at anything else. Very good place to have a dinner.

reviews.name: Greg T.
reviews.review: clean and pleasant environment to dine in, this new addition to Nashville's growing Indian cuisine scene serves a decent lunch buffet for $7.95.  They're challenged with a problem most new restaurants are faced with:  keeping up with demand.  during my 2nd visit, the buffet had 1 out of 7 dishes available.  the mgmt informed me that food would be out shortly.  "shortly" turned out to be 20 mins...let's hope these guys can fix these easy fixes...their food is decent!

reviews.name: Randy L.
reviews.review: I read the reviews and agree that this establishment serves great Indian food, I was in Nashville on a business trip. The service is prompt and servers attentive. I had the cucumber salad and the Garlic Naan with the Lamb Vindaloo. The lamb dish was perfectly spicy as requested (7/10). The Flying Horse beer was a perfect match for this dish. Prices were also very reasonable.

reviews.name: Shannon P.
reviews.review: Best Indian food in Nashville! Usually get it for take out but had time to eat there last night and get the "live effect" for the first time in awhile. Love it!

reviews.name: Ashley R.
reviews.review: This is my favorite Indian restaurant in Nashville thus far. No, I am not indian, so i am not the expert in the area, however, I know things, and it is delicious. I was with an Indian guy and he loved it. absolutely loved it. Not to mention, the wait staff loved him. We were celebrities all of a sudden, and got lots of free things. I have had a couple of things there, but the garlic naan is delish, and the chicken vindaloo and chicken tikka massala are my favorites. Insider tip: they serve alcohol, and prefer to serve their own, but they will let you bring your own wine and will not charge a cork fee. DealMAKER! The thing I was most impressed with was that when I had leftovers, they added rice to my to-go box so I would have rice when I ate them. Quite the nice surprise when I was dreading not having rice and I opened the box and there it was. Wait staff is delightful, and the ambiance is a little quieter.

reviews.name: Kevin A.
reviews.review: Great service, great food, and great ambiance.  Took a chance on this place as my wife and I came in from out of town. Thanks to all of you great local Nashville folks for taking time to review this place.

reviews.name: Uma S.
reviews.review: I have been to Bombay Palace several times for the buffet. I have found it oily and calorie-laden but tasty. Unfortunately, on our trip yesterday the food was bland and less than inspiring. I will probably not return to the buffet and pay 9.95.

reviews.name: Max T.
reviews.review: My favorite restaurant in Nashville, and the best Indian restaurant food I've ever had.  If you want better, you're gonna have to find someone who grew up there to make it for you homemade.  Also, unlike every other Indian restaurant I've ever known, the buffet is nearly as good as the dinners are.  My wife and I make a special effort to come anytime we're in the Nashville area.

reviews.name: Megan T.
reviews.review: We decided to try this place out last night. I was very pleased with the service, all of the servers were very polite and the owner actually walked around and spoke to the customers after their meals. It is a small hole-in-the-wall restaurant in a very nice area of Nashville. The inside is classy, yet relaxed and informal.We spent around $70 incl. tip for dinner. We decided on the combo dinner for two, it runs about $35. We also ordered two kingfisher beers at 7 bucks a piece, I  recommend their Indian wine. I can't remember the name of it but it was smooth, not too sweet and not too dry. A little pricey at $8 a glass, but it complimented the meal wonderfully.The combo came with a starter of pumpkin (?) soup, very flavorful. The main meal included chicken tikka, tandoori chicken, and a ground lamb type of kabob meat. The chicken was great, the lamb was interesting. The taste of the lamb took some getting used to, it was prepared a bit like meatloaf with fresh cilantro and mint leaves.  The tandoori chicken was delish of course. We ordered medium spicy, for the curries and that was pretty hot so beware of ordering too spicy here I was breaking a sweat, and I am definitely a Thai food regular. They veggie curry was great, they used fresh and crunchy ingredients which was greatly appreciated! I like my curry to have some texture. It was a bit cheesy, and a little hard to stomach but if you can handle the cream go for it. We also had some type of lamb curry, the cuts of lamb were spot-on. The meat was very tender and there were no scraps (i.e. fat/gristle). The naan was also delish, a bit crispy but still very buttery and tasty. We also ordered the raita (yogurt with cucumber) very good, but I usually like it a bit runny and theirs was very thick.For desert we ordered kheer, the sweet basmati rice pudding. I really liked the presentation with a little cinamon sprinkled on top along with some sliced almonds and a few raisins. Gorgeous.In all we were very happy with this place, next time we will be trying the lunch buffet, at $8.95 per person it should be a great deal considering the quality of food that is served here!

reviews.name: Ann S.
reviews.review: I don't understand why this restaurant is listed as closed--I just placed a to-go order by phone. Please correct this listing, because this is a great option for Indian in Nashville.

reviews.name: Nilabja R.
reviews.review: Food is ok. Nothing great. There are other comparable indian restaurants better than them. Very bad customer service. One time, went with baby and manager asked to move my baby to 'somewhere else'. :) ...Another time, went at 10:15 pm, outside sign was showing "Open". Went inside, about to be seated, the manager came and told us to get out since they are closing. I argued to no avail. God save their business.

reviews.name: Kurt R.
reviews.review: Went back for the lunch buffet and the line was out the door.  This was another good sign for me.  The wait wasn't terrible and me taste buds thanked my later.  The buffet was 10 bucks.  The Chicken Tikki was awesome as always.  The service was good.  I'm all ready looking forward to going back.

reviews.name: Kyle F.
reviews.review: Outstanding food. Excellent atmosphere and service. Menu is relatively expansive. Will absolutely go back next time I'm in the area.

reviews.name: Eve N.
reviews.review: The food at this place leaves a lot to be desired and the cleanliness should be called into question.  When they sat us down, I noticed that the tablecloth was used and dirty.  There were still curry and water stains from the previous patrons.  All they had done was to place red paper place mats on top with new glasses and utensils.  This is NOT what I call a clean table.  I brought this to the attention of a staff member and he showed us another table which was only marginally better.  There were fewer curry stains on this tablecloth.  But then I noticed that they gave the dirty table to the next party behind us without changing it at all.  Ew, gross!  This really put a bad taste in my mouth even before I tasted the food.  They disappointed in his department too.  The lemon and the white rice selections were hard and tasted like it was left over from at least a day before.  All the food tasted bland.  There were even bits of food and rice littered across the entire carpeted floor.  Do they even clean this place...ever?!

reviews.name: Phoebe R.
reviews.review: Great lunch buffet price, great and well-stocked buffet food, fast service when bringing yummy naan and drinks to table. Only part that took a while was getting the check. If you're near the VA Hospital or Vandy check them out.

reviews.name: Tony K.
reviews.review: Hands down our favorite Indian restaurant in Nashville. In fact, my wife and I had our rehearsal dinner there prior to our wedding. The service is good, the food is top notch and the lunch buffet is always epic. As with any cuisine it's important to recognize that not everything will be to everyone's taste, but we have brought numerous friends and family and all have loved it. It's rare to experience a misstep at this restaurant, so if you enjoy fine Indian food go and enjoy!

reviews.name: Elizabeth M.
reviews.review: I was here on a weeknight and everything wad great. We had the place to ourselves, though. Food tasted fresh and was fairly quick out of the kitchen. I'm very picky about my Chinese, and I would go here again.

reviews.name: Paul R.
reviews.review: We have tried several other Indian restaurants in Nashville. Bombay Palace is the best by far. The foodis well prepared and tasty. T.he service-a little slow, but they remember us, our favorite dishes, and which beer we like. Very personable. Parking in back is convenient.

reviews.name: Chad R.
reviews.review: I consider this to be the best Indian restaurant in Nashville.  I first went there only a few months after they opened and it was not busy at all but the food and service were exceptional.  Now the word is out about this place and they seem to be constantly packed.  When they were new the furnishings were all tables.  Since they have grown, they installed a lot of comfortable booths in place of the tables.  I have introduced many a friend to Bombay Palace because I consider it to be the best in town.  I usually go there for dinner but have been there for the lunch buffet a few times and it is excellent as well.  Just expect a wait because it is not a large restaurant and is very popular.  The staff has always been extremely friendly and work hard to give you the best of service.  I have seen business here grow dramatically while Sitar's business has shrunk over the past couple of years.  So I think people have caught on that you can get better food and service at Bombay and have migrated there just as I have done.  They are also open on major holidays like Thanksgiving, Christmas, and New Year's Day as well if you are a little tired of the traditional holiday fare and want a change of pace.

reviews.name: PL G.
reviews.review: Wonderful restaurant - for more than just one reason.Upon a recommendation from a couple that I work with, who comes from India, and has eaten at Indian restaurants in Los Angeles, Chicago, New York,  and many places in between, told me the Bombay Palace in Nashville was the best and most authentic restaurant they have eaten at since being in the US, so we decided to give it a try.  My husband and I were celebrating our anniversary and decided to go to Nashville for the day and eat Indian food.  We arrived around 8 pm to find the small restaurant very busy on a Monday night, but we got lucky and were seated immediately.  You have to know the food was good when 85 to 90% of the patrons are Indian (or similar descent).  We ordered the combination dinner for two.  The food was excellent - quite spicy and extremely delicious!  My husband loved the Lamb Rogan Josh and I loved - well- all of it!  So much food - we had plenty leftover to take home for lunch the next day.  The service was also excellent as the waiter checked on us several times during dinner.  Here is the unexpected part of the service we received....the next morning on my way to work, I couldn't find my cell phone.  I concluded I had probably left it in one of the places we had visited in Nashville - bummer - I would probably never see it again.  However, when I arrived at work, I had an email from a co-worker who  received a phone call from an employee at the Bombay Palace.  The employee had seen my co-worker's phone number in the recent calls list on the phone and called him.   They told my co-worker I had left my cell phone at the restaurant and wanted to let someone know so I could reclaim my phone.  Talk about customer service!!  I called the restaurant and "Ron", who happened to find my phone,  told me he could mail my phone back to me.  I tried to reimburse him for the shipping cost, but he wouldn't let me.  He just said for me to come back to visit the restaurant and let my friends know about it.  I received my phone the next day.So between the excellent food and excellent service you cannot go wrong with the Bombay Palace.  We will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Nadine D.
reviews.review: Hands down, best chicken tikka masala in town. The buffet is good, but I prefer to go for dinner. Service is always great. Slightly more expensive than a lot of the other Indian food places in Nashville, but worth it.

reviews.name: Dilpreet G.
reviews.review: You may not know this, but unless an Indian restaurant specifies that it is a South Indian restaurant, it most likely serves North Indian/Punjabi style food. Being a Punjabi myself, I'm really picky about these places. However, this is a place I've never had a complaint about. We live in Mississippi but whenever we are in town, we make sure to stop by for a meal and are never disappointed. The service is great, very friendly. The food is amazing! Very authentic and delicious. If you want to try North Indian/Punjabi food. Best place in Nashville, TN.

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: i really wanted to like this place...walking in, i thought it was a nice looking place (orange walls notwithstanding). we were seated at our table, and as we were waiting on our food i noticed something... our table was the only one that had dead flowers at it. foreshadowing? i think so!the other party at the table ordered a vegetable tandoori appetizer, and (after sending something else back to get the correct order) it was simply amazing. i'm not really into fried food at all, but this stuff was so good. two samosas, a slice of potato, a cauliflower flower, a thing of spinach, and a thing of onions encased in a really tasty batter that had a nice little kick. from that point, we waited about FORTY minutes for our entrees. i'm not the type to get restless/upset about waiting for food at a restaurant, but this was ridiculous. so FINALLY our food arrived. i had some sort of mashed eggplant with tomatoes, green onion, and other stuff. it was shit. to quote a line from ralph wiggum (of simpsons fame):it tasted like burning.yes, indian food can get spicy, i know that. but this really had no flavor. if i didn't know i was getting eggplant, i wouldn't be able to tell you that it was. my fellow diners ordered the dal, and it was shit too. the naan was thin and lazy. i hate to slam a business, but this was easily the lousiest experience eating indian food i've ever had. sorry, guys.eric b

reviews.name: Abby S.
reviews.review: I had been craving Indian in a big way. I checked the reviews & decided on this place. Super friendly staff, very nice ambiance, and decent prices. I love Chicken Tiki Masala, and theirs rivaled the dishfrom my favorite Indian restaurant back in SF. The only bummer is that their oven was on the fritz so they couldn't make naan. They told me there was a similar bread that was deep fried & tasted a lot like na'an. I tried it - sold! It was just as good (wish I caught the name). Bombay Palace was very good & I will def be back!

reviews.name: J G.
reviews.review: Such good food. Everything I've had has been wonderful! The service is GREAT and everyone who works here is so kinda and nice. Chicken Tikka Masala and Chicken Korma are both wonderful. The buffet is AMAZING. Naan is great. Mango Lassie drink is so good. I love this place so much.

reviews.name: Jasmine M.
reviews.review: This is my 1st Indian restaurant in Nashville and when we arrived on a Friday, it was packed but seating was available. I had the Tandoori chicken and some delicious rice. The bread was fabulous and the evening was well. There were many Indians (please excuse the term if it offends) eating at this place which tells me, it's probably good. All was great! Sitting, talking, laughing w/my boyfriend until he looks at me and says to move to the right. I'm thinking "excuse me? who are you to tell me to move?" But he said it again and for the life of me, i moved and then looked to the left and saw a cockroach on the wall! Oh heck no!! I told the waiter who then said "oh no" and went to get a towel. He reached over me and I sort of pushed him off of me and told him not to kill it over me. I moved to the other bench and he killed it and grabbed it. Now, i understand things happen so i didnt make a scene. He blamed it on the Chinese restaurant next door and took 25% off my check. I doubt I will come here again. It's a shame because the food was pretty good.

reviews.name: T A.
reviews.review: This restaurant is one of my family's absolute favorites--we get take-out each week for dinner. The service is excellent--everyone is extremely friendly and helpful--and the food is always ready for us to pick up in a timely manner. We have our favorite dishes and order them every time--they are always so delicious and flavorful. There are many wonderful dishes for vegetarians (like me), too. I highly recommend Bombay Palace. I love it when we can eat-in, here, too--the ambience is great!

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: A fine Indian restaurant in Nashville, with chandelier ambiance.  The imported from India wall paintings of the Taj Mahal, sacred elephants and native scenery help set the authentic tone. Baingan Bhartha roasted eggplant and the Subzi Vindaloo vegetable medley are good dishes among the 20 veggie options.  If you're a carnivore you might try their goat, lamb or shrimp biryani rice. I like the Mango Palace drink and the Masala Indian tea to go with my Bombay Palace meal. Although this is the fourth Indian restaurant in the west Nashville/West End area, market demand helps insure its success.

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: After reading a review in the Nashville Scene we decided to give them a second shot...as our first visit didn't live up to the hype. I'm sad to say that we will not be going back. After waiting for a considerable amount of time for our entrées...we were completely let down. We ordered the dal which tasted of nothing but heat.  The first sign that we were in for a mediocre meal was the watered down chutney. Their only saving grace was the nan and the assorted vegetable appetizer.  I think we'll stick with Woodlands going forward.

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: Bombay Palace is super close to my house and offers probably some of the best Indian dining in the West End area.  The best thing on the menu is the boti kabab masala.  Essentially it is a lamb kabab that is cooked in some funky Indian sauce.  It was super good!  It came with some zucchini that was mushy and not very appetizing.  The people that run the place are really nice and are very accommodating to guests (I came with a disabled friend and they were helpful at getting us just the right spot out of the way from the restaurant traffic).

reviews.name: Liz D.
reviews.review: I started coming here two years ago, and have never looked back. The spices are superb and yet delicate, the meats are always high quality (never chewy/fatty), everything is made fresh to order and with obvious care. Unlike most restaurants in Nashville, this is a gem that beats out its competition even in most of the other cities I've lived (East/West coast and continental Europe). The caliber of the dining experience extends even to the buffet--naturally a beast to be wary of but here, it is not to be missed. One or two favorites remain pretty constant (chicken tikka masala, a saag) but otherwise the variety is amazing. Every time I go I find a dish I've never tasted before, and both Northern and Southern cuisine are well represented. Vegetables are cooked impeccably (never overdone) and with beautiful naan and the occasional dosa brought to the table, I'm happy as a clam. The service is also something to note--one visit and you'll be recognized, more or less, at all visits following. To Indian foodies in Nashville, come see why we've converted to Bombay.

reviews.name: Hilary K.
reviews.review: Great food, great old-school decor, already looking forward to going back.

reviews.name: Eryn F.
reviews.review: Great menu. Great food. Great service! Can't wait to go back.

reviews.name: Carly K.
reviews.review: I love this place! We love Indian cuisine, and have been to every Indian restaurant in Nashville. Bombay Palace is the best by far. Their cuisine stands up to and is better than Indian I've gotten in Los Angeles, San Francisco and other great food cities. Their tikka masala is awesome, as is the veggie korma. They have several varieties of naan bread too. If you want to try lots of dishes, go for the lunch buffet- it's the best in the city. The atmosphere is warm and inviting and the staff is excellent and so sweet. You'll have a wonderful time here while eating delicious food!

reviews.name: Saurabh B.
reviews.review: We stopped in there on New Year's Day. The place was busy, but the server was very attentive and friendly. We were able to customize our dishes to our heart's content - Veg Jalfarezi (which is a standard in all Indian places) plus a Mushroom Broccoli Karahi (which is much more uncommon). The papad brought out at first was welcome since we were really hungry when we landed up there. The food came prepared quite in keeping with our customizations - not greasy or oily. We appreciated the friendly atmosphere and despite the rush of people coming in, we never got the impression that they were counting the seconds till we would be done and vacate the table. There was a small touch in the end that we appreciated - on the occasion of New Year's Day, they were giving payasam (an Indian dessert) to all the customers.Tip: If you cannot handle spicy food, ask for mild preparation.

reviews.name: Concerned C.
reviews.review: Not really worth it. Dinner portions were tiny. For $9.99 received a small bowl of entree and a slice of nan bread. I asked for rice and was charged $5.00 for the plate of rice. Outrageous. Three of us ordered the same entree (nirhani?) and 2 were served in identical bowls and the third was served in a much smaller bowl. Gum chewing waitress was not helpful. They were out of somosa appetizers at 7:00 pm????Would not recommend at all. I've never been to an Indian Restaurant that charged for rice.Nuff said.

reviews.name: Jonathan G.
reviews.review: Good food -- had dinner, tea, desert.  Very friendly service. The place was packed when I got there. They set up a table in a corner so I wouldn't have to wait. I thought the table was perfectly fine, but the owner came over and said that he would rather have me be more comfortable so he quickly arranged for me to sit at a bigger table.

reviews.name: Brad W.
reviews.review: I love Indian food and have sampled it all over the world, including India. I have also eaten at the Bombay palce several times. First the good: the decor is nice, the service is attentive, and I highly recommend the buffet at lunch. My main criticism is the tandoor dishes. It appears they use a tandoori oven and the nann bread is great. The problem was I ordered the tandoori chicken during evening hours after inquiring if it was breast meat and was assured that was the case. Then I was brought a plate with several drum sticks and two small pieces of thigh that appeared to have been left over from the lunch buffet, which is pretty unacceptable from my viewpoint, especially for the cost so I would recommend anyone to pass on that dish and get one of the curries. The kulfi indian ice cream is yummy.

reviews.name: ALEXIS P.
reviews.review: Visited for the first time last night.  The place was clean and nicely decorated, which was a surprise in that decrepit old strip mall.  Our waiter spoke english, but with a VERY heavy accent, which i don't care about at all, except that i had to ask him to repeat himself 4+ times when he asked for my ID (after I ordered a King Fisher), which apparently made him suspicious that i didn't have an ID (i look young, but am 25), so when he looked at the ID, i had to ask him to repeat himself again 4+ times as he was trying to ask me for my "date of birth," and he started cracking up like he was catching me with a fake?  it was REALLY annoying and if we hadn't been meeting a friend there, I would have left.  Apparently, I made it pretty obvious how annoyed i was with him and I assume he asked the manager to take over for him who served as our waiter for the rest of the night, and was wonderful.Aside from that unpleasant interaction, the rest of our service was fantastic, and the food was wonderful.  I had the lamb saag (lamb with spinach/cream sauce) which was aromatic and well-balanced, and the garlic naan was perfectly grilled and hot.We would definitely be back if they would lower their prices: dinner for the 3 of us, with a beer each ended up being $69 plus tip- a bit high compared to other places in town (Cuisine of India being our routine go-to-indian).

reviews.name: Emily Y.
reviews.review: pretty good.  i went for the lunch buffet.  good flavors.  and the decor is nice for a work/business lunch. my disclaimer is that i am no expert on idian cuisine.  i think i still prefer woodlands.  i'd go back for a dinner time try.

reviews.name: Roger R.
reviews.review: This is our second time to this restaurant. It been several years since our first visit.We were not disappointed the first time or we disappointed this time. Our seating was quick and service was outstanding. Ashley our waitress was quick, kind and polite. She made sure we felt welcome and took very good care of us. She was not too frequent but timely in her visits to make sure we were doing well.The catfish "southern style" was great and the portions were nice. Everything was fresh and hot.If your looking for a good catfish dinner this is the place to come to in Nashville.The ambience setting with the catfish pond just adds to the atmosphere and everyone else seemed to be having a good time.Make this stop to a very good restaurant.

reviews.name: Gary S.
reviews.review: Had a great meal with very good service on a slow weekday night - no wait.  The catfish and ribs combo was my choice and I really enjoyed it.  Lots of choices for sides, but the fries, beans, and onion rings were quite good.  Our server was polite and helpful.  She kept our glasses full and checked with us often.There is an awesome old Dodge Ram truck as part of the decor.  Yes, there are lots of stuffed animals, but some live catfish swimming in an indoor pond too.I will be a regular at this place and will recommend to my friends.  The photos already posted give you a pretty good idea of the place.  Check it out.

reviews.name: Ronald Y.
reviews.review: A dinner here is a great unique time for those looking to step outside some usual boundaries. Me and a couple buddies found this place and was greeted with a plethora of taxidermic plaques and still lifes. The menu was just as far from your normal burger joint as the rest of the building. I greatly enjoyed my elk meat sliders and a side of fried alligator bites.If I were to list some downsides, the time it took to sit my group of 3 down was unusually long because I spotted many empty tables from where we stood and it is on the pricier side (I think the food makes up for it though).

reviews.name: Rob W.
reviews.review: This place is quite touristy, but the food was good, and reasonably priced. They have lots of game and wild animals on the menu, but I stayed somewhat conservative and got the barbeque ribs with a loaded baked potato. The meal was very good, the ribs were super tasty and fell right off the bone. Service was wonderful.

reviews.name: George C.
reviews.review: I came in for dinner and was tempted to try the gator tail or elk but instead I played it safe and ordered the roasted chicken and 2 sides. The chicken was so dry that it reminded me of the turkey from National Lampoons Christmas vacation. Ugh. The white beans and baked potato weren't anything special. Bland. The highlight of my meal was the sweet tea.My server was a nice and friendly guy. Good job overall. The inside of this place is crazy. It's like you walked into a natural history and taxidermist museum.  Stuffed animals, flowing streams, waterfalls, open flames. Kinda fun if you're into the outdoors. I wanted to like this place but I was not impressed with the food.  Maybe I should have ordered the gator tail after all.

reviews.name: Marisela S.
reviews.review: This said it was known for their catfish so that's what I did, I got it grilled and it was delicious. The sides were good, service was fast and the ambiance was great country styling. It would definitely go there again, it was a great experience

reviews.name: Edward S.
reviews.review: Had the greatest time in Nashville and Caney Fork accentuated it with AWESOME food and stellar service!We had the good fortune (and sense) to eat here twice while we were in town. Both times I had the "special;" catfish and ribs. The first time, I chose to have the catfish grilled. It was moist, tasty, a good sized fillet. But it's the RIBS that's the shining star of this place. I don't care what technique they use to make them, DONT @#$%in' CHANGE IT!! They're quite possibly the best ribs I've ever had, ANYWHERE - most certainly in the top 3. I also tried the catfish "blackened" the next time we went. While the fish was FAR from blackened, in the traditional sense, it was still very flavorful and equally moist and plentiful. The fifth star of this review is for the service. Both nights we were greeted with smiles and hospitality all around. But "Sherry," on our second trip, was a true gem. She took great patience and care with our questions and requests. Even took an EXCELLENT picture of us at the table. Our drink glasses never got down to half before they were refilled. She was amazing. The ambience is down-home casual and further adds to the welcoming "vibe" of the restaurant. Prices are decent - my special for catfish, 1/2 rack of ribs and two sides was $19.99. That ain't bad!I only hope we get to come back to Nashville again, soon, so we can come back. .......oh yeah...... don't forget to try the Gator Bites! Another pleasant surprise.

reviews.name: Meghan Q.
reviews.review: This was the first bar I went to while in Nashville.I liked how there was no cover and the was a separate bar from the dance area.  The cover band was awesome and the bartenders were quick and friendly. Prices are good too. I'll be back!

reviews.name: Sara B.
reviews.review: Great service and food. We got the ribs and catfish combo. The corn fritters were amazing. Loved the decor too.

reviews.name: Rick S.
reviews.review: First time equest Derek's section, or don't either way the place rocks, swag is awesome and great ribs!

reviews.name: Nick M.
reviews.review: They claim to have the best fall off the bone Ribs! Well that was just a lie! I had to use a steak knife to try and cut through them and even then it was like trying to cut through a rock! The ribs were really tough, fatty, and really over priced!!! So much for their claims on having the best ribs!! What a joke! Even the service was on the slow side. The crab cakes & corn balls were the only thing decent I had there in my opinion. Overall I'm very disappointed in my experience of this place!! I do not recommend this place to anyone!            (WARNING!!!! DO NOT TRY THE RIBS!!)

reviews.name: D M.
reviews.review: There are better choices, if you are stuck in the area Cracker Barrel is next door.  Menus are Xerox paper, no wild game on it. Just frozen frog legs deep fried.  Not much to say here, place has a sad look to it, neglected and past its prime.  The food looks like it is from frozen.

reviews.name: Chrissie S.
reviews.review: I love, love, love this restaurant! Makes ya feel at home! The servers are super friendly & always so nice :) This was my 3rd time to this restaurant. My husband & I came here twice this past week whilst on our stay at Opryland. We just couldn't get enough of those amazing Corn Fritters. We even had to ask for some "to go" to take on the road :) 4 words: Cajun Fried Gator Tail. It is SOOOOOOOO tasty! The Wild Game Platter is well worth the cost & is definitely more than enough food to fill 2 people up. Our very last time here, I decided to get the Elk Sliders because of how much I had enjoyed the Elk on the Wild Game Platter &&& it was definitely a win as well :) Everything inside this restaurant is sure to keep your attention; from the Deer & other animals in there, to the Pond they have in the back with cute lil fishies. Not a super fantastic trip to Nashville, till you've tried this place sure to please the pallet ;)

reviews.name: Hana A.
reviews.review: Great location, decent food, nice decoration. Quick meals with good price. Recommended to tourists in the area.

reviews.name: Anne B.
reviews.review: As often happens on road trips, my husband and I chose Caney Fork River Valley Grille because it was in close proximity to our hotel. It turned out to be a great choice! The restaurant was adorably decorated to look similar to a hunting lodge or fishing cabin. I especially enjoyed the truck positioned to look as if it had crashed through a wall and the taxidermied bear positioned to stare at the music stage. The food was extremely good. The offerings consist of a mix of Cajun and Southern as well as a small wild game menu. I chose a Big Game burger, which is a double burger consisting of one beef patty and one elk patty. The meat was perfectly cooked and juicy. The flavors of elk and beef were very complimentary to one another. The service was also very good. The staff was friendly and courteous without being obtrusive. They were well prepared to offer suggestions. Our waitress made sure to point out the wild game menu which I otherwise might have been missed as it is seperate from the regular menu.All in all, I will defintely be adding this to my list of places to stop at in Nashville!

reviews.name: J W R.
reviews.review: We had the friendliest waitress imaginable in a restaurant that bills itself as the most unique restaurant in Nashville.  If you agree that rustic walls filled with animal heads, an indoor catfish pond and pictures of fishing are unique then the claim is true.  The food was not unique nor was it particularly good. The farm raised catfish had a funky taste -- it took a few hours to get past that meal.  The prices at Caney Fork are reasonable, the beer was cold, and the service good, however.

reviews.name: Penelope A.
reviews.review: I recently discovered Alligator meat with a friend in Denver, and so I just had to have it again!  I googled and came across this restaurant.  The food did not disappoint.  The wine was chilled to perfection, the crab cakes were delish and the gator sliders were great!  The service was good too.  The only things I was a little disappointed in was the chocolate pie and the very wooden, very country like decor.  Yet I would still return because I was satisfied with everything else as well as the prices.  This will be my spot for gator cravings:)

reviews.name: Will P.
reviews.review: Not bad at all  My friend and I wanted some dinner so we tried out Caney Fork.  Our waitress was very kind and took care of us well.  I had the fried green tomatoes along with a shrimp po-boy.  The food took quite a while to come out, but when it did it was fresh and hot.  The fried green tomatoes were a good thickness, but the l did not really like the corn meal used to bread it.  The po boy had a lot of shrimp on it.  Was not seasoned the best, but when the sauce provided was added it kept the bread from dominating and getting sticky in the mouth.  No complaints, but did not wow me.

reviews.name: Michelle L.
reviews.review: After driving 10 hours and finally settling into our hotel, we chose this nearby restaurant. We are pretty simple when choosing our food, so we didn't select any of the unique foods like  alligator or frog legs. We had the fried pickle chips, fried red onion stack, the house burger, and pulled pork sandwich. The food came out fast. The fried food was amazing! I would recommend the onion rings. I also LOVE pickles but wasn't overly impressed with the pickle chips. The burger was cooked well although the the bin was burnt. The ambience and decor was neat.

reviews.name: Courtney R.
reviews.review: First time here. Wasn't highly impressed from the get go when I was handed a paper menu that didn't include a child's menu. I decided to stick to something "safe" and ordered their smoked half chicken. It was moist so that's something. However the seasoning on it does not provide any type of flavor. You can tell that it is smoked though.  My husband ordered the steak and gator. The steak was perfectly cooked and although we were not fans of the gator (the youngest child loved it) it was well cooked as well. Our server was so sweet and gracious as well as the ladies in the front.

reviews.name: Kenny R.
reviews.review: Can't make reservations and can't call-in to be added to the list....so be patient Average BBQ joint with some pretty cool meat options (elk, gator, etc).  Portions are a little small for the money spent (2 avg people = $50)They do rely on the fried stuff.  Also, the stew with elk, yeah...that should be called Potato chunks with a trace of elk.  Service was somewhere between ok and a little slow.

reviews.name: Marcus B.
reviews.review: It took a while for the food to get to us but our waitress (Katie) did not neglect us in the meantime. She kept us laughing and our glasses filled. I had the frog legs as an appetizer. It was my first time eating frog legs, so I didn't know what to expect. I enjoyed it. You'll just have to try them to learn more. I've uploaded a picture of them. I also had the chicken. Very good. Moist and flavorful. Same thing with the steamer broccoli and mixed vegetables. Ironically, the frog legs and the chicken had the same texture. Is that coincidental? You be the judge!

reviews.name: Shawn N.
reviews.review: The food was good, the beer was cold and the service at the bar was excellent. Rolled in on a Saturday around 7 to a very long line. Sat at the bar and both bartenders were great. I had the Bbq platter with ribs and chicken breast. The ribs were fantastic, the flavor of he chicken was excellent. Not quite as moist as I prefer but still very good. Loaded baked potato was good and the mushrooms and onions were very good. I did love the bluegrass band that played. Between that and he service it was a great night out.

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Great ambience, very unique. Food was, as you expect, just ok. We had the fried pickle chips and gator tail appetizers. Both were very good.However, don't believe the menu when it says "Nashville's Best BBQ Ribs." I was hugely disappointed when our BBQ combo platter tasted oven baked as opposed to smoked. Ribs were the most disappointing. Chicken was ok.Our service was average.My advice here - this is a good restaurant, with great ambiance, but skip the BBQ. They don't seem to give it the love and smoke it deserves.

reviews.name: Brittany M.
reviews.review: This restaurant is the closest one in walking distance that isn't directly inside the Gaylord Opryland. My party of city-folks were not excited by the name or the outside appearance... or even the taxidermy filled country inside, but boy was I. We waited 45 minutes on the patio, but with a huge country-style porch bench and lots of room, we managed to keep ourselves entertained. Once inside, we were one of two larger parties sat back inside this little 'cabin' of sorts. While it had some neat things inside of it, too, it did shield our view of some of the other happenings in the restaurant, which was unfortunate.We ordered some gator bite appetizers which were totally awesome. This, in addition to these powdered-sugar covered 'corn nuggets.' Fair warning-- these were not corn kernels fried in a savory matter. It was more like cornmeal dough with powdered sugar. I wasn't a fan. You could get 2-3 huge catfish filets (blackened, fried, or grilled) for less than $14. I settled on 2 with some fried okra, and my gosh was it delicious. Everyone in our party loved their food, even if it was way too much for us to eat in one night, and the rooms at the Gaylord Opryland don't have refrigerators. There was also a bluegrass band playing that night with some hardcore knee-slappin', feel good music. I totally dig this place. I'd go back in a heartbeat.

reviews.name: Marcus T.
reviews.review: This place was absolutely terrible, the waiter took at least 15 minutes to come ask what we wanted to drink, our appetizers mine as well be dog toys because it was extremely chewy! The pulled pork was cold and tasteless when tyne waiter came up to us and saw there was only 2-3 bites out of each of our meals he tried making a joke instead of asking us how everything was going. Biggest waste of $70 for 4 people in my life. Better off just getting some 40 ounces and a dozen of eggs.

reviews.name: Rolando P.
reviews.review: Decided to check this place or since there was a long wait at cracker barrel.  I chose the cod and some fried pickles while my wow choose the gator sliders.  Both were great and the price was reasonable.  We also had the corn fritters which were awesome!  Our waitress was great and the atmosphere was nice.

reviews.name: Carrie Y.
reviews.review: We are so glad we made the decision to stop here. Being from CA we didn't want to eat at a chain restaurant. We wanted southern food! Our waiter helped us out with our decisions and they were amazing. The corn fritters they bring were mouthwatering delicious. We had the catfish taters as an appetizer and they are my 11 year olds new favorite food. We also went with the full order of ribs, baked beans & the campfire potatoes. The ribs pealed off the bones and were some of the best I have ever eaten. The campfire potatoes were served with grilled onions on the top. Delicious! The corn fritters were so good that we ordered some to go so we could have them in the am for breakfast. Great meal, atmosphere, friendly staff!

reviews.name: Nicola B.
reviews.review: For how tourist-trappy this place was, the food was actually pretty good--a pleasant surprise! Of course it's an absolute carnival scene, and I wouldn't necessarily call this "authentically Nashville", but it was definitely a fun experience. Very fast service, and the waitress was very kind. Very cheap for this type of place as well, in my opinion. So, basically, if you're stopping through and want a bizarre and trashy tourist experience with pretty good food, this could be the place for you!

reviews.name: Jay R.
reviews.review: A super unique, super friendly, super tasty place! I had the elk sliders with cole slaw/onion rings, corn fritters, and Tennessee white beans! It was so awesome! My server Kim was an angel! This place is one of a kind and will take you to heaven, literally! Come check it out! Lots of outdoors stuff on the wall, and also plenty of seating room.

reviews.name: Cait C.
reviews.review: You can't say you weren't warned. This is a tourist trap, and the food is BARELY edible. Please save yourself and eat somewhere else. Quality is probably better at McDonald's. Now that you have received a fair warning, if you are still going to eat here: order the gator and the fried corn fritters. Avoid salad at all costs.

reviews.name: Steve W.
reviews.review: After 11 hours on the road the family was looking forward to a good meal. We ordered the full rack of ribs and a chicken Caesar salad. The chicken was a little dry, but that was the only problem with the meal. The ribs were outstanding and the rest of the salad was perfect. The stag was very friendly and very quick, and our waitress made sure we were taken care of well. Oh, and they serve these deep fried dough balls sprinkled with powdered sugar that taste like mini funnel cakes. We'd definitely stop by again in the future.

reviews.name: Andrew P.
reviews.review: Service was awful as well as the food. The restraunt smelled like urine by my table. Not sure if it was the catfish pond or what but it was very unsettling. Waitress was rude and was mad that we were there. Family was in town and they wanted to come here. Needless to say they won't be back to this place. Catfish tasted muddy and was overcooked. The gator bites tasted like a deep fried leather glove. 3 of the 6 people were very sick the next day after dining here. The only wild game meat on the menu is frog legs and gator. I would save your money and go to cracker barrel next door or McDonald's.

reviews.name: Larz R.
reviews.review: Ate dinner there tonight. Service was pretty fast and very nice. In fact, she might have tried a little hard to be nice and flirty. I had the one-piece fried catfish, mashed potatoes, and fried okra. The catfish was pretty good, though some hot sauce helped it. Potatoes and gravy were damn good. I even had the chocolate and peanut butter pie, which wasn't bad. Include the sweet tea, and the bill was $21.The decor was... interesting. The taxidermy all over the place was a bit creepy, but it went with the hunting and camping theme of the place... I guess. Overall, a good meal.

reviews.name: Logan J.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere but food just so so. Very loud but cool decor!  I had BBQ plate with salad and mashed potatoes. Potatoes right out of the box :)Mom had catfish with veggies. Average.

reviews.name: Keivan S.
reviews.review: Great food, even better service. Very friendly, great for tourists. Try the gator and catfish.

reviews.name: Susan T.
reviews.review: This is the nearest place to get decent catfish. Our Grandson loves the pond..don't worry about leaving hungry.

reviews.name: Guy T.
reviews.review: Had to wait 20 minutes, lots of empty tables. Had the fish platter, really good, portions huge. fish done just right. Fried green tomatoes, excellent. Had my share to "fried" food for the week!Wait staff, EXCELLENT and lovely. I recommend ! if I wander back to Nashville from Manhattan, i'll do it again, as you should.

reviews.name: Matt C.
reviews.review: Service was excellent and I would ask for Tommy if we come back.  The ribs were above average as was the grilled shrimp!  Very good family place and it had a good feel to it.The children's menu is bigger than most and the meals had appropriate portions.  Good value for the dollar!

reviews.name: Cortney T.
reviews.review: I'm giving my review 5 stars, 4 for the food, and the 5th for the excellent customer service. We came with 3 little kids wanting to sit near the catfish pond. A family took it upon themselves to move to the open table waiting for us. The manager (or person in charge at the time) offered us a free dessert for the kids in return for the mishap which was beyond their control. Our waitress (I think they called her Dora?) was an absolute doll, just the sweetest lady ever and she took fabulous care of us. Food was great, not the best ever, but we came for the kid friendly atmosphere. The rotisserie chicken was very good. The kids picked the s'mores for dessert and had a blast roasting their marshmallows. I would definitely come back as our experience was excellent.

reviews.name: Carl C.
reviews.review: Visiting from GA. Great ribs would stop agian, when we come back to Nashville. Service was great. Waitress was on top ofeverything.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.review: Very quaint. Large catfish pond at one end of the restaurant. Gimmicky but fits ambiance well. Known for catfish and ribs we were told.Service was great. Fritters were good but the rest of the meal was meh. Not great but edible. I tried the BBQ platter. Beans were out of a can without any additional  spicing up. Pretty blah. wife had catfish.  She wasn't impressed  and she felt the catfish wasn't fresh.If we were really hungry, we might eat here again...in desperation.

reviews.name: Amy M.
reviews.review: Not bad.  Not great.  We had quite a variety, based on which we recommend the fried catfish and the ribs, which fall off the bone and require fork/knife.  Sides:  mashed potatoes, cole slaw and fries all forgettable.  Service was good.  Avoid the steak and gator...both are way better elsewhere.

reviews.name: Casey S.
reviews.review: Stopped here on a whim during a recent cross-country road trip and could not be happier with the decision!  The atmosphere is fun and the random decorations around the restaurant are cute and quirky.  All of the waitstaff were extremely friendly, polite and attentive.  The sweet little powder sugared dough balls that came out before the meal were warm, chewy, and not overly sweet.  We don't even know what they were called!Got fried green tomatoes as an appetizer - just the right amount of breading, well seasoned, and came out steaming hot.  The breading had great flavor but didn't take away from the taste of the tomato.  Wasn't thrilled with the sauce that came with them but it wasn't even necessary to dip them.Dinners:I got the blackened catfish with baked beans and steamed veggies.  Veggies were fresh and portion was large.  Fish was steaming hot and perfectly cooked - nice juicy filet.  The blackening seasoning was nice and spicy without overpowering the fish.  Just got the one piece meal and could hardly finish it; can not even imagine ordering the 2 piece catfish meal!  The baked beans were wonderful - sweet but spicy with lots of onion.My mother got the grilled catfish and half a rack of ribs combo.  The grilled catfish was also deliciously seasoned and cooked to a tee.  I tasted some of her ribs which literally fell right off the bone.  The sauce on them was sticky and sweet - very good.  Her sides were fried okra (not at all slimy like I've previously had) and campfire potatoes which were kind of like hash browns with grilled onions and peppers.  They were a nice addition to the meal.Both meals came with an order of hush puppies.  They were good but could have used just a little more flavor!Overall, a wonderful experience and would definitely recommend this to anyone in the area.

reviews.name: Chapalet M.
reviews.review: I got terrible service. Other tables around me with a different server got much better service. Had the grilled shrimp with loaded baked potato and Bbq beans. It was OK. Nice place though. Interesting things to look at. Won't be back.

reviews.name: Tony S.
reviews.review: Be patient the wait for a table is pretty slow.The food is ok nothing spectacular. They are supposedly famous for their gator bites. You only get 8-10 small bites and they taste alot like chicken. Most annoying of all was the floor is very sticky.I do not recommend.  Definitely a one and done kind of place.

reviews.name: Joe B.
reviews.review: If you're in Opryland, this is a solid option.  The wait on a Sunday night for 2 people was about 20 minutes, so plan your hunger accordingly.  The menu (and decor) really play up the southern theme, but the menu is so big that even if you don't care for southern-style food, you're bound to find something you like.

reviews.name: Brenda A.
reviews.review: The place certainly does have interesting decor and it's even interesting to walk around the place. But the food was just OK.  You really have to like everything fried to enjoy some of the dishes.

reviews.name: Tena E.
reviews.review: Excellent food and atmosphere. Our waitress was friendly and fun. We'll definitely be back!

reviews.name: Michael D.
reviews.review: The corn fritters they gave were so good. Had the gator, fried green tomatoes, fried pickles.  Then we shared a man course dinner of catfish and ribs. Everything was excellent.  Loved the outdoors environment and pond. The price was right. Oh also had the beer recconendation from our great waiter reed, I think his name was. Service was great.

reviews.name: H W.
reviews.review: I searched for catfish dinners near my hotel. Caney Fork came up first. The catfish could be fried, grilled, or blackened. I had the 2 piece blackened. Each piece was huge! And very delicious! It's easy to go overboard on blacken spices. They had a great balance of flavor! The fries were decent - kinda thick and some with skins (I like with skins). Hush puppies were nothing to write home about, but served as a good palate cleanser after the fish. I'd definitely recommend the catfish!! Yum!

reviews.name: Nicole R.
reviews.review: DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY. I was literally shocked by the cut rate service I received tonight. We arrived at dinner time and as expected there was a 45 min wait. My collegue and I opted for bar seating to avoid the wait. What we should have done was RUN. We sat down and were eventually greeted by a bartender, if you can call him that. How I would describe him would be a man that made poor life decisions and ended working at this establishment. This he clearly shows through his frat boy approach to customer service or lack there of. I watched him drop a drink on a patron and instead of apologizing he tosses him a rag from behind the bar. Rude.After browsing the menu we wait 30 minutes for him to return to take our order. After he does so he immediately prints us up a bill. I realize our appetizer isn't on the bill so I ask him about it. Honest mistake.  It happens. Only we never get the appetizer instead we watch him walk in circles with it only to then take it back to the kitchen never to be seen again.We eventually receive our food but no utencils. Instead we sit there dumbfounded by this guys utter disregard. We eventually flag down another waitress for utencils. He never returns to get us refills or to check on things. This guy is dispicable. Just when we thought it couldn't get any worse. Guess what? It does! We watch as a man stands and waits 15 mins to make a to go order. Only to be told by our incompetent waiter that he must wait until he takes care of the couple that walked in after him. But, the story gets worst. He over hears a conversation that we are having with the other angry customers and throws our change on the counters. I was at my tipping point and asked to speak with a manager. This place is a joke. The food was just okay. The service was the worst I've ever had and the place is dirty to top the cake! Avoid this place at all cost. And here is a tip for management teach your staff some manners!

reviews.name: Jen G.
reviews.review: Sat at the bar on a slow Wednesday for 10 minutes. No greeting, no water, no asking for my drink choice...no business from me.

reviews.name: Bob D.
reviews.review: One star only because I can't give it a zero. The entire evening was horrible. The service was the worst I can recall in years. Couldn't even get the drinks right. Never did get a refill on my tea. The food was below the level of what one would expect from Golden Corral. As a youth I had slopped the hogs with better chili. My entree was delivered with blood inside it AFTER I informed them well done was a medical requirement. I am an organ transplant recipient and as such  cannot consume undercooked meats. At NO POINT was I offered a manager and none ever came to our table. I asked if they check their Yelp reviews. I was asked, "what's Yelp"? I called in several days AFTER sending them a message via Yelp and receiving no response. I was told that the owner takes such matters very seriously and that he would be in touch with me. 2 weeks later? NOTHING. Do not waste your money in this overpriced clip joint purporting to be Southern cooking.

reviews.name: Brady B.
reviews.review: This was my first time outside of the western states so I felt a bit of culture shock.  Hell, I've never eaten crocodile before coming here (tasty I might add).  The service was perfect both times we ate here.  Our hotel was located next door so location was important. The decor is perfect for tourists.  It gives you that country feel with a dash of redneck thrown in.  I love the catfish pond the most.  I had the ribs which turned out to be amazing.  The meat would almost fall off the bone as I picked it up.  Flavoring was spicy sweet with one not overpowering the other. The drinks were made well.  Not too strong or week with just the right mixer added.  I'm no fan of cornbread but loved theirs.  Moist with a slightly crunchy top layer.  During the second visit we came for apps and drinks.  This is when I had the gator tail.  I was reluctant since I used to own a iguana and felt odd eating a reptile.  That all ended with my first bite.  I rationalized it by telling myself that I eat beef but it's not like I'm eating my dog. The bartender was awesome.  Us and another group of three were there and it was our coworkers b/day so the bartender made her the strongest drink available.  I ended up finishing it.  Great time had by all.

reviews.name: Alycia B.
reviews.review: I am not a fan. I can see how this place would appeal to some people...just not for me. However my coworkers seemed to like it.We ordered take-out and I had the gator sliders and catfish bites. Both heavily coated in whatever poorly seasoned fish fry cornmeal they use, which made the fish taste much drier than it was. Also had the key lime pie....it was terrible. Didn't take a second bite. Everything I had was just blah.

reviews.name: Brad S.
reviews.review: Great place to eat. The service was awsome and the food even better. This was the first time I tried gator and I loved it. I got the variety plate wich was the most expensive  item on menu but got to try many things. All was good. Went with group of friends and nobody  left unhappy. Can't wait to eat there again.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: We ordered a talapia Ruben ad a bunch of sides. The ruben was tasty and fresh. The fries were delicious and seasoned well. The mashed potatoes needed some salt and pepper but was still good. The fried tomatoes were ok. And the fried okra was pretty nasty but the waiter was nice and gave me some mashed potatoes instead. I think the best part about the meal was the sweet tea. I drank 3 cups!!

reviews.name: Chris C.
reviews.review: My 18 yr old son loved this place!  We were seated within 15 min in the bar section - quickly moved to another area once I told them my concern.  It also was great to be next to the pond and where you could hear the music.  I got the elk sliders which were very tasty.  For what I paid, I wish I would of got more than 3 of them with one side.  The corn nuggets they give you instead of bread were great, nice tough with the powder sugar.  Its like something healthy inside something that isn't...very sneaky you folk.  My son got the wild game platter with frog legs, gator, sausage, stew and elk.  It was one of his favorite meals.  Our server was great and very personalbe, it seems he really liked his job and that made our experience great.  We will be back here for sure when we are in the area.

reviews.name: Becke W.
reviews.review: This was the perfect dining experience after a few days at the Gaylord, which is easily walking distance. We took a group of kids, who were very entertained by the catfish pond and taxidermy animals. Very nice waitress. Food was good and plentiful. Corn fritters (instead of hushpuppies) were free and delicious. Ribs and catfish were awesome, too. Could have skipped the crabcakes. No room for dessert...

reviews.name: Chad E.
reviews.review: We were staying just down from the Caney Fork River Valley Grille (what is it with these long names?!?), and looking for a place to eat. Since we had no idea where to go, we naturally looked online to find somewhere with a decent menu, and somewhere that has boar and elk seemed like it would be interesting. Being in walking distance was a big plus and the gigantic moose outside (which is probably just life-sized) certainly didn't hurt.On the inside, the fun continues. It's like a redneck version of the Rainforest Cafe. Which is to say that there isn't really much to it - no animatronic elephant peeking out from the foliage - or really any foliage, for that matter. Instead, it looked like you were in someone's shack, complete with picnic tables, all manner of stuff and even a fishing hole. Yes, inside. The staff even completes the theme, as they are some of the friendliest you'll find.Is it a touristy place? Sure, but not any more so than any other themed restaurant and you're in a touristy section of town after all, so roll with it. Plus, this isn't quite as in your face as some of those others - see the Aquarium across the way in Opry Mills as just one example. As a bonus, you've got very friendly servers and the food is well-priced for what you get and tasty to boot. No complaints here.

reviews.name: Joe K.
reviews.review: Not saying your gonna have a bad meal, it's just they have never left me quite satisfied, gator bites are pretty good, however their steaks are bad, really chewy and tuff,  not fun :( it's meant for the tourists, I'll pass from now on.

reviews.name: samantha s.
reviews.review: Had the Elk Sliders and they were just ok, seemed over-cooked to me.

reviews.name: Stefinos L.
reviews.review: I ordered the ribs, very good choice. Service is excellent and the environment is cool. I think I will order another of the local beers on tap.

reviews.name: KELLY I.
reviews.review: I loved the gator bites and fried green tomatoes. The BBQ ribs are a must! Service was personable and just an all around wonderful experience!

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: It's a fun place, featuring Southern comfort-food, much of it fried.  The fried green tomatoes are just the start, they also have fried pickles, fried onions, and all sorts of fried meats, including some exotic ones.  I had some gator sliders, just to say I did.  I'll try something different next time.OK, more: It's very rustic, with dead critters hanging on the wall, and a fish pond in the middle of the floor.  It's also very close to Opry Mills and the Opry House. We were there with my brothers and their wives, so we ended up passing a lot of our food around.  I tried the frog legs, and enjoyed them, Kermit jokes notwithstanding.  I can also vouch for the shrimp po' boy sandwich.  The catfish was good, but not their best dish.

reviews.name: Michele S.
reviews.review: Stayed in Nashville unplanned, our Hyatt Place Shuttle Service recommended this place with high regards to the ribs, "best in town", he said. Our driver also recommended the catfish on the menu, and I could not be happier that the Southern Surf & Turf special had both on a plate for $18.95. A large portion which can also be shared since you also get two side items with your meal. The Backwoods Tea was really good for $5.95, just wished the drinks were served in mason jars, as our waitress accidentally poured water into my friends sweet ice tea glass, which is a red plastic glass. Budget friendly, great staff as everyone that works there greets you with a smile. Service on the food was a little slow, but they may have been because the kitchen may have shut down for 5min to catch-up from the dinner rush. What a unique campfire grill experience. Would come back again.

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: Service and food is fantastic! I got the buffalo quesedillas. Amazing! Tracy and Josh were remarkably friendly and way cool. Cat fish pond is an added plus.

reviews.name: Bill M.
reviews.review: The experience was overall average.  I had the catfish and rib special. Catfish was excellent,  the ribs were average. My friend had alligator bites that were tough and not good. Decor is cute and service was great but food not so good.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: Right at the entrance to Tourist Trap Row lays the Caney Fork River Valley Grille.  Fortunately you don't have to say all that to eat there. I'm exhausted just typing it all.We were greeted by a friendly group and were seated immediately.  We ordered the Cajun Fried Gator Tail, which was delivered quickly by our cheery waitress.Our Entrees rapidly followed.  For some strange reason my Po' Boy with "Everything" had just shrimp, Lettuce and Tomato on it.  This apparently *IS* everything. If you want tartar sauce, cocktail sauce, or hot sauce you have to ask.  I investigated this further only to find that the onus WAS on me to request these things.  Plus points for them sticking with "tradition". Minus points for them not letting me know that is what we were doing.Overall, considering the other nearby Tourist Traps you could certainly do worse than Caney Fork, though honestly if I was in the area again for food I'd probably just go up the street to Cock of the Walk.

reviews.name: Dan H.
reviews.review: Stopped in on business trip. Brad the bartender was a whirlwind, great. Catfish were great, especially blackened. Don't get the beans as a side though.

reviews.name: Mary M.
reviews.review: Don't bother coming here.  Food was served cold.  Campfire potatoes were more like campfire rocks.  Baked beans were pork n beans. Pulled pork was unremarkable.  Waiter was a dud.

reviews.name: Tina W.
reviews.review: Got there at 5 to avoid the dinner traffic and that strategy seemed to work.  The dining hall was full when we left.  Our server was pretty good, not overly friendly, but attentive enough.  She encouraged my son to try alligator tail.  He did try it, but wasn't a huge fan.  TONS of exotic/game food if you're up for it.  Sweet tea was good and plentiful.  My chopped steak was cooked as I requested it, but the brown gravy, onions, and mushrooms were gloppy and kind of cold.  We both left saying that we ordered wrong and would try it again, but I'm wondering with so many interesting places in Nashville if we should?

reviews.name: Bobby C.
reviews.review: Dear bartender Sage: this is not the calling for you.  I know you are trying hard and you mean well but multi tasking is a key part of your job.  For the food, not bad at all and good catfish too.

reviews.name: Tyler P.
reviews.review: Not. Bad. At. ALL!!!  Some reviews find this place too "touristy", and that may be true, but the food is GOOD!!!  We had Fried green maters as an appetizer and they were great.  Fresh hoagie bread, moist BBQ and slaw to tie it all together. We were staying across the street at the Gaylord Opry Land Resort and were tired of paying their prices.  Caney Fork River Valley Grille is WORTH the walk across the street!

reviews.name: Jerushah A.
reviews.review: so happened to drive past here and stopped on a whim, so glad we did the ribs were amazing service was great and fast!!! and it wasn't so expensive which was a big plus for us glad we got to try it!

reviews.name: Brady T.
