reviews.review: Not great. Ordered the catfish poboy sandwich with okra. The okra was great and the service was better, but the sandwich was not very good. The poboy bread was soft and low quality. The catfish tasted like it was frozen and under cooked. The restaurant is like BassPro shops with food. Very touristy and sorta like being in Disney land. The service is what sets the place apart. The waiters, waitresses, and staff are extremely funny and friendly, but they need some serious work on the quality of the food.

reviews.name: Rachelle W.
reviews.review: We just flew in for a conference and our hotel is right across the street. We opted to stay close since we had been traveling all day. We were very pleased with our dinner.  The wait was reasonable for a Saturday night.  Our waitress was very friendly and kept up with checking in on us.  I had the catfish and shrimp, while the others got steak and shrimp and the elk sliders. The portions were big, but not huge and we all left happy with what we had chosen.  If the opportunity arises, we'd go back.  There was even a bluegrass band playing.  It was nice that they were not set up with loud speakers. We could hear them in the background without it being so loud we couldn't visit with one another.   It's a fun, unique place that is well themed from top to bottom.

reviews.name: Devin A.
reviews.review: I recently tried the Caney Fork River Valley Grille on a recent business trip to Nashville, enticed by the promise of fresh catfish and live music.  Unfortunately, the best thing I had was the side of green beans that came with the undercooked, greasy blackened catfish that I ordered.  I went there trying to avoid chain food, but it seemed like chain food is what I got.Oh and the music was...well.....not what I was looking for...

reviews.name: Jewell W.
reviews.review: I was not pleased at all with the service provided while trying to make a reservation at this restaurant. I called ~ 4 weeks out from the day I need the reservation for a group of 25 and they woman I spoke with told me to call back closer to the day. In the meantime I found their reservation form online and filled it out. I got an email confirming I filled out the form and it said I would hear back in a few days or to call their restaurant if I had not been contacted. When I called them again to confirm my reservation (about 2 weeks from the date) I was told my form had not been processed/they had no record of it and that they were booked on that day. They GM told me she would speak to the owner and get back to me the next day or by the end of the week and I never heard from them. I was very frustrated that the first woman told me that they wouldn't be busy on the Wednesday night I needed and then when I fill out a form + contact them again to confirm, all of a sudden they are booked solid for that week. There needs to be a better system for reservations and their staff needs to be more professional in how they handle working with customers.

reviews.name: Chris C.
reviews.review: Basically everything here is fried, which is ok if thats what you're looking for. This place screams tourist trap, there are all kinds of interesting things inside, from a pond to an old truck. Service was great, and the dining experience was fun. However the food was nothing special. Deep fried everything - fish, fries, hushpuppies, fritters, you name it. It all tastes good going down, but your body will hate you later. I think there are much better places to dine while in Nashville, but this place is not a horrible option since it is conveniently located within the city. Indulge in the fried food goodness, but beware it comes with some consequences to your body of course.

reviews.name: Kathie H.
reviews.review: This was by far the best restaurant we ate at while in Nashville.  The service was great and the food was good.  We probably could have spent half a day walking around the inside of the restaurant.  It has a pond with fish inside as well as many taxidermy animals of all sizes.  We really enjoyed the atmosphere.

reviews.name: Bret R.
reviews.review: Been here a couple times. Food was good, service very friendly, price as expected. They have gator and other exotic game. Kids really like the catfish pond inside. Gives them something to do while waiting on food.

reviews.name: Kevin M.
reviews.review: Party of 4, early dinner new years eve. 3 sirloin steaks and a chicken tender dinner. Steaks were cooked as ordered, thick and juicy, seasoned with just enough to accent the steak but not hide it. All sides (baked taters, salads, beans) were properly cooked and tasty. Side of fried green tomatoes great. Corn fritters served at table were yummy also. Service fine. We all would eat here again in a heartbeat!

reviews.name: Ryan A.
reviews.review: 1st time eating here and we will probably be back. I had the big boy fish dinner. It was pretty good...The fish was placed on top of the french fires, which would have been ok if the fish had been allowed to drip grease before being put on the plate. I would have had a big problem with the soggy fries, but i still had my 2 other sides to eat. You get 3 pieces of fish with this dinner. These are not small pieces of fish either. I was quite surprised with the size of the fish. The mashed potatoes were pretty good, however the gravy tasted like packet gravy i can make at home. It was pretty bland. The server was very attentive even while being slammed. She did a very good job of taking care of all of her tables. The food came out very quick.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Good food, even if it is a bit of a tourist trap. The fried dough balls they give out as snacks taste like a cross between funnel cake and beignets, which are delicious. I had the roast chicken, which wasn't as juicy as the description made it out to be. Some friends got the gator and frog legs and it was pretty good. It's an interesting menu that offers some pleasant deviations from the normal fare you're likely to find in Nashville.

reviews.name: Adam C.
reviews.review: I dont know where all the good reviews came from....IWent there after a grand ol opry show....i had the southern specialNot so special  frozen catfish and shrimp. Tasteless hushpuppy.  The baked beans were ok.  Coleslaw dissapointing.Cool truck .....Tourist trap  pass on by.....

reviews.name: Todd F.
reviews.review: Pretty darn good.  Im from St. Louis so we have some good bbq.  I got the special.  Ribs and catfish.  Very good.   We also got the alligator app and the crab cake.  Could have done without the crab cake.  Everything else was great!  Good job.

reviews.name: Travis H.
reviews.review: Pretty amazing ribs. The backwoods tea was not very good, I wouldn't suggest it.  The sides were plain but good.I'd go back just for the ribs.

reviews.name: C V.
reviews.review: For the love of God, don't eat here. Colleague found a hair in her chicken caesar. Of course the waitress was apologetic and sent it back to the kitchen. 5-10 minutes later the chicken caesar redux shows up, colleague takes a few bites, then - I kid you not - a dead moth. The thing had wings, people! The waitress stops by and immediately identifies something is wrong. Needless to say we were ready for the check; I couldn't even finish my subpar shrimp poboy. The restaurant comped her meal, but we never once saw the manager. Seriously, do NOT go here.

reviews.name: Tim M.
reviews.review: Not a bad place to enjoy dinner near Opryland.Corn fritters (their version of bread) - hot, sweet, kept getting refills of this one.Shared the Surf & Turf with a guest. The steak (ordered medium) was a little dry but did the trick. Shrimp needed more seasoning.Live music was cool and watching the kids run around to the pond helped make the atmosphere fun.

reviews.name: Keith H.
reviews.review: The beer was flat.  The bar tender was fat (and useless).  Interesting southern decor with the lazy service to match.  A much better suggestion is the Sports Club around the corner.

reviews.name: BethAnn S.
reviews.review: You know its going to happen...family is going to find out you are in Nashville, and they are going to want to do the whole touristy thing.  Grand Ole Opry, Broadway, Gaylord. Well, if you are hoping to avoid the horrors that await you at the overpriced and undertasty Rainforest Cafe, you can skip over to the Caney Fork Grille and make everyone happy.  Think of this as Logans Roadhouse with a heckofalot more dead stuff mounted to the walls

reviews.name: Ashley M.
reviews.review: The place was neat. We enjoyed the decor and live music. Apparently this place is great for large groups and the kids enjoyed dancing around while the band played. It was pretty entertaining.The food wasn't overwhelming but it was good.

reviews.name: Scott M.
reviews.review: Good food, catfish is very flavorful, but was not the best I have had.

reviews.name: Sean H.
reviews.review: I waited at my table for over 10 minutes, as four servers and the manager all made eye contact with me and ignored me completely!! The server, who had passed me at least 10 times, then greeted me. I asked for water without lemon and what imports they had. She said Budweiser and Yuengling...sigh. She then brought me a water WITH lemon and my chosen "import." The manager then came up to me and apologized, saying she was new. While that seemed fine, then the server came back and said she'd been working there for years!!! The food got to me faster than the server had, and was good. I suggest the ribs with fried okra and mashed potatoes and a slice of their scrumptious key lime pie. Too bad I was so hungry or I'd have left before the server ever showed up...

reviews.name: Michael G.
reviews.review: If you only had Mac & Cheese this would be an easy 5 star folks.  We really enjoyed our awesome seat in the back of the huge restaurant by the pond and waterfall.  It is a great country restaurant with wonderful barbeque and the typical solid, southern service.I enjoyed the BBQ ribs and chicken platter with some fried okra and mashed potatoes.  The corn bread was solid too.  They have an extremely interesting menu that includes a wild collection of game meat to choose from.Fun experience.  Check them out.

reviews.name: Larry C.
reviews.review: Dined there tonight got the marinated ribeye   delicious! Never had a better steak. Excellent service too.

reviews.name: Duane F.
reviews.review: If you are ever in the area, you must stop in. We had the Gator tail, some special lemonade. The food was filling and the staff really good. This is very close to the Country Music Hall of Fame.

reviews.name: Rob B.
reviews.review: This place has decent service and the food is fine. The atmosphere really kills it for me, it's very touristy and made up. The exotic meat selections didn't seam very inspired. So I ordered the fried catfish with mashed potatoes and broccoli. All very standard and okay, just nothing to go out of your way for.

reviews.name: Mark P.
reviews.review: I am a local. We gave it a second shot tonight after we swore we wouldn't go back after our first experience a couple of years ago. This was the last time. The food is horrid. Our server was actually very good. We both had the cold, tough, catfish and cold over done baked potato. I had the green and brown broccoli she had the canned white beans. $14 per. Nonsense!

reviews.name: Eric B.
reviews.review: I went for the first time to watch the Super Bowl here. It is remarkably tourist oriented which is why I am giving it three stars versus four. Here in Music City I don't think we need the over the top tourist stuff you see in other towns. I had ribs as I do often on Sundays. The portions were more than fair and the prices were moderate. I loved the sauce but I will warn you that it is vinegar based and thin which is what I grew up on with my mom and my grandma. If you are wanting that thick, sugary sauce this is not the place to get ribs. I had a loaded baked potato that was fantastic and just about a meal all by itself. I also had the seasoned green beans and they were fantastic as well. We started off with some gator tail. It was the best I've had outside of Florida. It was fried in a light cornmeal breading with just enough seasoning so that one can still get the full flavor of the gator. I will be back!

reviews.name: Nancy R.
reviews.review: I had seen this place on TripAdvisor and I am glad I went! It was pretty busy, but we didn't have to wait too awful long. We got menus and plus there was one outside so we knew what we wanted when we got seated. You get cornfritters as an appetizer and I wasn't going to try them because it doesn't sound very good, but they were! They tasted like a fair funnel cake (I picked out the little bits of corn). We also ordered Gator Bites that weren't too bad, but they are a little seasoned. The catfish sandwhich wasn't too shabby. I really liked the catfish pond they have, and all the stuffed heads on the wall. It is a cool place, and I definitely recommend going there-but I do advise you like seafood before you go.

reviews.name: Alesha S.
reviews.review: We ate here before seeing a show at the Opry, and it was fun!  The food was good and the experience was great.  Outdoor Southern kitsch is how I'd describe the decor...like if Bass Pro Shops and Cracker Barrel had a baby.

reviews.name: Angela U.
reviews.review: We stopped here on our latest visit to Nashville. I was very happy with the food and service.We had the fried pickle chips and the onion strings as appetizers.Our entree choices were of course the Catfish (excellent) and the pulled pork (wonderful and tasty).Loved the decor especially the pond in the back of the restaurant with the live catfish.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: Was drawn in by the outside buzz of the cars and the "pet the live catfish" side in lights outside. Once we got in there was an immediate fun filled atmosphere. Live band started at 6:00, good interaction with the patrons, not to loud so you could enjoy the table conversation as well as the music. Lots of fried food to say the least! Had probably THE BEST sweet tea I have ever had. Great server by the name of Nicholas made sure my glass was never empty. Indulged in the campfire platter, talk about ALOT of food. Well worth the $18.95.***On a side note, they do not take reservations, however you can call ahead 30mins and they will put you on the list as if you were there. Walked right in from the truck to the table almost. Bypassed people who were standing there for 40 mins :)

reviews.name: Rebecca C.
reviews.review: Very disappointed with this place. On a Friday night we waited 15 minutes for a table despite multiple open tables. The food was mediocre at best. We expected an exciting vacation dining experience based on the appearance of the building. Our waitress was not interested in doing anything more than she absolutely had to. This included being pleasant, which she was not able to do. I think 2 stars is very generous. Do yourself a favor and skip this place and just go to the opryland backstage restaurant located across the street. It has better food, staff, and prices.

reviews.name: Kamy W.
reviews.review: Me and my family ate here and the service was good the food was just ok. Everything is deep fried .

reviews.name: Izzy A.
reviews.review: Don't come expecting to be impressed.  If you're starving it will do.  You might be safer heading to Logan's.  Seems this place might be benefitting from higher ratings because there is absolutely nowhere else to eat in this area.  VERY average dining.  Service average.  Food average.  Tastes like previously frozen fried food. Sorry.

reviews.name: Casey H.
reviews.review: I had the catfish plate the first time and the catfish tenders the second time. Both times, the services was pretty decent. Order was taken and the food came out quickly. Water was filled when low. The catfish plate was pretty tasty but the catfish tenders were tooo tooo salty like.... " would you like some catfish with that salt". I probably wouldn't go to Caney Fork again.

reviews.name: Yan W.
reviews.review: Staying closeby and seeing all of the great yelp reviews, I decided to give this place a try.  True to form, the restaurant was pretty kitschy. I called a carry out order and the folks on the line were friendly enough, but apparently carry out orders are processed at the bar. Also pretty normal. I got the catfish appetizers, and the elk sliders with a side of fried okra.  Sadly, the most delicious part of the meal was the fried okra.  The elk sliders wee okay, but in my opinion a little over done.  A couple of things that were turn offs-the dipping sauces were so heavy and mayonnaisey (in a bad way). The second is their "special catfish" - it was so gamey and fishy, I took one bite and really didn't want to eat any more of it. For the sake of yelp nation, I kept trying it thinking it would be better, but the fishiness remained.  So an appetizer and sliders was a total of about $22. I really can't recommend that.

reviews.name: Scott B.
reviews.review: This place is great. The decor is a little much but that is the point. The service was outstanding, food was very good and the pricing is very fair for what you get.  I had fried green tomatoes, elk sliders and an unsweetened tea, all for $28 - tip included. It was more than I could eat.

reviews.name: Erik S.
reviews.review: I am a big BBQ fan, and this place, hands down is the best BBQ for me. The pulled pork here is NUTS. Slap-your-grandma good. Side items are also outstanding. I even liked the catfish! (and I *don't* like fish) On top of that, the atmosphere is really cool, and even has a fish pond inside. The prices are super affordable, particularly considering what you get for it! If you have kids save room for the smores, it's a really fun experience for kids (and adults, too!) where you can roast your own marshmallows right at your table and make smores. Anytime I am in Nashville this is a must-go!

reviews.name: Frank S.
reviews.review: This is the place to try catfish, gator, frog legs, elk, and wild boar if you want - or classic beef, pork or chicken if that's what you prefer. The decor here is a hoot - fake cabin-in-the-woods style, with animal heads and statues of swamp people all around. A unique feature here is the indoor pond with live catfish, but it's not a catch-your-own kind of thing. The service was extremely friendly, and we enjoyed out visit immensely. We started with the "Cajun Fried Gator Tail" appetizer, which was fine - generic bits of fried gator meat nuggets with a very tasty sauce. I had the grilled catfish, and it tasted very good - not oily or fishy as these things can be. It comes with hush puppies and 2 sides, and I went for okra and a baked potato, again, both very good. We washed it all down with a sampling of beers.We'd go back in a heartbeat - truly a good filling meal, well prepared, in friendly and entertaining surroundings.

reviews.name: Elaine K.
reviews.review: Food ok. Corn fritters the best thing we had. Great quick service which we needed to get to the Elvis show. decent food if you don't want to drive into downtown.

reviews.name: John L.
reviews.review: I went there on a whim and it turned out pretty good the food was great and the service was excellent. I thought the Iced Tea was watered down too much and the price of $2.50 was kind of expensive, that was the only reason I didn't give it five stars.        The location was great right across the street from the Opry Land Mall and the Opry Hotel, along with the Grand Old Opry.... I will go back again just get water with lemon........

reviews.name: Apple F.
reviews.review: Ate lunch here on Spring Break, 2010, 4 adults, 3 kids. Everyone liked the place.Good food, friendly staff, and as Jose O. notes, a rustic interior, simulated hunting/fishing camp.Appetizer was the fried pickles, which were OK, but I had better at the Wildhorse Saloon in downtown Nashville.I had the Buffalo Chicken sandwich, which was great, as were the fries. I also tried the shimp and grits, which was good buy very spicy. I also had the local beer that the server recommended, it was very good.The kids enjoyed checking out the fish pond (which contained large catfish.)

reviews.name: Krystal W.
reviews.review: I stumbled across this place while searching for a unique place to take my out-of-town family.  Great choice!  I hadn't found many classier and clean places to take my distant friends and family for authentic southern cuisine, until today!  Loved the frog legs and corn fritters.  If only the fried green tomatoes were a bit more tart, I would have given five stars.  The dipping sauces for the appetizers were wonderful!Love the colorful theme and live band.

reviews.name: Brandon M.
reviews.review: This is not going to blow your skirt up but it will fill your gut with some nutrition deprived delights.  I had the fried catfish, game sliders, fried tomatoes, ribs, baked beans and veggies (terrible).  Why I had the veggies in a place like this baffles me.   Let's just say you should not be stupid and yell touchdown at a baseball game or order veggies in a restaurant known for being fry-happy.  The catfish was great and the sliders were good.  I would pass on the tomatoes...other restaurants definitely do them better.  The ribs were OK and the beans finished the meal off nicely.  Overall it is a good option if you are stuck in the tourist part of town.  Personally I really wouldn't go back but only because there are so many better options outside of this area.

reviews.name: Kevin W.
reviews.review: So we were on our way back from Hot-Lanta and decided to swing by this fun place. Server was very nice, food was pretty good and I liked the odd atmosphere. Had an overall good time and really enjoyed my catfish!

reviews.name: chris k.
reviews.review: I don't just give out five star reviews willy-nilly and Caney Fork gets ALmost a five.  The only reason it didn't get the full five is that the interior is kind of blah.  But hey, I wasn't there for the atmosphere.Our waitress, Brittany, was very helpful and friendly.  She suggested catfish and frog legs and by god, that's what we had.  I also had the gator.  The gator was typically pork-like (anyone who says it tastes like chicken has been eating some strange chicken) with a zesty dipping sauce.  Not bad at all.Frog legs were excellent with a zingy batter.  The highlight of the meal was the catfish.  Excellent, perfectly cooked catfish is hard to beat and Caney Fork has it.  Expect to pay around $20 per person for your meal.  I'd come back.Chris

reviews.name: Hope D.
reviews.review: Live music, fried pickles, fantastic corn fritters smothered in powdered sugar, fried green tomatoes, live catfish to entertain the kids, great service, and they even serve Popcorn Sutton Whikey! Um...yes please!

reviews.name: Jordan B.
reviews.review: Food was wonderful! I had a wild boar Philly with your standard French fries. Meal was great and service was friendly. The setting was cabin/outdoor themed and a taxidermist's dream.

reviews.name: Penny J.
reviews.review: Service was excellent here. Frog legs were awesome too. The ribs were ok. Price is reasonable. Very friendly staff. I will go back when we are in Nashville next time.

reviews.name: May K.
reviews.review: This place is perfect for kids and adults. The catfish pond and live music are fabulous! The ribs were very good, as we're the corn fritters. We tried gator for the first time and even the kids liked it. The fried frogs were good too, but I really couldn't stomach it. What you get is basically the bottom half of a frog. The gator are bite sized pieces so you'd never know what you were eating. Don't get the sirloin, hubby regretted it. Kids wanted to go back for dinner the next day, so we did. Service is awesome. Everyone is friendly and welcoming.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: This place is all about the kitschy ambiance. The food is a snore, but the beer is cold, the mugs are frosty, and my toddler was beside herself with joy seated next to the big old catfish pond. I'd pretty much eat hard tack for a peaceful lunch with my little crankybutt,  so we give it two teeny toddler thumbs up. Service was friendly and attentive too.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: For a good southern food taste of game that you don't normally eat up north. Gator tail was good. Wild boar Italian sausage very good. Service was excellent. I'd come back next time I'm in Nashville.

reviews.name: Bill S.
reviews.review: I love the atmosphere in this place, especially the cat fish pond! While I was initially drawn here by the ambiance, the food turned out to be the star of the evening. My filet mignon was cooked to perfection. My wife had the grilled blackened catfish and we both thought it was great!The server, Melissa, was absolutely outstanding! Not only does she have a great sense of humor, but she knew the menu inside and out and could speak intelligently about any item on it. She helped guide us with our choices.Definitely a good choice... especially for dinner.

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: Tourist Trap!!!Kinda kitchy and overdone, but can be a fun time especially with a group of friend or a family. They have live music at times- could be much more of that in my opinion.I  had the Steak & gator... not impressed. I'm going to read the other reviews ahead of time and next visit I'll try something else.

reviews.name: Dean Y.
reviews.review: Funky for sure. They do catfish right. The fried green tomatoes were right on. But the thing to write home (or Yelp) about are the corn fritters they ply you with while awaiting your entree. Think mini-Hawaiian malasadas - tasty nuggets of deep-fried decadence, sprinkled with powdered sugar. Nice.

reviews.name: Buddy R.
reviews.review: Go just for the atmosphere.  It's fun to walk around and look at everything in this place.We had the Catfish.  I'm glad I got the one piece as it was huge.  It was a little greasy and not real crisp but OK.  The BBQ pork was also just OK.Worth going - especially as, while the Mall is closed, there aren't many other places to eat around the Grand Ol Opry - but don't get your hopes up too high.

reviews.name: Gary P.
reviews.review: Stumbled in here to watch the Super Bowl. The wait staff were attentive and friendly. The decor was unusual and fun to look around to see what animal or wierd object you find. Food was good but not great, cocktails were a good pour. We enjoyed ourselves and would come back.

reviews.name: Stachia M.
reviews.review: Food was great. And the service even better. Enjoyed the indoor decor. For great service ask for Monica.

reviews.name: Tracy B.
reviews.review: I was in the area for somewhere that might be good while I was out of town and this place looked big from the outside with lots of cars in the lot so I stopped. Once inside the place had a really fun atmosphere and can seat many people! The menu is all southern food and I tried ribs and catfish and both were great examples of how southern food is supposed to be! I really suggest people to try this place! Food, service, and atmosphere are all great!

reviews.name: Lynda O.
reviews.review: Wow, the service was fantastic and the food was wonderful! We had the fried dill pickles and they were tart and the dressing was very tasty. When they brought them out they were very hot! I had the pulled pork and there was a lot of it and it was tender and juicy. The fried okra was so good too. I'll definitely be back.

reviews.name: Richard F.
reviews.review: Live music and fantastic bbq! Great atmosphere and my daughter even got an autograph from Casey James at the restaurant! I highly recommend this place!

reviews.name: Nick N.
reviews.review: Went here with a large group and these guys were great!  The place had a great atmosphere all around for both adults and kids....service was great!  They were not pushy or want to rush things as often happens when you have a large group.  Everyone got served in a timely manner as the group filtered in and the food was fantastic!  Our group had quite the variety from the menu and I don't think anyone left unsatisfied!  I personally had the ribs and they were very good as well as the side items of mashed potatoes and coleslaw.  Drinks were kept full, desserts served, and live music to boot!  What more could you ask for!!!  I highly recommend whether you have a large group or not...good food and great service!

reviews.name: Patricia F.
reviews.review: We were attending a conference at Opryland Hotel and decided to give this restaurant a try. Charming atmosphere with the indoor pond and a live bluegrass group. The food was not very good. I had fried catfish and was suspicious of it because it looked like it had been placed in a mold. It didn't have much taste. The campfire potatoes, which sounded delish were quite bland and dry and the Caramelized onions were actually tough. The hush puppies were also dry and rather tasteless. Intrigued by the cheerful atmosphere, I was ready to recommend the place to friends who are coming later in the week, but after tasting the food, I'm going to suggest they look elsewhere.

reviews.name: Sam A.
reviews.review: Atmosphere was good.  The free fried bread (not sure exactly what it was called) was excellent. I had the alligator and sirlion dish. The alligator was good, but they WAY over-cooked the steak.

reviews.name: Victoria C.
reviews.review: This was a great first meal in Nashville.  I had the Elk Sliders, and they were fabby!  The atmosphere was fun.  Family friendly, and yet there was a wine list.  Hubby had a Sirloin and Gator, and Olivia had a yummy chopped steak dinner.  The corn fritters were sinful, and we had NO room for dessert!  Good service too.  This was a winner.

reviews.name: E G.
reviews.review: Great selection of exotic foods.  Touristy? Sure, but the service was great, the food was filling, and the people were nice.

reviews.name: Mike F.
reviews.review: Stopped in after a long business conference.  Bar was clean and beer was ice cold.  Bartender was very nice and personable.  Food was good.  Fried Gator was excelent. Decided to stay for dinner and had the catfish cooked two ways;fried and grilled.  Would have liked a few more pieces in my order for the price, but it was still very good. All in all I would reccomend a visit if you are near the Grand ole Opry.

reviews.name: D P.
reviews.review: Had a great Friday night experience at Caney Fork.  At about 7:30 p.m., there was only a 15 min wait.  Had the catfish dinner (blackened) with fried okra and grilled mushrooms, washing it down with Grandma Bea's sweet tea.  The catfish was meaty and moist, seasoned well.  The fritters started off the meal well.  The Friday night entertainment was very enjoyable.

reviews.name: Tammy M.
reviews.review: Had this on the last night of our vacation.The wait was a bit long, as there aren't many restaurants in this area of Nashville, by the Opry. The mall is closed, under renovation- so no Rainforest Cafe or anything.The atmosphere is fun- with a fish pond, and a live bluegrass band the entire time.The food is mainly fried- fish, ribs, chicken, and steak.We got the fried pickles and crab cakes for appetizers- fried pickles were great but not a big portion. The crab cakes were nothing special- basic fried crab cakes. (I try them everywhere looking for the best- so far, Gaylord's Old Hickory-hands down).We got chicken strips for the kids- steak for all of us- not a lot to rave about- basic steak. Quite dry 7 oz sirloins. We did see our neighbors ribs and wished we'd gotten those- a HUGE portion' they looked amazing.Sides are basic as well- baked potato, mashed potato, beas, broccoli, fries, homestyle fries.The reason for 5 stars is for our server- Christina! OMG-can you say amazing??!!! She was on top of everything and super friendly. She took care of everything.So- the food was okay, not bad- fun atmosphere, EXCELLENT service, and a long wait.

reviews.name: T F.
reviews.review: In town for a family reunion, this is the place where we met our first night. On our arrival, our group already were in a private room and had been served their food which everyone seemed quite happy with...this night there were 14 of us. We decided to make reservations to return for Father's Day brunch, with 18 in our party. Again, we had our own private area in a different spot. Service was excellent. Being a Sunday they have a separate brunch menu. We chose instead to go with the catfish which was delicious. Meal starts out with fried 'donut' holes dipped in powdered sugar...arrving at the table warm and melt in your mouth goodness. Had to force ourselves to only eat one, knowing we had a full meal still coming. While we waited for the food I took a couple of the younger family members to check out the restaurant. Numerous fish & game mounts thru out, Decorated in a rustic cabin feel. There is a little fish pond in back with tables surrounding it. Lots of nooks & crannies and interesting things to look at. Back to the table, food was arriving. Our waitress was very attentive to our needs checking back with us often. While we ate there was a local blue grass band playing tunes which was nice background music for our meal. As we left all of the Dads got to pick up a free pack of fish hooks in honor of Father's Day. In regards to the restrooms, there is a b & w picture of a man & a woman holding fishing poles or some sort of camping item on each appropriate door. We did have to look twice at the woman's door to make sure we were in the right place, as the woman in the photo had a hood on & it was a bit hard to tell...a child in our party got it wrong! I would suggest switching the photo to a photo that there is no doubt it is a woman.

reviews.name: David K.
reviews.review: Food was just OK, service could have been better.  I sat in the bar and was largely ignored by the bartender/server

reviews.name: Rick G.
reviews.review: This place is terrific.  Good Food ... Reasonably Priced ... Interesting Decor.The service was great.  The waitress was there with a fresh drink before you even thought about asking for it.  The indoor fish pond was a nice little attraction.  I had the Blackened Catfish sandwich and it was great.  The deep fried dill pickle chips are very very good.  The peach cobbler and the banana pudding were also fantastic.Well worth the trip.

reviews.name: Chris B.
reviews.review: Food here was great had the catfish it was really good the breading was just right not to much but enough to do the job. Wife had BBQ plate said it was fantastic. Friends had chilly great and a mushroom Swiss burger and loved it. Friendly staff good atmosphere. Great comfort food great price a good place to go with friends and just hang out and eat

reviews.name: Amanda G.
reviews.review: Right in Opryland and close to the hotels. Try the fried gator... i mean when else can you try that?

reviews.name: Autumn G.
reviews.review: We ordered the cat fish and the bbq pork. Everything except my broccoli was unseasoned and bland. Cute atmosphere for kids. Won't go back

reviews.name: Kenny H.
reviews.review: This place seems mostly for tourists because of its proximity to everything Opryland. There is a giant catfish pond in the middle of the restaurant, and live music some nights. The food is good, but I have never had a meal that blew me away here. And the wait can be long at times. If you are a tourist and can get out of the Opryland area easily, go into downtown or East Nashville for a better meal.

reviews.name: Jose O.
reviews.review: Good food, friendly staff, reasonable prices. The decoration is rustic but lively. We sat by the indoor pond (no smells as per other reviews). Everything was mostly on point during our visit and we are definitely planning to go back.Food:The catfish is probably the best of the 3 restaurants I tried during my visit to Nashville - even the tartar sauce was better. My wife had the spicy shrimp and grits, quite a unique dish and highly recommended for anyone interested in trying something new. The macaroni & cheese seemed bland.This is one of the great places to eat at on the Music Valley Drive near the Opryland. If you are looking for prime meat, consider the Santa Fe just down the road.

reviews.name: Denise L.
reviews.review: Came here with a large group and food and service was smooth as silk. Not to die for food, but reasonable prices, and the service and cute atmosphere made it fun!

reviews.name: Taylor P.
reviews.review: Very good service, amazing pickle chips! Completely worth the money!

reviews.name: Beverly W.
reviews.review: Pleasantly surprised after reading previous review that the food was actually quite decent.  We decided to visit this place because it was convenient to our hotel.  The 3 people in our party ordered from their "specials" menu: salmon oscar and surf and turf.  The 2 having the salmon oscar thought that it was pretty good.  I had the s&t and was amazed that the 6 oz. filet  (covered with a crawfish cream sauce) was cooked to my desire and was actually pretty darn good!  The crabcakes were decent; not fried, but broiled with a pleasant topping as well.  The baked potatoes were very good.  Service was a little slow, but they were very busy.  Bar is good if you have to wait; a fair wine/beer selection. Great bluegrass band roamed the restaurant.  Overall, it was a very good dining experience, and I'm pretty picky and usually dine in more upscale restaurants than this.

reviews.name: Jerri F.
reviews.review: great food and service. decent beer selection.kid friendly and affordable. average pricing...similar to a tgi fridays or logans prices.....much cheaper than the hotel restraunts across the street.

reviews.name: Sissy D.
reviews.review: Its sorta a theme place. Backwoods country, with a fish pond that is interesting, but (smelly). Menu is typical and food is run of the mill. But I did like those free little sugar covered bread things? But their covered in sugar....i'm weak!

reviews.name: Adam D.
reviews.review: Had dinner for our 20th anniversary last night.  Everything was great!  Friendly and attentive staff, fabulous food and atmosphere!Love the potatoes with gravy and the brownie with ice cream and chocolate coating is to die for.

reviews.name: Bret A.
reviews.review: Excellent Steak and Service!... Don't forget the Pickles!Located off the lobby of the Omni hotel in downtown Nashville, Bob's Steak House is melt in your mouth good.  The steaks are cooked perfectly and very flavorful.  Each   table has a jar of pickled veggies that are serve yourself and outstanding.  They also serve a large crusty bread round which is delicious.  The steaks run from about $28-89.  There also a variety of a la carte salads, soups and appetizers.  The service was expert, professional and friendly.I highly recommend Bob's and think it should be a key stop when in downtown Nashville.  The only caveats and the reasons it is not 5 stars:  1)  It is very loud inside which takes away from the upscale steakhouse experience,  2)  the steaks come with a sugar coated carrot instead of a vegetable option.  The carrot is so sugar glazed you can taste the crystals.  Its $5 if you want to switch to a green vegetable instead of the the carrot "dessert." and 3) the potato that is supposed to also come with the steak never arrived which was strange and never mentioned - Kind of odd for such otherwise great service.None of those issues take away from the fantastic quality and flavor of the steak.Enjoy!

reviews.name: Kenneth Z.
reviews.review: Located on the first floor of the Omni and steps away from Smashville, Bob's gets my vote for the best steakhouse in Nashville.Don't come to Bob's looking for anything other than steak. This isn't some hipster, world-fusion pea foam ganache serving place where you're going to see Andre from The League. You're getting a steak, and it's a going to be a damn good one. Start off with a drink -- they have an excellent selection of scotch, bourbon, and Tennessee whiskeys, including the Macallan 25 if you're up to splurge. Wear a jacket or sport coat and nice shoes. You don't have to wear I tie -- I try to avoid them after work. The decor is old school, Don Draper era class. Almost makes you want to break out a cigar once your belly is full after an exquisite meal with incredible service. Tip your waiter well - you will agree that he more than deserves it.

reviews.name: Maria B.
reviews.review: This is one of our favorite places to eat! The food is always on point and cooked exactly to order. Connie is our server, she's so fantastic. We do request her when we come in and you should too!! My husband will venture out of the box every once in a while but I always get the filet mignon. It's delicious. I typically wear a dress but jeans and a nice blazer are perfect too. If you are taking someone who typically doesn't eat out as much at finer restaurants I would just make sure they have a nice sweater, polo, or button up on with khakis or nice jeans with a button up and blazer. Love this place. If you are a local and haven't gone--- GO! If you are traveling be sure to check it out! Bobs validates your valet parking at the Omni hotel which is an awesome thing too! Bring a few dollars to tip the valet. They are awesome too!  Maria and Brandon Williams

reviews.name: Jessica H.
reviews.review: This place was amazing.  We went for our one year wedding anniversary.  We made our reservation on open table and mentioned that it was a special day.  They made a special menu just for us with our names on it!  Very special!  Also, our waitress was very attentive, but no too much so.  She was very helpful and really knew the menu.  As far as the food goes, all I can say is YUM.  We got started with the tomato and mozz and the friend calamary. Both were very good.  We shared the 220z rib-eye steak with lobster Mac. OMG heavenly.  The steak was perfect, and so was the pasta.  A very good choice on our special night.  Thank you!

reviews.name: Will H.
reviews.review: We have visited Bob's on several occasions, and we have enjoyed it very much.  Though I cannot claim to be a steak expert, it gets my vote for best steakhouse in Nashville.Here's the deal at Bob's: they have steaks.  Don't go expecting adventures in molecular gastronomy; don't look for chef-driven innovations.  They have steaks and they do them right.  You have a wide variety to choose from.  You will get delicious crusty bread, and your steak will come with both a giant glazed carrot and your choice of potato-based side (pro tip: get the "smashed" potatoes).  You can get appetizers and desserts, which are terrific, but the main event is the steak.So here are my tips.  Come hungry.  Enjoy a cocktail or a glass of wine; both lists are terrific.  If they're running a surf and turf special (often a small filet mignon and a lobster tail), get it and don't ask questions.  Bob's is a splurge in terms of price, but for quality and total experience, you can't argue with it.  It is not merely a steakhouse in a fancy hotel; it is the steakhouse our downtown deserves.

reviews.name: Eric G.
reviews.review: This is the best steakhouse in Nashville!I started with a wedge salad, which was the epitome of what a wedge should be. My wife had a filet and baked potato, and both were perfect as well. I opted for the Tomahawk Rib Eye. One of the best steaks I have ever had. Creamed corn was delicious. The glazed carrot was great, and I don't really like cooked carrots. The skillet potatoes with the gravy and onions are a must try.We were staying in the hotel, and decided to have our chocolate cake packed to go. It was my bday, so they packed it with forks, plates and two glasses of champagne to take to the room. All on the house. Class act.Can't wait to go back and try the bone in filet, and the fried lobster tail.

reviews.name: Marvin R.
reviews.review: Excellent service, excellent food. You can't go wrong with this choice. Pricey but well worth it. Not a wine person but the waiter paired the wine perfectly with my steak, which was cooked perfectly medium pink. Veggies and salad were delicious. Roasted lobster was very good. Highly recommend.

reviews.name: Megan E.
reviews.review: We came here for my birthday a few weeks ago and it was everything I had hoped it would be! Great service, friendly staff and amazing food! Spot on. We will be back ASAP! Best steak I've had in Nashville. I am not a fan of dill pickles...however the ones that come on the table are a must try. We split the calamari as an appetizer (4 of us) and it was delicious and cooked perfectly.  I had the bone in ribeye, fried potatoes and we split the lobster mac n chz... I was stuffed and still had a ton of food leftover!

reviews.name: Melissa A.
reviews.review: While this place was certainly pricey, it did not disappoint. I was here with 14 others for the Beachbody Summit 2015, and at the last minute on a Friday night, we decided we wanted to eat out at a nice restaurant. I called other places that were unable or unwilling to accommodate us, but when I called here, they were able to situate us in a private room within an hour and a half. Several people looked at the steak prices and were hesitant, but about 6-7 of us went for it and got the filet mignon or rib eye. A few others got salads and the lobster mac & cheese and good lord was that delicious! If you see that on the menu and want something comforting and fabulous, get that!! I got a glass of wine and the 9 oz filet mignon, and though we had a wait due to a few people ordering their steaks well done (what??), none of us were disappointed in the least! The smashed potatoes were flavorful and creamy, while my steak was well-seasoned and a perfectly cooked medium-rare. The large carrot, although delicious, threw some off, but I ate all of mine. The bread was even quite good, but we were all also starving and ready to eat a small animal, but I'm sure I would think that way nonetheless! I will be back next year and hopefully with a pre-made reservation!!! Wonderful!!!! We all left happy and talking about it the next day!!

reviews.name: Curtis M.
reviews.review: Excellent salmon patties, creme brûlée to die for. Creme corn was amazing also. Date had I believe the 9 0z steak , said it was good as well. Onion rings appetizers are great too. Laura our server was very attentive without being overbearing.Meal for two with generous tip came to 200.

reviews.name: Peter L.
reviews.review: Food was loaded with salt and mediocre at best. When paying top dollar for a meal, mediocrity is absolutely unacceptable. Our server was rude, condescending and completely inattentive. The restaurant was empty, yet he did not come over once to offer us a drink even when we had empty glasses in front of us. He provided absolutely no guidance regarding portion size which caused us to over order. He continously made errors, and when told so he would blame it on the customer. For instance, a steak comes with a carrot and choice of potato. When I ordered my steak he did not ask me how I wanted my potato prepared, and then served me a plate without a potato. When I politely asked why I was the only person without a potato, he got very rude and told me I never told him I wanted a potato. Seriously? The icing on the cake was that he handed us the check and while walking away he said "by the way, gratuity is not included."Unacceptable. I would appreciate a prompt response from management.

reviews.name: Myra H.
reviews.review: Bob's, located inside the Omni, is outstanding. Nashville offers many steak houses, this one is worth the visit. Bob's Offers plenty of Ambience, comfortable seats and an elegant atmosphere. The lamb entree and bone-in steak choices are sure  to please. The Bar drinks were well prepared. 07/11/2015 was My third time in and it will not be my last.

reviews.name: Petie D.
reviews.review: Great place.   You'll be presented with table bread and a jar of pickles and red peppers - yum...   Appetizer?  Well of course you'll enjoy it!  All of their appetizers are excellent, and been there enough times to be able to say that.  Any of the beef you select is top notch, personally find it far better than ANY and I mean any other well known steak place.   Seafood menu is done well also. Salads are good, caprese salad a bit different, as it is chopped, but still enjoyable. Great selection of wine, bar selection is additionally good and drinks are consistently poured well.  Were you wondering about dessert,I did.  Carrot cake? Even if you weren't a fan you'd love this.  Try any of the desserts you won't be disappointed.   Make sure you have a reservation.  If you don't, remember, good things come to those that wait.

reviews.name: Ashley H.
reviews.review: As a foodie, I'm always excited to try new places. Bob's did not disappoint!!! Our experience was AMAZING!!! Laura took great care of us and the food was superb. We enjoyed the bacon and smoked salmon as our appetizers. The smoked salmon was so buttery and not too salty. My brother and father raved about how wonderful the bacon was. We also really enjoyed the pickled peppers on the table. Now the main courses were outstanding! We had the veal, lamb chops, crab cakes, and the surf and turf. Have I mentioned how AMAZING our meal was! To top it off, we enjoyed the best chocolate brownie and cake I've ever tasted.  If you've finished this review, it goes without saying, try Bob's! We will be back soon!!!

reviews.name: James J.
reviews.review: I've been here a couple times now and it's disappointed me over all. I think perhaps one more try is possible next time I'm in Nashville. The whole meal is very heavy. Good flavor and nuance is lost when you're handed five pounds of food covered in sauces. The cuts of meat are a good quality.

reviews.name: Becky S.
reviews.review: Food was delicious!   We ended up sitting at the bar for dinner because it was so packed and we had no reservation.   The service was great!

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: I wish the food was better. The lobster appetizers didn't have enough flavor or acidity to it. The wait staff was also too intrusive and had 4 different people helping us which got confusing and orders didn't come out right. The fish of day (halibut) was overcooked and dry. The cream spinach was too salty and brussels sprouts had too much char on them. The cream corn was very good and tasted fresh and just the right amount of seasoning. The steak (prime rib) was way too fatty and not a great cut of protein for the price.

reviews.name: Aimee L.
reviews.review: Went to Bob's on a Friday night.  We called in around 6:30pm for a table of 10, and they said they could accommodate us at 8pm... sweet!  Appetizers and soups came out pretty quick..... but then, everything went downhill.  Waited 1.5hrs for dinner to come out after repeated assurances from wait staff that "we were next.  just a few tables needed to be plated before us".   When you have a table of 3 kids and a pregnant lady, 1.5hrs is an eternity.  Granted, they were able to accommodate our large group last minute, but this is a hotel - you should be able to do that and handle volume, no?  We got our dinners after 10pm.  At that point, no one was hungry anymore, kids were cranky, and we just wanted to get out of there.  I should have kept my reservations at The Palm.

reviews.name: Anna S.
reviews.review: During a recent business trip to downtown Nashville I had one of the best filets of my life at Bob's. I am (unfortunately!) a carnivorous type and I love a good steak, filet being my favorite. Two gents and I had dinner at Bob's at my urging (it looks beautiful and enticing with its airy but alluringly dim seating and cracking fireplaces, as seen from across the road at the new music convention center). We didn't have reservations so we weren't able to sit in the fireplace-lit room (granted, we are talking the dead of a southern summer here), but we were luckily seated immediately in the bar area. The menu is your typical higher-price point steakhouse: steaks, potatoes, a la carte sides for sharing, salads, seafoods. We split an appetizer of the calamari, and while it was nothing profound (Bob's MIGHT have been a little more imaginative with the dipping option, a straight up marinara), it was tender and tasty and we three polished off the plate. (And I think Bob's serves bread, gratis, but we didn't get any - no biggie however).I wanted a bone-in filet, which isn't a regular menu offering but it was being offered as a special that night. Our server, a friendly and quick gal, noted it was a hefty one-pounder, so I opted for the slightly more conservative boneless 9-oz. filet, med-rare. The two guys also ordered steaks, which all came with perfectly cooked and bursting with fluffiness baked potatoes. And a carrot. We each got a huge, peeled, cooked carrot, tops lopped off, basted in brown-sugary butteriness. It was very pointedly phallic. I don't love cooked carrots or pointedly phallic objects, so I asked both of my dinner fellows if they'd like mine, one who deadpanned, "no thanks, I have 10 inches of my own." I plopped the offending root onto the butter plate (really some people may love it, both of the guys did, I just really hate cooked carrots), and enjoyed my filet and spud. My filet was literally cooked to fork-tender perfection, hot juicy red interior with a perfectly seasoned, slightly charred exterior. Absolutely delicious and I shamelessly devoured the entire thick, densely-rich portion.The entire tab before tip was about $137, for 4 beers+3 steak entrees+calamari appetizer. Very worth it and not a bad price for tourist-driven downtown Nashville. I would definitely do a victory lap the next time I'm in Nashville.

reviews.name: Linda A.
reviews.review: I put a week between our first visit to Bob's before reviewing.  Also had to ask hubby what rating he would give.  My hesitation was due to the feeling that I must have missed something.  But no, it was a solid 3 star evening.  We were a party of four and we had a great time entertaining each other; so the evening was a great time.  The food, however, was not exceptional.  Three of our four had steak and I had salmon.  We've all eaten at many a high end steak house; nothing stood out.  The sides were all fine.  The carrots served with my salmon ( I asked for double veg/hold the starch) and the carrots were huge and pretty tough.  I love carrots and ate about two bites.  The salmon was fine.  Everyone else said their meal was "good".  The desserts were eaten.  I didn't have a dessert but nobody at the table said anything like "OMG, you have to taste this!" either.  Service was fine...not great, but nothing bad happened.  I don't have much more to say...it was just ok.  Nice to get the parking validated.  Our dining companions were staying at The Omni and remarked that they paid $30 to park on the same evening that my husband and I had our parking comped.  Overall I was not taken aback by the bill at all.  A bit under $400 for the 4 of us, including tip.  I've paid more than that at many Nashville restaurants.  I've got nothing else....

reviews.name: Barbara S.
reviews.review: The rack of lamb was delicious; the service at the bar was horrible.  Very unfriendly bartenders and there were about four of them.  They didn't greet us or say good bye, we heard them talking to their customers with a very defensive attitude.  We would not go back to the bar they never asked how the food was or if we wanted another drink.

reviews.name: Doojin K.
reviews.review: Great service. The steak was on the salty side. I got the wedge potatoes with gravy on top and those were so salty to be almost inedible.

reviews.name: Suan R.
reviews.review: Incredible steak. Knowledgeable professional server. Sophisticated atmosphere.

reviews.name: Derek A.
reviews.review: Bob's is a classic steak house that will not disappoint but also will not necessarily surprise or amaze you.  Being a steakhouse, the offerings are pretty straight forward, and the portions are HUGE. Steaks come with a roasted carrot the size of an infant's leg.  Potatoes are the size of that same kid's head.  An order of onion rings looks like a replica of the Berlin wall.  Because we were there with a group, they showed their appreciation by giving us a free brownie sundae dessert that could have served half of a 2nd grade class.  Enough with the size puns - the food is good and if you're a steak fan, you won't be disappointed.  The decor is classic steakhouse, though very dark - not the place to go if you want to review documents during your work meal or if you have someone who has trouble seeing in the dark.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: The ambience is wonderful! Intimate and relaxing yet still fun. The service was a little slow the night we went, but our server was awesome and accommodating. The food was delicious, but I do agree with the other reviews I've read: a bit too pricey for what you get. It didn't blow my socks off, but it was good. A nice little icing on the cake was when our waiter brought free desserts for our 1 year anniversary. His treatment is what takes it from 3 stars to 4.

reviews.name: J n.
reviews.review: We had the pleasure of visiting this place for the first time last night and had an amazing time. The atmosphere was perfect.  The wait staff gets 5 stars! Our waiter, which had the nicknamed "Hoodick" was the best. Very attentive to our needs and explained everything up and above. The bone in rib-eye was amazing!!! The filet on the bone that my wife had was unbelievable. So good, you actually will pick it up off your plate and eat the meat off the bone! Crazy!!!  Also, get the chocolate cake when you finish!!  Love this place!

reviews.name: James B.
reviews.review: I had the porterhouse, and my girlfriend had the filet. Both were cooked to perfection and the porterhouse  was easily the best steak I ever ate! Excellent!

reviews.name: Tony K.
reviews.review: We started with a salad and lobster bisque. The soup was good but almost no lobster.  I requested piping hot but it was just warm. The bread was excellent,  crunchy on the outside and soft on the middle.  We had their lobster appetizer but it was very salty and did not taste like lobster. .I had their rib eye charged but it was burnt, I should have sent it back but I was starving. Service was very good and was  seated immediately

reviews.name: Gary C.
reviews.review: Ate here with a group of four.  Bar is fantastic.  Great cocktails and comfy stools.  Moved to dining room to eat and the steaks were extremely good.  The carrot was shockingly good, perfectly glazed with a brown sugar honey or something.  The only reason for the one-star reduction was the mac-n-cheese was mediocre, as was the bread pudding dessert.  The service was perfect.  Expensive place but that was expected at The Omni.

reviews.name: Brad R.
reviews.review: Stopped in, no reservations,  for dinner following a business meeting nearby. It was a bit early,  so there was no wait. Accordingly,  service was prompt and attentive.  Server (sadly I can't recall his name) was fantastic - explained options,  specials,  a bit of history (red peppers and pickles in salt water brine on every table).The meal was great - filet was as ordered and very flavorful. I had the 9 oz,  but it was very thick. Smashed potatoes were very good, as was the large glazed carrot (I'm not usually a fan of carrots but this was great - tender but firm and sweet).Did not try any of the drinks. Good location,  good ambiance.

reviews.name: Bill S.
reviews.review: I was here for a business meeting. We had the private room. The service was excellent. John described the special offerings and helped with suggestions. The steaks were tender and tasty. Save room for the Pecan Pie.

reviews.name: Mary A.
reviews.review: My husband and I went there for our birthdays and the food was mediocre. The steaks were pricey for what we got, there was a very limited selection of side dishes and salads, which were also very ordinary. I'm not sure about about the pickles and peppers, that's not something I want at a steak house. We did have a very attentive waitress, and the atmosphere was nice, but I can't say that I would return here. Overpriced!

reviews.name: Steve H.
reviews.review: Arrived early evening to ensure concert arrival and we were seated promptly.  Explained to Sam our expedited needs and he was more than successful in fulfilling our request.  Crab cake was a hit, filet was excellent and smashed potatoes were a success.  Wife and I both enjoyed the lobster mac and the serving size is quite large.Sam was superb and informative and the food top notch.  It was a great experience and I would recommend to anyone.

reviews.name: Steve E.
reviews.review: A five star if it is on someone else's tab, as my experience was. A 3 if not..I had the best steak of my life, a bone in Wagyu ribeye called the Tomahawk. It was ridiculous in every sense, and just....astounding. Service was impeccable. Side dishes....first, who needs them? But if you just...the carrot...very meh, aside from the comedy the size provides. I had smashed potatoes, and they were fine. Only other thing I tasted was the corn, and it was banging. Since it was a business gathering, I brought the wife chocolate cake home. Enough to give on-the-spot diabetes to 4 people, it was just ok.

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: I cannot say enough about the service at Bob's.  It's what you should expect at every restaurant of this caliber.  They were friendly and helpful, not overbearing, and attentive in consideration of the price you pay for the meal.You cannot go wrong with the breaded lobster tail for an appetizer.  It was absolutely delicious and perfectly cooked.  We also tried the calamari, which was average in flavor but well prepared.My filet was perfectly cooked and adequately seasoned. All food presentation was pleasing, and the wine list was sufficient for all budgets.

reviews.name: M.E. M.
reviews.review: We really enjoyed Bob's! My husband and I went with another couple the night after Valentines.Food: We had the calamari for an appetizer. It was pretty standard. My husband and the other man ordered the bone in Waygu steak. It was not on the menu that night, but our serve was fantastic and hooked them up. I had the special which was scallops and the other lady ordered the filet mignon -- All our food was fabulous. You must get the creamed spinach! It's too die for. The giant carrot on all the plates is kind of strange -- but whatever. We also had the creme brulee which was nothing special. We had a birthday in our party, so they brought a complimentary brownie sundae which was pretty good. Drinks: My husband is a beer guy -- he found their beer list to be adequate, but not expansive. The wine list on the other hand is out of this world! They also have a nice cocktail menu and all our drinks were very good.Service/Atmosphere: Our server was excellent. We never had an empty drink. He made sure that my husband got the steak he wanted -- he really took care of us. The atmosphere was good. It was dark and could be very romantic. We will definitely be returning to Bob's during our next trip to Nashville. I highly recommend.

reviews.name: Chris H.
reviews.review: Bob's always seems to be that steak house that you can never find anything really wrong with but will never impress you with anything amazing.  Very classic dishes, cooked properly, but with no real soul and zero innovation.  There are better steak house options for less money.  "Impressive" prices should be complimented with impressive dishes.  Unfortunately, not the case with Bob's.  Bread is great.  Fillet was cooked nicely but somehow bland and boring.  A real waste of a great cut, IMO.  Smashed potatoes were flavorless.  Carrot was good...  but just good.  Lobster appetizer special was a real let-down because the breading was so overwhelming that it killed the flavor of the lobster meat.

reviews.name: Erin R.
reviews.review: Went to Bob's this weekend and left totally unimpressed for the $$.  Our bill was right at $300 (including tip) and for this we got a salad, a bowl of soup, 2 steaks, 2 baked potatoes and a bottle of wine.  Now, granted, our wine was ~$80 of that but that is still very pricey.  We would have been fine with this if the food had been outstanding, but it just didn't wow us.  I ordered a filet, medium done, and it came out overdone.  My husband said his filet was also just "oK" and not really seasoned in any special way.The ambiance is severely lacking  here.  The acoustics in this place are terrible.  Even though the restaurant was only about three-quarters full, it was really noisy.  We could hear the conversations of a large group at a table 45 feet from us.   My husband and I had a hard time carrying on a conversation due to the noise.  It also didn't help that the table they sat us at was about 4 feet long so we were literally shouting across the table.  Not really romantic...I gave this place 2 stars because the service was good and both the server and the hostess were incredibly accommodating.  However, we will not be coming back.  For $300, we can get a way more outstanding meal at Kayne Prime in a nicer more intimate atmosphere.  I bet this place will stay in business due to the tourist traffic.  But native Nashvillians know there are far better steak house options in the downtown area.

reviews.name: Rebecca S.
reviews.review: Rude, Rude! We were trying to celebrate a huge milestone in my husbands career and I called to ask if they would still serve us right at closing... Instead I got a ear full of rudeness!  It could have been a simple polite yes or no! I will NEVER go to any Bob's.

reviews.name: J E.
reviews.review: The bone in rib eye was the best steak I've ever had. Scott T was out server and was fantastic. Friendly, attentive, and very real.  The food was fantastic. Drinks were wonderful. Dessert was over the top.  Two of us with appetizer, entrees, sides, drinks and dessert was $150, and worth every penny. On travel from California and in town for my girlfriends birthday dinner, this was a perfect stop.  Well done and hats off to Scott.

reviews.name: Happy G.
reviews.review: OMG!  I stayed in the Omni hotel and went to this amazing restaurant located downstairs.  Great customer service.  The best food I have ever tasted in my life.  The mash potatoes,lobster mac and cheese, lobster bisque, creme brulee, chocolate cake, steak,cheesecake,peacan pie were to die for.  The glazed carrot was unlike anything I've ever tasted(amazing).  I know I know..sounds like I ate them under the table.  Long story short is that everyone at my table was pleased(A table of 9 people).  It is a little pricey, but this is a place that everyone should experience.

reviews.name: Kimberley S.
reviews.review: The dinner was AMAZING!!!  Best filet ever, and the service we received from Scott was exceptional.  Definitely coming here again if I come back to Nashville.

reviews.name: David E.
reviews.review: Steaks are 5star.   Everything else was 3-4 star.  The steaks were large portions, excellent cut and quality.  Excellent flavor and tenderness.  We had bone in ribeye and mid size filet.  Shrimp platter app was solid but not outstanding.  Salads were fair. Sides left a little to be desired.  Cream brûlée was ok but had a grainy texture.  Overall good experience.

reviews.name: Christy M.
reviews.review: Everything was fantastic, from the crab cakes and champagne to the peanutbutter brownie sundae. I got the Kansas strip. The flavor and tenderness was great. The smashed potatoes and lobster mac n cheese was delicious and the honey glazed carrot was a nice suprise. Loved everything!

reviews.name: Tina P.
reviews.review: Dined there last night with friends from Austin. Last minute choice. Friends staying at the Omni. Everything else in Nashville slammed. Friends ate at other hotel restaurant the night before and raved about it (kitchen something). So we decided to give it a shot.Mistake.Pros- good service sorta. We actually had bad service and then some guy who never told us who he was, came by, apologized for the poor service, and told us he was reducing our bill by $125.We received our salads after our entrees.Cons- LOUD music! we couldn't converse in a small room with four tables. They did turn it down after we asked.The food is not good. The calamari was bland and the accompanying sauce was so tart it was nearly inedible. Ditto with my wedge salad which somehow was boring,bland and also very very tart.The meat (I ordered a 22oz KC strip and split it with my cousin) was fine. A tad overcooked for medium rare but ok. Husbands entree was ok. Nothing great. Sides are just plain bad or weird. Huge soft sweet carrot. I like carrots. But this one looked like it had been put thru that machine on a bugs bunny cartoon and super sized into a weird killer carrot.  Um can you say genetically modified ? Skillet potatoes were awful.We decided to cut our losses before dessert ....With all the places to eat in Nashville (finally!!) I would not eat here.

reviews.name: Debra M.
reviews.review: I agree with the other 3 star voters.  There was nothing impressive about Bob's.  My husband and I went with another couple for a double date.  We rarely get the chance to go out all together without kids so we decided to go a little fancier.  We chose the wrong place to give over $100 each for dinner.Food:  Don't bother with a salad.  The portion is disappointing given the $8 - $15 price tag.  My husband and I split the tossed salad and we each had about 7 pieces of lettuce on our plates with a few cucumbers and tomatoes.  Our friends got the blue cheese salad and the same small portion/unimpressive.  I ordered the 12 oz Ribeye cooked medium.  It was more medium well with one side very crisp.  It was dry and tough. My friend ordered the 9 oz Filet cooked Medium. The filet was, no kidding, three inches tall and the therefore, the middle was rare.  She had to send it back to the kitchen.Like others, we cut our losses and skipped dessert.I hate to say it, but I've had better steaks/meals at Outback.

reviews.name: PW D.
reviews.review: Since Bob's had only been open a few wks when we dined there,I feel badly giving such a poor review.   We had a great corner booth for six.  Liked the energetic atmosphere.  We were really excited to tour the beautiful new OMNI and try Bob's.   Our waiter was ok....seemed a bit inexperienced....but did the best he could and was very courteous.   The cocktail menu was lacking a proper variety.  Tried to order an off the menu drink, but they didn't have one of the ingredients which was fairly basic.  Settled for their peartini which was good, but too sweet for me.  Wine list was very weak in my opinion.   First bottle we chose they didn't even have.    The basic salad was unbelievably boring & uninspiring.  Might as well have been from a bag of salad.....maybe it was!  Hard to believe a restaurant like this would even consider serving this salad.      Delivery and presentation of food was very outdated and more like something in a much less expensive steak place.  Unbelievable that the server must come to table with a condiment serving dish and ask which items to put on your potato.  My husband and i split a potato....our halves each arrived on the plates upside down.  I had to flip it over, score it, so that server could then dress the potato from the condiment serving dish.   Reminds me of something from the 70's.   Very annoying.  All 6 of us were put off by this.    Filet was ok...not extraordinary.  It should have been extraordinary for the price.  (we dined this weekend at an out of town Flemings, and the filet was fabulous!  No comparison.)    Also, Bob's includes with the steak a huge whole carrot.  You heard right....what an odd choice.   Just too weird.It tasted fine, but again, just a ridiculous presentation.       Not planning a return trip to Bob's.  Too many other excellent choices. Hope things do quickly turn around so that Bob's can be successful.

reviews.name: Pagan Team Of Real Estate Pros P.
reviews.review: Good service but horrible food and too expensive for the quality. I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.name: Jennifer N.
reviews.review: The Best Filet ever!  Everything was great but the steak was the best.  I understand they recently opened here in Nashville, but they are running like they've been established for some time. We will be back.

reviews.name: Steve N.
reviews.review: We got the bone in ribeye, onion rings skillet potatoes and blonde brownie. The ribeye was cooked perfectly, nice crust. Two things I didn't like about the steak was the cresent was very small and it had a little gristle on it. But overall I would give it a 8 out of 10. The onion rings could feed a army. They where very large and you get a lot of them. But they where lacking flavor. The batter was lacking flavor and tasted like it was cooked in the same oil as some sea food. Would not recommend them. The skillet potatoes I got with the gravy on the side, potatoes well done. I also ask for garlic to be added. They where the best skillet potatoes I've ever had at a restaurant. The bread that they bring you is very very messy and hard to cut without annihilating the loaf. It was average bread. The pickles and bell peppers they put at every table were ok. The blonde brownie was amazing. Two brownies with a scoop of chocolate ice cream and a scoop of peanut butter ice cream. Then it had nuts and whip cream and a cherry. They gave it to us for free because it was are anniversary. Scott was are server, he did a great job. He explained the menu very well to us and told us what was popular. I like to talk and he was open talk to us. The atmosphere was very nice. The lights where dim but not to much where you can't see well. It's a very nice place for a special event or a business meeting.

reviews.name: Joe F.
reviews.review: The food, atmosphere, staff were great!  Located in the brand new Omni Hotel it was a great experience. Definitely a great place for locals and tourists.

reviews.name: Jason H.
reviews.review: R u in Nashville?  Feel like some steak?  Just go here !! Awesome filet , great sides, tastes wedge salad to start and delicious drinks all the way through.  Been to MANY steakhouses but bob's always comes through.  Njoy :)

reviews.name: Morgan C.
reviews.review: What ca. I say. As a fashion new style steak house.  One of the best I have been in. The steak was juicy and perfectly cooked. The carrot a nice hint, and the baked potato amazing. Love the table side service with the condiments for your potato. Staff was very busy but great service. Our waitress was a pro, she had short hair and looked like a sexy Molly  Ringwald.  She was so good handling a big group. The appetizers salads and soups were very good . Lobster bisque was awesome. The atmosphere awesome, nice bar area too. The whole experience was top notch right down to the decor and the entrance in the driveway straight to the restaurant. Very trendy.

reviews.name: Mandy H.
reviews.review: After having a few meals at the Bob's in Dallas, we were thrilled to learn that there was one that just opened in Nashville. We sat up at the bar and had the best service and met some fun guys that shared the love of the food they ordered. The steak was cooked to perfection, the bread is always fresh, the potatoes, salad (we order the spinach w egg and the honey something dressing) and corn are to die for.

reviews.name: Mark C.
reviews.review: New Year's dinner last night was excellent and service was also pretty good.  Great location and easy access to Music City nightlife.  Will be back in the future.

reviews.name: Semi-retired J.
reviews.review: We're going to have to say best steak in town until we go back to Jimmy Kelly's. Was expecting just more chain food for conventioneers but the ribeye was best in a long time of traveling. Smoked salmon appetizer a meal in itself. However, skip appetizer, skip salad, skip carrot, pickles, desert - eat steak with honor.

reviews.name: Jessica G.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I staggered in here at some advanced hour in the evening after arriving in Nashville.  We were perhaps a bit underdressed for this establishment, but the staff treated us graciously nonetheless and we were seated in the dining room.  Our waiter was a nice young man (a recent transplant) who chatted with us throughout the evening, not only bringing us the much needed sustenance but giving us a variety of tips and suggestions for our trip.  Sure the decor was nothing notable, but that didn't matter to us, because, when you want a steak, you want a steak, am I right?  And steak we got.  First, we started with the beefsteak tomato salad - fresh and delicious.  After just managing not to fill up on salad, bread and the tasty pickles and peppers they have available in a jar on every table, we both ordered the ribeye.  They wet age at Bob's and I can tell you that this may have been the juiciest steak I have ever had (and certainly in the top three if not the top of the list).  Juicy and delectable!  We were well satisfied with our meal, happy to pay their price and toddle off, full and contented.  One of the two best meals we had in Nashville.  We would definitely recommend.

reviews.name: Kayla H.
reviews.review: Service was so fast! Equally good, the prices are very, very affordable. For two regular rolls and a small salad, it was under $9.The rolls are good for "new sushi eaters" as they are typical American options: containing cream cheese, fried crab, etc. For that type of sushi though, it is good. My niece and I thought it was worth the stop.Plus, it's located in The Arcade which is such an awesome little place. It's like (if you're from NoVA/DC) the Torpedo Factory, but mixed with Prague-allies charm.The two folks at the counter were super sweet people too.

reviews.name: Evan L.
reviews.review: I've heard the sushi is good, but I can't go there with my wife for lunch because she was kicked out for asking for a sauce to go with her meal and will never return.Even if you serve food fit for kings, it's no good if you treat customers like serfs.

reviews.name: Karri B.
reviews.review: Very small menu but everything I've had has been great.  My only wish is that they offered more Korean options but considering they cater to a busy lunch crowd, I understand why they do not.  If you want a few good rolls and miso and you are in the Arcade, this is your place!They are very friendly and quick!

reviews.name: Diana L.
reviews.review: The owners are always smiling and super friendly! I've tried their sushi, miso soup, kimchi, dumplings, bibimbap, and chicken bulgogi. All of those items were always fresh and comes out hot. They also have free tea as you're waiting for your food to be prepped and they have sushi for you to taste if you can't make up your mind. At least twice the owner has offered me a free fried shrimp to eat while I waited. Overall, their service is spectacular!

reviews.name: Joanna F.
reviews.review: Unassuming little place in the Arcade. The owners were so friendly. They gave free sample of their rolls. Ordered pork bulgogi lunch special. It came with rice, dumpling and some lettuce to make wrap. They were really good and the price was reasonable. Oh, the also had self serve hot tea, really good tea too.
