One sweet thing that we saw was when the owner offered a sushi roll to lady worker who was sweeping the floor. We thought it was very nice of them.

reviews.name: Maiden A.
reviews.review: Dropped in. Ordered Crunchy And California Roll. Fresh. Perfect for lunch. Price was fair. Asked to sample their kimchee and that was just as good. Flavorful with some heat. Owners and I spoke of South Korea and where they lived as I was stationed there in military. Good people. They offer a few pieces of sushi at lunch while you wait. Best way to introduce new tastes. Very pleased with this hole in the wall. Space was cramped and standing room only at times. But it is a quick in and out kind of place that focuses on its food not the ambiance. I don't say that to be contrite, it is the Arcade but damn good sushi.

reviews.name: Ellen F.
reviews.review: The lunch options downtown are great and this hole in the wall can hold its own with the rest. The Korean options are FANTASTIC and I'll not try to name them for lack of spelling skills. They always have sushi samples too!Try the lunch roll specials or the Bibinbob (told you I can't spell). It's delicious and filling! Moreover, the owners are too sweet and the food is ready within minutes!  Don't forget a punch card!  You won't regret giving this a try for lunch downtown!   It really doesn't get much better than the Arcade... Let's be real.

reviews.name: Lindsey S.
reviews.review: Hole in the wall. Great sushi. Great price! Super sweet couple. Don't be turned off by the appearance. Yum yum! Some of the best sushi we've had at a very reasonable price.

reviews.name: David M.
reviews.review: My favorite sushi roll in Nashville lives here. Called the "All-in". Kind of a combo of fried outer layer with spicy crab and several sauces. This is great even for non sushi eaters. You have to try it. Nice couple running the place that remembers your order!

reviews.name: matthew B.
reviews.review: Very good sushi for the price.  Great lunch option downtown.  The couple running the place is always very friendly.  I love the Korean TV they have to watch as you wait. $7.50 and a five-minute wait here gets you one of the most satisfying lunches in the business district!

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: I have previously confessed in other sushi reviews to fear eating "fresh" fish in a  landlocked state.  And I am a huge fan of hole in the wall joints as they usually offer some of the best food around.  They have to, to get people in the door of such a crappy looking place.  My first experience to the Arcade, the lovely tunnel of awesome culinary delights in downtown Nashville, was my introduction to Jimbo's.  Digest for a second that this place is called Jimbo's Sushi and tell me you'd be jazzed to eat there based on the name.  I had visions of someone in camo fishing guppies out of a fishbowl and putting them over rice.  This, however, was not the case, and to my surprise, this may be the best sushi I've had in Nashville.  First off, this is the small restaurant ever.  Be prepared to get your food to go.  And to wait to go, because come lunchtime, the only time this place is open, the line is out the door and the wait could be an hour.  If you wait, and you're lucky like I was, you may get to sample some of their veggie dumplings.  The sushi tasted fresh (again, landlocked, so here's to hoping!) and despite the crazy busy-ness of the place the service was given with a smile.  Sitting out in the Arcade while enjoying lunch is an experience of its own.  Also, the prices here, and every other place in the Arcade, make this a great lunch stop.  I highly recommend it for the food and the experience.

reviews.name: Esther K.
reviews.review: Come to find out they're actually Korean (not Japanese as I read in the reviews). I ordered the lunch special spicy pork plate that came with lettuce, ssam jang, and mandu. Always love how korean restaurants also offer free bori cha (barley tea). Authentic! The kimchi is homemade and delish (created by owner's mother). Love the location downtown where there are a lot of other food options like a food court (cheap too).

reviews.name: Jordan T.
reviews.review: This place is cozy and affordable. Everything I have had has been delicious and the owners are so friendly.

reviews.name: Jt S.
reviews.review: This review is kinda late. We ate @ Jimbo's Sushi several months ago. Their kimchi is best of the best. I personally like sashimi better than sushi, but their sushi is good. Worth to try.

reviews.name: Elaina C.
reviews.review: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Jimbo's! The food is great and they are so sweet. I love the lunch special of two rolls and soup or salad (I get soup in this cold weather). Every time I go in there I leave even happier / in a better mood because they are just so friendly. It's a lunchtime treat!

reviews.name: Petra S.
reviews.review: Awesome greeting upon entering, sushi sample at the counter and yummy bibimbap.  Eating in is totally worth it for the friendly atmosphere.  Limited seating though.

reviews.name: Keith P.
reviews.review: We ordered the jabchae,  chicken Bulgogi,  and the all in roll with sushi.  Very friendly , delicious food and very quick.  Would come back again. Only open for lunch

reviews.name: Karli W.
reviews.review: The most adorable Japanese couple own this tiny little shop located in the Arcade off 4th downtown. As a Pacific Northwesterner, I am always looking for my next sushi fix. I recently stopped in on my lunch break, looking for a quick bite. I was a bit skeptical at first (sushi is very temperamental and can make you very sick if not prepared right), but was greeted warmly and offered a sample of the "all-in-all" roll. After one bite I didn't even need to see a menu, I ordered a full roll (to go) of the all-in-all immediately. This is probably more of a to-go kind of shop as it probably only holds like 7 people at a time. It was packed for lunch, though, which I thought was a good sign. Their lunch specials were fairly inexpensive- 2 rolls and soup or salad for 7 or 8 dollars. They also have hot dishes like bagogi. After chatting with the male owner for a few minutes while he prepared my roll, my roll was ready and I was on my way! LOVE this place!

reviews.name: Rachel J.
reviews.review: I cannot believe this place doesn't have more five star reviews. Sushi is so cheap and delicious! Two rolls and a miso soup or ginger salad for only $7. The rolls are small, but you get eight of each, so it's always enough food to fill me up. Pretty good selection, too. The Philly roll and the eel roll are my favorites. The wait is never too long, despite only having one chef and cashier, who are both very friendly and remember me every time. I just wish they were open more than three hours a day, five days a week. If you happen to be in the Arcade during business lunch hours, definitely stop by here.

reviews.name: Jacob G.
reviews.review: Because of new job relocation in the downtown area I am about to try a bunch of new places that I have never eaten at before... and I must say I am completely stoked.The first place I have felt the need to write about is Jimbo's Sushi (apparently it used to be Jimbo's hotdogs?).  I ate there today & ordered a spicy tuna, crunchy shrimp, California roll and a ginger salad.  My total bill was under $10.  UNDER $10!?!?!?! Yes, you can order their 3-roll special (choosing 3 rolls from about 10 standard rolls) for $9.95 or a 2-roll special from the same list of rolls for $5.95.  Oh, and each option comes with choice of miso soup or salad.  Additionally, the sushi met my expectations. Granted I ordered pretty boilerplate sushi options, everything tasted fresh and tasted great.  This place would be so easy to dismiss as some small "wonky" sushi restaurant by its looks, but try to look past that.  I actually that ambiance (shitty little tables in a tiny tiny dining area, little artwork, etc. w/ the sushi chef also taking your money) was great.Bottom line: No, this not the best sushi in Nashville... but they have an insane lunch special, the sushi meets expectations, and arcade is just all around an awesome experience.

reviews.name: Meredith H.
reviews.review: My experience wasn't the best, and partly it is because it's my fault, and partly because it's their fault. I went in just to get a Philadelphia roll, and they asked if I wanted to do the special (two rolls and a salad for like $7) and I declined, but they thought I said yes (even after I said no twice), so I left with way too much food that I didn't even end up eating. There wasn't anything special about it, but the setting was cute. Not too busy at 11. Probably won't go back, since there's so many other sushi places nearby to try out. Sorry.

reviews.name: Jess C.
reviews.review: Okay, let's just say I just got 2 great rolls and a miso soup for 7 bucks. Good cheap sushi. Go for the crunch shrimp or crab.

reviews.name: Bill G.
reviews.review: Ok with all due respect to the other two reviews, I have been all over the U.S. with my job and have eaten sushi in at least 20 states. The best so far btw was in Salt Lake closely followed by San Fran. but i digress. Back to Jimbos,,,Small place, 10 seats, no problem i got there b4 the lunch rush. Cheap, yes very when youre talking two rolls and soup with soda total, $8. However, the miso soup was completely liquid, noting in it, it was the cosistancy of tea and didnt taste much more than that. (Google miso soup real quick and youll see numerous pics of what real miso should look like). The rolls were very small, the pieces were about the diameter of a quarter. yea for bite size but not very filling. Meat was one small sliver down the middle of the roll. Packaged in a small carry out with wasabi and sweet ginger it reminded me that in my travels when i cant find a good sushi shop i can usually find this kind of fare in a grocery store. (Walgreens just off of centinnial park in chicago even had better rolls and it was 20pcs with two shrimp nigiri for 10 bucks! Even tho prepackaged it was better than this). So im sorry but I cannot give Jimbo more than the rating i did, I knew I should have tried to get thrown out by the sushi nazi Sam,,,,,maybe i will try and act like a local tomorrow.

reviews.name: Marci R.
reviews.review: Really good pizza. Crust is not too thin or too thick. Sauce and toppings were yummy. Had the arugula salad with goat cheese and almonds. Yum! We had the mussels as well with a thick slice of soggy bread in the broth. Great flavors! Service was good. We sat outside and I brought my dog! Fun, hip vibe!

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I already loved Sylvan Park. Then Cafe Nonna decided to open a pizza and wine bar. I love this neighborhood even more than I already did, and I didn't think that was possible.The restaurant is right next door to Cafe Nonna and is about the same size (small), so once it's popularity grows I'm sure it will be very crowded and hard to get a table at popular hours. The menu is small; appetizers, salads, and pizza. We opted for the oil sampling and cheese dip with bacon, beer, and some Gorgonzola to start. Um wow. The cheese dip was incredible and came with pita bread and carrot sticks for dipping.For entrees I split the Primavera pizza with my friend. It had veggies, goat cheese, and pesto with a tomato sauce base. Incredible. The pizzas were thin to medium crust and tasted SO good! It was a perfect amount, we had 3 slices each and I didn't feel that I over ate. The couple with us had the Goomba, their meat option with pepperoni and sausage. There was happiness all around. They had $5 glasses of sangria and $15 carafes and it was pretty decent. The carafe was enough for about 3 glasses total, so maybe not the best deal but it seemed like it! The sangria was nothing to write home about, but a decent. Their wine list looked nice too, they offer wines by the glass and the bottle at a variety of prices.I am definitely going to be a regular here!

reviews.name: Dan A.
reviews.review: Ok so nothing special here - born & raised in NY and many years making pizza in an assortment of restaurants.  This place does a 10" pizza for $13 the appetizer we tried was supposed to be an Italian cheese dip - disappointing. Every restaurant is higher than retail cost of the wine, even by the bottle...This place is running around 3 the retail price.So I came, I saw, I tasted and I'll skip this place next time.

reviews.name: Adrianna S.
reviews.review: How can you go wrong with piazza and wine? Simple, low key and yummy. Coming here was a total fluke, only found it driving around and searching Yelp as we drove. Started with the beer cheese dip with a glass of Prosecco, which totally helped the after work hunger. I hadn't seen my friend in a while, so we chatted, and the server was attentive but gave us space. BBQ chicken pizza and a bottle of Chianti hit the spot. Asked for extra BBQ sauce to dip my pizza in...different, but very tasty. Perfect for a Monday night after work!

reviews.name: Martí M.
reviews.review: What does one do on an unusually cold late March evening? Travel down the street to the neighborhood pizzeria. This space is small, but cozy. Perfect for a sleety night. I started off with a glass of imported Italian, organic red, valpentena corvina. For only $7.00, this wine is packed full of flavor, without being too dry or tasting cheap.The chicken, pesto (made in house with pine nuts), arugula, mozzarella piadini was a hit, and would make my grandmother proud. (A piadini is wood dried bread pressed with fillings; think of it as a cousin to the panini.)Nonna serves her piadinis with mixed greens and a chianti vinaigrette that is oh so delicious. For $8.00, the entire entree was rather large portion of food.My table mates opted to order different wood fired pizzas. When they arrived, it appeared both pizzas were overloaded with grease. While this is somewhat expected with wood fired foods in general, it seemed a bit excessive, and they both blotted their pizzas with napkins before taking the first bite.For dessert, the menu boasted local gelato for $5.00. Unfortunately, this chocolate chip treat was definitely NOT the traditional Italian gelato. It had the consistency of "American" ice cream. When we inquired as to where the "gelato" hailed, the server advised he was unaware. He further explained that almost all the foods served are made in house, but the gelato is not one of them.This said, without mention, he simply removed the dessert from the bill. Impressive.I definitely will be back for another round of the piadini, and a delicious glass of red wine to accompany it.

reviews.name: Bridgette C.
reviews.review: I am a huge proponent of anything I can walk to and stumble home from ,so thank you Nonna, for this little treat in Sylvan Park.  A pizza and wine bar eh?  Yes, yes this is a fantastic idea.I came here with friends the Wednesday before thanksgiving.  I need to state this at the beginning: it's small in here.  So if you want to try it out, I suggest quiet weeknights or dining at off hours.  The decor is rustic, warm, and the servers are wonderful.  They were running a drink special on sangria which was delicious.And the food was spectacular.  I love pizza, and I love pizza more if it doesn't make me feel gross after indluging.  The pizzas are a great size to either devour yourself or split.  They have great toppings with lots of options for meat or veggies lovers.  Their salads and appetizers were really delicious (they brought carrots and pita with the dips which I really loved).I would recommend this place for small parties (maybe 4-6 people at most) or date night, or catching up with a friend.  Again, its really small, and it can get loud quickly if it becomes packed (which it will be).  But the prices are reasonable, and the food is great, so if you want something fun and local I would highly recommend this little annex of neighborhood favorite Cafe Nonna.

reviews.name: Jena G.
reviews.review: We've visited Nonna's Pizzeria three times, usually for early weeknight Date Nights and once for a late glass of wine & dessert.The first two times were close to perfect - no wait, friendly & knowledgable service, and delicious, fresh food. The third time was less charmed, with an overcharge on our drinks and yellowing mixed greens, hence the four stars here. For appetizers, try the spiced nuts, which have an exotic robust flavor that will have you reaching for more. Also, the olive tapenade is a highlight, a generous portion of served with Cosi-like flat bread and carrot sticks, like all of the dips. Skip the dipping oil, a rather bland oil which deserves a bread with more crumb. The star of the show here of course is the pizza - a crispy thin crust and thoughtfully arranged, generous toppings. Yum!Try a piadini  - an Italian take on the quesadilla with flatbread - my grilled zucchini was hearty and filling.

reviews.name: Jessica M.
reviews.review: Yay for more restaurants in Sylvan Park!  This place is a great addition.  It is right next door to Cafe Nonna (the more upscale Italian cuisine restaurant run by the same owners) but is a bit more casual and focuses on pizza.  The service is very friendly, the atmosphere is laid back (we brought our 2-year-old) and the food is delicious.  We had the Tuscan BBQ Chicken Pizza and the Goomba Pizza (with pepperoni and sausage) and though both were good, the Tuscan BBQ was AMAZING.  We also had a flatbread with dipping sauce appetizer that was very good.  Happy to recomend this place and happy to make many a trip back.P.S. This is my new thing -- but yay for not having a TV in the restaurant!  Makes for a more relaxing atmosphere.

reviews.name: Louisa G.
reviews.review: I'm a fan! no secret that my husband loves pizza-- his favorite food, and I love me a glass or two of wine, so this place is right up our alley. further, it's close to home so bonus! tonight we stopped in after work and were pleasantly surprised by their Wednesday night wine specials ($5/glass!). I really love the way they designed the space. it's stylish and cozy but not overdone--perfect for what they're doing. the arugula salad was super yummy and perfectly dressed... could use a few more crumbles of goat cheese but let's be honest, everything could use more cheese in my opinion. we got a two pizzas and had plenty to take home. this is such a lovely neighborhood joint... thinking we have a new Wednesday tradition!

reviews.name: Mark M.
reviews.review: Love the atmosphere. It's small but refined. Pizza is very good. A bit pricey but the quality an taste is well worth it. A must go for people that want to support local good business.

reviews.name: Jessica H.
reviews.review: I've lived in the neighborhood for about 6 months and last night was my first trip here...so stoked to have this place within waking distance! The vibe is awesome and the service great. I did think it was strange to serve carrot sticks + mediocre bread with the dipping oil rather than excellent bread. And the dipping oil itself was a bit bland. This is usually my fave kind of app so I was disappointed. But the pizza made up for it! I wasn't a huge fan of the 3 Graces; I think with their crust I'd prefer a pepperoni or margarita. BEST PART: We sprung for dessert and the tiramisu was the most delicious thing ever. It was so freaking good. I'm really looking forward to warm weather and being able to enjoy their patio.

reviews.name: April ..
reviews.review: Sitting in restaurant number two after trying the Nonna pizza and wine bar to no avail. Hostess was nice enough but didn't set us up to expect greatness. For advertising themselves as a wine bar I guess we expected something a little more upscale. The boxes of wine and beer under the benches didn't exactly scream chic, but hey, we like trying new places so we stayed and started looking through the menu. The wine menu left quite a bit to be desired...short and hardly what you would expect from a wine bar...not very creative, interesting choices at all. The menu was also far from inspiring, but we each decided on something that would make each of us happy...and then we waited...and waited...and waited...and waited. By the time the fourth or fifth country song started playing (in an Italian "wine bar") we decided to leave our not-so comfortable plywood bench and head somewhere new...something that we never ever do. We'd love to have reviewed the food here, but sadly never had a server to even order any. We love this style of restaurant when that's what we're expecting. Local taco next door for example is awesome and we know what to expect, partially because it isn't advertising itself as a high-end tequila bar, just tacos. We love all of the new places in sylvan park that are popping up and are so excited for what's to come, but hopefully they will place a higher value on service and atmosphere than Nonna pizza and "wine bar" has.

reviews.name: Scott A.
reviews.review: This place is very "collegiate". Fun atmosphere, but for an establishment that advertises itself as a Pizzaria and "wine bar", the wine list is brief and ill conceived.  The prices were fair, but the selections (shy of one nice bottle) seemed like the wine buyer likes to hang out in the box wine section of the wine store.  The pizza I had, the "Goomba", was a 10", thin crust sad affair that was obviously made with a pre packaged frozen crust.  The cheese was not good quality, and there was a fair amount of grease on the pie. No value at $12.   I realize that I am coming across as a foodie snob, but in a town with such stiff competition, there are infinitely better options for pizza and wine.

reviews.name: Ashley E.
reviews.review: Hostess wasn't very helpful outside of tell us where not to sit. Not very busy, took a noticeable amount of time to take our order. Food was delicious! 3 Graces was so so so good. Tuscan BBQ Chicken was a little spicy. Great flavor! Wine prices are high. Probably won't go back--it was one timer.

reviews.name: G W.
reviews.review: The space was nice - could get a little noisy but the music was good.  Parking is a problem unless you live in walking distance.  Salsa was good but the italian ham/cheese appetizer not so much - too salty and a bizarre texture.  Nice wine list though.

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: I came here with my husband for a double date on a Wednesday, just early enough to catch the end of Happy Hour (It ends at 7 PM.), and I was pleasantly surprised to find out it was "Wholly Craft Wednesday". They have $2.50 Craft Drafts, $1.50 Select Domestic Drafts and $5.25 signature martinis ALL DAY LONG! I had a cosmo and the grand lemon drop martini. The lemon drop was the best I've ever had. Seriously, they are so good! And dangerous... It feels like you're just drinking some great lemonade, so be careful how quickly you down them! For dinner, I got the veggie wrap. It has spinach, broccoli and carrots with hummus and pesto mayo. It was honestly just okay. The ingredients are not scattered proportionately so instead of getting evenly mixed flavors in each bite, you will get a big chunk of spinach, followed by a glob of pesto mayo and then a huge carrot. However, judging by the empty plates of my dinner companions, I am definitely willing to go back and try something else. The location is great. I love everything about the Gulch. They have a nice patio, although it was sprinkling so we sat inside. It was a little noisy, which is to be expected with the territory. We were sitting in a corner booth in the back, so it would have been nice to be able to hear everyone a little bit better. I didn't realize I was having to yell, but I had a sore throat the next day. I would definitely go back again. Love the location, the various food choices and the drink specials. If you're looking for something a little more intimate with less noise, you might want to try somewhere else though.

reviews.name: Heath W.
reviews.review: Had dinner here last night. The atmosphere and location are amazing. There is a good selection of draft beer but an even better selection of drinks and wines. Some of the craft beers were lacking in variety but their were were a few. The food was very good but the service could have been a bit better in terms of timing from order to delivery. We ordered the Nacho Chips Trio which had amazing queso dip and and even better quacamolé. After we finished, they brought us our plates and silver ware and napkins. Same thing with the delay in drinks and main course. Good restaurant but has a few things that can be improved a bit.

reviews.name: Kurt N.
reviews.review: Let me preface this with this: the frontline staff are doing nothing wrong.I live in the same building and have grown to know many people who work here. If you want an example of a place that pulls every shady service industry trick on their staff, this is it. They don't tip people out properly, never cut staff by their schedule, and generally treat their staff like cattle. Some of the managers seem to purely use the establishment as a vehicle for taking girls home as they are constantly chatting up only attractive girls. I'd love for the department of labor to visit and see if everyone is being paid right.UPDATE: One of the managers came to me with a print out of this review and told me I am no longer welcome in the establishment. I think that says enough.

reviews.name: Gerald W.
reviews.review: Seriously. I waited longer for my food than for the birth of my 1st kid - and according to the misses, thats was less painful too. Skip the place and avoid horrendous service and average food.Stand in the line at Biscuit Love, the wait is shorter in the line which goes around the block (which we were avoiding - joke is on us).

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: Sorry bar Louie. I wanted this to be a good experience, but with lazy bartenders, dirty dishes, and cold food, it is hard to give a good review. We had to endure a empty Bloody Mary glass with a celery stick that looked like the blow up guy that his arms move for the 40 minutes we were here.  The flatbread that was brought out took over 20 minutes and was luke warm. No beer refills offered ( I had to ask each time). The dirty bar is appalling. $42 later, I walk out disappointed.  I will come back for drinks not expecting much but expensive beer.

reviews.name: Missy R.
reviews.review: Bartender Raymond was nice and is still taking very good care of us. Just drinking lol Beer is cold and plentiful

reviews.name: Christie B.
reviews.review: Very good food, service and outdoor seating! The veggie wrap is wonderful and so is the veggie flat bread. I highly recommend this restaurant for lunch! They also have valet parking for $5 bucks!The music was a bit loud for me outside and it was a little hard to hear the conversation, that is why I am giving it 4 stars instead of 5.#64

reviews.name: Lekesha J.
reviews.review: I visited Bar Louies for the first time on October 10 for my birthday. I loved it. Christina the waitress was awesome. The drink that she recommend was great as well. The effen Martini was effen good. I'm looking forward to going back real soon.

reviews.name: Nickie G.
reviews.review: There are so many reviews that I will forgo the usual long-windedness I have and just give you some observations.Nice ambiance - classy, modern, and extremely dark (like get your flashlight out to see the menu!). Also loud loungey music.Along with ambiance, the clientele is all over the board in age but everyone is dressed more smartly and the darkness lends itself to a meat-market type of vibe.Cocktails are good. Strawberry mule was refreshing. So was regular ole vodka soda.People that work there seem nice and like they know what they are doing.Outside is a fire looking thing and seating. Great for when the weather is nice.Not a bad bar but not a place I am going to want to go every weekend. It is just a little too upscale and posh for this dive lover.

reviews.name: Sincere R.
reviews.review: Service is kind of hit or miss but more times than not it's pretty good. Nice spot to come in after work to grab a drink, get some fresh air, catch the game, and meet some cool people. Oh, and did I mention there's a HH Monday-Friday: $5.25 martinis and half priced apps and flatbreads, and $3.25 draft beers.

reviews.name: Ashley P.
reviews.review: Took a trip to Nashville on the weekend the city had some of the worst weather it's ever had - so by necessity to eat we went to the closest restaurant for some dinner. Which happened to be Bar Louie (it was in the building we were staying in). The Gulch is an AWESOME neighborhood - so I'm somewhat kicking myself for not going to a less chain service restaurant.We got sat almost immediately upon entering, however, it took a good 20 minutes before we were ever acknowledged by server - and this only happened after we waved down a bus boy to ask for our server.Once she finally comes out (I think her name was Halley) she explains to us she had people taking their servers test and she had to over see. My first thought was - who makes people take their servers test on a Friday night at 8:30? Do they expect to have that slow of service? second though - after working as a server I would never blame my lateness on other people I would do everything I could to earn back my tables trust. Free appetizer? maybe a round of drinks - make it work. But sadly, she did not. And it only got worse from there.I ordered a blood orange mule -and it honestly was one of the worst cocktails I've ever tasted. So after one drink I asked her if I could send it back and possibly just have a regular a Moscow mule? Well - at Bar Louie this concept does not exist. She told me "once the drink hits the table it cannot be taken back". WHAT kind of a policy is that??? One that should be reevaluated. That's for sure. The food was okay. The buffalo chicken flatbread was decent - I would give more stars for that if the service wasn't so awful. The calamari was bland. The nachos only had like 3 pieces of chicken. Overall - horrid experience at Bar Louie.

reviews.name: Maria S.
reviews.review: Bar Louie is awesome.  It's a grown up environment with excellent martini's and fantastic service.  Recently visited on a warm Nashville day - we sat outside to people watch and enjoy a drink.  Levi was our server and between making great suggestions and never making us feel rushed - even though it was packed - she made the experience even better.  The Clover martini was absolutely excellent and for $5.25 during happy hour definitely a must try.  I didn't have any food but they had a great variety of appetizers which were half price during happy hour.  Can't wait to go back.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: Definitely the nicest bar Louie I have seen in any state. Very clean very well laid out. The food brunch could have been better.  My omelette order was incorrect, burnt on the outside raw on the inside.  But on a good note the server realized it before I even said anything and brought out a replacement

reviews.name: Chloe H.
reviews.review: I am absolutely appalled by the management at this location. I live in the building located above the restaurant/bar, and the management lets the employees run around like zoo animals on a regular basis. I cannot tell you how many times I have seen the employees drunk at the back of the building, chain smoking and making lots of noise yelling at each other into the early mornings on all nights of the week. However, last night I hit my limit with this establishment. The employees pulled the fire alarm not once, but TWICE in the middle of the night (around 3:00 and then again at 3:40 AM) on a SUNDAY night. We were told by the "manager" at Bar Louie that one of the employees "accidentally pulled the fire alarm while cleaning". Hmm I'm going to call BS on that one. And TWICE?!I think the Gulch would be very happy to see Bar Louie leave our neighborhood. I look forward to having a more respectable establishment with better management and better food (let's be honest, the food here is very sub par and way overpriced). I certainly will not be giving any business to this joke of an establishment.

reviews.name: Alisha L.
reviews.review: Cool vibe and dark lighting! I sat up at the bar with a friend and everyone was really nice and attentive to see if we needed anything. I ordered the veggie flatbread without cheese and the cook came out and suggested a marinara since I was 86ing the cheese. It was delicious! And parking across the street was ridiculously cheap! Will definitely be going back!

reviews.name: Jasmine W.
reviews.review: Great food, prompt service! Dani (beautiful server with bright red hair) was very kind to our 3 year old daughter, she even drew her a picture of the little mermaid. Very accommodating staff. Food was awesome, came out quickly. Great value for the price as well. We will be back again!

reviews.name: Katherine K.
reviews.review: Where do I even begin...this establishment is a joke and does not deserve to be in this prime location. Bar Louie seems to be run by a bunch of animals that do not care about the quality of service. I havebeen here a couple different times in hopes for better service each time. Well last night was my final straw. A couple girlfriends and I got there around 6:45 we were given a buzzer, my name was put on the list and we were told it would be around 15 minutes. 30 minutes later I went up there to ask how much longer it would be and on the list it showed that we were skipped over 3 times. 3 TIMES!!  Naturally, we were not happy about this. The hostess then took us to the most secluded table in the restaurant (again not happy). It took around 10minutes for the waitress to even come greet us and take our drink orders. After it took her another 10 minutes for us to get our drinks we ordered an appetizer, that came out in an untimely matter. Then we ordered our entrees. Our waiter, who by the way was definitely on something then proceeded to come back around 15 minutes after weplaced our order and told us she was splitting the checks 4 ways...ok? But where is our food?  We asked how much longer our food would be andshe looked at us as if she was crazy i.e she didn't put the food in. She then came back and said there was a mix up with the tickets so then we really knew she didn't put the food in. It had been close to 2hours we were sitting at the table with no food, when it finally came out it was mediocre at best.  We got the manager involved; he was also on some sort of drug. They ended up taking 50% off our food whenrealistically we shouldn't have had to pay at all. The checks were also completely wrong so she had to go back in and fix them not just once but multiple times. of course the waitress acted as if her mistakes were our fault. Needless to say, we will not be going back to Bar Louie and I do not recommendthis place to anyone.

reviews.name: MacKenzie T.
reviews.review: Horrible service last night. I had called a week prior to make sure I made a reservation to accommodate a large group of friends from out of town. It look over 30 minutes to get drinks and over an hour for ANY OF THE FOOD to come out and when it did IT WAS COLD. The manager I spoke to just acted extremely disrespectful as well and as if he really didn't care. The management really has no idea how take care of their customers. We won't be going back and that is the last time I take anyone from out of town there or recommend this establishment. There are so many other options in Nashville spend your money somewhere else.

reviews.name: Steve B.
reviews.review: Shout out to Bar Louie...they are down with Team Portions.  Not as crowded and noise as on Broadway.  Plenty of beverages to go around.  good staff, accommodating to say to least for a party.  It is fun, good times none the lessGrade: C

reviews.name: Matt D.
reviews.review: I love this spot, friendly staff and great food. They do a great job with football games in the fall, if you haven't tried their brunch yet I would recommend it. Great happy hour. Matt

reviews.name: Jacoby D.
reviews.review: We headed to Bar Louie for drinks for my birthday on a Thursday evening. We had a large party and were able to get a large tabletop for a group of 10-12. It was a great casual hang for a group, but a little noisy. It was unfortunately too loud to have conversation from across the table.The cocktails I had were delicious, but our server wasn't as present as I would have liked. Overall, fun and worth it to go!

reviews.name: Matt M.
reviews.review: Came in from Atlanta on business. Heard some friends rave bout this place. I used to live in Nashville over 10 yrs ago so needless to say...way different in this area!! But greatAmbiance was awesome; dig the vibe. Our server ( sorry, forgot his name ) very nice guy. Jacked, in real good shape (bastard)lolCame in for 1/2 off apps! So awesome!!Staff was mostly hot chicks (awesome).Overall, great place!! I'd bet that around "happy hour" all the zuit suits come out and the feeding frenzy begins lolOh yea... Going back this evening so stay tuned for part 2Thanks kids

reviews.name: Monique F.
reviews.review: A good neigbourhood, chain restaurant just outside of the rush of Broad. We were here on a saturday late afternoon and enjoyed the sun on the terrace with a few drinks and food. Both were oke and the service was prompt. Like all other Bar Louie they serve burgers, sandwiches and appetizers. The same like there is on all their locations. Familiar but not very creative.We had a burger and a vegetarian wrap. The latter stood out most.And please excuse any spelling or grammar mistakes. English is not my first language. And if that isn't bad enough I have an Apple device that keeps trying to change English into 'proper Dutch'. Yes, you've guessed right, my first language.

reviews.name: Emily C.
reviews.review: Came here for the food and drink specials on Wednesday. The specials were very limited to Bud Light and some other low quality beer. I didn't drink and just ordered food with my friends instead. Had the new chicken salad which I thought was decent. For it's price and amount, spending $15 wasn't bad.The environment on a Wednesday night was pretty social with most people socializing around the bars. Romantic although slightly loud, I wouldn't come here again to eat since the food was average. If I had to come here, I would just come for the drinks (during happy hour before 7pm).

reviews.name: Jason M.
reviews.review: Found this place by chance. Was heading to Biscuit Love and the line was way too long. Ask a waitress "Taylor" outside if Bar Louie served brunch and with a huge smile she said"yes and come on in." Not crowded fast service very clean and our glasses never ran dry!  I reccomend the spicy biscuit and gravy!  Our crowd will definitely be back on the next visit!

reviews.name: Armand H.
reviews.review: I basically come for the nachos. The chicken nachos are sooooo good. I don't drink, so my review may be pointless to you, but I also like that they have non-alcoholic "mixed" drinks. A pretty fun atmosphere, especially because people come to drink, so the patrons are a little "loose." Haha

reviews.name: David R.
reviews.review: Early in the afternoon, this place was close and open. I came here with an old friend.  It was my first visit here, but not to The Gulch.I ordered a drink called The Clover, it is made with Maker's Mark, Hennessy, agave nectar, lemon and orange juices, orange twist. I liked it.My friend was not sure what she wanted, but she wanted some she could "feel"; I suggested a Grateful Dead. It was okay, but not as good as others I have tasted.We ordered calamari and tempura shrimp. We liked them and the sauces that accompanied them. Our bartender was good, but sometimes inattentive. Overall, everything was good.

reviews.name: Robert S.
reviews.review: Bar Louie NashvilleHip bar located in the Gulch district of town.  Service was attentive though it was a crowded Saturday night.  Extensive draught beer list and unique martini list.  Did not have any food though the meals my  friends had looked good.  There is a table outside the building that is heated by a natural gas line and is a nice touch.Overall, a great place to have some after-work drinks or meet with friends for a meal, drinks and a game!

reviews.name: Simon T.
reviews.review: First impressions of bar Louie: crowded on Saturday night but even being crowded there is plenty of room to move around the bar to find a seat opening up. They have a very large selection of draft beers and there were about 6 bartender working so it never took long to get a drink/food. We had chicken nachos($11.25)that were very good with nice big pieces of chicken and fresh jalapeños. We will go back.

reviews.name: Carmen P.
reviews.review: i wanted to not like this place. i wanted to scoff at the ridiculous attire their female bartenders wear, i wanted to be able to make some quips and whatnot regarding our experience here, but i can't. the hubs and i warmed up with baileys and coffee and it was great--but really overpriced: 10.50 for baileys and coffee...really? but, the food was awesome, so, i'll let it slide. i can honestly say the huevos rancheros on their brunch menu is seriously some of the best i've had--anywhere. i'm pretty sure the eggs used are poached, which is amazing, and the tortillas are crispy, even more amazing! i've been thinking about that dish non-stop since we ate there last weekend.  i believe i even dreamed about it. dh and i shared an order of "fried" avocado slices--they were glory. glory in the highest. we had a failed attempt to enjoy some at rose pepper a year ago, and were so scarred from that experience, we were weary to try these, but i'm glad we did, because like being in fragile rock (an awesome show from the early 80's you young whippersnappers), these things helped us to cast our cares away and worries for another day.

reviews.name: Anita A.
reviews.review: This is one of my new faves! The best salmon slider ever and the chicken nachos are amazing. . The berry mojito (I like extra mint) has a phenomenal flavor!!! Cool atmosphere with valet parking for convenience.  I'm sooo glad we have one NashVegas! A great place for a large group of friends to get together and have a blast or just a couple to enjoy a fun evening... p.s. get the salmon sliders!

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: I wish I could give this 3 1/2 stars. The happy hour specials are great - try the shrimp, flatbread, and sliders. But the place is just so big and corporate and kind of anonymous. They have valet parking, but the valets were about to leave so just told me to leave my car in their lane - and tip them for it. I did. What can I say? It was raining and a holiday and I felt sorry for them. Anyway, service was ok, but not great. We were a big party and they needed more than one server who did not check on us that often. We ended up clearing the table ourselves at one point, just to make some room. And one of our party had to go in search of the server when she wanted another drink. The place was not that full... maybe they were understaffed?I'd go there again if friends suggested it, but not on my own steam.

reviews.name: Chase R.
reviews.review: This has become a go-to spot for my friends and I on the weekends. They also have a really good brunch special on mimosas, and the "hangover helper" is delicious!

reviews.name: Brianna H.
reviews.review: Very Poor and disrespectful service the whole staff! Me and my boyfriend went in around happy happy hour time we ate and we left happy! Unfortunately, that was murdered by the stupid selfish waiter!Here's what happened. After we made it out the door. The waiter WALKS OUT OF THE ESTABLISHMENT basically saying forget my job I have to chase this couple down and ask them Why I didn't get a tip!! I believe his name is Chris! He goes " what did I do wrong I make $ 2.13 an hour, where is my tip" Forcefully,he disrespected us and made judgments about were we should be eating.. "Yall need to go eat at McDonald's" I then explain to him how McDonald's employees are nice and they don't make below minimum wage!!! Long story short DO NOT GIVE ANY OF YOUR CENTS TO BAR LOUIE!! They will threaten you! The manager told me not to come back to eat at Bar Louie! Trust me when I say you will lose you're time and money going there! Who is Chris to tell me were to spend my money!! The big question is why did he chase me was it because of my skin color???? I'm sure this was not the first nor the last time Chris did not revive a tip. So why us! Chris if you're reading this! You're still working at Bar Louie for $2.13 an hour! Meanwhile, I'm about to graduate college making $50,000 a year! So you be blessed!

reviews.name: Cole H.
reviews.review: Food is decent for bar food I reckon. The problem I have with this place is they are always busy which is great for them but they are always understaffed. It literally takes 15-20 minutes to get a drink refilled sometimes. Hire some more people, ya heard?!

reviews.name: Gene C.
reviews.review: Great food and drinks as usual for this chain. But what got a 5-star with me was this particular location. I don't typically do chains when traveling, but we arrived late and looked for anything that was open nearby. Bar Louie was a name we could trust so we rolled in there. Everything about this location was right - the service, the food, the drinks - and it breathed modern Nashville. Well done.

reviews.name: Bob R.
reviews.review: Louie is surrounded by construction now so lunch is very quiet. Makes for good conversation. Service is immediate. Melissa treated us wonderfully. This may be short but it is the end. Try it.

reviews.name: FoodCritic 6.
reviews.review: The food here was okay! Just every time I ordered the chicken nacho twice they always forget to put the chicken on the nacho. I told my server and he told me, "oh I'm sorry we do have a new guy back there." The food is great the only reason why I'm give me a two stars is because the staff is very unfriendly! I am a regular here and every single time I come the service and the staff is always shitty! Yes you go in and seat yourself! However as you're walking by none of the staff greet you or ask where we like to sit. I haven't stepped foot in this place for almost a year I come back and it's still the same.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: I met a group of people here, tonight and they gave us the private room in the back. Less noise, less crowds, a couple of waitresses.When I first walked in, I sat at the bar and the manager greeted me, a bartender greeted me and everyone was very pleasant.I asked for a coffee and it was brought out immediately.It was delicious!  Very good tasting coffee.Went to the back room and hung out with my gang who ordered food.Portions were HUGE!  I mean gigantic!!One gal ordered the hummus plate and it had Tzatziki  sauce as one of the dips.I asked the gal if it was loaded with fresh garlic and dill and she said she tasted neither.The burger looked fantastic and with all the things on the burger, it stood about 5 inches high and came with a large portion of onion rings and french fries.the gal that ate the burger said it was delicious.I didn't order any food or liquor, but I watched everyone eat their huge plates of food.I will go back, one of the days and try out their menu.The coffee was high end.. not bitter, not full of chicory, but a very good rich, delicious tasting coffee.And everyone that worked there, that I came in contact with was very pleasant, right down to the valet.

reviews.name: Jacki O.
reviews.review: You cannot beat their happy hour specials. And the Effen Good martini is to die for. Love it every time.

reviews.name: Eugene P.
reviews.review: I ordered a BlackBerry,  Orange & Brie salad to go. The salad description: Blackberry, Orange & Briemixed greens, brie, oranges, blackberries, pecans, bacon, basil, bacon vinaigrette. No bacon in the salad, the vinaigrette had grease particles.  I called Paul the manager who stated that they melt bacon grease to gel the vinaigrette.  And that I could bring my salad back so they could add the two slices of bacon that he couldn't prove that wasn't there. I said really and what is your name again. His attitude change and  he said just bring the salad in. With that he was getting ready for a meeting. I could come back to the bar and he would have James to have me all set. NO THANKS PAUL!   BE careful how you treat your customers.  ONE CAN BRING ONE OR DIVERT HUNDREDS.

reviews.name: Kristo E.
reviews.review: Terrible service. Took us an hour to get a table. We waited because it was a group all coming separately so it was better to just stay and wait.But we should have known better. The waiter took 20-30 minutes to check on us, whilst other people were standing around dancing. Bringing a drink took 20 minutes.I will not be coming back.

reviews.name: Layne P.
reviews.review: Horrible service! It's Monday afternoon at 5:32pm and we (wife and I) had to wait at the bar for 10 minutes before even being approached.Bad attitude bartender! I feel like I'm at Dick's Last Resort. At least there I know I'm going to get "tude" from the staff. Enjoy your success- it won't last long unless you learn how to value customers.Big FAIL! To bad. The dark haired bearded guy who looks to be in his late 20's early 30's is missing out on a big tipper.I just got the bill and this guy put down "Alicia" as our server- what a coward!The hostess just told me his name is Damian... Yelpers none of this works if we don't express ourselves when we have a HORRIBLE experience- this guy was more than just a little bit rude- he was an ASS.

reviews.name: Wenye X.
reviews.review: Never knew that Nashville has such trendy and chic area. Love it and will definitely come back

reviews.name: Adam V.
reviews.review: This is a cool place--open seating, giant windows, and very good food!I had never tried Bar Louie until last night.  My softball team won a league earlier this year in Nashville Sports Leagues.  Bar Louie was gracious enough to sponsor that night (thank you!).  We had $150 to use and decided to take advantage of that during the Super Bowl.I was initially impressed by the layout and arrangement of the bar.  As you enter, there is a giant wrap-around bar by the door.  To the left, is an open seating area with  big, plush chairs and couches.  It's a great spot to congregate if you have a group of 6-8 people.  There is also a separate room in the bag that is a good size if you have an event or party.The service was excellent as well.  Our waiter was very attentive and did a great job of making food and beer suggestions.  He was on-point all night.The food is also very good.  I had the fried Louie burger.  It's basically a bacon cheeseburger with an egg on top.  Awesome.  It's a bit messy, but very good.  We also split some chicken nachos and they were excellent.Bar Louie has a pretty good beer list.  They don't have many craft selections, but they do have a few local brews--Turtle Anarchy, Yazoo, and Jackalope.  That's great to see.Bar Louie is a bit upscale with a modern flair.  The restrooms are very clean as well.  The food, service, and seating are all well done and it is a great place to catch a game.

reviews.name: Erin R.
reviews.review: We live in the neighborhood and have been to Bar Louie at least a dozen times.  There are really only 2 reasons to come to Bar Louie.  The awesome 1/2 off wine/drinks and apps happy hour specials and the patio (when the weather is cooperating).  Their food is very typical bar food - the salty kind that leaves you wanting to drink 2 gallons of water afterwards.  It's tasty but the quality is average.  Would not pay full price for it but at half off during happy hour, you can justify it.  For me, though, the main problem I have with this place is the service.  Every time I have been the service has ranged from mediocre to terrible.  I would say on at least half the occasions I have been to BL, it has taken our server a good 10-15 minutes to approach the table once we were seated.  Maybe they just don't staff appropriately or don't train their wait staff to be able to handle the capacity?  Whatever the case, this always seems to put a damper on my experience at BL.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: After 2 more experiences at Bar Louie, I have to give a new review highlighting the food. Their flat breads are tasty, I've had the buffalo chicken and the veggie and they were both spot on. They also have a house made hot sauce that is excellent as well. My BF ordered their steak burrito, and it was huge and pretty solid. The cheese sauce on top reminded me of the crap yellow cheese you get at a sporting event, but the salsa and meat was seasoned well. While the food is good, I do feel that it is a bit pricey for what you get. The flat breads run you $12.00 and the main dishes climb steadily in price from there, and I've avoided those items because of it. I sampled some more cocktails, and think the martinis are the way to go. They are pretty stout and tasty! The bar is loud (sort of clubish) but I feel like the decor is more upscale and trendy, so it's fun for a night out. Not bad Bar Louie.

reviews.name: Emily Myles H.
reviews.review: Bar Louie is a fun place to grab a bite/drink! Love their mojitios.  Their holiday fig & brie flatbread is delish.  I got it without the pork and it was light and flavorful.  Will definitely be back again.

reviews.name: Ginger F.
reviews.review: I was so excited to come here ! I came here with some friends and was helped by a Lee.  He has to be the rudest server I hs e ever encountered.   He had a foul attitude right from the begging, he didn't seem like he wanted to engage with out party at all.  I mean the food was alright , but lee was so cold and rude through the entire night.  He even got our order wrong! !!

reviews.name: Joelle K.
reviews.review: Had drinks here last weekend with my husband and sister. The ambiance was very nice and they have a great outdoor area outside with plenty of fire heating areas. Too bad it was 10 degrees out! My sister is a regular here and knew the bartender, who was awesome. I started with an amazing s'mores martini. I followed that with several of their local draught options. I would not hesitate to go back!

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: You can't beat a Bar Louie happy hour, however since they have such good deals on their food and drinks that it's almost impossible to get a table if you aren't there right at 5PM. I walked up to the bar to order food (because for some reason they don't provide service to any of their outdoor seating) and I stood there for 25 minutes waiting to be noticed. They will walk right by you knowing you were there before the other people who are scrambling for their attention.Overall, if you can get there early and get an inside table you will have a great time for a cheap price. If you can't, I suggest downloading the Happy Hour app and going somewhere else.

reviews.name: Lyrad V.
reviews.review: Visited Bar Louie for the first time tonight. They are one of several sponsor bars of the Nashville Sports League. One of my softball teams received a $150 gift card for winning a league last year and we finally got around to getting together to use it.First off, my husband made a reservation for Super Bowl Sunday since we assumed it may be really busy. They did not have our reservation when we arrived, but were nice and accommodating anyways. It actually wasn't busy (the weather was nasty out-raining with potential to ice later on), so we found a spot on some sofas around a large table. This place has a nice atmosphere. More upscale and modern than a typical sports bar, but with plenty of TVs to enjoy the game. Although they have a full bar, I was pleasantly surprised at their large draft beer selection. Love that they had Harpoon's UFO White. I don't typically see Harpoon beer anywhere in Nashville on tap.They have a good menu with lots of choices. Typical bar menu, but it does go above and beyond the basics. My husband like his "Fried Louie burger" served with a fried egg, and I had a breakfast burrito which  was excellent, served with generous helping of sour cream and guacamole, and both red salsa and salsa verde. Our server was attentive all night. Food came out promptly. After a certain time 20 oz beers became the same price as 16 oz ones. I'm not sure what time that was, but it was an added bonus!The only disappointing part of the evening was the Super Bowl and commercials!

reviews.name: Rachel C.
reviews.review: By far some of the worst service I have ever experienced. We waited so long for our drinks that our appetizers arrived before water was even brought to the table. The staff stood around and spent more time talking to each other than serving customers. My first time here will certainly be my last.

reviews.name: Stacie S.
reviews.review: It's amazing how there could be 10 or 100 people in the restaurant and, without fail, the staff still moves at the same pace: slow.

reviews.name: Todd D.
reviews.review: The food was tasty and the service was good but the drinks were weak and the pours were lite. The food and drinks are expensive for what you get. The manager refused to sell me a side order of loaded tots which ticked me off. He was nice enough to offer to sell me a full appetizer portion for 9.75.....I guess the $125 (without tip) that our table of 4 spent wasn't enough to have him figure out a way to make my side of loaded tots happen. Anyway, my take away is phooey on Bar Louie!  Find a more interesting, local spot in The Gultch.  Burger Republic is just a few doors down and they are amazing!

reviews.name: Anna J.
reviews.review: Great happy hour! My favorite drink is the "tickled pink" with X-rated liquor.  It tastes even better when it's half off at happy hour. The small plates that are half off during happy hour are great and they come in generous portions. Flat breads are also half off and the chicken verde is declicious!

reviews.name: Alicia M.
reviews.review: I'm currently here with 5 friends(getting ready to leave tho ha ha) celebrating my buddy's 37th birthday. Everything was FAB! We came in just to have drinks and the service was very courteous! Robbie was an excellent bartender so big ups to him!!!

reviews.name: Katie I.
reviews.review: The ambience was nice, drinks were decent. Food- typical bar fare.The pretzel appetizer was pretty yummy, but there were only 4 pretzel sticks with 3 huge ramekins of dipping sauces. Queso- tasted like rotel, Spicy honey mustard- the best one, and a cinnamon and butter one, which was like dessert-y tasting. Even if you drenched every tiny bit in sauce, you wouldn't make a dent. They need to double the pretzel order to match the sauce ratio. 4 sticks is ridiculous. The chop chop salad was awful. ice berg lettuce and hardly any toppings and little dressing. Had to ask for the missing avocado and bacon. The fried chicken sandwich was decent, but the mac & cheese was completely underwhelming. Stouffers taste better. I don't think anyone at our table liked their food, but the company, ambience and drinks were fine. I guess when you have the word "bar" in the name, expect nothing more than bar food.

reviews.name: Chelsy L.
reviews.review: This restaurant is perfect for a afternoon on the patio or to watch a game at the bar. The service is good, friendly but a little slow. The food is great especially the chicken nachos! The drinks are the best part about this place from amazing martinis to delicious wine spritzers and a great draft beer selection.

reviews.name: Emily K.
reviews.review: This is where my girl friends and I go every Wednesday night for happy hour! Best $5 martini's until 10 pm and half priced aps until 7. The bar tenders are all very nice and get to know your drink orders. Always have an awesome time!! The calamari is really good also!

reviews.name: Frank M.
reviews.review: Great place for a good American meal. Appetizers, entrees and desert were spot on for value, taste,and selection. I was pleasantly surprised by the exceptional  waitress Ericka who was extremely professional and very helpful suggesting menu selections and choices.  I will me make this my regular stop when I am in Nashville

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: I was hesitant to go as I assumed it was girl oriented and a chain.  I was wrong.  They have the best Wedneday happy hour and a decent Mon-Thurs happy hour as well. I probably wouldn't go there with a great local offering on the weekend, but during weekday happy hour you can't beat it.

reviews.name: Anthony T.
reviews.review: I want to start out by saying that I debated by giving the 5 stars and it's not because of the food for service... That darn fire alarm stayed on last night.We  were out for a evening with friend to celebrate the birthdays. I wish I could have remembered her name because she was GREAT. She made sure we had everything we needed. Our drinks was always ready before the other one was done and the food was the same way. So food and service 5 star... Alarm 1 star.If you are in the area, please visit and by the the way; it was Friday night...

reviews.name: Charlie K.
reviews.review: Honestly, I've had better quality food at Burger King or Taco Bell.  Feel ripped off paying their prices for overcooked, far from fresh food. Now we know never to come back here.

reviews.name: Ann E.
reviews.review: Went to Bar Louie's with my daughter who is a regular here (who knew). Since it was Happy Hour, we made a meal out of appetizers, which was a good value. That, along with a few awesome draught beers made a delightful experience.

reviews.name: Will S.
reviews.review: The manager finally discounted the bill after the worst service of all time. Good food, but customer service was not so great.

reviews.name: John S.
reviews.review: Good:Atmosphere, drinks, foodBad:No NBA games??? Really?But on a more serious note, I came here with a couple of buddies to relax and see what's going on. By the time we got there, there weren't too many people seated at tables, although the bar was pretty occupied. We sat down, got some drinks, and just chatted to the people around. It was pretty fun and a good atmosphere, but they would not show any NBA games no matter what (c'mon! it's playoff season!). Happy hour food prices started at 10pm, with half-off small plates (appetizers), which were good for bar food. Anyways, it was a fun experience but there could be improvements.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: Bar Louie is a cool place but nothing really original. Pros: Nice decor, outside patio, large space, attentive staff, and cool music.Cons: Expensive drinks, probably going to have to pay to park, since it's an open air concept there will be flies buzzing around you even if you're inside, and it can get stupid crowded.I'd definitely go again if someone else wanted to but probably wouldn't choose it myself.

reviews.name: Ashley D.
reviews.review: Bar Louie is a great atmosphere in the heart of The Gulch. I've been twice since moving to Nashville. Went once during lunch and had the chicken club with fries for $9 so I thought that was a good deal. But my husband and I went Tuesday for dinner and everything is so overpriced. My drink was $10.50 for a mule and it was really gross. I asked for regular vodka instead of orange and they have me orange anyway. But they had the football and hockey games on so that was fun. You gave to pay to park $6 in the lot across from them. They had a valet parking sign but no one was there? I'll probably go back for lunch but it's just too expensive to drink at. The spinach dip is incredible, though.

reviews.name: Jeremy Q.
reviews.review: Clean place to grab a bite or have a drink. Tends to have more of an "uptown" crowd, but amiable environment.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: This place has a serious identity issue. The bartenders wear breastaurant uniforms, the decor is upscale and modern, the menu has both wings and fish (we actually joked we should try to get ahi with a side of wing sauce), the drink selection is fairly high end, games on the many TVs, and K$sha on the speakers.  That said, they have Sierra Nevada Torpedo on tap, the service was good, and the pretzels are delicious. So I can't really complain - the identity crisis didn't mean I had a bad time...but this concept should probably decide what it is.

reviews.name: Carey James B.
reviews.review: I had the mussels and the fish and chips.the mussels were horrible, the sauce they were in was foul.the fish and chips were also HORRIBLE.go there to drink NOT eat.AND the service was slow and unattentive

reviews.name: Kara B.
reviews.review: I love this place! The food (especially the nachos and pretzel sticks) is great, the bartenders are awesome and extremely friendly, the drinks are good and they have great drink specials and happy hour! It's a really nice place to go in the summer and sit out on the patio. I have turned into a regular here

reviews.name: Charity L.
reviews.review: The food here is really delicious!!  Not the usual "bar fare."  We had the turkey sliders with fries, buffalo chicken flatbread and the chicken tortilla soup.  They were all SOOOOOOO delicious!!  It's very clean and open. The only drawback is that it's very loud!!!!  It's difficult sometimes to hear the person unless they are sitting right next to you.  There's just not enough noise absorption in the restaurant. Lots of TV's means it's great for watching the game!!  I would definitely go back here!!

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: Bar Louie is what it is. There are so many other places to go if you want really great cocktails and food. The food is pretty much Applebee's on a prettier plate and an outrageous price tag. The servers are sometimes a bit pompous! The drinks are crazy expensive and not even a bit stiff! It's a pretty trendy "to be seen" place of you are into that. Every now and again I have to meet a friend here. I make sure I let them know that's it's just because I love them that I'd even show up. Ha!

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: I have to say that Bar Louie has one of the best happy hours in town.  I know many others have already pointed this out but it's  1/2 price appetizers (minus the salmon sliders) and great drink specials from 4-7 during the week.  I went there before a show at the symphony and got the adobe shrimp skewers and the beer braised mussels.  My friend and I split them and even though they were both appetizers, it was plenty of food for the both of us.  The mussels had a nice spicy sauce and came with a large piece of French bread.  The bread tasted incredibly fresh and was perfect for dipping .  The shrimp also had a slight kick, with a salad on the side.  Both were very good and you can't beat the price.  Our entire bill that night for two was $20! The server was attentive and polite and I was impressed with how attentive she was.   The only issue I had with Bar Louie was the super loud music.  I couldn't quite understand why the music was blaring to the point we couldn't hear each other across the table without repeating ourselves or talking really loud.  It was early in the night and I would think you might want to crank it up a little later in the evening after everyone has indulged themselves in happy hour.  They did turn it down slightly after our request but it was still annoying loud.  I have been there on warmer days when the front patio doors are open and it doesn't seem to be quite as noticeable.  This may not be an issue for everyone but wanted to mention it since it was the only downfall.Bar Louie is a nice addition to the gulch and I look forward to visiting their patio this spring.

reviews.name: Justin M.
reviews.review: Having seen Bar Louie all across the US I decided to stop in to see what the fuss was about. Very trendy design with a large bar, and few monitors around the bar and coolest of all was the large firepit on the patio. Since it was full I decided to go to the bar.I was immediately greeted by one of 4 bartenders working and and he introduced himself by name and asked mine (which he never forgot). I inquired as to what beers weren't on the list. He proceeded to give a wine type description of three not yet released beers that they had on tap from a Blue Moon visit a few days prior. I ordered one of those and settled in to grab a feel for the place. Once another bartender saw that my drink was getting low he came over and introduced himself also and took my order.Everyone seemed to be having a great time within their own group but it didn't seem like a place to go and meet new people while watching a game. After trying another beer it was time to leave. The top 40 radio from the past 20 years and the bad basketball games on killed the mood. I will probably be back with clients but like a few others on here it doesn't seem like my kind of "Cheers". This is not due to any sort of lacking with the service. I was very well taken care of and the employees really seemed to enjoy where they worked.

reviews.name: Nancy P.
reviews.review: Visited late (midnight?) on a Tuesday night after a show at The High Watt. First time, hungry and super pumped that they offered full menu all night. Ordered chicken quesadilla and a "New" Old Fashioned. Quesadilla was awesome, cocktail was dreadful-- the beverage filled the already huge rocks glass, simple syrup (or whatever they sweetened it with) overload, cherry not muddled, no orange twist as advertised... not the Old Fashioned that I was expecting. Maybe that's why it's called "New"? Swapped it for Templeton rye on the rocks after much debate with my date about sending it back. I mean, this was no Bar No. 308, but for $10.50, yeah, i wanted to enjoy my drink. Swap was no problem, server was nice about it. Pop country radio blaring overhead and a restaurant full of bros ... Definitely not my scene, but I did appreciate their good draft selection with several craft brews.

reviews.name: Tara K.
reviews.review: While I'm not sure this will be posted....here goes anyway.  Bar Louie is a terrific place regardless of whether Kurt N  is going to walk down his hall or not.  On a recent trip to Nashville, I stopped in Bar Louie 3 times, no, I don't have a problem, I had two business meetings which took place at BL, and the third time was a visit strictly for pleasure.  Interestingly, before my first meeting, I had the distinct pleasure of Kurt N finding a seat right beside me.  He is a recent transplant to Nashville and a rather retiring figure, so I was quite surprised to read his rather scathing review.  BL hops by anyone's standards, and those bartenders hustle, so I wholeheartedly disagree with his slow service while not in the weeds statement.  Very often the bar is three people deep, so in fact, there may be a bit of a wait.  While I was there I saw customers who were lovely and a goodly amount who were less than lovely, but what was consistent was the barkeeps treatment of all, which was friendly, warm and welcoming, even to those who shortchanged them, and I saw quite a bit of those shenanigans going on.  I NEVER saw any bartender tell a customer that a drink did not taste good, I did see customers asking for recommendations which were given with accurate descriptions of flavor profiles.  If one thinks $7 is alot for a 20oz beer served to you in a glass, then perhaps one should walk back down their hall with a six pack and drink where there is no concern about the service.  As far as someone knowing your name or recognizing your face, I witnessed firsthand, you receiving a warm welcome and being treated in a very friendly manner, which you seemed to be quite uncomfortable with.  Perhaps BL does not meet your high standards, others should def not be put off....it's a fun place. with good music, very friendly bar staff, and a nice clientele.  I overwhelmingly enjoyed myself and wonder what the purpose of writing such a pointed review is especially when you threaten to keep returning.  BL take a good long look at his photo.

reviews.name: Azza G.
reviews.review: Had a such great experience at Bar Louie! It was not my first (or second or third..) time but I had to commend the establishment for the improvements in quality of service, from walking in the door to us leaving. My server, Britany was super sweet and attentive, and the drinks and food were delicious!

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: So, you ever know someone who was generally just okay and then a couple years later he's made a semi-lame attempt to remake himself into something 'cooler'? That's basically what I think about when I think about Bar Louie. They kind of collapsed under their own weight in Chicago-where they started out as a cool, semi-divey, post-college, pre-yuppie kind of place and then they started closing spots down until Bar Louie became the bar at the Holiday Inn near the airport.So when BL opened in Nashville, I figured more of the same and didn't really go out of my way to visit and when my buddy and I were looking to walk off our beer tour I tried to steer us away from it. Finally, with not too many options to just chill out we ended up in front of Bar Louie.The layout pretty much looks exactly like the newer locations I've been too. We were pretty up in the air about what to drink and our bartender was pretty patient with us and gave us a few samples after our first choice was no longer stocked (apparently, a corporate decision.) We ended up with Dead Guy ale and wings, with the wings being all right, probably a little on the bland side.My experience was just ok, but it's probably because I still have the stigma of Bar Louie back up north where it's basically become a not as brightly lit version of Chili's that I can't rate it higher.

reviews.name: Lynn M.
reviews.review: It was a nice weekend in Nashville but I wanted a salad, to sit outside (it was a sunny 75) and be far away from the hustle-bustle and noise of Broadway. I was so happy to arrive at Bar Louie in the Gulch!  Right away 4 pleasant young men and women asked if we wanted to sit inside or out. Everyone was so nice and helpful.  We sat outside and our waitress was a "breath of fresh air" and so friendly! Thank you Daly for your great service and for carding me and my husband (we are over 55 !)  The mango Mojito was delish. I ordered a salad with grilled shrimp and it was loaded with shrimp and thin onion rings. It hit the spot. It was very good.  My husband had a salad with grilled chicken that was very fresh! My step son had a great fried chicken sandwich.  We don't live in the area - but we would go again if we visited Nashville!

reviews.name: Susannah B.
reviews.review: I go here all the time just because I live right upstairs. I went first for lunch after moving in to my apartment mostly because I was too exhausted to go anywhere else. It was AMAZING. I had their Mac and cheese which basically changed my life. Not kidding. Not to mention the portion was big enough so I had it for dinner as well after I packed the rest up. I came back later with some friends for drinks and the bartender was so great. Kept our drinks filled to a reasonable degree and was very talkative with us. I'm not sure if he wanted tips or what but he was great. I come here a lot with my friends and it's super easy for me because I can just take the elevator down and walk.

reviews.name: Greg S.
reviews.review: Sad, the bartenders think they are celebrities, and cater to the fake LA crowd. Too bad they are to worried about being cool rather than good bartenders. The Assistant manager Eric is a joke and should not even manage a Mickey d's I have been to several Bar Louies in Chicago and they are great places to go. I will hand it to the GM, he seems like he is on top of things, however, he needs to clean house and hire a professional staff.

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: We threw a party for a co-worker at Bar Louie. We needed a venue where people who wanted to order food could sit down and eat and people who wanted to drink could easily order one and lounge around. Bar Louie was the ideal spot for this type of gathering of 30 plus people. Management reserved us a section perfect for sitting/standing. The ambiance was a mix of classy and cool-- you could have an intimate conversation or get a little hyper. The music was definitely TOP 40s... I'm pretty sure I heard some Britney Spears and Katy Perry, and for me-- that was PERFECT... but I understand not everyone is into that... so you've been warned. ;) But in all seriousness-- if you want a big get-together in Nashville (particularly in the Gulch), try this place out. The food was really good, and I noticed the place attracts a wide variety of people!

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: This place is something of a sports bar/gastro pub in the heart of the trendiest area in Nashville. The selection of brews is vast and the service is always great the times I've been. Large screens surround the entire bar area and games are always on. The vibe is friendly and casual and there's a nice outdoor patio too. The philly mushroom swiss burger is awesome! If you're a local to the neighborhood you get discounts too.

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: I agree with Brian R's review on Bar Louie as I am not quite sure what I think as of yet...My personal experience began with Bar Louie in my hometown of St. Louis where I may have visited the location once and a business acquaintance's suggestion.I appreciate the prime location in the Gulch with a sweet patio and the reasonable drink prices, the crowd was a bit of a motley crew of characters. Don't get me wrong, not being judgy... just not quite sure if this is a spot that I feel comfy with hanging my hat here on a regular basis. I shared some appetizers which fit the role of quintessential bar grub.

reviews.name: Amber E.
reviews.review: I've frequented Bar Louie across the country and was disappointed by this location for one reason ....the service. The food is good, atmosphere is lively and energetic, crowd young and hip... it has all of the right components, but lacking in the one thing that brings together an enjoyable experience.  Our waitress kept disappointing & drinks went empty for a long period of time. We would have ordered more in the period of time if the waitress would have kept up with the table. We were trying to leave by a certain time and spent 20minutes looking for the waitress to get our check. It was just disappointing.

reviews.name: Lauren Y.
reviews.review: I'm updating my review because I've been SO impressed with the speed of service and the awesome servers my last three visits. Way to go BL!

reviews.name: Trevor W.
reviews.review: Just moved in the building upstairs.  Have to say I was impressed with the beer selection and they have a great happy hour.  The staff was very friendly and will definitely going back many times.  Great place to start off the night maybe not stay all night.

reviews.name: Natalie D.
reviews.review: Tasty bar food and drinks but slow service.

reviews.name: Jacob A.
reviews.review: This place is okay if you know you want a certain atmosphere coupled with a pretty great location. If you come in knowing that the food isn't great and the drinks aren't the best, you won't be disappointed. I've been a few times, and the real reason is generally the open air atmosphere, the great patio, and the abundance of sports on the televisions around the establishment.
