Last time I was there, there were a large number of smokers on the patio, which I understand isn't a negative to some people who want that atmosphere (and to be fair, it is a bar before it is a restaurant). I've had a few of the food options- and all were just "okay." Nothing that I couldn't have gotten elsewhere or just made at home.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: Eh. I thought this was going to be so much cooler. Sitting inside was ok.  I liked the big wrap around booth tables. Maybe, I will give it a second shot and go out in the patio area. I didn't think it was that special though...

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: I had the fun opportunity to go to the soft opening of Bar Louie this past weekend and I had a great time. Friendly staff, reasonable food prices for tasty food. Hummus appetizer was great. I hear the Voodoo Chicken is the most popular thing on the menu with the staff who got to try everything.FYI Cocktails are around ~$9 but there are beers on tap for like $4-6 and plenty of wine.Mini update: Walked by this afternoon and saw a sign for 4-7pm happy hour with $3 drinks!

reviews.name: Ashwin M.
reviews.review: Meh! If I wanted to be told that I cannot have Stella from the tap, I would stay at home.The Gulch's latest addition perked my ears, but when I realized it was only a bar chain, I was let down. The food choices are mediocre, some of the staff rude and  fewer choice of import beers IMO.

reviews.name: John R.
reviews.review: A neighborhood favorite in the Gulch.  Always a smile at the door and the bar.  Bartender are attentive and have a great variaty of specialty drinks.  There is also a good selction of beer and wine.  Ask CJ to make you a lemon drop and enjoy that sweet and tart experience.  As for food, always a great selection of bar food.  Some of my favorites are salmon sliders, meatballs, shrimp.  I also enjoy a pear salad topped with salmon.  The salads are very large and better shared.  Enjoy......Don't forget the number of TV's and drink food specials make this a great fine for game day.  Get there early however, to ensure your seat.

reviews.name: Michael M.
reviews.review: Typical. Nothing "Nashville" about this place but popular and a great bar. Food is ok but the waiters and bar staff are excellent. Fun place to hang out too.

reviews.name: Bridget S.
reviews.review: Update: I have grown to truly enjoy Bar Louie. The food has improved....ahh... the salad with salmon, meatball appetizer and more. We usually share the large salad and a couple of appetizers. My suggestion to others: sit at the bar! The bartenders are great and attentive. Otherwise the service can be slow as other reviews have stated. Con: arrive early....they tend to become quite busy on weekends and game nights.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: Great happy hour! I haven't had the food, but lots of drink and craft beer options!

reviews.name: Victoria H.
reviews.review: First time going to Bar Louie last night. Had a great time! Atmosphere was relaxing w/ candles on table. Real upscale place. Strawberry Peach Martini and app of wingz were great. Definitely looking forward to going back!

reviews.name: Kevin W.
reviews.review: This was the first Bar Louie I have ever been to and this place is pretty good. I like all the TVs on the inside and the decorations. The seating is pretty comfortable too. THe food comes in large portions and should be shared. This place has happy hours from 3-7 and 10 to close. The place can get really packed and service can slow down to a crawl. My only quip is that the service was pretty slow but it was from the staff being busy and not ignoring me so I give them le-way on that. The chicken nachos tasted great and were too much for me to finish. The happy hours are cheap drinks and half off appetizers and flatbreads. All day wednesday is $1 drafts.

reviews.name: Morgan R.
reviews.review: Unacceptable service and intolerable drinks. Myself and some friends were walking around the Gultch area and saw this bar with a fire pit out front. It was cold and we thought, "this could be fun! Let's go sit by the fire." We walked in, went to the bar, and asked the bartender, "do you guys have any specialty whiskey or bourbon drinks?" She barely looked at us and said, "nope." "Ok," I said, "is that Hudson Rye that I see?" The bartender pointed to 3 different whiskey bottles before she was able to figure out which one I was pointing at (which was actually the Hudson Rye... So, not that hard to miss) and took our orders of 2 Manhattans and the bartender said she made a good Old Fashion, so, we ordered 2 of those as well. We had to return the Manhattans because they were literally undrinkable. They tasted like she used more vermouth than bourbon. The bartender rolled her eyes as we walked back to the bar to return our drinks and was very, very unpleasant with us. The Old Fashion I ordered tasted like she poured a shot of whiskey into a glass of cherry juice with an orange slice. Had two sips and couldn't take the sweetness and overpowering taste of cherries of it so I didn't drink any more.  We left without finishing our overpriced and disgusting drinks.We walked in laughing and in high spirits and left frustrated and feeling like we had ended the night on a sour note. None of us will ever be stepping foot there again.

reviews.name: Kimberly B.
reviews.review: The best happy hour in Nashville! From 4-7 every weekday (I think?), they have $3 drafts, $4 glasses of wine (SERIOUSLY, even their $10 glasses), $5 martinis, and half off small plates. It's pretty incredible. For TWELVE DOLLARS, I got two glasses of Kim Crawford sav and a huge thing of hummus. For such a large place, it's never overly packed and always easy to hear your dining companions. It's not the most exciting place ever but is definitely universally appealing.

reviews.name: Ashley K.
reviews.review: For black potential patrons: I've been to Bar Louie several times. I've had good service and wondered why some black patrons reported poor service with the venue, until tonight. We sat at the bar. A white couple was standing behind us. A male waiter/manager/owner came over and asked the white couple if they'd been helped. (Yes, the couple standing behind us.) The couple responded with "they were here first". He didn't apologize nor ask us what we needed. A female waitress came up and asked if we'd been served. We hesitated - wondering if we should stay or leave. The male server said - you take them, Ill take them. then he again asked the white couple what they needed. I will say that the female servers were very helpful all night. But his actions did strike us as rude and racial. As a local blogger whose followers are meeting and event planners, I direct great business to my favorite Nashville businesses.  I wouldn't dare recommend a place with such inconsistent treatment of black people. It's not cool to overlook or prejudge customers in any way. All should be welcomed and well served.

reviews.name: Crystal M.
reviews.review: Absolutely amazing experience from start to finish. Host was great and told us about the establishment, waitress was most accommodating and the manager introduced himself during our visit.Food was beyond expectation and reasonably priced. And loved being able to get PBR on tap. Thanks bar Louie- we will be back!Oh-- and loved the sanitary foot bars on the restroom doors! A huge plus!

reviews.name: Jasmin M.
reviews.review: We stopped here for dinner shortly after arriving from Miami. We were a party of 4 and arrived quite hungry. The service was fast and very attentive. We ordered the chips with dips as a starter it was very good. I had the Turkey burger with rice and beans for dinner and my party ordered a cheeseburger, chicken mexican dish, and lastly my child ordered chicken fingers and fries. It was all delicious. Our waitress was very friendly and gave us great advice for site-seeing. The restaurant was nicely decorated, clean, and lastly the music was also very good. I really liked it!

reviews.name: Ian P.
reviews.review: This place refuses to show NBA games.  The bartender and hostess both told me it was corporate policy.  I asked my waitress why they didn't show NBA games (they show all other sports games) and she told me that basketball games bring in the wrong crowd.  I'm not sure how else to interpret this other than racist.  This is a discriminatory and racist restaurant and I will never go there again.  I urge others to follow the same lead.

reviews.name: Rami B.
reviews.review: Watermelon Margarita! Sooooo good! Free parking for the first hour too. If you are just wanting to try some awesome drinks! The downside was service was extremely slow, and it was completely dead.

reviews.name: Lyndi S.
reviews.review: I'm all for sitting with friends and enjoying a good beverage in a real glass.  And Bar Louie offered just that.  However, I absolutely cannot give this bar more than one star, and that star is questionable.  0.5 stars, I say, and only because of the hefty beer selection.  Let me explain...The server came over and seemed pretty nice.  Dumb, but nice.  He chatted us up, but had no clue what wines were good or what beers were on tap.  He spouted off a few fake beer names - "Um, Summerdog, and the IPA...Ale" - give me a break you liar.  I asked if he could just bring me a beer list that included real beer names, and he said they were short on the lists, but he'd go find out.  He never did, despite coming to our table twice.  Not only did he not find the list, but he purposely ignored me and refused to make eye contact so that I couldn't get his attention.  Absolutely unacceptable.I ended up going to the bar inside and grabbing a beer from the bartender, who was pretty quick and helpful.  Thanks to her, the evening didn't completely suck.Additionally, a friend of mine wanted to try a specific wine, to which he brought a sample out for her.  And then when she liked it and ordered the bottle, he explained that they didn't have any bottles left.  Explain THAT one to me????  Here's a hint: don't use a sample bottle.  What kind of classless establishment doesn't offer the customer a sample of the bottle they plan on purchasing?  Am I missing something (besides good service) here?Lastly, and most disgustingly, after all of this hoopla over the wine, the waiter brought my friend a glass that had lipstick on it.  You know what he did?  He laughed.  He wasn't shocked or disgusted, and his apology was a half-hearted "Oops."If the service wasn't so unbelievably awful, I still wouldn't go back.  The clientele was full of douchbags and douchebaguettes.  Sorry, Bar Louie.  You are officially my worst bar experience in Nashville, and maybe ever, anywhere.

reviews.name: William L.
reviews.review: From out of state and wondered in here for lunch. Food was good and the service was even better. Very friendly and helped us plan out the rest of our night.

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: The scene is pretty typical Gulch and I'm sure this place will quickly become a trendy spot for that crowd. The outdoor patio is awesome and offers up some excellent people watching. The menu is full of yummy-sounding upscale bar snacks and they have a good beer selection. But I can't lie, my first experience here was not a great one. Came during happy hour and ordered a draft beer. 14oz glass with 2" head = not-so-happy hour. Ordered second beer. This one arrived with lipstick on the rim...the hour was most definitely not happy at this point. No problems with 3rd beer, except for a bored server who kept coming over to chat with us about her new house, her job, where she's lived, etc, etc, etc. Food: Soft pretzels were really good, and parm tots were quite tasty as well.Checks came and I was a little annoyed to see that my "lipstick beer" had not been comped, but I wasn't necessarily surprised. This doesn't seem like the type of place where management cares about that sort of thing. Our server continued to talk to us as we awkwardly signed our receipts.Needless to say, I don't plan on making a second visit. A properly poured beer in a clean glass is not a hard thing to find elsewhere in town.

reviews.name: James B.
reviews.review: Let me start by saying I am typically a BIG fan of Bar Louie. I recently moved to Nashville from Cleveland, OH where there are three Bar Louies. And when I discovered there was one in Nashville, I was instantly excited. In Cleveland, Bar Louie was my "Cheers" (where everybody knows your name). Now, I will say the happy hour is great. The food is great (especially the tater-tots which are like little crack nuggets - so addictive), but the service at this location is where my issues are. Now the staff is very friendly (Shout out to Amanda K.), but there needs to be more attentiveness on their part. It took some time for service, and the place was adequately staffed and not very busy during my two visits here. it was a bit difficult to reorder drinks, and get someone's attention to do so. Now I understand that this location has been operating approximately 6 months, which I feel should be enough time to have established a cohesive team. Myself having worked in customer service industries for many years, am very aware when there is a breakdown in service.I would definitely be willing to give a higher rating is the service was more "with it." The silver lining here is, even though I wasn't impressed with  service, I will definitely be back. Overall, Bar Louie has a great chillaxing vibe, and is definitely a cool place for happy hour, or to just chill and have some good conversations with some good eats in the Gulch. I'll be back soon to see if there has been improvement!

reviews.name: Kerry P.
reviews.review: I was really surprised I was going to enjoy it this much. It reminds me of a nicer yard house. Wednesday night happened to be $1 domestics and $2 for every other drafts and they were 12 oz beers! The staff was very pleasant even though they were packed! (On a Wednesday!) yes there was a wait because they were obviously backed up at the bar do I'd recommend ordering your next drink while you're still sipping the last. Selection is great. The Martinis... Oh man. And the beer selection is amazing! The crowd.. A great mix from college students to business men. And to top it off there's half off apps and flatbreads after 10 to finish the night. I will return with friends.

reviews.name: Kate A.
reviews.review: I had an "okay" experience. The bruschetta I ordered was delish as was the Honeydew cocktail. However, it doesn't seem like anyone can get out alive (by that, I mean without paying $10+ for a cocktail) unless it's happy hour, which I'm not sure that they have (?). Great location, of course. Great patio. My experience was okay, but doesn't scream, "I must go back immediately!"

reviews.name: Jamie B.
reviews.review: I experience a lot of racism simply cos my best friend is black & it's obv I enjoy black culture, music, and style. its the equivalent I'd imagine of what an interracial relationship feels like cos I love this dude through & through right. best friend shit. anyways, last night we went to #BarLouies and they may as well have called us both the N word and walked away. despite the 30 people in there with cowboy hats, beanies, & baseball hats... the teeny tiny little puff-chest boys at the front (also both wearing kangol caps) asked us to take our beanies off if it wasn't a problem. I laughed cos obv he had to be joking, seeing as more guys in the building had hats on than didn't, but then he said he was serious. when we asked him why cowboy hats were allowed, he said cos everybody wears them. when I asked about baseball caps, he said yes as long as the bill wasn't straight. lastly, when I asked about beanies, he said ours weren't allowed because they are pom beanies (the ones w the ball on top.) also, zero black people. needless to say we gladly left but it's really weighed on my heart since. a business in Tennessee that by policy doesn't allow NBA games because "heat fans like to start fights" and singles out dress code by something as small as a pom beanie vs a regular one... Bar Louie's Nashville your policies are ignorant, outdated, & racist and your staff is equally uneducated. you can say it isn't blatant racism if you like, I'd love to hear that explanation.i posted on my facebook and then on theirs, but was immediately deleted. if you want to se the responses on mine, check them at facebook.com/jamalikai

reviews.name: Dane M.
reviews.review: The Food Here is consistently good!   Even when the bar was slammed....    Kevin the manager there did a great job of coming by to make sure my drink wasn't empty!  Amanda the bartender is sweetheart too_Great place to watch Football, get some grub, & enjoy a lively atmosphere!

reviews.name: Brittany P.
reviews.review: It's OK, but there are certainly a lot more authentic and interesting bars in Nashville. I went here because a friend knew they had half priced drinks and appetizers during happy hours. The bar has a large, modern, industrial feel. The waitress was very nice and pleasant. We ordered a bottle of wine and two appetizers, and we were served promptly. My friend found a bug floating in her first glass of wine. She notified the waitress, who was very apologetic, and took the glass and brought her a new one. I know sometimes, no matter how clean a restaurant, they can't prevent 100% of bugs. However, I was very surprised she  (or the manager) didn't offer her at least a discount, as she lost an entire glass of wine. A few minutes later, we kept seeing the same kind of bug flying around, and had to swat them away. Our appetizers were certainly good, but nothing amazing. With so many bars in Nashville full of unique character and interesting people , I don't think the 1/2 priced happy hour is worth revisiting.

reviews.name: Adrienne H.
reviews.review: I would give this less stars if possible.  This is the worst service I have had in my entire life.  When I asked to speak to the manager about our extremely poor service he didnt once apologize but instead made excuses.  I have worked in restaurants before so I understand being busy and tht it was dollar beer night but this service was so beyond unacceptable

reviews.name: Tracy T.
reviews.review: Amazing place! Best happy hour in town as far as I'm concerned. Great place to meet your friends after work, and the wait staff is awesome, always friendly. My friends always get the s'mores martini, not quite my thing but they're rave over it.

reviews.name: Kelly W.
reviews.review: Delicious food, happy servers, and a FABULOUS happy hour on Monday-Thursday with half off apps and drinks.  Best app = Hummus, Tabouli, Tzatziki, Cucumbers, and Pita.  The "Effen Good" IS an effen good martiniThe 20oz Guinness always hits the spot. And their seared tuna platter is top notch.  Did you know it's a scratch kitchen, as in EVERYTHING is made in house? Even the ranch people, and we ALL know how much Americans LOVE ranch. Go here, you won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: Marcy W.
reviews.review: Pretty solid bar with good service and surprisingly good bar food. Met the gm, Chad, he was really nice!

reviews.name: Chris W.
reviews.review: Nice atmosphere decent food

reviews.name: Kathe G.
reviews.review: I had never been to a bar Louie and usually don't get too excited about corporate chains but I loved this place and will definitely be back! My only complaint is slow service...I give them 4 stars only because their happy hour 4-7 M-F is phenomenal! Half off appetizers and $5 speciality martinis, $4 wine, and $3 drafts (not positive on the last 2--I was drinking the $5 martinis!) we got the bbq chicken flat bread- pretty good! the salmon sliders were the best!! the bacon cheeseburger sliders were also good! and The price was right! The service however was slow for a downtown corporate chain in the Gulch of all places! Each round of drinks took quite a while to get! Food (for appetizers) wasn't fast either. But we enjoyed ourself and our server was very nice! Appetizers were easily big enough to be a meal for an individual.The price was right, ill definitely be back!!

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Great Bar and the kitchen is open late for quality bar food even late!

reviews.name: Pradeep G.
reviews.review: Awsum Boneless wings...i had it with En Fuego (habanero peppers) sauce instead of the traditional Buffalo....it blew my mind off....the sauce starts off with spicing your taste buds and then when you think you are done, the lemony zing awakens you up. A MUST TRY SMALL PLATE!!!! and yes your welcome if you liked it :)Also tried the Nachos, and they come with fresh jalapenos, phew!!! SPICYYY, great eat....they need to up the ante on the beer selections, pretty good to start off with...the bar area seems to have a little too many stools cramping for room.Staff were attentive, nice n frendly...And YES...i will go there again...

reviews.name: Nicci M.
reviews.review: 6.30.12Good food, drinks and atmosphere! Upscale, classy and trendy.

reviews.name: Bret D.
reviews.review: Dined here on a nice fall day and sat outside on the patio.  I was attended by a friendly server who was well versed on the menu items.  They had just introduced a new "value lunch" menu.  It had several choices for $7.99 and I think it even included my iced tea which is a bid deal when I am used to paying anywhere from $1.50 to $2.50 for tea or Diet Coke with lunch.  I chose a fried chicken sandwich.  The server suggested going "buffalo style" so I did.  It arrived with blue cheese crumbles as well.  I got tater-tots on the side.  What is with tater-tots all of a sudden becoming the popular side? Tasted like the Publix tater tots that I feed my kids.  Definitely, nothing special about them here.  I arrived for an early lunch, 11:45 or so, and it was not crowded so I basically had a dedicated waitress.

reviews.name: Katie Y.
reviews.review: I am a fan of the happy hour and the food here. Have had almost all the appetizers, a few of the main menu items, and have yet to have a sub par meal. Trying to get in during normal dinner hours is quite the wait, but what place isn't in the Gulch area? I have come here with always more than 3 people and haven't had bad service yet. Definitely a great place so far for me.

reviews.name: Lisa V.
reviews.review: Our first outings at Bar Louie were less than stellar but we decided to be patient and give them some time to get everything rolling.  Our last few visits have been a big improvement from the first opening weeks.We've not had a bad menu item yet (well, except for the Gumbo but Gumbo is very personal, you know?), the portions are huge and I'm a big fan of the salads.  It's nice to have a place in the Gulch with just regular American food at a good price.Bar Louie is not really a place to "dine"...more like a place to have drinks, eat with friends and have a party kind of atmosphere.  Husband does like the proximity of the TV screens to the dining tables.  I do like their interior...beautiful wood and tile gives the feeling of being in Chicago.We met Chad, one of the managers, and he was a really nice, sincere guy that really wants the restaurant to be top-notch.  He especially appreciates the patronage of the locals that live in the Gulch and wants us to feel like Bar Louie is "our place".  Thanks for the meal comp, Chad :)

reviews.name: TR T.
reviews.review: Were you you planning on drinking that beer tonight?? Because it could be a while before it finally arrives...Service here is way below average. At first I chalked it up to a new restaurant and employees still figuring out what to do. But I've been to Bar Louie on several occassions since they opened, and several different times during the day both when they are busy and when the place is empty. I would say 8 out of 10 times service has been horrible. The waiters seem to be bothered from the moment you walk in the door, to the time they take your order. Someone should let many of these employees know that they work in the SERVICE INDUSTRY, which means please put on a happy face while I order my tater tots and beer.I've also had bad experiences when ordering takeout--once they put chicken on a salad for a vegetarian and another time they forgot to put the order in all together. Both times they were not apologetic.Poor service aside, Bar Louie has an awesome happy hour, the food isn't too expensive, the portions are large and it's pretty good. My food has arrived cold on a few occassions, but I blame that on the waiters not paying attention.

reviews.name: Josh K.
reviews.review: My first outing to a Big Louie.  It is new to Nashville and we had a good first experience.  Wait staff was a little slow.  Food and drinks were great.  The bar has a lot of TV's which will make for a great place to watch football, basketball, etc.

reviews.name: Kristi A.
reviews.review: By far the worst service, the worst drinks, and bland food! How hard is it to make a vodka with a splash of cranberry juice or to keep my water glass full? I have never been treated like I didn't belong somewhere before in my life and I have been to some 5 star facilities. The next time a patron tries to explain to you without being disrespectful how their experience was before you fly off the handle regarding the "appalling $1 tip plus a sad face on the receipt" LISTEN!! ALL PATRONS SHOULD BE RESPECTED by all means we all keep the doors open for you regardless of race or gender! 8 african-american men and women and we all experienced rude behavior yet we all arrived at different times!! Don't be so quick to judge those of a different race because we too hold degrees, we too have prominent positions in our careers, and we too have the financial means to pay for the items we order.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: Chapstick. Fist Pump. Pushups! Where do the people's that frequent this bar live? Because I have never seen them in the year in a half that I have lived here. Jersey Shore meets South beach. If you are reading this review and thinking, "wow this place sounds awesome!" You are in luck, because Bar Louie just opened a few weeks ago and they are looking for you! Aside from the people the service was awful. The fact that they had just opened, is no excuse. I know a lot about different kinds of beers, and when we asked the waiter what all they had, he literally started making things up. Really? So we asked him to bring us a beer menu, he said that he would try, but they were running low. How is that possible, their are a brand new bar! My girlfriend eventually got so frustrated that she got up and ordered her drink from the bar. Completely uncalled for. If you are looking for a clueless wait staff and a douche bag environment, stop on by for a nice cold made up beer. Enjoy!

reviews.name: Allan S.
reviews.review: Bar Louie was a solid experience. The "vibes" are great as each table has its own atmosphere, included a section off to the side with more of a lounge feel. The TVs are plentiful and vivid, which help to occupy the great amount of space overhead and create noise to interact with the large amounts of floor space, too.Our waiter was pretty awesome, too. I suppose he didn't have many other tables, but he would hang out with us and talk for a while each time he came by. He was frequent enough to be on the ball, but not so much as to be annoying. Good stuff!Bar Louie has a great HAPPY HOUR until 7 pm: $5 martinis$4 glasses of wine$3 draft beer &Half-priced appetizers!

reviews.name: The B.
reviews.review: I live upstairs in the same building as Bar Louis and I couldn't be happier. They enforce a dress code so there's no Rif Raf! The food is amazing and the staff is as friendly as Nashville itself. The atmosphere will appeal to a wide variety of customers. You'll love it !!!

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Awesome!  Great atmosphere.  Incredible specials.  Hot waitresses.

reviews.name: Sloane S.
reviews.review: Third trip to Bar Louie. Staff is really friendly. Bartenders are attentive. Great attention to detail and making sure everyone feels welcome. Happy Hour is a great deal: $5 martinis and the appetizers are discounted too. Nice outdoor patio, weather permitting. Food is bar food. Nothing to write home about but it does the trick. Location plays a big factor in Bar Louie's popularity. It's nice to have another choice in the Gulch!

reviews.name: Mark R.
reviews.review: Great location and great atmosphere.  Has the feel of an upscale dinner restaurant but prices are not too expensive, especially for the quality of food. Most entrees are around $10-15 and have been happy with everything I've tried so far.  Drink prices are fairly standard, not expensive but not a deal.  Service is an are I think they excel at, has been exceptional on every visit.  Favorite bartender if you get a opportunity to choose - Tammy.  She's quick and great at providing individual attention, makes you feel like a person and not a ticket.  Had frequented many locations in Nashville and this one of my preferred spots to visit for drinks and food.

reviews.name: Christopher W.
reviews.review: I've given Bar Louie two chances now and both visits they have let me down. I really want to like this place... great location, nice space, awesome patio, good ambience, but the service is some of the worst I've experienced in Nashville. Both times I've been there I was seated on the patio and after many minutes had to flag down someone, anyone to get some service. The last visit was highlighted by the server bringing the bottle of wine to the table already opened and she neglected to even pour anyones glass. I realize this isn't a high end steak place but come on. Food is good and priced pretty cheap and it's a cool spot to hang, I guess that's really the only reason I might go back again.

reviews.name: Cynthia F.
reviews.review: The whiskey cake for dessert is so yummy, we went 2 nights in a row for it.  Ordered the hummus/tapinade/tsatsiki trio.   The tsatsiki was my favorite of the three; the tapinade and hummus were a bit too salty for my taste.  Our waiter was eager to please, very knowledgeable regarding the menu and very nice, but a bit forgetful when we asked him for a fork. We ended up taking a fork from a nearby table.

reviews.name: restaurant r.
reviews.review: wow..what a difference a year makes!!  We went in tonight...party of 6...with a celebrity..and had a waiter named Jacob...he was more than frazzled!!!!  everything was going ok until our food came...he gave my order to someone else who started eating it and 5 minutes later his food came so Jacob(the waiter) just pushed my food over to me-  the guy had been picking at!!!  I was completely disgusted!  Then to top off the experience- he put their order on my tab!!  I left the table to see him in private because I could see the couple next to me had their credit card down for their portion of the bill and he said he would just remove their food from our tab..but NOOOOO here comes a manager with him and they made a huge deal about the food (ps less than $20) on our bill and explained to the couple there was a mistake by the waiter.  Also, our friend ordered a sandwich and asked for something specific and it came out wrong- not the waiters fault- but still wrong..ps the waiter tried to say that the sandwich always comes that way but I actually heard my friend order and ask if it had cheddar cheese and that same waiter said yes thats the cheese...guess what it was blue cheese - maybe he should know the menu before he says anything to people ordering!! and maybe Jacob the waiter should be in training a few more weeks before they let him serve people and hand out bills!!  NEVER EVER WILL WE BE BACK!! A huge mess up from food to the bill!!  A customer nightmare!!

reviews.name: Exquisite C.
reviews.review: I attended a friends birthday, who was so very excited to have share the evening with her friends at Bar Louie. Unfortunately the restaurant told us they had lost the reservation? I am not sure how a restaurant losses reservations, but they did. We where all left to stand in the door way for over 40 minutes, until somebody decided to say something. The management reacted by buying us all a drink, which was nice. We had to wait over an hour before we where sat at a make shift table, which was three round tables placed together. This was most uncomfortable and inconvenient. The restaurant was obviously under staffed, and for a Saturday evening was a very poor show. The young ladies did everything they could to take care of us, but as they also had many other customers, the evening went from bad to worse! The manager seemed more interested in a pretty blond lady sat over in his bar area. The food order was a mess, incorrect food coming out, food orders wrong, everybody eating at different times. I actually did not eat, as my friends told me how poor the quality of the food was. Such a shame that the management of this new restaurant is so bad, as the place itself looks nice. I would recommend Bar Louie as a stop by for a drink, as long as you are not too thirsty, it will take a while for them to take your order, and then deliver it

reviews.name: Will D.
reviews.review: Went here opening week. Great first impression. Restaurant is centered around a huge bar which has 40 beers on tap. Happy hour 4-7 mon-fri, $3 beers, $4 wine, $5 martinis and half off apps. Awesome deal! Staff was extremely friendly and seemed pretty knowledgeable for first week. Hummus plate and calamari both really good, haven't tried main courses. Definitely more of a bar/party atmosphere than family restaurant which is exactly what the gulch needed. Really nice patio which completely opens on to inside bar area.  Upscale feel overall, except pretty awful green color scheme on wall. And good prices. Great addition to the neighborhood.

reviews.name: Lisa S.
reviews.review: late afternoon sunday welcomed by Tammy the pink hair streaked barkeep. frosty PBR and plotting the evening in Nashville. cute, mixed crowd; lotsa screens for sports and expansive beer picks. chicken nachos to kick off the evening!

reviews.name: Scott N.
reviews.review: I am not a hug Chinese food fan, but I have found the ONLY place I will go again. The service was fantastic, the woman at the counter was so upbeat, so happy, she smiled the whole time, said please and thank you and was such a nice lady. The food was very good, and hot and fresh. I drove here for takeout, then drove back to my home in Lavergne...the food was still piping hot.If you want Chinese takeout...this is the spot

reviews.name: Ray P.
reviews.review: Best chinese food in Antioch.  I love their steamed dumplings.  They don't deliver but you can order online and pick it up.

reviews.name: Jason H.
reviews.review: Food is so good, I go every weekend. The House Special Mei Fun is excellent!!!!! I also love their chicken on a stick!

reviews.name: Ivan G.
reviews.review: As you could see from the photos, this place is somewhat a hole in the wall compared to the size of the plaza. But, for the second time in the day, I was surprised by how good Asian food is in Nashville. We got the House Special Fried Rice, House Special Lo Mein, General Tso's Chicken and BBQ Ribs. This is the tastiest General Tso's I've had so far; the sauce is just perfect. Typically when I eat General Tso's Chicken, the sauce is either too sweet or too strong such that it's really good the first couple of bites, and the next ones become really hard to swallow. Not the case with this restaurant. Fried noodles and rice were also fantastic. It's great for take away but not good for dine in. The place fits probably only about 20 people. Call ahead before coming to save time. Also good service from the lady at the cashier. I wish them well in their business!

reviews.name: Sid N.
reviews.review: If Chinese take-out is your thing then you will love Chopstick House is the place to go in Antioch. It has all the kitschy red Chinese ornaments that all suburban hearts desire. The service is fast and efficient. They have an online ordering system which works great! I ordered my favorite items: chicken lo me in and General Tso's chicken. Both tasted great! The General Tso's was crispy without being greasy, and was smothered in a mildly spicy sauce. The lo mein was fresh and flavorful.Prices are very reasonable!

reviews.name: Katelin B.
reviews.review: This is my go to Chinese takeout place. You can order online and it's ready to go when I get there. Staff is friendly, food is what you would expect. Tons of food for the price. I do wish that they would do delivery, but overall it's worth the drive.

reviews.name: Travis T.
reviews.review: Brand new Chinese place by the Publix in Mt. View Marketplace. I am writing this review on the night of their grand opening (Nov 3, 2014).There are several tables here for eating in, or you can carry out. They also offer delivery within 3 miles of their location, with a $10 minimum order.I ordered chicken lo-mein with an egg roll, and my wife ordered vegetable lo-mein. What can I say? It's a nice, locally owned Chinese place. Food was good for the price, and for what I expected. Better than several other similar places in the area.

reviews.name: Howard L.
reviews.review: Hands down the best chinese in the area and possibly my favorite right now in the city.  I get take out when I'm in the area and I am always pleased with what I order. They use fresh ingredients and leave out the parts that are meant to be left out - I can't tell you how many times I've been served parts of the celery, onion and carrot that should have been thrown away at other local chinese places - Chopstick House has no such issues. Their pricing is also very competitive, especially if you order shrimp dishes. Shrimp main courses feature decently sized shrimp - they use small shrimp for fried rice, lo mein and mei fun. I also think they fry their food well - egg rolls aren't soggy with grease, fried chicken dishes are made to order and not pre-fried.I have one gripe: I am not a fan of their spice scale. They do tend towards the bland side of spicy, which means you should request more spice if you're into it. I don't blame them, I blame Nashville for that one. Totally recommended for take-out Chinese. Also, they have Chinese style sweet tea, which is syrupy sweet and delicious. Try it.

reviews.name: Steve S.
reviews.review: If you're looking for a great local area place to get some Chinese food, this place is great. I tend to move a lot and when I find that local Chinese food that's good, I will go back and this place is the one place I will def. make my Chinese food crave place to eat.There are so many places that look the same and even have the same looking building and menu setup. But its all in the taste. Each cook is different and some can be bland, but this place has full flavor in their food. I love the fried dumplings and they have really tasty egg rolls and spring rolls. Other places I've tried you can tell it was frozen or they just had the food sitting out.This place cooks to order on the spot. It only takes less than 10min if you walk in to order. But you always call ahead of time. Very big menu and their lunch specials is cheap and great portion size.For fast food you can pick Panda Express or a mom and pops family based place. I prefer the family based home cooking kind of food!

reviews.name: Olivier D.
reviews.review: This certainly the better Chinese take out in town. Good food, good pricing and very friendly service. Lunch specials are cheap 5.25-5.75$. I can easily become a regular.

reviews.name: Joey S.
reviews.review: This place is delish! Very clean and the staff is very friendly. The combos come with plenty of food for an inexpensive price. I will be a regular!

reviews.name: Jonathan M.
reviews.review: Ordered take out for the first time tonight.  Everything was wonderful. The house special lo mein was very tasty I had no complaints at all. On the phone they were very friendly and said it would be ready in 15 minutes.....wow that's fast in my book.The location is very clean and they seem to have a well working system of operation. Will be ordering again soon. I'm unsure if they have delivery or not.

reviews.name: Phillip F.
reviews.review: Fast, friendly, delicious!!! Welcome to the neighborhood!!!Standard American Chinese dishes. Made quickly, served hot, and yummy! Been here twice since they opened a couple weeks ago. Dining in is available, I think they have 8-10 booths, similar to a burger joint. No tables and chairs. It would make a great lunch stop, it's a relatively small place. Egg rolls are great, you can tell they are made with fresh ingredients. Not greasy, or mushy. The chicken batter is crispy, not soggy. Prices are relatively low compared to other Chinese restaurants in the area, but does not limit the quality.

reviews.name: Erik W.
reviews.review: So, we ventured out yet again to try to find some quality Chinese tonight. ..and we scored. I had the sweet and sour chicken  combo with fried rice and vegetables. Clearly  the best ive ever had. The batter on the chicken was excellent and the seasoning as well as the cook was spot on. The rice was the absolute best of any Chinese restaurant I've ever had. Specifically the seasoning was perfect as well as the texture. I was extremely impressed. Hope this was not a fluke. In addition i got to try the chicken lowmanin and it was spot on. I don't typically write reviews, but this one deserves a thumbs up. In summary whoever cooked tonight knows whats up.....Thanks!!!!, nice to not be be disappointed after a ordering takeout.Keep  up the good work! !!!!  I'll be back for sure.

reviews.name: China R.
reviews.review: I Love This Place...Everything Is Always Served Fresh And Tasty. The Best Clean Chinese Place To Me In The Nashville/Antioch Area.

reviews.name: Joanna F.
reviews.review: I've been coming here from the first day they opened. I'm from New York City and used to frequent Chinatown. Chopstick House is hands down the best in all of Nashville. They will also accommodate special orders. And lucky me, they're only a five minute drive away!

reviews.name: Sarah K.
reviews.review: Great food! Ordered pork mei fun, beef & broccoli, and kung pao chicken last night for delivery. Food arrived in 45 minutes, just as promised. They're only a few miles away but delivery is fun. :) Everything tasted delicious and the food wasn't drowning in sauce which is always nice for takeout Chinese food. Prices were reasonable too. Great food--we will be back!

reviews.name: Dan D.
reviews.review: well worth the drive for some good take out!

reviews.name: Maddie M.
reviews.review: This is my favorite restaurant in all of Nashville. That's right- not just Bellevue, but Nashville! Their chunky avocado salad is by far the best salad I've ever eaten. I can never decide what to get because everything is so good. I usually end up getting the luau sandwhich and I'm never disappointed. The staff is so friendly and the food is always instagrammable. The prices are great and it's always hard to leave without buying a lemon square. I hope to see this restaurant around for a long time!

reviews.name: Leighton B.
reviews.review: Crumb de la Crumb is simply a delightful place, and it's hands down my favorite restaurant in Bellevue. The staff is friendly and the food is good and fresh. Their dining area is cheerful and the assortment of mismatched chairs makes the place all the more charming. It's also great spot to do work and they have free wifi.I recently ordered the East Nashville, which is a fried egg, goat cheese, avocado and bacon on flax bread, with a side of . I've also had the French toast with raspberry and goat cheese (yes, I'm a goat cheese addict) but I wasn't super wow-ed by it. I've only been for breakfast but hoping to go back for lunch soon!

reviews.name: Sara T.
reviews.review: LOVE the food at Crumb de la Crumb. For lunch my favorites are the chicken salad sandwich and the Dressed Avocado Salad. They are both so fresh, and great size portions. Also the breakfast here is great. Love the menu and the food is always good.The only thing I could even complain about at all- is the service. It is a little slow. But since the food is so good, I still eat here very often.

reviews.name: Craig R.
reviews.review: This is an amazing place for lunch.  I think this is probably the best crab cake i have had since my last trip to Maryland.  The brownie and the pies are delicious.

reviews.name: Jeffrey L.
reviews.review: Not crazy about the atmosphere, but the food was very good. If you want a great tasting lunch with semi-healthy choices, this is your place.

reviews.name: Mike M.
reviews.review: Crumb de la Crumb is my favorite restaurant in Bellevue! The hospitality and warmth of the servant's hearts is felt as soon as you walk in the door. And the food is to die for. It's amazing what you can do tucked into a little nook in the heart of Bellevue. Trust me, it's worth discovering.

reviews.name: Tyler B.
reviews.review: I went to Crumb de la Crumb today for lunch with a friend. I got the vanilla bean lemonade. It's quite unique! They brought out a few ritz crackers and a small cheese and pecan ball covered with jam for an appetizer. It was really good. I ordered the ultimate grilled cheese (bacon and pimento cheese on whole grain bread) and the lemon artichoke soup for my entree. I'm really picky about bacon. I like it to be really crispy. I told the server this and debated on whether or not I should just order the plain pimento cheese sandwich without bacon so I could avoid disappointment. The server mentioned that the bacon is pre-cooked but that they could "nuke" it to make it crispy. When my meal came out, the bacon was floppy... The server asked if it was crispy enough as I was picking it off the sandwich. I told her it wasn't, and she offered to have them "nuke" it again, but I told her I didn't want to have to wait to eat my meal. She said, "Ok. Let me know if you change your mind. You're paying for the bacon." Not really sure why she couldn't just charge me for the regular pimento cheese sandwich since that's what I ended up eating, but I wasn't going to argue over a couple dollars. The pimento cheese is homemade, and it is divine! The lemon artichoke soup was so-so. I saw several other things on the menu I wanted to try and the atmosphere is nice, so I am going to go back again. Maybe I just didn't order the right thing this time.

reviews.name: Jamie D.
reviews.review: I can't overstate how much I love Crumb De La Crumb's cafe. This is my go-to, absolute favorite lunch spot in all of Tennessee. I live in Mt Juliet but travel the 30 miles to Bellevue to indulge in the delightful fare. My personal favorite? Charleston She Crab soup and chicken salad on a croissant. Heaven I tell you, heaven! If you haven't checked this place out yet, you're seriously missing out. Go now!!Reason for an imperfect review: Two things.1. The check out process is usually very time consuming. I normally wait 5-10 minutes in line before being able to pay my bill and leave. You have to go up front and pay which is fine but usually, the patrons in line are slowly picking out different desserts to purchase at the same time. There's only one cashier, usually the same lady. I don't know her name but she always seems down or unhappy. Which is always frustrating because the servers are usually very sweet and helpful. 2. I wrote a review several years ago on their old Yelp name "The Cottage Cafe", but they have since changed their official name to Crumb De La Crumb to keep in sync with the dessert side of their business. Maybe I've always had bad luck with the desserts but I've tried many of the bars and cupcakes and always found a serious fault with them. For instance, a red velvet cupcake I had was extremely dry (like it had been baked a few days before) and the icing wasn't as sweet as you'd hope for a cream cheese icing. TL;DR The cafe side is phenomenal but the check-out process and desserts are lacking.

reviews.name: SG P.
reviews.review: Totally delicious ! So glad we stopped in Bellevue and looked this place up. Everything was so good, service great, priced well. The place is decorated very well. Will be stopping next time through Nashville.

reviews.name: Lisa W.
reviews.review: Excellent food!  Everything was delicious and service was wonderful!  I especially liked the "swing/big band" music and the sunflowers on the tables.  Such a happy place!

reviews.name: Elizabeth C.
reviews.review: Very good food and the atmosphere is fun and different.  Perfect for a bridal luncheon or brunch!

reviews.name: Charline H.
reviews.review: HA! You thought you could hide this from me Bellevue. A friend of mine suggested we come here for lunch on Saturday and I'm so excited to know about this delightful breakfast/lunch café in West Nashville. Crumb de la Crumb (formerly The Cottage Café) would be great for bridal luncheons, showers, or just lady's lunch.We enjoyed every bite of our meal. Highlights would be the Berried Bird hot sandwich and Charleston She Crab soup. I know what you're thinking, Charleston She Crab in Nashville, but with one bite I was transported to South Carolina. The menu offers endless soup, salad, and cold/hot sandwich combinations. They serve healthy local options (large amount of gluten free) and sinful desserts for those with a sweet tooth.Another positive: they keep it local (7+ Mid-TN vendors). So go do your part, grab some brunch and keep it local!

reviews.name: Lizzie P.
reviews.review: Crumb De La Crumb was average at best. They bring out a pimento cheese with strawberry jam to be served with ritz crackers. (I honestly only associate Ritz with toddlers and cheese cubes at the park), I order a cappuccino that was actually a latte, and the shots had died (so they were bitter and pungent) it wasn't a smooth drink the way a cappuccino should be. I ordered one of the French toasts with goat cheese and jam. It sounded decadent. It was the least impressive thing I ordered. The toast was soggy as if the griddle wasn't hot enough and there was a gross amount of cheese and jelly. The jam also tasted like it came straight out of a smuckers jar. Over all, if I had payed $5 for this email instead of $16+ tip, I would have been ok. I paid too much money for a meal I could have gotten much better else where.

reviews.name: Sidney G.
reviews.review: It's amazing to have fresh food options in this area. The menu has lots of fresh and local ingredients. Breakfast, salads, hot and cold sandwiches, soups, and a delicious looking Mac and cheese. They also have a wide variety of coffee and teas. The only thing better than the food are the charming owners who play an active roll with their diners. They share their vision and hope for the restaurant and their wedding cake business too. I also hear they have a variety of events with live music and some stand out musicians that will be on their upcoming schedule. I'm enjoying a gluten free lemon square from there as I write this review! I will return and you should check it out!

reviews.name: Sarah K.
reviews.review: Great local cafe! Similar to panera (but a little more expensive and a little slower, but they do make their food fresh so that's always good.) They have an extensive menu. We enjoyed paninis for dinner, then decided to get dessert. The paninis were great and our chocolate croissant was good (but not amazing). It was fresh though, and they heated it up for us and brought it to our table with two forks. A nice touch! We wish they had wifi though.

reviews.name: Stephanie H.
reviews.review: Found this place on the way to Nashville through Yelp. The reviews definitely all tell the story. We went for brunch on Saturday morning but couldn't resist the 5 Cheese Mac n Chz. What better way to start your day than a M&C appetizer lol It didn't disappoint. We also had a RazzMaTazz French Toast and the German Pancake! Wow! Perfect brunch. Great flavors and portions that won't leave you hungry.

reviews.name: Mistye A.
reviews.review: Great service. Go in a few times & they will recognize you. Always nice to feel welcomed. Never had a bad experience. My favorites are: berried bird sandwich on GF bread, pear salad, lemon artichoke soup & the vanilla bean lemonade is a must. Enjoy. Oh...on Saturdays they have live jazz.

reviews.name: Holly M.
reviews.review: Take your mom here. Even my husband loved this place. Every bite was savory and full of flavor! I got the trio - lemon artichoke soup, citrus salad (my favorite), and pimento cheese! My husband had the French dip and citrus salad. We also got the maple bacon cake that was perfection. And I loved the vanilla bean lemonade - refreshing and not overpowering. I usually don't even write yelp reviews, but more people need to know about this place! It's a hidden gem!

reviews.name: Kim P.
reviews.review: Best breakfast place is Bellevue!

reviews.name: Karri S.
reviews.review: I haven't had a soup that wasn't delicious! we love going for jazz brunch on Sunday's. I always start with a chai, which is just mediocre but fits the mood. I always get a half sandwich and soup, because again their soup rocks. I wish there was more hot sandwich options or that you could create your own. surprisingly, even though they pride themselves on being a bakery, their dessert is hit or miss! but the carrot cake is 2nd best in Nashville and you can't go wrong with it! so good! I really wish they stayed open for dinner during the week and were open on Sunday for brunch!

reviews.name: Elizabeth R.
reviews.review: Cute restaurant.

reviews.name: Kristin H.
reviews.review: I brought my mom here for breakfast. We were hesitant at first, but loved our meals. The menu wasn't big or overly complex, but we both had a hard time deciding because so much sounded good. The staff was kind and helpful, but in no rush- I enjoyed that though. I got the east Nashville sandwich (2 slices of delicious last, local bacon, two eggs, avocado, and goat cheese). The portions are exactly how I'd make it at home- they didn't skimp on the best parts- avocado and cheese. The avocado was perfectly ripe and had a small amount of salt on top to accentuate the flavor. Mmmmm. My mom got the French toast and loved hers too. I left wanting to go back for lunch. I'm excited this restaurant is in Bellevue and am kicking myself for not going sooner!!

reviews.name: Alex. B.
reviews.review: Cozy, very good food even though it's gluten free!!!  Friendly staff, lots of smiles.

reviews.name: Ashley S.
reviews.review: Everything here is southern and delicious!!!The lavendar lemonade - sounds strange but once you try it you will never want a different summer beverage!The pimento, chicken salad, she crab soup, ANY off the cakes - so wonderful!Great place for lunch and I cant believe it's in Bellevue. Love this place!!!

reviews.name: Katie M.
reviews.review: Quality, fresh, amazing food! Staff is friendly and greets you. I contemplated on if I was going to do a review, I wanted to be selfish and not share my new favorite restaurant. The foods is so phenomenal I have to share!The Charleston She Crab is made with real crab! Only served Thursday-Saturday.  I take home a quart of to make sure I get my fix. It is so good. The Chicken salad is so fresh and tasty. I also get a quart of this to take home. Order early enough, they do run out. I take home two to three different desserts. Good luck on deciding just one!Very charming atmosphere. You will not be disappointed!

reviews.name: Emily P.
reviews.review: To date, most of the time I've spent on Yelp has involved perusing other people's reviews and hunting down new places to eat/drink.  That being said, after visiting this place I knew I had to write my first review.  To describe my experience with Crumb de la Crumb in a word: Delightful.  I stopped by on the earlier side of lunch hour today to place a takeout order: --Citrus, Spinach & Goat Cheese Salad, with Grilled Chicken:  I think this is the most excited I've ever gotten over a salad.  The spinach was crisp, and the cranberry-cinnamon-crusted goat cheese was delicious. The chicken on the salad was beautifully seasoned - it was tender and flavorful, but the flavor wasn't so strong that it distracts you from the other flavors in the salad.  And whatever they do to make that cranberry-orange vinaigrette... it's heavenly. --The vanilla lemonade was refreshing, and not overly sweet.  A perfect drink for spring/summer.Overall, I was very pleased with my lunch, and with the friendly owners as well - Jason and his wife Lorrie.  While waiting on my order (which didn't take long), Jason explained how everything at Crumb de la Crumb is made by hand... from the frosting to the salad dressings to the lemonade.  My only regret is not trying any of the baked goods that were calling my name from within the display case.  I'm currently watching what I eat because of an upcoming trip to the beach, but you better believe I'll be back for lunch again soon, and will have to try some of the desserts then... hopefully it will be on one of the days they have live music in the dining room!

reviews.name: Brian F.
reviews.review: My wife and I enjoyed a great late afternoon lunch. We both ordered the Vanilla Bean Lemonade, which was very good. Lunch included a chicken salad sandwich and pimento cheese sandwhich; both of which were excellent. Service is friendly and helpful. The ambience is relaxing and enjoyable. We live in the area and it's great to find another local restaurant to support. If you enjoy the City Limits in Bellevue, then try this restaurant out too.

reviews.name: Laura W.
reviews.review: The lemon artichoke soup is to die for. I highly recommend the Lieper's Fork for breakfast it is delicious and you'll have enough to take home. They have a really great selection of hot teas. Don't bother trying to find parking, use the valet and save yourself a major headache.

reviews.name: Nancy T.
reviews.review: Best French Dip ever!! East Nashville breakfast uniquely mouthwatering!  Vanilla lemonade is dreamy! My favorite new restaurant. .....in Nashville!  Who'd have thought. ....in Bellevue! !:)

reviews.name: Patti M.
reviews.review: I was so happy to find this place when I moved here a year ago! The food is exceptional and fresh the people and service is outstanding.  They keep improving on what they have, they've expanded the facility, added brunch and music wonderful!  The bakery is fabulous including the gluten free amazing options.  I've brought several people here who now love it as I do! Thank you Cottage Cafe/Crumb de la Crumb for being so good at what you do serving healthy options with great people and offering decadent deserts!!

reviews.name: Lisa D.
reviews.review: This is our happy place for lunch. Go on the weekend and enjoy the wonderful piano backdrop. Consistently scrumptious food. My favorite iced tea ever. Highlights include the cheddar jam appetizer, the Maryland She-Crab soup, melt in your mouth crab cakes, welcoming lovely atmosphere.

reviews.name: Mary E.
reviews.review: I wish I could write a review on the food, but after two visits we still have not had anything. The first time I stopped by their credit card machine was down and we didn't have any cash. Not a big deal, right? We'll just stop by another time. On my second visit there we waited in the packed out lobby of the bakery for 10 minutes. The line hadn't moved a single bit and no one came to seat us. If we're feeling up for a third visit maybe we'll get lucky and finally get to try this food everyone talks about.

reviews.name: Megan H.
reviews.review: I'm giving it 4 stars only because it feels snobby in there....the manager or owner who greeted us seemed unwelcoming and snobby. However, the waitress was great, the food was amazing, and tea menu will have me coming back! Parking is an awkward problem.

reviews.name: A S.
reviews.review: Food was good service was terrible. Our waiter dropped off our drinks - coffee with cream and water. Food came out and he never returned to check on us. We had to flag him down for napkins, some jelly (which we found cost .75 for a teaspoon size amt) and coffee refills.  Never brought more cream or asked how our meal was. In addition he never brought out the muffin we ordered.  When it was brought to the attention of management I was told that I shouldn't judge it on one bad experience. Not an apology for the service which was disappointing. If you are ok with bad service I recommend it. Otherwise, steer clear. There are many other options for brunch in Nashville where food is amazing and service is top notch.

reviews.name: Gayle R.
reviews.review: The food is good but the attitude of the owner (wife) stinks. Folks around these parts are so friendly and polite... So her rudeness stands out like a sore thumb. She has no idea what customer service means. I'd give the cakes a miss. They taste dry and as if they have been frozen. Due to the rude owner and lousy cake, I'm no longer a customer.

reviews.name: Stan H.
reviews.review: A family favorite. Great Vanilla Bean Lemonade and Fruit Tea. I love the Ultimate Grilled Cheese. The Tomato Basil soup is the best.

reviews.name: Elizabeth M.
reviews.review: I. Adore. This. Place. Every food item I've tried has been amazing. Their peanut butter cake is insanely good. I love the razzatazz French toast. I love the sausage and cream cheese quiche. I love the ambiance. I love it love it love it!!

reviews.name: Ken J.
reviews.review: Vanilla bean lemonade was interesting, but I probably would not do that again. Cheese and cracker plate as an appetizer was very good.   Mac and cheese appetizer had some interesting flavors but seriously needed more moisture.  Lemon artichoke soup was cooked to the point it lost a lot of identity and tasted like a vegetable soup. Those that like a great lemon Greek style soup, this isn't it. Chunky avacado salad was light and excellent. My favorite thing I ate. Crab cake had good lump crab, but a bit too much breading. Chicken salad was good without being remarkable. The live jazz was a nice touch. Overall, pretty good.  Flavors were pretty deep and developed everywhere except in the soup. I'll try something here again.

reviews.name: Susan S.
reviews.review: Love their lemonade but it's too expensive to go regularly. Food was okay but nothing exceptional.

reviews.name: Jason P.
reviews.review: My wife and kids eat here a lot so I had lunch with them and it was great! Great food and drinks. Had the crab cake sandwich which was excellent.

reviews.name: Libby P.
reviews.review: The lemon artichoke soup is fabulous and I love both their chicken salad and pimento cheese.  But I especially love their cakes.  They are fairly large and serve a number of people.  Whenever I have to take a cake to a party/event I pick one of these up and everyone raves about it.

reviews.name: Sarah B.
reviews.review: Best food in Bellevue!  High quality, good portions and reasonable prices!  Highly recommend this cafe :)

reviews.name: Henry S.
reviews.review: Very stupid. Ten empty tables and we have to wait in small lobby waiting for our forth party. Waited 25 min. This is stupid.

reviews.name: Juliana E.
reviews.review: i"m happy to say there is a delicious, gluten free, local food restaurant in Bellevue! i'll be back! roasted turkey, cranberries, toasted almonds and local goat cheese with lemon artichoke soup. delicious!

reviews.name: Corey L.
reviews.review: I have gone here for many years (before the move to East Nashville) and the food has always been top notch, and the service has always been friendly.For someone with gluten allergies (like me) this place is a god send. But making gluten free delicious isn't easy, and they pull it off in spades.Even those without gluten allergies/sensitivities will enjoy this menu. I highly recommend the Cuban sandwich on the baguette  for first timers.

reviews.name: Blair M.
reviews.review: 1 star for being there, let me say this upfront I will never go here again!22.00 for a shrimp entrée that look like my 12 year old son or daughter could have prepared on their own with 5 minutes of suggestions.Yes the curried flavored quinoa was niceBut the ever so small frozen shrimp were ridiculous, and the sprinkling of 1 to 2 table spoons of black beans were very sad along with the slivers of mango.Bread was extra, and no vegetables.Next time save your money and go to Olive Garden.And have a feast for 22.00 plus tax and the waitress want have such an attitude, and ask do you need change, my guest used cash.Very sad!

reviews.name: Ron B.
reviews.review: Trying to feed a vegan and a gluten-free person along with someone who can eat whatever isn't always the easiest so I was glad when I stumbled upon AMOT. It's just the prettiest little venue with both indoor and outdoor seating, a bar (with TVs) and really lovely staff who are warm. I ordered the fried chicken only for the novelty and it was well prepared but I thought the seasoning was lacking. My friends enjoyed their own dishes as well and cleaned their plates. Fantastic variety of wines and beers and another reason we chose the place.But really the decor and just the lighting and everything made this place Grade A. I'd probably eat something else the next time, but most certainly a must visit on another Nashville trip.

reviews.name: Adam B.
reviews.review: This is a very fun place with a great setting and very friendly staff.  The food is best described as sophisticated bar food, but good and affordable.  They also have some more sophisticated options.  Overall, it was a great experience.

reviews.name: Tiffany M.
reviews.review: A great place for those who are gluten free to enjoy dishes they may not normally be able to indulge in. I am not gluten free, but we attended a birthday get together here. We were a little apprehensive about the food, wondering if it would taste odd or not, but, honestly, everything was really good. The bar staff were great. The server was very nice. The menu is clear about what comes in each dish and states that they're willing to accommodate any changes you wish to make. It was really nice. Most of our table ordered the pizza because it sounded really good. I had that as well and added chicken. I'm not sure what I expected from a gluten free pizza, but it was very good and the chicken was grilled wonderfully. The decor was classy and clean. I loved the lighting and all of the signs and hand written art on the walls. It was a cozy as welcoming environment. There was a gluten free cake served for the birthday girl and it was also amazing. I'm not sure if the cake was made there or not though.

reviews.name: Cara C.
reviews.review: Wonderful meal and wine! In town visiting friends in East Nashville, they suggested this cool restaurant. Our server was friendly, appetizers were awesome and food was filling. We had delightful truffle desserts. I loved the inside. The crisp and clean white was welcoming and open. Enjoy!

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: I wanted to try this place for the longest time and finally got a chance to. The interior is decorated so nice. Really well done. The colors and furnishings are all fresh and new. This was "on a whim" - I just waltzed in by myself. They said they didn't have any tables so I opted to sit at the bar. I got the Buttermilk Fried Chicken topped with pesto, served with roasted garlic mashed potatoes and a seasonal vegetable garnish. I don't remember what she said the vegetable was but it was a leafy green delicious leaf that was underneath. It had veins of red in it. I was waiting for a very long time. I know it takes a while for greatness. It must have been about 45-50 minutes and the bartender said she would buy my next drink for free. I opted for a cucumber soda. I thought this gesture was very nice! The chicken was delicious. Everything was delicious. I really loved the personal attention given to me by the bartender. I don't blame them for the time it took.

reviews.name: Emily T.
reviews.review: I wanted to like it. I tried. Everything was bizarre. My dads salad was way over seasoned. A salad. Yes. My risotto was gloop and under seasoned. My $5 plate of seasonal veggies consisted of a minuscule amount of raw kale. My Celiac sister liked the fried chicken and appreciated that she didn't have to ask if anything was GF. My moms salmon was ok. The tomato soup tastes like marinara sauce. The wait staff was kind but over attentive. People were constantly hovering at our table asking how we liked things and if we thought it was good. When we brought the salad issue to the waitress' attention she called another woman over but never introduced her. Maybe the owner or manager? She apologized profusely and said she would take care of it. Apparently that meant bringing us cake. They also said the cake was for my moms birthday. Unfortunately, that was dry and the buttercream frosting just tasted like butter. We did not have the heart to say everything was bad. The unidentified woman in charge timidly watched us and the other diners - looking for approval. It was a nice try. They need to work out their kinks in the kitchen and have a little confidence.

reviews.name: David G.
reviews.review: 100% gluten free --- the entire menu! Sign up the troupe of characters that includes the Celiac and let's schedule a night out on the town!The space:The space while small, is quite nice, quite open concept, and had it not been the dead of winter then I think we would have asked to sit outside on their deck which was cordoned off from the restaurant by glass garage doors. I really enjoyed the cute little reclaimed wooden frames scattered throughout with glass inside and then hand written words on the glass (that can be changed all the time). There were also two old either barn doors or sliding wooden doors at the back of the restaurant with motivational phrases written in chalk across the doors.Sign me up for some positivity.The food:Appetizer: The spinach and artichoke dip nachos. Concept lost upon you? That's okay. Just think about it for a second. Normally, when you get spinach and artichoke dip, you also get bread or chips to dip into it. Well, Matter of Taste has taken care of that for you and drizzled the glorious cheesy mixture atop the chips for you. Main courses:The risotto of the day: scallops, steak (filet mignon), and creamy and rich garlic and cheese risotto. Scallops were cooked to perfection, and were not chewy and overcooked - a common mistake in this beautiful yet landlocked state. The steak cooked medium-rare to perfection and savory on the way down the gullet.The cuban sandwich: chocked full of meat and the right amount of mustard and pickle. Just try and stop yourself from double fisting each half. Served with salted/peppered potato chips (I didn't have the side of potato chips since I had nachos to start --- chip overload on the part of our ordering).The build your own margherita pizza with currant tomato sauce, onions, and cheese. The little dude is 50/50 when we add meat so we just got it plain old margherita pizza. I tasted half a piece and the crust was quite good for GF pizza crust and the currants added a nice flavor to the sauce. Plus, it was a sizable offering of pizza -- I'd got with between 8 - 10" as my guess. The menu might have said but I have forgotten. Dessert: a GF blondie served with strawberries, blueberries, and homemade whipped cream. Okay, so the first one that came out to us had some aluminum foil still baked into it. Oops! Bit of a snafu. We sent it back. The second was sans aluminum foil, and the one bite I had was delicious and tasted like a traditional blondie. I would say the dessert was not meant to share, but we didn't want much so we all shared.

reviews.name: Lindsay M.
reviews.review: Never anything less than stellar. My mother and I have made AMOT our go-to for dinner on a regular basis. Neither of us have issues with gluten, so we tend to avoid the GF breads here as we don't like the taste. Plenty of options for GF or otherwise. Everything is always extremely fresh and well prepared. I always order the salmon with extra bok choy. My mother tends to jump around the menu and try different things. The filet and risotto have always been great. The service is spectacular and they are never annoyed if you want to modify what you're ordering. The ONLY "complaint" that I have is that the alcohol selection is lacking. We usually start next door at The Local Taco for cocktails then venture to AMOT for a nice dinner. Perfect combo!

reviews.name: Sarah N.
reviews.review: Prices are too high for the quality of food. Waited 35 minutes for a cheese tray. Will  not recommend.

reviews.name: Chad P.
reviews.review: I love this spot. All of the employees seem to be very down to earth. The bartender is always awesome. They have happy hour with $5 house wines and half price beer. Some days they make Tapas and they are really legit. Also, it's a gluten free restaurant, which is good despite the scowl from fellow carb lovers :). Try  the portobello caps stuffed with goat cheese, roasted red peppers & sautéed onions, topped with bread crumbs served with mushroom risotto & sautéed kale FTW!

reviews.name: M E.
reviews.review: I was really looking forward to trying this place. I was so excited when it opened, but it was a bit of a letdown. I've been here a few times. Every time, I waited for my food forever. When it got to the table, it looked great, but their food just isn't fantastic. I get that it's gluten free - I'm celiac, so believe me, I know the taste difference. But these guys really dropped the ball. I've been to so many other restaurants that can modify their dishes and have them taste amazing. These guys can't even get it right, and they're supposed to specialize in it! The french bread was absolutely terrible. Too salty, hard as a rock on the outside, and far too airy on the inside. I've had better gluten free rolls at other restaurants! If you can't make edible gluten free french bread, find something else to put on the menu! I can't remember what I've had for actual meals, I just know nothing was too exciting. I've tried both their chocolate brownie, as well as their strawberry shortcake, as well as another desert. All were letdowns. Such a bummer, because I really feel like they could be great. A lot of potential here, but they need to find someone that knows how to cook gluten free, and just get some new recipes together. It really seems like someone is just experimenting with food, which is great, but do it on your own time. I spent years perfecting certain recipes, and even my worst efforts were better than some of their dishes. I'll probably keep going back every few months, just to see if they get any better. Hope springs eternal - I really want them to be great!

reviews.name: Theresa R.
reviews.review: Rather disappointing! We were so excited to try a completely gluten free restaurant, but we were sorely disappointed. The service was mediocre. The servers were friendly enough but once our food arrived we barely saw our server again. We ordered biscuits and preserves to start. The biscuits had a grainy texture, but we're okay otherwise. My wife ordered pancakes and bacon. The gritty texture was even more pronounced in the pancakes. They were dry and not flavorful. There were only 2 slices of bacon, one of which was almost all fat. I ordered the southwestern omelet. It was supposed to have salsa, but there was none. No one asked us how the food was so I didn't get a chance to ask for some once I realized it was missing. Perhaps the worst part was the avocado with the omelet. It was too hard and rubbery to stick a fork into, let alone eat. That omelet never should have left the kitchen with avocado like that. I would have been much more understanding if they'd just told me they didn't have avocado. But to put that on a plate and try to call it food was laughable. Then, with our food barely touched, the server offered us a box and when we declined she simply brought the check. It was clear we didn't like our food but they didn't bother to ask us why. Super cute decor, super great idea, very poorly done. And I make gluten free baked goods at home frequently, so it isn't like it was just the gluten fee part that was the problem!  Gluten free can taste delicious if done right, but this wasn't.

reviews.name: Elizabeth M.
reviews.review: Really, really wanted to like this place but just couldn't. The service was great but the baguette made me keenly aware that I'm gluten intolerant which I was hoping to avoid at a gluten free restaurant. Maybe it just wasn't my thing, but I think they can do better.

reviews.name: Lynne H.
reviews.review: We have been here 4 times to eat inside and then had take out the last 2 times. They seem to get progressively worse. At first the nachos and bruschetta were great. The second time the fried chicken was not so great. Third time, the tomato basil soup was tasteless and the chicken salad sandwich was horrendous. you need to take some lessons from the sandwich bread used at Mitchells as well as giving a better portion of chicken salad instead of 3 big leaves of lettuce because you are pretty pricey. Tonight on October 10th, the squash and ginger soup was so thick that it looked like southern gravy and had chunks of uncooked squash in it. the Caesar salad I ordered had no croutons and I asked for an extra cheese biscuit and they gave me two slices of their hard as a rock sandwich bread. Case in point, I could have gone anywhere in order to order a Caesar without croutons, I love you little cheese biscuits substituting sandwich bread is ridiculous. So I call and tell them after I get home and realized how messed up my order is that I didn't get my cheese biscuits and there are no croutons on my Caesar salad as well as the texture of the soup. I would not even be writing this horrible review if the customer service was up to par. the girl who answer the phone could have cared less and told me to come back and get something else and that they were out of the cheese biscuits and that's why I got the sandwich bread. I said I wasn't driving all the way back but could I get a credit. she told me that was $0.50 for the cheese biscuit and barely anything for the croutons so I guess basically a $0.75 credit. you guys need to learn customer service that should have been offered another meal because this was not what I ordered not because of the price. Not to mention the takeout order before this had to be repeated 6 times because the girl could not get it correct. Pretty pathetic and I won't be back and if anyone ask me I have no problem telling him how pathetic it was.

reviews.name: Allan F.
reviews.review: Lovely peacefull place to eat GOOD gluten free and very tasty meals  have some wine or craft local beer and enjoy, music has addecuate volume and only one tv makes it perfect to pay attention to your companionship.

reviews.name: Kelly S.
reviews.review: 2nd visit.  The burgers were delicious and the sweet potato fries and regular fries were some of the best I've had!  Love the Caesar salad.  I think this place is sadly, really underrated.  Definitely one of our favorite places to dine when we visit Nashville.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Lovely, clean, sparse setting with an awesome LCD tv on the wall..Great patio out back.
