We were seated immediately with menus. 20 minutes later we were still sitting there. No water, no greeting, no nothing. Finally got some water and we ordered our meals. I got the Veal piccata, my friend got something that I don't even remember what it's called. Wide noodles with some sort of tomato sauce and goat cheese. 30 minutes after we ordered we got bread and we were invited to order salad dressing for our salad. Our waiter hyped up the bleu cheese as the best in the area. It is not. We were given one roll each and when I asked for more bread, I got a fairly mean look and a lot of talk about not eating too much bread. Really? Here's a tip waiter: Wait on us and shut up. 20 minutes after our salads we got our simple pasta meals. He set down our dishes and said he would be right back with cheese. My piccata was OK...nothing to write home about, but the noodles were al dente. The veal itself was not that great. Just a small to medium veal chop on top of some noodles. The wide noodles....nasty. The tomato sauce was super sweet, like Papa John's sweet. Anyways, my friend thought she'd wait for cheese to try to rescue her dish. 15 minutes pass. Nothing. I finally flag down somebody to get cheese, and he looks at our dishes like, "Hold on there, I already put fucking cheese on your dish..." and he gave me an annoyed look and a sigh before getting the cheese and grating some on our dishes. 2 hours, 1 water refill. Glass was empty for the majority of the time. Our waiter...wow. I tried to like him, but in the end he was just annoying and took forever. He had a "charming" accent, but in the end he spent most of the time talking to my female friend rather than addressing both of us, which I found super annoying. The restaurant is very tiny and he had no more than 4 parties at one time. No excuse.  The back breaker: 2 hours after we sit, we finally got a bill. There was an extra 6 dollar charge on the hand written check, for which I could find no reason. It was either for asking for cheese on our dishes or for the extra 2 rolls. Either that or he thought he had uncorked some wine for us. I didn't feel like dealing with it so I left what he asked for plus a tip. But that will be my last tip ever for them, because I am not going back. Summary: stingy with bread, stingy with water, time wasters. Too dark as well. Meal for two, no drinks just water. No apps, no desserts. 57 dollars. Also, MC or Visa or Cash only. Thumbs down.

reviews.name: Ozro D.
reviews.review: Considering Mama Mia's is stuck in between two gas stations, I never assumed much when I drive past this place. However, a friend's recommendation persuaded me to give it a chance. Turns out, this is one of the most straightforward dining experiences you can have. There's no flair, no overdecoration, no superfriendly waiters. In fact, there is very little waiter presence at all. It's just good food. I'm not sure I'd be bold enough to say it's the best italian in town, since I've really only tried major chains, but it's certainly not a stretch to say that this is better than most. It might not be cheap, but I'm not sure of any nice Italian restaurants that are. The portions are also very generous, leaving me with plenty leftover for the next day.Adding benefit is the restaurant's BYOB status. The corking fee may be annoying, but it's still cheaper than buying wine at any other restaurant. Plus, in addition to the donut shop and aforementioned gas stations, Mama Mia's shares a parking lot with a liquor store, making it easy to grab a bottle before walking in.That they're able to survive in such an odd location with what would generally be considered awful service is a testament to how good their food is. Singing waiters may be fun, but I'd much rather have great food, and Mama Mia's is a place to find it.

reviews.name: Rachel F.
reviews.review: Bottom line: Will not return.Went with a party of 6. Had reservations for a Monday night. We spent a total of 2.5 hours stuffed into this tiny, stuffy, uncomfortable mess of a "restaurant" because the service is THAT slow.Appetizers: cheese sticks and calamari. I've had better cheese sticks at Sonic, but the calamari was quite good. Not rubbery at all.Salads: Terrible. Dressings were not good, and the salad is just a bowl of lettuce with a slice of tomato and some black olives.Main dishes: Mediocre. I threw away my leftovers.Desserts: didn't try the tiramisu, but the cannoli are a super gross mix of chocolate and orange, and the chocolate cake is swimming in sauce but is still dry as a bone.No espresso, no cappuccino, but are clearly listed on the menu.Our waitress was super annoyed with us for ordering dessert, and took her sweet time getting us our check. WE NEVER SAW AN ITEMIZED BILL. Each couple was charged over $60, but we have no idea what we paid for. Very unprofessional. I will not eat here again, but if you do, GO TO THE BATHROOM. The "art" in the men's room is something else, while the women's room contains a nightmare. We took photos. And the Jesus painting with the actual hole in it is something to behold as well.

reviews.name: Lyrad V.
reviews.review: This is the best Italian in Nashville, hands down, which is amazing since the owners are not Italian... they are Cuban or Colombian or something. They also own Back to Cuba cafe pretty much next door. Check that place out too. Both located where you'd never see it unless you were looking for it.In short, I won't even go into specific entrees because everything I've ever gotten is amazing. But I will note that their bruschetta is by far the best I've even had. Good portions, reasonable prices. My husband and I are in agreement that this place is the best. Most people we know that have eaten here have said the same.I noticed some of the lower reviews are not about the food, but about the wait and service. We know this place is popular and they don't take reservations. So we always go to dinner around 5:30 or 6 and don't have a problem at all. If you have a group and get there 6:30 or after, be prepared to wait a while. No bar to wait. This is a BYOB place with a minimal corking fee.If you don't give Mama Mia's a try, you are really missing out!

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: I have had this restaurant bookmarked for a while, and today I finally got a chance to check it out! We picked this location for a work group outing, and we couldn't have been more pleased. First of all, the service was excellent. While the dining area is fairly small, they seated our group of 10 right away for lunch. Our server was attentive but not overbearing. As we waited for a few stragglers in our group to arrive, out came this gooey, buttery, delicious garlic bread on the house! I think I had four pieces! Everything on the lunch menu ranged from about $7-13, from salads and strombolis to pasta and pizza dishes. I ordered a Marinara pasta dish that was fantastic! Everyone at our table ooohed and awed as their dish came out and the praises kept coming even after the food was cleared into our tummies. Mama Mia's is hard to find on Trousdale Dr. especially if you aren't looking for it, but it's definitely a place worth seeking out!

reviews.name: Clayton K.
reviews.review: It's ok. Nothing special. Service is slow and food is a little overpriced. Pasta is cheap so I've never understood $15 plus for pasta dishes. I had the chicken raviolis.  They were tasty but like said worth about $10. The cheese sticks we got we a nice size but the forgot to melt the cheese on the inside so it was just a big piece of what felt like rubber on inside. Not sure how you mess up cheese sticks? Overall 3 stars. In a city like nashville there is def better places.

reviews.name: Eddy W.
reviews.review: We have been here a before and the food is excellent. It was my gf's birthday so we decided to go there to eat.. When we pulled up the parking lot was empty. I wondered if they were closed or we had gotten there too early. Well we found out that the head chef wasn't there that night as he/she had to go to the emergency room. The staff informed us they had a very limited menu that night which disappointed us. But the food was still good and the service was great. Since it was slow the waiter sung Happy Birthday to my gf. I should rate this 5 stars due to the service we received but on this night with the food not being as good as normal it gets 4 stars.I am sure the next time we go it will be a 5 star rating

reviews.name: Frank M.
reviews.review: First time. It was peaceful, they played Italian music and the service was nice. The meals were expensive but the food was great and definitely filling. I enjoyed my time here.

reviews.name: Amber K.
reviews.review: The food is ok, but don't come here if you're hungry because you'll have to wait. Our waitress told us everything on the menu takes 45 mins and because they were busy it would take longer. I wouldn't have minded the wait if it didn't take so long to get us simple things like bread and salad. We also waited a while just to place our order. I had the ravioli di pollo al forno. I didn't like the filling. My husband had the tortellini amore which was also just ok. Also, they only had coke, diet coke, sprite and unsweet tea. Still hunting for some good Italian food...

reviews.name: Joseph P.
reviews.review: Wait time: absurd. Food: meh. I've been a few times either out of convenience or just wanting to give another chance. The mushroom ravioli were pretty good, mussels were tasty. Salad is iceberg straight out of a bag. Service is the worst- no reason to ever wait as long as they force you to. And for halfway decent food and bad service, truly not worth what they charge.

reviews.name: Ashli D.
reviews.review: A friend visited this place for dinner based on the Yelp reviews.  It is tucked between gas stations and parking is limited.  We had fried mozzarella (yum!) and house salads which were also good.  The garlic bread sticks were great!  She had the chicken and pasta dish and I had penne ala vodka. Both were very good but my friend's dish was loaded with so much garlic it burned your mouth.  Other than that, the food and service were great!

reviews.name: Clint R.
reviews.review: Went for lunch yesterday and had place pretty much to ourselves.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Fresh bread delivered to table was outstanding as well was the Stromboli we ordered.  Food was great. Not sure why this place was empty at 12:30.  I will certainly come back.

reviews.name: Michelle C.
reviews.review: Took 2.5 hours from start to finish and we were happy about that.  We were with friends we hadn't seen in months and enjoyed the time together. Food was very good. The 4 of us each had something different, we had bruschetta'and calamari apps.  Great bread with salads.  We finished with cheese cake and a cannoli. All very good. The service isn't outstanding (hence the 4 stars) but overall a really good option for Italian.  Its BYOB/wine.  There is a wine shop next door if you forget your at home.

reviews.name: Carly H.
reviews.review: The food here is absolutely phenomenal.  I ate with four people; we all ordered a different entre and everyone absolutely raved about the quality of the food.  Our waiter was attentive and knowledgable about the menu, and was able to answer all of our questions. He recommended the bruschetta as a starter, and it was fantastic. We were too full to try any desserts (see later in the post about portion sizes!) but next time we are planning to skip the appetizer and save room. It is a little pricey compared to other Italian places, but the portions are enormous.  I will be making at least two meals out of my plate, so to me the prices are worth it. It is BYOB, as others have mentioned, but there is a liquor store located conveniently next door, so that is easily remedied if you wish to have a bottle of wine or hard liquor. I will definitely be making many return visits here!

reviews.name: Laura G.
reviews.review: Not a fan. WAY too expensive for what you're getting. They act like they're making their own pasta. Not at all. Throw the pasta in boiling water, dump marinara sauce on top and charge $13? No thanks. The point of having a restaurant in a gas station parking lot is the "cheap" factor. No. I could go to City House if I want to spend $100 for dinner and eat amazing food. Not this spot. Never again.

reviews.name: J C.
reviews.review: SLOW. This is place to dine, not eat. In 1.5hrs my wife and I got 2 breadsticks each and 2 water refills. We had to request our order be changed to "to-go" to accommodate our baby sitter. The food was good yet colder once we got home. Will only attempt again as a "to-go" place

reviews.name: Karen G.
reviews.review: This might be as good as it gets. Our first time at this neighborhood, unassuming on the outside, jewel. Unassuming? If you don't know about it you will probably keep on driving. It literally sits between two gas stations. Inside is quite a surprise and a real treat. The smell is delicious, garlic, basil, oregano, bread and mushrooms and the ambiance is surprising comfortable. They don't take reservations for two but we were seated quickly and the service as on time and attentive. Our meals were amazing, Pasta Vagabondo and Mushroom Ravioli with chicken were fresh, interesting and quite honestly the best pasta dishes I've had in years. The price is very affordable especially since you bring you own wine, cocktails, ect. Love, love, love this little place.

reviews.name: Michele H.
reviews.review: Good food. It was good we came early because dinner takes awhile. We came with friends so we loved the time to visit. Definitely don't come if you're in a hurry.

reviews.name: Daniel B.
reviews.review: Love it. It's hard to go wrong with any menu item. I just can't begin to write about the various items because their whole menu deserves a review.One cool note: the Back to Cuba restaurant a few doors down provides the coffee! Hmmm...perfect. Stop reading...go eat! Buon appetito!

reviews.name: Elle w.
reviews.review: Absolutely DELICIOUS. Really, I have never had anything bad here. Let me warn you: it is BYOB (but there is a liquor/wine store next door), and it's going to be a leisurely meal. Everything is prepared after your order so while it takes some time, you can be sure that it is hot and fresh. Also they are great about making substitutions to their pastas (no mushrooms but add garlic please)!It can be busy, so make sure you phone ahead to see what the wait time is.

reviews.name: Kristine T.
reviews.review: Waited ten minutes for seating.No one else in restaurant. My realtor suggested this place. We both ordered scampi, I asked for NO PARMesan cheese. It takes at least 40 minutes to prepare, then mine has parmesan cheese all over it, The waitress tells me to just scape it off.!!! It was all throughout so I ate the 5 shrimp that came with it andstill had to pay 14.00 for it. My realtor took two bites and sent hers back. She said " This is not what I expected.Take it back. Worst Italian food I have ever had in Nashville and I have been here since 1972. The service was AWFUL.I could have done better at Romanos Macaroni Grill...I will go there next. Oh....and the response from my review on Citysearch and Facebook was. was sorry...come back soon. Yes when Hell freezes over!!!!!!!

reviews.name: Erin J.
reviews.review: Since I've been to Mama Mia's at least 5 times over the years, I thought it was about time to write a review.  Let me start out by saying: if you're in a hurry, DO NOT come here!  The restaurant is also quite chilly, so be sure to bring a jacket or sweater.  I've always come for lunch, but I assume dinner is the same way.The food is definitely tasty featuring very generous portions.  They also bring out some yummy bread prior to the meal, so it helps tide you over while you wait.  I think I've ordered the same thing every single time - the manicotti.  It always comes out piping hot which is great.  It does seem to take forever though.  We waited 30 minutes last time - far too long to come very often!All in all, the food is delicious.  They have all sorts of pasta dishes but also have paninis and calzones.  I know I'll be back for lunch, but I'll have to make sure I can be gone for longer than an hour!

reviews.name: Laura M.
reviews.review: Last night my husbands sales crew went to mama mia's for dinner as part of hitting their sales goal. There is about 25 of us and we showed up around 7 on a saturday night. The ladies that worked there where very nice and a bit overwhelmed with us *I would be too* because we can be a bit rowdy at times. We were there for about 2 hours and the service was nice, my water was never empty and my hubby had refills constantly of his pop. The food was OK not the best Italian I've had but pretty darn good. OMIGOODNESS the bread before the meal was divine. My only complaint was the marinara was too sweet, I know LAME but I prefer my sauce savory. I had the mama stravaganza which is a sampler plate, I got manicotti, lasagna, and chicken parmesan. My husband had the pesto, the pesto was delicious, but my sampler plate all tasted similar, so next time I'll get just one type of entree. The owner of the restaurant is the cook and she actually owns the cuban restaurant just down the street as well. She herself is from Cuba and is seriously the sweetest person you'll ever meet. We had her flan, which was amazing because she uses a caramel mango sauce on top of homemade custard. It was really really good and unique. I liked this place a lot, quite memorable in many ways.

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: The search is over I found scrumptious Italian food in Nashville!!  Wa-hoo!  I actually slept better that night knowing I wouldn't have to spend months finding decent Italian.So why does this place get 5 stars?  5 reasons for 5 stars.Number 1:  It's basically in a trailer with a foundation.  Some of the best Italian food in NJ was served in a trailer and cash only.   (This place is NOT cash only.)  Cozy and romantic, the way it should be!Number 2:  There is a painting of an almost naked lady in the bathroom.   The other artwork is just as kitschy. Number 3:  The chicken basilica was everything it was supposed to be!!  Priced decently too.  Number 4:  They got the garlic bread almost down.  Yeah I know, I said almost but it was the best yet!Number 5:  $5 wine corkage fee!!  You can also bring in beer or hard alcohol!!!  If you forget they are conveniently located next to a liquor store.  (Author's note, this is 5 stars in Nashville, not 5 stars in the continental US.)

reviews.name: Lee P.
reviews.review: I found my Nashville Italian joint. I married an Italian - her father and all of her relatives are from (and many of them still live in) Italy. Mama Mia's would impress all of them. Try the bruschetta and for your entree try the gnocchi with the veal sauce. Be prepared to wait.

reviews.name: Steve M.
reviews.review: I don't know if I went on a bad night, but I really was not impressed with Mama Mia's. We arrived and we were greeted by a friendly female who sat us at our table and took our drink orders. I asked for iced tea, and she said the restaurant did not have any (this is a first - what restaurant would not have iced tea?). I then asked what she had that was sugar free, and she said normally Diet Coke, but that the soda machine was broken. She said my only sugar free beverage choice was a glass of tap water. Definitely not a good way to start the meal at a restaurant that strives to be 'fine dining' with $15-20 dollar entrees.A male waiter then comes to our table asking to take our order before we had a chance to even look at the menu. We asked what he recommended and he said "everything". That did not help us narrow our selection.We both order the Siciliana with Bolognese (spaghetti with meat sauce), with a side of meatballs. The salad comes out and was fine. The dressing seemed to be store bought and not from scratch, but it wasn't a big deal. The garlic bread we received was stale and hard as if it had been reheated in the microwave a few too many times and was dripping in butter. We left it in the basket. Gross.The meal then arrives and we begin to eat. First off, they got the order entirely wrong - we ordered Bolognese sauce and they served it with Marinara sauce instead. The sauce was so sweet that my dinner companion said it tasted more like a dessert than a dinner entree! The meatballs were ok, but cold in the center as if they had been re-heated, and the pasta (which they told us was from scratch) was out of a box (yes, i can easily tell the difference).The entire experience reminded me of the Food Network show Sandra Lee/Semi Homeade. Its as if they were trying to be fine dining, but it was an epic failure.My dinner guest could not eat his meal because it had so much sugar in the sauce (and they put the wrong sauce on the pasta to begin with). The restaurant did take it off the bill, but made some odd comment about "had you eaten more than 25% of it, we would not have been able to remove it from the bill". isn't that an odd thing to say in a 'fine dining' establishment?In a nutshell, Mama Mia's may be fine as a $5.99 lunch special dive, but as a dinner/fine dining establishment, it has a long way to go.

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: I have passed this place forever and decided the other day to swing by for lunch. This place has really good food. I mean really good food. It's nice inside and they try to dress it up as much as they can for where it's at. The bathroom is very small but clean. The people I went with decided we would all share and order several items so we could try several things. I liked everything I had. Trust me I know good food and this place is a must try.

reviews.name: Samantha joelle A.
reviews.review: Mama Mia's was a quaint little place tucked away, not generally seen unless you're actually looking for it. I was sent here based on recommendation, and was I glad that I took that person's advice.First of all, Mama Mia's has an awesome BYOB policy, where they charge a small corkage fee and anyone can bring their own bottle of wine. The fact that there is a liquor store right next door makes this very convenient. My friends and I weren't aware of this until we went into the restaurant and saw practically every table had a couple empty bottles of wine that they had brought with them. Now we know for next time.Both my friends and I were extremely satisfied with the food that we ordered. I got a mushroom ravioli that was probably the best ravioli I have ever had. The bread that they serve with dinner was very tasty. My friends and I loved the authentic Italian feel of the place, and the service was quick and on top of it. All in all, I could not find one thing to complain about. I was just excited to discover a new Italian gem in Nashville.

reviews.name: Heather P.
reviews.review: Definitely NOT pleased with this place. My boyfriend had raved about this place in the past and couldn't wait to introduce me to it, but after our visit there a couple of weeks ago, he's now wondering if the place is under new management. We started with an appetizer of calamari. The breading was sparse, it was soggy, and very minimally seasoned. I also found the marinara dipping sauce to be pretty bland. For an entree, my boyfriend ordered the sampler plate of lasagna, manicotti, and chicken parmesan and thought it was just "alright". I tried a bite of each and again, thought the sauce was very bland. For my meal, I went with the one of the pizzas. The outer crust was just barely crisp, but the underside of the pie was like eating RAW DOUGH! I ate one slice and just couldn't sit there and eat anymore! To give them the benefit of the doubt, I got a to-go box and took the pizza home with us. The next day, we heated up the leftovers for lunch and even after 20 minutes in the oven, it was STILL doughy. We ended up throwing it away! Overpriced Italian cuisine...probably could've done better had we gone to Olive Garden...and I am not the type of person who frequents chain restaurants. Very disappointed.

reviews.name: Amy C.
reviews.review: The carbonara was so rich and unctuous I couldn't finish half my plate. That's no disparagement, just an observation. I thought it could've used a little something to balance the butter - the waitress looked at me as though I was mad when I asked for some fresh-ground pepper.The bread was good, though we thought it could have used a lot more garlic! The salad was a bit of nothing. I thought it was odd that the server didn't tell us it was a Balsamic Vinaigrette and called it "Italian" when I asked about a house dressing.As to ambiance, the place is very clean and neat inside. But the thrum of what I think was the air conditioner (or a massive blower of some kind) really gave me a headache after awhile. I couldn't get used to it.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: Totally underwhelmed.First, I have no idea why a small restaurant with no bar and no lobby would not take reservations.  I despise places that don't take reservations and generally as a rule avoid them, but if you choose to do so, you should probably have a place for people to wait, and I don't know, maybe help them bear the wait by letting them get loaded and order appetizers.  Who knows?  You might make some money out of it.  And let me tell you, when we tried to go here with three pregnant women, this sort of business model really shows its weaknesses.When we finally got in, after waiting outside in the cold with three very pregnant, and very hungry women and their respective spouses, we were greeted by okay Italian food and uneven service.  It was pretty pricey, too.  Nobody at the table was really "wowed" by their meals.I am all for intimate, cozy, romantic experiences, but not at the cost of inconvenience that overshadows the pros.

reviews.name: MACK L.
reviews.review: I have loved this little Italian jewel in the Crieve Hall neighborhood for many years.  The veal dishes are my favorite.  REMEMBER, there is no alcohol served here but they encourage you to BYOB of wine or a six pack of beer.  If you forgot to bring along your favorite Chianti, there is a liquor store next door.  Makes the whole meal very inexpensive since our bar tab is usually as high as the food bill.  Take note, Young Guys Dating on a Budget, this is a cozy, candlelit, oddly romantic place.  You will still have enough money for Sunday brunch in the morning. I promise you will like it.

reviews.name: Tim W.
reviews.review: In short great food terrible service! I have been here twice now and the experience has been consistent both times. The food is great but the waiters are slow, rude and it just makes it a overall negative experience.

reviews.name: Shannon R.
reviews.review: Besides the disorganized wait, this place is a MUST! My boyfriend and I decided to finally try Mama Mias on our 2 yr. anniversary. We did wait about an hour, there was not anybody really taking down your name so we just kinda started to form a line( kinda cool though b/c you have no choice but to talk to the other people waiting) But once you are inside and seated......TOATLLY WORTH IT! ~ Our server was very nice and on top of things~The Bruchetta App. is delicious~Very cozy, dim lighting, candlelight, smells amazing in there:)~The Sampler( Stravaganza) is the perfect dish to split. Plenty of food for two people and you get to try 3 of their most popular items.~The breadsticks are heavenly~Best Tiramisu I HAVE EVER HAD!~AND THE BEST THING....BYOW ( bring your own wine)....$5 corkage fee.....but by doing this saves so much money and not to mention its super neat too!~All together we loved it, and will most definately be back. And not to mention we ate alot of GREAT ITALIAN FOOD for UNDER $50! Cant beat that!

reviews.name: Dessa T.
reviews.review: Four words: best. Italian. in. Nashville. There's no point in writing specifics about the food because it's all amazing. They do not take reservations and it's a small (snug? intimate?) place. If you go on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared for a long (and possibly frustrating) wait. It's worth it (but if you really hate waiting, go at 5:30 or on a weeknight - don't skip it entirely!). Sometimes it does seem as if the staff is a bit disorganized and/or overwhelmed. Don't let what I'm about to say deter you, but it's really better to go when you are relaxed (i.e. you are in the mood for a nice, long evening with your honey, rather than you are grumpy because you haven't eaten all day and you are trying to fit dinner in before catching a movie). Mama Mia's is a great date spot. Because it's so cozy and busy, I personally would not go with more than 4 or 5, but I often see large groups there during high traffic hours and they seem to make it work.  They don't serve wine, so bring your own and plan to pay a small corking fee. These are just a few things to know before you go - if you haven't tried it yet, you are really missing out!!

reviews.name: Robin S.
reviews.review: Great place to go for a low-key, authentic Italian dinner!  It doesn't look like much from the outside--heck or from the inside.  It's clean but small, and they have the requisite checkered tablecloths and candles on the tables, but it's nothing too fancy.  Doesn't need to be.  If the food is good (it's outstanding) that's all that matters!  I suggest reservations, just because it's again, a small place, but they do take walk-ins.  Just be prepared to wait.  Another thing I love about it is that you have to bring your own wine--they don't serve it!  It's a $5 cork fee (pretty sure on that) which really, is a deal if you think about what most restaurants make you pay for a bottle of ho-hum wine.  This way, you bring whatever you want and only pay a minimal price.  Most meals come with a salad and delicious buttery, garlicy breadsticks all for a very reasonable price.  I usually get out of there for about $15.  Great for date night, or night out with the girls.  I've never had bad service either!  Mama Mia's is one place I'll go back to time and again.

reviews.name: Chris T.
reviews.review: Normally not one to write restaurant reviews - but our experience recently at Mama Mia's compelled me to send this one as a caution for people considering dining here. Been there only twice - and the first time (6 months ago) was a good experience overall. Not overly impressed with the atmosphere or service - but the food was outstanding. Then, last week we went back only to find the service was atrocious (slow and inattentive to basic needs). We went early on a Saturday to avoid the rush but it didn't matter. Many around us had the same problem and at least one couple walked out. After an hour - we finally were served and the food was actually quite good. But the wait and hassle were simply not worth it. They can recover - but need to focus on the basics and be consistent.

reviews.name: Tim R.
reviews.review: I've patronized Mama Mia's for over a decade. The food is great. Service always has room for improvement though. Staff is slow and disorganized. I cannot recall a visit where the service was good. Be careful on holidays because they offer only prix fixe menus that rely heavily on meat or seafood. Found this out the hard way when we were denied our usual dish on Valentines Day, thus requiring us to change our plans on a very busy dining day after we had been seated. They charge a corking fee also.  You would think that after having a rehearsal dinner there, having various holiday dinners there, and bringing new people often that they would be more sensitive to a long time customer's expectations and holiday plans. Guess they can't be bothered though.

reviews.name: Kevin E.
reviews.review: Terrible service, no one came to our table to even say hello after 10 minutes. I complained to two servers and still nothing so we left. Only three other tables occupied! Fortunately Back to Cuba was next door, they have authentic food and friendly attentive service.

reviews.name: Stephanie K.
reviews.review: We've been going to this little gem for years. The excellent Italian food is a bit slow to come out so if you are toting a tot, bring snacks.  Also bring your own wine. I really enjoy the simple menu of very well crafted entrees. I've never had a miss and would recommend it especially for a date or a boisterous gathering of friends.

reviews.name: Jennifer S.
reviews.review: So yeah, it's in a strip mall. But the inside is really cozy and the food is delicious. It's a BYO, which I think is so fun. The corkage fee is $5 and if you forget your wine, no problem: there's a liquor store a couple of doors down in the same strip. I had what I believe was called penne alla san giovannello, which was a cream-based sauce with mushrooms, sun-dried tomatoes, basil, and Italian sausage. The pasta was perfectly al dente and the sauce was flavorful without just being doused in salt. The fried calamari were huge and the green dipping sauce was delicious. Our server was very friendly. I'd highly recommend Mama Mia's!

reviews.name: Gary R.
reviews.review: Real Italian food is hard to find but Mama Mia's has got you covered.  When you walk in you get that aroma of freshly grated Parmesan cheese and real Italian sauces.  It is a cozy place and is the epitome of comfort food.  This is not a chain and you can tell everything was cooked with care.  Now this is Italian - be there.

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: I have been going to Mama Mia's for years and it's our go to for Italian. The food is good, the prices are great, the servers are always awesome and their are paintings of naked people without heads in the ladies bathroom. The paintings are always the highlight for my kids even my son ventures in for a look. Of course he comes out one day and says "jeez, I don't see what the big deal is, the artist didn't even bother to paint their heads." I digress... Some of my favorite highlights are that it's BYOB and I think the corkage is only $6 so it's lovely to have nice wine with dinner without spending $10 a glass. Secondly, they serve salad and bread sticks with your meal and they are soooo good. They have a large variety of straight forward Italian fare and there are always left overs. There is a reason this little place has been open for so long with little change to it's menu or decor It's just simple good and they stick with it.

reviews.name: Ingrid E.
reviews.review: Nashville's best kept secret in my opinion.  The first time I went, we pulled up to a trailer and I was worried that my parents were crazy.  After trying to find parking and wedging in the non-existent waiting area in the trailer, we were finally seated and had the best meal. ever.  The food is delicious, the service is excellent.  They don't have a bar, but you can bring in your own wine or beer and pay a corkage fee.  I went back on a date and it was so romantic.  If you haven't been, go. now.

reviews.name: Joshua K.
reviews.review: Nice place. Good quality Italian food w/o the fancy bells and whistles.

reviews.name: Ray Ray K.
reviews.review: Great Italian food at a good price. We got the salmon appetizer and the pancetta pasta entree. Brought our own bottle of wine, only a $5 corking fee! Can't beat it! I thought it was funny when we told the server it was our first time and he said, "You'll fall in love with the food here. Not the service or the server, but the food." He was right, but the service wasn't even that bad. The food was a little slow coming out but that just made more time for wine drinking! Cozy atmosphere. The ceilings could be redone with a little more modern flare but an overall attractive place for a date. The only thing i can complain about were the breadsticks. Maybe it was just getting late but they tasted a little stale. But you can also have as many as you want. I would definitely come here for dinner again. (Did i mention the $5 corking fee??)

reviews.name: Mindi M.
reviews.review: I have been a Mama Mia's fan for years! I tell everyone in Nashville that is is the BEST and my favorite Italian. Unfortunately, Friday night will be my last date night there with my man. We've done it many times. He now refuses to set foot in the restaurant again after once again having terribly poor service. The food is usually spot on and phenomenal but you have to be prepared to WAIT. Not sure if they're just understaffed or if they are being very literal with the Italian flair and think dining should take 3 hours. I think that is fine when you have a large party (hence, the word party) and are visiting with one another. When it is you and your significant other that you see every day, we're mainly there to eat, drink and get on our merry way. How difficult could it be to hire a couple more servers, especially for the weekend. Come on, Mama Mia's, after years of having this issue, can't you fix this problem?!

reviews.name: Rachael Anne E.
reviews.review: Don't judge this restaurant by it's building. Though painted with an attractive mural, the cement building can be off-putting. However, the best option for Nashville Italian food is inside. You have to bring in your own alcohol, but Radnor Liquors is just a couple store fronts away. The strip center and Mama Mia's shares a parking lot. It's a small restaurant and it can have a wait. It's worth it and you should try it.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: I love Mama Mia's because it makes me feel like I'm actually getting a glimpse of what a traditional Italian restaurant should feel like. It's romantic, cheesy, welcoming, small, and charming all in one package. More importantly I guess, it's good Italian food. However, my reason for reviewing it without a doubt is the fact that it's BYOW (Bring Your Own Wine). Oh heavenly restaurant that lets me bring my own wine to enjoy with my meal and only charges me a few bucks to cork it. Seriously, I like the food, but I love that they let me bring my own wine.

reviews.name: Megan R.
reviews.review: AWFUL AWFUL AWFUL SERVICE!!!! Food is good but the service is awful.  Not worth it at all.  Not even close. Doesn't even deserve one star.

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: Small, cozy, and charming comes to mind when I think of Mama Mia's.  The décor reminds me of times past.  Not that it's a bad thing, it adds to the atmosphere.  You'll find the usual Italians suspects on the menu, nothing modern or cutting edge.  The food is unpretentious, comforting, well executed, and the service has always been friendly and warm.  Bring your own wine and you're in for a good night.

reviews.name: M M.
reviews.review: We go here often as a family outing. Great food and hard to go wrong with any order. For Mother's Day I took my Mom and we had a great time and meal. She left her wallet with everything in it by the table and they called us the moment they found it! Thanks Mama Mia and we will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Josh F.
reviews.review: First let me say that I have been to Mama Mia's on multiple occasions over the past several years and have recommended this restaurant many times for those looking for a great local Italian restaurant.  However, on my most recent visit on 8/20/11 I was extremely disappointed to discover that the food quality has decreased to a level so low that I don't think I can give them another chance.  My standard order is the chicken parmesan, and minutes after I placed my order at approximately 7:45 pm on a Saturday night, I was informed by the waitress that they "had just sold out last order of chicken parmesan."  This was fine as I have other menu items that I also have had and really enjoy.  I decided on a chicken and mozzarella with olive oil base pasta item while my wife went with the chicken with spinach and fettucini cream sauce.  We had both had these dishes on previous visits and they were thoroughly enjoyed.  However, on this visit, the pasta tasted completely unseasoned and had little to no sauce on either dish.  Additionally, my dish did not have any chicken in it!  The taste was so far off of what we had previously experienced that we were at a loss.  At the end of the day, I have always been able to put up with the slow, mediocre service because of the high quality, great tasting authentic Italian food that Mama Mia's serves up, but after this occasion I'm afraid they have lost a valuable and repeat customer, not to mention lots of word-of-mouth recommendations.  Mama Mia's, call me when you remember how to cook excellent Italian food.

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Romantic, economical and quality eating is the essense of Mama Mia's. Factoring price, food quality and ambiance, this is Nashville's number one best Italian restaurant for me.  Sure you can easily drop $100 at several of the West End midtown Italian places. Why bother with such bourgeois places when you can enjoy a modest romantic Mama Mia's for good Italian eating in south Nashville.

reviews.name: Todd A.
reviews.review: There are certain foods that I expect to be simply good and at a good price, I put Italian food in that category and Mama Mia's meets all of my requirements. For starter, the BYOB is a huge savings as corkage is minimal. The salad is simple but fresh, love the blue cheese dressing! The breadsticks are hot and covered in herb butter, awesome. The entrees are very good and plentiful. I tend to go for the cream sauces with my favorite dish being the Chicken Florentine which consists of a large chicken breast, flattened and grilled over a bed of pasta with an amazing creamy, cheese sauce. Only the added spinach keeps it from falling into the completely sinful category. Because of it I only go a few times a year, doctors orders!! The red sauce items are good as well. It is a place that is not going to blow you away but you will definitely feel you got your moneys worth in portion and quality.

reviews.name: matt c.
reviews.review: Mama Mia's is a well-met mid-range Italian ristorante  owned by the unpretentious geniuses behind near-by Back to Cuba. Making smart use of darkness and candles, the place manages a romantic atmosphere despite officelike drop-ceilings and situation in the midst of the ramshackle not-so-romantic interesection/gas-station plaza at Harding Rd. and Trousdale. But such humility seems to be the common trait of most of the best culinary gems; I think of Gira Polli's old little nook of a place in North Beach... The menu hosts an array of standards from north and south Italy, and a few interesting slightly obscurer things. Salads are not extraordinary but do the job, and include olives as well as the usual romaine/iceberg mix topped with tomatoes and onions .  The bruschetta appetizer has a flavorful topping of diced tomato, garlic, onion, basil and pancetta, and the bread is the same kind you get on a cuban pork sandwich: wide, buttery, white and warm but perhaps not toasted enough for our taste. The saltimboca is the house special and features a delicious sauce and includes a side-dish of spinach gnocchi in marinara. The service was very accomodating to our dietary idiosyncrasies. Like Back to Cuba, this establishment is BYO and conveniently located (for all parties!) near a wine store.

reviews.name: Marilou S.
reviews.review: We experienced a Monday night here with the Song Suffragettes.  The whole familyenjoyed the night.  We ordered dinner, drinks, and sat back, relaxed and listened tosome really talented female songwriters   Very enjoyable evening!  Hope to return some day.

reviews.name: Ali S.
reviews.review: I've been here several times and have left feeling less than impressed the last few visits. Overall, the atmosphere is great -- wide open room, rustic finishes, live music and the ability to accommodate large parties. As for the waitstaff, I can vouch for the other reviews here when I say service takes forever. After sitting at our table for about 20 minutes this morning, we had to walk up to the bar to let the staff know we hadn't been given menus/been greeted. Puzzling, since it wasn't crowded. I made the mistake of going there hungry - it took close to an hour before we were given our plates for the buffet. Side note on the buffet: pretty basic, and not replenished from the time we got our table to when we got our plates. Except the bacon was bangin' - but can bacon ever really be bad? The bottomless mimosas always seem like a great idea, but take forever to be refilled, so I'm not sure it makes much sense to go that route - they're small glasses and you end up averaging about 2-3. The menus were printed on computer paper with a printer that was clearly running out of ink, as some lines couldn't be read. Nit picky comment, but I'm taking the time to leave this review so I figured I'd throw in all of the deets. There's a chance I may be back in the somewhat distant future, but not with the highest of expectations.Heads up to Listening Room management: you've got great potential as a business, but it's time to take some pride in your service and presentation.

reviews.name: Hye Eun C.
reviews.review: 2.5 Stars. I came here inadvertently after failing to find cheap parking for Bakersfield. Why are the public parking lots $30??!?!?! Luckily, Listening Room Cafe had complimentary valet, so we chose to dine there for lunch. The restaurant is very open, with tables facing a large stage. At first, I was pretty excited to hear some live music. It was too bad, however, that all 3 singer/songwriters were just okay--nothing too impressive. The food and service wasn't much better. Although our hostess quickly seated us, we had to wait at least 15 minutes for a server to even take our order--and that was only after we flagged her down. Furthermore, our server perpetually had a frown on her face and didn't even smile once. I don't think we saw any of the staff look friendly. They just looked really unhappy and bored to be there. Not a good sign.I ordered the All American Scramble (omelette with cheese, kielbasa, and gravy sauce) and it was just okay. For $13, I was expecting something much better, but the omelette was kind of dry and one note. The restaurant was also serving a buffet option for $18, but by the looks of it, it wasn't worth the money. Very small selection of food items. Overall, I left feeling very meh about the Listening Room Cafe. For what it is--a live music venue that serves food--the Bluebird Cafe is much better.

reviews.name: Anthony K.
reviews.review: I am not a huge country fan, but this place was amazing.  The Listening Room Cafe is a another place like the Bluebird Cafe, where country music lovers can listen to some of their favorite country songs.  The singer here are mostly the songwriters them selves.  It is a little pricy for me...but well worth the visit....or two.

reviews.name: Mari K.
reviews.review: This was a great place to hear some up and coming artists, grab an inexpensive drink, and hang out! The food options looked tempting but we had already eaten, so I can't speak to that. Our experience was positive, though!

reviews.name: Francesca D.
reviews.review: This is probably one of my favorite hidden gems in Nashville. It was my husband and I's first time visiting and we have friends that are locals and brought us here. The food is okay- but the music is incredible. Being able to listen to such talented groups, hearing their stories is just magical. I'd highly recommend this spot to anyone who wants a true music experience on their trip. I would have never known about this place as it's off the beaten path. Be sure to reserve a spot ahead of time and arrive early if you want to be seated closer to the front of the stage.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: Eeehh. This was not a great experience for me. With out of town guests, a group of us decided to do a touristy brunch at the Listening Room Cafe. We came in around 10:30am with live music starting at 11:30am. Our table had about 7 people and the place was pretty empty with the exception of maybe 5 other tables (the place is pretty large). They offer a buffet for $18.00 that looked very similar to a continental breakfast at a Holiday Inn. No thanks. So we sat down and looked over the menu. I decided on the veggie flatbread with bacon instead of french fries that come with it normally. They offer bottomless mimosas/bloody mary's for the reasonable price of $15.00 if I remember correctly. I did not partake but had a sip and they were pretty solid. Not all orange juice and mixed properly. That's where the good ends. We waited an hour for our food. Then they broke restaurant rule #1. They brought out 3 entrees and then we waited at least another 10-15 minutes before the rest of our table got their food. Seriously? No one had silverware either, so we had to wait be able to eat our brunch. I was very cranky at this point and starving. Much to my chagrin, I discovered that my veggie flatbread was not a pizza, but rather a clump of veggies and a tiny bit of hummus in a thick bland pita, and made like a sandwich. Huh? Since when does flatbread = sandwich?  On top of that it was bland and boring once I started eating. The bacon was OK and they brought out french fries anyway. Unfortunately, the poor food didn't stop there. The burger was just OK, the chicken and waffles had completely unseasoned and dry fried chicken that needed salt. It was a huge portion, so I ate some of that since my flatbread was not good and left me hungry. I was not a happy diner. NOTE: One person ordered the pancakes and said they were very good, so all the food wasn't a let down, but I can't speak from experience.I must shed light on the performers who were very good and entertaining. They were the only saving grace of this meal and sounded awesome. It was definitely neat to be able to enjoy their music at this venue. Should I ever return, I would not eat here but would get drinks and listen to the music. The place has a cool vibe and would be fun to do without the pressure of a meal.

reviews.name: A B L.
reviews.review: I was so excited to hear from our waiter, Travis @ Erch, about the Monday artist showcase here at 6pm. It is the Song Suffragettes- which is women of country who sing and write their own music. It was great. The happy hour 2 for 1 beers were also good! We sat on the front row and the event cost me $5 (for the beer). The food people were ordering looked good but we were just there for the music. This was a great way to hear live music that wasn't just the typical Nashville radio country. We came here knowing we could get a. Seat and we were also already parked downtown for the day. We had planned to go to the Bluebird but were told the wait was ridiculous and it was be so very crowded.

reviews.name: Stephanie T.
reviews.review: After spending the weekend in Nashville, The Listening Room gets an A+++++ in music and service. We attended the Song Suffragettes writer's showcase and were pleased with the quality of music these young ladies presented. Far and away from the drunken noise of Broadway! I ordered the fried green tomatoes...they were ok. Can't say they overwhelmed me, but I came here for music. Service was outstanding compared to any other venue we've been yet. The staff is constantly moving and very attentive without being in your face. Since the Bluebird seems so hard to get into, check out the Listening Room Cafe. Did I mention there was no cover, either on this Monday night???

reviews.name: Jon W.
reviews.review: Best place in Nashville to watch songwriters sing their hits. Amazing food. Great sound and people, from the chefs to the wait staff to the bartenders to the owner.

reviews.name: Ellen R.
reviews.review: I am not a complainer, but I would hate for a group of visitors make the same mistake my friends and I made.  We were looking forward to a beautiful morning with live music, breakfast buffet and bottomless drinks.The music was enjoyable.  The breakfast buffet is disgusting. It is a basic menu, which is fine.. however, poor quality in food, and EXTREMELY slow service at refilling the buffet. To make matters even worse, the bottomless drinks were so weak, and they ran out of Bloody Mary Mix by 1030 am on a Sunday.   We basically paid for bottomless Orange Juice. So disappointed in our experience.

reviews.name: Johnny T.
reviews.review: 3.5It's right there in the name: come here for the music, stay for the drinks and patio after the set... you can probably skip the food. The Listening Room can give you a pretty decent night out (especially in good weather) but you have to know why you're coming and choose your experience accordingly.As anyone who's visited can tell you, it's a cool venue. From the moment you walk in, you can feel the musical electricity. The stage is the real deal. It's not overly fancy; it's just legit. You know it when you see it. Other venues may have more cache, but the LRC is no slouch. If you're set to see a show here, be excited. Parking can be a bit of an issue but they have a (free?) valet. If Tom is working, he'll take good care of you and your vehicle.Since it's a music venue, one would hope the drink program is up to par. It is. I came here on a Wednesday night in early autumn and was on a red ale kick. The only one I saw on draft was Fat Bottom's Ruby -- which was a-ok with me, as I'd been drinking a lot of it... but that's when I saw the rest: there were four tubs of hooch! Forget the suds. I can get that anytime. Bring on the hooch! Since I needed to be presentable (at least, that's what I told myself), I decided on the tasty but not knock-you-out Fancy Lemonade: vodka, simple syrup, lemon, soda. Very drinkable. Good for a hot day. I wanted to try the watermelon drink that had moonshine or the Blowin' Smoke drink which had whiskey but the bartender told me both were pretty strong and, again, I needed to be coherent so...When the music's in between sets or you need to talk (don't ever talk during a performance), take your drink and hit the patio. There's not much of a view right now but once the amphitheater gets built up, you've got a game changer on your hands. The only real letdown is the food program. My Caesar salad was mealy and my portabella burger was cold & rubbery. The food would have been a rather unfortunate end to a decent evening had I not observed a woman spitting the worst game I've ever heard to a guy who couldn't care less. I thought only dudes did stuff like that. The beautiful disaster that woman brought to my life made me almost forget about the bad taste in my mouth.

reviews.name: Ron G.
reviews.review: Good selection of craft beer, helpful bartender. Gotta try the TLR Stack, house made chips with smoked pork and bbq sauce.

reviews.name: Amy D.
reviews.review: This was one of my favorite live music experiences in Nashville. I could easily picture the talent we saw Amber's Drive at the Listening Room Cafe breaking out and making it big and I assume their other scheduled gigs are equally impressive. The sound system and acoustics were excellent! The venue is spacious and clean with friendly staff. You can reserve a seats online and they start seating 15 minutes before the performance. The hostesses have the system nailed down and quickly seat guests. We placed a drink order and our waiter had our cocktails well before served before the show began.The drink menu consists of an excellent selection of drafts, cocktails and wine. While we only partook in drinks the food smelled delicious and looked to be large portions. I ordered a malbec and later a champagne cocktail named berries and bubbles. If you love live music seeing a band at the Listening Room Cafe while in Nashville is a must.

reviews.name: Demetra R.
reviews.review: My friends and I came by for brunch on a Saturday. Thankfully it wasn't crowded. The food was great and I enjoyed the live music. I will definitely be back!

reviews.name: Cynthia M.
reviews.review: Great show and very clean, airy, open space with lots of seating -- totally different atmosphere than most of the music venues downtown. Free valet parking, which is a big plus in this location. The website has a show schedule and they accept reservations. Free admission, but remember food and drink sales are what pay the bills. Still - come for the music, not the food.

reviews.name: Tim R.
reviews.review: Great music venue with pretty good food.  I think this is one of the best sounding rooms in town.  I usually come with a specific person to see in mind.  For me, eating at a music venue is a mixed benefit - I'd rather just drink and listen.  But if it's dinner time, the food is good.  It is much better than other so-called "cafe's: that offer bad frozen pizza for their $10 food minimum.You may have to pay a cover for some acts, but I don't mind that.  They also offer valet parking.

reviews.name: Elizabeth S.
reviews.review: We had a great time tonight! Makers series with four very different artists. We all enjoyed it. The beauty of this sort of gig is that they aren't specifically country music influences which appeals to the non-country fans. Artists ranged from experienced to new performers but they all did a great job in letting their personalities shine. The place was only half full on a Thurs night. Venue is very nice, has great acoustics with a warm ambience. We all ordered dinner. Food was good. Mac cheese balls were overpowered by Parmesan in my opinion. The smoked chicken was good but mine was a little dry in places. My friends was perfectly moist. I grabbed some BBQ sauce and it was great. The black eyed peas, green beans, corn on cob and sweet tator tots were all good. I had two cocktails- the pear, which was very enjoyable, and the seedling which was good but I wish I'd skipped the black pepper  garnish. We all agreed it was a very pleasant night and would absolutely go back. The free valet parking (if you spend over $20) was also hassle free.

reviews.name: Kalynne M.
reviews.review: Wonderful night of music!!! Our server was fantastic!!! I attended the dinner and a show on 7/11/2015 with my mom and two kids (4 and 9). The kids shared an order of chicken fingers and fries, washing it down with a scoop of vanilla ice cream. They were enthralled with the music and even danced! The food was good. Their menu is in a state of flux with a new chef, so some items like pork chops are no longer available. I ordered a plate of pulled pork and side of mashed potatoes. Again the menu wasn't updated, so it didn't list pepper as the main spice in the mash. My mom is allergic and this made her very unhappy. The server apologized and brought out a huge slice of cheesecake with chocolate and raspberry drizzle. The venue was very spacious and had tables that sat four people, but a few were pushed together to accommodate a larger group. Lots of couples on dates or small groups kicking off their Saturday night. Originally I was quoted a bucket of beer was ten dollars, but when the bill came it was $20! The server did correct the price without hesitation. I think it must be very confusing to not only customers but servers too if the menu is not updated. This would only be my only suggestion to Mr. Blair, if you have a new chef please print out an updated menu to showcase a short bio and a list of the new  offerings. Please discard the nasty old stained file folders and just print it on heavy card stock. It wasn't a great first impression to sit down and see old file folders on the tables; it made me think about work and I wanted to relax;) The musicians were very talented: Bill Griese and Julie Gribble. I bought both of their CDs to listen to in the car back to Georgia. Very wonderful, authentic Nashville experience!!! We will definitely go back again.PS Valet your car and get it validated by your server. Much easier than driving in circles to find a spot.

reviews.name: Chester K.
reviews.review: Great music, low quality food. My waiter lost my credit card and showed great indifference to that fact. Not good...

reviews.name: Tommy H.
reviews.review: The listening room is a great place to catch premier songwriters (e.g. Jason Duke)... Saturday brunch buffet was awesome! If you want a real taste of the Nashville music industry, check this place out!

reviews.name: Eric H.
reviews.review: The restaurant has a great open space with a clean look.  The breakfast buffet was sub par, food was barely warm, chicken was dry.  Had to ask to have utensils put out on the buffet in order to serve some of the items. The bottomless bloody Marys helped offset the cost of the food. Bloody Mary's and Mimosas were good.  The music was good unfortunately it ended 15 minutes after we arrived and was switched to football. No real listening happened not sure If this was due to the time we arrived.

reviews.name: Liz C.
reviews.review: Great place to hear live music in a laid back  environment.  We went for an earlier show so perhaps it get a little crazy later in the evening.  Cocktails were great and appetizers were tasty.  Good service and amazing music from Carly Pearce.

reviews.name: Mitch S.
reviews.review: I came for brunch with a large party expecting the buffet.  The buffet was small and resembled a hotel breakfast. So I decided to stick to the menu. Had a fantastic turkey and apple sandwich with the best sweet potato fries I ever had. I also tried the gravy from a buddy of mine, pretty good as well. The sweet tea didn't taste much like tea. The service was ok, the waitress seemed like she was working, but the infrastructure isn't ideal. Ok experience, better if you like live music.

reviews.name: Emily C.
reviews.review: I LOVE it here. Local beers and fabulous live music in an industrial space that also succeeds in having a cozy, intimate feel. This was my first stop out on Saturday night and I honestly wish I spent more time here rather than checking out the grimy honky tonks on Broadway. The bartender was superbly friendly and small plates were excellent - especially the smoked veggie skewers and toasted ravioli. The cocktail menu surpasses anything you'd find down the street. Listening Room totally spoiled me with goodness before heading to Tin Roof on Broadway where I returned a gin & tonic because they accidentally poured tequila. But that's a review for another time.

reviews.name: Randal S.
reviews.review: Get the big hit burger - you need to eat this one with your fork! Dig in don' t be shy there is always great music here!

reviews.name: Renetria D.
reviews.review: It's really hard to screw up breakfast/ brunch but the Listening Room managed it! First off, you can't split the $15 bottomless mimosas okay ...Which are $6 each. Cheap champagne and juice should easily be  $2-3 bucks anywhere except here. The chef wouldn't a la carte waffles?!? No wonder no one is here! Really wanted The Southern but the wait was 1hr 15min and for it to be game day this place was totally empty....Lesson learned should have waited for the Southern My friend had the chicken and waffles with scrambled eggs...eggs looked great... Scrambled with cheese throughout... I sent back the dry shrimp & grits ( who puts S&G on a plate?!?) and got the subpar steak & eggs... I requested my eggs scrambled with cheese instead I got an egg patty with cheddar cheese melted on top! Wth! Our server was great tho, the "chef" not so much.

reviews.name: Christopher K.
reviews.review: Good music scene.  Stay away for brunch, nothing special at all.  Food was mediocre, the scramble came out moderately hot, the buffet look like something out of a cheap hotel.  Orange juice was concentrated out of a bag.  Coffee was burnt.  Come for the music and a cocktail, that's about it.

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: I love live music, which works out well since I live in Austin, TX. However, this also means I have high standards and happily the Listening Room did not disappoint. First, be sure to get reservations. They are free (at least they were every night that we were visiting Nashville) but it guarantees you have a spot to sit. Without a reservation, you are guaranteed to either stand in the back of the room or not be allowed in at all. Even with a reservation, get there early! We arrived 30 minutes before the music started and were one of the last tables seated.Second, eat before you come. The food is definitely not the best, but you aren't coming for the food anyway. To note, we ordered the fried pickles and they were overly sweet, almost like they were cooked/rolled in a syrup before being fried. Not really what I want in a pickle. My husband also ordered the Mac and cheese, which was tasty, but a very small portion. The drinks were tasty, a little on the small side, but good. I had the watermelon crawl and it was delicious - they were out of watermelon, so they made it was pear juice. I guess I technically had a pear crawl, but still tasty! The music is AMZING. We stopped in on a Monday, where they were featuring the Song Suffragettes, as they do every Monday. The set consisted of 5 female singer/songwriters and each was beautiful and incredibly talented. As soon as our vacation ended and we got home  I started looking at past artists from the Listening Room and can now say that I have a full playlist on my Spotify account made solely of the artists they host.

reviews.name: Noelle M.
reviews.review: Had Sunday Brunch here - upon entering, we were told that we had to wait at the bar despite having reservations,  because the chef was backed up. There were about 50 empty tables, so that was bizarre. My bloody Mary was great though - don't do bottomless, as the glasses are half the size of the $6 pint and not worth the $15 price tag. The menu was much more scarce than the website, plus they gave my friend and I each a different one, which had to be corrected. Our food was okay (my friend got Shrimp and Grits and I got the Veggie flatbread) - glad we had a groupon. The singer played from about 1130-1, and it was a nice intimate setting for her performance.

reviews.name: Juliet L.
reviews.review: I can only speak to the brunch experience at the Listening Room, but it left much to be desired. First, we barely listened to live music. When we called ahead, the manager confirmed the online listing that said the music goes from 11-1, so we made a reservation for 11. When we arrived a sign out front said the music started at 11:30. Our server confirmed this, even though on the wall inside it listed the first musical act as starting at noon. But we thought, well if it's at 11:30, that's ok. It didn't start until noon, and well after we had finished eating.  The food options were overwhelming and overpriced (I guess to pay the musicians?). If you're going to have an $18 buffet and very limited additional menu options, make the buffet something more than eggs and bacon set up in hotel pans in the back. Also the math on the bottomless mimosas and bloody marys didn't make a lot of sense.I had family in town, so it was a shame we wasted a meal at this place.

reviews.name: Lina Z.
reviews.review: This is the place to go if you're not in the mood for country music. They were playing indie music when I went here, the guys did a great job performing. I heard from the waitress that the first show is free, and second show charge a cover on weekdays, the cover is cheap anyways. The food is decent, it was a good experience overall.

reviews.name: Karen R.
reviews.review: Went for lunch based on yelp, it was terrible. Service took forever!! Food was blah. The only high point was the outdoor patio. Don't bother!!

reviews.name: Rhonda B.
reviews.review: Great place to watch great music. I will definitely come again next time I visit Nashville. The singers were all awesome. Service was also good. Can't beat the price to attend.

reviews.name: Jack D.
reviews.review: A truly great place to listen to singer/songwriters.  Very large, open, easy seating.Good food and drinks at reasonable price.Family Friendly.Will go back as often as possible.

reviews.name: Jessica L.
reviews.review: Easily one of the worst restaurants I've ever been to. We sat for 20 minutes without a waiter even coming to our table or being given menus. Finally after asking for a server twice, a waitress came over. We ordered the bottomless mimosas. They were basically just orange juice, very small, slow to be refilled, and not at all worth the $15. We then ordered some food from their incredibly short and unappetizing menu (vegetarians beware, there is one option for you and it's disgusting). The food came out and all of it was incredibly awful. I've had better food in dirty roadside diners, where I question whether or not I'm eating chicken or rat. As for the music, it wasn't bad. But the jerk making tranny jokes needs to just not. Way to be an ignorant piece of crap. Save yourself the trouble and go anywhere else.

reviews.name: Janene O.
reviews.review: Five stars for the music and zero stars for the service. We went on Sat evening for the 6pm show.  The music was outstanding but, after our first drink, the servers largely ignored us. I nearly had to tackle the server to order a second drink - which arrived as the show was ending. We liked the music so much we decided to brave the servers again for Sun brunch and music. As on Sat, the music was very good but on Sun the service was even worse. We ordered "bottomless mimosas" which was basically 1 mimosa unless you could catch the server for a refill. We ordered brunch prior to the start of the show but almost 2 hours later had still not received our food. When we complained they said they would comp our brunch and then brought our brunch out in to-go containers???In summary, great music but absolutely no service.

reviews.name: Michael M.
reviews.review: People moan about bad service here. Get over it. The kids who work here come and go. We had great service. Maybe next week it'll be shite. But that's not a constant. And you can be proactive if you have any problems. In any case, Mondays are great. Kids on stage singing their hearts out. You know some of them are going to make it. Food is good. Beer is cheap. Audience was respectful. If you are in the area on a Monday, come here.

reviews.name: Alex P.
reviews.review: Hands down an Great music venueFood quality was less than ideal and a bit pricy for what you get.  Did not finish salad entrée, just did not taste fresh.

reviews.name: Jonathan G.
reviews.review: My wife and I stumbled upon this place in Nashville after dinner at Husk. The music is top notch and it is a way different vibe than the typical Broadway scene in Nashville. Apparently you need to make reservations. Luckily, the nice lady at the door let us stand in the back and we were able to nab some chairs. We didn't have the food, but what was coming out of the kitchen looked pretty good.

reviews.name: Karen J.
reviews.review: Love the valet parking. Sound is wonderful...food...eh.  While they do fancy themselves as the new Bluebird they really need to work on the menu. changes way to often and prices are pretty high. They brought out some chips no one had ordered and somehow managed undercook and burn them.

reviews.name: Amit K.
reviews.review: We held a private event at the Listening Room Cafe and I feel compelled to write a superb review for their excellent and attentive service. When trying to find the right space in Nashville for our party, I stumbled across the Listening Room Cafe by pure chance but it was exactly the place I was looking for to host our event. The decoration is rustic interiors with brick background, wood beams and elevated ceilings. The sound system is amazing and they have a projector as well to use for tv or your own a-v hookups. There is also plenty of parking for your guests which is a HUGE plus in the downtown area considering there are parking lots at every turn and corner. The outdoor patio has a nice view of the Nashville skyline and is a great place to catch a drink on a cool evening. The Owner was a pleasure to work with and helped work through every little request I had. He even helped the kitchen prepare a custom menu with a authentic home recipe for our guests which came out incredible. We created a customized menu and bar menu for our guests and they were willing to accomodate all of my requests.  I especially enjoyed the local Yazoo beers on tap. I got to try a lot of the offerings on the menu and highly recommend the fried pickles, southern fried chicken, whiskey salmon, and broccoli casserole.  Our guests left the evening with an awesome and authentic Nashville experience and I even got on stage and played a song to close out the evening. If you are searching for a place with character, a place where you can support a local business owner with a vision and dream of the perfect singer-songwriter venue, and a place that just gushes with that local Nashville flavor then I highly recommend the listening room cafe. The sound system is awesome in here and really gives the musicians a platform to perform their trade. I look forward to coming back soon and enjoying the listening room cafe another time. Support Local!!!

reviews.name: James D.
reviews.review: Came here whilst visiting Nashville with a buddy. Loved the music. The service was very friendly, if a little sluggish. The waiters were moving as quickly as they could! I think they just need a few more people. It was slightly irritating that a lot of people there just chattered away even tho there was a sign saying to keep conversations down. It probably wouldn't hurt for them to enforce it.

reviews.name: Marisa P.
reviews.review: Looks like the place would be fun for music. Sound system is nice, and ambiance was great. Food was such a disappointment, I ordered the veggie frittata. It said chefs seasonal choice, diced tomatoes, hidden jalapeños and two chives.

reviews.name: Brittney V.
reviews.review: My sister is living in Nashville. We were looking for something relaxing but fun to do on a Monday night. I learned about some live music at the listening room cafe. Soo glad we swung by there. Delicious food, great location and excellent talent!
reviews.location: La Jolla Shores, San Diego, CA

reviews.name: K B.
reviews.review: Came in on a Saturday during lunch to find out they were out of burgers. My appetite went out of the window immediately! I ended up having just the lobster bisque. It was too rich for my taste but wasn't terrible either. My friends had the steak and eggs, fried egg bagel and scrambled eggs. They said theirs was good. There was a girl performing an acoustic song when we got there but she only sang two songs. I forgot her name but she was extremely talented. The service was terrible. Our server was extremely slow.

reviews.name: Britney W.
reviews.review: Bought a living social deal to use while we were on vacation in Nashville.  First off.. figured the reason they were on living social... construction blocked the parking lot and the front entrance making it really hard to get to. They have a giant banner on the side of there building, printed on their door, and printed on their menus that Brunch was served Saturday and Sunday from 10 am to 3 pm. We arrived Saturday at 10 am. Was seated and ordered drinks. Then we were told that the kitchen didnt opened until 11 am. ... seriously then why does the giant banner on the side of your building say 10am?????

reviews.name: Andrea B.
reviews.review: We didn't eat,  but we sat at the bar and Theresa was our bartender.  She was working her butt off trying to accommodate the large crowd for the 1pm show with Colby Dee, but we were still served in a timely manner. Thanks Theresa for making our stop here a pleasant one!

reviews.name: Ally H.
reviews.review: This was a fun place to have brunch. The food was OK, and pretty overpriced for the portion sizes. The service was ok but our server was pretty out of it and didn't offer us anything to drink at all. A band of young children came on the stage and we actually thoroughly enjoyed how good they were! But we waited forever to get our food and the band started much later than they were supposed to. Ultimately this is a really cool place and I would definitely go back but maybe for drinks instead of eating.

reviews.name: Aj M.
reviews.review: This is my second visit to the Listening Room. I have to say it is a hidden gem in our city! I like to come and have a drink and small plates with buddies and now I will make a return visit for Brunch! Our server is awesome and wehave had a great start to our Sunday here.

reviews.name: Swirleen H.
reviews.review: I like the Listening Room; however, WATCH THE WAIT STAFF!  I went there yesterday for lunch.  My bill was $40.42, I gave the waitress a $6.00 Tip (which was fair).  I get home and logged in to see my charges for the day and was horrified .... The waitress gave herself $2.00 more.  My card was charged $48.62!  CRIMINAL!  For this reason, I will NEVER eat here again!

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: Wanted us to pay $5 cover to sit on the patio outside and have a drink. Yeah bye. Do they know you can hear the music out on the street for free?ETA I received a "compliment" from someone saying they have to pay the performers with a cover charge. You can pay the performers with a drink minimum too, you know.

reviews.name: Flick R.
reviews.review: If I could give no stars for this place, I would. I was part of a group who made reservations to come in on a Sunday morning for brunch, and the service, food, attitude were all below acceptable standards. I was one of the first people there and placed my order for the brunch buffet and bottomless mimosas. Thanks to APPALLING service, I got two tiny drinks. When I tried to flag our waitress down, I got a surprisingly snarky response. I'm not used to being talked to like I'm an 8 year old, especially when I'm paying for the pleasure. The restaurant ran out of food for the breakfast buffet, so many members of our group were waiting on their food or unable to get basic menu items. My mind was blown by how poor an experience it was. The person who made our reservation complained about the shortcomings, and apparently got blown off. No love for this place. I've seen better service at IHOP.

reviews.name: Stacey M.
reviews.review: Across the street from our hotel. My friend knew someone playing here. Have been here for over 15 minutes and no one has taken our drink order yet. People who came in after us had drink orders taken.

reviews.name: Scott P.
reviews.review: The Listening Room Cafe was the quintessential Nashville experience during our last trip.  Our brief experience with the Listening Room Cafe was great.  This review is only for the music and bar, as we did not have any food.  We ran across it as we had some time to spare before concerts at LP, and this place is right near the entrance of the bridge.  There is not much around it, but we could clearly hear the music from outside, so we decided to check it out.When you walk in, it is an open, brick room with a bunch of tables and a stage.  Pretty stripped down place, with a basic bar menu with a bunch of drinks.  Service at the bar was great.  It was clear from the start that this place was about the music.  No gimmicks or distractions.  Just a couple of folks on a small stage playing great original country.  Sure, at the bars, you get great music, but music there seems peripheral; at LRC, the music is paramount and just feels important.

reviews.name: Eric P.
reviews.review: This was a huge disappointment. It took almost 2 hours to get breakfast. The server never came to fill coffees. The food was cold and bad.
