The server complained of being hungover after a rough night on the town. He tried overcharging us and then didn't want to do anything about it. "I guess i can ask the manager if you want". Of course since we were in a party of 6, gratuity was put on the bill so I guess the server didn't really feel it was necessary to offer any service. He never asked how our meal was. It took 30 minutes just to get our checks and pay. Terrible way to start a day. Do not go to this establishment. And if you do, pray your server is not Charles because he is rude and unhelpful.

reviews.name: Jeff P.
reviews.review: Fantastic venue for live music...excellent food and atmosphere! Recommend highly the smoked chicken wings with a Kentucky Bourbon Barrel Ale. Music talent is first class!

reviews.name: Natt A.
reviews.review: Overall, I had an exceptional time with my girlfriend at the Listening Room Cafe. We went on a Saturday night with singer and songwriter Vanessa Bransan, AJ Engstrom, and Phil Barton performing. They were amazing and made the night enjoyable for us and everyone else. We both really enjoy the opportunity after the show to meet and chat with the artist, and also get pictures and autographs from them. Vanessa was so sweet and nice to my girlfriend and me, and Phil was very personable when we chatted with him. We didn't get to talk to AJ, but he was very comedic onstage and had a great personality. We both really enjoyed the ambience provided at the Listening Room Cafe. Our waitress was very courteous and nice. She did a tremendous job trying to wait on her tables while allowing everyone to hear and enjoy the show too without being interrupted. However, I did have to take a star away for the food. Our waitress was kind and updated us on our food and apologized for the wait, which was very nice of her. The food was mediocre. I'm sure the kitchen was well busy with the amount of orders, but I expected better execution with the atmosphere they provided. The french onion soup was solid and tasty; the veggies skewers had an interesting taste; the portobello mushrooms were a bit heavy on the greasy side and they forgot the ranch sauce, but they had good flavors; and the sweet fries were seasoned very well, but very soggy as if the deep fryer temperature wasn't hot enough and the fries just soaked up the oil. We will be back for the show and I hope they improve on their cuisine. When they do, I will gladly give them 5 stars. :)

reviews.name: S J.
reviews.review: It was terrible. I was with a group that had made reservations for brunch well in advance. There was practically NO food on the buffet. I got a tiny pancake. I had also ordered coffee... it never came.I was one of the lucky ones though... some paid for the buffet and got a piece of fruit only... some got nothing, but insisted on not paying.There was only one other table besides our group, so the restaurant wasn't even 1/2 full. I have no idea what they would do if any locals actually came to their Sunday brunch... I imagine not much different though.My bill was $25.00 with a 20% gratuity. $30 for a pancake and water... I should have refused to pay. The owner of this restaurant owes some serious refunds to the people in my group, and I can assure you that none of us will ever return!!!

reviews.name: Gina D.
reviews.review: Food is terrible but great venue for live music. Be aware, if you don't specify the vodka you want, they will charge you for the most expensive one they have.  What a rip off.

reviews.name: Ebonee N.
reviews.review: The experience started off well; nice solo act performing with her guitar, friendly host, beautiful atmosphere. But our visit ended terribly. Service was horrible, waitress was slow and not very friendly, management was awkward, entire visit was too long and our food came out cold. We stopped in for brunch bc of recommendations from visit nashville sites, and a banner on the building. We would have had a better time stopping somewhere else...

reviews.name: Cyndy M.
reviews.review: Not a handicapped friendly facility.  Yes. They have a slanted ramp, but they make you stand without a place to sit for hours waiting to get in for a concert...even in the cold rain. Don't think they know the definition of ADA except for building materials. Certainly not in understanding pain issues.

reviews.name: Linnea T.
reviews.review: This is another great live music venue in Nashville, but it is a lot cleaner and hipper than the honky-tonks on Broadway. Although the food menu is a little limited, most everything we tried was good, including the local beers on tap. I had the fried ravioli and waldorf salad while my friend had the calamari and black-and-blue salad. The salads were awesome and the ravioli was tasty but the calamari was nothing special, if not a little plain. We went around dinner time and got to see some GREAT performances by some young singer/songwriters all the way from the UK! I would highly recommend this place if you actually want to enjoy some good food and music but want to get away from the noise of the main strip.

reviews.name: Andy S.
reviews.review: Took a small group for brunch. Bottomless mimosas were rarely refilled. They had two brunch menus that didn't agree. People were charged for sides that should've been included. B&G were lukewarm.They fixed the bills, but it took them a while.Seems like the locals know to avoid this place for brunch...

reviews.name: Petie D.
reviews.review: We were so excited to have brunch here!  And then we went in.  Can you say blah?  There is nothing nothing nothing appealing about this place.  The hostess and people working there seem so  miserable. Are they overworked? Short staffed? I dont know but honestly customers should never feel like they're intruding.  Waited 15 minutes for a table and 3/4 of the place was empty.  Stood at the bar for nearly 10 minutes before the bartender asked if we would like something.  And there were empty seats at the bar IT WAS NOT BUSY! It's a big empty room with tables, no deco except for the giant sign telling everyone to be quiet and respectful of the entertainment?!?  Cmon now, are you paying me to eat here or vice versa?  And the singers?  I'd rather go to anyplace on Broadway for better service, food, drink and entertainment and NOT told to be quiet! friendly employees! Food was marginal.  Patio is 'dog friendly?'  What?  Last thing I want to to be eating and have a dog at the next table!  Left all 3 of my dogs at home, cause they don't belong at a restaurant, maybe I'll bring all of them next time..  Do yourself a favor don't waste your time, the only good thing they have here is valet parking.  Sorry listening room, you gotta try harder you're fading fast.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: I have been here a few times - mostly during Songwriter's Festival.I have always had a good seat, whether it was on the couch, a big overstuffed chair, or a barstool.Music always sounds great.I have never felt like the place was so crowded I couldn't enjoy the performers.In fact, every time I have been here, I have always gotten a great seat and no one standing in front of me, to block any views.I really like this place.Food isn't bad, either.Good beer.

reviews.name: Da Deacon H.
reviews.review: Lo Cater was having a 80's night so after reading some reviews from fellow yelpers we decided to check out this spot...Overall I liked it! Great stage area to accommodate live band and singers. Plenty of seating, 2 full bars, outside patio area with a decent view of the bridge, valet parking and other parking sites that are free within walking distance. Minus one star to the dude at the front door attempting to charge us 10$ even though we had reservations already and there was no for mentioned of a cover charge in thee advertisement SOOO no that wasn't happening on my watch! Food was decent and drinks a fair price, I had the barbecue nachos and my better half had wings along with two beers and one wine concoction I'm not sure what the name was but she hated it and I loved it! Total price $52...not bad in my opinionSo yes I will check out this spot again to hear local talent and partake in the ambiance a lil longer...fan!

reviews.name: Glen G.
reviews.review: Well........we went on april 18, 2014 @ 830The venue is great. The foo was fine. However the patrons and tourists that happen o stop in don't seem to understand that this is a music venue with food, bot a restaurant with a band.  The sound from the bachelorette parties that aren't listening to the musics and are more interested in "woohoo" were jot only rude to the performers, but ALL of the other patrons.  I tried ti talk with the staff and they said they would try to address it with the  servers. One of the singers tried to calm them down as well but it worked for probably 3 min tops. What i would recommend?   Someone with a LRC cafe introduce the artists each night.  As part o that introduction explain that these are songwriters and the venue is about them and celebrating them. In order to so , we ask you keep conversations to a minimum and we may warn you a few times, but if you persist, we may ask you to enjoy the patio outside. Please do this. We will be back. We will bring others. We will try you again, but i it isn't addressed when we return, we simply wont come back.  Update:  (as um un the review when im writing this)They put a powerpoint slide up asking you to min tour conversation. The result:  no change. I truly felt sorry for the performers.

reviews.name: Timmarie D.
reviews.review: Terrible management. 2 times trying to come in we have been treated very poorly. One time we tried coming in at 11pm because the door was still open and the nba finals were on and they very rudely told us they were closed from the table they were all sitting at chatting. From my experience working you are not closed until you lock the door and if you are you apologize not rudely reject people. Then the next time the manager and girl at the front door were not friendly at all! We didn't realize we needed tickets because the sign was posted on the front door who I was covered by people waiting in line so we waited in line for a long time in the wrong line. And they made it seem like it was our fault. After that I suggested they post the notice about the lines elsewhere where it could be seen and the girl completely ignored me and did not apologize. Also someone in our party asked if they could use the bathroom because we were at the front of the line (the wrong one before they sent us to stand in the correct line) and they refused even when she offered to leave her cell phone at the front desk. This was just terrible service. There are so many places to go in Nashville stay away from this one! You will be much happier! Take it from us! The only good thing is the singer's are very talented

reviews.name: Cindy C.
reviews.review: Out of our entire trip to Nashville this was by far our favorite part.  We bought some tickets online ahead of time and it was quick and easy. We got there 20 minutes before the show and were seated right away. The waitress was nice and attentive. The show started 20 minutes late but it was so excellent we didn't mind.  The singers and musicians were awesome and the kids eyes didn't leave the stage. The food was a 4/5. Small portions but good flavors for the most part. Buffalo chips were not good and are the only thing I wouldn't do all over again. The performers were so nice and made themselves available after the show. A Nashville must!!

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: The new location is a definite upgrade! Don't be alarmed about parking because it is now Downtown (off of Broadway) and in the new SoBro district... there is an attached free lot and tons of off-street and affordable lot options that surround this spot. We popped in last night for a low-key hang to celebrate a dear friend's birthday and enjoyed ourselves. Some great music was on the gorgeous stage and the acoustics were certainly on point. The staff and our server were super friendly and made some suggestion off the diverse cocktail menu.... which also happens to include "Skinnies" - drinks under 125 calories. Hello diet-friendly cocktail. Prices were fair on both drinks and bites and I happened to love the layout of this joint. It is spacious yet still offers a cozy vibe. And, I'm absolutely smitten over the rustic lighting fixtures - perhaps I have watched too much of HGTV lately? Either way, this is a great spot for a meal, drinks, catch live music, host an event, or dare I say - to just hang out!I dig it.TIP: The patio offers up pretty sweet views of downtown. Great place to relax and enjoy!

reviews.name: Emese T.
reviews.review: Don't go for the service or the food. The music is good but that's it. It took an hour to getting a drink, the food came out cold. The ribs were tough, the vegetables cold and mushy and the Mac and cheese tasteless. Project 48 were playing and they were energetic and worth the listen.  Our server was uninterested and seemed to be going through the motions.

reviews.name: Steve P.
reviews.review: "It took 5 phone calls, 2 emails, and 25 days to receive a $20 check (not even the entire amount I was overcharged).I paid $25 to park, $22 to get in the door, and $50 for a sandwich and 2 beers to be afforded this experience.Like I said, the music was good and the place was cool, but Nashville is eaten up with cool music places."The place is cool. The music was great. The food was bad.The service was horrendous, and then a few days later I saw where I had been overcharged for more than $20.And, when I say horrendous, I mean nearly 30 minutes before we saw a server (the place was not busy). We saw her when the food came, but never saw her again. We had to flag down someone else to ask for another beer and water, though the water never came. Then, we waited a good bit at the end of the evening trying to catch a glimpse of her to get a check, eventually just going to the front of the place and asking for it. Then, of course, charged $50 on a $24 bill.I talked to a manager by phone who sounded pretty aggravated to field the call. Their calls roll to their personal phones. Service industry don't live in the office...It wasn't the attitude you would expect on calling to report an overcharge, and there was even a tone at one point like I might be making this stuff up or something.I didn't hear back from him for 5 days, at which point I contacted the owner. He was sympathetic and accommodating at first, and agreed to refund the entirety of my bill. I waited for 2 weeks, but the check never came. I contacted him again and he was less than caring.A reply email that he meant to mail it 2 weeks ago; but had an emergency; but actually did just run across it yesterday and it was on its way.The check did arrive after another request, but not only was it not for the entire bill, it was not even for the entire amount of the overcharge. He did include 2 tickets to get in the door; like I would want to experience this again.Both of these guys double-talked so much they couldn't keep it all straight, not for some schmuck like me. It was palpable when you talked to them and evident in their actions.It took 5 phone calls, 2 emails, and 25 days to receive a $20 check (not even the entire amount I was overcharged).I paid $25 to park, $22 to get in the door, and $50 for a sandwich and 2 beers to be afforded this experience.Like I said, the music was good and the place was cool, but Nashville is eaten up with cool music places.Spend your money somewhere else.This place does not care about its patrons; plenty of tourists in Nashville.

reviews.name: H M.
reviews.review: I went to The Listening Room Cafe tonight, and the food was awful--greasy nachos with fake cheese and no salsa, unimpressive mac and cheese, and the so-called "house-smoked seasonal vegetables" consisted of microwaved broccoli and carrots with a sickeningly sweet teriyaki sauce drizzled over them. It is 4 hours later and I am still feeling ill.

reviews.name: Sharmeela S.
reviews.review: Its like a bigger dossier version of the bluebird cafe.  Great performers.  Downtown location. Valet parking.  Great cocktails.  The food is okay.  Eat at the southern or Ichibaninstead and then come here for music and drinks.

reviews.name: D B.
reviews.review: Meh, I'd skip this place for brunch.  Live music doesn't start until 12 (which is really why we came here).  Food was just ok.  Nothing special.  Ordered shrimp and grits.  Shrimp lukewarm and shredded cheese on grits not even melted.  Lobster bisque was terrible.  For the price, I'd head to Southern Steak and Oyster for brunch.

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: Music was pretty good but the service was terrible. Made advance reservations and got there early to be seated in the back with a nonexistent waitress. Felt very snubbed!!

reviews.name: Allie M.
reviews.review: If I were just basing this on the entertainment and format, I would give this a 5-star rating, but when considering the service and food, it drops to a 3-star.We arrived around 7:30 p.m. not knowing how the showings at this place work. From what I gathered, there are a few "shows" each night. They seat for each showing, begin serving, and various musicians play for the next hour and a half to two hours. Our show was set to seat at 8:00 p.m., so the host told us we could either wait 15 minutes or so until the band wrapped up at the bar or outside on their large patio. We opted for outside, since the weather was beautiful. About 15 minutes later I walked over to the door where the host was standing. He commented that the band decided to play a little longer than scheduled. I jokingly said, "Yeah - likely story," to which he responded with attitude that they were "all just a bunch of music loving hippies around here who don't care much for time anyway." SCOFF! Just because I got dressed up that night doesn't mean he should assume that I'm not also a music-loving hippie without much care for time! I normally wouldn't be offended at that kind of remark, but it was his tone of voice when he said it that was offensive.Anyway.We went inside soon after this little incident and proceeded to ask him where we should sit, since it seemed there were reservations to consider. He said we could sit at any table where there were no people, so we headed for one near the stage and sat down. He didn't bring us menus, take our drink order or clear our table.About 15 minutes later, our waiter came. He was seemingly confused as to whether we had hung around from the previous show or if we had just been seated. We told him we just sat and he quickly cleared our table. He asked if we were seated there or if we chose it ourselves. We told him the host said to sit where ever we wanted (he said the host was supposed to seat us). He asked if we got menus or a drink order taken yet. We said neither (apparently the host was supposed to do both these things, too). Luckily, he quickly made up for the service the host was lacking. He brought us our two pints and appetizers relatively quickly, was hot on the water refills, and our entrees came not long after our appies.The show was great, too. I loved the format, having so many acts come on along with a host to tie everything together. All the performers did a great job and it was nice to see so much camaraderie among them - they all seemed to know each other and helped one another out during technical difficulties or if someone needed a fill-in percussionist, etc. It was more like a mini festival inside a super awesome music venue.For your NYers: the venue itself reminded me a lot of The City Winery. There are lots of tables and chairs, standing room near the back, and a decent-sized bar area.Despite the holier-than-thou host, I would still come back here for more great up-and-coming musicians and tasty food, too. Get the fried pickles, but don't get the full size - it's pretty much a pound of pickles.

reviews.name: Frank F.
reviews.review: Absolutely fantastic.  You don't get this kind of vibe many places.  Live music, southern food, full bar, lively crowd.Took my daughter on a Saturday.  Reservations are important; a full restaurant, every table with a great view of the stage.  Four acoustic singer/songwriters sharing the stage, taking turns playing their songs and backing each other up.  Selling CDs from their instrument cases.Food was very good.  4 stars for the food.  Fancy burgers, deep fried pickles, smoked pork chops.  They had lots of other southern food and BBQ on the menu.  Lots of beer choices.I'd give the overall experience 6 stars if I could, so the whole thing gets 5 stars.  We will be back!

reviews.name: Jennette F.
reviews.review: The deviled eggs, fried mushrooms, and sweet potato fries were delicious.  Great music too.  I always bring out of town guests to the Listening Room- for the music, food, and outside dining area.

reviews.name: Betty A.
reviews.review: Get place for a night of music. Even a standing room only event was fun. The bar-b-que was great, yes a little pricy. People should expect to pay for great food, especially when it comes with music on the side. I will be back.

reviews.name: David C.
reviews.review: A very special venue where the music, not the crowd, gets top billing. I really enjoyed the moving performances last night from Rivers Rutherford, Bobby Ham Rick, et. al.

reviews.name: Laura S.
reviews.review: Great great room and vibe.  Food is a little full but not bad.  A much more convenient option than Bluebird but it feels similar.  Very nice staff.  Great music!!'

reviews.name: Steve H.
reviews.review: Great place to hear up-and-comers in the country music business.  I had the pleasure of hearing Bobby Pinson and Friends on a Saturday night.  Great time, even when the band blew a fuse and the lights went out. The food is average, but the music acts are great.

reviews.name: Judi F.
reviews.review: Bottomless mimosa on Sunday! With one to go to boot!

reviews.name: Jesse S.
reviews.review: The staff was very pleasant. I had the eggplant Parmesan. I found it to be too thickly sliced, which meant that the eggplant was not cooked evenly through. I'm a vegetarian and it's clear from the sparse number of options that the place probably specializes in meat, so take my food critique with a grain of salt. The live music was not so good. The music was loud to the point of preventing comfortable conversation where my fiance and I were sitting. So, if it's so loud that it demands attention, it should be a bit more compelling. Overall, I came in with high hopes based on previous reviews and was underwhelmed.

reviews.name: Michelle D.
reviews.review: Attended the grand re-opening last night and thought the venue was amazing!  The line-up stellar - the place was packed!  We had fried pickles, fish tacos and the nashvegas burger - everything was great! My husband tends to be a 'burger snob' and wanted to go back the next day for another one!  The home-made chips are perfect too!!  The owner is wonderful - he stopped and talked with guests all evening!  He is very friendly and approachable.The venue is perfect!

reviews.name: Lori H.
reviews.review: Went here on a weekday evening. Had decent service (the place was dead) and a good burger. Then went here on a Saturday for brunch. Terrible service. Not only was I ignored half the time, but multiple people came in complaining that hey had been waiting at the front for someone to seat them or something but were never acknowledged.  They advertise bottomless bloody Mary's which were mediocre at best (I wasn't expecting amazing out if bottomless). Biscuits and gravy... Well lets just say I've had better at Denny's. Biscuits were dry and chewy and there wasn't enough gravy even if they were moist and fresh.Music: The weekday night was good. They had a songwriters round that wasn't too bad. Saturday they had a pretty good playlist going but then let some guy walk in off the street and start playing. Not sure what that says about their music standards. The guy was decent though.

reviews.name: Emi H.
reviews.review: I would KILL to transport the Listening Room back to Honolulu. I made a reservation for $2 online and got a seat right up front by the stage. Worth it? Um...yes! It's not so much the decor that makes Listening Room amazing but it is the sheer amount of musical talent you're able to watch in Nashville which makes it completely worthwhile.I came here twice to watch songwriter rounds during the Tin Pan South Songwriters Festival and was blown away both times. It's amazing to listen to some of my favorite songs of all time (multiple #1 pop and country hits) sung by the people who took part in writing them. It's always been my dream to be a professional songwriter and having these live musical experiences makes it only more of a reality.My tips if you're deciding to watch a show at the Listening Room is to make reservations online. It's really easy and affordable to reserve seating with a full map of the venue. I wouldn't recommend sitting in the very front simply because the speakers are usually turned up pretty loud and you might go deaf. Instead opt for seating which is midway but still has a good view. The Listening Room is small so you can see the stage from pretty much any point in the room. Another tip is to eat somewhere else unless you enjoy bar food. I ate the beet salad one night which was not good at all, but found the chili to be pretty good the second night. Honestly I just don't think I'm cut out for Nashville fare in general because I'm such a picky eater. The food is a bit lackluster but the staff is very accommodating. They always did a good job of checking up on me and making sure I was able to get a fresh drink. You can find street parking but be prepared with a boatload of quarters or park in the pay lot across the street. It's a bit spendy so do your best to find street parking.Yelp 365 Challenge: #202/365 (The Songwriters Round)

reviews.name: John O.
reviews.review: If singer/song writers are your thing, this is a must place to go.  And it's downtown.The food is good and the performers are excellent.

reviews.name: Jeannie B.
reviews.review: We went to this restaurant for a goodbye brunch for 50+ people. The manager was so confused and the wait staff had no clue how many of us were coming in. They do not have any decanters for coffee. One of our organizers even asked if she could help get the coffee to the group she was told they do not have decanters and can only do one cup at a time. Half the group did not get their drinks. When we first walked in I asked the waitress if they have a gluten free option on the buffet the waitress couldn't even tell me what was on it. Once the buffet was empty they did a terrible job refilling it. They provided menus to our group but then told us that we could not order from the menu. So we paid $18 for an empty buffet. On top of that we had to pay a gratuity of 20%.  Also I saw into the kitchen there was only 1 cook working. I asked the manager if she could run my card and she told me she could not that only a server could.  I find this terrible. I hope that the management reaches out to our group to make it right. Also we had people from all over the world and country there this was their last meal in Nashville and all it did was leave a bad taste in our mouths!

reviews.name: Robert S.
reviews.review: I like this place.  It is a music-oriented bar and restaurant that features bands and musicians who are either recorded or on the cusp of being recorded.  Tables can be reserved online, or one can just show up and take a chance that there are seats.  Unless a well-known artist is playing, there should be tables/seats available.  This is one of the Nashville Originals restaurants which was the reason for my visit.The menu has a variety of American food with a southern touch, including BBQ, fried pickles and green tomatoes, a baked potato selection and more.  My Smoked Pork Steak was hearty and savory and came with house-made chips and a BBQ sauce I used to dip both meat and chips.The service was polite and laid back, like the atmosphere inside this venue.  The music tonight was indie-rock and I've also seen country too.  The mixing could have been a bit better, but the musicianship was very good.Altogether, a place I would come back to and bring friends from out-of-town.

reviews.name: Joan v.
reviews.review: Are you sure you want to risk having beer spilled on you? How is it possible that a place like this would hire people that can't hold on to their drink trays? As the show ended this klutz dumped at least two beers and a couple of glasses of water all over me and table and floor. This guy was so clumsy that after the first dump he proceeded to knock over a bottle of root beer on the table!  I wondered if somehow I had pissed him off somehow and this was his  revenge! But we don't even live here. So management, I hope you will reevaluate who you hire, because you were lucky it was me and not someone that is lawsuit happy. And if you like to hear the lyrics, forget it. It was so loud and acoustically deficient, making the performances less appealing.

reviews.name: Diane M.
reviews.review: Four of us went here for lunch this weekend, or brunch as they call it. I should have known as soon as the waitress said there was no hamburger meat, we should have left, but we stayed and ordered. The inside dining room was empty, and there were a few tables on the deck occupied. After 50 minutes with no food, and a clueless look on the staff person's face when we asked how much longer, we left. This is the first time in my life I walked out of a restaurant due to service. Congratulations Listening Room.

reviews.name: Chris G.
reviews.review: This is actually a really cool place. The parking has easy access, if you got 5 bucks! I went there for a Yelp Elite event and was treated to good music and a very friendly staff. The bartenders were extremely friendly and the place was rustic and cozy.  It's a lot bigger inside than it looks outside thanks to its depth. The music was really good and wasn't overly loud. I had the sliders and they were really good I especially liked the blue cheese burger. The bathrooms were small but clean and the place was busy but still cleared the tables pretty quick. So if your looking for something fun one night that has easy listening music with good food and reasonably priced drinks, this place is worth the stop.

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: The place is shaped like a handgun.  You enter at the handle, the bar is the trigger enclosure, and the stage and main seating area are the barrel.  You might be wanting a gun after some of the musicians play, but probably not.  There was one song I wanted to take their guitar away from them and shoot it, but was otherwise an ok performance when I went.Something to note if you're wanting to drop in for a quick listen is they have a $10 minimum charge on credit cards, I noticed this at one overpriced drink, but had cash so it was not an issue.There're some spaces across the road in a fenced in parking lot.  The bar has its own spaces assigned if I remember correctly, so you can park in there, one thing to note though is that area is a cage, you go in you have to come back out the same way.  Walking you have to go through there.  I only mention this because a long time ago back when Kaz ran what is now the Living Room a man stood there and pretty much all but said he was planning to rob me.  This was a long time ago though.  You have unrestricted view, so you can tell going in or out if someone is planning on barring your path.If you've never been to a songwriter's night before, this is definitely a good place to go acoustically and seatingwise.  Anywhere in there you'll hear it pretty well.My only real complaint of that night was that although the songs were lyrically well written and interesting, the instrument portion always seemed to go back to "strum strum strum chord change strum strum strum chord change", which I understand, these are writers and not performers who have polished the lyrics to perfection, the night came across as "people who write well-versed songs, can sing competently, but are not rocking the music" ... like "here, I wrote these words, let me give them to you in a somewhat repetitive melodic format" - then again, maybe that's just how it goes.Bathrooms are a bit hard to find if you're at the bar, but just go down the gun barrel, and if it looks like you're going through a kitchen make a left before the black curtain and keep on heading back.I'd spin by and check it out again

reviews.name: Ashley W.
reviews.review: We went last weekend during Mardi Gras Y'all. It wasn't very busy at all because we went late in the afternoon. The service was good, the music was great, and the food was amazing! -As to my knowledge there is no children's menu, but you can get a side of mac and cheese for $3.

reviews.name: Dani M.
reviews.review: By far, the best thing my mom and I did in Nashville. Good food, service, and extremely talented performers! Whenever anyone asks what to do in Nashville, this is my first recommendation. If you watch the show "Nashville", this place is very similar to the Bluebird Cafe, the difference is that the Listening Room Cafe is located right downtown Nashville, walking distance from Honky Tonk Row. Perfect place to grab a bite and a drink (or two), and listen to some authentic country music.

reviews.name: S S.
reviews.review: Nice venue. Good music and good food. Plenty of room. Visit this place!

reviews.name: Jennifer R.
reviews.review: Went here last night. Saturday march 1. Was celebrating my b-day. The place was kinda empty it was late. They weren't serving food anymore. And the one drink I had was completely nasty. It was the Aztac drink 11.00 dollars of nasty. The servers were either lazy an rude or tired. We was seated at a table but after 5 mins had to go get my own drink from the bar. First and last time there. Yuck.

reviews.name: Chris P.
reviews.review: Could't get into the Bluebird Cafe so my Girlfriend and I thought we would give this place a try. We were not disappointed, the food, drinks, and music were amazing! Would definitely recommend to anyone looking for the Nashville music scene!

reviews.name: Joe R.
reviews.review: First visit, last visit!   Came for the 9 pm show.  30 minutes and still waiting on a beer.  No take service.  Bartenders are so slow.  Apparently the owners don't care about customers or making money!  Lame, lame, lame service!  Bring a six pack!

reviews.name: Madison G.
reviews.review: What a great place! The staff is all friendly and the music is AMAZING! If you enjoy live original music this is the place for you!

reviews.name: Rachel W.
reviews.review: Listen.  I feel horrible giving one star for anything but this was terrible.  The only thing I liked here was the music, specifically Taylor Dukes. She was phenomenal, but literally everything else was very bad.  My girlfriend ordered a beer and her glass had lip marks on it. I quietly told the bartender and asked for a new one.  I watched her pick up a different glass, hold it up to the light, and put it back to get another one.  BOTH GLASSES WERE DIRTY. No bueno!  We ordered a couple of small plate dishes.  The ravioli was OK, but really, how can you mess up fried ravioli.  The chicken tenders were so dry and cold we asked for another order but don't worry, the new plate was cold too.  After about $30 in small plates of bad food we were still hungry so we ordered two sides of mac and cheese that they basically threw on a blank white plate. Zero presentation, it looked like I went up for seconds at a potluck.  We left immediately and drank a glass of red wine to try and kill any possible foodborne illness that may have been lurking. Thanks but no thanks.

reviews.name: Ray H.
reviews.review: Love this place. Great music, decent beer selection from local breweries, fantastic atmosphere

reviews.name: Rachel W.
reviews.review: Check your tickets here people: 10 + 10 does not equal 22...I don't remember the exact total on our bill but at the end, it was 2 bucks more than what the food and tax added up to be. I'm just saying, if they do this to every check, they're making more money every night because people don't look at their bills...The service here is excellent though and they were super understanding and fixed our bill (even though there was never a real explanation). In fact, the whole night our waiter was delightful. The food was typical bar food. The chicken on my salad was burned, I just tasted charcoal the whole time, and my husbands fish tacos were somehow bland and super peppery at the same time...But, the fried ravioli was delicious. It was a great atmosphere for dinner and entertainment, we'll be back again!

reviews.name: Kelly M.
reviews.review: My friend and I were in Nashville for the weekend and we recommend to this place by our tour guide we had that morning.  This was exactly what we came to Nashville for and it was right downtown.  There were 4 singer/song writer performers that night (we went on a Saturday) and they were all great!  A nice change from the bars on Broadway where you are all cramped and sweaty.  We got a table in the front row and reservations were only $5 for the Saturday show.  Well worth it in my opinion.  I only give it 4 stars as the food was nothing exceptional - stay away from the apple slaw as it was terrible!  Also, if there happens to be a bachelorette party in the room, they tended to be a bit noisy and not really interested in the performance and were sometimes a distraction.  Other than that, if you are looking for some live music from actual songwriters this is a great place!  We had a great time and would recommend it!

reviews.name: Matthew L.
reviews.review: Great place to hear music and plenty of room to accommodate guests. I would go back here on my next trip to Nashville. Try the vegetable and chicken soup. May have been the best meal I had in Nashville. It was that good!

reviews.name: Meredith W.
reviews.review: We had a large group event - 50+ people a few weeks ago that went horribly!  Reservations were made, but the manager never informed his staff of the large group coming in so they were completely unprepared.  They ran our of food on the buffet before even half of our group went through the line and only refilled it ONCE maybe twice and we were there for at least an hour and a half. The brunch buffet was more expensive that was advertised on their website and I wouldn't really classify it as brunch at all.  Bland sausage gravy and biscuits, eggs (if you could get them since they never refilled them), bacon, chicken wings, fruit cup and yogurt. And french toast that was only meh. Unbelievably this southern establishment didn't even have grits anywhere on the buffet - or even on the menu.  It was almost 30 minutes before I received my drink order as well - a half decent sweet tea.  The wait staff was wonderful - doing the best that they could.  But they were understaffed because the manager never told anyone that a large group was coming in.  I left there still hungry and almost $30 lighter in my wallet.  Nashville was a wonderful city, but this restaurant was just the pits.  Save yourself the grief and go to Pucketts's Grocery.  The food was much better and the live music fantastic.

reviews.name: E M.
reviews.review: My rating is for the Saturday brunch.  The items included: fried potato, scrambled eggs, French toast, bacon, sausage patties, and biscuits.  There were also some fresh vegetables and fruits and yogurt.  Food tasted fair, seating is plentiful and atmosphere is excellent, with great music.  Service is slow and friendly.  Really just wasn't worth $18.  If price was $10, may be a three star.

reviews.name: Laurie E.
reviews.review: Very cool place.   4 singer song writers play their best.   Local brews.  Food was okay but who cares.  A great night of fun.   Not so loud that you can't hear your table mates.  A little bit of an older crowd.   30-40 scene. Lots of couples on dates.

reviews.name: Kim Y.
reviews.review: On the way back from a long winters walk from the Frist exihibit to our parking spot my husband and I last minute decided to drop in here to warm up with a quick beer and free music. The good: the bar itself is actually really pretty and the servers seemed friendly. The early show we wandered into was free, yay, love me some free. Oddly enough the coffee the woman next to me was drinking smelt amazing for a bar and the acoustics in the room were nice. The music wasn't so loud you couldn't have a quiet repspectful back and forth with your date and they werent all uptight about it. ::cough, bluebird, cough::The bad: they seemed to be out of everything at 7:30 on a Saturday night. I ended up with a $5 Sam Adams, which seems a little steep for Sam Adams. Not terrible mind you, but high side.They also have limited free parking, but if that is gone you are left to the downtown pay lot wolves.

reviews.name: Marjorie C.
reviews.review: Great fun. Perfect venue. And food was good. I went for the music so good food was a bonus. I had the fish tacos. Very yummy.  Get the coleslaw !!

reviews.name: Phyllis P.
reviews.review: Good food & great music!

reviews.name: Becky C.
reviews.review: I visited The LIstening Room Cafe last week and it was really nice.  I got there pretty early in the evening and enjoyed chatting with the bartender.  It was also two for one drafts so that was nice.  They only offered valet parking which is kind of a bummer, but the guys were nice and when I tipped them seemed surprised.  The writer's circle was good and they had some very talented people playing.  I have been to the BlueBird Cafe and have to say I enjoyed Listening Room more.  They just have a lot more space and that made the night more enjoyable.  I will be back.

reviews.name: Caitlin C.
reviews.review: A cool room to listen to music indeed!I attended a yelp event at this venue and I have to say I quite liked this place. It has a very open feel to it. I think this is in part because all the windows haven't been blacked out or boarded up, you can actually see outside. Apparently it used be to looong and narrow but the new owner knocked some walls down and I have to say that was a very very good choice indeed. We were treated to some freebies including their Velvet Elvis cocktail, chicken tenders and spinach dip. I wasn't blown away by any of them but they were perfect in the 'bar food' sense and I would definitely order the food here if I were attending a show. If you go to Listening Room this week for Yelp Drinks Week you can get yourself some discounted drinks, so check out their calender and go see a show. One of the girls working the bar was very attentive and friendly the night we were there, so I get the feeling that service is a priority for these folks! Which is a plus at any place. Yay!

reviews.name: Julie H.
reviews.review: Stopped in Nashville overnight on way to Fla. wanted a more local experience than Grand Ole Opry... This place exceeded expectations. Listened to 4 talented singer/songwriters. This is a small venue- reservations not required but recommended. Two shows most nights - $12 cover. We sat at table #60 (you choose when you make reservation on line)- it was perfect! They are also a restaurant and the food was good... Had roasted veg sandwich, grilled pimento cheese and fried pickles. We stayed at Union Station Hotel and it was just a short walk to this place

reviews.name: Lisa M.
reviews.review: All around great place.  Great live music, great bar food and great drinks.  Mark is a super friendly bartender!

reviews.name: Damon D.
reviews.review: Not a bunch I can add here to the existing reviews except that SOME of the servers there appear or act to be a little "snobby."  As if they are doing us a favor by visiting and keeping their establishment alive...?  Again, not a major deal, but on a couple of occasions I got that feeling.  Other than that, cool venue, nifty little menu for food and beverages, nicely priced, great outdoor patio, and they bring in some great musicians!  Definitely worth checking out!  The valet option is nice too.

reviews.name: Sasha T.
reviews.review: The Listening Room is one of my favorite places in town to both play music and listen to music. The sound is great no matter what side of the stage you're sitting on, which you can't say for a good chunk of the venues in town. There is plenty of space to make yourself comfortable and the staff is very friendly and attentive no matter where you are in the room. The food is also pretty good. They at least try to add a little bit of creativity to your standard bar food menu. The only thing is depending on the time of day they might be out of some options, but usually whatever your second option might be is just as good as what you originally had in mind.As far as music goes this is a must stop place in town. The talent is amazing on any given night. If you are from out of town looking to hear great local music, add this to your itinerary(not to mention parking is free and not blocks away!). If you're not from out of town, then come stop in and support your local singer/songwriters! You won't be sorry that you did.

reviews.name: Matt H.
reviews.review: For me, this place is as good as it gets. The price of the food was very reasonable for what you get- a live stage show. We had the turkey-apple sandwich thing which was amazing, along with their home-made fries. Service was also outstanding.

reviews.name: Stephen H.
reviews.review: The music was absolutely great! We were only looking for a place for dinner with some music but ended up staying 2.5 hours just to listen to more! The food was good too. I had the mushroom "burger" which was probably the best selection at our table (out of the chicken strips, wings, and turkey sandwich). Service was awesome as well as beer selection.  Four stars instead of five for the small menu and the food could be a bit better.

reviews.name: J N.
reviews.review: First, I'm sorry to be so negative, I am not inclined to be nasty but we are here now with a group of nine and this place is an absolute joke. The music is fine but the service is worse than a third world country, honestly. We waited an hour and a half for French fries and they refused to make cocktails that we ordered and offered bus light instead with no apology. We made a reservation for dinner weeks ago and have been treated so poorly. They eventually explained that they were short staffed but no one attempted to make the situation right. This is my first time in Nashville and I am appalled. I would give negative stars if I could.

reviews.name: Jennifer N.
reviews.review: This live music venue has everything you may want for a night out in music city. Good food, good libations, and friendly and attentive staff. I attended a yelp elite event here. When the music was playing, it wasn't conducive to conversing, but hey this is The Listening Room and not just any bar. We tried the turkey sandwich- a nice mix of turkey, Swiss cheese, bacon and granny smith apples and served with homemade chips. The aptly named Velvet Elvis was a sweet cocktail that sure went down easy!Since The Listening Room is in Cummins Station, parking can be difficult later at night or if there are other events close by, so arrive early.

reviews.name: Michael D.
reviews.review: Decent sandwiches, salads...nice set of musical talent, not too loud...can still talk over the music.  Industrial decor...very open...the apple fritters are unique, and the turkey, bacon, apple crisp sandwich is one-of-a-kind.

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: I went there with a group on the grand opening night and was very impressed with the amount of space. Very comfortable as opposed to the downtown scene. However, they were understaffed for opening night! I don't know how this was possible. There was also a very small selection of beers and didn't have the typical brews. The check in offer says one free bud light, something they didn't even have. Even though we didn't order food it was funny to see the reactions of people around us when their food came out as they busted into cheers. One couple just got up and left before their food came out. If they get the staff thing under control and have a elaborate selection of drinks this place would of got my 5 star review but i just don't understand how you can be so ill prepared for a Saturday. The best part of the whole experience was obviously the music. This is by far (with only one visit) my favorite music spot in Nashville. Here you will find the songwriters for some of the best songs in country music. The night that we were there we heard the song writers for rascal flats. This is a place I would love to try again and give a better review.

reviews.name: Denise T.
reviews.review: I love listening to music here.  The bar food is okay and the beer is a little over priced for me, but the artists who come through here are good for the most part.  I was there last night and it was terrific.  They have a couch close to stage, while there are many tables & also a bar to sit at.Service is pretty good.  I would say eat elsewhere and come here for the music.

reviews.name: Kathy R.
reviews.review: What a great venue! We had a large group there last night to listen to Andy Roadarmel and friends, who had a set from 6-7:30 p.m. Great music, nice menu (much more than just bar food), and friendly, efficient wait staff. A jewel on 2nd Avenue. We will definitely return.Kathy

reviews.name: Erin J.
reviews.review: I'm writing an update because I gave the place another try & was pleased.  I visited again this week on business & although the food still came out a little slow, it tasted very good.  We both ordered the chicken tenders; I got fries & my coworker got sweet potato fries.  Mine was excellent - if you visit this place you really should try the chicken!  I ordered mine with the buffalo sauce on the side & also a side of bleu cheese.  Mighty tasty!I'll also note that the owner contacted me about my first review, wanting to make things right.  I'd already gone back in & had a good experience, and him contacting me makes me want to return even more.  Consider giving this place a try!

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: We went for the AFTRA show and it was absolutely fantastic. The sandwiches were delicious - the turkey not processed, locally baked bread, locally grown produce, great service, good prices, good bar selection. And that's to say nothing of the music and the space. Kids welcomed, but definitely don't bring them if you aren't prepared to leave the second they cramp a musician's set.

reviews.name: S G.
reviews.review: What a great find thanks to yelp.  Easy parking, which is a feat for downtown at lunch hour.  Wings were good. So was Caesar salad.  Banana creme brûlée was worth the visit on its own.  Iced tea a bit weak but still tasty.  Service very friendly.  Prices are reasonable.  I will be back for live music.

reviews.name: Jennie C.
reviews.review: I have had the great pleasure of having dinner at The Listening Room Cafe and we had fabulous food along with great music.  Chris has done an amazing job making it feel welcoming and warm.  It is what you would expect to see when coming to downtown Nashville.   Live entertainment and a wonderful variety of southern home cooked food, with a great selection of Alcohol.  This is a must see spot when coming to Nashville!!  Thanks for the great experience Chris, we will be back!!   -Your Fort Wayne, IN Friend

reviews.name: Chris M.
reviews.review: Really good food. Worth it for the food, not sure about the music. I'm always here during the day. Great coffee too, believe it or not..... $2 for a cup is a bit much, but not much else in Cummings Station.

reviews.name: Susie C.
reviews.review: Really loved this place. We were visiting from NY and couldn't get into the bluebird so we tried the listening room. We loved this place so much we came back on our last night in town. The talent showcased here is unreal. I wish I could remember some of the performers names because I would love to follow their careers. The food was pretty good too. Definitely worth a visit.

reviews.name: Paula W.
reviews.review: Great place to see higher quality music in nashville. Music started at 7pm on Friday with three singer songwriters. One had a big hit song for rascal flatts so this was real talent. Good sound quality. It is a full restaurant with small tables surrounding the stage.  The food is decent.  I suggest the fried pickles.  They have a nice selection of sandwhiches and a few entrees. The greenbeans that i had on the side were exceptional. Sangria was awesome but the music was awesome!  Second band had so much energy and had a maroon 5 vibe. This is a great place if you want great music, solid food, and an actual table while you listen.

reviews.name: Yonnie B.
reviews.review: The drivel I heard tonight was cringeworthy.Which was a pity.  The musicians were all ok with their guitars and had decent vocal ranges.  It's just the lyrics they sang were uniformly of that high school heart break quality.   I'm tolerant and respect people with the gumption to get up and give it a go.  But even then I still thought it was bad.  So maybe tonight was an off night.  But if what I saw tonight was at all representative, my advice is don't come for the music.Food?The burger was made with a cheap bun and a pattie replete with gristle. My chilli was ok but luke warm. The prices would be reasonable if the food was competent but it wasn't.  I'd rather McDonalds.In short, don't come for the music.  Don't stay for the food.

reviews.name: Amanda C.
reviews.review: Great time. Really enjoyed the music and the food. Give the seasoned fries a try. The girls and I went on Wednesday evening. We had a great time. So if you are looking for a week day meeting place, check it out.

reviews.name: H. W.
reviews.review: Decidedly Meh. Granted, I've only been here for lunch, so I can't comment on the nightlife or music. But the food is average at best, the service is standard, and the prices are a little high for lunch. It's one of the better options in Cummins Station, but I wouldn't choose to eat here, otherwise.

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: My husband and I showed up Sun evening when the Listening Room Cafe was hosting a post-St. Pat's Day benefit concert.  The place was pretty empty and they served off a pre-set menu because of the benefit.  Thankfully, we were still able to order brunch which was a run-o-the-mill omelet with hash browns.  There was one solid performer of the three on stage when we arrived.  There was also an organizer who joined in singing a couple songs -- with his blond, permed(?) hair wearing glasses inside, after dark I found him a bit spectacular.  Not sure I'd visit again if I was in the area.

reviews.name: Ryan S.
reviews.review: Awesome Music Food and Killer Food!  They just reopened in a brand new location, a block away from Broadway right downtown.  You never know who you're going to run into at the place.  The live music rounds are always impressive and sound quality is top notch.  The open floor style of the venue is really good too, unlike most places in broadway that are very narrow and overcrowded.  They have live rounds at 6pm and 8pm every night, but after talking to the bartender, I found out they are also open for lunch during the day too starting at 11am and will soon be having artists playing throughout the day as well.  So thats pretty cool and def a spot I'll stop in again and again for lunch!

reviews.name: Shane B.
reviews.review: I was very satisfied with the food at the listening room.  I have been several times and the food has always been cooked correctly and delivered to the table quickly.  It was also great venue to see incredible singer-songwriters.  Will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Sarah M.
reviews.review: I'll pass...... The writers were awesome and amazing!! So, as far as music goes....thumbs up! But, you can get the same writers and performers at all of the music venues. So, as far as compliments go, they go to the artists and not the venue.The food??!! Wha??!! As quoted from TLR's website: "That's why singer/songwriter Chris Blair, who founded The Listening Room Café here in Nashville in 2008, has teamed with one of the best Executive Chefs in Music City to bring you a menu that is just as tasty as our music is toe-tappin'. As owner of Nashville's premiere music venue, Chris wanted to showcase superstars on our stage...and on your plate".Okay so, please tell me who this so-called Executive Chef, is....because Gordon Ramsey, needs to have a serious chat with him!! My taste-buds were definitely NOT happy! The food is subpar at best. Greasy, over-cooked, not hot and/or not cold. We didn't receive what the menu described, romaine lettuce?? Ummm...nope, totally iceburg! Homemade tortilla chips?? Not. Gourmet burgers?? Really??!! Cajun fettuccine....how about mushy store bought. Garlic fries? Have had better at a ballpark for the same price that were actually worth it.  And small portions for sure. I mean REALLY small...pathetic.The owner seemed to be arrogant as well as full of himself..... Not accommodating, nor friendly in the least. And it appeared that his staff is "trained", to bilk the customer.Bottom line.......don't go unless you know who is playing. Otherwise.....you"ll be very disappointed! And at that....just sit there and order free water.......lol!! See what happens!!!

reviews.name: Tart L.
reviews.review: Listening Room Cafe is a premier music venue in the spirit of Bluebird Cafe for music lovers and singer / songwriters. It's twice as big as its Bluebird cousin and you will not be shushed here. Their big balcony patio overlooking the gulch is fine for smoking and chatter. Owner Chris Blair used his singing skills at today's first regular performance in this new Cummins Station downtown music hall. He and his friends did great, but he will mostly stick to running it. The performance style here is often "in the round" style with singers taking turns solo and sometimes in harmony. Some band showcases are planned for future dates in this relatively intimate 200 seat room. A choice of 20 sandwiches and wraps as well as salads and appetizers are yours to enjoy for lunch or during the performances. The daily 7pm shows are free and the 9pm shows are $5 and up. Shows and food are both reasonably priced.

reviews.name: Shellie M.
reviews.review: My Go-to lunch place! Sometimes 2-3 times per week. Salads, specials and sandwiches all at a reasonable price.  Staff is nice and accommodating if you want to make substitutions.  Sometimes crowded but that is to be expected when someplace is good!  Note:  Get there early if you want the special because they run out quickly sometimes.  Favorite is the Bella Blue Sandwich!

reviews.name: Melanie B.
reviews.review: I am shocked I have never reviewed this place given the amount of times I have eaten here. I know all the employees by first name. I love that this place is a mom and pop shop. The prices are very reasonable for what you get. Also, everything tastes so FRESH! Know why? Because it IS! I love how I go in there and create my own salad. I did it so much they saved my order for me. Great customer service! My faves? They seriously have the best egg salad and pimento cheese sandwiches I have ever had. The snickerdoodle cookie made by pastry chef Amy are mouthwatering. I dream about them at night.

reviews.name: Mark R.
reviews.review: Went to this place for the first time yesterday and will be going back again many times in the future. I had a terrific roast beef sandwich and corn chowder. Great staff. Lisa, the owner clearly is passionate about serving great food. Can't wait to try some other offerings. For such a reasonable price, you'd be hard pressed to find a lunch spot with fresher, tastier ingredients

reviews.name: Blair S.
reviews.review: I had a good sandwich, the "Edmonson," roast beef with tasty herb cream cheese. It was a nice alternative to salty chain sandwich shops. The Itallian wedding soup was not bad but not noteworthy. The price was quite reasonable. My food was pretty quick once I ordered, but the ordering was a sloooow. A second register or faster register and faster operator would help gain another star.I'll be back to try some of the really tempting looking pastries.

reviews.name: Amanda C.
reviews.review: I have not had a spec of food from this place but they saved me from a melt down last Thursday.  Coffee....all I wanted was coffee.  Good coffee.  Wonderful coffee.  Wait...ROAST INC IS CLOSED!  What!?My mind was close to shutting down when I walked into this place and said, "Please tell me you have coffee!"  "Yes, just black", she replied.Happiness and Headache averted.  Thank you Unique Flavors Cafe.  Thank you.

reviews.name: Nicholas R.
reviews.review: Delicious sandwich, get the Steeplechase if you are a fan of brie and fruit. The decor is great, nice couch and furniture. Tons of space. My only qualms is that I wish there were more coffee options. I guess I should have gone for tea and gotten coded at Roast, Inc. Next door.

reviews.name: Claire R.
reviews.review: The food was very good. Curried chicken salad wrap and a turkey and avocado sandwich.  However the staff is rude.  They have free wi-fi and my friend left for a meeting.  I got my laptop out to work but they clearly thought I was overstaying my welcome, making audible comments.  At no time was there a wait for tables, so I was uncertain as to why they cared, but I would not recommend this place if you're looking for friendly employees.

reviews.name: H S.
reviews.review: Unique Flavors makes an extra, extra good pimento cheese sandwich.Not too much mayo, good quality cheese and a pickle spear on the side-if you are into pimento cheese you will most likely be into their version. Great stuff!Pros:* Amazing pimento cheese!* Other sandwiches that my non-pimento-cheese-eating friends tell me are great* Yummy cookies* Cute, quaint dining room* They will toast the bread for that pimento cheese sandwich. If you're into thatCons:* Location-unless you live in Crieve Hall, in which case this would be a definite pro.

reviews.name: Rachael Anne E.
reviews.review: My favorite place to grab a sandwich for lunch.(The chicken salad is my favorite.) I'd go for dinner, but they are only open till 3pm and on weekdays. They have a different special on a daily basis and all are good.  (The chick pea pasta sticks out as a favorite.) The names of all the sandwiches are based on Crieve Hall, which can be amusing if you live in the neighborhood. The service is friendly and the owner is a trained pastry chef. They have delicious desserts, I always end up with one or more.

reviews.name: doug d.
reviews.review: I love this simple place and frequent at least once a week.Basics:  Soups, Salads, Sanwiches and daily specials. Soup and Pasta changes weekly.  Also some nice baked goods (scones!!!)Pros:Large array of sandwich options, my fav is their incredible egg salad.Sandwich bread is freshest I have ever had.Some of their specials (changes daily) are truly incredible... too many to list, but what stands out to me is the curried lentils.Nice clean atmosphere, fairly quiet unless alot of people in there.Fast service.Wonderful people running the place.Cons:uh, hard to think of any...  oh! they close at like 3pm, so it is impossible to stop after work to pick up take home... maybe if they had a wider selection of hot tea's and coffee's it would be nice.If you are in the mood for this type of food, this is the place.

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: Great sandwiches and salads.  Very fresh ingredients.

reviews.name: Andy S.
reviews.review: We discovered this place by a complete accident.  We were heading towards another destination, when I saw this place.  You couldn't miss the smoke coming out of the smoker.  The prices on the sign were cheap as well.  We were hungry, so we decided we had to try it.  It was around 5:00pm, and they were out of many of their signature items.  I tried to get the gizzards and the shoulder sandwich, but he had already run out.  I settled on the leg quarter, when he said he thought he had one or two left, and the greens.  Then my friend asked what was the best thing, and he said the rib sandwich (which was not on the menu).  He said it was the best on Jefferson St, and probably in Nashville, and that if we didn't like, he would give us whatever we wanted.  Therefore I had to change my order and add that sandwich.  In the end, we ended up with a rib sandwich, which was huge.  There were two pieces of bread laying next to each other and the ribs spanned both slices.  We also had an order of okra, an order of mac n' cheese, two orders of greens.  We also had two leg quarter sandwiches.  This was too much food for two people, even though we finished it off.  And the best part was the price.  The total price for everything was on $12.50.  The ribs were as good as he said.  They had clearly been smoking all day, as all the fat had been rendered into the meat.  The ribs had that beautiful pink smoked color and were fall off the bone.  The leg quarter sandwiches were also delicious and full of that smoked flavor.  The sides were all good, but not as awesome as the meat.  We were unable to eat at the location, which is really just a food truck.  So, be prepared to take it somewhere else.

reviews.name: Hannah H.
reviews.review: What a find! Mayo's Fried Pies and Mahalia Jackson's Chicken was founded by E.W. Mayo, and it was a tribute to his favorite singer.  They are known to serve up chicken livers and fried pies.  We had the opportunity to talk with the owner as well as Mr. Rasheed, the head cook/chef of the place.  It's a small little shack, and you might just miss it if you're not on the lookout!  I tried out their chicken gizzards (deliciously battered and fried, great with the Louisiana hot sauce they sprinkle on top for you), and my sister had their BBQ grilled leg quarter sandwich (between 2 pieces of white bread and some pickles) - very moist, delicious, and a great sweet BBQ sauce with a grilled taste!  We also tried a side of their baked beans, and that was also delicious as well - yummy! We had to come back again for the homemade pies (offered in peach, apple, and sweet potato); they fry them up for you, and my favorite was the apple one - crispy crust and the filling of diced cinnamon apples - yum!  They are kind of small, so think of a rectangular empanada size.  There's a picnic table off to the side, but most people seem to be coming in for a carry-out or a drive-thru.  Definitely a local and a hidden gem, check them out! :D+ask for Mr. Rasheed :D+Homemade pies (cinnamon apples!!!)+BBQ grilled leg quarter (chicken)+chicken gizzards

reviews.name: Jessica Y.
reviews.review: I read about Mayo's in WildSam's Nashville travel guide, and it immediately became a "must-do" item on our itinerary. My sister and I get a little overenthusiastic about food, so we hurried on over to Mayo's in a panic when we realized they had opened for the day. Keep your eyes peeled - it's a blink-and-you'll-miss-it kind of joint. Unfortunately, Mr. Rasheed (the head chef) told us that they were all out of their famous hand pies, but that the owner would be delivering some more in an hour. We ordered the BBQ chicken sandwich (savory big drumstick served between 2 slices of white bread with pickles) and the gizzards (I didn't go near these, but my sis said they were tasty). We let Mr. Rasheed know that we'd be back later for the pies, and did some more exploring. Well, when we went back, the hand pies still hadn't been delivered - Mr. Rasheed felt bad so he told us to come back after lunch, and that he's make sure he set some pies aside for us, and give them to us free of charge. How nice of him! He stuck true to his word, when we came back later, we were treated to an apple pie and peach pie. The hand pies are long and rectangular in shape, and were piping hot. The apple one was my favorite, but the peach was also really good. We even got to meet the owner, who was very friendly. He got a kick out of the WildSam guide I showed him - he was famous! I highly recommend Mayo's for an "off-the-road" dining option. Don't forget to try some of the other items on the menu!

reviews.name: Tin N.
reviews.review: If you compare this humble BBQ shack to most BBQ establishments throughout Nashville, it would probably get about 4 solid stars. But keeping the review relative to the fact that it's a tiny shack with a pretty inefficient drive through (lol), it easily deserves 5 stars.The prices are ridiculously low, but all the meats are cooked on an open flame in an outdoor charcoal grill. Needless to say, the food is great. I suggest calling in ahead and placing your order. Otherwise you'll have to use its odd drive through system. Most drive thrus at restaurants work well because fast food is relatively FAST. Given that most of the items here take about 15-20 minutes to cook upon receiving your order, the drive thru here ends up being a game of shuffling and rearranging the cars.I did not mind waiting though. The scent of burning charcoal while waiting for my food brought back memories of weekly bonfires at the beach in California.The fried okra and french fries could have been crunchier, but both were well seasoned. The grilled chicken was flavorful and juicy ($0.99 per leg quarter!). You'll need to eat two portions to be full though.I will be back, especially since it's so close to the hospital.

reviews.name: Carla T.
reviews.review: I just wrote the best review in full detail all the way down to the herbs i tasted on my $1 leg quarter sandwich. but with the slip of a renegade pinky, i accidentally deleted it. So all imma say is "dont let the looks of this place fool ya"! It is great food, cooked just right. I felt good walking away as i heard the chef say to his customer " the lord told us to go out and feed the people, and thats what im going to do".  Yes sir, and god bless you, and your lil resturaumt!

reviews.name: C.C W.
reviews.review: Sorry to leave a crappy comment but I purchased two hot dogs a few days ago and was extremely disappointed. I had heard so much good news about this place from classmates so I don't know why my visit was total different. I waited 25 minutes for two hot dogs and when I got home to eat them they were hard as a rock! I'm glad I didn't bite into it I probably would've broken a tooth. That was my first and last visit.

reviews.name: ALEXIS P.
reviews.review: Absolutely the best fried pies I have ever had.  The apple is incredible.The chicken's pretty good too. I think this place could be huge in a high traffic area like 12th South or 5 Points.  A taco-truck setup would also be so fun.

reviews.name: Daniel S.
reviews.review: I enjoyed our experience here. Our server was very nice and the food came out very quickly. I had a beef enchilada and a beef taco (#12 lunch special - $6.99 - awesome price). The quality of the food is standard. The enchiladas were fine but very lightly sauced. The chips were warm but I don't think they were fresh. The guacamole was moderate as well. You can choose between standard and fresh guac - we chose standard to save a couple buck$. We should have sprung for the better stuff. Overall - I would come here again. Don't judge the book by its cover. The sign outside is dilapidated and dated. I was pleasantly surprised by the authentic Mexican atmosphere and very pleased with the fantastic and prompt service. Great for a quick lunch, not for a first date.

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: Easily and by far the best Mexican food restaurant in West Nashville, and definitely amongst the top in the greater Nashville area!!I give Tequila's credit for balancing true authenticity with Americanized cheap Mexican fare, which is saying a lot considering the dearth of authentic Mexican fare in Nashville. Do not judge this restaurant by its exterior. Tequila's is located in the corner of a less-frequented strip mall with a bowling alley and a discount home place, but the interior is dimly lit and cozy- great for dates. The waitstaff is excellent and you can tell they take great pride in the quality of their food, which they should.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: It had been a really long time since I'd eaten at Tequila's and I gave them another try on Saturday.We ordered cheese dip like any good American, and it was perfect! Good consistency; not too runny, and the flavor was great! I loved the salsa but it was in a really tiny dish and we had to ask for a lot more of it! I love hot salsa, and this one was pretty hot. If you aren't a fan of heat, this would be too much for you and you should probably ask for a mild salsa. But I loved it! For entrees I ended up ordering off the a la carte menu and had a bean burrito. It was fantastic! The beans were very good and it had the perfect amount of cheese and red sauce on top. Yum! I also tried a drink of the margaritas on the rocks and they were very good and reasonably priced too! Overall it was a good meal and service was fine with the exception of a weird/funny incident with our server. I went to the bathroom after we had paid and was going to meet my friends outside. Our server stopped me from the bathroom and asked where his pens were. I was confused and didn't pay because my BF picked up the tab. He kept on saying "I need those pens, ask your friends if they took them!!" So I went outside and asked... apparently he had also stopped my BF asking him where his pens were. They were all left in the check holders on the table! Ha. Another staff member came outside not long after and told us not to worry, apparently our waiter thought we stole his pens before looking and it was a big deal. That was a first! Great Mexican joint close to Nashville West, just don't take the pens!!

reviews.name: Colleen B.
reviews.review: Place is much bigger than it looks.  Our pitcher of strawberry margaritas didn't have any alcohol in it--delicious but everyone agreed, no alcohol.  Server polite, English was difficult and he didn't understand our questions.  Food came within minutes, incredibly fast.  Nice sized portions, delicious and reasonably priced.  We will return but won't order any mixed drinks.  Nice atmosphere, clean.  Food was wonderful.

reviews.name: Beth G.
reviews.review: My second favorite Mexican eating establishment in the west side. The staff servers and bartenders were very considerate an helpful. We heard about this place at another place so decided to stop in and we were so pleased we did. Came on a Saturday lunch. Friend has the burrito, really great red sauce and salsa. Also had the nachos. The red sauce and the considerate servers will keep is coming back. Parking I lot and is easy. Enjoyed this place.

reviews.name: Nakita S.
reviews.review: We happen to live very close to the area, and happened to know a few folks from where we live- so this might be a bias review---- however! The food? First class homemade, the customer service?? First class fast. The people? You gotta know em. It's the place to be. I am proud t be a part of the neighborhood cuz not only is the food amazing, but the folks who work here are down for a personal connection. A++ all the way.

reviews.name: Micah C.
reviews.review: I had the flautas and my hubby had a burrito. I'm proud to say that I was the best picker this go around. Typically,  I end up liking his meals better than mine. Everyone talked about the cheese dip so we got some. I'm spoiled by oklahoma mexican Restaurants bc queso is like salsa and they just give it to you, but even so, it's worth getting the cheese dip. About a 25 dollar ordeal for 2 meals and the dip. Something I really liked are the generous portions of guac and sour cream! I'd go again. If I lived here!

reviews.name: Ken J.
reviews.review: My wife and mother-in-law are authorities on Mexican food, and they concur that this is the best in Nashville. Not only that, but the staff is charming and professional, and they make sure you get a pitcher of their delicious margaritas when it will save you money. The cherry on top? They serve the MOLCAJETE!

reviews.name: Cherryll T.
reviews.review: Tequila's was a great choice to try. We're staying in Nashville area..so we're on a discovery trail. We were seated immediately, waiter greeted us and then got our very good margaritas. The salsa had a great kick! We chose fajitas...very tender shrimp, beef & chicken. Our waiter was fast & attentive. We would go back again. Glad we stopped.

reviews.name: Caleb C.
reviews.review: This is my go to Mexican restaurant in Nashville. Always great food and great service.

reviews.name: Tiffinney R.
reviews.review: This place is awesome! This is by far the best Mexican restaurant around. I love their cheese dip! They have good cheese fries!  Everything is so good here. I love this place and it's right around the corner from my house. I can call and order and the food is done rather quickly.

reviews.name: Eric E.
reviews.review: This place has hit the skids! Used to be so good. Now bland, low quality, and hurried. Service tonight was almost as bad as the food. I'm out.

reviews.name: Katie I.
reviews.review: There are very few "cheap" Mexican places I like these days. It used to be Las Palmas, but they've gone downhill. Nacho's in Bellevue is decent, and now there is Tequila's. The standout here is the shrimp. Huge, giant, grilled shrimp can come a myriad of ways. Many times they have a special on the white board. Get it.  Since I try to do the no white flour/low carb thing, I usually get the Camarones Cancun which are perfectly grilled shrimp, pineapples, peppers and onions all mixed with their queso- yep- sounds crazy, but it's delish! Comes with rice. Rice is decent, not a fan of the beans. Tacos are solid. There is a pretty big selection of your standard combo specials and entrees. I wouldn't say they are "cheap" but it's reasonably priced and one of our go-to "cheap" Mexican places.

reviews.name: Kaleena 'Kala' H.
reviews.review: Mainly went here with my husband and some friends for a friend's birthday dinner. I really loved the decor...it seemed a little more modern than a regular Mexican food restaurant. The staff was very welcoming and the waiters for our table were awesome. I wasn't too hungry, so I only ordered a grilled chicken quesadilla and a bowl of cheese dip to split with my husband. Both were delicious! The only thing I didn't care for were the prices...we paid nearly $6 for my quesadilla, when I have gotten it cheaper at other restaurants.  However, I will gladly come back!

reviews.name: Royal R.
reviews.review: The food is great.  The service was fast to refill my drinks and to bring out my meal. I will be returning soon.

reviews.name: Joe M.
reviews.review: The food was good. If you want hot Mexican ask for it. Otherwise your getting the same food at the grocery store.

reviews.name: Ferdinand C.
reviews.review: Have frequented Tequila's for many years, but I'm sad to say it's going down hill. There's all new staff in there these days, which may have a lot to do with it. Tonight there was miscommunication about a vegetarian fajita burrito order with the waiter. What arrived was a flour tortilla filled almost entirely with onions, beans and rice were on the side.
