Gross, but miscommunications are not fatal, was hoping to have the kitchen readjust the burrito. However, the waiter became argumentative with me, taking no culpability for the miscommunication. Even the manager treated me like a schmuck. They did eventually offer me something else, but I declined - I'll never take food from an angered food staff!Sorry to say that after over 50 trips to my favorite local Mexican place, this experience turned me and I will not ever be going back.

reviews.name: Benjamin S.
reviews.review: Went here with some friends for a birthday dinner and I was blown away. While a little pricier than most mexican restaurants they give you a huge amount of food for what you pay. Also, while their menu selection is smaller, they have a pick 2 or pick 3 combo option where you can choose from any combination made up of burrito, taco, chili relleno, enchilada, quessadilla, chalupa,  tostada and tamale. And regardless of the combination you get beans and rice, plus you can add their yummy queso on-top of your food for 99 cents extra. When you stop and consider the different varieties each item typically comes in (chicken, beef, cheese, etc...) and factor it in to the possible combinations, who needs a combo menu! This is pure genius and so delicious.And the cheese, oh the cheese. I could not get enough of the queso, so I had queso on my beans (they come with it), queso on my rice, queso on my quesadilla and of course... Cheese enchiladas topped with queso..... I had the most wonderful food coma after finishing my meal and look forward to the next one. This is easily one of my top 5 Mexican restaurants, possibly top 3.

reviews.name: Matt H.
reviews.review: The food is beyond good. They also have a better variety of vegetarian options than most Mexican restaurants. Just all around really good!

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: One of the most pleasant surprises I've experienced in Nashville to date...I was dragged here by my fiance, who wanted to try something new and different for lunch.  I was running errands in the Nashville West shopping center and told him to pick a place nearby to meet.  When he suggested Tequila's I hesitantly agreed, thinking the place would be the normal subpar Tex-Mex joint Nashville seems to have plenty of.When I walked in, I was immediately greeted by a friendly host, who offered a very genuine "Hola, Amiga!"  My fiance was already seated and halfway through a basked of chips and salsa.  He told me I needed to try some immediately, as they are the best he's had in Nashville so far, and I am a chips and salsa fanatic.  He was right!  The salsa is flavorful, with a good amount of tang and spice, and the chips were warm and fresh.  Tequila's had me right there.I ordered chicken fajitas for lunch, and they were served within 10 minutes of ordering, piping hot and sizzling on an iron pan.  The chicken was moist and very tasty, the portions of meat and veggies were both plentiful, and the tortillas were fresh and delicious.  My only complaint was that I asked that the fajitas be prepared with little to no oil, and they came out a little oiler than I would have liked.  Nothing some napkins couldn't fix!  My fiance enjoyed his soft tacos, though far preferred my fajitas.With tip, we thoroughly enjoyed our lunch for $20.  You simply can't beat the price for the quality and quantity of food you receive.  We'll definitely be back!

reviews.name: Brandon F.
reviews.review: I'm giving this place 4 stars for one reason. It was way better then I expected. My girlfriend and I were looking for a New Mexican restaurant and saw this on yelp. We knew where it was and thought it would be a shady place. The shopping center it's in has that sort of appearance and vibe but being adventitious we decided to try it anyways. When we walked in I was pleasantly surprised with how clean and friendly the staff was. The food was like most Mexican I have encountered in Nashville and frankly I like El Stuffed Pepper or Rose Pepper better but over all everything was pleasant and the food wasn't bad. If your feeling adventurous and can't make up your mind like my girlfriend and I then take a chance on this place. I think you'll be surprised like we were.

reviews.name: Nick D.
reviews.review: OK.... I live right by this place. Have been countless times. It's always been a decent place to get Mexican food on the west side. I'm still waiting for a GREAT Mexican joint to pop up over here. I've tried them all. No one is great :( Food here is just ok. Margaritas are not that good. They're the cheap green stuff that's watered down. Chips and salsa... just ok. These would all normally be reasons to not go back to a certain place but b/c of the lack of any good Mexican restaurants in the area and the fact we live super close, we kept going back. The main reason I'm not going back is the lack of customer service. A good restaurant recognizes repeat customers and should treat them as such. I'm not saying anyone deserves free food or anything but a genuine appreciation would be nice. My family and I never got it here. Sometimes we would come with a big group of friends and it seemed like they were upset we were there?! We've never not tipped well or anything like that that would justify this attitude.  After a few more bad experiences with the staff we've just decided not to go back here.

reviews.name: Debbie B.
reviews.review: In visiting Nashville I relied on Yelp to take me to Mexican food - and Tequila's consistently had great reviews. Glad we followed recommendations! Tequila's had perfect service - amazing salsa - and the food was super yummy. You can't go wrong! Venture out and enjoy the margaritas!!

reviews.name: Jason P.
reviews.review: Took my wife and kids here tonight for the first time and will not ever go back. Food was normal Mexican food but the service was awful. It wasn't crowed for a Saturday night either. The waiter never refilled our drinks and my wife and kids went to the car as I waited 20 mins on check and I repeatly asked for it! Don't waste your time!

reviews.name: Randy P.
reviews.review: Awesome food and great service.  Will back if I'm ever this way again.  Best I have had in a while.  Salsa was nice and hot too.  I think most will enjoy it.

reviews.name: John W.
reviews.review: There are three kinds of Mexican restaurants: the large chains that are tex-mex (at best); the cookie cutter restaurants; and, finally, restaurants like Tequilas.It has the items you expect from any decent neighborhood Mexican restaurant. But the menu is decidedly different from the run-of-the mill places, with a lot of unique takes on the old standards. There are also things that Tequilas does unique from other restaurants.Finally, one thing that sets a Mexican restaurant apart is its salsa. Tequila's salsa is just spicy enough, with good texture and flavor.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: In the south there is a term "Fair to Middlin'".  I suppose this pretty adequately sums up Tequila's. Once you get past the fact that the seats are very hard and the table and booths seem to be on ice, scooting around despite your best efforts to keep them in place (When I went to leave I almost took the booth out the door with me).Service was good, but the menu warns that each table gets TWO helpings of Chips.  I'm not sure if they are sticklers for this or if its just on there to prevent you from having an "All You Can Eat Chip Buffet."The Fried Burritos would appear to be the signature dish, and I was not disappointed in them.  They didn't particularly blow me away, but I found them to be satisfactory.If you are in the mood for a burrito, but really wish it was fried.  This is your stop.

reviews.name: Sissy D.
reviews.review: This was my first time at this place, I was over at Costco and thought I'd see if this was a find for authentic inspired Mexican food.....and it was a BIG NO.Everything is straight up out of a darn Sysco bag/can. No inspiration or creativity at all! A pile of mass produced crap smothered in copious- barely melted  amounts of cheese. I think they try to hide the bad food with cheese!Try Chuy's (where they actually make their tortillas, their poblanos are to die for, and they have 4-5 unique sauces to choose from! At least Chuy's has a little imaginationHow stupid do some of these restaurants think we Joe public are? I mean its pretty obvious what Tequilas serves is crap.And the waiters here are to consumed with hitting on young teen aged girls and trying to get a lay lined up for the night. Yeah I saw that today.I wont be back. It really sucked. Dont waste your money.I've had better back in my middle school cafeteria.

reviews.name: Christi R.
reviews.review: Great food. Great margaritas. Great service.

reviews.name: Terrell L.
reviews.review: The vegetarian plate was good, I stopped in late in the evening for dinner and was served quickly at the bar.Chips & Salsa with a cold Cerveza while watching soccer on TV, life is pretty darn good.

reviews.name: Stephen L.
reviews.review: This place is killer! The salsa is great! The service is excellent! One of my favorite Mexican places in Nashville! I have never had anything here I didn't like and there is a patio.

reviews.name: Robert A.
reviews.review: This restaurant opened a few years ago. It's tucked into a corner of a shopping plaza, so I overlooked it at first. I finally went in after it had been open for a few months. The food was excellent then and has continued to be of the best quality every single time I go there. And because of it's location, I still often overlook it and every time I eat there, the food is great. I highly recommend you go there.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: Same sh!t.  Different day.  Margarita tasted like they melted salt water and poured it in the drink instead of tequila.   The fajita's were actually decent.  But nothing to go brag about.  I was disappointed because based on reviews it seemed this place had some LEGIT mexican food.  But yet again it was another Tex Mex place, that when I asked for a Chorizo Taco, he shook his head and said sorry, no we don't have that.  Really?   I will not return.I will say that the service was great and they were very attentive.

reviews.name: G. L.
reviews.review: Tequilas has been my new favorite Mexican restaurant since the first time I went there, but I can't say much about the menu because I always order the same thing--chicken fajitas.  I love 'em, and Tequilas does them so right I crave them.  Well flavored and the veggies are always cooked just right.  Friends who order other things always finish their plate and compliment the food, so I assume that it's all good.   I don't usually eat chips and salsa while waiting for food, but their salsa is good enough to have changed my ways.  So lets get to the real reason I go there: the margaritas :-D  I prefer mine top shelf, on the rocks, no salt, and they're so good I always have a second.  The atmosphere is fun, staff super friendly (they always remember my name!), and the place is clean.  Don't let the restaurant's proximity to Dollar General and a bowling alley stop you from going---it's definitely worth a trip.  They also have a back room that I've been told can be reserved for large parties.

reviews.name: Angela F.
reviews.review: Best steak chimichangas in town! The food is amazing, fresh and very affordable.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I've been a regular here for several years, and cannot say enough positive things about Tequila's. The owner and staff are so accommodating, and the dishes are consistently tasty! My personal favorite is the chicken soup, washed down with a margarita (or two), and a crunchy taco (or two). It's a little bit of a drive for me, but I'll gladly make the commute to get my fix!

reviews.name: Melissa G.
reviews.review: Good luck getting seated. My boyfriend and I walked in and asked for a table for two. The rude, what appeared to be 15 year old hostess held up her finger and told us to hang on a sec. She walked away to set up a table for a large group who was waiting. While she was setting up the table, another couple walked in, and the girl at the cash register asked how many and she sat them immediately while we stood there right in front of her. We continued to wait while the original hostess came back and began speaking to what appeared to be the manager. After standing there awkwardly for probably another two minutes, we decided to leave. RUDEST SERVICE EVER.

reviews.name: Richard C.
reviews.review: I grew up near Dallas, TX and ate Tex-Mex all the time...this is THE BEST MEXICAN FOOD I've found in Nashville so far. The regular stand-bys : Chuys, Las Palmas, Cinco De Mayo, just don't even compare. The prices are good, the service great, it looks like a hole in the wall from the outside, but once you step inside you'll see...this real mexican food the way it should be! Get the combo plate and choose your favorites. I ordered chicken burrito, chicken chille relleno, and chicken quesadilla with beans and rice only $10! Simply the best flavor and perfectly cooked, especially the quesadilla, light and crisp, but not oily or greasy. These guys know what they're doing, I'm going back....

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: Yum!  The bf and I came here for dinner on halloween weekend and enjoyed delicious Mexican food.  I loved the quesidillas I ordered and the chips and salsa were solid.  The employees were decked out for the holiday and one of them tried (somewhat unsuccessfully) to scare me, which was pretty fun.  Great service, reasonably priced, and I've heard they make a damn good margarita, though I haven't tested that out myself just yet.

reviews.name: adrian E.
reviews.review: Watch out momma you are going to get slapped!... Really, it was that good. So let me tell the story. First, mad props to Yelp.com because this is the first restaurant that i have ever been to solely on the recommendation of this site. It was lunch time today and we were working in bell Meade and we were low on cash. In Richy rich-ville that means your options are limited. So i typed in the filter; cheap, close and good. this was the #1 result that popped up so off we went. I was their first customer of the day and was sat by the kitchen door. I knew i was in for an adventure when I immediately heard all the employees inside the kitchen give out a massive Aztec battle cry to start their shift. Then our waiter instantly appeared with chips and salsa. I was fully prepared to order their $6.00 lunch portion of fajitas when i tasted the salsa. "WOW, this place may have some real potential". That is what i thought when i decided to jump into the deep end of the menu and order the $12 palliadia mexicana fajitas. [sorry about spelling there]. It was wonderful. the churizzo was very spicy. the pork was very tender and the carney asada was not overdone. My friend also ordered the fiesta chicken and said it was awesome. I did not taste his food but the presentation was pretty with very festive use of red and green peppers. Our waiter did his job well by giving me at least 5 drink refills plus refills on the chips and salsa. the only negative was the food took 14 minutes to get to the table after we ordered it but i was understanding because they were just opening. Believe me when i say this is a place that i want to go back to with other friends and say "LOOK WHAT I FOUND"

reviews.name: Brian N.
reviews.review: I've been coming to Tequila's now for a year or so, maybe longer. I live very close so I was excited to see a Mexican place that close to home when they opened.I can give a pretty fair review now that I have tried many items on the menu.  Fajitas - they're always good, with good quality meat, tender, juicy and flavorful. My favorite version is the Parillada Mexicana which comes with chorizo, chicken, steak, and shrimp and a carnita, along with the normal grilled veggies.  I will say that sometimes the carnita that comes with this is a bit dry and tough and sometimes the shrimp are overcooked, but overall this is still my favorite fajita dish. (When I say sometimes, I would say out of 7 orders it may have happened twice)The normal carnitas however are always top notch. I think the difference may be that the carnita on the fajita plate gets a bit of extra cooking time being in with the fajita mix and on that hot griddle plate)They also have a spinach burrito dish that is excellent if you're vegetarian. It's creamy and rich with cheese. It comes with two and is great with a guacamole salad. (lettuce, tomato, guac)I also enjoy the fish tacos, they are not fried but grilled and have a nice kick to them. If you want it HOT like I do, you can ask them to cook the fish in the diablo sauce which to me, is still not "set you on fire" hot, but others would disagree. I have a pretty high threshold for what most would consider hot.For a different type of lunch I ordered the Huevos Con Chorizo (Eggs with Mexican sausage) which comes with rice and beans, and found it to be great!  Light because of the eggs, but extremely tasty due to the chorizo being scrambled with the eggs.Their guacamole and salsas are always very fresh as well as the chips.Tequila's does a great job of offering the standard Mexican fare those in the US are accustomed to, but also has some items that lean more towards authentic Mexican. The one thing that is missing from the menu (and usually is on most Mexican joints) is a good Mole.  If they could add a good Mole chicken dish, I would be in heaven.  As I've said in previous reviews I'm a bit stingy with stars so very few joints get 5 from me, but Tequilas has always been a solid 4.They have a great and friendly staff, the food is never disappointing, and their prices are very reasonable. You can eat for under $10 easily, or you can get a large meal for between $10.00 and $16.00.If you live in, or are close to West Nashville, it's by far the best Mexican place you can find. And if you're looking for entertainment on the weekends, they do music and karaoke. (or at least they have been)They have a patio you can enjoy and a large back room for larger/private parties.

reviews.name: Westnashy Y.
reviews.review: Tequilas does the normal stuff but there are exceptions, they let the real Mexican come out sometimes. fish tacos, yes.  the fajitas carabenas are good, the hot salsa (not served on the table you have to ask for it)  is authentic and the enchilada sauce is yummy. I think the owners are from Guerrero originally, which is on the west coast of Mexico. check it out.

reviews.name: Matt C.
reviews.review: Tequlia's is a hidden gem. I've eaten here about 7 times now and its become my favorite mexican restaurant in town. If you go, try the Chef's special, a ribeye stuffed with chorizo mash potatoes. Its so good! The 5 different fajita combinations are also great. The wait staff is alway very friendly and the owner is excepional.

reviews.name: Sasha T.
reviews.review: This review is long overdue considering my husband and I have been eating here once a week for who knows how long now. This place is by far my favorite Mexican restaurant in Nashville. I think we've tried one of almost everything on the menu and haven't been disappointed. I always end up going back to the Fajitas Hawaiiana (chicken, beef, shrimp, ham and pineapple) without fail because its that good. The staff is extremely friendly and attentive and the food arrives fairly quickly. Another big plus is their margaritas are awesome. Thursdays and Sundays pitchers are $13.99. Great food, great drinks, great service and the price is right. If you haven't tried Tequila's yet you really should!

reviews.name: Christy L.
reviews.review: Food was great, drink was even better. I think they possibly served me the best strawberry margarita ever. Can't wait to go back!!

reviews.name: Sara E.
reviews.review: This place has amazing salsa! Their guacamole is also very fresh and you can still see chunks of whole avocados in it. We also love their tacos and chalupas. The service is always fast and friendly. Overall a great option for good inexpensive Mexican food!

reviews.name: Erin M.
reviews.review: I'm not giving 4 stars for exceptional, intricate preparation or beautifully crafted tequila cocktails. I'm giving 4 stars because this is as good as it's going to get in this price-range. The servers were friendly, polite, and extremely quick. The food had lots of flavor- as it tends to have when smothered in cheese and/or cream sauce. I had the Camarones Chipotle- which wasn't spicy at all, but was rich and creamy. The shrimp was juicy. We got a pitcher of house margaritas on the rocks for $15. Although I loathe Cuervo- sometimes you have to slum it. They were completely drinkable and I dare say I sucked down more than my share.Tequila's has a pleasant atmosphere, it's not expensive, and it's the perfect place to stuff your face full of chips and guacamole, get half drunk, and slump over in a booth shoveling a huge plate of comfort food into your starving mouth.

reviews.name: Alea H.
reviews.review: Workers are very friendly and the food is really good. Chips and salsa are probably my favorite of the places I've been in Nashville. We did get a couple things wrong on our order but they were so friendly that it didn't matter too much.

reviews.name: Steve C.
reviews.review: I used to really like this restaurant. I went a couple of times a month for the past four years or so, either with a group of friends for lunch  or dinner with my wife. All that changed last Thursday night when I noticed the new No Guns sign at the door. It had just gone up that week. I won't be spending a dime there again.

reviews.name: Sheron S.
reviews.review: Really enjoyed the "fried burritos"! Clean, fast & friendly place tucked away in a strip mall (next to Big Lots). Is a lot like Cinco De Mayo, but quieter with outdoor seating..

reviews.name: Justin Y.
reviews.review: It's nice to know there's good Mexican food in West Nashville.  The staff is nice and accommodating.  The food is always prepared quickly and well.  Be sure to get a tasty margarita to complement your meal.  The salsa is pretty delicious.  I would, however, avoid going when it's karaoke night (not sure what day of the week that is).In essence, I would describe this establishment as Las Palmas with slightly better tasting food.

reviews.name: Steph H.
reviews.review: I've spent a lot of time on Yelp talking about the glories of "authentic Mexican" food, which is actually readily available in Nashville. Of course, there's plenty of TexMex and Americanized Mexican food available in Nashville too, and I happen to think that's a good thing. Sometimes you just want to eat something that's slathered in cheese sauce, am I right? U.S. Border Cantina used to be our go-to spot for Mexican food when I was craving queso and margaritas, but now that it's gone to the restaurant graveyard in the sky, Tequila's is our new haunt when we're in the mood for Meximerican (a term of my own creation) food. I think most of these "Mexican" restaurants are pretty interchangeable, but Tequila's food is legitimately very tasty (the fajita burrito is enough for two, though it's so yummy you won't want to share) and has lightning fast service. Additionally, while it doesn't serve the best margaritas I've ever had, it does offer up decent incarnations of them, and for a reasonable price, too. For $6.50, you can get a top-shelf marg that will seriously rev your engine. Better yet, they have plenty of drink specials, including $15 margarita pitchers on the weekend (and they're even cheaper during the week), which makes getting your tequila fix all the easier.So not authentic by any means, but still good in its own right. The food is filling and inexpensive and the service is friendly. Sometimes that-and a margarita- are all you need.

reviews.name: Tracie R.
reviews.review: Yummo!  Great place for Mexican food.

reviews.name: Brittany S.
reviews.review: I had a great experience here. Way better than at las palmas. I had beef nachos supreme and my bf had chicken quesadillas. I liked my entree a lot. Filling portions and the waiter was pretty attentive :) We'll be back!

reviews.name: Helen Joy G.
reviews.review: Gross. Everything was just gross. The chips tastes like week old cardboard, the food was so below average. Do not waste you time, money or precious taste buds here. I feel so sad I wasted my one meal in Nashville here:(

reviews.name: Victor F.
reviews.review: After eating here for the first time over a year ago, I have been back numerous times. The food is very good and the service was excellent.  The entire staff was friendly and accommodating. Definitely one of my favorite Mexican restaurants in Nashville.

reviews.name: Riffi O.
reviews.review: Husband and I went last night. We performed our own taste test of margaritas and decided premium brand was worth the $2 difference. We ordered a fajita mix and burrito with shrimp and mixed veggies ( on the especiale list). Both were more than one person could eat, succulent and well-flavored. Even the beef was nice and tender. The place was crowded but we were seated right away. Service v good.  Price range is just under $10 to $15.

reviews.name: Deepak B.
reviews.review: Went there again for lunch cico de mayo. I still love this place! Low price, and food is consistently good. If it means anything, I am very picky eater.

reviews.name: Kathleen W.
reviews.review: My husband and I go to Tequila's all the time.  It is definitely one of the best mexican restaurants in town.  We've brought family members and several of our friends and they all loved it too.  We always get the Fajitas Texanes which has beef, chicken and shrimp and one  order is enough for us to split.  They are the best fajitas I've ever had.  The margaritas are delicious as well.  My dad always tries the special of the day, and has never been let down. The staff is friendly and they always have a warm atmosphere.  It is a must visit especially if you live on the West side of town.

reviews.name: kristen p.
reviews.review: Tequila's is our (husband and i)  favorite mexican in town. I really like the cheese enchiladas (the sauce is amazing) and they have good spinach burritos too. If you want to splurge try the papas con queso (french fries with queso sauce). Not healthy but oh so good! The staff is friendly. The manager / owner always makes us feel very welcome. It's also a good place to eat while there is a game on. Husband can keep an eye on the game (they have a couple of tv's) while you eat.  Oh and don't forget the mango margaritas!

reviews.name: Justin S.
reviews.review: the food is so-so, but the salsa is so awesome!!!  best salsa I have had in Nashville.  Cheap margaritas as well make it worth hitting up...

reviews.name: Peter C.
reviews.review: Great spot. This is a different spin on Mexican fare, and I'm a fan.First, the margaritas are fantastic. No mix, a light, mojito-esque take that really works well.Flavorful and stout, just what I want.The chips and salsa is anything but, three kinds of salsa? Yes please. The food is quite good. I've had special burritos and fajitas, both were great. Definitely enjoyable. The patio is great, and I have fondness for any place using Christmas lights as decor. The place draws a hip crowd and the service is as good as the people I met at the bar. Worth a stop for sure. Toughest thing is parking, good luck!

reviews.name: Chris Raymond H.
reviews.review: Wow, I absolutely am a fan of the Rose Pepper and would recommend it to anyone in the Nashville area to give it a try. They automatically start you off with chips and three different kinds of salsa. I had the Fajita burrito, but we definitely would recommend substituting in their marinated steak and adding the grilled jalapeños to make it caliente! It's definitely good sized portions too. Also, we ordered a pitcher of the house margarita. It lasted the whole meal and it was delicious. Additionally it was pretty packed when we arrived but they accommodated us with our request to sit outside very quickly. The server did a great job too; food and drinks both arrived at our table timely and flawlessly.

reviews.name: Queen B.
reviews.review: Genuinely nice staff.On a scale from 1 to 10... 10 being superior..  I give Rosepepper a 2 for recipes.1 for quality / recipe of their red salsa3 for quality of fish tacos10 for quality of patio3 for quality of taste and recipe of their "house" margarita10 for employees.If I had to guess, I would have to say that most of their food comes out of cans.Salsa, refried beans, tomatillo sauce..  I have a hard time believing that any of this is house made.. If it was house made, why on earth such bad quality??  It would be so easy to make a good salsa that would be profitable.But................it's in the neighborhood.It has a great patio.and the staff is nice.period.take it or leave it.

reviews.name: Ashley T.
reviews.review: I have only heard amazing things about Rosepepper and I do always love what they have posted on the marquee. We have lived here for 9 months and for whatever reason, we just went for the first time last night. It was raining outside, but the hostess was able to immediately seat us on the covered patio at 6pm on a Friday. Since everyone raves about the margs, my husband and I split a pitcher of the house version. Sadly the happy hour prices were not offered but I think these were like $24.50 (50¢ added for fresh limes). They were really good and not from a pre-made mix. And nice n' strong. The chips are accompanied by a trio of salsas that were all good. My husband's dish came with guacamole on the side and it was very good as well. I'm really picky about guac. It's either too ripe and I can't eat it or it's fresh and I can't stop. I didn't stop until his was gone. I also liked that the condiments were served in tiny fried tortilla bowls. Ate most of that too. I opted for the grilled fish tacos (duh) and husband ordered the veggie burrito. Fish tacos were alright but sadly they just use bagged corn tortillas and don't make their own. Halfway through the second taco, I had to eat with a fork because it was falling apart. I really liked their beans. Rice was really bland so I didn't eat more than a bite or two. Husband said his burrito was good but kind of bland and not great. All in all, I wasn't super impressed with most of the food, but some of it was really good. I will probably go back for happy hour margaritas and to try something else on the menu. Ps The interior is really divey and cute!

reviews.name: A. F.
reviews.review: Food's good. Patio is nice, and service is generally good, and OUTSTANDING if you get Kyle as your server! Overall, a very good culinary experience!

reviews.name: Eddie L.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is by far the best Mexican in all of Nashville. You must ask for Carrie as your guide for the food experience of a lifetime! An East Nasty Rockstar, she will not steer you wrong on any food choice and her eclectic Southern charm makes Rosepepper a win-win on any given night!!!

reviews.name: Maria K.
reviews.review: I came here for my best friend's birthday dinner and was pleasantly surprised by what a cute place it was. I feel like in Nashville you come across a lot of cookie cutter Mexican restaurants (Las Palmas, Nachos, etc.) But Rosepepper is different. They office am ambiance like none other and a non traditional menu.So I am all about the cocktails, so I'll start with those! I ordered a sugar cane mojito. It was the best mojito I have ever had! Plus it came with a stick of sugar cane in it, which was fun for the whole family to try. Then I had a mango margarita. It was a little sweeter than I expected, but was overall a delicious drink. My friend had the traditional marg, which has one several "Nashville Awards". I took a sip and it was wonderful. If I was just rating this place on cocktails, I would give it 5 stars.So the two years of my life that I didn't live in Nash, I was going to school in dallas. During that time I fell in love with street tacos. I have been looking for a place with great street tacos in Nashville, and finally found some here! They were absolutely delicious! They came with rice and beans, which were just mediocre. So overall, if you want decent food and wonderful cocktails, I recommend Rosepepper!

reviews.name: John K.
reviews.review: A hipsters dream come true but in a good way. Stumbled into this place on a rainy Nashville afternoon. Sat outside and was taken good care of by Gant. We split some avacado fries (holy hell you have to try these ) just so tasty and texture was just right. Think thick cut slices of avacado deep fried in a nice light but crunchy clean fry (meaning didn't taste like all the other fried food, someone cleaned the fryer oil) my entree was the Carne Asada burrito that comes with onions, tomatos and  delicious steak, not traditional but very good, get the spicy green sause on the side and thank me later. A bit pricey and no real parking are a bit of a bummer but I would still come back here again.

reviews.name: Eboni S.
reviews.review: When we walked in the host seemed startled. Kinda like we weren't supposed to be there. She made it kinda weird but it was no biggie at all. I ordered huevos rancheros. I totally understand that everyone makes them different, but these were not good.  I asked for a fried egg, completely cooked. When I got my food, my egg was running all over the plate. I hate sending back my food, and I usually just eat the food. I couldn't do that with this egg. She brought another plate out. It was just right. I will just be honest and say that it was not enjoyable at all. The pieces of the meal were good separately but all together was pushing it. I really liked the eggs and potatoes. I kinda just ate it because I hadn't eaten. I was happy she didn't charge us for the meal. It made the situation a little better even though I had my heart set on a really good meal. We ate outside under their tented area. They had fans blowing but it was still kinda hot. I know I know... It's TN in the summer so it's expected. I'm not sure if it's where they seated us but there were a ton on flies. Again I know summer time in the south, it comes with the territory. I'm mentioning this because no one else sitting outside had to fan their food constantly. I was overall disappointed because my last experience was way better. This incident won't stop me from going back. I just know not to sit outside or order their brunch.

reviews.name: Krystal T.
reviews.review: You'd get a better food quality with cheaper drinks and a much shorter wait time nearby at Five Points Cocina.This is Mexican fusion done fairly well. The food is good, but definitely not worth waiting 45 minutes or more. Most people rave about the specialty margaritas here, for which I grant Rosepepper their due credit. Again, though, not worth the 45 min+ wait for an overpriced, overly designed margarita.There are some great dishes at Rosepepper, especially since it is one of few places in Nashville that serve mole. But you can get great mole at Las Fiestas, too, up the street on Gallatin at a fraction of the wait time and cost.The patio seating at Rosepepper is pretty cool, especially since it is covered and quite extensive in size. However, after you wait on a table, you will probably have to contend with the slow service, as well.Overall, this is a trendy place for bringing friends, and you should try this place once. After that, though, go to Five Points Cocina.

reviews.name: Ben M.
reviews.review: I have never left this place and said "Fuck yeah, glad I ate there!" Once I got the vegan burrito, which said it was going to have steamed veggies in it. I was expecting peppers and other Mexican kinda stuff. Nope. Cauliflower, carrots, broccoli. All of which obviously came pre chopped and frozen. It was the grossest thing I have ever put in my mouth. Pretty sure the veggies were freezer burned. My girlfriend tried to order the flan today. The waitress got a disgusted look on her face and said "Don't do it."Now I am here currently drinking. I went to Las Maracas prior for food, as I refuse to eat the gross food here. We are sitting at the bar and I am looking at the wall behind the bar. Up at the top there are mirrors leaning against a pipe and there is a gap where you can see the wall. I have seen a number of large bugs crawling around in that gap and one behind the bottles of liquor. I am not coming here again.

reviews.name: Billy H.
reviews.review: I've been to Rosepepper a few times now. I like the atmosphere but I hate the wait. This most recent time it took about an hour to get seated on a Friday night. We finally got seated on the patio section. The patio section is a large wooden deck with a wooden fence around it. It's nice to be outside but it's like a wooden box. Our server was fast & friendly. We ordered the fried avocado fries as an appetizer. It's not on the menu but they're great. We skimmed the drink menu & decided on getting the casa margarita, pitcher for $33 for the 3 of us. The margarita was good, but I don't think it was $33 a pitcher good. Maybe 20 bucks. We drank it all & enjoyed it though. I wouldn't say it's the best margarita in town. The chips & salsa are pretty good. You're given a 3 sampler with the salsa. One is a Verde type salsa. The next is your average tomato based salsa and last is the HOT salsa, that was my favorite. For my dinner, I decided on the Rosepepper special in the enchiladas. It's listed as VERY SPICY. I like spicy food, so I thought it was just kind of spicy. I wouldn't say it's very spicy. The beans were your average Mexican beans with cheese on top. I enjoyed the beans more than the rice. The rice had peas & carrots in it. It didn't taste like your normal Mexican rice. My boyfriend got the fajitas which were 15 bucks. I'm not sure why they were so expensive. Overall my favorite thing about the meal was the fried avocado slices. I think this place is a little pricey for the food you get.

reviews.name: Joe C.
reviews.review: Literally the best margaritas in Nashville! And cheese dip! And the enchiladas are fantastic! And the multiple salsas are phenomenal! The patio is huge and there's plenty of parking across the road in the gravel lot if you can't find one in the neighborhood. I would highly recommend this East Nashville treasure. If you get 2 margaritas, plan on calling and UBER!

reviews.name: Simon C.
reviews.review: This place has a great vibe and the food is solid. I don't think any local will tell you it's the best Mexican in nashville. More like Tex mex I guess. Famous for their margaritas which are good, but absurdly priced. I wouldAvoid the $30 top shelf pitchers, save your money. Nolensville Rd has about 10 places with better food - but you won't get the trendy east Nashville atmosphere.

reviews.name: Leah V.
reviews.review: Winner winner chicken dinner! After our 7 month search for REAL good Mexican food left us bitter and cynical towards the recommendations of Nashville natives, we finally found a place to call home. Rose Pepper has been the best Mexican food we've had since leaving the Promise Land.Our groups dinner plates consisted of the shredded beef chimichanga ( flavor explosion with tender beef and that white queso sauce.... HOLY CRAP) the shredded chicken enchiladas ( tasty and not dry ) followed by the Fajita Burrito. This plate was the show stopper, filled with tender chicken and grilled veggies, deliciously topped with that miracle white queso sauce. We can not wait to come back. Rose pepper  hit all our tex mex desires and lived up to our Texas standards with its tender meats, delicious sauces and perfect seasonings. My inner fat kid thanks you Rose pepper. We'll be back.

reviews.name: Hye Eun C.
reviews.review: The Sonora enchilada was ok. Had a fried egg on top, but that couldn't save the dish overall.My dining partner had the carnitas, which are made once a day apparently. The meat was very dry and hard, so he ended up sending it back and ordering a fajita burrito. All three dishes came out less than 5 minutes after ordering. Didn't think I was entering a fast food restaurant. If I was, I would have gone to Taco Bell instead.Overall, food was very mediocre. Saving grace were the house margaritas (pricey at $30) and the free chips and salsas. Service was good and the waitress handled the unsavory dish situation gracefully. Unfortunately, would not come back again.

reviews.name: Brittany N.
reviews.review: Ok, the outdoor patio was nice but other than that, this place was TERRIBLE!! Stupid ridiculous slow service, our waiter was Kyle and he was clueless. Took 25 mins for our waters and a chips/salsa refills. When I asked him if we could get another chips and salsa, he said "if I get some free time...", wtf?! That is your job as a server, to make time. The table that got sat 10 mins after us received their food 15mins before us. One friend ordered their Bloody Mary and he claimed "worst Bloody Mary he had ever had, tasted like ketchup juice." My other friend ordered their house margarita and when it came to the table, it looked like a salted glass of water with a lime. Appropriate because it tasted like just like tequila water!As for the food, it was bland at best. Fajitas had no flavor and my friends also said the same about their dishes. My friend found a hair in his sour cream and my other friend's quesadillas were super soggy. Waiter also took another 20 mins to bring the check after we asked. Oh, and the bathroom situation...ridiculous. Me and my gf had to stand in line for 10 mins because of the 4 person line since they only have 1 oddly large bathroom with only 1 toilet. For such a large resturant, this is absurd. Not sure why their was sooo many people eating here today, maybe because it was the only place that didn't have a super long line due to Memorial Day. This was the only reason we came here and we definitely will never be back.

reviews.name: Travis B.
reviews.review: The main thing you should know about Rosepepper: best (strongest) margaritas in Nashville. Also, their food is incredible. I've been to Rosepepper several times since I moved to Nashville in 2012, but my culinary experience tonight warranted a review, and a favorable one at that. First off, get a margarita. Don't let your friends talk you into getting a Corona or, god forbid, a Miller Lite. Get a margarita. Their house margarita is excellent, and the specialty margaritas are quite good, as well (I'm a bit partial to the Jala-piña-rita (jalapeño-infused tequila)). They're always made fresh to order, and *clear* (i.e, made with tequila and lime juice, not margarita mix). Trust me, don't miss out on this. That would be like failing to vote or going to Wal-Mart on purpose or eating McDonald's right after eating McDonalds. Don't be that kind of human.Next, get the homemade guacamole. Don't ask any other questions, just get it. It's fresh, it's spicy, it's delicious, and it comes with fried tortilla chips (like regular chips, but fried (aka better)). Combine this with the margaritas you just ordered and the complimentary salsa trio, and you're well on your way to a good time (which I hope you're sharing with others; if you're by yourself, call me and I'll come meet you). Now, the food is where I leave you to your own devices. People like what they like and I'm not here to be the Ghandi to your search for meaning. I'll just tell you what I like. The mole carnitas. Houston, I repeat, the mole carnitas. The holy mole carnitas. Let me break it down for you like this: steaming, pull-apart pork, perfectly seasoned, alongside pico de gallo and avocado; to the side is rice and black beans; in the aluminum foil are your piping hot corn tortillas (i.e., heaven). In a little cup on your plate is the mole sauce. And it's not like mole you've had before. No chocolate wanna-be's here. This is delectably spicy *pecan* mole sauce. It has a superb balance of nuttiness, heat, and depth that make you want to tilt your overwhelmed head back and drink it. I think world leaders are bathed in this stuff as children. When I tasted it, my wife told me my eyes closed and I went to my little food heaven for a minute. Am I exaggerating? Would I use a word like "superb" or "delectably" if I was? See? I answered your question with a question. Call me Socrates. Hopefully you still have some of your margarita (or second one) left to wash these homemade carnitas tacos down. When I first tasted the multi-layered goodness of tortilla, black bean, carnitas, pico, avocado, and mole, I had to take a (figurative) step back and contemplate my life. After that, I relished each bite. And when you realize that your whole meal was only $24 (margarita + dinner + 1/2 guacamole), then it's even more worth it. I think I actually sang "Baby You're Worth It" to my plate of food (and much to my wife's chagrin). So, take my advice, or don't. But here, that's like saying "buy health insurance, or don't," or "marry the girl of your dreams, or don't." Anyway, you get the picture. Go forth and enjoy. Cheers.

reviews.name: Dagan B.
reviews.review: One time its a 5. The next time its a 2 the next time its a 3. Inconsistency really hurts this place.

reviews.name: Von W.
reviews.review: The food, drinks and portions are great, which is why I hate to leave such a negative review. However, on account of the horrendous service, the food was spoiled by the pure lack of respect for paying customers. We called ahead to make reservations and were told they don't take reservations. When we arrived, we had to wait over an hour for a table (we were the first on the list). We had a party of 8, so I understood having to wait for a larger table to open up. About 45 minutes after our arrival, a party of 7 was seated before us, having just arrived. We asked why and they said that the party of 7 had made reservations. What?!When we were finally seated, the manager came out to seat us... at two completely separate tables.Once seated, I thought the wait would be over. I was wrong. We finally ordered about 20 minutes after being seated and I asked for extra silverware as there wasn't enough at the table.Yet another 20-25 minutes pass and finally everyone's food arrives. It looks great! But I can't eat it because I don't have any silverware. Another 10 minutes pass before I can even get a hold of the waiter. The story goes on, but unlike the Rosepepper staff, I'd rather not waste more of your time.

reviews.name: Emily T.
reviews.review: Bah. This place stinks. It's in a great location - huge space. The host was quick to seat me and friendly. The waiter was kind but didn't come around much. The salsa was sweet and the hot salsa was too spicy. I skipped their "famous" margarita and just went for dinner. For $8 I got an enchilada that was about 5 inches long - it was like a mini enchilada. The plate said it came with "lime vegetables" - they were sliced, raw carrots that tasted like nothing. The rice was bland and the beans were runny. Everything was wrong. I ate almost nothing on my plate and the waiter did not ask if anything was wrong. I could have told him - but judging by my friend's plate in not sure that anything else would have been much better. If I go back it would be to try a margarita.

reviews.name: Alicia M.
reviews.review: Great food...STRONG Margaritas!!!! Great Service!!!  I recommend coming out to this fine establishment!!!

reviews.name: Jessica S.
reviews.review: I've always been intrigued by Rosepepper because of their witty signage in front of their restaurant. Yesterday, my fiance and I made a point to finally try it. I'll start off by saying that I'm pretty sure we had one of the worst servers of all time. When we arrived, the restaurant had a few guests but was not packed by any means. Our server took our drink order, returned with our drinks, and disappeared FOR THIRTY MINUTES. Our water was empty, we were starving and ready to order, but he was nowhere to be found. Several times during that thirty minute time period, we thought about leaving but decided not to because we wanted to try the food. The food was decent! I'm Mexican so I'm always on the hunt for some genuine Mexican grub. Unfortunately, since our filled up on chips during that waiting period, we couldn't finish our meals. I like margaritas and I like patios. Now that the weather is nicer, I was SO stoked to come here but I'm completely bummed about our experience. I understand that if the restaurant was packed - there would be a wait. However,  it wasn't packed and we shouldn't have waited as long as we did for water. Bleh. You let me down, Rosepepper.

reviews.name: Zeb M.
reviews.review: Life is like a dinner at Rosepepper - you never what you're going to get.I've had both horrible and great service and bland and delicious meals at Rosepepper. If I could, I'd give them 3.5 stars, but I'm rounding up because more times than not I've enjoyed it. It's not the best Tex Mex/Mexican food around, but I think people keep coming back because of its location, awesome patio during nice weather, and margaritas. Their margaritas are always great. Order a pitcher and friends along with a chimichanga smothered with buffalo cheese sauce. It's one of the best items on their menu.

reviews.name: Anthony S.
reviews.review: Their house margaritas are my favorite in town. Their best meal is their Verde Chili. Pork chili in verde sauce, roasted jalapeno... I get it with tortillas, shredded cheese, and sour cream. It's hot enough to make me sweat a little but not hurt. It is addictive.The rest is unfortunately inconsistent. My wife has had great carne asada and horrible. I've had some of the most bland rice ever and the best sonora sauce in the same meal. It's ususally busy, so there's often a wait. No reservations. Great bar, great patio, spotty service otherwise.

reviews.name: Tyler O.
reviews.review: Great little Mexican restaurant in East Nashville. I would highly suggest the queso to start out your meal. Portions were good and the food was fresh and tasty. Had a few beers and a margarita (these bad boys are strong). Definitely would come back again!

reviews.name: Linz L.
reviews.review: I really don't understand the hype around this place.  I had been wanting to try it for a while.  I love Mexican food.  I was disappointed by how bland the cabo tacos were.  Their homemade ranch is an abomination and should not be classified as ranch.  The muy caliente Rosepepper Especial enchiladas were flavorful, but the meats were way overbooked.  The drinks were ok,  but I won't be driving back out to east Nashville any time soon for them.  I think I will stick with La Hacienda from now on.  Also, the wait was awful-- when they finally sat us, I couldn't u set stand why.  There were tons of available tables.  Service sucked too-- even though they seemed to have plenty of help.

reviews.name: Ashley M.
reviews.review: Best chicken Cesar salad ever (I know you don't think of Cesar salad when you go Mexican). Not a normal cesar salad either - has fajita chicken and more like lettuce wrap style. It's the only think I ever get there now. And the margaritas are obviously the best in Nashville!

reviews.name: Steve C.
reviews.review: I think this is a good place to meet and have a cocktail to chat and have some fun. The food is OKAY, chips are not nearly as good as other Mexican restaurant in East Nashville area. As you expect at a busy Mexican restaurant, the service is slow.. this is the situation I start to wonder about how much I should tip...

reviews.name: Thomas B.
reviews.review: The food is a little bland but it tastes very fresh. I compare it to Cantina Loredo in that regard but cheaper and less presentation. The margs are the best in the city and even though its $8 a piece, you get the bang for your buck. Catch it at happy hour and its a steal at $5.

reviews.name: Chris A.
reviews.review: I have been here twice, and will continue to go here. now that that's out of the way I will review:Atmosphere: fun and great decor. Love every unique item. Food: Decent and standard Mexican fare. Las Maracas is actually great tex-mex at a cheaper price. They do have unique menu items though. Plus they are locally owned so I would always support them because of that. Loved their 3 salsas. All of them are very good. The green one is my favorite. Be warned, one of the red ones is hella hot though. Drinks: They use actual real fruit in their drinks. The margarita is 10$ and its worth it. Service: waitstaff were fine and service was fine. However the management tent to have a light dusting of asshole-ism when it comes to seating. They did accommodate our large party well, but they made it seem like it was a big inconvenience for them. When you are in the restaurant business and you almost sigh when we say how many people are going to be joining us. You are in the business of making money, no? You are going to have 13 people sitting down at your restaurant, each with an entree, and one of those delicious 10$ margaritas. Does the idea of making money not interest you?Anyway. I will return to this place and they would get 5 stars but the stand-offish attitude by the staff knocks them down. Sorry.

reviews.name: Courtney S.
reviews.review: We are from Texas and I went in here with high expectations! I judge a Mexican place by their chips and salsa. If that sucks, I know your food will most likely be equally as horrible. Chips & salsa come out...delicious. I ordered a margarita with extra muddled jalapeños (told you I'm from Texas) and it was phenomenal!!! My husband loved his margarita too. All the food was amazing and I would come back to this place in an instant, even with my Texas friends!

reviews.name: Jessica R.
reviews.review: Service was good even though they were short staffed. We really, really liked the food here. Our table got a margarita pitcher, which was fantastic. We'll definitely come back.

reviews.name: Chris S.
reviews.review: Mediocre food, ridiculous wait times, the margarita i ordered cost nearly twice what my entree did....thats not a good sign. The food was the equivalent of a frozen dinner. The service was apathetic and slow. All in all it was not a good experience. The chips and queso were good but thats pretty hard to screw up. People like this place i think because they think they should.....i.e. its trendy....but ultimately, falls far short.

reviews.name: Jake A.
reviews.review: The drinks are the only reason this place hangs on to a 4 star for me. The food is so so and service wasn't the best either (although they were very busy). The x rated Rita and house margarita are delicious and very strong! Hope y'all like tequila cuz you can definitely taste it in their drinks. Get the queso dip with the deep fried chips. Delicious

reviews.name: Michael M.
reviews.review: Worst takeout service ever. The girl on the phone was the most difficult person to deal with and then the order wasn't correct, even though the receipt was. However all of my sit-in service has been decent.

reviews.name: Laura C.
reviews.review: Margaritas were great! Food was not great. Not good. Pretty meh. I could have prepared something nicer at home.Ambience was nice, we sat on the patio. Service was good. Disappointed with the food though :/

reviews.name: Carl Y.
reviews.review: I give this rate due to the terrible service, especially that offered by the front desk servers. We had a group of 8. After asking how many people we have, they just put us waiting and served the smaller groups coming behind us. They refused to tell us what we were waiting for by ignoring our inquiries. Are larger groups paying less for the food?? If it's not the case that all restaurants nearby were full, I would definitely not stay. Besides, there is a strong smell of toilets welcoming you once you step into the hall. The food is nothing special to talk about. I was surprised that they enforced a 20% tip on the final bill. Have these people seriously learned that no one will willingly pay them a good tip? Don't go to this restaurant if you have any other choices. I sincerely suggest McDonalds.

reviews.name: Mary T.
reviews.review: "I like my salsa like I like my men - HOT"This is what the marquee outside Rosepepper said as we walked by. We hadn't intended to eat here, it wasn't even our second choice, but I forgot to confirm if our first choice (Silly Goose) was open on Sundays (twas not) and here we ended up.The interior is what some might call kitschy, others might call it tacky. The large room is cobbled together into odd little sections. Christmas tree lights, sheer panel curtains (or shower curtains) adorned with purple lights, and chandeliers are hung haphazardly. The outdoor patio, however, is quite great - large and equipped with fans and heaters to handle all sorts of weather. We only opted to sit on the patio because of said fans (it was hotter than balls); as promised, they kept the place pretty breezy.We were brought a bowl of chips and three salsas to start. The chips were good, homemade I believe. I'm not sure who penned the marquee, but if they truly think those salsas are hot, we have vastly different taste in men. Hot they were not; two were incredibly mild and one just barely passable for medium. If they were men, they'd be those nondescript, forgettable types.For our lunch, he ordered steak tacos with a side of the spicy salsa verde and I ordered the del mar (white fish) enchiladas with their special spicy salsa verde. I should have known better, there's a reason you don't see fish (shrimp maybe, but not fish) enchiladas on menus. I do not recommend these; they're not inedible, but the salsa softening the tortillas on top of white fish being so flalky made the thing a mushy mess. The special salsa, though, was pretty good. The only oddity was that the side my companion got was served warm (as in heated). Bottom line: There's probably a reason the vegetarian place across the street had a steady wait and we walked right into Rosepepper. I'd return for drinks on the patio, just not the food.

reviews.name: Susanna H.
reviews.review: Go to Rosepepper if you want a strong margarita, guacamole, and queso.  If you are interested in an exceptional Mexican dining experience, you will not get it here.  I do come to Rosepepper often because my husband is adverse to spice (both flavor and heat), and that is the same reason that I am left with an "eh" experience every time.  If Rosepepper started using more garlic, spices, and salt, I may give them another star.  They do have a bloody mary bar on Saturday, which was pretty nice.

reviews.name: Nicki C.
reviews.review: Cinco de mayo TODAY is my 1st time here & I really like it already. Inside is very cool looking , service is prompt & diligent, almost as soon as we set down we served chips & salsa! Great place to come!

reviews.name: Dan M.
reviews.review: Food is bland. Salsa taste like out of a jar. Margarita don't taste like a margaritas. Atmosphere is cool.

reviews.name: Matthew H.
reviews.review: This was some of the absolute best food and drinks I have ever had at a Mexican restaurant. The margarita's were top notch. So crisp and natural. Very strong. I had the buffalo white cheese dip with chorizo and it was the best cheese dip I have ever had. So much flavor. I saved it to put on top of my tacos!! Can't wait to go back to Nashville to eat here again!

reviews.name: Zooey G.
reviews.review: Awesome food! Friendly service.

reviews.name: Andrew M.
reviews.review: I constantly drive by this place and wonder how on earth there is a line. I guess that if you're there just to drink it's fine but don't order any food. It's dirty and refuse to eat there again.

reviews.name: Emily C.
reviews.review: Great chips and margaritas complemented with a side of average food.The chips and salsa provided were tasty - thick and crispy chips are unique for tortilla chips. The banana margarita was delicious - wasn't strong but it was well made.I ordered the enchilada specials which came with two enchiladas and a side of rice/beans. I wasn't too pleased with the soggy enchiladas smothered in cheese. My friend's fish tacos looked and tasted amazing. In the future, I would order the tacos instead. I liked the atmosphere and enjoyed the open bar seating where another group of friends were watching the game. For better tacos however, I've had better at Mas Tacos and Boca Loca.

reviews.name: Emily C.
reviews.review: Not impressed. Not going back. We were going to go somewhere else and told the hostess so but she said "I literally just got a table for you" so we stayed. Our waitress started off by telling us she had other tables and wouldn't be around much. I ordered soup and when it came out, the guy bringing it spilled it all over our table and into our cheese dip and walked off after saying "sorry about that". He had a rag and didn't offer to clean it up. The food wasn't good. I ate my soup but my steak on my salad was filled with grease so I just didn't eat it. Waitress took years to run our credit card too. Think we saw her twice.

reviews.name: Adam C.
reviews.review: Very generic Mexican food. Absolutely not worth the price or the wait. Our waiter seemingly forgot about us at least two times even when bringing us our check. Not a pleasant environment at all.

reviews.name: Karri B.
reviews.review: We live very close to Rose Pepper and have enjoyed going the past few years.  If guests or friends want some good Mexican, we go here. If we want good margaritas, we go here, if we want black beans, we go here.  We loved this place and went for the last time last Thursday.  We had friends in town and the four of us wanted Mexican and margaritas.  There was a "wait" and we ordered a pitcher of margaritas to pass the time.  We tried to drink them on the side patio but we were told that section lost it's liquor license so we had to drink them inside.  No biggie but we did notice lots of open tables inside and outside (which is where we wanted to sit) and thought it odd there was a wait.We got to our table and ordered cheese dip and it was brought and we enjoyed it with our drinks and started to wonder where our waitress was to order.  The pitcher became empty, our chips ran out, the cheese dip was half gone.... no waitress.... we tried to flag down another waiter who was helping THE TABLE BEHIND us and he looked at us and said, "No."  We were stunned.  I was embarrassed that we had brought people from out of town to one of our favorite weekly Mexican fix places.  NO?!!!  No you cannot help us?  No you cannot find our waitress?  NO?!  What kind of business are you in?!  Needless to say, I was pissed, we finally ordered our food, our waitress brought us the wrong type of margarita for the second pitcher and we ate our food and left.  Don't bother going here.  Some might say, "this only happened once!" but for us, the rudeness is a total deal breaker.  They weren't busy and there is no excuse to not help guests find a waitress.  I will be writing a letter to the establishment. My husband and I decided we were done.  We are a bit sad but we aren't going to continue to give an establishment our money when we were treated so poorly.

reviews.name: James S.
reviews.review: I don't like really spicy food, so it's weird when I say food is bland. All of the food was nicely done, but a skillful addition of spices could knock it out of the ballpark. While the chicken flautas were well prepared, chicken breast is naturally bland and dry. They really could use some cheese, onions -- anything to give it a kick and a little moisture. The chimichanga had beef that was tender and a little tastier. I found myself pouring queso and salsa over everything to bump up the taste. Refried beans were good, rice was tasteless, but the three salsas were good, chips were adequate. The atmosphere was fantastic. We were seated fairly promptly, and service by Hannah was attentive and pleasant. The total for two lunch entrees, a side of queso dip, one soda, tax, and tip was $20, which was a great deal for what we got. You also could spend a lot more here. Overall, I had a good time but wouldn't go very far out of my way to return.

reviews.name: Lindy B.
reviews.review: I hate to do it Rosepepper, but I have to drop 2 stars. 1 for charging extra for refills on chips and salsa. That's BS. You know it, and we know it. You lose another star for the diminishing quality of the food. The last few times I've been there my food has been very mediocre, bordering on just not good. My cheese enchilada last night was hard, chewy, and practically glued to the plate. The time before that my burrito had no taste whatsoever. Also, last night 3 out of 6 of us at the table had things wrong with our order. On a positive note, I will say that I still love the patio and the margaritas are still awesome. Also, I do really like the seasoned vegetables with the zucchini and corn. I will never pick this place again but I will likely still come if someone else wants to. I'll just plan on not really eating.

reviews.name: Chris W.
reviews.review: so here me and my gf are, looking for some good food on our way home to va and we discover this place. we walk in just infactuated with how nice the employees are and the place has a unique vibe to it. also full of chattery people, we got the buffalo cheese dip wich tastes like heaven and mango sweet tea wich is also very good, we ordered our food and it didnt take too long to arrive but it was just horrible, messy plating. beans looked old , the rice is just white rice with frozen veggies cooked in, then. ontop of all that, i found myself picking all kinds of random ingredients that didnt even belong in my chimmechanga, nor my plate. we politly pushed our unwanted plates aside and waited for 25 minutes to see the waitress to ask for our check, and then another 10 minutes so far and she still hasnt come back. but this is my experience here and although the people are nice i will not be returning.

reviews.name: Brett M.
reviews.review: I first saw Rosepepper glimmering in the July dusk light. Hearing the sound of laughing and clinking glasses, it was inviting. I checked Yelp and saw it rated three stars and had some pretty vocal dissenters, so I held off for five months. I found our waitress to be warm and helpful. Appetizers came fast, but the entrees came two minutes later, smashing the illusion that ordering both appetizers and entrees is a good idea. The servers dropped the plates on the table from a foot above. The chips were tasty, the salsas too hot or too sweet. My fajitas were large, tasty, but dry. And so I sank into my chair, resigning myself to what I knew would be, an average meal. Not dissatisfied, but not pleased, I filled my stomach, and walked across the street to get an ice cream.Sigh

reviews.name: Haley V.
reviews.review: Ever since moved to Nashville (a year ago) I've heard people hype this place up. My husband had been two times previous and left after 45 minutes without service, so I never bothered to go until tonight.The salsa was good, and the atmosphere is fun but that's all I can say positively. The food was very bland, and we saw our waitress maybe twice in the hour we were there. For a Mexican restaurant, you would think there would be some spice to it to make it exciting.Overall- I would suggest opting to go somewhere else.Rosepepper, find your spice- and maybe I'll try you again sometime.

reviews.name: David M.
reviews.review: Great food, funky atmosphere, and prices are reasonable, and the service is good.

reviews.name: George H.
reviews.review: I live one block away and I have eaten here more times than I can count. The food is pretty good, but I wouldn't rate it 5-star and it is certainly not authentic Mexican. The Senora and Chicken Fajita burritos are my favorite items. The bar is well-stocked and expertly managed. The margaritas are the must-have item in the restaurant. And, in my experience, the staff is quite friendly and very attentive.

reviews.name: Uma R.
reviews.review: Just went in for appetizers.. Avocado fires - had to try! Nacho's - pretty good sauces.

reviews.name: Payal S.
reviews.review: Amazing margaritas! They looked super watered down when we first saw them but actually taste delicious. Food and service was average. Sit outside, the indoor is a little too kitschy for dinner.

reviews.name: Kerry M.
reviews.review: There was a rock in my burrito and I had to share silverware with my friend.  Couldnt complain to my waitress because she never came by once to check on us.  She did make sure to auto grat us all 20% though for her time.  Hostess was rude.Margeritas were wonderful, save your time and just order food somewhere else.

reviews.name: Helen H.
reviews.review: We just tried Rosepepper for the first time and ABSOLUTELY love everything about it. The atmosphere is cheeky, the food isn't complicated, just relaxed, tasty Mexican! Our server was Kyle and he was fantastic, never once let our water glasses/margarita glasses run dry (and very funny to boot)! My husband and I will definitely be back. Get the chicken enchiladas supremas!!!

reviews.name: Ali S.
reviews.review: This is your standard Mexican food in a hipster part of town.  The thing that sets this place apart from other places is their awesome margaritas!  But be careful, they will sneak up on you! Cool crowd, big portions and awesome drinks are the reasons why I keep coming back.

reviews.name: Christa P.
reviews.review: Honestly, their food is really not that good. Its not even traditional mexican, more american mex. They have some good appetizers - such as flatuas, taquitos or nachos. Overall their shredded beef and ground beef tastes the same and needs more flavor. Their guacamole and queso is pretty good though. They do have really good margaritas and pretty good service at the bar though, along with a really good happy hour ($20 pitcher of margaritas)

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: We were very happy with this place! my wife said the mushroom quesadilla was awesome.  I was iffy on the mango iced tea, but it was awesome. I got the beef and chicken fajitas and it was awesome. So much I had to take some home. We were interested in the Kahlua Flan, but our waitress Carrie said that it really wasn't red best in the world, and that they are in the process of changing the recipe, but it's not there yet, and she wanted us to leave happy not 'meh'. Not very many servers out there with that level of honesty. She was awesome, friendly and attentive. Would definitely come back!

reviews.name: Josh H.
reviews.review: Rosepepper seems to have really gone downhill in recent years.I used to enjoy the eclectic decor and warm ambience. On my most recent visit, I was struck by a stale energy and musty smell.Nowadays, the employees, from hostesses to servers, seem burned out and to have lost their collective charm. The bartenders still seem friendly, though.Menu-wise, even their trio of complimentary salsas isn't as good as it used to be. The salsas were bland, lacking seasoning. I ordered the "buffalo white cheese dip" (i.e. chori queso) which came with maybe a teaspoon of rendered chorizo crumbles on the top. I felt ripped off.In my opinion, there are only two things worth ordering here:1.) For drinks, the skinny margarita (i.e. a real margarita, made with tequila, fresh lime juice, and triple sec). At $9 for a pint (YES, a pint) on the rocks, I found this to be both delicious and a good deal.2.) For food, the chile verde. Their very spicy pork green chile stew is served in a bowl, accompanied with rice, refried beans, a charred jalapeño, and (average) flour tortillas. This hearty bowl of spicy comfort food will do the trick when you're not feeling well.Knowing exactly what I like here and considering only the margarita and chile verde, I'd be more inclined to give 3 stars (probably 4 back in the day). But all things considered, Rosepepper has fallen to a 2 because of the rest of their food, the service, and the ambiance. I hope that they do some spring cleaning, on multiple levels.

reviews.name: Mitchel B.
reviews.review: Some of the best Mexican food I've found in Nashville. Of course, there is the remote possibility that the liberal amount of tequila in our margaritas had something to do with our impression of the restaurant. Regardless the wait staff was attentive, the food came quickly and the bill was very reasonable. Give it a whirl!

reviews.name: Julie C.
reviews.review: I'm not going to change my 3 star rating but I'm disappointed that they gave us a pager and forgot about us. We had to ask and they say us but It's an hour until close and we really wanted to enjoy this great weather on the patio. I hope this server makes up for forgetting us...
reviews.location: Downtown St. Paul, St. Paul, MN

reviews.name: Gretchen G.
reviews.review: Ok Mexican food, great margaritas. Casual Mexican restaurant atmosphere with a heated patio. Good set up on the patio for groups. The salsa sampler and chips are good for free chips. The guacamole appetizer is a generous portion. The avocado fries are a little bland but with the dip they've got a little kick. The enchilada and tacos were fairly unmemorable. The margarita came out looking pretty clear, no fake green dye here. Delicious without tasting too strong.

reviews.name: Jan S.
reviews.review: Not sure what all the fuss is. We wound up there because every other place we wanted to go to had a wait and this place did not (red flag #1). The outdoor seating is rather nice and the service is good. But the food was average at best. The chips, salsa and guac were a 7 out of 10. But I had a burrito and my husband had tacos of some sort that I remember thinking I could have made better at home. I do not drink, but I hear this place has the best, freshest, made on-the-spot Margaritas.Will not go back.

reviews.name: Molly M.
reviews.review: I've had pretty good experiences with Rosepepper up until tonight. I called in an order to be picked up - I ordered the Enchiladas and the tacos (on their menu I think it's called "Los Originales"). When I ordered the tacos, the woman taking my order asked "Just one?" which I answered "yes," assuming she meant just one order. I guess she took that to mean I just wanted one taco with nothing else. I get the food home and see the lonely taco in the box. So I call them back, explain what happened, and get met with some weird attitude. Like I was an idiot for not spelling out that when I said "The beef tacos," I meant that I wanted the food that's actually listed on their menu. She put me on hold for awhile while asking her manager if they could fix the order. When she got back on the line, she apologized and said that we could come back and pick up the rice and beans. When I asked, "And the other taco?" she said, "Oh....you wanted two tacos?"I was very tempted to ask her to actually pick up one of the menus, flip to the "taco" section and ask her to read the ONLY THREE OPTIONS. Not one of those options is "Single taco with literally nothing else." Normally I would give this place 4 stars, my husband and I eat here a lot. But this was really weird. I hope they're damn good tacos, considering it will now have taken hours to get them.

reviews.name: Kristie A.
reviews.review: Overpriced Americanized Mexican food BUT great margaritas! The second half of their menu is just a list of different tequilas you can put in your drink. It's $8-$9 for a cup of margarita BUT it will definitely make you feel some type of way after one drink lolThe food was okay. Nothing special. The service was so-so. The guy had too many tables but he was nice to us.Don't come here expecting special food but if you're looking for a strong margarita, you came to the right place.

reviews.name: Nicole F.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I had been looking for an excuse to go to RosePepper for a while. When my mom came to town and expressed her interest in having Mexican, we decided to finally take the leap. My mother and I got to the restaurant around 6:30 and were promptly seated and greeted by Shane (who was fantastic - very pleasant and accommodating). He got us set up with some margaritas (and even carded my 57 year old mom - made her extremely giddy!). The chorizo queso was great as well. My boyfriend showed up a little after 7 - it took us 10 or so minutes to order, followed by 40 minutes to receive our food - however, previously being a server, I have to say - NONE of it was our waiter's fault. Even though it was a Monday night, it was extremely busy, and it seemed every server had 7-8 tables at the very least. The food was worth the wait, and I was fine after I got some food in me, but when I come back it will probably only be for appetizers and margaritas with some girlfriends.

reviews.name: Shay J.
reviews.review: I'll give 4 stars because I absolutely LOVE their margaritas (the mango is my fave). And chilling on the patio is also nice. I've definitely had much better Tex Mex for the price, though.

reviews.name: Susan H.
reviews.review: We were visiting Nashville and our relatives had heard great things about Rosepepper, so they took us there.  It was SO disappointing.  The wait was about 45 minutes. When we finally got called in, the hostess was pleasant and the service was good. But the food was hugely disappointing.The best thing served was the tomatillo salsa.  Great flavor and not too hot for this hot pepper lightweight.  But nothing else was worth coming back for.  I had their spinach enchiladas.  When I cut into the enchilada a huge amount of grease spilled out. It looked like they had cooked the spinach in a vat of oil.  The beans and rice served with the enchilada were adequate, but not spectacular.  My husband had some kind of beef burrito.  The meat was flavorful but dry.  The burrito was filled with nothing but the meat, so it was a very dry burrito overall.  We are used to eating burritos bursting with flavor and goodies.  But not here. My advice:  go across the street to the Wild Cow.  They have GREAT, imaginative food and plenty of dishes with Mexican flavors done much better.

reviews.name: Mark V.
reviews.review: This place was a nice find as we drove into an unfamiliar place. The 3 salsas were excellent with the complimentary chips. I had the shredded beef nachos, also very good. The beer menu was a little light, as I had heard good things about the local beer here. Quick and standard Mexican food here. Glad we stopped.

reviews.name: Sandy W.
reviews.review: I wouldn't file Rosepepper under "Amazing" but certainly it's really, really good. Their menu is a little more experimental than your average Mexican joint (avocado fries, etc.) and their drinks are on point. An entire page of the menu is devoted to varieties of tequila- sorted by shelf/price range. Mojitos, mezcal, and margaritas: yum. I like trying different drinks every time I'm here and the bartender can be a big help in selecting a tequila right for you. Back to the food. I usually get a burrito, which is as big as a football, so it's easily enough for two people. I always forget that their courtesy chips & salsa comes with three kinds of salsa, which is awesome. You get mild, medium, and tomatillo salsa bowls. Their guac is also good, which is crucial to me. I like their patio which is heated and got a recent makeover. Service is always great too. I guess my only complaint is that sometimes the dishes aren't as good as I know they've been. They're not 100% consistent in taste. But this is true of most places.
