Rosepepper is still my Mexican restaurant of choice.

reviews.name: Danny N.
reviews.review: My favorite Mexican restaurant in Nashville.  The place is a great representation of of East Nashville's offerings.  They make a mean margaritas.  This chips and salsa offerings are quite good as well.  The place is slightly trendy and modern and definitely screams the opposite of hole the wall Mexican place.  The smoked pork carnitas are amazing.

reviews.name: D M.
reviews.review: The food was really good and the atmosphere pleasant. Server was a bit miffed at my questions. I promise my food allergies are a bigger inconvenience for me than they are for you. :/ Other than his eye rolling it was a good dining experience.

reviews.name: Carl Z.
reviews.review: The best in east  Nashville!

reviews.name: SHERRY E.
reviews.review: This place was awesome!  The hostess was super sweet and our server did amazing job.  The chips and salsa were really good, 3 different kinds. My husband and I both got enchiladas and they were both delicious!  But the best thing was the margaritas hands down!! So many to choose from. They were not the usual sweet and sour from a mix!

reviews.name: Lyrad V.
reviews.review: I've been to Rosepepper multiple occasions (usually with a group of friends because I don't live on the east side), and although there is much I would like to love about this place, I find it to be pretty average.First, I've never gone without having to wait to be seated, even with a reservation. This place is always packed. The service has always been good, and the atmosphere is nice.They do have great drinks. They also serve yo three different salsas which is nice, but their chips are sometimes stale. I love avocado and got the avocado fries once. Don't get them. They weren't good at all.The food has been hit or miss. It's usually good though.Overall, a good place to hang with friends and grab a delicious margarita. I just wouldn't make the trip across town just to eat here with other good Tex Mex options closer to my neighborhood.

reviews.name: Sheena T.
reviews.review: I've had mixed experiences with the food at Rosepepper, but the margaritas bring it up to a solid 4 stars. Love me some top shelf margaritas!!I really like that they give you 3 different salsas varieties and are eager to replenish the bowls once they are depleted. I also tried their cheese dip on my last visit, and it was tasty. They don't fancy it up like some restaurants, this one is just the good white cheese dip you get at a Mexican place.Their food prices are on the higher end for Mexican food, and has been hit or miss for me. I've tried the burritos with limited satisfaction, and have had a similar experience with the enchiladas. Overall their food lacks a lot of flavor. I finally ordered something delicious, the chicken fajitas. For $14 I expected it to be a large portion, and it was. I split them with my BF, and the meat was seasoned well and I really liked the refried beans. Finally a good dish! I'll go back to Rosepepper when I'm craving a good margarita, but the food I can take or leave.

reviews.name: T H.
reviews.review: Yummy place. Love the vibe. Absolutely love the nacho fries and burrito. Great vegetarian options.

reviews.name: Darren L.
reviews.review: Been here numerous times in the past years. It's a landmark for East Nashville. Great food at great prices. Large portions almost always insure some lunch for the next day. The pork chile verde is life altering but beware!!! It comes with a price. Love the Queso and the fried pepper rings! Delicious! Great place to have a group. Big place with lots of room.

reviews.name: Staria C.
reviews.review: I was soooooooo disappointed! I had heard so much about this place but the food was a total let down! Overpriced and I just didn't even think it was decent mexican food.The place has a very cool vibe and great service... I also did not have any of their drinks so I can not judge them on that.

reviews.name: Jon M.
reviews.review: Excellent margaritas, they do not skimp on the booze.  Their chips and offering of three varieties of salsa are very good.  I ordered a chicken burrito and added jalapeños to it, the wife had the borracho shrimp fajita. While they were both good, they didn't blow us away.  The food did arrive fast, but in the case of my burrito, the jalapeños were all loaded on one end of my burrito, c'mon spread them out!  We did score a table on the deck, which was nice. If I were a local, I'd come back and try more dishes.

reviews.name: Adam T.
reviews.review: I really enjoyed visiting RosePepper on a recent trip to Nashville. Being a Texan, it's hard to find good Tex-Mex and even harder to find good Mexican food while traveling. When a family member suggested RosePepper I knew I had to check it out. We arrived around noon on a Saturday and we were seated immediately. For lunch the restaurant was a little dark but once my eyes adjusted I was navigating to the back half of their menu--the margaritas. My wife and I are suckers for a good margarita. I ordered the Jalepano Pineapple Margarita and it was great. My wife ordered the house margarita and I was surprised by the sweetness of her drink. It was a refreshing change from the artificially enhanced sweet and sour mix that most places use, but still too sweet for my taste. I ordered the chicken quesadilla and loved the flavor as well as the amount of meat. I hate getting a quesadilla with 3 pounds of cheese and little to no meat on it.  Overall we had a great experience. I look forward to returning to RosePepper on my next visit to Nashville.

reviews.name: Patrick P.
reviews.review: Love the variety of salsas they bring out with the chips. I order the large appetizer quesadilla and it is filling plus under $10. It's pretty tasty and I will return.

reviews.name: Bailey M.
reviews.review: As a native East Nashvillian, I began eating here soon after the doors first opened many years ago. It is my go-to for lunch or dinner- especially the margs. Shredded chicken quesadillas are also one of my favorite menu items!

reviews.name: Christine K.
reviews.review: My favorite Mexican food spot in Nashville! Their margaritas are to die for especially with the fresh squeezed lime juice. (Heads up that's an extra .50 cents, I think) I absolutely LOVE their Veggie Burrito! Even if you're not a vegetarian give it shot, it's THAT good! Service is always great, especially at the bar. The ambiance is great very spacious, really good for huge parties. Came here twice already and will be coming back for more!!!

reviews.name: Carmen P.
reviews.review: meh. i guess if you're desperate for an east nashville experience and are desperate to be served by these youngins who wear thick rimmed glasses, skinny jeans, and wear ironic t-shirts, than this is your place.  you can sit under 1980's style (the 80's are the key to any hipster party) christmas lights with pictures of matadors behind you and longingly stare out the window at that vegetarian/vegan place across the street (because that's where you should have gone) and jeni's splendid ice-cream, because that is where you'll go next. i don't know.  it's just...meh.  there comes a time in your life when you realize that having personable servers and good quality food outweigh the desire to be in a "hip" area.  there are some pretty awesome restaurants in this area, but this isn't one of them. if someone tells you otherwise, they haven't had decent food--check their other yelp reviews, they probably also gave mcdonald's and applebees good reviews.we had the avocado fries, which were fraudulently described as being fried in a tempura batter.  whatevs, this was not a tempura batter, it was like a thick, greasy, mcdonald's chicken nugget type batter.  the chicken quesadilla was pretty decent, but not enough for me to really want to go back, or give it more than 2 stars.

reviews.name: Angela B.
reviews.review: I had the Jalepeno Margarita--it was absolutely delicious. The chips were good too. My only complaint would be that they serve the margaritas in martini glasses with no ice, which is super annoying on a hot day. I kind of wanted to go to the bartender and explain that there are reasons why margaritas are served on the rocks and not in martini glasses, but instead I just ordered a glass of ice and poured the margarita over it.

reviews.name: Jason C.
reviews.review: I'm really struggling to see the wide spread appeal in this place.  Sure, they have tons of margarita choices.  Hence the three stars.  But what happens when you get hungry? Fairly recently I had the veggie fajitas. Seemed more like a puddle of grease with some veggies swimming in it. Not the best, but not the worst either. But the most recent trip was worth writing about. We had an 8 top, and the restaurant was slammed on a Thursday night. I'm not going to drone on, but the service was AWEFUL, rude, and bitchy. Not worth listing the details. There's a difference between being in the weeds, and simply not giving a damn about your table. I have a theory. She ended up adding 20% gratuity to the check so I'm thinking she didn't give a hoot. Then there was the food. I had some kind of tilapia steamed on a banana wrap. The amount of fish was absolutely ridiculous for $14, and I had to smoother it in hot sauce to make it edible. I might come back for some cocktails, but will probably choose to eat somewhere else.  I really wanted to speak to a manager, but since it was a birthday party I didn't want to make a scene.  Yikes.

reviews.name: Kap P.
reviews.review: Def awesome place .. Not your typical Mexican restaurant. It's unique in its own ways the food was pretty damn good . I ordered the combo plate and it as less than 11 dollars pretty good deal . Highly recommend this place but as always parking sucks in this area

reviews.name: Brent E.
reviews.review: Had the Grilled Fish Taco's, but I believe the appetizers were way better than the main course.  Cheese dip has bits of sausage in it...and I have to say this is the best cheese dip I have ever had! Avocado fries were awesome! Wish I had a picture, but they got devoured before the smartphone could get pulled into action. Would love to come back just for margaritas and apps!

reviews.name: Mark T.
reviews.review: My wife and I really enjoy this restaurant. The fajitas are great. I like them with chicken, beef, and shrimp. 3 great sauces are served with the chips. Service is always top notch. Great vibe, as others have mentioned. Top shelf margaritas are our favorite in town. We go there often, and I highly recommend.

reviews.name: Joey N.
reviews.review: I will start by saying I love Mexican food and these guys have the best chile verde I have had in Nashville.  But a to go order that went wrong turned ugly. After the second trip back to the restaurant to get everything I ordered they were very nice and comped my dinner, while doing this they charged another tables tab to my card. Once I found this out a couple of days later after checking my balance on line I went back to the restaurant. A member of their management team came out to assist in getting things squared away. But after being told that they served over 240,000 people that  year I would just be one that they missed. I was kinda dumb founded and still talk about it today.

reviews.name: Kristofer G.
reviews.review: Top shelf margarita and queso with deep fried flour tortilla chips were awesome.  I had good company on the patio which made for a goo time.  We will be back.

reviews.name: Blake S.
reviews.review: I enjoy Rosepepper and go quite often, however, after my last experience it will be a while before I am brave enough to go again. It was a Friday night, so of course they are busy which I completely understand. What I don't understand is the food runner who spilt cheese dip in my hair, on my jacket and in my purse. Look accidents happen and I get that. But saying "oops sorry" and not offering me at least a napkin is not okay. It was beyond clear that cheese dip was all over me but none of the wait staff even stopped. I had to go behind the bar myself grab napkins and then wipe down in front of the hostess stand. She knew what was happening because I had to repeatedly ask if it was okay that I threw the nasty napkins away in the trash can beside her. We are seated and I decide to stay because I am starving and surprisingly craving cheese dip at this point. Guess who is the person bringing our food to the table? I figure that he would apologize then, or at least tell our waitress what happened but no. He proceeds to act like nothing happen and is too scared to even look at me. HORRIBLE SERVICE!

reviews.name: Holly H.
reviews.review: I'll start by saying the margaritas and guacamole here are great. Service is good. Despite all the vegetarian options on the menu, they just do not know how to do vegetarian food. Maybe they feel like they don't need to, with a legit vegetarian restaurant right across the street, but we like to switch it up sometimes. I've tried every vegan option on the menu, and aside from the bean chimichanga, which is delicious because it's fried, everything has been completely bland. The vegan burrito is filled with unseasoned (and maybe even unsalted?) black beans and steamed carrots, cauliflower, and broccoli. The rice doesn't really taste like anything either. I feel like the margaritas and nice servers are the only things that raise this place from a 2 to a 3.Maybe their meat options are better.

reviews.name: Dillon V.
reviews.review: Okay I've been to this place about 5 times over the last 5 months. Each time I go the place is dirtier than the last. I usually order fajitas and I can honestly say they are gross here. The steak was worse tasting than taco bell and the whole dish was cold. I asked for corn shells and they gave me some grease drenched soft taco. There isn't enough alcohol in the place to make me go back. They have a smokers patio and you can't take your drinks out there. Tables are always dirty, menus are always dirty, bathroom is always dirty, that must mean the kitchen is nothing I even want to think about. I was watching an employee clean dishes with a hose out back when I parked. This place needs a visit from the health inspector. I've never finished a whole meal here ever. I do not recommend you go here ever. Note to the owners, clean you act up and your restaurant. I tell everyone I know to avoid this place, and if you disagree you must like eating nasty food. I don't care how hipster the place is go somewhere else where the employees are nice and the place is clean.

reviews.name: Molly B.
reviews.review: Don't go here. I haven't even eaten here and I am telling you, don't go here. A) my friends that have eaten here tell me that they charge extra for chips and salsa refills. That's complete and total BS. B) we went here on a Friday night and their website and Yelp said they close at 11, and we got there at exactly 10:36. (I know that's not very courteous of us, but we tried another place before and couldn't find a parking spot so we ran here.) As soon as we walked in a worker said (incredibly rudely) "whoa whoa whoa, this kitchen's closed. If you want drinks you can stay but there's no food to be had here."okay first of all, you weren't supposed to close until 11. At 10:36, that gives you 24 minutes until closing time. You aren't allowed to do that. And then be rude about it to potential paying customers? No thank you. I will never be coming back here.

reviews.name: Jordan C.
reviews.review: we had a group of 7 and promptly seated! waitress was very laid back because we had to wait for our other guest to arrive and no pressure! finally ordered and food was quickly ready - I had a small chicken quesadilla, not that impressive, kinda dry and way cheesy - the guacamole and sour cream served on the side helped though. decor was for sure eclectic (which I love) but kinda looked thrift store picked and thrown on the walls and ceiling! I will go back but for sure try something different to eat! and just a warning- there is one bathroom for the entire restaurant- so be ready for a line at the door! blah haha

reviews.name: John B.
reviews.review: Very good food but no sense of urgency at all.

reviews.name: Dee D.
reviews.review: Ate here last night and everything was awesome (tropical blend margarita was great) until my friend noticed a mouse. I have been a customer to this restaurant for quite some time and didn't believe her.. Until I also saw it scurry across the floor withy own eyes! Told the server and hostess and they were so nonchalant about it, it made me feel as though this is a regular problem. We were not compensated in any way, still paid for our food, but will not be back due to how this was handled. Very Unfortunate.

reviews.name: Sarah K.
reviews.review: If you're looking for Mexican, skip the usual el whatever and head to Rose Pepper.Wonderful use of flavors. The chicken tamales are fabulous as are the fish tacos. THANK GOD FOR TOMATILLO SALSA! Add a margarita pitcher and you're in heaven. Fun atmosphere, too.

reviews.name: Katie H.
reviews.review: We went here a few weeks back after waiting FOREVER for a table at Silly Goose. Anyway, the margaritas are ballin'. We split a pitcher between 3 of us and for the price, it was definitely worth it. I like that they bring you three salsas with your chips because I'm a salsa fiend. I don't love that they charge you more for another round, but I suppose it keeps me from eating my weight in chips before my actual food arrives. We also tried the avocado fries which were okay. I'm not a huge fried food fan, but my husband liked them.I split the chicken fajitas with a friend. Pretty standard, but I loved that the veggies were still a bit crisp. Usually they're drown in oil but these weren't. I'd definitely be back, but hopefully when it's not packed to the gills!

reviews.name: The Bob L.
reviews.review: The Carne Asada was cooked to perfection and our waitresses choice for our tequila was spot on...

reviews.name: Angela C.
reviews.review: I visited Rosepepper for a late Friday night dinner with a group of girlfriends. It was bustling. We were seated much faster than the quoted 45 minute wait, but managed to get a pitcher of margaritas and some chips and salsa at the bar before we were called to the table. The restaurant is colorful, cozy, and noisy. My group sat out in the patio area, which is probably great in the summer when it's not covered. Food: pretty standard Mexican (fusion) fare, and it was good. I had the Sonora enchiladas, which were nice and spicy as promised, and very tasty. Everyone in the group seemed happy with the food and drink. Service was fine. My biggest complaint were that the chairs in the patio seemed low for the table, and were outdoor metal patio chairs with no cushion. The seat of the chairs slope back so it's a little uncomfortable, especially for the petite person.

reviews.name: Cody H.
reviews.review: Amazing food and service! Hannah is an awesome server and makes sure you never go thirsty or hungry during your time there. Always make sure to get seated at one of her tables. Great atmosphere in a East Nashville. Can't wait to come back again!

reviews.name: Stacey T.
reviews.review: Horribly slow service.  It took over 20 minutes for anyone to come to the table.  They did apologize and bring free queso, but then we waited another 15 minutes for our drinks and awhile for the food that was just okay.  The taco was very greasy, while the three salsas and chips were good.  The queso was the best part, but I recommend you request regular chips instead of the highly fried pieces it comes with.  This was our first trip to East Nashville and a huge disappointment.

reviews.name: David L.
reviews.review: A new discovery for me...My wife and I chose Mexican today and made the drive downtown for this opportunity.I'd heard about this spot some time ago, and today was a perfect day to enjoy a margarita on their patio.  And so... we did!  (Good flavor.  A bit pricey - $7...but I suppose that is a pretty common price point.)We started with chips and salsa (how else?!?).   (The bus boy/man was right behind us with them...how could we refuse?)  Their chips are served with a variety of three salsas - very tasty! (pic attached.)We were intrigued by the "Rosepepper Rings" -tempura battered sweet peppers fried and served on a bed of sesame seeds, with salsa and a guacamole sauce. So terribly bad for us (I said FRIED!  :( ), but so wonderfully tasty! (pic attached).My wife chose the spinach enchiladas and I had the fajitas.  The enchiladas were very good, served with black beans.  The fajitas were good, too, although far more than a lunch portion deserves to be.  As apparently traditional, they were served with refried beans.  As per my own tradition, I ignored the beans! (...never have taken a liking to nuked beans...)Our waitress (Ronni?) was very friendly and gave us good service, but left us alone, too.  (Just the way I like it.)I give this a solid "3", with perhaps a bit more for the layout of the outside seating.   I liked the originality of the place.Try it, you'll like it!

reviews.name: Amy E.
reviews.review: Highly disappointed is service and did was sub par. Now if you want an amazing pineapple margaritas there you go. No.parking.so.you are park and walk. Wait is average. Deep fried tortillas and weirdo was great. Not.happy with the soup.or.shrimp fajitas. Food was hardly warm. My father said he wont go back. I keep this place in my back pocket for drinks only.

reviews.name: Larry S.
reviews.review: Rosepepper Mexican Grill was on my to-do list, based on other Yelp reviews, so I was excited when my High School Class decided to meet here.  I know that our group contributed a lot to the noise, but by the end of the night, I was hoarse from talking loud enough to be heard over the din.  But we all had a great time!  Rosepepper's house margaritas are great, as were their chips and guacamole.  My wife had a taco salad, and it was OK..  I had the enchiladas del mar and loved them.    Considering how many of us were constantly moving around to talk with old friends, our waiter did a marvelous job of taking orders, bringing drinks, and delivering food.  The only time he seemed overwhelmed was when it was time to distribute the checks.  It took a very long time for him to sort things out.  He left our appetizer off our bill, so I just wrote it in.

reviews.name: Max R.
reviews.review: Maybe the worst excuse for mexican food I've had. Bland, flavorless and meh. Our server was nice, and so was the patio - too bad they don't have any skills in the kitchen. We let them know our dissatisfaction and they deleted the food from the bill, which is why this is 2 stars. Oh how I wish this had been better.

reviews.name: Andy S.
reviews.review: We were traveling through Nashville to go to Detroit, and we decided to stop by and see one of our friends.  He chose the Mexican restaurant called Rosepepper.  They have an amazing patio.  It looks like it is as big as the restaurant.  They give you complimentary chips and salsa like most Mexican restaurants.  However, they give you three types of salsa:  a green one, a spicier red one, and a mild red one.  I had the shrimp fajitas.  I enjoyed my meal.  The guacamole was obviously made with fresh avocados. My food was fine, but the company of friends is priceless.  Since we were roadtripping, I didn't have a margarita.  Next time, I'm passing through, I may have to change that.  Service was great, too.

reviews.name: Matt N.
reviews.review: The chicken in the tacos was so good. It was the best chicken taco I've ever had. Our server Leslie was very attentive and polite. Will definitely be back.

reviews.name: Shafi K.
reviews.review: This had become a place for work parties over the years. My co-workers and I love to go here at the end of each semester to celebrate our success! They have some great large tables at the back of the room for larger group. Happy hour starts at 4:00 p.m. If you get here at 3:50 p.m., the waiter will give you a hard time about being able to order from the happy hour menu for that price. So.. get here at 4 promptly! Bartenders are cool. I forgot my I.D. and they asked my boyfriend to write down my birthday on a piece of paper and then made me verify it. Cool deal. Margaritas are a little overpriced but that's OK. The food here is great. We shared a plate of shrimp fajitas and the portions were huge. My friend got a salad and my boss literally commented on how it looked like it weighed 5 pounds. Overall, good place for the hungry soul if you are coming with a group of friends and want good prices on Mexican food! I'll be there again in a couple of months. :)

reviews.name: James C.
reviews.review: Stopped in for lunch on a Monday. My lady ordered fajitas and they were sizzling and very good with a proper mix of beef and vegetables. She opted foe a margarita which was very good. I ordered the fish tacos (cabo taco, I believe) which were good, not great. Chips and salsa were good prior to our entrees. We will return.

reviews.name: Caitlin C.
reviews.review: I love Rosepepper. It seems to be the only place that's always open when other places are closed on Sundays, Mondays and even Tuesdays in East Nashville. I'm still not saying this is the best best best food in the world, but it certainly hits the spot on a warm day. And I can't say enough about their happy hour, because the Magaritas actually have a decent amount of alcohol in them unlike other happy hour restaurants in town. Only two got me rosie cheeked, then again I don't drink very often. I've never had trouble with service, it's always been efficient and friendly. I can get Pacifico beer and that just brings back all sorts of California memories. ALSO I'm happy to report that I like their Ceasar salad - yes Ceasar salad is Mexican - they do a good job with theirs. Always a great go to when I can think of anything else!

reviews.name: Mike F.
reviews.review: Flies. Flies everywhere. At least during the summertime, the deck is covered in swarms of disgusting flies.As for the food, well, it's pretty average. I've never been blown away by anything here.If it weren't for margarita's and it's amazing location, it probably wouldn't be in business any longer. Every time I go I try to remind myself never to return. And I think I finally remembered.

reviews.name: Bethany W.
reviews.review: Rosepepper offered great, attentive service along with a speedy arrival of our food. I enjoyed the de tomatillo enchilada with rice and beans, and we split the fried avocado slices, which were perhaps the highlight of the meal. The delicious margaritas (the casa magarita for me and the jala-pina-rita for my boyfriend) definitely packed a punch.

reviews.name: Carolyn S.
reviews.review: They've got great originial margaritas and their chips and queso is great! I love their homemade chips, they're thick and wonderful. The rest of their food is nothing to write home about and I usually skip having a meal here because I don't care for their food, with the exception of the previously mentioned items.

reviews.name: Olivia S.
reviews.review: Let me start this off by saying I love Rosepepper. I've been here many times and it is my go to place when I can't think of where to go. Last night I went with a group of ladies and it was beyond what I had ever experienced there. Service was subpar at best...and most importantly, at the end of the meal, we waited OVER AN HOUR for our check. At the time, we were all out of drinks, done with food, and were trying to get out of there to go somewhere else. I understand things get busy, but to just leave a table sitting there for a solid hour with not even so much as a glance is very frustrating. Also, when we finally got the check? There was an additional 50 cent charge for fresh lime juice on everyone's margaritas. Really? If I would have known I would have requested to leave that off....so...I get a 9 dollar marg AND you charge me extra for lime juice?! Finally, after we talked to a couple of people they refunded us our money for the lime juice, which I think is the least they could do for making us wait so long for our check. All in all, I will think twice before coming here on a busy night. They just don't have a system down to manage all the tables properly.

reviews.name: Brian R.
reviews.review: I am giving this place 3 stars because the food was good and the manager did her job and saved what was an awful experience.  Our server would disappear for 30 minutes at a time and never fixed an issue with my order.  We never even got the chance to order more margaritas.  Luckily the manager was extremely apologetic and comped our entire meal.  I never call a manager over but we had to in order to get our checks.  She insisted on taking care of the check and because of that I would give this place another chance if I come back to Nashville.

reviews.name: Afkham N.
reviews.review: ummm yeah not impressed at all. Sonoman cousine or not, it just didnt have anything special that would even remotely excite a food connoiseur. bland, lacking originality, just regular mexican food from just some regular mexican restaurant that happens to be in a hip location. i hear the drinks and the specials are really good thats all the reviews say too. but i came here for the food and left hungry and unsatisfied. only thing worth mentioning from the menu is thier buffalo white queso dip. it was surprisingly good but try it with the regular chips they offer, the ones the dip came with were thick and burnt-oil tasting.

reviews.name: Caroline H.
reviews.review: I dunno, this place was A-OK, but nothing spectacular. Would I come back? Sure. Am I putting it at the top of my list? Not really. Goods: chips come with salsa varieties! Booths in the back! Friendly atmosphere! Not too crowded for Sunday brunch! Chorizo brunch special is a lot of food! Mehs: Nothing blew me away.Bads: None!

reviews.name: Selena P.
reviews.review: I wish I could give this place no stars ... Me and my mother went there today and immediately got sick after eating there, hands down the most greasy way to prepare food not even with good oil .We were sitting inside and still getting bit by flys and other bugs. I should have listened to my co worker when she told me her boyfriend had tell another guest sitting by them to get a cockroach off their shirt. Defiantly won't ever be going back

reviews.name: Matt P.
reviews.review: Found this place polarizing-- there were parts I really liked, but also parts I really didn't.Service was prompt and friendly, props there.  Really appreciated the waiter being willing and eager to go ask a bartender about the status of a drink that we saw on the online menu, but not on the "in person" one.Drink offerings were good too, no gripes from me.Where I dinged Rosepepper, though, was the food.  It wasn't BAD necessarily.  It just didn't wow me.  Maybe it's just me, but I was not a fan of the peas and carrots in the rice that came with my enchiladas.  Something seemed a tad 'off' with the beans, too.  Again, they weren't bad, but they just weren't great.

reviews.name: Lina H.
reviews.review: Definitely one of the more authentic tasting Mexican restaurants we have ever been to. I was pleasantly surprised because i had low expectations, and they blew us out of the water. They have 3 different types of salsas ranging from mild to hot, they are generous with their chip portions which tasted unlike other corn chips we have ever had... more hardier and quality taste to it. The quesadilla is amazing, and they made it gluten free by switching out the flour with corn, and it had generous chicken portions in it. The rice had fresh pees and carrots and corn in it, and the beans were some of the best black beans we have tasted. The carnitas were to die for... fresh, seasoned well, flavorful, and i believe they smoke it there. The margaritas.... WOW... now these are amazing! You have got to try the house one, because when she brought it out and it was clear and not green, she mentioned it wasn't a mix, but rather fresh lime... and i thought WOW WOW WOW... and it was delicious! If you have a chance to even just stop in for chips and salsa and margaritas, you should totally do it!

reviews.name: Jessica W.
reviews.review: I truly used to love Rosepepper, I truly did.The past few times I've visited, though, things seem to be more than lacking.I'm not sure if it's their popularity that has made them feel as though they don't have to try as hard considering that the business will come either way at this point.My last visit, however, was a completely different story. The chips they served us were harder than peanut brittle and the salsa was nearly flavorless. I've never been too impressed with their vegetarian options, but I opted for the spinach quesadilla-it seemed to be the best option of few.Now, I am not exaggerating when I say that I've made a better quesadilla drunk, at home, with scraps in my fridge. I was severely disappointed, to say the least.Anywho, the margaritas are still decent enough to bring me out to the east side on occassion, but I'll venture over to Wild Cow for some nosh afterward.

reviews.name: Leanne B.
reviews.review: Excellent top shelf margarita - there's a reason they won the award for best margarita in Nashville!  Nice variety of menu items from spicy to not. It you like spicy food, I highly recommend the chili verde. I haven't made it to the rest of the menu because I order the chile verde every time, so good!!

reviews.name: Jim V.
reviews.review: Great authentic Mexican food can be enjoyed at this Eastside establishment. I got their grand mariner top shelf margarita and it was perfect. Followed that up with their cheese dip. The breading for the dip was amazing. As an entree I got the steak fajitas. I just wish they gave you more tortillas. Overall a great experience. The only thing missing was some Mexican music. I will definitely venture here again!

reviews.name: Jill W.
reviews.review: Came into Rosepepper for my birthday and the staff was phenomenal. We came in with a large party and they were nothing but accommodating even though we stayed significantly past closing. The food was great and the margaritas were some of the best I've had!

reviews.name: Carly B.
reviews.review: I LOVE the drinks and salsa from here! The veggie options are okay, always fresh and get to the table fast. I come here mostly for drinks and salsa though.

reviews.name: Allie B.
reviews.review: The food would get 4 stars, but the service is so rude and crappy, I can't give this place more than 3 stars. You'd be well-advised to never dine with a large party there. The only times I have been there are to go to this place for a birthday, baby shower, etc. The lady who was having a birthday was asked to wrap up her party and free up the table, though we were still ordering margaritas and drinking. This also happened to the expectant mother of a baby shower.

reviews.name: Michelle P.
reviews.review: I like Rosepepper. I think they get the drinks right but the food is always hit or miss. I ordered the Taquitos and they were just standard fare. Nothing exciting about them at all. I wish that they would sprinkle a little seasoning on all the food really. The service is great depending on who's working and what time of day you go. I work near here so I'll always hit up the Happy hour.

reviews.name: Jennifer B.
reviews.review: Our waiter, Drew, gave us some of the very best, most attentive service we have received in quite some time. Our food was quite good on the whole. I would have loved it if the sautéed veggies had been cooked a bit longer and seasoned just a bit more, but this is really being picky. It was a great meal and the price was super reasonable, especially for an urban area.

reviews.name: Mike K.
reviews.review: I've never been to Mexico but I've been to Texas a few times. This place is everything I ever wanted a Mexican place to be. The food was just so awesome. With Mexican food, sometimes when you go to a place that boasts having a twist on traditional Mexican fare they incorporate the worst of American cuisine. Like taking Mexican food and giving it an "Applebees" spin. What made this place so great is that the unique-ness to it is actually great. For example, i had tempura fried avocado slices. Blew my mind. I also had a "spicy pork quesadilla" which was geniunely spicy and delicious and a perfect taco. They also serve guacamole and sour cream in a fried dish that is the great invention I've ever seen.The one thing that I wish they would do is this. They have shrimp dishes on the menu, but they didn't have any shrimp tacos, shrimp burritos or shrimp quesadillas. Its not a complaint as much as a suggestion because I think they would do a great job with those dishes

reviews.name: Stephanie P.
reviews.review: I feel people only go here because it's in east Nashville and that is supposed to be cool.They don't have the best prices and the margs aren't anything to rave about.Also, they now charge for your 2nd basket of chips and every basket after that. Maybe they do that so their skinny jean-wearing customers will stay skinny...

reviews.name: Phil C.
reviews.review: 1) Service has gone downhill sadly. It use to be a hotspot for my staff to enjoy a mexican fiesta... or just lunch, but after the last couple visits -- i'll be shocked if we return. 2) Who charges for chips and salsa? I could understand requiring a minimum order ($10 or something) -- but after one small container of chips and a vat of salsa, any table of two or more is usually wanting more (and will typically spend $50+ on a meal + drinks).  Just a disappointing move. 3) Yeah the mexican is ... sloppier, but I will find myself as Las Maracas from now on.

reviews.name: Samantha S.
reviews.review: I do not like this place.  I've tried for years but no.I brought some out of town girlfriends here today after they had asked about Rosepepper.  I figured I would take one for the team and let them try it out.  UGHService was beyond horrible and to top it off it took 15 minutes from when when asked for our check and when the server dropped it off and there were maybe 8 tables in the entire restaurant.  We had somewhere to be so that was pretty annoying.  The food - no.  Salsa has potential but stop watering it down.  Margaritas are fine - that's why I didn't give 1 star.I asked for a side of guacamole and it comes in a cute little fried tortilla bowl.  The server brings it out in her hands and just lays it on the table.  No plate. Are you serious?I was embarrassed but the food and service were both so bad we were still laughing about it later in the day.  Never again.

reviews.name: Ryan P.
reviews.review: Bummed that my birthday dinner happens to end here tonight. Given I wasn't very hungry after already having lunch at an awesome place in downtown Nashville, but when we came down to see Jenny's ice cream from recommendations, we were looking forward to a small appetizer style dinner here before ice cream. Unfortunately we were disappointed by the food. Don't advertise tempura fried avocado then serve deep fried battered version of it. Tempura should be light, crispy, high temp fried food that keeps the flavor of what it's coating intact. These were heavy and way over batted and just nasty. Had 2 pieces. Had the quesadilla appetizer also and brought it home as leftovers. Glad we didn't spend money on a full blown meal like we usual would have, would have been disappointed to spend $100 on a meal and be of the quality we had.

reviews.name: Mark H.
reviews.review: I my quest to find great Mexican food in Nashville I was prompted to try Rosepepper's Mexican food in (East) Nashville; their margaritas are reputed to be the best in Nashville.After eating there yesterday afternoon I hate to say disappointment again. First off they sat us on the patio, with was cold but we stuck it out (no patio heaters???) We ordered margaritas, which was the clearest I'd ever seen anywhere and about as flavorful as water with a twist of lime. The menu labels some dishes as "muy cailente", but my entree night was bland. If you serve a taco in a corn tortilla you need to use two, if not they just fall apart.The service was good, though. Parking can be tight during peak times.The quest will continue!

reviews.name: Joshua B.
reviews.review: So - I have written this review a couple times.  I have gone back and changed the review more than once because I can't seem to express what I want to say, really.Perhaps just stating it as plainly as I can will help.  So, here we go:  Not at all impressed.I visited Rosepepper several times years ago.  I hadn't visited in a while and my group of friends and I were originally going to go to the Silly Goose across the street.  However, they couldn't fit us in until 9pm.  So, instead of waiting - we decided to go to Rosepepper and see if we could get in.  I didn't think we could because, in my previous experiences, it was hard to get a seat at Rosepepper.  They had no problem seating 10 of us immediately.  Great!  So, we were seated on the patio.  And, they put us at a table that really shouldn't have seated more than 8 - but, that's OK.  We made it work.We place our drink order and, for some unknown reason, it took forever for them to come out.  And no one ordered anything alcoholic.  We all have a discussion about how odd it was that there was a sticker on the front of the menu telling us that they are now going to charge for more than 1 bowl of Chips and/or salsa.  They brought 2 bowls for 10 of us.  The bowls were small.  This seemed a little 'nickel and dime' to me.  I can't remember being charged for chips at a Mexican restaurant.  Sure, they will charge for queso or guacamole.  But never chips.  Very nickel and dime to me - especially considering that there are plenty of Mexican restaurants in the Nashville area and none of them charge for chips and salsa.  Then we finally ordered dinner - and it took forever for everything to come out.  And, when it did - everything I had was cold.  The beans, the rice and the Chimichanga were cold.  And the cheese sauce over the Chimi was congealed meaning that there is no doubt it had been sitting for a while.  During the meal - our table was FULL of glasses, plates, empty salsa cups and chip bowls.  Not once did the server remove any plates or empty glasses.  We all finally just decided to put the stuff on the floor because we didn't have room for anything else.  All of this left me wondering if the owners of Rosepepper are having money issues or some sort of business issues or something.  I mean - in previous encounters at Rosepepper it was hard to get a seat and this time - no problem.  Nickel and dime on refills of chips and salsa and the inability to get the food out in a timely manner and the server not clearing anything - this might mean they are short staffed or can't keep help for whatever reason.  It was all very disconcerting.  I don't think I'll be back.  Usually - at a restaurant - even if everything doesn't go well - if I can find a reason to come back (food or service) I will come back.  But, the service was lack luster from beginning to end and the food was mediocre in flavor - and was cold when we got it (another service issue).  Even if the food was warm (or even hot) the flavor was the same.  It was very bland.  Wish I could have given a good review for Rosepepper.  If the food had been good, I could have excused the service.  Next time I might get a different server but I would expect food as good as my previous trip.If the service had been good, I could have excused the food.  Maybe it was an off night in the kitchen.  Maybe next time the food will be better - but at least they had great service.I honestly couldn't say there was anything that made me want to come back - and that makes me sad.

reviews.name: Kate A.
reviews.review: Okay, after three not-so-great experiences here, I'm writing a review:Bad Experience #1: It was last summer, and it was hot. The air-conditioning/electricity went out before we had even gotten our meal. I get it - we did have a very hot summer in Nashville last summer and the A/C was being overworked. It was still a bad experience and I never want to sweat that much in a Mexican restaurant again. Bad Experience #2: I was there in the evening for a small birthday party. Dinner was over, we were leaving. It was around 8pm. A girl (who I didn't know) threw up all over my back and the floor as I was exiting the building - not the restaurant's fault, but still a bad experience none-the-less. I never want to be thrown up on in a Mexican restaurant again.Bad Experience #3: Again, here for a friend's birthday dinner earlier this month. Our party was for 16, though originally when the reservation was made it was 14, so we upped the numbers (by two) and let them know. We waited an hour and a half to be seated (no biggie - we had a big party, we understood). So finally they were ready to seat us. There were two seats missing, so my boyfriend and I asked for two more seats. The host was a little short with us, asked us if we had let them know that it was supposed to be 16 and not 14 - we said yes (because, yes, we did let them know). She made zero effort to find a small table to add to the end and told us that we had to sit on the corners as she handed us chairs. Basically we ate our food in our laps. And, I would also like to add that the bathrooms were not clean (messes on the floor - it was just gross.)The food - not memorable. If the food was amazing I'd probably forgive my bad experiences because really, after writing this all out, it looks like I've just had extremely bad luck at this place. I'm a believer in second chances but the third time is the charm - Bad Experience #3 was the icing on the cake and I'll probably not be going out of my way to come back.

reviews.name: June S.
reviews.review: I'm giving this 4 stars for the margaritas and the queso... that's it. They are that good that it outweighs the rest of the flavorless food.  So just go there during happy hour and get sloshed on their 'ritas :)

reviews.name: Steve C.
reviews.review: Margaritas on the Rosepepper patio is great way to enjoy a warm Sunday afternoon in Nashville.  Rosepepper's has an extensive margarita menu, but my wife and I enjoyed the Casa Margarita with side order of the Chile Verde on this visit.  The Chile Verde is listed as Muy Picante on the menu and this is a fair representation of the heat - definitely a sinus clearing dish.

reviews.name: Tara W.
reviews.review: Food is some of the best I've had in a very long time. Impeccable service. Would recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: Below average food. Rude and arrogant waiters. Can't believe this place hasn't gotten any better since I last went 3 years ago. I am a local, and I was reminded of why I avoid it.

reviews.name: Bob R.
reviews.review: This place is a 2 minute walk from our house.  This afternoon we went for a walk and decided to stop by for a drink.  It was like we were invisible, only about 6 customers in the whole place.  We finally gave up and walked out.  I don't think they cared.

reviews.name: Robert B.
reviews.review: I went to Rosepepper for the 2nd time last week, and I'll be honest...I don't want to like this place for a number of reasons:1. It's trendy -  New trendy places tend to lose their appeal once all the new shininess has warn off and people start judging them on their food and service.2. It's full of hipsters and folks of that ilk - I'm probably showing my age, and maybe I'm just hatin' for the sake of hatin', but some hipsters really get under my skin. 3. There's always a long wait to get seated - refer back to reason #1.Despite these reasons, I can't help myself; I like Rosepepper. I have had margaritas on both occasions, and being a former bartender, I must say they are quite excellent. They are exactly how I would make a margarita for myself; heavy-handed on the tequila, a splash of Cointreau, and fresh-squeezed lime juice. Darn near close to perfect. The food is also not too shabby. The Sonora Style Enchiladas are out-of-this-world tasty with some crazy-good spicy flavor. I would also recommend the Chile Verde which also has quite a nice kick to it. I wasn't expecting it to be quite so soupy, but it worked really well considering it was very cold outside and we were eating on the back patio area. Speaking of the patio area...I liked eating out there. It wasn't as loud as the rest of the restaurant, it felt more private, and think it would be a cool place to hang out at night in the summer.Bottom Line: Go there, but if you hate waiting in line, then you may want to consider going for lunch. 4 Stars.

reviews.name: Steven M.
reviews.review: Heard Spanish from the kitchen, boost, aways a good clue that this place is legit. Happy hour marg was not watered down and the food had a nice kick to it! In other words this place goes balls deep! Outdoor seating and a full tequila bar sets this joint apart from the standard tex mex, but it won't break your wallet on a date.

reviews.name: Krissy T.
reviews.review: Went here for my bday and had a great time! I love the margaritas, the house does the trick!! However, our server Paul really made our experience special. He's funny and outgoing and really attentive. The coolest part was he gave us a code for the app "lyft" so we were able to get around safely the rest of the night for free! Next time we're asking for him again!

reviews.name: Lindsey D.
reviews.review: As many other Yelpers suggest, the margaritas are what make this place so great. I was told by our server they're made with 100 años tequila, triple sec, Rose's lime, Sprite, and fresh lime juice. She might have left out a secret ingredient but I often make them like this at home and they're great.The salsa trio is a big plus. Speaking of big plus, those burritos. Sheesh. I get three meals out of them. Fried avocado- yes sir.Good: vegetarian/vegan optionsburritosfajitaschimichangasservice (can be a little slow but this place is usually slammed)Great:margaritaspatioBad:they're closed 2-4 (maybe this is seasonal? I've run into this issue a couple of times but other reviews don't mention it)their reservation system is whack- I would explain it better if I understood it betteralmost always packed- expect a wait (not necessarily a bad thing, just comes with the territory of a popular place)Tip:Check-in on Foursquare and get happy hour prices on your first round

reviews.name: Ozro D.
reviews.review: Let me say, up front, that the food here is fantastic. Keep that in mind through the rest of my review, because it's probably going to sound more negative than it should.This is not a typical Mexican restaurant, by any means. In East Nashville fashion, Rosepepper emphasizes trendiness, which results in higher prices and a small hint of pretentiousness. This is most apparent by the sticker that graces the front of every menu:"Your first round of chips and salsa is on us. Refills: Chips $2.00 Salsa $1.00 ea." Call me old fashioned, but that's the ONE thing that a Mexican restaurant can do to annoy me. I've put up with bad service at plenty of them. But to charge for extra chips and salsa borders on absurdity. Oh, and the sticker has a big, condescending smiley face on there, as if that makes it okay.The service was actually pretty good. Not super attentive, and our margaritas took a while to come out, but nothing was particularly bad. The food all came out right and relatively quickly, each of which is a minor miracle at many Mexican restaurants. But like I said, the food was great. Overprice, sure, but delicious, nonetheless. I don't mind paying extra for good food, but is this really twice as good as any of the places on Nolensville? Fancier, sure; better, no. The margaritas, however, were noticeably better than most - something that's actually worth the price increase. And despite my frustration with them, the chips and salsa were great. But I'm not going to pay $2 for more chips, solely on principle.Rosepepper is a good, though overhyped, restaurant. It certainly delivers some great food, but it's hard to justify the tradeoffs.

reviews.name: Chad P.
reviews.review: Don't seat yourself in the section in front of the bar. They don't serve anyone who sits here. Frustrating to say the least. However, their one redeeming item is the margarita. You even pay for chips and salsa..

reviews.name: Sarah C.
reviews.review: This was my second time at Rosepepper. The first was for a yummy meal with friends and this time it was a drinks celebration! Our semi-large party rolled in about 20 minutes before closing time. Fortunately, we struck up a deal with our server who had a few tables that remained open. I ordered a simple bourbon and diet with a lime. I expected a short cocktail glass...Whoa buddy was I surprised when it came in a full sized glass! Delicious!The service was outstanding for our little party and the vibe is great to hang out. I can't wait to move to the patio once the weather improves.

reviews.name: Angie L.
reviews.review: I used to go there a bunch before moving to the south side. I miss being close to some of my girls and some of our favorite hangouts. On a recent Monday night (they are a great time to go out, no crowds and a needed break after working hard all day for the "man"! Haha) We got started with a pitcher of mango margaritas. As usual for Rosepepper, they were awesome. The chips were fresh and the salsa was ok. I ordered a fajita burrito (chicken) and it was huge. It tasted fine, guess I would call it good but nothing exceptional. I sometimes think that restaurants like this could easily find a way to improve their chicken, either cooking it differently or getting from another supplier. It's like when you can get better cooked chicken at Kroger, it can't be that hard.

reviews.name: Wendy P.
reviews.review: Besides the margaritas and the nice staff, there is really no reason to visit, sadly. It is in a great area of East Nashville, but the food is overpriced, greasy, and it's difficult to leave without a stomach ache. The servers are very friendly - this review is certainly not based on any bad customer service. Purely on food, there are many better Mexican places to go (hit up Nolensville Rd instead!)

reviews.name: Paul K.
reviews.review: I was not too particularly thrilled with the food or speed of service here. The people saying the food is insanely good, I sure didn't get that. I got a burrito the size of a small dog that's primary flavor was green peppers and slightly undercooked chewy beans.Now, that's not a terrible thing mind you, if you're El Cheapo Mexican, it's fine. As I understand it, the primary draw here is their margaritas, I've had them in the past and as I recall they were decent.It was ok, don't get me wrong, I did not dislike the place, just was not really impressed with the food offerings, lack of parking, wait, service, chips, 2 out of 3 salsas.My experiences have been, average on average. It was loud, I felt I was waiting more than anything. I have no problem waiting for greatness, but waiting for a beer and a burrito and a check... ugh

reviews.name: Nashlandia X.
reviews.review: Here's what I wanted:Free chips & salsa, no frills service, beer, easy atmosphere, affordable prices, good food, and a variety to choose from.Rosepepper nailed it.Your chips and salsa come out quick and delicioso.  Your salsa is a little watery (it's true), but the green tomatillo salsa is flavorful.Your guac was pretty darn good (though I personally could up the garlic salt).Your queso dip? Forget about it.  Nom nom.$3 for an extra tall glass of Dos Equis during happy hour? = Great deal!I was torn between entrees and while I went with the asada burrito, I wouldn't go there again.  It was fine but not what I really wanted.I'll be back to find my #1 entree.  :)

reviews.name: Laura C.
reviews.review: This place is definitely worth a visit, particularly in Nashville, which doesn't have great Latin@ food (sorry, Nashville). The margaritas are great, and so is the salsa. I got the chile relleno, which was prepared differently than I expected. Somehow the outside was coated and grilled, which was good, but that combined with the cheese inside was too rich for me. A really good selection, especially if you like meat!Get here early to avoid a long wait.

reviews.name: Carly H.
reviews.review: Here's the deal:  Rosepepper's food is average, at best.  Good chips, and you get three different salsas, two of which I really like, though I'm not a fan of the verde. Serviceable Mexican food, but nothing to write home about.  The thing that makes Rosepepper a place that I will not stop going to is the fantastic margarita they make! They are pretty expensive compared to say, Las Palmas, unless you go at happy hour, but it is so worth it.  They are strong, and there isn't a drop of pre-packaged mix to be found. The atmosphere is also pretty fun, the deck is really nice to sit on in the summer, and the servers are attentive.

reviews.name: Dawn H.
reviews.review: I've been racking my brain for a good place to take my boyfriend, family, and friends (17 of us) for his birthday tomorrow.  Wanted someplace that was kinda fun for our dinner.  Thought of the Rose Pepper so I called this morning.  No answer.  Okay maybe it's the one restaurant in Nashville where the managers aren't in at least 2 hours before opening.  Called again at 11:00.  No answer so I left a message.  Manager, Helen, called me back at 11:33, introduced herself, then put me on eternal hold.  I hung up.  It's now 12:20 and no call back.  After reading the reviews about the bad service....I believe you!!  Will rethink and go somewhere else.

reviews.name: Liz R.
reviews.review: This looked like a fun place and we ate outside because there was a wait to eat indoors and we had three kids with us. First, the food, it was very below average. The tacos looked like they were ordered off a non-Mexican restaurant menu. I was surprised to be served stiff, flour tortillas with a tiny amount of filling and cheddar cheese and lettuce and tomato. The grilled vegetables that came with mine were terrible and mushy. No one else's food looked very good or authentic. And of course, the flies.. wow. They were TERRIBLE. A very modest investment of a few skilled workers and some screen could solve this problem forever. And it was pricey. Would not recommend or return.

reviews.name: Tracy F.
reviews.review: I've been to Rosepepper a number of times since moving to Nashville in June, and been very happy on most of my visits.  However, the last couple of times I've eaten here, I've been disappointed by both the food and the service.  On my last visit (President's Day), I came with a friend and my boyfriend for lunch.  It was an unexpectedly nice day outside, so we decided to sit on the outdoor patio.  I don't know if the staff was unprepared for the number of people wanting to sit on the patio or if this was just a fluke, but the service was absolutely terrible from start to finish.  Our chips were cold, and it took about 15 minutes for my boyfriend to receive his Diet Coke.  We all ordered fajitas, which were fine but not nearly as good as they'd been on previous visits.  The most disappointing part of our meal, however, were the avocado fries.  They came to the table freezing cold, as if they'd been sitting out of the fryer for too long.  The batter was flavorless, and because avocado has little flavor of it's own, the fries were a true let down for all of us.  If the waitress had come to the table more often, we probably would have sent them back--but she was too busy to come around more than once or twice throughout our meal.I'm hoping these past couple of visits were just flukes, since our previous visits were all wonderful.  We'll probably return, as we haven't given up hope on this place quite yet--one more bad experience, and we'll probably try to find a new spot when we're craving Mexican food.

reviews.name: Em S.
reviews.review: Nothing too much to write about here: terribly slow service, mediocre (that's not necessarily a bad thing) food, and a typical (read: somewhat loud) atmosphere for a Mexican / Tex-Mex type casual table-service restaurant. A fair warning: the avocado fries were disgusting! I wasn't sure if there was more avocado or grease or flour or salt in those few oddly-shaped pieces that came out as an undesired hybrid of crispy and soggy. My wallet shuddered as each bite probably costs almost a dollar. Luckily, the spinach enchiladas were scrumptious, and came with a good portion of rice and black beans. Free chips and salsa were appreciated.Plenty of outdoor patio seating as well as a bar with TVs.

reviews.name: Gabe F.
reviews.review: I've only had a few things off the menu. The fajita fresca taco salad is massive and exceptional! Also, try one of the fabulous margaritas and buffalo queso dip.Seating and service can be pretty slow during the weekend because it's always super busy. Try going for lunch or week night.

reviews.name: Liz F.
reviews.review: I've been here several times and every single time I leave wondering why I gave them another chance only to be severely disappointed.The only redeeming factor of my experiences has been the margaritas. If you're looking for a good magarita and absolutely nothing else, this is a fantastic spot to drink a few down and munch on some chips. I think one of their salsas in the trio are actually yummy, but 1/3 isn't great.I've ordered several different items from this restaurant, and have always been less than happy with my dishes. The chicken is always dry and poorly seasoned. The raw vegetables on the side are completely unnecessary because they're bland and not even incorporated into the dish. The rice has absolutely zero flavor and I am confident I could make it better at home.The only good food I've had here in maybe 6 different visits has been the carnitas (off my brother's plate after I decided I didn't want my food) and the guacomole (which is admittedly delicious and chunky and comes with great tostadas). Even these good items wouldn't bring me back to this place because not only has the food not been good consistently but the service has also been dismal on several times.One instance in recent memory happened back in February or so where we waited forever to have a server come to our table (on a night that was not extremely busy) and then the server never came back until the meal ended and she brought us our check. No water refills, no drink refills, no "how's your food?" (which was probably good since I would have returned mine to the kitchen), nothing from this server. We had to get other servers to do things like refill our drinks or busboys to bring us chips. This isn't the only time we've had less than attentive service from the Rosepepper staff, either. Combined with the less than flavorful food, I have very little reason to ever eat here again. But if I want a good margarita for happy hour, I know what bar to go to.

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: Sundays in Nashville are strange since almost everything is closed down by about 3 or 4. I didn't want to take my lovely here since I've been here before but it was a lack of options. I had take out here before but never came for table service. We were both in the need for something small and after looking through the menu I ordered the special for the day: Tamales vera cruz, while my gf got the small chicken quesadilla and a mango margarita. The tamale was pretty good, authentic a little on the blander side but the beans and rice made up for it-the salsas were helpful with that too. My gf liked the quesadilla which had its share of veggies in it along with just meat and chicken and it was really tasty. She really enjoyed her margarita which was on the stronger side but with a nicely sweet taste. I enjoyed the experience of sitting in the outdoor seating area and the service was nice but still kind of underwhelmed by the flavor of it.

reviews.name: Nicole P.
reviews.review: I've been coming here for years, so I can't believe that I haven't reviewed Rosepepper yet.Is it the best "Mexican" food you'll ever eat? No, but I don't come here looking for super authentic food anyways. I like to think of them as Mexican with a modern twist and what they do make, they do very well. I particularly love anything with their shredded beef in it and the chimichangas -- the tortilla tastes like a pastry and it's sooo good. You also can't go wrong with the buffalo cheese dip with chorizo, the tamales, or the carne asada burrito, which is giant and can easily be split between two people.OH and if you love spicy food, you've got to try the Rosepepper Special Enchiladas -- they cover the enchiladas in their super spicy, but delicious, chile verde pork. I prefer them with the shredded beef, but the chicken is good too.Come here for big portions, decent prices and their killer margaritas (especially during happy hour). If you're on the search for authentic Mexican food, don't go to a trendy part of town and be surprised that it's not there. Head to Nolensville Road or Antioch if that's what you're looking for.

reviews.name: Brian S.
reviews.review: We went with a group of 6, visiting from out of town.   We were looking for a different restaurant that we couldn't find, and stumbled in to Rosepepper at around 2 on a Saturday afternoon.  We were seated outside on the protected deck area.  We ordered a pitcher of margaritas, chips and guac and queso with chorizo.  All of that was outstanding.  I got some carne tacos that were probably 4 star.  They benefitted from a little salsa and leftover guacamole. I am very picky about my tequila and margaritas, and that was what made this a 5 star spot for me.  Absolutely outstanding margarita.  As we left a little after three in the afternoon, there was a line to be seated.  I guess it was a good afternoon for some day drinkin'!

reviews.name: Eliza R.
reviews.review: Here's the thing - Rosepepper has great food in HUGE portions for a decent price.  But to me, the atmosphere is one of forced trendiness and it oftentimes gets so loud that it's overwhelming.  The hipster serves are generally pleasant, but they are sloooow and seem more concerned with chatting up their co-workers.  If you can get past the service and ridiculous atmosphere, the food is delicious, fresh and interesting.  I highly recommend the avocado fries, which are deep fried bits of battered heaven.

reviews.name: Brittany K.
reviews.review: The vegetarian burrito was spectacular, and a huge portion for a fair price! Strawberry margarita was decent, but i'm not sure where the "best margarita's in nashville for 9+yrs" comes from.. regardless, i'll visit again and try another flavor.The food, drink and atmosphere gets 5/5 stars.The service gets 2/5. VERY slow wait staff, we ended up having to get out of our seats and track our waitress down thirty minutes after finishing our meals/after she took our plates, in order to get our check. Ridiculous.

reviews.name: Meghan E.
reviews.review: I really wanted to rate this place higher, but there are a few reasons I could not.  The food is good and there are always interesting specials, as well as a large and reasonably priced tequila selection.  I had to downgrade because the avocado fries appetizer were awful, tasted like the fry oil really needed to be changed.  On the night we went we sat at the bar, and the bartender had clearly had a few too many.  Our order arrived wrong, but was quickly made right, although I did ask for the check numerous times.  Hopefully just an off night!

reviews.name: Kim Y.
reviews.review: I have to agree with Amanda W.Eat at another one of the bevy of wonderful Nashville restaurants beforehand and just while away an afternoon on the cute patio drinking tasty 'House' margs. They are good and the vibe is nice.Word of warning. We once accidentally ordered a specialty pitcher of margs on recommendation of snooty staff. In the end it was like $60. Are you joking? My bad for not asking, but your bad for not mentioning the HUGE price increase.Ask about those prices, peeps. Unless you are on a corporate card or something....

reviews.name: Ashley C.
reviews.review: Went there for lunch on Saturday. We got seated right away and then sat there for 10-15 minutes. No one ever came to ask for drinks, bring us chips and salsa, or take our order. We walked out and the hostess was not apologetic or surprised.

reviews.name: Justin R.
reviews.review: I have to agree with everyone else that has reviewed Rosepepper. Go here for the margaritas, not the food. While the food is not awful, its completely forgettable. I've been a few times now, but couldn't tell you what I had without going back and looking at the menue. Even then, I'm not sure I could remember. But, the thing that I do remember, are the margaritas. They are delicious and incredibly strong! I wouldn't suggest drinking more than one unless you have someone driving you home.  The service is just alright. I have never been treated badly, but if I were managing that place, I would whip some of them into shape. Show up for happy hour, drink a margarita (or two), have some chips & salsa, and leave before dinner.

reviews.name: Michael B.
reviews.review: Disgusting food, bad service.... Gave me a stomach ache.... Eat at Casa fiesta near Olive Garden... Fuck this place

reviews.name: Joseph B.
reviews.review: Just ate here on 29 Dec 2013 with my girlfriend. Great food. Chips and salsa came out with three kinds of salsa. A hot thick one, a mild thick one and a cilantro base one. All very good. Had the best quesadilla here I have ever had. Sour cream and guacamole came out in deep fried to tortilla shells...awesome. Only thing is that they gave us tiny straws...they were long but condensed...like coffee stirring straws.

reviews.name: S H.
reviews.review: We enjoyed our meal and would give 5 stars if the restaurant was a little less shabby.  But I will them 5 stars for the margaritas.  Absolutely the best ever.  100 percent agave tequila and fresh lime juice.  Looking forward to our next visit.

reviews.name: Adam H.
reviews.review: Hands down the most AMAZING mexican food to be eaten in Nashville. HOWEVER, the service is lacking. The moodiness and attentiveness of the servers could be better. With that said, they have the greatest patio EVER and with the food & margarita selection being so good, you have to take what you get in the service department.

reviews.name: Kendyl S.
reviews.review: What do I say about Rosepepper.It could be great, but its just not. Went there last night because there was a 30 minute wait at Silly Goose. (at 830 on a Tuesday? Really?) The service was really slow. The host put us at a table right in the middle of a crowded walking path and when my mom asked if we could move to one near a window that was open, she stood like a deer in headlights "I don't really know". Maybe she was new. I'll give her the benefit of the doubt and say she was. Eventually we were able to move to the much more pleasant window table. The chips and salsa are pretty good, we got some guac, it was pretty delicious. I think everything on the menu is over priced. Especially for the quality. I got fish taco's, grilled. They were OK. My mom got the tamale. The texture was way off for a tamale. It was like boiled polenta wrapped around stuff. No thanks! All in all, I don't like to go to Rosepper and this is why, it costs a lot and nothing is ever very good. and its slow.

reviews.name: Karli W.
reviews.review: Went for Sunday Brunch a couple weeks ago, which was not very brunch-y. Although they refer to it as "Sunday Brunch," you order off the lunch and dinner menu anyway.  The experience was pretty pleasant though despite the lack of breakfast options. The bloody mary bar was well worth it! They kept the chips coming and even start you with THREE kinds of salsa!! I ordered fish tacos, which are always kind of hit or miss, and they were fairly decent but nothing spectacular. It was kind of a random thing to choose, so I wasn't really expecting much. My roommate had the burrito asada and was obsessed with it. I will definitely be going back ...and getting something other than fish tacos.Update: I have been back several times since and I am in love. Their margaritas will knock you on your ass for $5. Amazing food. Definitely order the guacamole as a starter. It's totally worth it.

reviews.name: M J.
reviews.review: Great food!  The enchiladas are mouthwatering and the fish tacos are yummy.  The margaritas are excellent.  I've been twice and both times I left knowing that I'd return soon.  And I normally don't eat mexican food...go figure!

reviews.name: Marcia M.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is a hop, skip, and jump away from my pad and I shockingly have only had it for carry-out once until this past Saturday. A small group of my friends and I made our way onto the patio for a late afternoon lunch. Regardless if you like the food here or not, you must appreciate the patio and the random play-list of soft-rock music. During the 45 minutes that I was there, Richard Marx, Bette Midler, and that song that Fievel sang from Amercian Tale were all bumping from the speakers. Ah...memories. It did make me reflect on how I could never get into the sequel Fievel Goes West, did you?Back to Rosepepper.Our waitress was doting and made sure that the mounds of tortilla chips and salsa were always plentiful at our table. I ordered the Vegan burrito (around $9) and was elated when it landed on my plate. The size of this thing was just about as large as my chihuahua Chico who happened to be sitting next to me at the time. Wowza. Unfortunately, the quality wasn't as good as the quantity because it wasn't seasoned well and was a tad on the bland side.Vegan food is not boring and frankly my dear...I was nearly in a coma from the lack of flavor. Word.The service was good and I dug the environment so I will likely be back to take another swing but it may just be to grab pitchers of margaritas.

reviews.name: Zac P.
reviews.review: Good Mexican food.  The price is pretty steep for what you get compared to other exican places around that serve basically the same food.  They charge for chips and salsa after the first basket so beware of that.  The margaritas are very good but also come at a price.  I'm all for paying for what you get but this place gets three stars simply for the fact that the price doesn't match the quality and amount of food that you get.

reviews.name: Diane L.
reviews.review: We have frequented Rosepepper on many occasions and have always loved the vibe! I mean it's East Nasty people, easy breezy, laid back. The interior is festive and today we sat on the patio and it was beautiful. However.....after we were seated it went down hill fast.Took awhile to get our orders in, waited an exceptionally long time only to have our unfriendly server inform us that the kitchen lost our order. Ok not that big of a deal... Our food finally came and it was incredibly bland. I had to salt it and add guacamole to make it taste like anything. My daughter-in-law and I ordered the exact same dish and while it looked the same on the outside it was completely different on the inside. The server was unpleasant and clearly in a rush. It wasn't even all that busy today.It's going to be a long time before we go back there which makes me sad. This was a request made by my husband to go to Rosepepper for Fathers Day. It really was an epic fail. 2 stars were given only for the environment. Everything else rated a zero.

reviews.name: Beth C.
reviews.review: I so want to love this place, but I just can't. The service was excellent and the atmosphere was fun and lively, but the food can be bland. The restaurant recognizes this and has a blurb in the menu. There is a spicy verde sauce that you can add to your entree, and my husband and his friend said that there meal was much better with it. I stuck with the veggie fajitas even though I wasn't wowed by them. I . enjoyed making them and trying to add some pizazz to them, but it was just okay.

reviews.name: Lulu C.
reviews.review: This place is the most overrated restaurant in Nashville. The food is absolutely horrible. Ive kept giving it a chance over the years because its in my neighborhood. But no more. Everything is SUPER bland and cheaply made. I ordered the taco salad, sub shrimp. They just boiled the shrimp. There was ZERO seasoning. They gave me no sauce or dressing. The prices are absurd for the low quality and shitty tasting food. they put zero effort into the food. Do not waste your money at this place.

reviews.name: Robert J.
reviews.review: Love to see how east Nashville is changing. A lot of hipsters are around but I found the good to be terrific. Service was outstanding. Everything from queso to fajitas were first-rate!

reviews.name: Jessica H.
reviews.review: Rosepepper was previously one of my fave Eastside spots. I raved about the place. Everyone I knew did too. Then a funny thing happened & we all spoke up to say it just wasn't that great. We realized we were going for the margs & perhaps a pre-wednesday 3crow 241 meal or someones birthday dinner (ample seating to fit big parties: the other major pro besides housemade margaritas.) The food is nothing spectacular & the service is mediocre. One of those right of passage places that you frequent once you cross the bridge post-grad. It's great because it's THERE. Then you have one too many bland, slightly overpriced meals & you think enough of this. They say we're growing up. Bottom line: go when you're craving a margarita or when your roommate from sophomore year has a group dinner for her 25th bday, get drunk on the strong drinks, ask for more mild salsa (just leave the hot & green in the back, already) & call it a night.

reviews.name: Lee M.
reviews.review: Food is good. Drinks are strong. Rules are rigid. They don't like to split checks and if you are a large party will spend the first few minutes scolding you about various things. They charge for refills of chips and salsa. And ugh, the bathrooms. They. Are. Filthy. But servers are great - and it is an all and all fun spot.... Just don't expect the world.

reviews.name: Allison B.
reviews.review: This place makes me happy. I love the margaritas--they are super tasty and should be consumed by the pitcher. I also love the queso with the bit of chorizo in it. Its served with flour tortilla chips, they are a little heavy, but they are super tasty. They serve 3 different salsas with corn chips; one salsa verde, 1 spicy salsa and 1 mild salsa. They are all very yummy-- I prefer the salsa verde. Its garlicky onion goodness. Both times I've been there, I've gotten the fish tacos. They are grilled and fresh and yummy. The service was attentive and fast. The decor of the restaurant is very hip and cute, and I can't wait to try out the patio!

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: I'm not a Margarita drinker so I think I'm missing out on the primary draw of this place.  Overall I found the food to be Bland. The Salsa with the chips was nothing to write home about, and the Fajitas was truly a miracle of blandness.  My Girlfriend did commend on the fact that there no Mexican music, which was a nice change. The staff was attentive and the food came extraordinarily quickly, but I don't see myself returning.

reviews.name: Gwen T.
