reviews.review: Hey folks, a few things you need to know before dining here.  While the margaritas are quite good, the food is only average.  The avocado fries were disappointing.  As consumers who practically pay the wages for the servers while the owner pockets the profit, you need to know that when you leave a tip, cash or credit, the server does not receive it that night.  Nope, the owner pockets all tips, including cash, and then pays the server the following week. If you feel you must eat there, know that the server may or may not receive the full amount of the tip.  I hate to post this and steer anyone away from tipping a server, but folks need to know what type of establishment this is.

reviews.name: Adrianne J.
reviews.review: I've been here once and will not be going again. The atmosphere is fun (we sat on the patio, which is a nice space), but the food and service are both lousy. My husband's chile verde was fine, nothing special. My friend's tacos were also kinda meh. But I ordered the special carnitas and they were the worst I've ever had, no contest. The meat dry and greasy. The black beans that came on the side were clearly straight out of the can (my husband and my friend both had refried beans with theirs, which were pretty standard). The rice was completely flavorless and had low-quality frozen veg mixed in: peas, corn, cubes of rubbery carrot---gross. Everything was room temperature when it arrived. The waiter dropped off our food and then didn't come back for ages. When he finally returned, my two companions had been done with their plates for at least 20 minutes. At that point, I sent my food back. The waiter was super snotty about it, but I refuse the believe I was the only person to send back the carnitas! They were freaking nasty.

reviews.name: Chloe M.
reviews.review: Wow. I feel badly giving a place a one star review, but seriously. The margaritas here are the BEST in ALL of Nashville? Really, Nashville? Not to sound snobby, but I feel sorry for Nashville if that's the case. I came into Nashville for a weekend wedding and we had the bachelorette dinner here. I first ordered the sangria. Big mistake. Anytime I have ordered sangria, there has always been fruit in it. Not at Rosepepper! No fruit. It tasted like a sprite that wasn't properly mixed, not enough syrup, that had gone flat and been sitting in a warm car, and then you stuck it in the fridge trying to make it cold again, but it just didn't work. I have *never* sent a drink back to the bar.... until now. This was truly undrinkable. I tried to be as polite as possible in telling the waitress that I simply could not drink it and decided to try the Margarita instead since this is what they are know for. The waitress was friendly and didn't give me a hard time about it. She told me that most people think the sangria is pretty horrible, but she can't really tell people to not order it. That made me feel better... like I'm not the only one hating on it. The margarita was OK. It wasn't bad, but I've had many better ones. Nothing to write home about and I really can't believe that Nashvilians can't find a better one. Enough about that though, on to the food. We ordered chips and guac. Again, I really don't want to sound like a snotty brat, but I'm seriously struggling to come up with something positive to say about this place. I guess I'm spoiled by the Mexican fare I get on a regular basis in San Francisco. I don't even remember what I ordered for dinner. It wasn't good. Basically, I can't tell you where you should go if you want good Mexican food in Nashville, but I can tell you, that if you are visiting Nashville from somewhere else in the country, and you are used to getting good Mexican food, then you should not go here.

reviews.name: karla m.
reviews.review: First time at Rosepepper and was really looking forward to it.  For a Tuesday night it was very busy so I thought great the food must be super.  Not the case at all.  The 5 of us should have left after trying the chips and salsa but we had heard so many good things about this place we thought it must be a fluke.  Three of five dinners were not good at all, the other 2 thought just ok at best.  with so many other selections in the Nashville area I would suggest you go somewhere else.All very disappointed to say the least.

reviews.name: Brennan W.
reviews.review: Not much more I can add to everybody else's reviews. Great atmosphere, huge place, delicious food, massive portions, mediocre-to-poor service. Overall, a great place to spend a night with friends.  I highly recommend the Queso with homemade pita chips. Delicious.

reviews.name: Janette C.
reviews.review: Don't go expecting Mexican. Go expecting fusion.:) I had the carne asada and it was delicious.   I love that they bring three types of salsa with the chips too!

reviews.name: Austin T.
reviews.review: Since I don't live on the east side, I don't go to Rosepepper often, but we met some friends there late last week and sat on the patio. As I recalled correctly, their margaritas are still most excellent. We had a pitcher and enjoyed it with our chips and salsa and talking with friends. As usual, the food was good. It's not something you would write home about, but the quality is good enough and the quantity is more than adequate. Our server was friendly, and even though very busy, seemed to always be in the area when someone needed a glass of water or later, a new fork after flinging it several feet while making a really big hand gesture.If Rosepepper was in school, it wouldn't be an A+ student, but as I recall, it was a lot more fun to hang out and have a drink or 3 with the B students. And because their margaritas are so good, Rosepepper gets a B+ in my book.

reviews.name: Shani H.
reviews.review: So we sit down to 3 different salas and none are good. Bland bland bland. Ordered avocado fries with avocado sauce and it just didn't give me the life I was looking for. Margaritas are ok, big but not great (not sure if drinking lime water). Needless to say we're leaving after appetizers...

reviews.name: Jamie A.
reviews.review: I absolutely love the margaritas, chilequiles and the chile verde pork (dump a side of chile verde pork on the chilequiles for a fantastic lunch!), however the majority of the menu is just kind of blah to me.  Enchiladas have a weird sweetness to them; I find myself adding salsa or salt to adjust.  Service, for the most part, is decent.  They handle a large crowd well, though last time I visited as half of a party of two, we had to flag down a server to put in our orders.  I hate doing that, but we had been there a while and other tables that arrived after we did had all ordered.

reviews.name: Michelle M.
reviews.review: I've been here several times and always left feeling meh, if not disappointed. The decor isn't great, the food is alright, but nothing to write home about and, and the drinks are ok. Again: meh...

reviews.name: Teresa B.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is a cool place to hang out and have a drink or few with friends.  Their margaritas are among the best in town.  The wait staff and bartenders are always friendly and attentive.  I'm more of an authentic Mexican food eater so their menu isn't exactly my taste but the food is good.  Definitely worth a try if you have not been.

reviews.name: Bridget L.
reviews.review: I went there for lunch and ordered the pork tamales and they were delicious. We went in a group and everyone seemed equally as satisfied with their meal. I had the house margarita and it was hands down the best margarita I have tasted at a restaurant. I will definitely be going back.

reviews.name: Heather L.
reviews.review: The BEST margaritas in the universe! The atmosphere is fun and the staff are accommodating and nice! If you go on a Friday or Saturday night be prepared to wait. They are packed out and it takes forever to get a table. Part of that is because you don't want to leave! :) oh and they have waffle fries...WAFFLE FRIES!

reviews.name: Gracie L.
reviews.review: Do not get their vegan burrito. I asked the server what kind of vegetables came in it and I was told fajita veggies like red peppers and onions. It came with half cooked broccoli, cauliflower, and carrots. Who wants broccoli in their burrito? I ended up taking the veggies out and trying to finish the rest. The rice and beans were bland and just plain gross. I got my order to go, otherwise I would have had them take it back and give me something else. I usually never complain, especially on yelp but when you're starving and having a bad day and just want a burrito to make you feel better the last thing you need is 10 dollars worth of crap.

reviews.name: Sandy T.
reviews.review: Margaritas rock!

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: A few things you need to know about he Rosepepper. 1. The food will not BLOW you away2. It's not the most modern looking decor3. The service will be average at bestOk, now I know some of you are wondering why I gave it 4 stars. Here goes:The food is tasty. If you want fancy Mexican, go to Cantina Laredo. I, for one, am happy to get good chips with 3 salsas, and a damn good chimichanga w/rice and beans  for $7. They also have a delicious fajita salad for the ladies and gents watching their waistline. The margaritas are above average as well. No neon green, ecto HI-C colored mix used in these babies. Fresh lime juice, good tequila, and a healthy pour make for a happy mouth. I feel like Nashville doesn't know a decent margarita. The heartburn inducing, aforementioned mix is the norm, and shouldn't be. It's lazy and disparages the good name of Margarita, wherever she may be. If you care about decor in a Mexican restaurant, I dont think you are Mexican food material. Christmas lights year round, sombrero's and cheap church fellowship hall chairs are the standard set here. Also, the two best Mex places I have ever been to looked like they were selling blow out of the back. Service usually does suck, but just order everything at once and you will be fine. Worth a shot, just follow the guidelines!

reviews.name: Derek E.
reviews.review: I'm glad this place is in my neighborhood but it could definitely improve. I've been here 4 or 5 times and I've usually enjoyed the atmosphere but the food has been hit or miss. The service is either great or kind of snobby, depends on who you get. The fajitas I recently ordered were not worth the price. If you are going to charge a little more for mexican food than other places then it should be better. I'll be back, but I wonder about the quality of food and service I'll receive.

reviews.name: Amy C.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is my "go to" place in East Nashville.  Great patio, tasty food and BEST of all...$5 MARGARITA'S!  These aren't your ordinary margarita's...they are award winning and with one sip, you will understand why.   To get these beauties for just $5, visit them M-F from 4-7pm and drink until your hearts content...I promise it won't take much, as these suckers pack a PUNCH!

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: Rosepepper - the East Nashville Mexican staple.  I've been hearing about Rospepper for years, especially about their award winning margarita.  That's unfortunately the only thing that was really award-winning about my experience with Rosepepper.  I'll start at the beginning:Chips and salsa came out.  Chips were crisp and fresh.  An assortment of three salsas came out, mild, verde, and "hot", the "hot" being quite a good salsa. (Rosepepper's explanation of my criticizing the unspicy "hot" sauce might be that their focus is on Sonora-style Mexican cuisine, which is in nature not spicy.  Eh, whatever.)  Really, it was maybe the best thing I ate.  The verde salsa was syrupy and extremely mild, and maybe too sweet.  And the mild salsa - could hardly pass as salsa.  It was tomato paste with a few herbs and spices.We had a casa margarita and a frozen peach margarita.  These margaritas are HARDCORE.  Lots of alcohol.  They're  well made and homemade.  However, if you're lookin' for a real sweet concoction, I'd hit Cantina Laredo first.  And ladies go on Ladies Night Thursdays when the margaritas are $6.We had the fish tacos and a combination plate including a bean chimichanga and chicken taco.  Chimiganga was a cute burrito-sized fried pocket filled with yummy beans and topped with a Buffalo cheese sauce.  Yummy, it's hard to go wrong with an item like this - especially for me, because I love beans.  I know it sounds funny, but I really do.  The chicken taco was really bland.  Flavorless!  Well cooked and well, but totally without any character.  Fish tacos were well battered, and accompanied by a tangy mayo sauce.  Did I mention tangy??This may be the most amusing part of my meal.  The combination  platter was accompanied by "lime veggies".  Sounds like an over-complimentary description for what came out on the plate, which was clearly raw carrots, cucumber, and celery.  Uh, nice try.You know, it's a cool place with a varied menu.  I know it's a really hip hang, any restaurant with the cheapest margarita priced at $8 would be.  But honestly from my experience tonight, I wouldn't come here again.  The service was plenty fine and the setting was fine, but the food just wasn't good enough.

reviews.name: Heather H.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is a cool little joint with an offbeat vibe, good music, and a tempting drink menu. I can see coming back here for drinks, definitely. I ordered the vegan burrito which was surprisingly tasty with fresh black beans, julienned carrots, avocado, cauliflower and broccoli florets in a flour tortilla. It was topped with tomatillo salsa and came with a side of guac. The flavors came together better than I figured and I cleaned my plate, for sure. I don't think I'll order it again, though, because it was something I could throw together at home. Maybe an enchilada update to follow....Something about this place didn't grab me, but it's solid hangout for the neighborhood.

reviews.name: Will Y.
reviews.review: I'm not very happy with the value of Rosepepper.  Their food is a little expensive for what you get, it seems.  For example, nearly all dishes are small to moderately sized, and they deceive you with large portions of rice and beans.  This is not gourmet Mexican food, and don't ever think it is, no matter how many actors visit.  The music is good, that is true.I've been twice and once had enchiladas (they tasted very bland, and the spinach was just gross) and then a burrito.  I've had far better, fresher-tasting burritos at Qdoba (and Baja on Thompson Lane!).  The veggies were bland and oily.  I added lots of sauces to try to elevate things just a little, but that only goes so far.  I really don't like the rice with peas and carrots and what not.  As someone who perhaps irrationally dislikes peas but likes rice, what the heck?  Throwing some peas in your otherwise utterly boring rice does not by any means save us.The margaritas are great and are alone worth a couple stars.  The chips and salsa are great.  I would go here to drink and have chips, but not for an actual meal again.  It's a shame, because I really wanted to like Rosepepper.

reviews.name: Thomas I.
reviews.review: I went last night to Rosepepper with my wife, a friend, and our three-year-old son. It isn't the best environment for kids, but it definitely wasn't bad. I got the fajita burrito, which was incredible. Also, the margarita's were tasty. Everything that we ordered was delicious and perfect.

reviews.name: Kelly T.
reviews.review: I've been a couple times now (had to give them a 2nd chance) and can't say I would return.  The food is no better than Taco Bell.  As for the margarita's, they're ok at best in my opinion.  I'm not sure why everyone raves about them.  Our table was dirty on the second visit and the service was average both times.

reviews.name: Peter K.
reviews.review: So this is where I eat my own words. After many more visits to Rosepepper, I've found that I really enjoy some of the menu offerings.  Let's start with their trio of salsas: the hot is actually really hot, the green salsa verde has a nice light flavor, and the 3rd not sure what that is?My favorite menu items now are the chile verde: slow cooked pork in a very spicy chile verde sauce served with tortillas, and the sonora style enchilads: spicy pork chile verde enchiladas that's served with a fried egg on top.  A fried egg makes everything that much better.As far as I'm concerned, those two dishes with their spice levels really stand out on the menu.  I'm still not the biggest fan of the rest of their offerings.I've also grown to really love to their buffalo white cheese dip and chorizo served with thick flour chips.  It makes for the perfect app to share.Service is always quick and friendly.  If you're unsure of the place, try them again and maybe explore a different side of the menu.  It worked out in my favor.

reviews.name: Andrea R.
reviews.review: You know how people say "the photos don't do it justice?" Well, what's the opposite of that? The photos....DO do it justice. A lunch pal and I chose this place thinking it was "upscale Mexican." I mean look at the website, then visit the actual place and let me know what you think. When I pulled up I was a little scared my friend might want to eat on the patio, as it looks like a trailer on stilts propped up on the hill like that. I went in and was kind of relieved to find that they had split hours - they are closed from 2-4, we were there at 1:30 but we like to linger (which is why the late lunch hour) so we didn't eat here. The margaritas were good, but I was pretty underwhelmed by the atmosphere - it's dark so you can't see how tired the place is. The manager was kind of rude about the split hours. My friend had never heard of such a thing and asked her if they'd always had them, etc. The lady didn't like being questioned about it. She said "WE NEED TIME TO REST." Um, okay. Go take a siesta. Also, I don't want to be one of those people who goes to East Nashville and complains about hipsters (duh), but the wait staff is hipster hell. I'd probably have marked it 2 stars but it's unfair to the food that I didn't eat.

reviews.name: Ben C.
reviews.review: As Josh R stated best, "Rosepepper deserves a 5 star review for the margaritas..." there is not a better margarita within driving distance.Happy Hour prices are great and the food is acceptable. Nothing exciting about the food. Guacamole is great, but anything else on the menu can be made at home the same or better. Still an enjoyable place to go.One thing to note, parking is not so obvious the first time around. Best to park behind the restaurant as parking across the street fills up even more quickly. Many restaurants in this area with conservative parking.

reviews.name: Kathy C.
reviews.review: I love the food here. I was raised in California, so I do know good Mexican food.They put a little twist on their food but it's good.Two down sides :  go between mealtimes or you will have a wait. They have street parking  when that's possible and a large parking lot on the back side of the building. Other down side...NO ONE ANSWERS THE PHONE. I tried to call several times to find out how long the wait would be.I enjoy the patio more than inside dining, but inside is okay too.

reviews.name: Paul R.
reviews.review: Solid Mexican food, hipster-ish neighborhood, funky surroundings, scantily clad and tattooed female servers, great house margarita. On the whole Rosepepper is good, but given that I live in the uptight enclave of Franklin, it's not food I'd drive 30 miles to eat. But if I were in that 'hood and craving Mexican, I'd go.

reviews.name: Ian M.
reviews.review: I'll try to keep this simple. The service was very poor, but I could totally live with that. What I can't live with is utterly awful food. Everything from the bland salsas to the flavorless soup to the dry chicken main dishes was underwhelming. We had chicken tacos and a chicken chimi; both were very dry. The tacos were decorated with cilantro and the chicken appeared blackened, but it was virtually tasteless. The chimi had a small amount of cheese sauce filming on top which was the only thing complementing the chicken (no peppers of any kind on my dish). The margaritas were another story. Beware of the house margarita (even top shelf)--it tends to taste like sweet hard candy as if they use Gatorade instead of lime juice. Our second margaritas were better as we specified tequila and to use actual lime juice. Also on a good note, the tortillas in our main dishes were pretty good.  If you want good Mexican food, hit up your neighborhood strip mall place--it will be better than Rosepepper. If you want great Mexican food, head down Nolensville road and take your pick. If you have the palate of a picky twelve year old but want to be seen somewhere hip, Rosepepper is for you!

reviews.name: Megan C.
reviews.review: Today's restaurant review is brought to you by the letter 'M,' as in 'Mmm...that is a Mighty fine Margarita.' We went to Rosepepper this past weekend to celebrate one of my bridesmaid's birthdays and had a blast. Since there were 11 of us, we had to wait for some tables out on the heated patio to free up. To kill some time while the rest of the party showed up and while taking in eclectic decorations designed to hide some structural issues (not sure what this place was before a restaurant but there's some odd heating and plumbing work running throughout), we ponied up to the bar area and ordered some house margaritas which were delicious. The bar itself has a cumbersome layout making it difficult for the bartenders to serve drinks in an efficient manner (think of it as 3 people stuffed into an area meant for one person), so at busy times drinks are a bit slow - but they are definitely worth the wait. We were seatedfairly quickly once all of our group arrived and were treated to tons of chips and three types of salsa. Two of the salsas were a bit runny that night, but I'm not going to look down on free chips and salsa. Our waitress arrived and deftly took our orders while keeping our gullets gushing with libation. We ordered some avocado fries which weren't my favorite way to eat avocados but my fiancé was digging them. I ordered the fajita burrito which in all honesty wasn't anything special. My fiancé on the other hand had the dish that I would want again and again - Sonora Style Enchilada. It was spicy, delicious and that verde chili sauce with fried egg to boot was great (I'm glad he shared a little because I'm not sure if I would have). We stayed for a bit until a chill came into the room from patrons keeping the outdoor patio door open (yes, because we all know that the perfect place to have conversations is in open doorways). Anyway, great margaritas, some good dishes, and good service.

reviews.name: Matt M.
reviews.review: Came in at 6:30 waited at the bar for an hour to be sat. Host skipped our name. Waited another hour before we finally decided to get a manger because our waiter visted our table once. Got food to go, because it was close to 9 and we filled up on chips and salsa. However, the manager on duty took care of the tab and was very apologetic about the situation. A potential disaster was rectified. Great location. Good atmosphere. We will be back again, but not because of that particular server.

reviews.name: Marinda H.
reviews.review: Have drank and eaten at Rosepepper 3x now. The margaritas are outstanding - love that they use the lime juice mix rather than sweet and sour mix like most of the mex places around Nashville.Love that they have 3 salsa options with the chips - tomatillo is the best, although wish it was a little more solid (very liquidy). Was told by many that I must try the queso dip - was not something I would order again, but I think I have a different palate than most southerners. The entrees we tried haven't impressed me. First visit: Enchiladas de Tomatillo - extremely cheesey and somewhat bland, small portion - did not fill me at all. Got the Sonora veg as side - was completely disappointed as the vegs were chili peppers and corn - blah. BF got he Burrito Asada - good, but nothing to write a song about. The guacamole was the highlight - tasted freshly made and delicious. 2nd visit - BF and I tried combo plates (taco, enchilada, flauta, chimichanga, rice and beans) - not impressed with any of the items. Bummer. 3rd visit - chicken fajitas: love that chicken is nicely trimmed/cleaned with no boogery things left on it and that green peppers were plentiful and not overcooked/mushy. Not seasoned enough though (bland). Taco al carbon - looking for authentic taco, not quite it - chicken bland and onions/cilantro/lime could not season it up enough (did not think that was possible).  All times the greeters/hosts and waitstaff were very friendly. And, I love the atmosphere (fun, whimsical) - reminds me of many of the cantinas I have been to in San Antonio, TX. Will give it another try, definitely for drinking and hopefully for food IF SOMEONE CAN PLEASE TELL ME WHAT THE GOOD ITEM TO ORDER IS -  ;)

reviews.name: Anthony C.
reviews.review: Good food, great margaritas, fun atmosphere, so-so service would sum up my thoughts on Rosepepper. Since living in East Nashville since '07 I have eaten here many time with fairly consistent results each time. The chips are always fresh and crispy and the three varieties of salsa (mild, hot, and tomatillo-the best one) are always a nice way to start your meal. Their cheese dip is REALLY good and has a little chorizo on top for a little extra flavor and spice. the guacamole is good, but nothing extraordinary. Both the cheese dip and guacamole do come with these deliciously sinful and puffy fried flour tortilla chips that are a nice change from the corn tortilla chips that accompany the salsas.  Definitely cool off with one...or three of their delicious margaritas to enjoy with your meal. My personal favorite is the original one, but the pineapple one is a close second. I tried the peach, but it wasn't as flavorful and peachy as I expected, so I wouldn't recommend that one if a lot of flavor is what you're after. Once the chips, dips, and margaritas have you nice and primed, it's time for the entrees. My personal favorites are the mixed grill fajitas, fish tacos, and my very favorite, the Rosepepper Special. The fajitas won me over because they keep the vegetables nice and crunchy without using a lot of oil. Most places bring out your fajitas and you are staring at a sizzling platter full of oil and greasy, overcooked veggies. Not here. I also like to get the chicken and steak mixed so that there is some variety.Not to mention, the shrimp fajitas are also a winner. The fish tacos are really good and can be fried or grilled, depending on your mood/willpower. The grilled ones are good, but let's be real, you are getting the fried ones because they are awesome! A generous piece of fish, fried golden and crispy, fresh cabbage, and a wonderfully creamy and cool crema to top all of that yumminess, all wrapped up in a toasted corn tortilla. Now the Rosepepper Special is not for everyone, especially for the faint of heart...or should I say heat. Tis dish consists of two enchilada with your choice of chicken or shredded beef, then topped with a mouth melting verde pork salsa that is out. of. this. world. Cue the margaritas being quickly refilled because this one will set you ablaze, but I love spicy food and don't mind breaking a little sweat to enjoy this.....but you must love hot food to make it through this experience. One of my favorite things about Rosepepper is the variety of sides. Not only do they offer the typical refried beans and rice, they also offer black beans or Sonora vegetables (a sauteed mix of corn, onions, peppers, and cactus) as a nice change from the typical. One of my least favorite things about Rosepepper is the hit and miss service. Sometimes you go and feel like a prince, other times, a pauper. The servers are usually nice and attentive, but sometimes you get Mr. or Ms. Moodypants and the refills and general duties fall by the wayside. That being said, I have had many more good experiences than bad and if you want my dos pesos, I would still highly recommend Rosepepper before I would most other Mexican restaurants in Nashville.

reviews.name: Rachel M.
reviews.review: I am giving this place a 5-star rating because their house margaritas are fantastic, the service is great, and I like the atmosphere. I agree with the people that say their food is nothing to write home about, but I still think it's really good. I haven't eaten anything that I found offensive there. I also like the fact that they give you three different kinds of salsa with your chips. The burritos are effin huge. I really like the Sonora burrito. It's the only thing I get when we go. I am one of those people that tend to get obsessed with one particular menu item and will lose my shit if there is a menu change that removes said item from the menu. It happened at Olive Garden a few years back; it wasn't pretty. Anyway... Rosepepper is a fun place to go. I highly recommend it.

reviews.name: K R.
reviews.review: Our friends suggested this place for dinner.  I was a little surprised, since they knew this was my first time to Tennessee and they recommend a Mexican joint?  Because there isn't any decent Mexican food in California...  ;)  It was a little busy when we arrived so we had some drinks on their patio area.  I'm a slow drinker and I was almost done with my drink by the time our table was ready.  So obviously, this was a popular restaurant!   What I liked was how there were THREE kinds of salsas!!  Yeah!!  Salsa!  And we also ordered the fresh guacamole.  Delisio!  I heart good guacamole and I was would have been happy eating chips, salsa and the guacamole for dinner.  I ordered the carnitas platter and that was also super yummy.  Not overly greasy and flavorful!  I ate so much of the chips and salsa that I ended up taking the leftovers back to our hotel room and it still tasted good the next day!

reviews.name: Corey M.
reviews.review: The food is amazing. Its pretty different from most mexican restaurants, but in a good way. Great place for people who love hot salsa with chips like I do. Also their pita chips and queso is just too good for words.I always love my server. Some of the nicest girls that have ever waited on me. I also really enjoy how big it is and their big patio section.The drinks are a little expensive ($9 for a margarita), but they are tasty!Gay friendly for sure! :D

reviews.name: Kelsey G.
reviews.review: Okay. Rose Pepper tears me apart inside, I just have to say this. The margaritas.....the margaritas. I'm kind of drunk right now off their margaritas. I come here time and time again and tolerate the mediocre food just for these magical margs.Which brings me to the food. I've had the enchiladas, the tequitos, the rice and beans, the spinach quesadillas, the soup, etc. All extremely lackluster. Someone needs to introduce a little thing called cumin or maybe some chili pepper to this place. Salt and pepper, anything...DAMN. For real, I had better quesadillas made in a dorm room microwave. You know the food ain't good when no matter how drunk you get, you still can't stop thinking about how half shitty this tex mex is. But I will come here until the end of time and drink these margaritas...until the end of time

reviews.name: ryan M.
reviews.review: Pretty cool Tex Mex dive joint.  Has a good amount of outdoor seating, great for good weather and drinks.  The Margaritas are very good, they are strong, but well mixed without all the artificial sour mix.  The food was pretty good for the value.  I had the shredded beef enchilada with their famous pork verde salsa.  The beef was very flavorful and juicy, and the pork verde salsa was awesome.  It's pretty spicy though, so it may not be for everyone.  The quesadillas are thick, packed with meat and cheese.  We like the guacamole and chorizo cheese dip as well.  They come with thick fresh fried tortilla chips that are amazing.  The tamales were the only dish I wasn't crazy about, the chicken was bland.  The only downside was our server wasn't great, she didn't do a good job after the meal was brought to the table to check on water refills.

reviews.name: Whit W.
reviews.review: I want you to enter this review understanding this: I love mexican food, and I've been rather spoiled by some places in California and Arizona. Every experience I've had at Rosepepper has been pretty good. Their thicker, double fried chips are ready for some serious salsas, and  I appreciate the multiple choices, especially the salsa verde. I recently got the chicken enchiladas, and wasn't extremely impressed by the rojo sauce on top. My friend got the Juevos Chorizo (it was the weekend), and enjoyed it a lot. I tried the beans that came with hers and decided I obviously picked the wrong entree.  I will continue to give it some more chances, but I do think there are some slightly better and more consistent choices for authentic mexican around.

reviews.name: Kristin Marie S.
reviews.review: So I liked it!  After a lackluster trip to the US Border Cantina, I feel like I found solid Mexican food.  I am picky about my tacquerias, I am not so picky about sit-down.  The margaritas were strong, just how I like them, and I loved the atmosphere.  They even advertise agavero.  I used to promote that stuff in SF, like for money, not because I loved it.  The flauta was, wow, good stuff, my dinner actually was, wow, good stuff.  My only complaint is why don't they serve carnitas!!  Carnitas is one of the best things ever to come into my life, oh that salty, yummy goodness.  If it could tuck me into bed at night I would let it.  For the guy who complained about hipsters, just don't talk to them.  No I'm not one.  I'm not sure where you are from but the Nashville hipsters, um, they aren't hipsters.  Take a trip to Brooklyn or the mission in SF and you will see what it really means to be hipster.  These guys and gals are harmless, if they entered the hipster olympics they would come in last.Back to the pepper.  So solid, a good date spot and a good spot to hang with your friends.

reviews.name: J L.
reviews.review: Said it would be a 30 minute wait but turned out to be 1 1/2 hours the said the patio area was heated to 75 temp but we froze!!! Told the waitress and nothing done !!! Food was good but bad service!

reviews.name: Jay W.
reviews.review: I travel every week within the U.S.I love Mexican.  Rosepepper was recommended by a local.Service was terrible, the food mediocre and the happy hour frozen margarita's the worst i have ever had.

reviews.name: Jenn Z.
reviews.review: The man and I visited Rosepepper for lunch, mainly because if I am going to try somewhere I may or may not like, I'd rather pay for a lunch special than a more expensive dinner and risk being let down and for more money!Rosepepper is not an inexpensive restaurant in my opinion for the style of food. The portions are minimal in comparison to more traditional Mexican/Latin restaurants, however, I did appreciate the quality. I ordered the Chimi (about as nontraditional as you can get I know) with Chicken and the Flautas with shredded chicken as part of the lunch combo it comes with rice and beans as well.The rice was nothing special, very basic rice with what appeared to be frozen veggies fried in but I am okay with that, it tasted good! The beans were very good, there are so many ways to go wrong with beans, too salty, not salty enough, too runny, too dry - the beans were spot on. The chips were good, the salsas were very tasty I particularly liked the salsa verde and took a small amount with me for my leftovers. The only downside was the chicken was a tad bit bland. The quality was definitely there, appeared to be shredded breast meat rather than a hodge podge of fat and dark meat that you may find at other places, but it lacked a bit of seasoning. I would have been elated if it had more flavor, overall though it was a good meal. Our service was exceptional. The waitress was very attentive, friendly and accommodating to our 13 month old Son. She brought him water with a lid and straw, and when placing hot plates on the table was careful to place everything out of his reach. This is a huge deal breaker for us as Parents.I like that this is situated in the East End area near Ugly Muggs and other East Nash favorite, but I dare say that is why you will notice the slightly steeper prices. The food is good, the service is welcoming and friendly, the patio is lovely and I am sure it is a lot of fun at happy hour or in nice weather, we were there during rain! :( I would definitely try other items on the menu and would like to return this fall to enjoy the patio.

reviews.name: Jessica B.
reviews.review: Feel free to go here for trendy atmosphere and good margaritas but if you want good Mexican food...or good food period...do not eat here. The food is terrible. Head to Cinco de Mayo for awesome fajitas. Actually, just head to your closest local cheap Mexican restaurant and eat there. Don't pay for the hype if a good meal is what you want. It should be noted that I will still go here if friends all want to and I will enjoy a drink.

reviews.name: Rita D.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I had stopped in Red Dog Beads and the owner there had recommended we stop at this restaurant while we were visiting Nashville. The atmosphere felt very fun and the patio was great. We came right at 4:00 when they open back up, so it didn't start filling up until we were finished and leaving. Our server was a sweetheart and attentive. We ordered a spinach quesadilla as an appetizer, which paired great with the three types of salsas brought out. I ordered steak tacos with beans and rice, my boyfriend ordered a burrito (which was literally the largest burrito I've ever seen). He's the lanky type that somehow eats his weight in food everyday, so he was ecstatic and (for the first time that I've ever witnessed) almost couldn't finish it. I ordered just a plain margarita, but would have loved to have tried more if I came later in the evening.All in all, we left wishing Milwaukee had this gem and vowed to return on our next trip back to Nashville. Thanks, Dottie, for the recommendation!

reviews.name: I C.
reviews.review: Had an early dinner here a few weeks ago when visiting Nashville. I had a chicken fajita salad ( the grilled bell peppers were a nice touch) and a margarita (Happy Hour rate). The portions are generous and its fine - but the very simple house margarita was even better and more generous. Our server was perfectly friendly -we were too full for dessert  Or, its very a solid option  and definitely a place to have drinks with friends if you are in the neighborhood. Its a perfectly sound option for dinner. The person I was having dinner with did say what other reviewers have mentioned -that the quality and consistency vary widely when the place is really busy - that they stopped ordering anything with chicken because it tended to be dry. That afternoon the meat was tender - but the place had just opened for dinner.

reviews.name: Josh R.
reviews.review: Rosepepper deserves a 5 star review for the margaritas (best in the city, in my opinion) and guacamole.  It's an awesome place to just come for drinks and some guacamole appetizers with friends, which is really the only reason I come here.The rest of the menu outside of the guac options, however, is pretty horrible.  I would not suggest eating a real meal here.

reviews.name: Avonel R.
reviews.review: This place is a good staple in the East Nashville area with tasty margaritas, but I will not go out of my way to eat here. The food is not up to par with what I'm used to. I absolutely hate poor quality mexican food (a lot of guilty restaurants in the Nashville area) and sadly this is one of them. I don't want to scare anyone away because it is a perfect place to grab drinks with friends, but don't go here for great mexican food.

reviews.name: Jemina B.
reviews.review: Went here because The Silly Goose is closed on Sundays and Mondays, and had a decent time. Will I go back? Only if I have to.It's true what everyone else is saying, folks- the drinks are good, the food is just alright. Normally I wouldn't be heartbroken about just okay food in a Mexican restaurant, but when that bland buritto is almost 10 bucks? Houston, we have a problem.Someone do Rosepepper a favor and get it some flavor.

reviews.name: Jason S.
reviews.review: This oasis of slightly-more-upscale Tex-mex has been a favorite of mine ever since my old buddy Simon Newman introduced me to it back in ought-six.  Also, NEWMAN!I love the menu here.  They have a nice mix of offerings from all over the Latin-American world, not your typical offering in most of Nashville, which features low-scale Tex-Mex restaurants that all essentially have the same menu, prices, and maybe staff.  Rosepepper on the other hand has cool things like home-made tortillas, battered and fried sweet pepper rings, cool salads and soups, great fajitas, and burritos.  And dammit, they have great marguaritas, even the house ones, not the high-fructosey citric acid watered-down nonsense you get at every NachosCasaDeHaciendaLasPalmas place in the rest of town.  Great selection of tequila and draft beer, too.  And they have Mezcal. for when it is time to make really bad decisions, and fast.Service here has always been good, and they have a really nice patio for outdoor eating, can seem a bit grungy at times, though.  But really, can you trust a clean Mexican restaurant?But a word of caution, for the love of all that is holy, do not, I repeat, do NOT go here for Cinco de Mayo if you value your sanity or sanitation.  I have been schnookered into going here once for that auspicious occasion and it was a nightmare.  They are not only packed to the gills with people spilling out everywhere, they also have WAY WAY too few bathrooms to accommodate hundreds of people with bladders full of tequila.  The lines to the bathrooms were so bad for the women especially that they had taken over the men's room.

reviews.name: Ericka B.
reviews.review: Really great food and drinks! I've been going since they opened. I particularly love the tacos al carbon (beef), pineapple margaritas, beef flautas, and I would drink their tomatillo salsa with a straw if they would let me! The only reason I will not give it 5 stars is the service is pretty slow and inconsistent. It's not uncommon for your table to switch servers 1, 2, even 3 times. And the main manager (possibly owner), an older ethnic lady, is extremely rude!

reviews.name: Ann W.
reviews.review: I love Rosepepper. Love it. Have loved it ever since I moved to East Nashville in 2004 and became a semi-regular visitor. I've been here on dates, with groups of friends, for birthdays, for girls' night out, etc. I also know those who bring their whole family. Something for everyone. Great outdoor seating in nice weather. Plenty of room inside, too, and I always enjoy sitting at their bar. I have to admit, I almost always get the same thing. Fish tacos, sub black beans for refried. Sometimes I get the fish fried and sometimes grilled. Fried is tastier. Occasionally, I've been known to order the guac, which comes with these deep fried tortillas (different from the chips) that are so crispy and delicious and probably a heart attack waiting to happen. I've also been known to grab the guac and chips to go when I need to take something to a party at the last minute.I almost forgot to mention the margaritas. That would have been a tragedy. Favorite margarita in town served in tall water glasses - on the rocks w/salt. Tastes like a margarita should - none of that chemical mix taste you get many places. To summarize: Love the fish tacos, Love the guac. Love the margaritas. Love Rosepepper. That is all.

reviews.name: Glen M.
reviews.review: food and margaritas are good, but those salsas are weak! that has to be lamest excuse for salsa verde i have ever seen. i would rather have store bought. so thin it runs off the chip.

reviews.name: Kaitlyn K.
reviews.review: I am tempted to bump this to a 3 Star Review, but based on my last trip, I'm sticking to my guns.  2 Star it is.  The reason why I am not super loving this place right now is because a group of friends, my husband and I went to Rosepepper on Sunday night, and the waitress couldn't have been less attentive or more rude.  On top of ignoring us when we begged for water and simple things like that, when I was ready to pay, I flagged her down to give her my debit card.  You would have thought I punched her in the face.  It was like it was a HUGE deal and inconvenience to take my money.  The bus boy ended up bringing us water and food, and somehow this girl walked away with the tips.  That made me sad. Overall - The food has always been very sub-par in my opinion.  Not terrible, just not great.  The reason to check this place out is because it's in a fun area, it has a patio for Spring and Summer (even Fall), and the bar is pretty well stocked.  I didn't dig my margarita last time I went because it was way too sweet and I can't even guarantee there was tequila in it, but the beer and well drinks were just fine.  The restaurant gives you chips and 3 salsas for free, which is cool, too.  The avocado fries are interesting, and if you dip them in salsa, they're even better.  Otherwise, it's a typical Mexi restaurant.  It's a fun place to go, especially if you're with a group.  Check it out, but if you get the waitress that we had...I'm sorry.

reviews.name: Christopher M.
reviews.review: I've lived in Nashville for 22 years and I had never heard of this place until last night when I was invited by some friends. That was a red flag to begin with. It's rundown, the bathrooms aren't clean, the bar is boring. The food was less than mediocre. The chips were old. This just isn't a good restaurant.

reviews.name: David H.
reviews.review: Not too shabby I suppose but I am becomming disheartned with the mexican joints around town. So far I haven't really been bowled over by any place in Nashville and this place was no exception. Parking in back was convienient and the hostess and server were very nice. The Britney Spears and other top 40 pop hits playing through the place however; just didn't set the mexican mood. Call me kooky. Liked that they brought out 3 salsas. Hot, mild and green chile. Disliked they were abit watery and lacked flavor. Just didn't have that "umph".( if ya know what I mean.)The queso was ok but if that would have sucked I likely would have just left and gone to a Taco Bell and called it a day. I had a beef chimichangs and a beef enchalada wich were small in size and average in flavor at best. I left hungry. I may return some day to explore what appeared to be a pretty nice tequilla bar... (wich reminds me. My dates margarita was very strong and after only one she was ready to let me take a swing at her pinata... so. I guess that's a win.) But there are a few other places I wish to try before I return.

reviews.name: Marnie B.
reviews.review: Best homemade margaritas I have ever had! Service isn't the greatest, but the food is to die for.  Amazing chorizo dip and outstanding fajitas.  I am a fan for life.

reviews.name: Taylor D.
reviews.review: I always get the same thing, but if you are a lover of chicken tacos- This is the place to go! Also- no onions pre mixed in anything!! Yes!

reviews.name: Mina K.
reviews.review: I don't know how to do minus stars but if I could this place would rate MINUS 5 stars.  Our waiter greeted us in a very bored manner and as he left a table next to us he was rolling his eyes.   don't care what you do outside of work but when you are there my thinking is...you're a waiter, right?  We ordered after many attempts to ask the waiter "are the tortilla chips corn or flour"....simple question that took him 10 min. to answer.  I order a taco salad.  If I could adequately describe the nasty entrée that sat in front of me you would envision road kill.  it started on the bottom with running tasteless refried beans with lettuce on top and the "seasoned" beef was on top of this masterpiece without any "seasoning" whatsoever.  Were the cheese and tomatoes mentioned on the menu merely teasing me into thinking this was a real restaurant.  the meat tasted like pot roast.  As a waiter I would have refused to serve it. As a cook/chef (although I doubt any chefs at this restaurant) I would have been embarrassed to make such a dish.  while the place was indeed busy it made me wonder "are people eating here because they are drunk".  I will never return. Its an embarrassment that Nashville has a restaurant like this.

reviews.name: Rachel S.
reviews.review: I feel like this place is perfect to get some margaritas and chips with queso but behind a snack hangout I would not recommend this place to get a full meal. I tried the chimichanga with chicken, it was good, nothing special a little dry. I also had a tamale, this ranks as one of the worst I have ever had; dry, tasteless, and just looked gross. The margarita was delicious, I get mine on the rocks with no salt. As far as service is concerned I'm sure they have better servers however our girl seemed like she did not want to be there and that happens. Additionally she was super slow and I think she forgot about us at one point. I'd like to see them for happy hour if I get out of work on time. That would be cool.

reviews.name: Erin R.
reviews.review: Best. Margarita. EVER!  I can see why they have won Nashville's Best Margarita for several years.  I was a little skeptical when the margarita came out in a pint glass and the liquid was almost clear, but it was awesome!  Also, pretty potent!  My bf and I got the chorizo cheese dip.  The cheese dip was good, but what made it a hit for me was the fried tortillas that came with it.  Those are waaaay better than a tortilla chip.I got the enchiladas for my main course.  They were good, but not out of this world.  My bf got the carne asada and it was great!  The steak was cooked perfectly and very flavorful.  They serve very large portions.  The bf and I decided we could split something the next time we go.Overall, great place, great atmosphere and GREAT margaritas!  I can't wait to go back when it is warmer and sit on the patio.

reviews.name: Amanda M.
reviews.review: You're tearing me apart, Rosepepper!No, really. I'm torn. Con: The hostesses took great pleasure in telling us it'd be an hour wait and seemed a little annoyed when we shrugged, submitted our name and propped up at the bar.Which brings me to the pro column of the night... margaritas! Seriously. Their original margs on the rocks are probably the most delicious I've had in Nashville. So delicious that I may or may not have ordered three. Don't judge me.The food? Eh. I didn't order anything too crazy. A taco and enchilada a la carte. Everything else was a bit too pricey/heavy for my taste.If/when I return (and I will because I love my hipster East Nash-dwelling friends), I will eat beforehand and instead join them to simply imbibe these heavenly beverages.

reviews.name: Cheryl B.
reviews.review: I traveled several Southern states and didn't find any Mexican food that pleased me like places in the Bay Area and Los Angeles... Until I went to East Nash's Rosepepper. Chips with 3 delicious salsas? Yes, please. And I swear the chimichanga is made from unicorns and glitter. I LOVED it. I did try to avocado fries, but I recommend skipping it because the tempura batter was really thick (perhaps they didn't ice it). Friendly staff. Great location.

reviews.name: Sarah A.
reviews.review: Amazing Mexican!I have had the flautas twice now and the beef taste like roast beef .. I was thrown for a loop! I love some cheap Mexican so I was surprised that there was something as good as this in Tennessee!Next I had the Fish Tacos and these also were amazing! Very suprised at how much I enjoyed this interesting taco! (had it fried... I am sure it was not the dietary delight)I am sold on Rosepepper as my only East Nashville Mexi Spot!

reviews.name: Danielle W.
reviews.review: Great food at a great price! They have delicious fajitas and even better margaritas!

reviews.name: Lucy M.
reviews.review: East Nashville's answer to Mexican foodMargaritas and Queso dip. That's all it takes to make this girl happy.And you know what? The Rose Pepper has Queso and chips as a meal on their menu. Needless to say, I'm a fan for life.As many of these reviews state, Las Palmas pretty much dominates Nashville's Mexican scene and for good reason. BUT there is no Las Palmas in East Nash, and to save the day is the Rose Pepper. Location really saves this restaurant from being over looked, which is great because the service and menu/drink options are stellar. The staff are fantastic and willing to bend over backwards to make your order perfect.The outdoor patio is very comfortable and easy to cater for big groups too.For good competition to Las Palmas, give the Pepper Rose a try.

reviews.name: Henry M.
reviews.review: I love this place!!! We came in and ate the exact same thing we had the previous weekend because it was so good: the ribeye with chipotle shrimp. WOW. Who knew that would be so good? I'm kicking myself for ordering the tacos, chimichangas, enchiladas, chicken caesar and everything else over  the years I've been to Rosepepper. I should have tried the ribeye earlier!Of course, one cannot mention Rosepepper without saying something about the Guacamole and Margueritas. The best I've had. They were served to us by Molly who was able to complete the totally awesome experience while the place was slammed on a Saturday night. How everything remains so good when they are so busy must be part of the Rosepepper magic. It's consistently fantastic no matter what. That's why we keep coming back.

reviews.name: Carolyn M.
reviews.review: 3 star food, 5 star margaritas. Good variety in the menu and the beer selection. Service is attententive and the ambience is nice, but without any of the Gulchy pretentiousness. Kids are welcome.

reviews.name: Chris V.
reviews.review: After moving from Colorado - the land where authentic Mexican joints are plentiful - I immediately began my hunt for something to cure my craving for something south of the border. Unfortunately in Nashville the "green sauce" isn't quite the same and I have accepted that I'll have to satisfy my cravings when I visit friends and family out west. But when I was introduced to Rosepepper's in East Nashville, I was impressed. The food is moderate at best, but the choice of salsas and margaritas might be some of the best I've had in town. On a nice day, sitting out on the patio is a relaxing way to spend an afternoon. If you're ordering off the menu, be prepared. The portions are big and not worth wrapping up in a to-go box, so order appropriately.

reviews.name: Sam L.
reviews.review: The food was good for Mexican, but it seemed to be overpriced compared to most of the places around the area.  A $7 margarita was less satisfying than the $3.50 one I had at Cinco de Mayo last week.  The atmosphere is what makes Rosepepper a good place for a meal with friends.  The patio is awesome!

reviews.name: Jennifer P.
reviews.review: Fun/kitschy atmosphere...but so loud i spent the meal asking my table mates to repeat everything.  The chips were good, the "avocado chips" special was fun (tempura fired avocado).  The fish tacos were...not great.... The blend of flavors was just slightly off.  We had ten at the table and they put a 20% gratuity on automatically...which I don't begrudge, but I would have like to see our server more often and the bottom of my empty glass a bit less often.

reviews.name: Brittany F.
reviews.review: Veggie burrito was amazing! Super large with delicious and fresh guacamole! The salsas were fresh and flavorful and service was attentive. We sat out on the large back patio that had a great atmosphere. I just wish I wasn't there for a working lunch because I would have loved to have had one of their margaritas!

reviews.name: Sara G.
reviews.review: Good food, large portions and fun atmosphere

reviews.name: Mike R.
reviews.review: I was pleasantly surprised! Very! Firstly, yes, the margaritas are good. Tasty, and we had a pitcher of mango flavor, so there was enough. Could have been a bit stronger for my taste, but that's me.I loved the three types of sauces with the basket of chips, good touch and they were all yummy. 'I had the Sonora enchiladas, and they were spicy, flavorful. The Sonora-style veggies were also very tasty.  The Carnitas were cooked properly- not too dry, not mushy, and flavorful. Being from California I'm used to some excellent mexican-style food from hole-in-the-walls to larger restaurants, and the dishes I tasted held their own. I can't speak to the other menu items, but I recommend all of the above, heartily!

reviews.name: El E.
reviews.review: I love the Rose Pepper margaritas.  The food is good but the drinks are awesome.

reviews.name: Brandon W.
reviews.review: Very noisy, hot, and crowded. Sonora burrito was definitely not the best I've had.

reviews.name: Mell F.
reviews.review: Margaritas: 5 stars. They should be for $26 a pitcher!Food: 3 stars honestly, but 4 if you drink a couple of margaritas...4:30 Sunday afternoon on the deck. Peaceful and lovely.Chips and salsa are good. Get the Queso with Chirizo for sure.We split chicken and steak fajitas and were satisfied.Less than a mile from the house is a big plus. Not sure I would drive across town for it though. But the margaritas are freaking good, so maybe...

reviews.name: Matt E.
reviews.review: I went here for the first time this week at the suggestion of a friend. Unfortunately, I should have had a driver because they have a huge margarita and tequila menu and was unable to partake.  Why not? Because the margaritas are essentially a large glass of tequila with a lime wedge.  Apparently they don't use any mixes.  So I will definitely have to come back.The food was average to good. We sampled the guacamole.  It was creamy but lacked much flavor.  I chose the fajita burrito with steak for dinner.  It was a large portion but not large on flavor.  The fajita burrito at Chuy's is by far much better.All in all, I will go back mainly to try the margaritas.  The food is fine, you get a lot, and its reasonably priced.

reviews.name: Laurie S.
reviews.review: Ah Rosepepper. You have never failed to disappoint me. Your margaritas are wonderful and when I'm in the mood for some Tex Mex you hit the spot. Two things. I love the music. Can you turn it down just a bit? I was yelling at the people at my table so they could hear me. Also, and I'm fully aware that this probably won't change, however the rice is just bland. Some Spanish rice or something with more flavor would be great. And if you get Kelly (sorry if I misspelled your name) as your server consider yourself lucky! She's wonderful an my daughter loved her tattoos!

reviews.name: mumin k.
reviews.review: I stand behind my previous review: good margaritas but below average food. i had fajitas on my most recent visit and that was the worst fajita i ever had. the chicken and steak were just unacceptable. i had stomach cramps all night after having the fajita here. my margarita was pretty good though. some (including myself) would say "there is no bad food after you have a couple of margaritas" but unfortunately i had only 1 margarita which did not help much with the food either.margarita: 3.5 starsfood: 1 staroverall, i would give them about 2-2.5 stars for offering a good margarita.

reviews.name: Declan G.
reviews.review: The one thing holding me back from giving the Rosepepper 5 stars is the food.  I've tried their quesadilla appetizer with vegetables and the Gringos, and they were both fine, but kind of bland, especially considering that Rosepepper is a little on the pricey side for a Mexican restaurant (the entrees range from $10.75 - $23.95).  Even the 3-salsa plate they bring you with the tortilla chips isn't as flavorful as it looks like it would be.  But I do hear the margaritas are good, and the servers are always friendly and laid back.  The huge, tastefully festive patio out back is pretty unique, and the colorful decor inside is ecelctic without feeling forced or too-cool-for school.  Maybe that's why, despite the lackluster food, I keep coming back...

reviews.name: Tonya O.
reviews.review: While I can't really say anything bad about Rosepepper, I can say that it's not Las Palmas. I'm afraid that Las Palmas has set the bar for me with fajitas, and Rosepepper just couldn't compete. The fajitas were a little on the bland side for flavor, but on a positive note they were plentiful with both meat and veggies. If you've never been there, it's a little confusing on where you need to go if you enter from the rear entrance, and staff walking around didn't seem to offer much assistance for us when we looked lost. Our table's server was, however, very friendly, helpful and prompt. While I wouldn't turn down a chance to go back to Rosepepper, I'll most likely go back to my old faithful next time. I think this place suits the margarita lovers more than the fajita lovers.

reviews.name: James B.
reviews.review: Great atmosphere and they make their salsa in house. Problem is, they add sugar to their salsa so it tastes sweet and contributes to diabetes. Why, Rosepepper, why?

reviews.name: Esther L.
reviews.review: Rosepepper's assets include a spacious patio and great margaritas. Food and service are fine. I'll continue my search for excellent, authentic Mexican food elsewhere, keeping in mind Rosepepper's for outdoor sipping. Note: if you are visiting for the first time, ask the server to explain the complicated margarita ordering process. Fish tacos were delicious (both grilled and battered options), and the carne asada tacos could have been more flavorful.

reviews.name: Andrew W.
reviews.review: Wow, this place is trendier than where I usually eat. It could have also been something to do with the people I went with. First of all, I almost never eat at Mexican restaurants. I'm not usually a fan of Mexican food in general, but this place was actually not bad. The portion sizes are HUGE!  Be prepared to take some food home.People like to brag about their alcoholic drinks but I didn't have any. Most people with me did order the margaritas. So take that with a grain of salt (no pun intended).With all that said, I'm not terribly impressed with the food because I've definitely had better. The service was excellent. Probably could not have been better.

reviews.name: Dara S.
reviews.review: Just okay. Those two words sum up my ho-hum lunch experience earlier this week. The grilled fish tacos were delicious, but the cold veggie rice side was disappointing. The waiter disappeared after ordering only to resurface 30 minutes later with the check. Meanwhile I had to refill my own ice tea at the bar. This is not the first time I've eaten here, but the first time I've thought it average. There are other Mexican restaurants in town, so why go back to an average one?

reviews.name: David R.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is "okay".  We eat there semi-frequently because it's close, the food's decent and the margaritas are (generally) very good.  What dampens my enthusiasm  is the service--it's always been pretty poor.  SOme of the servers are just bad servers, but MOST of the servers are simply over worked--RP can get busy, and because a lot of people are there for the drinks, each table requires more waiting "runs" than your typical restaurant.  Perhaps making matters worse, RP has now started charging for salsa and chips--the first round is still free but subsequent rounds cost $$ and because of this, the server (not the table bussing staff) are now responsible for all salsa/chip deliveries.  So, this now adds even MORE trips to the table by the overworked staff and since they instigated this new salsa/chip policy, we've found ourselves waiting 10-20 minutes for server attention on each visit.  It's gotten so bad that we have stopped going when they are line-out-the-door busy.  It's just not worht the frustration.Ah, but I digress...I digressed because we used to love RP.  Back when we could easily pop over for a meal (and not have to plan on waiting for 30-45 minutes for a week night table) RP was a nice, fatty, cheesy, easy dinner treat.

reviews.name: Brad W.
reviews.review: Went there for the first time on a Friday night. Loved it. Even though they were packed, the service was fast. The flour chips tey serve with the queso rocked. And I'll have to say, that was the best top shelf margarita I've ever had. I'll be back.

reviews.name: Claudia K.
reviews.review: I'm just going to be really honest....the food was bad.  Fish tacos lacked any kind of seasoning and the beans were runny.  Spinach quesadilla also lacked seasoning.  This is cooking 101, taste your food before sending it out!  The decor was amusing.  I'm not sure what exactly they are going for but pick a theme and stick with it!   It is seriously all over the place!  Oddly enough the music playing was also all over the place.  The hostesses need to loose the attitude!  On a positive note our server (I feel really bad but I can't remember her name) was wonderful!  She was super pleasant which is why we didn't complain about the food, we just won't ever go back.

reviews.name: Simply S.
reviews.review: Just wanted to update that since my incident at Rosepepper the manager has addressed the issue.The hostess in question as actually let go for a while. Sadly she is back but seems to be in a better mood? I can't deny that Rosepepper is the BEST mexican in Nashville.I'm happy that they attempted to address the issue :)

reviews.name: Victor L.
reviews.review: Awesome place, I've lived in Austin Tx, and this place can rival any of the tex-mex places you can find down there.  Great margaritas to start your dinner, and everything on the menu was fantastic.  Try this place if you want real mexican food, this place won't disappoint.  The atmosphere is a bit trendy, and not as traditional, but the service you will be very pleased.

reviews.name: Evamarie N.
reviews.review: Avocado fries?!  For reals?!  Mexico meets Tennessee. Delish and different.  Fun atmosphere.  Nice waitress. Beck mixed with Luis Miguel--legit.  The food is good. Not necessarily "authentic" but solid Tex Mex.  Wish fajitas had a bit more chile, but the lime was there. Good neighborhood standard.

reviews.name: Christopher W.
reviews.review: The food at Rosepepper is good, but nothing that is going to blow you away. It's not really good enough to put up with the pretty poor service. It was clear my server was entirely too busy with too many tables and I blame management, not the server. I asked her about it and she said she was even having to jump behind the bar to help make drinks. However the bus boys were awesome, delivering chips and salsa literally in unison with me sitting down. This seems to be the typical East Nashville restaurant. Decor that is trying to be as crazy, hip and wild as possible, a room packed with people, OK food and bad, unfriendly service... You'll be treated like you aren't cool enough to sit at the table.

reviews.name: Hope D.
reviews.review: I love the idea of fried avacados more-so than I love the fried avacados themselves...but I continue to order them because they infatuate me. The fish tacos may be the yummiest I've had in Nashville so far!

reviews.name: Amanda B.
reviews.review: We love Rosepepper and we're in about twice a week.  The servers are very friendly, the margaritas are absolutely amazing (try the Top Shelf House Margarita with Cointreau, rocks and salt--you'll thank me) and the chips and salsa are plentiful.I always order the same thing: Plato Carnitas from the specials menu.  I am pretty sure this is a "permanent" special, as I've been coming in to Rosepepper for several months and it's always been on the menu.Carnitas (or roast pork) is absolutely the most flavorful thing I've had at Rosepepper and, perhaps, the most flavorful thing on the menu.The pork is served with rice, beans, tortillas, some bitchin' pico de gallo, and an amazing peanut mole sauce.  Seriously tasty.  Don't think, just order that: you'll be hooked.Meanwhile, I've ordered fajitas once and a taco salad once and both fell short in the seasoning department. I've seen some of the other reviews mention the same.  They may be under-seasoning to allow you to add your own salsas, etc., but I'd prefer if they took a little more initiative.If you're feeling adventurous, the tequila menu is extensive! Call yourself a cab and try a few out.Rosepepper is a great place to meet friends for dinner. Spend some time on the patio on a beautiful evening, order a pitcher of margaritas, some guacamole, and a round of Plato Carnitas.

reviews.name: Nicole M.
reviews.review: it has been several days since my meal there and I still can smell the steak and spices and taste my burrito yes I have brushed my teeth several times since then but the food was fanfreakingtastic

reviews.name: Shayne H.
reviews.review: As for the food, I just can't make myself like it.  Nothing stands out as memorably good.As for the house margarita, I really like it.Buyer beware!  The pitchers of margaritas are $26!!  (we got the bill & it killed my buzz!)I like the funky decor on the inside & the size of the covered deck on the outside.  The staff has always been good to us.Honestly, though, I will go to Cantina Laredo for Mexican food in the future.

reviews.name: Lauren S.
reviews.review: I can't say enough about the margaritas at Rosepepper. They're, hands down, the best in Nashville. Go for the basic house on the rocks and you won't be disappointed (that is, if you're a tequila fan. you can definitely taste and feel the kick)The food is kind of a mixed bag. The quesadillas are very thick squares but can be a little dry if the kitchen is having an off night. I'm a fan of the fajitas, though. Always sizzling and flavorful. If you're looking for an appetizer, I recommend the queso - and make sure you get it when the chorizo.If you go for lunch, it's usually pretty dead but it can get pretty busy during dinner time. If you have a large-ish group, be sure to call a couple days ahead (a week if you can) because it isn't the greatest for parties.

reviews.name: Josh W.
reviews.review: I used to love Rosepepper, but over the last 2-3 years, the food quality has really gone down hill.  It's a fun place to go with a group and the margaritas are good, but it just isn't as good as it used to be.

reviews.name: Bret s.
reviews.review: This place was great the food was more authentic in style and had just the right amount of heat. I had the sonoma enchiladas and a cold beer, they hit the spot..twice. The only reason I did not give five stars is because the seat back on the booth kept sliding down so if I was not careful I would end up under the table. Overall this is a great place, try it if your in Nashville.

reviews.name: Jessy Y.
reviews.review: I love the idea of Rosepepper, but every time I eat here I am disappointed with everything except for my margarita. Most recently, the wait was so long and ridiculous (took more than an hour for a party of six -- and larger parties behind us took their seats before we did) that I have decided I am done with this place, at least until next summer when the patio opens up again.The salsa options aren't bad -- you get hot, mild and verde for free -- and I agree that the fried avocado appetizer is good (though nothing compared to Alley Cat, RIP), as is the buffalo queso with chorizo. Word to the wise: If you like sweet tea, do not let them convince you to order their mango tea (since they don't serve sweet tea).The rest of the menu is extensive, a crowd-pleaser, and it always sounds delicious, but my friends and I have been underwhelmed more often than not. I don't know if it's because I grew up on cheap Mexican food or what, but every enchilada I try that's not on the a la carte menu is always in some specialty sauce that my taste buds just don't enjoy. The taco salad was meh, and the tamales aren't as good as ones that cost half as much on Gallatin Road.The margaritas, however, and the atmosphere are Rosepepper's saving grace. The patio in the summer is screened in, and nothing beats a pitcher of their always-strong house margarita on a hot July day. The margs actually come in a number of flavors -- raspberry, strawberry, mango -- that are delicious frozen treats. That's why this place gets two stars -- I'd be lying through my teeth if I said I'd never come back. I'm sure I'll be here every other weekend next summer, experiencing mediocre food and delicious drinks. Just not until then.

reviews.name: Tim R.
reviews.review: Eaten here for years. Excellent food and the best Margaritas. Drinks are a bit pricey with Margarita pitchers approaching $30.  They never hurt for business. Downside: they've begun charging for chips and salsa, can't be because they're hurting for income. It's a real chintzy move in my opinion.  Also, had a hostess ask us to vacate our table in the middle of our meal because "other people were waiting." Inappropriate for a long time customer who spends a lot and sends people there, but what're you gonna do?

reviews.name: Stephanie C.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is a thriving, long-standing East Nashville restaurant staple. It's an eclectic looking, colorful place with interior, bar and covered patio seating. I've had to wait 15+ minutes the last couple of times I've stopped in - but both were weekend events. The portions are a little out of control, but that's not really a bad thing is it? The ingredients seem a little fresher than traditional mexican fare. My faves are the appetizers - particularly the chorizo queso with flour chips. I could eat the entire portion for my meal. The fresh-fruit margaritas are top-notch. Flavors rotate seasonally. Last time I mixed raspberry and pineapple - YUM!

reviews.name: Patrick R.
reviews.review: The Rosepepper is the centerpiece of a lovely and growing little district on Eastland.  The restaurant specializes in "Sonora" style cuisine, which, according to their menu, is a blend of traditional Mexican and contemporary international flavors.  Honestly, this might be just a tiny bit of a cop out, because the food always strikes me as traditional but not especially unique.As noted in past reviews, one of The Rosepepper's most unique attributes is its patio, which is quite a lovely locale for sipping margaritas on a breezy summer evening.  And while we're on the margaritas, allow me to digress only for a moment... Say what you will about The Rosepepper; I believe they have some of the finest margaritas in the city.  The Rosepepper's management also runs Foo Bar on Gallatin Road, so you can sample them there as well.  Anyhow, the margaritas are probably the reason I'm awarding The Rosepepper four stars.  These tempting and tasty tequila concoctions are quite literally The Rosepepper's saving grace.Anyhow, the food itself is good but not spectacular.  Portions are large, and servers bring three varieties of salsa with your complimentary chips.  Unfortunately, you could probably get food that is as good and more authentic (and certainly cheaper) at a traditional Mexican joint.  I recommend it for newcomers to the East Side, if only for the classy atmosphere and delicious cocktails.

reviews.name: Todd G.
reviews.review: This was not my first trip to Rosepepper. I had been there before... a couple of times actually. Each time was a fairly unimpressive event. The last time I had gone I ordered a veggie burrito. I remember not liking it and that was about my only memory of the experience. I do remember though that they had put really odd vegetables in it. I guess it had been so long since that visit I had forgot how unimpressed I really was. While driving around East Nashville looking for a place to eat this evening we unfortunately ended up at Rosepepper.  My entire meal was just plain bad...wet lettuce in the mediocre salad.... bland food... some sort of Mango overSWEET! tea that tasted like a Yankee Candle. I also noticed a couple of things while I was there. # 1) they are the kind of restaurant that will put one ingredient on every dish. so and so with Tomatillo , burrito with Tomatillo and so on... Feta and Bleu Cheese were another one I noticed on everything. So if you are not a fan of certain ingredients it's kind of a downer. # 2) everyone was drinking. I for one go to a restaurant to eat... not drink... they have bars and clubs for that. If you are a restaurant you should focus more on your food and less on your booze.So if you up for a 12$ Margarita then knock yourself out... but if you're looking to get a decent meal then head across the street in any direction.

reviews.name: Jonathan P.
reviews.review: Run of the mill americanized Mexican food off of Eastland ave in East Nashville. It's that pricier mexican food joint all the cool peeps hang out at, but not for the food. Food is decent, bland, a homestyle type of Chipotle's. They have a bar...reminds me of the bar on the first Star Wars in tattooine where Obi-Wan Kenobi cuts that one aliens arm off. Okay back to food. The margaritas rock, the salsa is eh, the food is eh. You will get full, you will pay money, you will get tipsy and may think you are living on Tattooine. Visit sparingly or if all the other east nashville restaurants have a wait.

reviews.name: Deborah C.
reviews.review: Margaritas were top notch!  Guacamole fresh.   I had the special which was the Spinach enchiladas.  Very fresh and tasty.  Loved that the chips and salsa had a sampling of different types of salsa.   I have a local mexican restaurant by my house that is a 5 star due to authenticity.  So, can't give this place much higher than a 3.  But its fresh, tasty and a solid place to get Mexican!

reviews.name: L S.
reviews.review: There are three reasons to go to Rosepepper:1. House Margaritas2. White queso dip.3. Big outdoor patio.For food...it's okay. I might be biased because I'm from California so I think that things like carnitas and tortillas should look and taste a certain way. All in all, I wouldn't say the food is bad...it can be decently good, especially if you know what to order but often things are just a touch bland for my tastes. Burritos are huge --- like a small loaf of bread. But honestly, what I really go to Rosepepper for are the house margaritas. $5 and you get a glass full of tequila with lime and salt. It is just about the best thing to drink on a hot summer's day. Not all sweet and syrupy like lots of places make them. And not like chugging back a cup of gasoline either. Just refreshing and limey.The atmosphere here also helps compensate for the mediocre food. It's almost always bustling with people (lots of young people, which for me, means 20's-30's). It's a great casual place to meet up with friends. Oh, and white queso dip....to die for.

reviews.name: M. C. M.
reviews.review: Bustling americanized mexican large restaurant.You know what you're getting atmosphere wise, but we all the food was a much better, fresher, more flavorful quality that can often be found at similar establishments.Their margaritas were stiff and spectacular.Service was fast and friendly.

reviews.name: Michael W.
