reviews.review: The food is good, that's fine. Totally passable, slightly ritzy Mexican food, and really good margaritas. Awesome service and cool decor, great atmosphere, hip crowd.So why the 3 stars?It's a MARGARITA JOINT!!! It's not supposed to be so expensive! You can't serve a passable $5 burrito--good as it may be--in a slightly nicer atmosphere and expect me to pay $12 for it.  And a margarita that costs more than 5 bucks is pretentious! It's tequila and lemonade fer crissakes! Sure they're great and refreshing and socially lubricating and everything you want from a margarita, but it is so expensive!So if you're an oil tycoon with a hankering for mexican food, I highly recomend this joint. I see what the fuss is about, people love it, and I don't want to make enemies. Really the only major negative is the price you pay for what is really just decent food with excellent service in a cool environment.

reviews.name: Mel V.
reviews.review: Husband likes this place, I really only like the appetizers. Every entree that I've ordered has left me disappointed. I can't pinpoint what it is. Service is great, but I think its a little overpriced for what it is. Maybe I'm a little critical  after living in Mexico for a while. Or maybe the food really is mediocre. The Queso, guac and salsa are very, very, good though.

reviews.name: Josh M.
reviews.review: One of the better Mexican places I've discovered in my short time here so far.The serving staff are great and can easily accommodate special requests.  When we went, they accidentally made the enchiladas more spicy than my girlfriend wanted, so they gave them to us for free and made her a new plate.All the food is fresh and tastes great. Chips and salsa come standard of course. I had a steak that came with tortillas, guacamole and grilled vegetables.  Everything was delicious and full of flavor.Their drink menu is expansive, with lots of beer options on tap and in bottles, both local and national, as well as a lot of tasty margarita choices and (I believe) a full bar for other mixed drinks.An added bonus is the covered patio, which has a great atmosphere, even when the weather isn't perfect.

reviews.name: Janet S.
reviews.review: Funky indoor space decorated with beads and casbah curtains.  Rustic seating, Small bar area, and huge outdoor patio.  Casual and a good spot  for large groups. I cannot say anything good about the food because I just do not like it, but plenty of others do,   I come here for the margaritas -yummy and big they are.

reviews.name: Amie S.
reviews.review: The search for decent Mexican food can be exhausting, depressing, and occasionally downright painful. Ok, well not for me personally, but I happen to live with someone who is coo coo for taco puffs and gets really mouthy when Mexican food is not up to par. That's why I'm glad there's Rosepepper! This place serves up tasty traditional Mexican fare but spices things up with its own unique flare. It is not many a place you can get a plain old cheese enchilada with hearty red chili sauce and top it off with some fried okra and fried avocado. Rosepepper has a fun, funky vibe with colorful rope lights and antique chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. The outdoor seating area is amazing: enormous, gigantic, huge-ongous...it's big, is what I'm trying to say. The outside deck seems as big as (maybe bigger than?) the indoor dining room. Service is friendly, attentive, and quick, and kids are very welcome!

reviews.name: Shelley V.
reviews.review: A friend of mine lives within walking distance and this place is one of her frequent haunts. So off we went!Luckily, there was no wait on a Friday night and went in and ordered. I didn't try the margaritas but I hear they are good. I ordered enchilladas, rice & beans. Food was fine, nothing uber gourmet but not Taco Bell variety either!M had fajitas which he liked, T had tacos and B the same. Everybody finished and no complaints were heard...Being I'm a California native, I'm really particular about Mexican cuisine. Rosepepper did the trick for this girl outta CALI ;)Definitely a safe place to go and have some drinks and tacos!

reviews.name: John J.
reviews.review: The food is edible. If you like margaritas ask for fresh lime juice. And no ice, or else that's all you'll get. and go for the top shelf with cointreau,with a nice shot on the side,along with a Bohemia or carta blanca.

reviews.name: Devin P.
reviews.review: if you are in the mood to try some good tequila then this is a good place to start. The selection here is pretty fare,pricing is good as well. I spent this last Saturday night trying out some of my favorite shots before heading over to Fran's. 4 shots of Don Julio later and the night was beginning to take shape. along with the fast and friendly service,I will always come back to one of my neighborhood local retreats!

reviews.name: Anna A.
reviews.review: Margaritas!!! Yes please... I have to admit that on a lovely Spring day when we are emerging from our grey winters that there is nothing like eating chips and sipping a Margarita on the patio. My challenge for the Rosepepper is that I don't' find the food compelling especially for the price. It's good but not that good for the price. I can definitely find much more dynamic Mexican food on Nolensville road for half the price. That being said, since I live near Rosepepper, the kids menu is only a dollar and the Margaritas yummo, I am a frequenter of Rosepepper. My go to dishes are the fish tacos with black beans instead of re fried and the the baja tacos  with chicken. Both are limey, full of cilantro, and fresh. The Rosepepper will make a quick dent in your wallet if you aren't careful so check out the happy hour specials or just stick with the schooner of beer that is a pretty good value.

reviews.name: Jesse W.
reviews.review: Great food, generally good drink specials. I enjoy the quesadilla a lot and the margarita is solid too.

reviews.name: Nadine D.
reviews.review: Having grown up in Arizona, I guess I must just be particular about my Mexican food, as I have yet to be impressed by a Mexican restaurant in Tennessee in the 5 years that I have lived here. I ate at Rosepepper a couple weeks ago and was relatively pleased with my experience. The ambience is nice and eclectic, but lacked authenticity. I noticed that the staff was comprised mostly of white hipster kids. Nothing wrong with that, but when it comes to Mexican food I prefer it as authentic as possible. I ordered the Sonora Style enchiladas, which were topped with a runny, lukewarm fried egg and the dish overall was bland and lacking in texture.  I will probably come back another time and order something else, and probably have a few of those tasty margaritas.

reviews.name: Marit S.
reviews.review: My boyfriend and I made a trip to Nashville to visit some friends for the weekend. We went to Rosepepper for lunch--and I must say I was very pleasantly surprised. For the most part, unless you are in Texas or California, I have the opinion that "Mexican is Mexican." This is NOT the case. From the different salsas, to the huge variety of margaritas, to the amazing food--Rosepepper was not the average Mexican eatery. And to make it even better, they have a nice large covered patio--perfect for a meal in the rain or shine. I wish I could transplant it to Columbus, Ohio!I will definitely be going to Rosepepper on my next Nashville visit.

reviews.name: Lucas P.
reviews.review: This gem, and yes I rarely give that title, is a near miss if you were to drive by it on busy Eastland Ave. While the decor and servers clearly cater to the hipsters (and, no, I am not one), it also caters to the yuppies, guppies, et. al. It can be a little loud inside, but the vibe and decor (from Picasso Prints to mix-match chandeliers) add to its flair. The service was/is very laid back and friendly -- food is fast to the table. The salsa and chips were really great, three types of salsa brought to the table to start , Quite an original staple in most every Mexican joint. However, the fresh 3-choice salsa made it semi-unique. The Sonoran-esque prepared food was really nicely done. NOT greasy and super flavorful. The portions were grand and the pulled beef was amazing. To top it all off, well, the pricing was right in line with a 2-star joint! Nice job, well played Rosepepper.

reviews.name: Kyla A.
reviews.review: My biggest advice for a visit to Rosepepper is to skip the entree. Everything else about the place from drinks to decor is excellent, but the main courses are usually only okay.Once you walk into Rosepepper you will be able to see it is not your typical Mexican Restaurant. The decor is eclectic and flashy, including everything from chandeliers to wrestling masks. The patio is superb. It's main seating area even boasts misters which keep the air cool even on the hottest of days.  The margaritas are some of the best in town, but I prefer the white sangria.  Your table is set with three different salsas which combined with an order of queso (which is served with these delicious fried tortilla pieces instead of chips) will give you more than enough food to keep you going for afternoon drinking with friends.Tip your waiters well; they are some of the coolest people in town.

reviews.name: Tammy M.
reviews.review: Okay-We are on vacation and I read the reviews and was leery of going- it's a little hard to find even with nav, and parking is horrible-(lack of it with many cars) Needless to say, we were seated right away even at a busy dinner hour! You are given chips with 3 types of salsa: reg, hot, and green salsa verde- original is my favorite, kinda sweet. We ordered the white queso blanco-AMAZING!!! Go for the bowl! We wanted flour tortillas with butter, but they don't have butter on the premises! (strange- but we are Texans)Food- I got the choose two- cheese enchilada and crispy beef taco- um- yeah!!!! The crispy taco is crunchy with seasoned shredded beef!!! So tasty- same for enchilada- cheesy and lots chili sauce on top!Hubby got the pork and chicken tamales- they are wrapped in banana leaf- different. He liked the pork but hated and didn't eat the chicken- it was bland and he said it tasted like the banana leaf- he usually eats anything!!! So skip those!I loved my food though- but we'll bring the butter next time ;)kids meals are chicken strips and basic mexican food.Overall- the FOOD IS GREAT!!!!!I only gave it 4 stars due to very difficult, frustrating parking, if they improved this- I'd give it 5!

reviews.name: Rainer F.
reviews.review: On a recent visit to Nashville I checked out this place because of the rave reviews of their margaritas. Not sure what gets people excited but the ones I tried were pretty much standard fare. The food was actually better than I expected - the enchiladas with the pork chili verde sauce had some nice oomph to it - but by and large it's the same stuff you find in any other Mexican restaurant. The nicest touch was the spacious patio.

reviews.name: Jeanne C.
reviews.review: Don't bother if you're 50 + as the snooty receptionist will discriminate and tell you it is a minimum of 1&1/2 hour wait all while you are watching people being seated upon their arrival.  First time myself and my group of friends were ever treated so discrimantly in a U.S.or European restaurant  before.  The three snooty and unattractive receptionist girls treated us instantly like we had a third eye in the middle of our foreheads.  All of us vowed to never darken the door of this place again. My only regret is that I didn't have one of their famous margarita's to loosen my inhibitions enough to tear all three of those twits by a tongue lashing.  Instead, we all politely left and went to enjoy ourselves at Las Maracas down the street.  The management of this establishment should be ashamed of theirselves for having such horrific employee's as their representatives.

reviews.name: Paul H.
reviews.review: Solid three-star Mexican place.  While the food is pretty standard, I did appreciate the three types of salsa they brought out at the beginning of our meal.  I ordered the beef taco plate, which was okay.  I wouldn't warn anyone against it, but I wouldn't tell you to seek it out either.But, I really enjoy the margaritas after a long day at work.  They always hit the spot.  Rosepepper seems to be a pretty good after-work spot.  So it gets crowded early - but makes for some interesting people watching.

reviews.name: Tom L.
reviews.review: Rosepepper serves generous portions of above-average American Mexican food at  a reasonable price. The pork is great in anything, and although it may be something that is uncouth from a culinary standpoint, I am a sucker for gratuitous amounts of cheese dip covering my food. I got that at Rosepepper. The margaritas were weak, but tasty. That being said, the frozen fresh fruit margaritas are fantastic. I personally prefer the pineapple (these things are essentially just good frozen drinks, but if you are a Margarita purist and you expect an authentic margarita, you may be disappointed). The service was precise, prompt, and genuinely friendly. My order came out wrong, and I it was corrected by our perceptive waitress with a free enchilada without me even having to point out that it was wrong. The patio is comfortable, and the atmosphere is hip without being too hip (more of a naturally hip feel than the phony overly hip ambience).Overall, I am a fan of Rosepepper and plan to return.

reviews.name: Lisa M.
reviews.review: probably more like a 3.5great margaritas!they have a vegan burrito, which I was excited to see.  It is pretty good, and a fun vibe.   The food and service is ok, but not great.  Having said that, it's still worth a trip for the margaritas!

reviews.name: Elizabeth C.
reviews.review: I was pleasantly surprised with my visit. I attempted a food dish out of the ordinary (at least for me) and I was pleased, but most impressed by my picky parents' reaction... They had the chicken fajitas (They could share the dish) They wouldn't stop talking about the quality of the veggies, how there was more meat the veggies (which almost never happens in other Mexican food joints) and were extremely pleased with the prices! Rosepepper you have impressed my parents, and won me in the process.

reviews.name: Brian C.
reviews.review: A definite East Nashville staple which has weathered a long road to become an institution for the neighbors.  The food is consistent with my personal favorites being the chicken taquitos and the beef flautas.  The patio pumps when it's warm; so expect a wait if you want the exterior experience.  The pre-service (chips and salsa) is immediate.  Based on how busy they are, the rest of the service is hit or miss.

reviews.name: Natalie D.
reviews.review: The Best margarita in Nashville.  Most margarita's taste pretty similar, however Rosepepper manages to take my favorite, classic drink and improve it.  It is magical. Truly.

reviews.name: Meredith W.
reviews.review: Margaritas were good. The food was good also. I didn't like the rice. Great atmosphere. I will go again.

reviews.name: Courtney B.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is one of the best if not THE best Mexican restaurant in Nashville.  Their margaritas are some of the best I've ever tried.  You could make an entire meal out of them they're so yummy, but I don't recommend doing so before bribing one of your friends to D.D. for you. I love it when Mexican joints serve multiple varieties of salsa with their chips and its an extra delight at Rosepepper because their salsa is so fresh and tasty.  I love love the fried avocado it's a concept I'd never really considered before.  They're fried sweet peppers are another favorite.  They serve up some more traditional fare as well as some of their own creative twists and I have yet to order something I haven't liked.  They have a fabulous covered patio which is the place to be if the weather is treating us well.  There's just something about enjoying a tasty margarita outside that heightens the experience.  The decor is eclectic and colorful with lights strung from the ceiling and decorations everywhere you turn.  Its like fiesta time 24/7.My one real complaint is their prices.  To do a trip to Rosepepper right can cause some major stress on your bank account.  Expect to drop about $50 for dinner for two with drinks (who can go without they're margaritas?).

reviews.name: Erin D.
reviews.review: Everyone I know is head over heels for Rosepepper. I'm not saying it's a bad place by any means, but I don't think it lives up to the hype. In my opinion it's a northern Tex Mex joint and not quite the real thing. This isn't to say I don't enjoy the food because I do I just have learned what to order. Being somewhat of a guacamole snob I don't recommend ordering theirs as an appetizer, it's a nice addition on meals, but doesn't really stand on it's own. It's pure avocado: no cilantro, no real chunks of onion or tomato.Some people like that.  When I do get it, I mix it with the salsa. I do love the Gringos appetizer (nachos layered with bean and cheese), which are the only menu listed vegetarian nachos. What I find unique in relation to other Nashville Tex Mex joints is that they use black beans and it comes with salsa, guac, and sour cream in tortilla bowls (rather than actually on top of the nachos). Another variation are the heavy flour tortilla chips that almost remind me more of a pita than a chip. They serve these with the guac as well. The service here has always been very decent, and they have always been accommodating to small groups. My last trip in particular we walked in and were told it would be an hour wait. We were starving so, in front of the hostess, debated going somewhere else. Within 10 minutes we had a table. It's definitely an experience and not a bad place to go, unless you're a Mexican food snob and aren't interested in paying slightly inflated prices.

reviews.name: Carla B.
reviews.review: Not the best Margarita but a family friendly place. Good food, good ambiance, our service was fast, friendly waitress knew was she was doing, she took really good care of us :) the salsa was great, fresh and cold with their chips...yummy! Fresh salsa says a lot from a mexican restaurant. You could almost judge a place by their salsa, this was great!

reviews.name: Erin C.
reviews.review: Margarita- GoodService- GoodFood- BlandPrices- Good

reviews.name: Ryan D.
reviews.review: Food is all right.  Gets a little crowded in the evenings when I've gone.

reviews.name: Vanessa H.
reviews.review: I've only been to Rosepepper once, and I always give places more than one try before making a final decision. I went for lunch with a friend who raved about it. "Mexican" food is my favorite cuisine, so I've eaten a ton of it in my time, but I know that everyone likes it a little different. For me, the chicken fajitas were just too bland. I was in need of some kind of flavor, or at least salt. I did enjoy the salsa choices that came with the chips at the beginning. Next time, I'm going to plan my trip for a time when I can indulge in the margaritas everyone is raving about. Rosepepper, I haven't counted you out yet!

reviews.name: Nick L.
reviews.review: This place is just amazing! Great service, great everything!

reviews.name: Robert K.
reviews.review: Rosepepper Mexican Grill is an above average Mexican place in East Nashville.  They offer all of the standard Mexican fare and over thirty different types of tequila, needless to say you will be speaking Spanish in no time... or at least slurring your words.  I went there two weekends ago and had a regular margarita, boy was it strong, too strong to the point that it was not enjoyable.Drinks aside, the food is really good, although it is pricier than other Mexican places around the area.  The enchilada that I had was really good and cheesy.  You are given the option of three different types of salsa... I chose mild, but I should have chose medium or hot because the food itself did not have very much heat.  I will definitely come back here next time I am cruzin' around the hip-side.

reviews.name: Amelia D.
reviews.review: The Rose Pepper caesar salad is not to be underestimated  here. It is so good!The service is friendly and fast, and you are immediately greeted with a basket full of warm chips and three varieties of delicious salsa upon being seated.I DEFINITELY recommend ordering a margarita. I had two. In the middle of the day.

reviews.name: Peggy O.
reviews.review: Being from California I am a bit of a Mexican food snob.  That being said..... nothing so far has beat Rosepepper that we've tried.  The margaritas are delicous, the ecletic decor, the salsa... yum.  Although I don't live in East Nashville, I love this place and we make the drive whenever we can...

reviews.name: Karen M.
reviews.review: Great place to go with friends, good food, GREAT margaritas!  Please try even just the house margaritas, you won't regret it!

reviews.name: doug p.
reviews.review: Whoever voted this place the best margaritas in Nashville came real close. They really do make a good one. My issue with this restaurant lied with the food. This is About the third time I've eaten there and I like to hold off judgement based on a bad experience or 2. This is no mistake though. The food just doesn't measure up to their great patio ambiance and margaritas. I've had an assortment of the usual Mexican fare there including chicken and beef enchiladas, tacos, flautas,  and all the usual fixings. Each was bland or dry or something just wasn't there. $10 Mexican food should be on par with the rest of this restaurants very impressive other exploits, but is not.Hope your dish is better than mine, I'll be sitting at the bar next time.

reviews.name: David S.
reviews.review: I remember being very excited when Rosepepper first opened. It might have been one of my first trips to East Nashville just to check the place out. And it ended up being ok Mexican. I've been back a few times since and enjoyed it but haven't been blown away. I think the space itself and the outside patio makes up for any deficiencies in the food itself, or maybe food just tastes better with friends and a few margaritas.One menu item I can definitely recommend are the fried sweet pepper rings. I guess it would be hard to make a list of favorite fried vegetables, but these were something I had never had before and had a nice flavor. The food itself was a little bland to me. I think it's a regional variation of Mexican I was used to, but I can't remember anything fantastic that anyone had. So maybe this is a better joint for drinking, relaxing, and grabbing some ok food with friends rather than the best Mexican in Nashville.

reviews.name: Sharon K.
reviews.review: The Rosepepper is a great Mexican restaurant. I went here for a late lunch with a big group of friends, and had a couple pitchers of their specialty Margaritas and food. We had a table out on their big and breezy patio.  It was a great atmosphere for having a relaxing meal.  Their menu items are a blend of the traditional and modern styles of Mexican cooking.  So their specialties include picante items like Chile Verde, and more savory items with less heat such as Carne Asada with guacamole.I went for their veggie burrito.  It was served with veggies black beans and rice, and topped with tomatillo sauce. The burrito came with both sour cream and fresh guacamole.  First of all the burrito was HUGE.  But I really enjoyed it, the veggies were grilled just right, and everything had a lot of flavor. The guacamole on top was just the right mix of cool with the hot of the burrito. Tasty!

reviews.name: malia m.
reviews.review: Just moved to the east side and have been doing alot of takeout.  I love to drink one of their margaritas while I wait for my food.  I love how eclectic the decor is, not your usual Mexican restaurant.

reviews.name: Jerry E.
reviews.review: Sat at the bar with a client and the food was great.or maybe it was the margaritas we started off were the key to the food.

reviews.name: Walt B.
reviews.review: Great Friday night hang. Great Margaritas. Never disappointed

reviews.name: Sylvia R.
reviews.review: The patio on a nice summer night is what I could see as bringing someone back to this cute little 'mexican' restaurant. We went on a Tuesday night, and although there was a good crowd, we were seated on the patio no problem.  The waitress was friendly and brought us our margaritas quickly.  (YUM, btw- very strong!- and $7 for basic margaritas.)  We split a fajita platter ($13)- which was a good size portion of meat and veggies, but only 4 small tortillas with the platter- and we didn't get any plates? ? I'm sure that was an oversite, but we asked for another plate and the waitress never got around to getting one (my husband used the chips and salsa bowl as his plate.  Overall, and like I stated in the beginning, the atomosphere, patio, and strong margaritas would bring me back to this place. The bill was about $40- steep but worth it for a nice night out!

reviews.name: Jonathan R.
reviews.review: Very average Mexican food at best. Over priced and cheap tasting. No idea why people think this is good.

reviews.name: Melinda C.
reviews.review: This is a great place to get some reasonably priced, tasty Mexican food in Nashville, either with friends or on a date. There's a real nice atmosphere to the place, and I would definitely recommend it. I particularly like their fish tacos.

reviews.name: Caitlin D.
reviews.review: Agree with the previous review. Cute spot, good drinks, chips and salsa are decent... but beyond that, this place disappoints. Most of the food on my plate was overly greasy, lacked flavor, and was generally unauthentic Mexican food. While there aren't many better alternatives in Nashville, I can't bring myself to consider this real mexican cuisine.

reviews.name: Erin J.
reviews.review: The best thing about Rosepepper is their house margarita.  Really good!  A lot of margaritas can be sour and full of junk, but this place really has it right.  They have a happy hour every day, maybe 4-7pm?  The food is less than memorable though.  I give 1 star to the food and the rest to the margaritas.

reviews.name: Amanda W.
reviews.review: I went to Rosepepper for lunch.  I ordered two beef enchiladas and they came with rice and beans.  I was surprised how large the portion was (I should have ordered one enchilada instead of two).  I was disappointed, however, at how bland everything tasted.  It was good but not the best I've had.Their chips and salsas were very good and it seemed like a fun atmosphere.  I think I would rather just come back to have chips and margaritas rather than eat a meal here.

reviews.name: Nate C.
reviews.review: the night started off well. Our reservation out on the patio was in place, the margarita was excellent, and the chips and 3 salsas were great!!! But that's where the goods stopped and bads started...the server was extremely slow. we were seated for about 15-20 mins, dusting off 2 bowls of chips before the server even took our order. then we dusted off 2 more bowls of chips and salsa before our food came out. and this is where the real grip begins...WTH is up w/ the basics here? i have never had any mexican/spanish RICE w/ frozen pea, carrot, and bean mix. this is abolutely atrocious! this is not chinese fried rice, but it sure looked and tasted like one. the BEANS... well, the beans sucked too. it was more like bean soup; very watery and tasteless. now to the entree, well, i ordered the combo plate with shredded beef enchilada, pork tamales, and chicken chimichanga... the ENCHILADA was basically a taco. they used corn tortilla with the beef inside. they didn't even bother to make it look like a enchillada, but it was descent. the TAMALES looked gross. i don't know what kind of tamales they're are used to, but the color of the corn looked grey/brown. the texture of the corn shell was very rubbery, not good at all. the CHIMICHANGA was just a disaster. i couldn't even try the second bite b/c it was just straight up NASTY!!!honestly, this is not a mexican joint, but the vibe is good. I might hit this place up for margaritas, but not neccessarily for food. just have the margaritas and their chips and you'll be good, but stay from everything that i've mentioned above.one more note, my friends that had the fajitas and the carnes asada tacos seemed to like their food. =]

reviews.name: Susan K.
reviews.review: I love the Rosepepper. They have different types of margaritas you can get, but the original is good by me. I always say I'm going to try something new, but time and again I get the Cabo (Fish) tacos and they are always delish. People have said it's overpriced, but my question is what's not overpriced these days? I think for fun, sit-down, don't go there every day type environment, the price is decent. Unless you go at 7:00pm on a Fri or Sat night, you likely won't have to wait very long. Any place in Nashville then is going to be packed though. It's a great date spot, and there's something good for everyone.

reviews.name: Winnie L.
reviews.review: unbelievable margaritas -- 1 is all you need ;)

reviews.name: Michael F.
reviews.review: Just tried the platos combination with a carne taco and pollo chimichanga.  Cleaned my plate.  Everything was fresh and tasty.  The server was cheerful and attentive.  I try to find local food wherever I travel and Rosepepper was recommended by a local.  I will return!

reviews.name: Jason N.
reviews.review: This place has been taken over by hipsters. It has become loud with poor service and a depreciation in the food quality.  I have therefore moved my initial rating of 4 stars down to a 2 star rating.

reviews.name: Meitra A.
reviews.review: Great food, great service and great ambience.  This is not your typical Mexican, and Rosepepper's has incredibly good margaritas.

reviews.name: Alison G.
reviews.review: Good margs, but very, VERY mediocre food. The deck is a nice place to hang and have a beer, but if you're looking for decent mexican, look anywhere else but here.

reviews.name: jamie z.
reviews.review: Finally got a chance to check this place out after hearing so many good things about the place. It seems to be in a nice area with a lot of up and coming potential. We ate here on memorial day, sat out on the deck... its a pretty decent sized deck, we liked that a lot right away.. Only problem was it began raining, and raining hard.. the staff was quick to change us to a seat that wasn't right next to the edge. We didn't mind and still enjoyed watching the downpour while eating. The food was good and cheap. They definitely give you enough to fill up on and then some.  I wouldn't say the food was spectacular by any means, but it was simple and tasted good enough to bring me back when i get an itching for Mexican food. Only complaint i would have, slight as it is.... The sangria.I am use to cha cha cha sangria,  No Cha Cha Cha meal feels right without sangria! So of course we were stoked to see sangria on the menu. The sangria here was very watered down, the pitcher itself is filled completely with ice. They charge 26 bucks for a pitcher and it barely filled four glasses. seems a little pricey for what you actually get out of it. It lacked that punch I'm use to. I think if they served it with a lot less ice and maybe let the sangria and fruit settle over night it would be much better!That's the only complaint, next time ill just have a beer or a margarita.Anyways worth checking out, especially with the weather getting nice and warm.

reviews.name: Mariela C.
reviews.review: As I have mentioned in almost every Mexican restaurant review, Nashville's Mexican food options just don't impress me. However, in hopes of letting go of my love of California Mexican food, I will say that Rosepepper is definitely above average as far as Nashville options go. OK now why Rosepepper is getting 4 stars from me: because for once a Nashville Mexican restaurant has actually figure out of how to make Burrito. When I saw the Sonora burrito on their menu, my heart seriously skipped a beat; no longer would I have to writhe in anger as I was forced to eat another burrito that was just meat and melted cheese, instead, Rosepepper has figured out that rice, beans, and salsa also belong in there. HURRAY Rosepepper, HURRAY! The Sonora burrito is actually a burrito, its huge, and accompanied with one of their really strong margaritas it makes my heart and stomach happy.

reviews.name: Lisa P.
reviews.review: My first thought upon entering the restaurant was "Wow.  I'm not nearly cool enough for this place."  I was meeting four other ladies for dinner, all of us on separate checks.  Five checks at one table would be enough to make some servers bitchy, but ours was AWESOME.  I wish I could remember her name, but I tipped her very well, so hopefully that's enough.  The usual complimentary chips & salsa get an upgrade here, with three different salsas served - regular, hot and verde - all excellent.  I don't drink tequila (anymore), but my companions raved about the margaritas.  At a companion's urging, I had the chili verde pork quesadilla, and WOW.  Just WOW.  Quite possibly one of the best things I've ever eaten.  It's super-spicy and not for the faint of heart, but if you like your food to smack you in the face, this is not to be missed.  My friends' meals came with rice & beans, but the only accompaniment I got (or needed) were little cups of guac and sour cream.  It was so good that I ordered the same thing to go to take home to my husband.  My tab for two drinks (tall doubles), two quesadillas, and an order of the BEST queso dip I've ever had came to $33.  That's pretty freakin' good in my book, especially considering the service and the quality of the food.Be warned:  the place is NOISY and parking is a nightmare.  I parked out back, and was blocked in by a bus dropping kids off from a field trip for over 15 minutes.  Luckily, I had the memories of my fabulous meal to keep me warm.  ;-)Edited to add:  Even though we had long ago paid for our meals and were still lingering, our server brought us a dessert that another table had ordered, then claimed they *didn't* order.  I'm not sure what it was - fried bananas in some sort of sauce, arranged around ice cream - but it was FABULOUS.  Even though there were five of us dipping our spoons in, we all had plenty, and best of all, it was gratis.

reviews.name: travis allen a.
reviews.review: I'll keep this one short and simple. I used to live down the block from here, and as Rosepepper indeed has Nashville's Best. Margarita. Ever., I have spent many a dime and many a day downing their delicious libations. The food isn't bad, either. As far as a Nashville-proper Mexican establishment goes, I would rank this at the top, perhaps because it feels more fresh and healthy than Las Palmas or La Hacienda, although both are pretty damn delicious. Rosepepper has huge burritos, served 'wet' style, and their tomatillo salsa is pretty divine. If you want a fresh, solid texmex meal to go with your amazing margarita, well, then you've come to the right place. Patio seating is great during the summer, too!

reviews.name: Jeremy E.
reviews.review: I *love* this restaurant.  It was recommended to me by a friend of mine who's lived in Nashville for the last 5 years as "the best" mexican restaurant in the city.  The tortilla soup was great, the enchilada was awesome and the chips+salsas (they give you three) were fantastic.  I loved the green salsa (with lime flavor) was so yummy.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a cool, local mexican joint that's casual, laid back and delicious.

reviews.name: Jenny P.
reviews.review: Let me start off by saying that I *was* a long-time patron of this East Nashville staple. I used to think this place was wonderful and have hosted many gatherings, had a few first dates, and too many margaritas here. That is until my most recent experience. I've moved out west- Seattle to be exact, a city not lacking in great restaurants, especially Mexican- and wanted to have my last meal in town with my family and closest friends at The Rose Pepper. I called days in advance- 5 days to be exact- and asked to make a reservation for 7 for a Friday night. This action I feel is as much a stress-reliever for me and my party as it is for the establishment- what restaurant wants a large party to show up with no warning on a weekend night [their website states that they accept reservations]? The man who answered my call said that all reservations must be approved by a manager. I can handle that. He also said that technically reservations are only for parties of 8 or above. I said I could make it for 8 then and would just invite another person. He said he would put us down in the books and I should hear from the manager the following day. By the next day's end, I hadn't heard word. I called again and was informed that there was no record of my reservation. The woman that answered this time gave me the same spiel and took my info. Except that she already had my info. Which confused me, as I thought there was no record of my reservation...still confused about that one. Anyways, the woman said, even though she'd probably be "fired", that she'd make my reservation without the manager's consent. Whatever gets us a table. So the manager calls on Friday, the day of my dinner, basically saying that she technically cannot uphold my reservation since she had no prior knowledge [not my fault, right?], but will do me a "favor" and "allow" my party our table, as long as all *8* of us are there ten minutes *prior* to our reservation time. Excuse me? I called The Rosepepper, right? And not The Palm? Nobu? I mean, I'm awfully sorry Rosepepper to have so inconvenienced you with my courtesy of making a reservation for EIGHT margarita drinking adults. I'll be sure to never do this again. And to tell all my rather Nashville savvy friends to stay clear of this, let's face it, mediocre quasi-Mexican mess. Taco Mamacita is much better [and cleaner] anyways. Regardless, I canceled my reservation [still confused as to whether if I had shown up at 7 if we would've been served...] and went to THE YELLOW PORCH. This was a much better choice for my last Nashville dinner. This kind of treatment would never hold up in Seattle. Just sayin'...

reviews.name: moore t.
reviews.review: the patio and atmosphere is better than the food itself.  they do, however, have AWESOME avocado fries.

reviews.name: Sean B.
reviews.review: Good Mexican, great margaritas on the east side. The food can be inconsistent - when it's good, it's good, other times, not so much. The patio is a great place to sit when the weather's nice.

reviews.name: Janin O.
reviews.review: First, I would like to point out in reference to the two reviews below that there are many different styles of Mexican cuisine. The style served at Rosepepper is Sonoran. I do not care in general for Jalisco style cuisine but that does not mean that it is not mexican food. That being said I absolutley LOVE the Chimichangas here. They use a very thick flour tortilla and fry it so that it is crisp. The Tamales are super. They come wrapped in a bannana leaf and are darker in color than what most people serve in this area which are wrapped in corn husks. They have excellent margaritas that always seem fresh. My only gripes about the place would be that the service can be inconsistent. I have had some rude servers there and some great servers. I would also say that their salsa is inconsistently mixed. I have been there and loved it and other times felt it was tasteless.Overall i would say it is one of the better mexican rest. in nashville and a nice change from the norm.

reviews.name: Ben G.
reviews.review: Rosepepper is definitely another sweet spot on the east side.  Similar to what other people have said, it is pricier than your normal mexican restaurant, but I believe that the quality for the most part, is a little above your standard place as well. For one, their margaritas are amazing. When I was there and I assume that this is always the case, we had Patron Margaritas, and that was not by choice, that is the standard. They are incredible and incredibly strong. The food is also really good, very fresh, and their menu is a little different than most mexican places.  If you like spicy, and I mean it will make you sweat spicy, try their verde pork. It has a a lot of flavor and is really good, but only if you can handle it. It was really a little too much for me, but the waitress will let you try it before you order it, just to let you feel the heat. The atmosphere is also cool and original and even a little hip.  They also serve sour cream and guacomole in fried tortilla cups, which is pretty awesome as well. Its def a go to place in my neighborhood.

reviews.name: Ian R.
reviews.review: Typical Mexican fare done just a little bit better than normal.  Excellent margaritas and fishbowls of beer.  Portions are huge, me and my wife often will split a single entree and are still satisfied.  Also if you save room then you get to have the chocolate chimicunga which is awesome.

reviews.name: Terry M.
reviews.review: My favorite Mexican restaurant and I live in California.  The fajita's are the best I have ever had.  Great Margarita's.

reviews.name: Michael N.
reviews.review: The patio is the best thing Rosepepper has going for it.  Like many Nashville restaurants it gets consistent low health department inspection scores that it manages to get to a decent level on reinspection.  This makes you wonder about the time between inspections.  The chips when I first started going there two years ago were dripping with grease.  Now they are actually very good.  I still go there due to popular demand.  The food has also greatly improved after much local criticism.  Go for the patio and the adventure of the experience.

reviews.name: Ian K.
reviews.review: Great food and great atmosphere.  Its location in East Nashville brings in a fairly mixed crowd of people.  Finding someplace to park can be a little tough, but not impossible.  Weekend nights are quite busy of course, but even weekday nights can get a little tight.  The wait staff has always been very good and very friendly.

reviews.name: Peter M.
reviews.review: Excellent margauritas and superb spicy dishes.  Definitely a cut above your typical Mexican restaurant.  Plus, a fun bar and lively crowd.

reviews.name: Tina F.
reviews.review: Really great authentic cuisine with an atmosphere that one could totally find in Louisiana. The fact you can purchase Tasso to take home is a big bonus. The staff are very accommodating also.

reviews.name: Hope D.
reviews.review: This place is small, and you may have to wait a bit, but so far this is the only place in town I've found that has muffulettas! I was thrilled to find this place. They also have a pretty tempting dessert display! My BF had the crawfish plate and it...is...huge!

reviews.name: Tim A.
reviews.review: Only rarely has a restaurant provided so many conflicting bases for a review. On one hand, the Cajun cuisine is generally really tasty and fills a niche that is largely unfilled in the Nashville area. Those two things count for a lot, for sure. However, one must all contend with a genuinely misleading website, prices approaching obscene, and a generally dysfunctional workstaff.I ordered a crawfish etouffee with carrots and slaw for sides, based on the web-indicated price of $14.95. I placed a to-go order and showed up based on the approximate time I was told over the phone, which turned out to be a good 25 minutes before the food was actually ready. But no matter, I wasn't really in a rush and the time had sounded a bit over-optimistic anyway. What did bug me was that I ended up getting run up for over $20, as it turned out my entree was actually $18.95 before tax. I can understand a small discrepancy between online and current prices, but over 25% higher? Give me a break. The cole slaw was pretty forgettable, but the great carrots and etouffee were tasty enough that I honestly have to consider returning in spite of all other things. It's worth a shot, especially if you're getting those specific Cajun hankerings that few other places are likely to satisfy.

reviews.name: Megan K.
reviews.review: Talk about hole in the wall! Tucked in an unassuming area off Charlotte Pike (look for the big boat out front). I love the idea of Cajun food, but am not big on rice or crawfish (I know). We stopped by for lunch, and I settled down with some gumbo (rice-less, of course) and boyfriend had some jambalaya. Both were really, really good. An excellent amount of heat. Great service--we even chatted with owner Darrell Breaux throughout our meal. I loved the experience there... but boyfriend loved it so much, he went back the very next day. :)Definitely recommend if you're craving some quality Cajun.

reviews.name: Christina G.
reviews.review: If you love New Orleans Cajun you should eat here.  Soft shell po boy, shrimp po boy and balls appetizer are excellent!! So sad I don't live closer

reviews.name: Mike S.
reviews.review: Bro'a definitely the real deal for Cajun cuisine. Gumbo was just like mom made it. I had the sampler and all was very authentic and tasty. I'm a native from Louisiana and this place his a hidden gem.

reviews.name: Michele R.
reviews.review: Love this place!!! We love Cajun..!  It's like you are eating in someone's kitchen... Smoked pork chop was outstanding... Crawfish yummy.. Pecan pie to die for!!! Portions are large.. Very friendly!! Loved the red beans and rice.. The small was quite large!! Cannot wait to go back !

reviews.name: Jimmy H.
reviews.review: Having spent weeks at a time down in New Orleans I have to honestly say Bro's has got right!Very reasonable prices and great food. I had the Muffuletta for lunch one day and the next Day I had the stuffed Pork Chop. The Po Boys, Jamalaya and fresh vegetables are great also.Definitely stopping by here every time I'm in Nashville or just passing through well worth the detour.

reviews.name: Susan O.
reviews.review: We love Bro's.  Haven't been able to find another place anywhere near Nashville that does red beans and rice as well, and have to make a visit here when I get a craving.  EVERYTHING is really good.  We've eaten there for many, many years, and have enjoyed getting to know the Breauxs.  Check it out if you haven't.  You'll be very glad you did.

reviews.name: Laura M.
reviews.review: The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is the staff. We ordered our drinks which it seems weren't going to be delivered until our food was. I ordered a pound of crawfish, turnip greens, and gumbo. Right away, the chef put the turnip greens and gumbo up to be served. 10 minutes...I finally stood up and grabbed it myself. We poured our own refills for our drinks as well....which is necessary for the fantastic, spicy, and juicy crawfish. The food is amazing but treat it like your own kitchen. If you don't get it, it seems like no one else will!

reviews.name: Lusi C.
reviews.review: We became a pin on his map .. It is def the dive in Guy's diners drive in's and dives...  From the moment we walked in we were greeted like old friends... The owner was súper nice .. My Husband Loved the frog legs and alligator bites .. As appetizers... He could not finish his catfish po boy... It was awesome he said .. My stuffed pork chops were yum... They had the best smoked flavor ... There are no words or for that matter no picture to describe the pecan pie ... Omg absolutely amazing ... One bite and I could not put my fork down long enough to take a picture of it... Really the most amazing flavor .. A creamy not sugary syrupy base... Wow do not leave without the pie ..

reviews.name: Dean C.
reviews.review: Today was my first time eating at Bro's, and I must say I was disappointed.  My buddy and I waited almost 40 minutes for our orders to be taken, and another 20 minutes to get our food (he ordered the gumbo, and I got the muffaletta).  He said his gumbo was 'okay', but my muffaletta was pretty sad.  The bread was soggy and they were pretty stingy with the meat and olive spread (I counted two flat slices of ham, one slice of cheese, and the olive spread was a thin layer like butter).  The whole sandwich was easily thin enough to fit in a toaster slot.  The fried potatoes that came with it were soft and cold.  Hardly a bargain at $10.50.The server apologized for the wait, explaining that they were behind due to a large catering order.  Still, with only six tables in the dining room, I think we could have gotten a sandwich and soup a little more quickly, especially at lunch time.  We were both late getting back to work.They do get one star for having RC cola on tap.

reviews.name: Alexandra H.
reviews.review: The food is delicious! (Recommend the sampler- crawfish étouffée, Cajun shrimp, red beans/rice & gumbo).  The service is very disorganized.  But, if you're not in a hurry, don't mind asking for your sides repeatedly, & are craving some awesome Cajun flavors - give them a shot.

reviews.name: Sara K.
reviews.review: OK, my Baton Rouge companion gives this place a 2.5, and let me premise by saying that - 1) there was a fight in the middle of the restaurant  between the chef and waitress and the waitress proceeded to say some obscenities and storm out 2) too much BBQ sauce on the stuffed pork chop (unlike the show) 3) out of several sides 4) chef was yelling at other staff membersAnyways, we saw this place on Diners, Drive Ins and Dives and the restaurant is crawling with signs from his show - they won't really let you forget that they had that opportunity. All the menus and wall decorations have Guy Fieri's face all over it. The show specifically showed the stuffed pork chops (which we both wanted) and starved from a full day. So appetizers consisted of smoked sausage and linked boudin. They were out of the Boudin Balls.  Smoked Sausage was too sauced. It just points to the meat not being either 1) cooked well 2) not of good quality hence NEEDING the sauce to overpower the flavor. The linked Boudin was good, i was a little taken confused on how to eat the linked Boudin but it was delicious none the less. Then the pork chops came - dripping in BBQ sauce. It takes away from the meat. It looked so good on the show and although it tasted good it wasn't THAT good. And not for $14.95 each. The fight broke out shortly after our waitress got a phone call while walking around the restaurant from someone and started screaming about house keys and "being done with this sh**". She seemed to be in a relationship with the chef and both of them escaped to the back room with muffled screams. Maybe it was apart of the ambiance, i doubt it, regardless the truth remains the same. The situation they placed the customers in  was extremely unprofessional, the food was not as good 'as seen on TV' (sadly) and the food choice was limited due to their stock. If you're not fully stocked on a Saturday night ... when would you be stocked? They don't even open till 4pm and we were there at 7. No bon apetit.

reviews.name: Kim R.
reviews.review: This place has the worse service...I ordered a turkey two months in advance went to pick it up the day before Thanksgiving...waited in line which was out the door for over an hour.  The owners dumb son screwed all the orders up and moves very slow not a care in the world.  This was the worse experience ever!!!!!!

reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.review: So, I think it's all right. I don't have that much experience with Cajun food outside of a blurry, drunken couple of days and nights in NOLA and a boudin truck at Ft. Polk. My sister, however loves Cajun food and can put on the Swamp People lilt with ease, loves LSU and the Saints and misspells the word for move or proceed as G-E-A-U-X, I can thank her Louisiana native boyfriend for all that. No crawfish boil for our visit-since they're out of season, we were told. Well, it took a while for anything to get to us. They were really shorthanded the Thursday we showed up and we sat around for a while before someone came up to us in a fluster, apologizing for the wait. She was apparently waiting on everyone since the other waitress was let go. She was friendly enough so waiting a little longer than usual wasn't too bad.We both went with the Boudin, EACH. We weren't about to share that. The boudin was tasty, hot, so hot that I had to wait for it to cool off before I could take another bite. Main meal wise I got the jambalaya which was a deep plate but I thought it was just okay. The plate was deep but not necessarily big, the black-eyed peas and cornbread I got for sides were tasty though and it made a complete meal. My sister happily feasted on the crawfish po'boy with fries. The service, was friendly but harried and also some of the food wasn't as much as I thought it would be.

reviews.name: Misty M.
reviews.review: So wow a lot has happened. We came here a few weeks ago and a fight broke out between the kitchen staff--two guys making the food. They were shoving and cussing. It was on a Friday night. We ordered to go and walked out. It was insane! Two grown men shoving each other and not caring that we all saw it.I gave them a second chance today. We ordered to go, waited the 20 minutes and went to pick up our food. The lady at the register said our order was never taken and we would have to wait another half hour. No apology. Nothing.I'm done. What a waste! I guess our good first experience was a rare experience. Just stay away. Businesses like this don't deserve to be open.

reviews.name: Chip M.
reviews.review: What a shame Saw this place On tripple D.  The staff seemed to be unorganized and chaotic Quite possibly the most I've ever seen. Came on a sat evening. They were out of catfish........ I ordered the    Muffuletta and I requested the fried potatoes to be Crispy. When my meal arrived the "fried potatoes" were soggy greasy and were it Crispy  the sandwich was so so. I asked for my empty tea to be refilled   I ended up asking my waiter what his name was since he hadn't introduced himself.  He said his name was Chad Bro. When I explained my concerns about what I've been seeing tonight about the chaos watching another tablesMeal come out randomly and then multiple dishes continuing to arrive.  The other party with me ended up with the oyster poboy. Oysters were cold .... They said they were short staffed and kept making excuses. We both had a fewBites and decided to cut out losses and leave.  We did pay the tab, which I shouldn't have done..... I  address it to the cashier ( an older robust fellow who I believe to be the owner) he seemed indignant to my concern and obviously didn't really have any interest in hearing constructive criticism.  He even made some smart ass comment about if we wanted a fancy meal to go to west end I believe.  Well it's NOT about being fancy but getting what you expect which is good service and food. Advice to you sir would be to take constructive criticism and learn and grow not take it as an insult.  I honestly think if not for bing on tripple D this place would not be in business. They might be better suited for restaurant impossible with Robert Irvine.  If you want good Cajun creole food I say head south to New Orleans. I Wouldent make a trip here or waste my time darkening this doorstep.  So sad because it doesn't have to be his way.

reviews.name: Tim D.
reviews.review: If you call yourself a foodie, you must not discriminate.  looks like a run down dive. Had to drag my wife from the car.   This is exactly what you would expect if you were in your great great  aunt's back woods Cajun home.  Eat in front of the kitchen for a full dining experienceBest jambalaya I have ever eaten.. Turnip greens well seasoned. Pork chop not bad. It is an experience. Enjoy the show

reviews.name: Amy C.
reviews.review: Really SOLID Cajun food right here in the heart of Music City!  On this, my first visit to Bro's Cajun Cuisine, I went ALL in and ordered the sampler plate where you get a taste of all their famous dishes...Crawfish Etouffee, Red Beans and Rice, Gumbo and Shrimp Creole for $16.95 (the portions are HUGE and could be a meal for 2 people easy!).  My fave on the sampler was the Shrimp Creole, but the Etouffee was a close second!  I was told that the owner has one of his employees drive down weekly to Lafayette, LA to pick up FRESH Louisiana crawfish...it's obvious in the taste - SUPER fresh! Oh, and a nice surprise was that we learned that Guy Fiere from Diners, Drive-In and Dives was recently here and featured several dishes from Bro's on his show! Pretty cool!

reviews.name: Doug V.
reviews.review: I have only been here once, but thought it was some of the greatest cajun food ever.  The place is also ver interesting and adds to the charm. The Gumbo and crawfish were great.

reviews.name: Ryan H.
reviews.review: I had seen this place on Diner's Drive-ins and Dives a while back, and decided the next time I was in Nashville I would swing by.  A friend and I decided to have a guys weekend and headed up.  We wanted to try this place as we both love seafood as well as cajun food.  Most places barely float above water when it comes to calling themselves a cajun restaurant.  Typically, just lots of paprika and deep fried breading and hushpuppies that are stale and bland.  So we pulled up to this dive, and there was one car in the parking lot on a Friday evening in a 'transitional' location of town.  It took a few minutes for us to figure out where the entrance was, which is in back. When you walk up, you may be tempted to think that you are about to enter a shady business that is a front for something else.  To us, this added to the interest.  When we walked in, there was one person just finishing a meal, and the hostess told us we could sit where we wanted.  We selected a table near the counter, which is basically like an old lunch-style buffet with all the sides / etc. in pans behind a glass divider.  We opted to try a few things from the menu, the cajun sausage, the boudin balls and the all-u-can-eat catfish.  I have to say, from the moment the first item arrived until the last, it was a fantastic meal.  They didn't spend extra money on decorations, high rent or trendy looks, but rather put their money where their mouth is and made amazingly delicious food.  The spices were just right, the boudin balls were killer, and the catfish was lightly breaded, spicy and some of the best I've had.  Also, don't go there unless you plan to eat, as there is a TON of food in each serving.  Some places have all-u-can-eat and its designed to give you a decent first portion, then the subsequent portions get smaller / longer to arrive and don't taste as good.  Completely the opposite here.  Our second helping of catfish was double the size of the initial order, and as good if not better than the first.  Oh, and the hushpuppies were moist and packed with flavor.  I would recommend this place as a fun, casual / dress-down place to get a surprisingly good meal.  As we were leaving, 3 more people showed up, but otherwise was nearly empty (their main business is apparently lunch).  I would suggest going for dinner and make sure your belt has a few extra holes.

reviews.name: Jim B.
reviews.review: Very Disappointing!!! The service staff seemed very confused and brought out one tables food 2 times, while we waited and waited and waited for our dinner. Ordered the catfish platter and was told they were out of that as well as other selections. Finally decided on the oyster po-boy and came to me cold and bland. The fried potatoes were greasy and soggy. Spoke with our wait staff and he seemed apologetic but didn't really care. Excuse after excuse but didn't make up for the chaos or lack of flavor. I guess if I want really Cajun cuisine I should go to New Orleans! I will not be back and feel I threw $42 dollars away. Very sad experience after high hopes of seeing this place on Triple D.

reviews.name: Kenny D.
reviews.review: This place is definitely in the "Dive" category of Triple "D". An old building with rambling rooms of old tables and chairs. The appearance does not give a sense of sanitation, but that doesn't really bother me; it just makes me wonder how a place like this cannot be flagged by a health inspector of fire inspector for that matter.Definitely home style cooked food here complete with a Cajun cook that looks and speaks like he is very unhappy (Chef Breaux was not there). At least I think I saw him cooking...but also taking orders with no personality whatsoever. The girls/ladies of Bro's are all sweet and very nice.I was so excited to eat here. Finding real Cajun Boudin is impossible in my home state of Virginia unless you have it shipped or make it yourself, so of course I had to order it here. Unfortunately the Boudin at Bro's was not that good this day. I have made much better Boudin myself at home, and I have also had the best. I wont identify "the best" in case this site has a policy about referring to other establishments. I also ordered the gumbo. I was good, but not great. Once again, I have made gumbo at home that blows this away. The smoked sausage in the gumbo was also good, but did not seem authentic to me. The real Louisiana smoked sausage I have had is more coarse and natural in texture than what was in this gumbo.  Bro's is more pink and more like a commercial smoked sausage you would buy in a supermarket.I also ordered fried frogs legs. Again, virtually no flavor. They do not add any spices to their flour apparently...or the frog legs. They were not terrible, just not really flavorful at all...bland and boring.My wife ordered the shrimp po boy. She said the bread (appeared to be a baguette) was fantastic, but like my frogs legs (I tasted a bite of her shrimp) there was zero seasoning. Her sandwich was good she said, but the shrimp was unremarkable. The sandwich was made in two halves that were nearly impossible to join in to one cohesive sandwich, but all in all it was good.My wife also optioned for the cucumber salad as her side. She said it was OK...but yet again, my homemade cucumber salad blows it away. I guess I'm a better cook that I thought!All in all, Bro's has some decent home-style food...but it weren't no trip to "flavor town" for us. We did not try everything obviously, so your mileage may vary. I'll bet some of the food is great, but this place could really use a good cleaning and renovation.

reviews.name: Angela B.
reviews.review: The food was great! I had the frog legs with cucumber salad. Very nice and friendly people.

reviews.name: Lisa B.
reviews.review: We had a very memorable and borderline-strange lunch experience here. I was a little nervous based on the appearance of the restaurant, both inside and out, but the food made for up for any negative first impressions I had. The restaurant is a little house in an interesting area, to put it gently.  We were helped right away and directed to a back room with a few mismatched tables and chairs in it.  There seemed to be several seating areas upstairs and down, all ummm.... eclectically decorated?The waiter was clearly truly Cajun, as it was sort of hard to understand him most of the time. Is that bad to say?  I'm not hating, I'm French Canadian, we talk funny too. The food was all really good! We ordered an appetizer that came out after the meals, and water refills were few and far between, but it was generally a good experience.Now for the memorable parts: 1: The gumbo is served in shallow, very full bowls... Do you see where I'm going with this...? Let's just say that because of the way the bowl was placed on the table, my boyfriend opted to work from home for the rest of the day due to the now infamous "gumbo pants."2: On our way out we chatted with Chef Breaux for a few minutes.  He told us about his experience with Guy Fieri when Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives was there and told us about the restaurant's history, etc, which was all really interesting.  Then he asks us what part of town we live in.  When I say West Nashville he immediately asks me, in all seriousness, "Who's your daddy??"It took everything I had to hold back my laughter as I realized that he was just honestly asking if he knew my family.  Call me immature, but it was hilarious.

reviews.name: Zach G.
reviews.review: Ah yes.  My former Friday Lunch Lover.  For a good part of a year and a half, my bosses and I would go here EVERY Friday.   We would literally ALL only order 1 thing off of the menu (I have since tried a few different things since then).   But before Darrell Breaux (he is the owner...great guy) made it on Diners, Drive-Ins, and Dives on Food Network this was my local place.   Things to keep in mind.  You don't want to sit down stairs because from my experience the service tends to suffer down there, depending on the time you go obviously.   So if planning on eating at Bro's for lunch it's best to get there at 11 or 1pmish.    If the entire table is intent on ordering something different for each of you...tack on time of staying there MUCH longer for lunch.   If like me you know you are going to order a bowl of LARGE Red Beans and Rice with the best Sweet Tea in town then you are better suited to eat and go, otherwise the experience could become a full on event called "waiting".  Though service has gotten better over the years I will admit.If you take the time to get to know Chad (one of Darrell's sons) you will find his gruff humor hilarious over time.Darrell too has a great sense of humor and loves to come around and ask everyone how their meal is today.   My favorite line he ever said to me was "What do you mean you didn't get onions on your Beans (short for red beans and rice)?   I like my women like I like my onions, because they both make me cry."Prices are great.  Atmosphere is divey, but fun.  I know it's on Charlotte Pike and knife fights are common, but don't worry, this place is only open past 330pm on 1 day every week, Friday, so you don't have to worry about gun shots during the mid part of the day.

reviews.name: Ryan C.
reviews.review: there is a video review on youtube posted by jack on the go show and in the video it totally shows this place thawing out there food outside near a huge garbage bin.. hello golden corral. food poisoning 101. you are taking a risk eating at this restaurant.

reviews.name: David O.
reviews.review: An incredibly hidden Cajun experience. I've seriously driven by this place hundreds of times, but until was looking for it I missed it.All in all a good experience with a few strange hitches.Our waiter was apparently so Cajun it almost made it difficult to understand what he was saying.  He also had a strange tendency to make me uncomfortable. Case in point:  Apparently too much Gumbo was made for another party and another waitress was kind enough to give me a cup (not a full size bowl) of Gumbo on the house.  As this was my first visit I was enthusiastic to try some.  When my waiter (Who must be one of the owners) discovered this he became very inquisitive, to the point of interrogating ME about how I got this cup of gumbo.  I tried to explain as best as I could, but he continued to quiz staff members until finally he just said something to the effect of "Well, okay".  The better half of the Yelp couple and I came up with several humorous situations as to how I could have nefariously obtained this gumbo.The second problem was that since the cooking is done right there in the same room with the customers and it did have a tendency to overpower the senses, including making both of our eyes water.The Gumbo, and my Po Boy were quite delicious though, and I would happily return.

reviews.name: Tom H.
reviews.review: Great lunch today at Bro's. Fried catfish, turnips greens and white beans. Simple and very good. Bro was behind the register. Go see him.

reviews.name: Led D.
reviews.review: Their crawfish's boil were freshly cooked, firm, spicy, and not too salty. This place WILL GIVE any Louisiana restaurants a run for there money.  That's how great the food at Bro's are. It was so good that my wife and I ordered 3 more pounds TO GO after eating 6 pounds together for dinner. That's how good it is!!!!We also tried the fried boudin sausage balls and crawfish etouffee, it was all very good and flavorful. Great job Bro's for giving an authentic taste of Louisiana in Nashville:))

reviews.name: Adam C.
reviews.review: Disclaimer.....I am aNortherner so I am giving an outside opinion......I went here for a late lunch...  I had the whole fish unboned catfish special with turnip greens and mac& cheese... also Bouidin balls....The fish was very good turnip greens good...the resr  so-soThe guy who owns the place came out and was greeting people and I had myPicture taken with him...   i would like to try the ribs.The smokers were starting as we left ;-(The catfish imo was the star of the show.....FRIENDLY SERVICE  but appys came during dinner......

reviews.name: Sarah S.
reviews.review: I did not like this place. Everything came from the microwave. The service was really slow. I ordered the boudain balls... They were yummy but not amazing.  The gumbo was not good either. The bread pudding was good but i have definitely had better. The service was poor and overall my experience here was just ok. I will go back one more time and try something different.

reviews.name: David E.
reviews.review: Been enough times to sample quite a few dishes. It's pretty solid cajun food.  A few complaints are there are the veggies/sides of the day are pretty limited.  Had some sort of corn nugget my first visit.  Would love to have them again but they haven't had them.  Crawfish etouffe and RB&R are good.  Just had gotten crawfish to boil on my last visit.  I like to wait a few more weeks until they get some size.  I'll definitely eat them here, but $10.99 a pound hurts when we used to get em for around $3/lb in Baton Rouge & NOLA.  Oh well.

reviews.name: Janet Y.
reviews.review: Yum, Yum, Yum! 'Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives' got this one right! We heard about Bro's through the show, and what a wonderful experience it was!From the jambalaya we got as an appetizer to my fried catfish, the food was delicious and oh-so authentic New Orleans. The seasoning was just right, and for the amount of food we got, it was a steal!My catfish lunch plate was $10, and that included 3 to 5 strips of catfish and rice, two additional sides, and these delicious potato slices!! To top off our greasy but AMAZING meal, the service was most excellent! The owners themselves (the Breauxs) greeted us when we came in and made sure to ask about our experience before we left! And you can't miss their accents anywhere. They are as authentic Louisiana as it gets here in Nashville, Tennessee!

reviews.name: Jenifer G.
reviews.review: The red beans were terrific and I adored the chef and the woman I think  was the manager.  The smoked beef was good, but the sauce was more of a standout.  The greens, well, they were spicy, but didn't have any meat flavoring.  Strange to think that I automatically think greens=meat, but that's how it is.I have to go back and try the bread pudding, even though it has raisins.

reviews.name: Bob S.
reviews.review: Well there not much i can say good. Service was horrible. My son got his food and 15 minutes latter i got mine. Plus i never got my side dish. The Food was not good, the crawfish in my sampler were very fishy. The Cleaniness of this restrauant was bad. When i went to pick up my dish to move it, it stuck to the table. They need to fix the air conditioner. I would not recommend this place to anyone.

reviews.name: Allison R.
reviews.review: Bro's was fantastic! Chef Breaux is great. The restaurant is homey, and a nice place to sit and have a drink. The crawfish were surprisingly good. I was expecting really bland over cooked crawfish, but they were great. Nice and spicy, with excellent potatoes and corn. They were hot, cooked just right, and huge. Turns out Chef Breaux has a driver that runs to Lafayette every week to pick up crawfish and bring them to Bro's. So yes, they are Louisiana crawfish and yes, they are cooked by a Lafayette native.It was good, not too expensive, and a good time.

reviews.name: Reyna A.
reviews.review: I am not from the south but wanted a good experience while I was visiting Nashville. A co-worker suggested it for our group so we went. On the outside it is definitely not to nice looking; typical hole in the wall place but those are usually the best places. Customer service was wonderful and the food was good. I ordered the sausage appetizer and they were generous with the portion. The place filled up quickly so you can tell it is a favorite among the locals.

reviews.name: Brad S.
reviews.review: Overrated. Was very ok.  Dont see what the fuss is about for this place  meh.

reviews.name: Catherine K.
reviews.review: I've been a regular at Bro's for 10 years now.  Darrell and Linda are such hardworking, great people!  Every time I see Darrell, he reminds me that he started this restaurant with "five dollars in my pocket."  Go for the food, not for the service.  Try the shrimp po'boy, gumbo, or jambalaya.  You won't be disappointed.

reviews.name: David A.
reviews.review: Lack of flavor on everything that we had I can't much more then that the portions were good but that was it I would try this place once if they add flavor to there's food

reviews.name: Victor F.
reviews.review: Spring. Crawfish.  Yum.

reviews.name: J. H.
reviews.review: Went to Bro's on 1/14/2012 at opening (4:00pm). The food was very good, the service was another story. Food is traditional Cajun and plentiful. Large portions and a nice "dive" atmosphere. However, the waiter was not very attentive and be careful when ordering on the menu, as prices don't accurately reflect what you'll be charged at the register. I ordered a full slab of ribs. I wanted 1/2 on my plate and the other 1/2 to go. This was after the waiter suggest I do that because I couldn't decide between the 1/2 slab or a full slab. Price for a 1/2 slab on the menu: $14.99. Full slab price: $20.95. I figured if I ate the 1/2 and wanted more, I already had it on tap. If not, lunch tomorrow. Imagine my surprise when I got to the register and saw they had upped the price of a full slab to $25.99.  This was shown on a post-it note, at the register, and had been covered by some knick-knack.  The waiter failed to mention that the price of a full slab had gone up.  Furthermore, imagine my shock when I was charged $14.99 TWICE on my bill.  That's right.  They charged me $29.98 for a full slab, not the $25.99 the post it note had said.My card had been ran at this time when my wife noticed the discrepancy in price.  She brought it to the attention of the cashier who said she would get it worked out.  Out came the owner and said "well, it's a heat up fee".  Not really sure what that meant, as I was taking my leftovers home anyway.  The lady hastily tried to explain to me that there's some sort of unwritten "warm up fee" attached to ribs.  She said "since its only a couple of dollars difference, how about we let this slide for the confusion?"  I responded by telling her I didn't appreciate the "miscommunication" of their menu's, post-it's, and "fee's" that aren't on the menu.  In the end, my card had already been charged and the fee will stand.  I just know this was my second and last time at bro's because of this.So to sum it up:  food is good, service is lousy.  Make sure you get the current prices before you order and scrutinize your bill.

reviews.name: Brent E.
reviews.review: Location and restaurant decor definitely meet "Dive" criteria. But Cajun cuisine is one of best in Nashville. Love the jambalaya and crawfish etouffee.

reviews.name: Gonzalo R.
reviews.review: Pork chops stuffed with smoked sausage was very good. Gumbo was on point. Small seating area that can definitely used remodeling. Good food and service.

reviews.name: Kenneth P.
reviews.review: Five stars is truly an understatement. The food here is mouth watering. The fried catfish was perfectly fried, fresh, and succulent. The fried shrimp was even better. You can not go wrong with any of the vegetables but I HIGHLY recommend the baked beans. The owners of this restaurant are true to the definition of "Southern hospitality". The owner took us for a personal tour of the surroundings, giving us a basic view of his toys for cooking. I came here all the way from New York.Go here for anything and everything. it is the epitome of Southern Hospitality. Add your pin to the map.

reviews.name: Sissy D.
reviews.review: If you have seen this place on "Diners Drive-ins and Dives or Tennessee Crossroads" and think thats what you're getting.....think again! Everything was shockingly bad. The place is a dive and thats cool buts its DIRTY......thats different from "dive-y".The food was horribly dry/old/reheated and totally lackluster. Always ask before you spend 10 minutes looking at the menu because half the stuff is not available! This place is not what you see on TV. It was sooo disappointing......I was literally shocked at the quality.Dont expect the "chef" to be "cooking" your food.....someone else will be reheating your food. The attitudes from the staff at this place did not come across as "characters" but more like "We dont care and we dont need your business".You WILL need to check your bill!

reviews.name: Melissa L.
reviews.review: The place isn't flashy like a more upscale 'cajun' place in Cool Springs but the food more than makes up for it.  This is true, down home country, old fashioned Cajun cooking.  I'm not sure what some of the other reviewers here thought they were coming to but it's a whole in the wall, a joint, a dive but a great mom and pop place.  Chef Darrel Breaux and his wife Linda and sons are the main characters aound here.    I've been going to Bro's since it started in a gas station over on Murphy Road.  Yeah - that long.  I've never had a bad meal.  This place isn't perfect, remember that it's a family run restaurant and there are days the help doesn't show up or someone works a double shift and they don't have the extra staff of other places.  But he food is prepred with love and pride.    Tonight I had crawfish, four pounds of them.  For this early in the season and compared to what I got a couple of weeks ago elsewhere, these crawfish were incredibly nice sized.  Cooked perfectly - unlike the facny cajun resturant who ket sending me out leftover crawfish that had been 'reheated' and were mushy, these crawfish were freshly boiled and nice and firm.On other trips I've had just about everything on the menu.  Chicken fricassee.  Gumbo.  Red beans and rice.  You name it.The po-boys -
